FBcCa0azotsiLyYbs_eMgw.text: I cannot wait to go back!!!!!!!  This place gives me an excuse to eat well during the week, and then splurge here.  We ordered skirt steak on field greens with carmelized onions, and the shrimp with rosemary and lemon.  We loved everything we got.  We forgot this place was BYOB and the manager even offered me a glass of his own wine.  Super nice people, AMAZING steak.  The next time I go back I am doing the sampler.  I will say, if you want a standard restaurant with a server, and a sit down menu, and lots of indoor tables.  It is not for you.  If you don't mind standing, or sitting at a bar or outside tables, then you are golden. It has a New York, Boston, or Paris vibe to me. Which is exactly what Pittsburgh needed.  I am a huge fan, and I can't wait to spread the word.

aNrjzVM74-Sn6Kj8XlCQ6g.text: Had an A-MAZING dinner in Pittsburgh strip district tonight!  We had a few people so we could sample a variety on our first visit. The 5 cuts of beef were all cooked perfectly and the shrimp were very good also.   We went specifically to try the empanadas and were only disappointed because they only had a few left. However, the ones they had available were ours and the were delicious!  We also sampled a variety of vegetables. The zucchini, sweet peppers, onions, mushrooms and asparagus were all grilled to perfection.  That being said, the grilled corn on the cob is a must!   The potatoes were somewhat average, but they are potatoes so what can you expect, but to quote my wife... "the toast tastes like Christmas".   All topped off with very friendly and attentive servers and four varieties of  sauces to top your meal, you can't go wrong at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina located in the strip district of Pittsburgh.   You might think the prices seem marginally high when you walk in but I promise you'll think you got a bargain by the time you leave.   This was our first visit to Gaucho, but certainly won't be our last!

-VdnYdW0B-vrww5jzLafMg.text: Let me just start by saying the people that work here are friendly, well mannered, and awesome!!! They welcome you help you order and participate in the entire experience.  My boyfriend got the Rosemary beef sandwich.  And loved every bite.  I got the carne asada sandwich and it was delightful.  The music playing was artsy and fun. The whole atmosphere was positive and happy.  Be sure to try the sauces with whatever you order they come in mason jars near the ordering area and are yummy.  Was curious to see if all the hype was real and it's definitely worth your time to stand in like and enjoy the food!!!

UK-bvYmVuXmwhJ-gW9M9Fg.text: Two words: Smoked Meats. Get there, this place is amazing.

Pruytkxm6VI2j8ueINTJZQ.text: After 497 reviews at the time of this writing, and with 4.5 stars, I don't think that I have too much to add on the awesomeness of this place that hasn't been said numerous times before.  I will say that they have recently enlarged the seating area - but I went around 6:30 pm on Weds, and it was still pretty packed.  People love this place, and for good reason.  Authentic, hearty, unpretentious, great grilled/charred flavor, BYOB at no charge, fast service - that alone puts it in the top restaurants in Pittsburgh.   I went on a hot summer day, and I will say that while it was air conditioned on the inside, I was quite warm.  The ac is lined on one side of the upstairs room, and is not so easily felt on the other side.  It is also a bit loud - but then I suppose that is to be expected when there are sooo many people wanting in that place.  These were very minor inconveniences given that the food was so good.  I would like to add that the overall costs for this place are very reasonable for the quality of food that you are getting.   Value is even better since there is no alcohol served here, and there is no corkage fee to bring your own alcoholic beverage.  In addition, there is no real wait staff, only a few servers and a busboy.  I think for this reason many people may not leave a tip - but there is a tip jar at the front by the cashier.  Normally, I am not a fan of most tip jars (as many places seem to have one for no reason at all), but assuming that the busboys and servers get a portion of it, I happily left one.  All of the staff here were friendly and helpful, and I hope that others reading this will realize that and leave a few bucks for the hard working staff here.

Bw1QExKCb_QoUivJcOl90Q.text: I haven't been back since the renovation, but have never been disappointed in the food!  Hoping there's more seating than previously.

EQrYvdgP6_ypkAx-v77llQ.text: This place deserves all of the hype.  I have been here three times and I am still enchanted.  Both their pork and their chicken are unbelievable.  They even make the toast noteworthy.  Be prepared to stand in line, as you won't order until they have a table ready for you.  You can expect at least a 45 minute wait if you line up outside.  They are BYOB, and sometimes they even hand out glasses and openers before you get to your table.  Yum!

t8EREXqFvMFUIkzQh2aBJw.text: Awesome - worth wait (which moved faster than I expected). Staff very friendly. Can't wait to go back.  I ordered the Rosemary braised beef and side of Brussels sprouts. Delicious. Love the bacon on the Brussels sprouts.

Z5mfV7XnMNlrgadjaDZ5YA.text: This place is the legit, real deal delicious sandwich place.  This is a place that you go out of your way to visit.   I had a matambre sandwich.  The meat was smoky, delicious and well seasoned.  The bread was great too.   Definitely coming back to this jewel.

_dd7YPJHjMfDoTa_UATGgQ.text: Very nice staff and atmosphere on the interior - wish there was a little more room to sit though! Regardless, the beef sandwich had a lot of potential but it fell short due to a lack of balance in two major categories; texture and flavor profile. This was mostly caused by the roasted red peppers and sauteed onions. Having three smokey ingredients on a bun is a bit overpowering and was too overwhelming on my palate. Concurrently, these roasted peppers and onions combined with the soft meat and bread robbed every bite of a much desired crunch; having cast-ironed vegetables would have been a much more welcome exchange. (I also felt the onions were overcharred)  With all that in mind, I'd still gladly come back here and try it again. Nice people.

QvxvnxiWicepPvQT6QtVCA.text: Luckily walked to Primanti Bros. after a Pirates game and on the way there, my nose picked up the magical aroma of wood smoke. Popped my head in and found they opened at 11 for the next days lunch.  You can smell the smoke from outside and once you walk in it's amplified. The inside is small with my a dozen seats. The menu is written on a chalkboard on the wall, full of tough choices. We decided on the rosemary braised beef sandwich , corn and sweet potatoes. The sandwich was enormous and amazing. The corn and sweet potatoes were cooked over an open fire and also delicious.   I will definitely return next visit!

Ov_W8mjEtWFcAGcf7-ms9Q.text: The Strip District, Pittsburgh's home to most ethnic foods and fresh seafood, recently got a new neighbor - a restaurant serving up wood-fire grilled fare from Argentina. I am not familiar with Argentinian food, so I was eager to try it out when I heard about the place. The space is next to the 16th street bridge(Near Altar Bar), so the cold weather had prevented me from making the hike up, until there was a nice warm break and I was finally able to walk up.  The space itself is minimal, imagine a pizza shop - 70% of the building is dedicated to the kitchen, the remaining 30% is left to standing room. There are about 3 countertops to eat at, but no stools. On the wall there is a menu, written in chalk, separated into about 4 sections: Small Plates, Hambre (Hungry), Salads, and Con Pan(Sandwiches). There are 4 types of condiments in jars in the middle of the restaurant which are there for your tasting pleasure: Chimichurri(Herbs, oil, lemon), Ajo(garlic), Cebolla(onion), and Pimenton(Roasted pepper). Gaucho also offers various ways to receive 10% off on different days. Wednesday, show your facial hair(doesn't have to be real, ladies) - Friday, show your fashion flare.   So far I've had tastes of quite a bit of the menu - The Vegetales sandwich($7, I think), two steak sandwiches(Flank and ribeye, $10 lets you choose from any beef they offer), Shrimp(6/$13 - 'hambre menu'), Empanadas(Beef, onion, and hard boiled egg, 2/$3), Chorizo($5 - small plate menu), and a pollo sandwich($8). The empanadas were hands down the best that I've ever tasted(Which should be taken with a grain of salt), the steak is incredibly flavorful and juicy, the shrimp were very large, with a sprig of rosemary stuffed into the back of each one and a lemon that was charred on the grill as well. The chorizo was full of peppery flavor and just a little bit spicy, and the veggie sandwich was piled high with peppers, zuchinni, and asparagus(my friend ordered without portabello).   You can also order two slices of oiled, grilled bread for $1. The bread here, a fresh ciabatta, is stunningly delicious, soft throughout and a crust that, while chewy, won't resist you as you bite into your sandwich. I highly recommend ordering the bread so you can try out all of the condiments. I'm a sucker for caramelized onions, so the cebolla is my favorite, but the ajo is a close second, with the others also being incredible.   I've only gone around 1:00pm, and there is usually a short line, but I'm not sure how this place handles around dinner time, or during the lunch rush. I asked about catering and the chef said that one day they'll be able to. He also said that he dreams of doing a whole cow roast one day - a goal that I can wholeheartedly stand behind.  Gaucho is a welcome addition, and I am sure I will find myself a regular here. If you work in the strip or downtown, block of some time and make the walk. If you don't, then drive down on the weekend or for dinner. Their website sums it up nicely, "Eat Gaucho."

kLWyv-OJZgFusFLBalyYSQ.text: Showed up at 1120 and waited 20 minutes without the line moving. They advertise they take phone orders , when you call no one answers. Good food. Horrible service. They needs to learn how to get people their food faster. I don't recommend.

YILFOSzzuR0bShIFNFbEXQ.text: Delish. Everything was great. The veggies were Cooked to perfection with lovely seasoning. Loved the Brussel sprouts  the chic. .Steak, toast and rice.  The wait was way to long almost 1 hr. The service is so very friendly. You wait on line to place your order and then wait to be seated and the staff brings your food. BYOB

_QNt83ch8T4GB2AoBx98qQ.text: Is the food good?  YES.  Salad very good, sandwich very good.  Is the food great?  Almost great.  2 sandwiches and 2 salads (plus 2 waters), about $50.  Is that cheap? Of course not.  To me, 5 stars would be excellent food, and ideally at a price point I thought made sense.  I do recommend everyone try this place, but 5 stars, to me, means fantastic...and unfortunately I think this place is slightly below that metric.

p3NW4a_JanF_gEU_GlnGgw.text: The food here is phenomenal. Be prepared for a bit of a wait and close quarters...they expanded recently but there still isn't a ton of seating, and when we went, there was a line out the door. However, the staff is incredibly friendly, and my Bondiola (roasted pork shoulder) sandwich was well worth the wait. Also, it's a BYOB, which is great. We will definitely be back.

3r-6s4UZJTIVSVJXduNumw.text: One of my favorite spots in the city.  The whole experience is handled with enthusiasm and confidence.  And why not?  When you're putting out marinated love you should be proud.  Now if they only delivered.

u3fnRa2RRum2zaNh8LWbmA.text: Oh Gaucho grande, how I love thee!!!  The new space is incredibly beautiful. Everything from the exposed brick, the space with wooden tables and chairs by open, wonderful windows and new chalkboard menu is incredible. It was day one of new Gaucho and the lines continually wound out the door. Still everything seemed to flow nicely. This was a happy, appreciative crowd!  We worried we'd be unable to find a spot to sit, but everything was perfectly timed so that we found a comfy, sunny spot in plenty of time. Don't be scared off by the lines--it's more than worth your small investment of time!  The new expanded menu is great. The new veggie empanadas were just amazing!  We had the veggie and fish con pane and our favorite papas.  The sauces were, as always, super tasty and the old butcher block serving station was a welcoming site to see after the hiatus. Everything was Scrumptious!  We cannot wait to try the paella and see the soon-to-be opened expanded dining room.

1Ffp78c8DOd36XF964x4ew.text: Best sandwich in the city! I know we pittsburghers typically go after something with fries and slaw on it, but this is one sandwich that doesn't leave me reaching for fillers. Everything you need is in the delicious meats! Not a meat eater? (Why?) Try the veggie plate! Seasoned to perfection and happily drowned in an amazing sauce! Can't say enough good things about Gaucho!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie plate. Delish!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary Brazed Beef Sandwich

yiRCB19u4icDrIi9XPXm8Q.text: I've been here twice now. Great food every time. Everything I have tried has been awesome. I am not a huge fan of the line style ordering but the place is cool and has cool decor. I will be back.

iaBu3DqnxfnhmsBlmmdSUg.text: I was only able to eat here once, because I was never able to get past the long lines! I still love the place - especially their chimichurri is to die for. My favorite was the filet mignon and ribeye. And not overly expensive!

8U-4gabqXlEMWkg_XqIvyQ.text: Grilled veggie plate is great along with chi chi chicken. Squash is very good as well. Very fresh and a different take than typical chain restaurants....flavor from actual herbs and spices!

Uiha4GYgVWb9ea7PZIMhDg.text: We wanted to try Argentinian food and were very pleased with the food. I ordered the NY strip medium with a side of oven roasted red potatoes. Absolutely delicious and would certainly eat here again. The sauces were great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jEnKrwcVSc-O4F98udN2ag.text: My mouth is still watering from the incredible meal I had here. We ordered the filet mignon sandwich, cauliflower, green beans and pork sandwich. Not to mention the 4 different types of sauces they had and boy do I love sauces! The chimichurri was super tasty as was the onion one as well. It's BYOB with NO cork fee! Can't beat that. I would highly recommend this place. The food was phenomenal and fresh, and the atmosphere was welcoming. It can get a little loud in there but it just adds to the excitement and conversation. The line was out the door but it was beyond worth the wait. You order first at the counter then get seated and given wine glasses and they call out your name for your order. I'll be back for sure. It's not everywhere you can get non dry meat and flavorful too! Yes please!

fAkIuc5DG4ZYb98yhGgTRQ.text: We ate at Gaucho's today for lunch when visiting the strip district in Pittsburgh for the first time. This place had good yelp reviews.  The reviews were right.   There were plenty of vegetarian options. I ordered the provolone toast and charred brocollini and would def order again. My friend enjoyed the veg soup and a big salad.  The staff were all terrific and decor was fun. Hope to eat here again on my next visit.

nYCPnAmBHKLsvfZFEziVkg.text: The good: The food was really good. We tried a little of everything: Skirt steak (excellent, perfectly cooked) with the house salad, funghi (yummy), papas (the potatoes were fine but I loved the addition of the rosemary and grilled garlic), beef empanada (flavorful), vegetable empanada (subtle - not bad), and the grilled provolone (awesome). Once we ordered, the food arrived promptly.  Parking was easy to find. They allow you to bring your own beer/wine and don't even charge a corkage fee. The coffee was dark and smooth and perfect.   The not-so-good: I guess it's their shtick but I just don't understand why they think I'd want to wait in line like cattle to order at the counter before I am seated, then have someone yell my name across a crowded room while I'm chatting with my lunch mate.  We only ended up eating here because we happened to get here when the line was still only inside the front door. And the line moves SUPER slow. I get that it's a small place so there's going to be a wait, but either let me make reservations or take my number and text me when it's ready. So unfortunately, I'm not likely to come back; there's just too many other options without the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fungi, grilled provolone, vegetable goat cheese empanada, beef empanada, skirt steak with house salad, papas

DP-EAkWwjy61GYM4eNqC_g.text: This is the 3rd time here and it never disappoints. I'm looking forward for my next visit. Amazing food and service!!! Meat lovers this is your heaven!! Make sure to try the empanadas.

BlR4HJco4C4vWxVffdurYQ.text: I was shocked to see how much the place has changed since the last time I was here. It is way more spacious and I really liked the ambiance. The food is still as delicious as the first time I had it. Their chimichurri and garlic sauce are amazing. I usually get the carne sandwich ( Fillet mignon) with papas and a beef empanada.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich.

vrGh4C1Y3QdgTcpc8UwYBQ.text: Welcome to hipster hell!  This place seems like it is always packed with a line outside the door. However the line is more due to unqualified staff than it is  actual demand. The people taking your order seem to go on a union break or a pause on a regular basis when they think the kitchen is busy or they just need a smoke break or pause.   Also really appreciate the guy who took my order and told me all about how sick he was with a fever while taking the order. Really hope this guy was not also preparing my food.   As for the food it was great. If you can put up with questionable service and a hipster crowd then by all means try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

O0tSD7YEWH_heNf6w7YF-Q.text: Visiting from Orlando, FL. Very cute little counter order service Argentina restaurant. You need to make sure you are ready to stand in line. The line sometimes loops down and around the building.  Ordered the porky emapana- it has chicken and pork stuffed inside  Ribeye Carne Steak sandwich with onions and red peppers   Corn on the Cob   And my favorite dish! QUI QUI chicky, two legs, two thighs with an awesome quiquirimichi sauce on it! The chicken practically melted in my mouth.  All that with a Mexican coke only cost $30.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Qui Qui  Chicken, corn on the cob,  Ribeye sandwich,  porky empanada.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. menu
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sign on the outside.  I thought it was funny.

_eaZLv7SVwPXd20PDSx6Fg.text: Holy crap.  I had Gaucho for lunch this summer, but it was their food truck.  No offense, GPA...but that food truck isn't necessarily doing you any favors.  Not that it was bad.  It wasn't.  It just wasn't as great as the food I got at the restaurant.    Which...okay...was great.  Sorry for the spoiler.  Great food.    No reservations, so there's usually a line, but honestly the wait was no more than probably 5 minutes AT LUNCH.    I had the special...Gaucho Banh Mi.  It was delicious.  See above.  My date had empanadas that she then shared with me.  Because she's awesome, but we're not rating her...the empanadas...ALSO awesome.    Every sauce/condiment was drinkably good (though honestly, i don't recommend that).  The staff was super high energy and friendly.  So if you don't like friendly people this may not be the place for you.    Cool vibe, great food, great staff.  Five star.  Bang.  Done.

8rB8vYCCA3sDElVbD0bpsg.text: Fantastic, and a fun dining experience, the slam the counter seating to the self services sauces and silverware make this place a must do when in the burg.

bmL5fiAj4cBXJ42zwVoWXA.text: After wanting to go here for a number of years I finally drove past and didn't see a huge line outside. Anything and everything on the menu here is great. This is one of the best places in all of Pittsburgh.

iOYtBfpDI1QUCCcsM5-ARg.text: Gaucho did deliver. I've been skeptical and find some of their signage off-putting. Maybe I'm getting too old or whatever.   Anyway, despite them botching our order and totally forgetting one of our entrees, they did fix it on the fly and offered us a free dessert. So, in the end they did the right thing. The root cause ended up being a new, inexperienced person at the register printing out a bad duplicate ticket for the kitchen. So it was not the kitchen's error to begin with.   So on to the food; it was absolutely delicious. I've been thinking about that skirt steak since I've had it. I've even gone so far as to call around to butcher shops and ask if they sell skirt (turns out not everyone does).   Let me review our order: an Argentino salad with medium rare flank, the grilled winter mushroom salad with medium rare skirt, along with a large order of the grilled shrimp. We ended up choosing the alfajores as our comped dessert.   I just wrote about the Rainbow Salad last week at Kaya's and said that it was a salad I would go back for as a meal. Well I guess I have to add the grilled mushroom salad on to that short list as well. The oyster mushrooms were just flame kissed and the brussel sprouts were charred just enough to make the whole salad have a meaty flavor and texture even without a bite of steak. The steak itself was truly spectacular and made my dinner date jealous despite their flank steak being excellent as well.   The Argentino salad was very good as well and got rave reviews by my date. The flank steak was cut into thick, meaty slices that were cooked perfectly.   Finally, grilled shrimp were excellent. And for a dozen at $18, while not cheap, totally worth the extra protein!  In the end, even the impromptu alfajores were delicious. And that coupled with the BYOB made it an absolutely perfect dinner. So, five stars it is, despite the wait.

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Mushroom Salad w Skirt Steak. $18

PwqCbM-yTQ2xyR6JQyNm1A.text: This place is great with bonus points for being kid-friendly! Order first, pay, and then sit down. Tried the empanadas, some meat, roasted roots, and a piece of bread with cheese on top. All of it was great and flavorful. I especially liked the self-serve sauce options, with the garlic and onion ones being my favorite.

3Z2A6yHs1BLzhgJnHDLcYg.text: Quite possibly the best food experience I've ever had-- for taste and value. I took two of my out of town friends here, both of which wanted to move to Pittsburgh after eating here! The quality of ingredients is absolutely remarkable especially for the price point. I don't think you can find better steak at Pittsburgh's most expensive steak houses. Pro tip-- at no extra cost you can upgrade the salad side on a steak plate to the garlic roasted potatoes! I also suggest if you like your steak medium-rare to get it medium, they tend to undercook. I would choose gaucho over any 5 star restaurant in this city or others

qKznNGIhYpFVcmRv-ng5zA.text: Our absolute favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh. Always worth the long wait in line. Some of the best chimichurri you'll ever have- do yourself a favor and get some extra toast just to dip in the sauces. I recommend the Asado Platter- good to split between 4 people when you order lots of sides! The empanadas are also great, but they do sometimes run out before the end of the night, so try to get there before then!   10/10 highly recommend. Great food at a reasonable price considering the quality & quantity. Be sure to bring your own wine or beer!

8Ic17QLp-nvOWN6SwT8u0w.text: I've been here three times - each time lured back by glowing Yelp reviews and the line snaking around the block.  Each time I couldn't figure out what I was missing.  Was it the food?  The ambiance?  The service?  Twice I even brought friends.  Maybe they could shine a light on what I was missing.  But they weren't impressed either.  The menu is on a vast, confusing chalkboard that carelessly (and unhelpfully) mingles Spanish and English.  The first time I ate here I was looking for the ribeye platter;  I couldn't find it on the board, lost  amid the sandwiches and appetizers, so I ordered a sandwich.    You order at the counter.  Since no one seems able to decipher the menu, each customer peppers the cashier with a hundred questions. This makes the ordering process very, very slow and is probably responsible for the line around the block.    The first time I asked for iced tea. All they had was bottled, so I passed.  I thought maybe I'd get another drink, but I couldn't see them on the menu, so I didn't know what my choices were.  Water it was.  I never did find out if they have anything other than water and bottled ice tea.  Once you order your food, they bring it to your table by calling out your name. One time I saw three "Bobs" jump up at the same time to claim their order.  Seating is plentiful - most people are still waiting to order.  A condiment bar provides four different Argentinian sauces: a chimichurri sauce, a pimento sauce, an onion sauce, and a garlic sauce.  The onion is the best. And you better like at least one, because you're going to need it for the dry, tasteless meats.  The first time it was the ribeye sandwich.  The bread was burnt and hard as an English biscuit. The ribeye was not tender, not flavorful, and was easily overwhelmed by the pound-and-a-half of roasted peppers laid on top of the sandwich.    The second time I tried the ribeye platter.  I ordered medium.  The meat came sliced, without a trace of pink.  I call that 'well done.' The meat was much the same as the first time - tough, dry and flavorless. It compares to a sirloin from Outback.  No wonder folk rave about the sauces, you need them to make the meat palatable.    The third time the meat was just as bad as the others.  Granted, at this price point I wouldn't expect Prime beef.  But if you're going to use Choice or Select, you should probably spend some time tenderizing it.  If skirt steak can be made tender, so can a ribeye.  Shoeleather sucks.

cTyYI6B2jsWItvvLhMvudA.text: Now, everyone talks about this place. Your mom, your cousin, daddy, step father, sister, cousin...everyone. I certainly didn't want to try it out because of all of the hype. Well, the hype is warranted! This place is everything! I mean everything. Like the moon and the stars type of everything.  I arrived around 11:30 am on a Friday. It was a good thing that I did because the lunch crowd appeared at about 11:40. Once you arrive, you stand in line, and on the wall is a large chalkboard menu. You order at the front, pay and then you are seated. Someone then, brings your order to the seating area, and yells your name. They then bring your dish to your table.   I got the Carne sandwich with rib eye and a side house salad. The sandwich was so big and scrumptious. I literally, drooled on the table when I opened it up (the sandwiches come in that sandwich paper). I should have known it would be good, the paper it was wrapped in was so greasy. The meat was so tender, and the onions, the caramelized onions leave nothing to be desired. The house salad was a perfect size, and I believe they make their own dressing. It was peppery and tangy.   I loved my experience here. The service was quick, the place was clean, and the staff was polite. It was a great place to celebrate the end of the work week!

VCzELuxPz0r38lFH-2ecqA.text: You best come early to this place if you don't want to wait.  There is a reason why the line is always long...their food is simply delicious! They make homemade sauces and their meat is seasoned to perfection. I personally get the rosemary braised beef, either as a sandwich or on one of their salads. Staff is always helpful and knowledgeable about their menu. You order at the entrance then sit and your food is brought out to you. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas! Chicken, beef, and veggie.  All very good!

pCp1dZXG5DvhRYrr7JbgiQ.text: This place rocks!  No alcohol, but byob.  The food is out of this world.  Argentine steaks grilled and sliced perfect.  Huge Paella and grilled appetizers.  Fed a group of 7 of us and so much fun!

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

W7xAfjDjzbqe4p7WvjbfXg.text: This place is definitely worth the hype. Every time I've been there the line has been out the door, but it moves very quickly. They have someone delegating where you should sit which helps with the wait time/worry around finding a place to sit. I'm on a strict diet for lifting and their meat/veggie options fit into my diet. Highly recommend the flank steak.

ItXIRpI1lpMBMZcLHmVEgg.text: Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is one of the best restaurants I have ever dined at. My experience began rocky, with a 45 minute wait. But, the wait was completely worth it. The food came quickly and was extremely hot. We ordered the provoletta, empanadas, pescado sandwich, el gaucho salad, flank steak, and roasted cauliflower. Everything we ate was delectable. The el gaucho salad was scrumptious, with fresh vegetables and a light dressing. The provoletta did not disappoint either, and was one of my favorite dishes. The flank steak and pescado sandwich were otherworldly, for they burst with flavor. The empanadas were fine, but a tad lackluster in flavor compared to the other dishes ordered. My personal favorite component of the meal was the toast. Though almost everything comes with toast, but do not undermine as a plain food or label it as the underdog. It was seasoned to perfection and the right amount crunchy. To be honest, I would eat at Gaucho again just for the toast. Making Gaucho even better, the staff is amicable and quick. They made conversation with us as we waited, and you could genuinely tell they were trying to move as fast as possible so people could sit down and start enjoying their meal. The wait, in my opinion, was completely worth it but not something to be ignored. Nevertheless, I can guarantee you I will dine at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina again, even if I have to wait an hour.

cwW90MDf4t20_YIuiGLEWA.text: Tried this spot with some friends on a hunch only to discover that it was the home to one of the greatest steak sandwiches ever. I got the carne with flank steak and it was more than enough in terms of both portion and flavor. They also have a great environment with an incredibly welcoming staff. Excellent spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WaBRQWal4yr-JsjRjjkTOg.text: I have been to Gaucho many, many times and each time I'm reminded that it is hands down the best place to eat in Pittsburgh.. if you want the meat sweats! (In fact, many years ago, I'd eat lunch here weekly before they had a ventilation system and even then, 10/10.)  I always go with at least a party of 4 and go all in with the meat platter and a bunch of sides and bread- family style. The BYOB option is incredible. The process to order and sit is very streamlined and I appreciate the ease.   Make sure to try all of the sauces, each one is delicious.   #bringbackcampfireyams

q0KSqqH0TIiTVooLoGrCAA.text: Every time I'm in Pittsburg I eat here... really a special place and the best steak. They even gave me pointers on how to make steak at home better!

Iu3j3UFF-qH4wCyXb1XB_Q.text: Where do I even begin with Gaucho? This is one of the best restaurants in the city, and an absolute must-try if you haven't been yet.  Gaucho is a tiny little place in the Strip that you might miss if you're not looking for it. Often times when you drive past you'll see lines out the door at this small brick building. I actually like the way Gaucho is set up - instead of being seated and having a waiter, you just wait in line to order at the register and then go scope out a table. The employees will call out your order as soon as it's ready. Overall I think this strategy makes the process go a little more quickly, which is good since it's always so packed! They don't take reservations here, but if you come on a weekday before around 6 PM you shouldn't have to wait long at all. My boyfriend and I came on a Wednesday at 5:45 and had no problem finding a table and getting our food in record time. Bring a bottle of wine with you - this is one of the only restaurants in the city that I've discovered that is truly BYOB (no uncorking fee!).  I've been to Gaucho twice now and have been overly impressed with the food both times. Absolutely everything on the menu here is so deliciously flavorful; you honestly can't make a bad choice when deciding what to get. I highly recommend the classic steak sandwich with the rib-eye. The roasted vegetables are also a favorite. I have never had such delicious grilled veggies in my life! The steak empanadas are also wonderful. The best part about Gaucho's food, in my opinion, is the way that all the strong flavors mesh together so beautifully. You won't find a bland dish here!  This is one of those restaurants in Pittsburgh that I will keep coming back to again and again. If you haven't been, you need to go TODAY!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The menu at Gaucho.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak sandwich, empanadas, roasted veggies, and roasted potatoes.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

B4kKOF9xuwoh1Rjcr32gag.text: We went to Gaucho last winter.... before the expansion because I remember it being so, oh, so cold. The small waiting/dining area was probably about a 8'X8' room. The 5-6 stools were against the wall and window. They also had a patio area that was open only in the summer. Anyway, I went back today and they've expanded. The place so huge! So glad... no more standing around and giving someone the death stare as they are enjoying their deliciousness. My friend and I got the Chuleta Cochina (pork chops), Caldo del Mar (seafood soup), Brussels Sprouts and bread pudding. The pork chops can feed 2 people -- it didn't come with a side so order one! I ordered the brussels sprouts, they were halved and then grilled (?), maybe - anyway, it was really good! The Caldo del Mar was good, there's a little bit of a broth on the bottom with 2 pieces of bread and then Mussels/Clams and squid sat on top. We had bread pudding... it was good - can't say it's the best I've ever had but it's solid!   We were there at 6pm right before the rush at 7pm so I would definitely recommend getting there earlier. Parking wasn't bad at the time we got in and there are plenty available on the street.   I'm definitely a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chuleta cochino
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brussels sprouts
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caldo del Mar

Ff-oI5T9iFrWkXIcNp3UGQ.text: I had tried to go to Gaucho once before, but since the lines tend to be long I never made it to the door. Yesterday we had the chance to get there for an early dinner... and I must say, it was worth the wait! We ordered five different items to share and I don't know which was the best! The chicken Empanadas (2 for $5) were a nice start - we paired them with the dipping sauces available for a little extra flavor.  The Provoletta was amazing! Perfectly cooked and was nice to share with this amount but isn't too heavy to have all to yourself. The corn-mash (I forget the actual name) was possibly my favorite item.. served warm, it was absolutely delicious! Then we shared a sliced beef plate that had good flavor and a nice medley of veggies / caramelized onions with it.   Top that all off with the pineapple-bread pudding and a nice bottle of red (BYOB, but NO CORKING FEE!) while sitting outside was a perfect Tuesday!  Everyone was friendly and helpful when we couldn't decide all the dishes we wanted - and the wait staff was fantastic! I'll definitely be back!

2VpVEwhtJB87aFnEkJyL6A.text: The hype is real folks. Read this review and get thee to Gaucho if you have not been there yet! Seriously. Don't wait. Do it!  I split the Rosemary Braised Beef and the Carne Steak sandwich with a friend. GREAT idea because it was the best of both worlds! While I enjoyed the Rosemary Braised beef more, because I love horseradish and caramelized onions, the Carne Steak was just as good! The steak was so flavorful you didn't need anything else...   Unless, you're into sauces like I am! I love sauce! They had four different kids of sauce on the table in the middle of the place. I wish I could tell you what every kind was, but all I know is that they were delicious! I just wanted to steal them and put them on everything I eat all the time!   It's s small place, so beware you may have to do take out, but don't fear, they're looking to expand shortly and will hopefully offer dinner service and more!! So get thee to Gaucho ASAP!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ROJTy8DdV4I6ocaAyFWg6g.text: I went there on a Saturday at 6 pm, and the wait was about an hour and half to get in. However it was certainly worth it, as this restaurant serves some amazing food. I had the spicy sausage sandwich and a chicken empanada. I would highly recommend both of those options for they were delicious, and I was able to eat the whole meal considering the hunger I built up waiting in line.   I was told there is no line around 2:30 and 5:30 on weekdays if you have the chance to go then.

TwvqcJ2z3nR9zCx3K6mQAg.text: All of the other reviews have this place covered.  It is incredible.  Been here many times and I am always impressed by the food - steaks cooked to perfection and extremely fresh ingredients.  Very reasonably priced - not cheap, but not overpriced either.  Nominee for favorite restaurant in PGH.  Love the 5 star food without the stuffy environment.  Always bring out of towners here as it is sure to be a hit.

IW5S3EeoR-hOypzWfxDwSQ.text: As difficult as it is to get in here, particularly if you are constrained to a lunch hour, I'd like to tell you that it wasn't that special, not worth the wait. I'm sorry, it's fabulous; we'll be coming back even with the long lines. The steak is unique to Pittsburgh, different than I've had anywhere else here. I love the variety of sauces that they encourage you to try. The staff is friendly to the point of being fun, even though they work very hard to service the crush of people. We have been trying for three years to get in here, so waited for a vacation day, came during the week, at 1:45, and only waited about 15 minutes to give our order. We'll be back next time we get a day off.

hw1WjNEpTY9MopkTezVxbg.text: I wish I could give this place 4.5....only downside is that the price is a little steep.   However, the food is solidly delicious.   Check out my pics for what we got this last time.  If you can get past the line, it's got a pretty good vibe in there.   Their meat is delicious---and they seem to run out if their signature flank steak occasionally because it's really so yummy.   I also forget what healthy portions you get for sandwiches and we usually end up ordering a meat platter.    This last time, I got a little daring and ordered their seafood mix soup...and it was really really good.  The broth is rich and just full bodied.   I could have just had the broth, but the seafood just brought this dish to a future always-order category.   Anyway...I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted potatoes, seafood mix, and the famous flank steak.

DbeEr85OHfLDrW3y5H0nqw.text: We were walking by Gaucho and it smelled so good we knew we had to stop. Their was a small line but it was all worth the wait.  We ordered the fugazza, the provoletta, chicken empanadas, the rosemary braised beef, the campfire yams and rice.  The fugazza was good but you must love onions and rosemary. If not, it's not for you. The provoletta was tasty. The chicken empanadas were just ok, not super flavorful. The rosemary braised beef sandwich was delicious. The rice was plain and the campfire yams were sweet and delicious (they would even make a good dessert).  If I lived in Pittsburgh I would definitely go back. The only thing that bugged me was you feel a little rushed while eating since they are trying to seat as many customers as quickly as they can.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Campfire yams!

UxT_pIfbjQofkp9irpk6Pg.text: Don't come here in a hurry, because it is not uncommon for there to be a line around the block waiting to order at this counter service restaurant.  It is worth the wait!  The steak and homemade sauces (try them all!) are the must try items, but salad to shrimp to bread to side vegetables - everything else I've tried here has been great as well. I just wish they served wine.  You are allowed to bring your own alcoholic beverages if you wish to though.

jeUPGX-teU_xBWVADhS3SQ.text: I'll admit I was skeptical: is this place _really_ that good? Um, yup. And they're not pretentious about it. Go early, tho. Even though the line moves quickly, it gets insanely long.

Kb9JHB6e9Jj6K764lphF6A.text: Can't beat this spot. My favorite in Pittsburgh. Food is phenomenal. Staff is quite nice. Today, I got the Bon Mi. It was stellar!   I suggest arriving 10 mins before they open the doors to avoid the rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outdoor patio
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bon Mi - what a delight

HOKOFx2bTsHHsGCZpT7FTA.text: Love this place every time. Casual dining. Great, friendly service. All the food is delicious. Amazing lamb and fish. Always get dessert no matter how full you are. Try all the sauces on everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I waited for a long time to eat the Paella at Gaucho.

G4QOdu8VixTRSCzcCQcXxw.text: Very poor customer service. I wish i could give them zero. Our friends recommended this place. We decided to have dinner here. We called before we go there. Nobody even bothered to pick up the phone. We were there 45 minutes before their close time. They said they are closing the kitchen and they wouldn't serve us. We insisted since we drove from Virginia but they didn't even respond and shut door on us! I guess she didn't care!

1Oasf-CMckZmv7OFaDBcQQ.text: Very tasty foods. Both for the meat-centric or a less heavily reliant. BOOB is nice, to let us choose the pairings. Friendly staff are there if you need em but unbothersome otherwise. The lineup is pretty much worth it. But from a managerial perspective, somewhat unavoidable. But its an asset to the institution that is probably a deliberate keeper to passively keep the hype. I'll play the game any day for food that tasty though. bravo.

tZVQvQL9Tein1y1bpYNHUA.text: Too many amazing restaurants in Pittsburgh to wait in line for 35+ minutes. My beers were cold when I got there, I swear. Sad because I was a loyal fan and customer.  The ordering process is not working. Fix it.

7jEdQPsopWCSEJfBrhkK0g.text: We have been wanting to try Gaucho for a while after all the great reviews and I got to sample some of their food at a previous Yelp event-it was yummy!  I was not sure what to expect and called to make reservations haha I hope they laughed at me. This place is so small and just a few counter tops to sit at. I recommend getting take out or going on a nice day when you can sit outside.  With Growler in hand  (it is BYOB) we waited in line and decided to take our food home as it was packed inside (def. a good sign).  There seems to always be a line but the food is worth the wait. My only complaint is that we went around 5:30 (be warned they close at 7 pm) and they were out of bread so no sandwiches. I mean come on how can you be out of bread.  I was super disappointed but was one of the lucky few in line that got my sandwich on the toasted bread they did have left. When we got home the food did not disappoint and the rosemary braised beef sandwich was fantastic. Had enough to make 2 extra sandwiches with the leftovers. The horseradish sauce and caramelized onion are the perfect combo with the meat. I also got the grilled veggies and corn on the cob.  I highly recommend the corn on the cob and will order 2 next time! My date got the flank steak which was cooked to perfection.  The flavors of this meat cannot be beat! I can't wait to go back as I heard they are moving to a bigger location at the end of the month.  Update:  We went for lunch since they have expanded to part of the space next store.  We waited in line of over an hour but were prepared for this.  The staff could not have been friendly from taking our order to checking on us numerous times. I ordered the same braised beef sandwich this time they had the bread to serve it on and it was the best sandwich I have had!  The new space has lots more seating!

KFU4lkddXWxM-WnS4CA0kA.text: The food is amazing! You will probably have to wait in a long line though and maybe not get a table because it is extremely popular. In regards to the private room, we held our rehearsal dinner for probably 25 people in May 2016 and I can't say enough how wonderful it was. Almost everyone said it was the best food they've ever had including people who live in LA as well as my mid-western family who aren't keen on trying different types of food. The service was above and beyond what you could ever expect. The staff was professional but fun. They took pictures of the group and joked around with them all night while also being quick and professional. I really can't praise them enough!

gyAJ9HLp73zuRzhhwf7D9w.text: I don't know anyone who has been to Gaucho and not loved it.  I'm a vegetarian and big fan of cheese so I always go for their provolone sandwich.  My boyfriend loves meat and he is crazy about their steak sandwiches.  The only problem is that there are only a few tables inside to eat at.  Best to go on a weeknight or get it to go.  So worth it though!!

UqP1P-9gt0dUasw2iN1vKw.text: One of the True gems of Pittsburgh. If you haven't noticed, this town is becoming a food town and the best part about that, is all the hidden gems resting around the city. This place is not even remotely close to being hidden, but rather, stands out the moment you walk by. The smells are intoxicating and the food is 100% quality. The service is always prompt - no matter how busy - and I don't need to say how good it is - all you have to do is walk by at noon on a Thursday to see the line out the door.

V4jj7AXbLkjScwP0mRW-hA.text: Best lunch spot in Pittsburgh.  For those of us who don't eat a ton of of meat, especially red meat, this can seem like an unlikely choice...but I promise you you will not be disappointed. And don't be intimidated by the line which is always wrapping out the door and up the 16th St. bridge. It is worth the wait if for nothing other than the steak burger.   I've also had the gaucho salad topped with the shredded chicken and it is outstanding. And let's  talk about those sauces... Just get as many little cups and fill them up with every single one! I never remember what's what, but truthfully it doesn't matter :).  This is one of those places where the food really does live up to the expectations set by all of the press reviews. It's just that good!

AKhn1BAmnpuqryGXZci5ZQ.text: Delicious food, great atmosphere, and wonderful owner/staff. There is usually a line out the door but they are very efficient in getting people in and out. It's definitely worth waiting in the line.

474mZ2qIBYGonubwlMCOog.text: I REALLY did not want to like this place....  The line was long and we had to wait outside.  I thought it was strange you ordered and paid before you sat down..  But I LOVED IT.  The food, wow, the food - amazing! Gotta go with the meat!  My girlfriend and I split the large sirloin.  I definitely recommend getting it medium.  It is served with toast, salad, and a steak sauce.  Delicious is an understatement.  The meat is tender, and that portion alone was massive.    We also split an order of the wings.  The wings were huge, as they were five full wings (10 total).  I recommend using their homenade sauces on top of them, as they can be a bit crispy (not quite burnt). Then we each had a chicken empanada, which if you put their homemade garlic sauce on = epic.   My girlfriend and I are the type who like to leave a restaurant full, and typically finish everything on our plates.  Here, we had leftovers (just to give an idea of how much food it really is).   All that food was just $41.  ONLY $41.  Finally, we heard amazing things about their dessert, so we had to indulge.  We split the cheesecake.  Best dessert I have had in a long, long time.    So, even though I REALLY wanted to hate this place, I ended up loving it.  Keep in mind, my girlfriend and I went at 7:30 on a Wednesday and still did not get our food until 8:30. I cannot imagine what the line is like on a weekend.

D8WLnHZqZwLxmLH7Wfnx7g.text: This place has the best food in Pittsburgh. Hands down. I would even put my hands back up again, so I can hands down again. Whether you are visiting or a burgher in the flesh, GO TO GAUCHO NOW.   I am blown away by Gaucho and their incredible food. We walked in intending to eat in there but its not big enough for that. We took it over to the Beer Market in the North Shore and just raved about every bite. We all got sandwiches and since there were 6 of us all ordering different items on the menu, I can say I tried a lot of them. I couldn't tell which one I loved the best. I think 4 are tied for first. Is that possible?  The sandwiches were filling but we also got some potatoes and veggies. Potatoes were a little underdone, but the veggies were perfect.

9FL4yINPe3VmMG4MNDItww.text: Everything was amazing. I ordered the Flank Steak Plate, chicken empanada, and the grilled vegetables. The flank steak had a perfect crust that married so well with the chimichurri and other sauces. So very tender and delicious. That being said, my favorite part was the grilled vegetables. They were absolutely stellar. I put the grilled onions and peppers on the olive oil soaked bred and then rubbed it with the chimichurri. So so good. The empanada was nice but not the star. It went well with the pimenton sauce.   I'd come back to Pittsburgh for this.

qMai8AjpYpHT71grcLAGgg.text: You've already heard that the sandwiches are great, so I'll focus on the other aspects.    There was obviously thought put into the decor and the design of the space.  There's lots of great decorative accents and fixtures throughout.  It's a small space, but super cute.  The patio area also looked very cozy.  Customer service was also great!!  Personally, I was really confused by the chalkboard menu.  I had no idea what any of the categories were!  I had to ask the cashier, "Which ones are your sandwiches???" and "What's all the other stuff?"  She was super friendly and was more than happy to explain their menu to me.  When my sandwich was ready, the manager(?) brought me my sandwich and was also very friendly and even took the time to explain their sauces to me.  Seriously, I was very impressed by the customer service!!  Not because they made any huge gestures, but it was the very genuine, unhurried, and unpretentious attitude and treatment that I received.  (We all know what it's like to walk into the new hot spot/hipster hangout and get the typical unimpressed and unfriendly customer service...)  Now on to the sandwiches!!  I've had their infamous steak/carne sandwich before and it was delicious!  Even as leftovers!  So, this time I tried the Rosemary beef sandwich.  Also very good, but could have done with a little more horsey sauce in my opinion.  There's a big chunk of meat, so luckily I had taken the suggestions of the staff at Gaucho and gotten a little bit of the ojo sauce to add to my sandwich.    All the other items looked so yummy! I can't wait to come with more people to try all the sides and options.  If you haven't already given Gaucho Parrilla a try, make sure to stop by the next time you're at the strip!  It's also on the end of the strip, so that makes it an easy stop for lunch if you work dowtown!

R7VsuzWkAgBjLzAFUY5vog.text: We had an amazing meal here about an hour ago before the game. We looked up healthy places to eat in Pittsburgh and this place came up. They have a wide variety of options for meat lovers and vegetarians alike. All their food is wood fire grilled. The service here is so kind. I'm definately going to recommend this place to everyone. We will be returning very soon

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mH1E0xjt_ga-I_FlOvC9ow.text: Meat. Delicious, delicious, juicy meat. Shared a couple of the sandwiches with a friend (bread to meat ratio on point) and I got a corn on the side. I would totally come here every day if I could.   Service was also fantastic - my friend brought her dog and the dog got a bone half the size of her.

eJDEsEbEU1T_OWF3JyE0MA.text: The setup for ordering is poorly planned but the food makes up for every possible inconvenience.

EmaZcywSTSWAv6b-fn1ssw.text: Oh I looooove Gaucho!  I remember when they were half the size, prior to the remodel. I didn't even mind the wait for a table. When I go, I love the Carne.  It's my favorite!  Parking is a bit of a challenge, but it is really worth it.

9SjGpCPw0upUvo9tG70tbA.text: Food poisoning: I get it, this place is very popular. Lines out the door. People raving about it. Staff emboldened. Lots of buzz. But, when things don't go quite as planned that is the True test of an establishment. I've been coming here weekly for some time. Two weeks ago I decided to try the "steak burger" cooked medium, which I have never eaten there before. I got it to go, got home, was very hungry, but midway through eating it (though it was flavorful) I felt a rumbling in the stomach and physically could not finish it. 10 minutes later I was in the bathroom with a problem. My GI tract was thrown off for a week. I called Gaucho and asked to speak to management. Spoke to manager Mike, told him the problem, told him to please check the burger batch and not feed that to any more customers as it was clearly contaminated. He assured me he would speak to chef and offered to get me a free meal to make up for it. I didn't expect that, but then he took my number and said he would call within the next few days to follow up. No call came. It's been 2 weeks. Don't make empty promises, especially when your customer was sickened by your food. This has left me very bitter to Gaucho. Enjoy the yummy tasting food but don't expect this place to do anything for you if you have a problem. And watch out for the burger!

9BcBLHr2qbzuT5iEyI8u-Q.text: Another non-traditional restaurant. There's a very large menu on the wall when you enter and you're not seated until after you've ordered and paid. Yes, it was weird tipping before being served???  The food was all very very good though especially El Chorizo, my personal favorite. The shrimp and churrasco were EXCELLENT also.

f9TX3iS1bzqZ8m-pOnhWqw.text: Worked in fine dining for 5 years and this may have been my most euphoric food experience yet. Part of 3 of us we each tried each other and every thing was absolutely to die for. Smoked pulled pork sandwich with caramelized onions and mustard was fantastic. Other person got sweet sausage sand witch and sausage had a very unique twist in the flavor that worked in perfect harmony with rest of flavors. I got the Ribeye medium with side salad, by far best ribeye I've ever tasted. They aced the medium temp on their wood fire grill.  Even side salad was very tasty and prices aren't too bad. 3 of us was roughly $35 and that included a tip. This is the rare kind of place where every last menu item will completely knock your socks off! Can't wait to return!

zbW3IWmeCU63NDmTC1iM7Q.text: This place was awesome. It has a bohemian feel and great customer service. I got the mixta plate which has pork chicken and beef. The sides are extra. Really great presentation and everything tastes so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixta

RXhHbgQpARMcoOa4RPmm7A.text: On my trip to Pittsburg I heard through the grapevine that this place was somewhere I had to go. Well this place was fantastic and it is a must go to place if you are in Pittsburg and you love meat. Everything tasted extremely good. The steak came out to perfection and the sides were very good as well. They also server about 4-5 different meat sauces. These are probably the best part and take the meat to a whole different level! This place is kinda expensive so be prepared to spend a little. But it is totally worth it for-sure.   The building is small, but the food is good so I could understand why there was a long line when I arrived. They have a very nice setup that relied on mostly natural lighting. I like that they had l4 containers of spice next to the line so you could taste them. We had to wait about 30 minutes to get to the desk then about another 20-30 for the food. But it was worth the wait. I would suggest maybe googling this place to see when the least busiest times are and go then.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VxW2eYIqibx_KiBMf0seWg.text: This was my first time trying Argentinian food, and let me tell you, wow!! I chose the deconstructed chicken sandwich and my boyfriend had the steak burger. We both really enjoyed our meats (served hot and cooked perfectly), as well as a side of baked cauliflower, which was delicious. The best part about Gaucho is definitely the sauces, though. They have four different sauces you can choose from, and we had a hard time picking which was our favorite (so we used them all, of course)! Additionally, the restaurant is BYOB, with no corkage fee which is a plus. The only downside was the wait to get in, since they dont take reservations. There was a steady line out the door the entire time we were there (from about 6 PM - 8 PM). The food is definitely worth the wait, and I cant wait to get back there to try out some of the other stuff on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Deconstructed chicken sandwich, side of cauliflower, steam burger, and ALLLLL the sauces

3EpSij2vZioHLgjXFCAakg.text: I've been here twice now and each time gets better and better. I am OBSESSED with Gaucho! The menu is huge & I feel like you can't go wrong with whatever you get. There are so many options- from sandwiches, to small & large plates, to appetizers & more. This place is incredible. I've never had a wait before ordering which is always nice. The first time I was here I got their catch of the day which happened to be salmon. It was INCREDIBLE. And the serving of salmon was huge! It was served with a side salad and a piece of toast. I swear their toast is made from God himself bc it is just that good. The next time I went I made sure to grab and extra order of toast. I've tried the sides of spaghetti squash, yams, and potatoes. Everything is amazing. There is so much flavor in everything they make and it is just all so amazing. I got the pulled pork the last time I was there and it was the best I had ever had in my LIFE. 10/10 for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NrUy0hEt020r0X8BUjjMHw.text: We came on Thursday for a bit later lunch and were surprised at no line! While our first visit, it will not be our last!  Casual, yet excellent food!

WqANNcqVfy_EhjLUTABeLQ.text: Great food, HORRIBLE service for the following reasons (all of the below were after spending $250):  1. After waiting 1.5 hours in line, we had a standoffish waiter who was rude, abrupt, and obnoxious (seated at 8:52 - see below for the rest  of timeline). Waiter's name is Patrick.  2. After finishing dinner, they didn't clear any plates and instead, basically put the bread putting dessert on top of the unfinished paella 3. They started putting chairs up on the empty tables around us at 9:30pm (this was a SATURDAY NIGHT FYI) 4. We asked for an extra chair for a friend who was coming to meet us for drinks (this was at 10:02 - remember that we got seated at 8:52), they said no - HERES THE WORST PART "sorry we've been here for 8 hours and want to go home so we're locking the doors. No more guests allowed". We then ask for the manager.  5. Manager refuses to come, waitress comes back and says "sorry my manager supports me 100% and doesn't want to come up, sorry bye!"

PrDm9ly8prullA0fcDw4tQ.text: DON'T CRY FOR ME ARGENTINAaAaAaAaA !  I finally tried this Argentine chacusary styled restaurant. There is a line outside so you know something is up.  See, the way it works is you order your food from the chalkboard and pay for it, collect your drinks, sit down and get served one time only. You have to walk around and find your own water and drinks but they still want a tip!   I ordered the Carne steak sandwich with roasted peppers and I chose sirloin meat. I ordered the side of rosemary garlic clove potatoes which I ate with my sandwich which boosted the flavor. Everything is slightly charred.  It was fun to try different styled food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Papa al Horne, rosemary garlic clove potatoes
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mxh8y67EDnWLt-0KO7A_HA.text: Just yes, everything yes! It was all delicious! The sides are as big of stars as the entrees. Also, the cookies were amazing too. A place like this, it's easy to focus on the meat and think you can get everything else somewhere else. I'm, no. Just do yourself a favor and order everything. And in case you're thinking, my eyes are bigger than my stomach, no, you're stomach will just need to make room. Favorites included the steak burger, carrots, and the chix empanadas. Fair point pricing on everything. I'd say pro tip, but it's more an obvious tip IMO, you want to try the four sauces that you pick up on your way to the table after ordering. Be prepared to pay probably wait a little to order due to lines out the door, but also be prepared for staff who are super friendly and helpful. Also, plan your visit accordingly; they are closed on Sundays and Mondays.

0fgmeX98eM02i9LWIYShLg.text: Second time at this restaurant and I still love it! Unfortunately we had to wait 45 minutes on a Tuesday evening to order but the food was still delicious. We wanted to order empanadas as our appetizer but they only had 1 left at 7:45pm :( I got the Argentinio salad and it was huge. The papas (potatoes) were slightly hard but all the other vegetables were grilled nicely and served hot/warm over the salad. Mixed some of the veggies with the sauces they provide on the side and it was a treat. My friend got the catch of the day (Salmon) and it was cooked very well and was soft and flakey (definitely recommend this). The service is always great and everyone is super friendly and casual!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Large Argentino Salad
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. NY strip on the bottom, empanadas in the middle. Amazing

Ag-QXqdJbbhpIXfpWoeoew.text: This is my repeat visit to this meat haven, granted it's been years since my first visit, I think I've gathered enough information to develop a conclusion: I am not nearly the carnivore I think I am.   Seeing how Gaucho is quite possibly top three restaurant in terms of Yelp popularity in Pittsburgh, I think it should be held to a higher standard. So here comes the truth:  Good -The energy is undeniable and the wait staff is pleasant, beyond helpful.  -This space is vast despite its deceiving outer appearance. -the smaller items on menu are exceptional. Take the whole "smaller" term with a grain of salt though. I'm not sure these guys know small....  The not so good -although the meat is plentiful, this isn't exactly Texas low n slow style. Tenderness matters, especially when it's this much packed in a sandwich!   Personally I feel where they excel is the sides and appetizers. Items like the empanadas or the roasted cauliflower are great. The cauliflower honestly is out of this world good.   Gaucho remains a formidable lunch option, with great value for your dollar. Just don't expect to have additional stomach space for dinner....

lf7CtF1kicu166DI0z871g.text: *HIGHLY RECOMMEND (Especially for steak lovers)*  This was rated one of the top 10 places to eat in the US according to Yelp a few years ago. Many people raved about it and I knew I had to try it out. I went here to celebrate one of my friend's birthday on a weekend. We were forewarned about the line and had to wait in line for about an hour. But was it worth it? YES. Everything was under $20 and for the amount and quality you get, it was definitely at a good price point. Service was great! The waiter gave us free dessert because he overheard us say it was our friend's birthday. I would go back again and try their famous paella that can feed like a whole family.  *DINNER*  We ordered 2 steak platters, one fish platter, 2 appetizer, and rosemary pulled pork sandwich. The rosemary pulled pork sandwich was sooo gooodd! It was juicy and fragrant. The steaks were all perfectly medium rare, and comes with a side of bread and salad. There were different dipping sauces to dip the steak in. The fish was tender. The yellow rice was standard and the corn was okay. Since this place is known for the steak, it definitely did not disappoint.   We ordered banana bread pudding and we got free cookies from the waiter. The bread pudding was good, but a bit too sweet for my liking. However my friend thought it was "life changing".

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bzcN4WUcT8KasL-yOCqlcQ.text: This is definitely one of my favorites in Pittsburgh. Get there before 6pm to avoid the long lines. The atmosphere is very chilled and the staff friendly. I love that most dishes come with a salad and toasts. Can't go wrong with anything beef.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parrillada Mixta
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bife de Gaucho

XrIerzDGayVXUkCEsdThcQ.text: I really love this place. The trick is to go there at 6:30 in the middle of the week. The meats are done to perfection. The daily empanadas are always great. There's a plethora of meat to choose from but if you feel overwhelmed ,which I did, the staff is more than willing to help you. I also enjoy the corn and cauliflower, they have a nice char to them. It's worth the wait and it's byob!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp, potatoes, sirloin sandwich

Vz339Gu7wI3q1614zyX2og.text: Arrived at 8:30 on a Friday night and there was no line so we went for it! The service was great and the food lived up to the hype!  We had a large steak plate and one of each empanadas and the corn. The steak was perfectly cooked and the onions bread and salad were awesome! There are four different sauces available and I recommend getting all of them to dip meat, bread and empanadas. The dough of the empanadas was perfect and almost flaky!!! Enjoy!

N_SnVYJpOEhBr29On8RbKA.text: Gaucho is nice...the food is good and varied and I love how you can customize all Your orders . Make sure to get the potatoes with garlic and rosemary. I don't appreciate all the waiters there . But the majority were nice . Worth trying and going back .

aqv0E4iNbMHHc5i-EG52OA.text: My absolute favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. It's never been a disappointment, and everyone I take here asks to go back. I'd recommend you read the menu, get the type of meat you'll enjoy, because I love it all. Rare 5 stars from me.

1pRCMIN2_5DoC1Y7dOe-2w.text: Everything is good here. The steaks were tender, perfectly cooked and seasoned, and melts in your mouth. The chicken appetizer, grits, and potatoes were all amazing. I'd make sure to also try all the sauces. The beef empanadas were just okay but I'd skip them if you want more potatoes or grits.   They don't have parking and it can be a pain in the ass to find street parking. There are some parking lots nearby but they accept cash only. The line for the restaurant can also get really long so I'd try to time it by coming in off peak hours if you don't have too much time. Despite those things, I will definitely try to come back if in Pittsburgh.

O1y9lfoQXHO80thPqbVw3w.text: I finally made it here a few weeks ago for lunch. I've had their amazing food truck offerings before but had not been to their restaurant.  Lunch on a weekday is busy but the woman taking our drink order treated us like we were her only customer. She gave some great suggestions for ordering. It was a toss up for me between steak and salad. She recommended the salad with steak. What a novel idea!!  Why didn't I think of that?  So, I got the Argentio with medium rare steak. It was so good!  The steak was cooked just right and there where so many good flavors mixed together in the Argentio salad. I would go back again just for that. But they have some many other amazing sounding items on their menu, I can't wait to go back.

O-S7Nbo69LDcC_BBpaKYzg.text: My husband and I decided to try Gaucho for my birthday yesterday, after hearing nothing but praises by friends over the past couple of years. They were certainly not wrong! We waited in line for maybe half an hour, which for good food is not long at all. I had the pollo and my husband had the carne sandwich. We also ordered a side of potatoes. Everything came fast, it was hot, and amazing! My husband said it was the best steak sandwich he's ever had! We tried all of the sauces with our potatoes, our favorite hands down was the red pepper sauce. All of them were tasty though! We will definitely be back again.

90YpJGzlBIskT2Y2-7CIew.text: I stopped here after wondering where to get something to eat for dinner. I was a little worried about how long the wait would be after reading a few reviews. I rolled in around 4pm and I gotta say there was hardly any wait. I was army table in about ten minutes and had my food about fifteen minutes later. But on walking in the staff was super friendly and I mean super super friendly. I had any questions they where sure to answer them and help me decide what to get being a first timer. The menu is pretty big and there seems like so many good options I wanted to get it all. I ended up settling on the sliced ribeye steak that was cooked to perfection with a perfect rare temperature. It was seasoned amazingly every bite was so juicy. It came paired with a salad and toast and it was all so fresh and the toast was such a great add on. I added on a side of potatoes and a veggie empanada and a beef one. The potato's where roasted with whole gloves of garlic and rosemary and sea salt it had so much flavor and the potatoes where the perfect softness not over cooked at all. The empanadas where good to but kinda small but they change them up regularly they said so that's a plus. They had a area where you could get different types of sauce in a little cup and all of them where so delicious but the red pepper one was by far my favorite. This place was everything I was hoping for plus more. I can't wait to return here again and try more of the menu. The staff and the food and the setting really just gave it that WOW factor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rib eye
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Church style booths

HFTFBt6YlmCyvFbFOgF0fw.text: I have been to Gaucho several times, and it's definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh! I would recommend it to anyone visiting the area for the first time.  I love getting the steak sandwiches, but honestly anything is good here. As a side I would recommend the potatoes. One of the best parts of the Gaucho experience is the self-serve sauces they have. When I go with friends we usually have a good time talking about which is our favorite (I maintain that the ajo/garlic one is the best!). Sometimes when I'm extra hungry I even get some toast to eat with the sauce, but a sandwich or any other entree is usually more than enough. Prepare by going with an empty stomach!  Just one note of caution: lines can get very long. I have waited in a line for around 2 hours to get in on a Friday or Saturday night. If you want to get in quick I would recommend going for lunch on a weekday, but there still might be a bit of a line. It does go pretty quick though! On a similar note, they don't take reservations and their system is that they seat you after you order at the counter.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sandwiches, toast, grits, and sauce! Delicious!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The four types of sauces. My favorite is the ajo (garlic) in the bottom right.

CH6PjvJquVAdfDj0yyj-9Q.text: One of my fave places in PGH! I always recommend this whenever friends or coworkers ask about casual but quality food places to check out. The steaks here are REALLY GOOD! Make sure you get all the sauces they have (and take some home too :')) - full of lots of flavor. Gaucho gets packed superrrrr quickly - so either come here with a very small group (or by yourself, lol) or come at weird times, unless you're okay with waiting in line for almost an hour. I've seen lines wrap around this place in the dead of winter so.. you know its good. There's a decent amount of seating in the back (it's an order and sit-down place - but they will bring our your food for you and help clean up), but be sure to have a back-up plan in case it's crazy in there. Empanadas are alright, but what I come here for, is the steak + sauces and the roasted veggies! Go go go

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

cIDaYDhRQd94tQ3TsoBbRg.text: Great place and so delicious food! I love this restaurant. The sauces are so cool and very yummy. Especially the onion sauce. We ordered the ribeye small and pescado plate. Not too many roasted vegetables. Will try others next time. Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LsjHNkOiiyXaK-qMNxOLSQ.text: There is an absolute good reason the line is wrapped around the block on the weekends for this place - it's incredible and worth the wait - I swear!

L2jB0KzTKwmYem97lBE8uQ.text: Delicious although the wait outside can be very long. Very casual and not obviously the place for your first date

FqwmacWlSV4zLSsAXvhzvg.text: So maybe you're wondering: "What's all the fuss and why is there always a line around the block?".  Do you like an exceptional meal that sticks out in your memory long after the last bite? So do all of those people in line. I promise, it's worth it, so get your spot in said line while you finish reading this review.  Gaucho is really first and foremost about the meat. I go for vegetarian options quite often, but I can't do that here. You only need to inhale the smoky, savory aroma that cloaks this establishment like an enchanted fog to get the idea. I've tried several sandwiches over the years, including the Chory Pan and the Pollo, but the Rosemary Braised Beef is legend, and I keep going back to it. It's a perfect combination of flavors; notably, the marriage of rosemary and horseradish sauce. On my last visit, I finally tried their empanadas and Humita (corn pudding). Delightful, although I still stand by the sandwiches.  Pro Tip (ha!) - Go at an off time! I've gone either right at 11AM or between 2 and 4, and the wait is incredibly shorter. Just have an early or late lunch; let me reiterate, it is SO worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas (pork and chicken) and that delicious corn puddin&#39;

KzClr202y8xRlO8R6Ia_Dg.text: Amazing. This place is def bang for your buck. I've been to fancy steak restaurants and this place on another level. It's BYOB without corkage fee and the food is delicious!!! One drawback was we waited 1hr online. The places gets packed and there is typically a line outside to get in.

f76CcdjNdPMMu3u7ci_N5Q.text: The food was awesome. The environment and atmosphere was very hipster-ish. The service people were kind and helpful. Not too expensive either. Would go again!

TAwOdoH2LRs003NWDL11yA.text: Best steak salad in the city! I routinely crave the charred but definitely not over cooked goodness that is a gaucho steak. The blue cheese and baby potatoes on top seal the deal!

lA0MLP8HxoVL_aKMlGy4CQ.text: Yes! Finally, I got to take someone here. I do not know why but whenever anyone visits this is my go to suggestion AND yet people sometimes say no because of the wait. Let me tell you each and every minute I wait is worth it. My aunt and uncle were in town for the baseball game (btw we won) and I suggested we go here. We were already in the Strip District so they said ok. We walked in and they were just wide-eyed gaping at the menu not knowing what to try or where to even start. They kept on saying, wow it smell good. There was no wait, miracle!, and we got a table right in front. I got us each of the dips and sat waiting for our food to come and them to be amazed.
