Accompanamientos: Maiz: Grilled Corn on the Cob: It was amazing as usual. I talked my aunt into getting one with me. She bit into it just saying, wow...that is good. It was sweet and grilled to perfection. Each time I get this corn there is nothing that I would add to it at all. My aunt added one of the sauces, or maybe a bit of all the sauces, to hers and really seemed to enjoy that mixture.   Pequenos: Provoletta: Sharp provolone grilled with arugula, lemon, and olives on toast.: I did not order this my aunt did for her main course. She said that it was almost too much cheese (if that is even a real complaint) but it was grilled to perfection. She also realized after this dish that she like arugula. It looked good. It was a nice thick slab of cheese on their toasted bread. i loved the look of it and would love to try it on another visit.   Con pan: Pescado:Fish of the day w/ lettuces, lemon, and caramelized onion:  This is my jam. I get this all the time even though I always want to try new things. It is just so good. The onions are just perfection. Smokey and soft with the hint of the grill in them. The tilapia just grilled so that it flakes off in your mouth but stays together in the sandwich. The lettuce is abundant and so when things fall off the sandwich you also have a little side salad to go with it. The bread is just the best. Light and crusty....yummmmm. I would eat this everyday.   Exclusivos: Cerdo: Pork tenderloin, caramelized onion, and spicy mustard. Served with a small casa salad and tostado: At the last minute after much back and forth my uncle decided on the LARGE plate of the cerdo. It was a mountain of pork. He got it and when he looked at the plate just goes, maybe I should have gone with the small. He said the meat was great and the side of spicy mustard was just the right kick to make the plate amazing. He really loved it.   I always enjoy showing and bringing people to some of my favorite places around the 'burg. I love it even more when the people love the places we get to try. I am so happy they had a great time and can not wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish Sammy

YZ7vaJR0po8jAcI4b9Y4zQ.text: First I called to get a pick up order and they said they don't do pick up orders.  So we went there and ordered and it took 70 minutes to get our food it was cold and the service was terrible but I could see where the food would've been good but I will never go back and you're a fool if there's any indication that they're busy and you go

c2QqJ4s9yo234cYPJ0EjEw.text: This food here is completely delicious.  I've been on gaucho land in the Argentine highlands and this is better (albeit far more expensive).    I had the New York strip 6 oz and it was perfect caution the line to get in was loooooong and my brother told me it always is.  On the bright side I arrived 40 minutes late while he waited in line .... Sooooo I only had to stand in line like 20 minutes :p. Thanks bro!  So what that means is if you have leg issues or something it might not be fir you to stand outside in the sun for that long.  But if you do it's worth it, food is great!

2tCLUqOBAmIfB9nW46ErdA.text: Closed their doors an hour before their scheduled closing time and shut off their phones with only half capacity. Gaucho wants to shepherd their customers through the restaurant with the same care as the beef they serve and care little about the customer experience.

ztJPYVFL_fRLDnYw1DqCmw.text: One of the best spots in PGH, but expect a wait. Fast-casual and line is usually out the door. But it's so so worth it. Shrimp and flank steak are incredible. Even the cauliflower is fantastic.

zkQkTbULh5v-wQpWOaxclA.text: 6 out of 5 stars!!! Ok maybe the fact that i was starving when we got there on our road trip past Pittsburgh contributed a half star but nevertheless one of most memorable restaurants I've been to. My wife a I shared the Parrillada Mixata that included a choice of steak (we tried NY), spicy chorizo, bbq chicken and toasts. We also tried the chicken and beef empenadas. Everything was amazing! The portions were generous and enough for the two of us. The sauces couldn't be any better. Specially the smoked pepper sauce. The service was great and the staff were super friendly and attentive. We were lucky that we got there a bit early for dinner but there was a huge line for dinner by the time we left. The prices were also very reasonable. Overall i wanna go back to Pittsburgh just to go to Gaucho Parrilla Argentina.   Food: 6/5 Service and atmosphere: 5/5 Price: 5/5  Overall: 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parrilla mixata
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas

vasigAqSUb3kbj2Kl-uSAA.text: Came here on a weekday night and the line wasn't as bad as I had anticipated based on other reviews.   Items I recommend: - Beef empanadas: beef wins over chorizo in my opinion. I would almost always choose chorizo over beef in any circumstances, but the balance of flavor was better in the beef empanada - El Gaucho salad with steak added: I highly enjoyed each bite of this salad that contained radish, asparagus, bunch of leafy greens, carrot strips, and avocado, tossed in a light dressing. One bite of medium rare (or whatever other shape or form you like your meat) steak followed by a massive bite of vegetables made me feel much proud of myself for eating veggies because I actually really would never pay money to buy myself a salad. But this one was worth it.  - Sauces: try all the sauces and put it on everything whether it's empanada, steak, your fork, or whatever. Find out which sauce speaks to you the most and discuss it with your company for meaningful conversations.   If I come here another time, and everything tastes consistently amazing, I will upgrade my rating to a five-star.  Oh, and BYOB.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5_coaF3YWcP8696Ijwqrmw.text: AWESOME food!! You place your order from a large chalk board right as you walk in but they do have seating. There is always a line so be prepared to wait a bit. Everything that I've ever had here has been great. All of the staff is very friendly and super helpful if you have questions. Don't forget the sauces!  They have multiple homemade sauces that you can add to anything. You will not leave this place hungry!

ZL_i7-e5a3Ejsaf16cWeeA.text: Gaucho is a very interesting place with a cool concept. A big line awaits you when you walk in and it is not the people who are waiting to be seated but they are also placing their orders. You can order your meal and beverages at the check in counter and pay for it too. The waitress will get you and find a seat. Then someone will bring in your food and serve it at your table.   Now I liked most of my experience but when you are looking for any service at your table, you would barely get any. Probably because I was there between 8 and 9, I don't know. The food was very good, I ordered small plate of camarones (shrimp), veggie empanadas and chicken sandwich. Their sauces are a must try!  If not for their poor service at the table and the wait at the front, it is a 5 Star experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jgb_-TRiLfUKpWmlu7I96Q.text: Great quality food. Pork empanadas were great. Braised Beef Sandwich (add Avo!) was best thing we had. Chicken was solid, not great, but good. Customer was outstanding. Would definitely recommend and come back if ever in area.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MrhJONlzvnoHgs4dr0NnYQ.text: Gaucho is well worth the hype. I visited after a friend spent an entire day telling me how great this place was. I was fully prepared to be disappointed. Our first attempt at getting into Gaucho's was on a Friday night, and we were already a little late to the party. The line can be fairly long, and the restaurant isn't a big place, so the wait can get a little lengthy and daunting. We had places to be that night, so we decided to come back the next day for lunch. We made sure to get there early and got a reasonable spot in line.   Drinks are the first things ordered and you get them while waiting in line shortly before you order food and pay. There are 2 options for seating, indoors and in a small outdoors area immediately outside. We opted for the outdoors spot since it was a nice day, and it was great. My friend and I ordered the carne sandwich (with filet, medium rare), a ribeye plate, empanadas, and grilled corn. We were hungry.   Carne sandwich: 5/5. The meat was amazingly cooked, tender and flavorful. The ciabatta bread adds significantly to the sandwich, I'm pretty sure it would not be as good with any other type of bread. The chimichurri sauce complemented the meat nicely, and the array of sauces that are available inside all tasted great on top of the sandwich.   Ribeye plate: 5/5. The meat again was top notch. The toast was nicely done, not too dry and not too rough to eat. Plenty of flavor to add to the plate. The salad was a typical salad but was an appropriate amount to combine with the remainder of the dish.  Empanadas: 5/5. We ordered the beef and chicken empanadas. The empanadas are reasonably priced and very nicely done. The shell is toasted to a nice crisp that is also easy to bite through. The empanadas were packed, and were certainly a good portion. All of the contents tasted great.   Corn: 4/5. Corn was lightly grilled and appropriately buttered. Great flavor, but not anything out of this world.   Even though we were outdoors and somewhat secluded, waiters made sure to find their way to our table to refill drinks and make sure everything was tasting good. Service was excellent. The only issue with this restaurant is the possibility of a long wait, however that seems to be a growing problem at all great restaurants. If you come a little early, the wait shouldn't be too bad. The parking options around here are reasonable and we found parking 1-2 blocks away.   Definitely recommend coming here!! I would have come back the next day however they are sadly closed on Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye plate

kZVmZiUapgdOe2lySVoqoQ.text: A line out the door and around the corner on a Thursday!?  I think it took me around 25 minutes to get in and get my food, so it wasn't too bad of a wait.  I got the carne con pan.  It was good, but a tad smaller than I expected it to be.    Wish I could've tried more food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sandwich with ribeye

4Nw6p6QMuy15k_-WC8wA7g.text: I have been there a couple of times and had a steak sandwich. It is better as a lunch place than dinner.  Make sure to get something to

HrmqKmff8Jpg1fJB_SNHEw.text: Amazing. It taste like I'm on vacation. My 5 year old son absolutely loved the ribeye plate and the saffron rice was perfect. He empanada crust was favorful . I will certainly return!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu board

dVhY16MjBeV7uuB3NLEhIg.text: Amazing! This place is worth the wait and certainly lived up to the hype. Everything is so flavorful. The ribeye plate was excellent. Also recommend the potatoes with garlic and rosemary. Tried it for lunch and can't wait to come back for dinner sometime. The small ribeye plate and side of potatoes was the perfect sized lunch for two to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small ribeye plate (ordered medium well) and a side of roasted potatoes with garlic and rosemary. So good!

qfEoxS--UFfyK9g2RsULng.text: This is a go to favorite place for take out or bodega night/private event. The salads, sides and rosemary braised beef are my favorites!! Get spoiled during a private event and go for the paella! It won't disappoint, promise! Estis is our favorite server for private events! The line to eat upstairs is the only negative..and can't even call it that...get takeout and no line will effect your meal!

QRsdCEt_PRd7pXkRCxNmXw.text: Gaucho's legendary status is well-earned: when it comes to sandwiches, there is Gaucho and there is everyone else.   Perfection is their filet sandwich: expertly-grilled filet complemented with smoky, slightly-charred vegetables, all piled onto lightly toasted bread that's sturdy enough to hold everything together yet delicate enough to let the ingredients shine. An array of available sauces creates an impossible, delicious dilemma; the only rational solution is having some of each.   This is the sandwich of my dreams.

2oCKO_UdIt0_Ehu2EwMhuw.text: Was there on a  Tuesday evening. There were not many customers. My soup was cold. My friends food was cold and not good. The mixed drinks increased by $1 in a week period. There were no pecan balls which come with dinner on Tues nights. They had no ice cream at 7pm. Definitely has changed from the former Kretzler's Tavern. So much for the original family place to eat!!

B7FC4dgoU7BcaDKgM8CxJw.text: Food was definitely pretty amazing and priced surprisingly cheap. Steak was awesome, sauces were unbelievable and the sides we're really good too.   Just wish it was a bit bigger inside. It's also not a place to go if you're in a rush, but it is well worth the wait.

64jLlfGkaF3KiEuQRAWAlg.text: Every. Single. Time. That's how often Gaucho is awesome. I work in the Strip District and I love eating meat. This means I eat there super often. And honestly. Every single time I do, it's amazing.  Flavorful, perfectly cooked beef? Check. Amazing, succulent chicken? Check. Delicious and abundant sides? Check.  It's always crowded but they have a nice seating area in the back now (they've expanded) and they have an equally nice patio seating area during nice weather. Some might consider it expensive when compared to other lunch or dinner dining options in the area (there's a $5 delicious pho joint right down the street,) but MAN do you get what you pay for.   Go there. If the line is around the corner, which is often is, wait in it patiently. You will be rewarded with tasty meat treats.

M-oGma8eW3VUSUgiXEm8UQ.text: Ate here last week Tuesday and lunch time on Wednesday. This place is a must if you love open fire flame cooking. The Cordero lamb chops were the best lamb chops that I have eaten in years! The Papas Dulce had amazing seasonings on it. The lamb was cooked to perfection during dinner time. The Lunch time chef didn't get my lamb medium rare like I requested, but it was still tasty. I'll be heading back there in the coming months for work and will definitely make it a destination!

qNxctk-pZXW3OBjEaYYmFg.text: My friend and I were looking for a fun, ethnic restaurant in Pittsburgh. We spotted this place and although we had to wait outside in the long line, all of the food that we tried was definitely worth the wait! The chimichurri sauce was some of the best I've ever had. The meat was so well cooked and everything that we tasted was amazing. I can't wait to go back!

IU8lorkionx1BshReplWbw.text: WHAT IS LIFE!!! This was so good!!! I've had wood-grilled meat when I was younger, and this place knocked me off my feet! All meats are amazing here! Loved my chanchito in a sandwich. We also got the New York steak which was perfectly medium rare and mouth-watering. So good! I can't say much about the veggies because we pretty much just ate lots of meat. Mmmhhh meeaaat.   Only down side to this place is that it's very small. I would suggest getting things to go, but if you want a homey experience, dine in. Just don't go with more than 4 people, I think they have 4 chairs total :P The owners are amazingly kind though, so they don't mind people squeezing in.   Final tip: go before 6pm!!! They close at 7pm and I swear everyone and their mom goes between 6-7pm, it's so funny! Not sure why this is the case, but we beat the crowd because we're pros. Be a pro, you'll get your food faster! :)

qODsIW6Qu9AxEpmnkrHLvg.text: My boyfriend ordered the mixed grill which had the pulled chicken, chorizo, and New York strip steak.  I ordered the grilled shrimp.  Food is freakin delicious and You need to eat here! Seating is weird but who cares when the food is freakin awesome and the people who work there are sweet as pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed grill &#34;New York strip, pulled chicken, chorizo,&#34; and grilled jumbo shrimp which half were already eaten ;)

kRSkcCbIJCrI-AnDeq-sRQ.text: I love this place. Food was cooked to perfection and very tasty too. Will definitely go again on my next visit to the 'Burgh'.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My meal Parrillada Mixta which contained Chorizo sausage, Pulled Chicken and NY Strip Steak.

J94mMjAed_asPXZztnyLQw.text: My husband and I, in town just for a day and taking our college student son out to dinner, attempted here on a Wednesday only to find the wait too long.  My son had an early start the next morning.  The next day my husband and I headed there for lunch intrigued now to see what all the fuss was about.  There was still a bit of a line but the staff was very conscientious to make each customer as comfortable as quickly as possible.   We're glad we had the opportunity to try the delicious food and the flavors lingered with us on our journey home.

P19zKi7gGKoCXj57lAb-ow.text: Was very good, but not excellent. The price for my NY Strip was great and the portion was okay, but the cut was very chewy and a bit tough, especially for medium rare. Their in-house sauces were excellent and the service was very nice. Will be back to try some other items. Oh try the side of mushrooms; delish.

jlVRayy-K7tVL-T7_OyXuA.text: Again, FIVE STARS!   Incredible filet, chimichurri sauce, red roasted potatoes, salad, grilled olive oil bread, all delicious and satisfying!! Can't wait to come back again!

NmDkllgEDFWZXceEavCXRQ.text: One of my favorite places, takes effort to not eat here everyday. I don't know if this can be beat. GET THE CORN AND THE GAUCHO PAPAS! Hanger is probably my favorite, but it's hard to go wrong.   With apologies to Gaucho I would recommend a fattier cut of meat than the filet simply because of how outstanding the flavors are on all of the dishes and sauces. Filet stands well alone and while fantastic the flavors feel less impressive on that cut.  You can not go wrong here though. Get creative and push your boundaries, you are in excellent hands at Gaucho.  Finally, try the rosemary short rib sandwich at least once  before you lay down for the dirt nap.  The line looks more daunting than it really is. Once you order and pay, your food is typically out within 10 minutes (at most), compared to conventional restaurant where you wait at your table.

XXHk3JZfOt4w4ix_BcF83Q.text: A definite go to place. The people who work there are friendly. You can take them beer or wine to show thanks or just for yourself! My go to favorite is the Carne sandwich with NY Strip. I love 3 of the 4 sauces ( the one that kinda looks like mucous is the one I leave behind ). I've never heard any complaints from friends about everything else on the menu. Whether you eat in or get it to go, it's a great choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixta (for short - I can&#39;t remember the full name) Chorizo, NY Strip, Chicken with 3 out of the 4 sauces.

aaA1xwsrKvF6BQrTj0YkmQ.text: Picked up for lunch. Steak sandwich was brilliant!  Empanadas were okay. Prob won't order again. Overall would try again though. Shows potential.

8k8187ytcR_kqlMvGniroA.text: Food is great.  Service was good. Not a fan of the location.  Not a place to take a date if you want to hear her speak.  Order ahead and take the food home

VQK9xDckV4PDOS_RWk-2DA.text: I have tried the Bondiola, the Pollo, and the Carne sandwichs. I had the Carne with flank steak and arugula and it was amazing and perfect in every way, this one was bar far my favorite. My boyfriends favorite was the Pollo, which he ordered with goat cheese. I would have enjoyed the Bondiola more, except I found it way too salty. The complimentary sauces make the sandwiches even more amazing than they already are.

wGolO-vyfltMpov6vU69Rw.text: Wood fired authentic food. A gem in the Strip district.

Py7I3Ckx286YEMltOV24Hg.text: I heard they had 6-7 vegetarian items on the menu and I thought I must go. I ordered a pabrecito (one of the vegetarian options) and it was horrible! The grilled veggies I was promised consisted of a single bell pepper and there was too much salt. Not recommended for vegetarians!

4-BVF13VOky2mQBObXHeyQ.text: Had the flank steak sandwich.  Very tender and tasty.  Would definitely go there again!

UOtVCriXSJzgRaf3HrftzA.text: Tried the steak burger because the thrillist article.  It was pretty good but not mind blowing.  I got cheese and grilled onions as toppings.  I probably should have gotten another topping. The bread it's on is fantastic. I also got one empanada and it was pretty good. Nothing spectacular.  I will be back sometime to try something else.  I guess a plate of meat or something.

Y9GxwldQ2yOAGFMKq-k2aA.text: No seating. Honestly I didn't even eat here because the staff was rude. Since their front door doesn't automatically close they asked us to close it politely, then muttered loud enough for me to hear "this isn't a barn". I will not be returning if this is how their staff treats its customers.

JE-VwiRIBO5It6UuQm5h4A.text: My boyfriend and I were walking past and couldn't ignore the delicious smell coming from the open front door! Everything was delicious and the folks here are -friendly-. If you don't know what to get they're happy to recommend something. You could tell they all share a real sense of pride in the place and why not? The restaurant looks great and the sandwiches are killer!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. pan con carne - flank steak. Every bit as good as it looks
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mmm..Provoleta!

eh5B6dlL3NG6sTgCl6-Pvw.text: It's a no brainier! 400+ five-star reviews? This is the way food is suppose to taste. Do yourself a favor and go there...now. Why are you still reading this.....go!

Ze8hvVaddlmDFzVPNPwh2Q.text: This meat is to die for.  We only had to wait about 15-20  minutes on a Friday around 6pm and our food came to us within another 10-15 minutes.  I love that there is no corkage fee!  We shared the mixta with NY strip, chicken, and chorizo, all great.  We also had the Carne sandwich w/ filet and carmelized onions, which was also the best steak sandwich I've ever had.  Seriously.  GO NOW!

0VBtzQWAw4zBwpMsz0QBfw.text: Awesome ribeye steak sandwich, awesome corn, the staff is very friendly, the food speaks for itself with the flavor of the wood in everything. The only thing I didn't care for was the soggy bun, it didn't really matter that much once I bit into the delicious sandwich, that had ribeye steak, caramelized onions and roasted red peppers with chimmichuri sauce. One recommendation would be to cut the meat against then grain, then when your biting into the sandwich you don't pull whole chunks of ribeye out and have to pick up with your fingers. With that being said, yummy and I will be back :)

ZcveP1uw45_mLDJi_zzxug.text: This place has great food, friendly staff and lives up to the reviews I've seen all over the country!    My only complaints (not really complaints) are that it is always so packed and the wait is forever, but that is expected in a place that has such great and unique food in this area.  The other is that they don't serve alcohol, which is not a huge drawback but if they did, then no one would EVER leave!  And the lines would only grow longer.  PLEASE open another one in the South Hills!!    Try this place...you will not be disappointed.  Something for everyone.

E677xF7pCBkzdHl5hATayg.text: This is the cutest place ever!!!! I went to the Chef's table with my friends and had a seven course meal (reservation only). It was an amazing experience. I can't wait to try the lunch and the Argentinian grill!!!! What can I say the food was made with love. This is why I love small businesses.

GR1YpGWN7rsleIXzHpNkAw.text: Good food. Meat is greta with a lot of variety. Sometimes the char is too much.  Get there early before the line goes out the door and up the bridge.

wm7iyMslZvCNamUjbpN9Jg.text: This place is heaven. Tried different cuts of meat and they were all delicious. Great environment and unique service.

2_wnwi4wWFKN5InCVsIBZw.text: I am in the afterglow phase of one of the most amazing dinners I have had in Pittsburgh. Or ever for that matter. The flank steak is next level. The pork is amazing. The toast and sauces are top notch. Even the salad was good. The veggies have this interesting smoked flavor that works with the meal. Very few times does the place live up to the hype, but this was one of those times.

LLfL20b_Po9xQoj_eX5iYg.text: This argentine steakhouse does a fantastic job at guess what? Grilling steaks! The prices are fair, even a little cheap, and (drum roll) it's byob with no corking fee! The empanadas were so-so, but my salad and arrachera (flank steak) were great.

gFK5dmTT03OdXyJMgvWC9g.text: No matter what you choose off the menu, you'll most likely eat the best sandwich you've ever had in your life.

jokiVgmpER7IIlKcbBOhXw.text: Everyone was incredibly nice and the food was amazing! The carne sandwich was fantastic, especially with the different chimichurris. I highly recommend it if you're looking for a casual dinner.

B7JfM4VhzG40v7BKpN8WuQ.text: I loved this place.  I wanted to eat here again the next day!  Staff is friendly; the food is incredible.  I highly recommend one of the steaks - we had the bistec (round eye cut) and wished we had ordered the 12 oz instead of the 6 oz.  The Rosemary braised beef was good, but I'm just a fan of juicy steak topped with one of their wonderful chimchurri sauces.  Prices are good.  Overall 10/5 stars if I could!

sDRjrJPtJbDb1FU8YK8-Og.text: Don't want everybody to know about this place. It is really good. Opt for the steaks and skip sandwich. Corn is awesome and you have to get all the sauces. Probably my favorite place. Not fancy like theses other places that try to hard and fail. Simple awesome food and u almost have to take to go. To small to eat inside.

suTpyFbWvgsmzcvEb08ukg.text: Hands down the best place to eat in Pittsburgh. Just the sauces alone are enough to give 5 stars for. I have been known to eat the Chimichurri sauce by itself while waiting for my food. The wait is well worth it. The wood-fire flavor is out of this world and it seeps into every food that they serve. The roasted veggies are to die for and a must to order as a side. The steak sandwich is a classic and so filling. I can hardly ever finish the whole thing but still order sides because I just can't resist.   Finally, the star of the show: THE PAELLA! I lived in Spain for some time and it's the closest I've experienced in the states to authentic paella. It's cooked in the traditional cast-iron skillet so it gets that charred, crunchy rice at the bottom that I have bene missing. Truly worth it.   And the price just can't be beat. For such an outstanding, renown and acclaimed restaurant, it astounds me that they haven't raised their prices. I myself can eat there (and feel like I don't need to eat for days) for $15. And for a group of four adults, we got an order of steak (that came with a side salad and grilled bread), four pieces of corn, an order of the veggies, an order of the wings and the $50 paella and our entire bill came to just $99. And we had leftovers! It was fantastic. Plus, the fact that it's BYOB makes it even better.   The only set back is that you can't sit and bask in the glory of your food coma because there are so many people waiting for a table. But it's honestly part of the experience.   Just remember to tip the staff too! They work so hard and the service is great. Just because it's not your typical sit down service doesn't mean they shouldn't get some cash thrown into the tip jar at the register. The whole staff (including the kitchen) shares the tips, and that's always been something I've appreciated in an establishment.

6AVNkPhqhuSNicejIjuYpg.text: Ummmmmm..... amazing!!!!! The food is so good. They have really good options for vegetarians. However, you have to watch what time you go here because they start to get really busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Table full of food #soyummy

sJmrMBicjer-RLhBZQ4yLg.text: My boyfriend and I went here last minute on a Saturday. If you plan ahead and go at non-peak times, the line isn't too long and the food comes out relatively quickly. We had chicken, beef, and vegetable empanadas which were all fantastic. We also had 2 orders of tostado with all 4 different types of sauces (you can get any kind you want which is cool!). I really loved this place and thought it was very authentic and super yummy. If you hate long lines, just plan ahead and you'll be fine, but I think it's worth the wait.

dDGJQITFcTYapkGmk8KI3g.text: I really wish I'd tried Gaucho when I worked just across the street. It's not as convenient any more, but we'll definitely be back. I suggest going early, so the line it's too bad. You get a lot of food, so it's better to eat early anyway... The line moves very slowly, but everyone is so friendly, so it doesn't seem as long as it would be without the friendly atmosphere. As I'd heard from many friends, the food at Gaucho is WELL worth the wait. It's delicious and they are BYOB with no corking fee, so you can take your own beer or wine to enjoy with the wonderful food.

QsHY8MLNT-IPYOc8ujg5uQ.text: Came for dinner around 530pm on Thursday night and we were one of the first parties there before the big craze! It really fills up around 6pm and the line gets backed up! Bf and I ordered the sampler plate and a cauliflower and avocado salad and 2 steak empanadas. Our bill was around $70 and the food was pretty delicious! The sauce options were great but you couldn't really taste one from the other...

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dinner for 2

zwhMVYbjpdXHYBXz0QCZTA.text: Oh my god this place is amazing. I had never been before but I told my family we would try to get in because I had read great things. We went on a weekday, so the line was short. I had a steak sandwich, which was delicious.  It's BYOB so we brought beer from East End, although everyone else was drinking wine (I felt a little out of place).  We ended up coming back later in the weekend and waiting an hour, but it was still worth it.

GcY4xubTKS2qzAszScim3A.text: So. Good. Other than the staff getting really perturbed with you if you aren't standing in the correct spot (due to long lines out the door), it's incredible. Note: get there early!  Go with a group. Get everything. Share. You'll be really full halfway through but press on.   You're welcome.

4dxnm6Wj9E1tkeYw4TRenA.text: Like the other 1,200 reviews on this place, I couldn't say less about this Gaucho Parilla. I went on a Monday around 1:00 pm, planning on going on a self-guided food tour of The Strip. This was my first stop. I found myself waiting on line for about 30 minutes, which I had been giving warning, but about 29 minutes of that time was spent in DEEP THOUGHT over what delicacy I would eat. I went with the NY Strip steak sandwich and at the friendly, hip cashier's suggestion, the rosemary potatoes as a side rather than the pork empanadas. I ate happily alone at counter, feeling not at all alone and more so openly welcome by the wait staff. All I have to say to end this review is that my food tour ended at this first stop. This was one of the best meals of my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oh my lord, look at that steak

V1_rA6YZWkTcv50TQ2BxAg.text: I truly don't even know if this review needs to be written as it's obviously no secret that Gaucho is amazing, but I'll put my two cents in as well.   I always get either the small Bife de Gaucho or the steak sandwich with filet. They are cooked SO beautifully each time I order them. My favorite sauce is the onion-y one that I can't seem to remember the name of. Of course, if their corn on the cob is an option, you definitely need to have that in your life!!  Their BYO policy is wonderful and I really like the new system of how they seat you vs. letting you seat yourself.  I also recently had the pleasure of having their Asado truck at a friend's event, and the quality of the food was just as on point. They are killing the game right now!!

jPKl5tk-hZARkDH9jnwe5w.text: Oh man, I finally got around to trying this place. It's been on my list for years. Through many boyfriends and bad dates, I've been "meaning to try that Gaucho place".  Well finally... I did. Awesome sauce, awesome sauces.  We got the meat selection, we got the meat sweats, we died of happiness. It smelled so good, the whole drive home I envisioned myself lunging forward and tearing into the brown paper bag to get to the meat like an animal.  When it touched my lips, I knew love. I knew this was what my mouth had been longing for all those years.   Bad kissers. Bad sex. Bad food. Bad alcohol. Bad cigarettes.  Forgot them all. I tasted this meat and I will never again be the woman I once was.

ZV7DL1-H7TCrHN2626hcsQ.text: Of course this place doesn't need any more positive reviews - but if certainly deserves them!  Went here with friends for lunch on a cold Saturday, had to wait outside for about 30 minutes but it was worth it!  We love brunch so brought in bottles of champagne and orange juice and mixed up our own mimosas while we were there.  I got the Argentino salad and I highly recommend adding shrimp to it!    The staff was all very helpful and friendly and I will definitely be returning.  Good to know - you can order ahead so that you don't have to wait in the potentially out-the-door line!    #brunchsohard

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Argentino salad - highly recommend the added shrimp!

OFKpwDgQ8YX_zICEvM_7Tw.text: I wish Guacho wasn't so popular, so that it was easier to get into and enjoy they're amazing food! The flow of the restaurant is the only reason it's not getting 5 stars: you order at a counter that's right by the front, clogging up the entrance and almost always causing a line out the door.  But I will always wait in the line because it really speaks for the delicious food, great ambiance and super friendly staff. Extremely authentic, Argentinian food means tons of grilled meats, veggies and some of the best empanadas in town. The fact that it's BYOB just tops of the reasons why you should definitely make your way over the Gaucho!

c9edCf_wbeiaeLyGKMUpQA.text: First of all, our taxi driver wasn't sure where this place was when we first gave him the address. And then when we finally got there, he looked at us and said, "Well, there's people inside." We got out, looked around with some trepidation (as we're not city dwellers), shrugged our shoulders and decided to go for it, and I'm so glad we did!  The place just smelled amazing, and we were really hungry! I finally settled on a salad with rib eye steak. I would have liked less fat on the steak, but it was super flavorful and a perfect compliment to the salad, which had yummy roasted/grilled veggies.  We didn't realize that it was close to closing time, so they were running out of things like bread and sweet potatoes, which was bad for anyone who wanted a sandwich. I was impressed with how friendly the cashier guy was, even at the end of the day. He calmly and patiently explained the menu to newcomers (like us!). There's hardly any seating, so we were lucky to grab some seats as people left.  The kitchen is open, and they keep the wood piled up in the front area, so you can see them cooking/making your food. I was thrilled to watch my salad being made oh-so-carefully by a very cute guy.  We were the last patrons as they closed up for the day. They were kind enough to call a taxi for us, and when we left, the chef and his staff said thanks and goodbye as they stood outside smoking their cigarettes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El gaucho salad with rib eye steak

ha8gQ8LgzB23TZv7BHCeZQ.text: What a wonderful and delicious evening!  The entire event, designed especially for Valentine in the Bodega (downstairs dining room), was well planned, executed, and a total success.  Each dish of the four course meal was perfectly prepared and served.  Despite the "family style"dining among 24 strangers, the experience was enriching.  We all left with new friends.  We enjoyed meeting our dining partners and felt warmly welcomed by our lovely hostesses.  Thank you for a wonderful evening....know tomorrow night's edition will go just as well!

xCXa5senfXnODQ5Yaz1jmQ.text: Rated as one of America's must-have meals for a reason! The long line, which exists so long as this place is open for business, is well worth the wait.  You cannot go wrong when ordering here, so have no fear!

nSjzE_un6-vrIUua0sAvdw.text: The simplicity of the food and the way it's prepared is what makes it so great. Haven't eaten anything here that I haven't loved.

qoEcwrHooMHqYzvD2V_yBg.text: I was in town visiting my sister in Pittsburgh and yelped a bunch of places, and of course, Gaucho popped up with its 5-star rating.  Pros: I did really like the ribeye sandwich! After reading many Yelp reviews about it, I decided it was worth a try.   Cons: Everything else was pretty mediocre. We got the grilled veggie plate, side order of potatoes, rosemary braised beef sandwich, NY strip plate and the fish of the day plate. The rosemary braised beef sandwich was nothing compared to the ribeye sandwich. The potatotes and grilled veggies were soaked in oil, as was most of the food. There was so much char on most of the meat, and it wasn't anything special anyway. The fish was good, but nothing spectacular. There was a huge long line and we had to wait about 40 minutes until we actually got to eat.   Overall: I came to Gaucho with high hopes, but left pretty disappointed. Don't get me wrong, the food is not terribly BAD, but it's not worth the hype. I'm surprised that this place has a 5-star rating, is this the best Pittsburgh has to offer?

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye sandwich
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled veggie platter
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish of the day

d7Dsck0hD1Ksd_vyL3XpmA.text: Great lunch. First time to PITT and was told to check this place out by a buddy. Wasn't disappointed at all. Not overly busy at lunch and took my time to read the menu. Everything I ordered was delicious and would recommend. Super clean and very friendly staff. You do order first and then sit so keep that in mind. They bring your food out and they have pseudo waiters that clean up your plates which is nice. Tipping apparently is at the beginning as well. Little different but whatever... everyone seems to be putting a little different spin on how things work these days. I got up and refilled my water as I needed and if your boozing it's BYOB, otherwise they have some pop and some other non-etoh options.

Hh0IAlPqq3HHkzJZYjNdDw.text: I've so looked forward to writing this review. Not that writing Yelp reviews is something I daydream about on a regular basis, rather it would mean I had finally tasted the deliciousness that is Gaucho Parilla Argentina and pretty much gone to carnivore heaven. That is precisely what happened!   My friend and I talked about coming here for months, but one thing or another kept preventing it. Yesterday we decided to make it happen. I read in some reviews that getting food can take time if it's busy, so I arrived before he did and put in our orders with the friendly and helpful staff at the counter. I loved the open, airy feel of the place and the easygoing rapport up front that the staff created. I also appreciated how the staff dressed and looked more like themselves and less like a traditional army of servers who all look the same. It was one of the most refreshing restaurants I've ever been in for that reason alone.   I made my way to the quieter back section of the restaurant and chose one of the lower center tables. There was sufficient room for the amount of space without feeling like other patrons were all up in your business. The room was also sunny, a huge plus! My friend and the food arrived soon afterwards, and we began to eat.  Wanting to sample several meats we went with the mixed grill, which has steak, chicken, and chorizo. On the side we had two orders of potatoes, an extra order of toast, and all four sauces. I can't choose a favorite meat, because they were all utterly divine! The steak and chicken were so tender they pulled apart easily without a knife, and the chorizo had a satisfying snap to it as well as a spicy flavor that I loved immediately. The potatoes were roasted until crispy on the outside, and the toast was chewy perfection. My favorite sauce was difficult to choose, but I would have to say the thinner green one edged ahead slightly for me. I tasted an interesting sour note that complimented literally everything on the table. We ate everything but a few potatoes, and with two Mexican cokes the $40 bill seemed like a steal for the caliber of food we had just consumed. Gaucho exceeded my (incredibly high) expectations, and I can't wait to come back and share the steak platter I've had my eye on and try some of the different vegetables. Gaucho, you're incredible!

ljRjY2lkzLAJRdEm2bTI6w.text: You can't go wrong with any meal here. Definitely one of the best restaurants In the city. Be warned,  it's casual and you order in line when you walk in so not a fancy ambiance at all, but a must try for any  meat lover. The carne sandwiches are my go to and the spicy chorizo is untouchable. Beef empanadas are really good as well.

v7MP9j7QOCPCTk5h60pblw.text: I work just a few doors down from this place & whenever it's open it's ALWAYS packed. I believe I've even seen the line go out the door upon a few occasions.  So yea - the place is VERY good.  The menu pretty much has anything you can think of from chicken, beef, pork, & fresh fish prepared in a multitude of ways... & they even will do special request orders if you don't see exactly what you want on their menu - WHAT???!!! :) Some downers, LLLOOOOONNNNGGGG line to order & to get your food. Very tightly spaced place inside & a lil more open in their tiny patio but not by much... so be ready to get your food to go & go.  Some helpful pointers, CALL in advance to place your order (especially if to go) & you get I think a 10% off.. so that's really nice, HOWEVER; because they are SO busy - don't expect them to answer right away -- you may have to leave a message to get a call back or keep trying til you get thru... so yea - did I mention they're busy??? :) In all in all - it's worth it  - the food is excellent & I enjoy it immensely.

G87sA610i9PB4El_i5sV6w.text: Delicious little find.  The sandwiches are generously sized and tasty! I came upon the place around 6pm on a Saturday and there was only one other couple in the restaurant.  My fiance barely made it to his seat before they delivered the sandwiches to our counter.  Both the steak and hamburger were well-made and had great combinations of flavors.  The guy at the register was quite the friendly chatty-box, a welcome departure from the typical NY treatment!

VEMTWNGMfSmlCYlcYhQQLQ.text: Great food. Bad service. When we came in, granted it was 30 minutes before closing, the man behind the counter said "not like we are about to close or anything". I was very put off by this on my first experience. The food was great but a bad overall experience.

o3B-LvRHqe7wLyBgl_-IvA.text: Food was good but we were disappointed that our appetizers were delivered at the same time as our entrees:/  Made it hard to appreciate it all

Cy14SJiWggyRDI_zuOdtzw.text: Was good but absolutely not worth the wait....stood on line for two hours and another 40 minutes to actually get our food. I heard so many great reviews but I personally did not find it to be all that good...

nxN0PeARLdtB6vGVv6nGzw.text: Fantastic.  The steak burger is one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten in my life.  Perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned.  The pork shoulder sandwich could use a bit more sauce on it, but luckily, they provide you with four delicious sauces to add!  This is hands down the best restaurant I've eaten at in the city so far (3 years)!

JzJrXMcS27TQ9KXS3fVGSg.text: I honestly can say, this is the most phenomenal food I have tried in PA - hands down. The employees were excited about their product, the other customers were exuberant about the place, and we had an incredible experience. The corn, rice, pollo sandwich and steak sandwich ... all were incredible. We WILL be back!!

_hgwhgPAPvBloXjBXWOUrg.text: Quality beef, fresh bread, and vegetables you can actually taste (when was the last time you could say that about a bell pepper?). A word to the wise: seating is quite limited, so until the restaurant finishes expanding, it's perfect for takeout during busy times.  Now, stop reading this review and start gorging.

jimEYd-sFl09HQrp8sFlWQ.text: Amazing food and awesome people. I recommend their streak burger. The meat is incredible here.

4BpvF9Pj0ka8g61psko2yA.text: I was lucky and there was no line when I arrive. The menu is a bit confusing, but the staff was patient and eager to help. The food was delicious and hearty. I loved that it was BYOB as well. Great spot for any night of the week.

dc-wMFcGWmbtJW6-oi5_iA.text: I have been hearing about Gaucho's for the past 2 years but only recently had an opportunity to go there.  Wow!  It was delicious.  I had the fish sandwich and then, a week later, had the steak sandwich.  This is definitely in my top 5 go-to places for anyone visiting Pittsuburgh.

OB5Y2cbviLi8yyXmubkz7A.text: I waited in line on a Saturday for no less than 45 minutes. I waited no less than 25 minutes afterwards for my two platters and sandwiches. We ate outside in 40 degree weather. And I'm STILL giving them 5 stars. This food is great! Load up on sauces and enjoy.

5rED81chWxv2Z_hDgtHawg.text: We were supposed to visit friends today and they were going to treat us to a special dinner they were going to make but they had the flu or the crud or something ... so instead we went to Gaucho and had a SCRUMPTIOUS meal to help assuage our disappointment. Man, was it good! This little place is a gem and the short wait in line was really worth it. We had carne of filet mignonette and rosemary carbones accompanied by simple toasted 'taters with bacon. The sauces -- all fresh made and take as much as you want -- were indescribable. This place is killer. And the best part? We're going to send the bill to our "sick" friends and they'll never even know it was for us because they're so ill. They won't have a clue. Hahaha.

Sch5pka4tK1aSrkn3TplhQ.text: It's not the first time I visit an Argentinian restaurant. I was excited hearing this place since it had amazing reviews. I was extremely disappointed!!! It was a long wait to order food which would have been fine if the food was cooked properly. We ordered the Parrillada Mixta (steak, chicken and chorizo). One word to describe the food would be "DRY" The steak was chewy (I ordered medium rare and it came well done), the chorizo was rubbery and the chicken well flavored with the garlic sauce was also dry).  We also ordered the Arrechera platter (flank steak). I ordered it medium and it came out burnt. I had to cut all the outside, so I didn't  have to taste the bitterness. On the positive side, the salad was delicious and fresh. The Chorypan was good. Extremely overrated place, or the kitchen had a bad day.

YUasoi2PqRAxwbdwMSZHkA.text: I was in PA over the weekend, and decided to venture into Pittsburg, but prior to going i needed a place to satisfy my meat cravings. I did a yelp search of course and the places that were popping up, i was uninspired, lo and behold i see this place Gaucho. It piqued my interest since it was Argentinian. What made this place a no-brainer to go to was the consistent 5 star ratings. Yes, my decision was done Gaucho P, it was. I was not disappointed, i wasn't going to drive 45 mins to the strip and then order a sandwich, i went big and ordered the Asada Platter, which is more than a generous portion of 5 cuts of meats, grilled and seasoned to perfection. I ordered it to go. They were out of empanadas or as they said their machine was broken. The selections the seasoning the chimmichurri sauces that i scooped up fantastic. I have had 4 meals on those meats and i intend to come here again when i am in the area. Cheers.

g1WpZc4fob4FeE3KWMdHfA.text: They have a party room downstairs which provided the perfect setting to celebrate a friend/co-worker's birthday.  Food was delicious, space was warm and inviting and allowed us all to mingle.  The staff was extremely attentive.  I would go back in a heartbeat!

agBnoeTNxGlSfrWByPx--w.text: Now physically expanded. Same quality, now more seating. This place continues to do it correctly.

sHCNn9VEQc9qc4Szu5YOOw.text: Was surprised by the extremely high rating in Yelp for this spot, but I love steak and went in hoping for the best. This place didn't disappoint. Food was incredible and so delish!! For my first time, they recommended the steak sandwich which I got with a rib eye cut (you can choose the cut of steak for your sandwich...which was cool in and of itself). Steak sandwich was topped with sweet caramelized onions and roasted peppers which were packed with flavor. The location was really cool and trendy with Snoop Dogg and Easy E playing in the background. Staff was genuinely friendly and helpful. Definitely will be back.

MeQmpCO1ZkYo8QgfUjY7_g.text: My wife and I came here with no knowledge of the establishment beforehand, but on the basis of a recommendation. We both enjoy Argentinian food generally and a good steak especially, we were going somewhere closeby, so why not? What I have to say about this restaurant, very simply, is: IT'S NOW OFFICIALLY MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT. Read about the great food in all the other reviews. We second them all. Steaks tasty, tender, and succulent, nice portions, wonderful bread and other accompaniments. A great aspect: when there was a problem with one of our steaks, they took it back and produced a new one in a matter of MINUTES and it was absolutely perfect. If you like this kind of fare, you will love this restaurant. Can't wait to go back. Tip: no liquor licence (yet?), but bring your own red wine and enjoy. Very accommodating.

OSMFoB6-kFGiTM0uUloHKw.text: Service is a bit autistic. But the sandwiches are amazing. The wait is always stupid long but that's part of it I guess.

H0ODwsCfT4iAxbgbLFjwBw.text: On a warm summer Thursday afternoon, I did a self-directed gastronomic tour of Lawrenceville and The Strip.  Gaucho was recommended over and over, even by other restaurants and bars. I was warned that there was going to be a huge line, so I was glad that I went at 4:00pm and was able to get right in. The huge chalkboard menu to the right of the counter lists all their features, which is a True reflection of an Argentinian parilla. Chicken, pork, beef, shrimp, all go on the grill with herbaceous and flavorful sauces. I ordered the spicy chorizo, shrimp, and empanadas, and everything I had was delicious. They are BYOB and the staff is more than happy to help you navigate the South American menu. Jars of self-serve sauces featuring chimichurri, roasted tomato, roasted garlic, and roasted onion sauces are openly available and pair great with...well, a spoon, they are that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

DLqMXOXsO5em8efSmz_4fA.text: My mouth is watering thinking about the time I ate here. There's a great selection of items on the menu. Only complaint is that they don't take reservations...and because this place is popular, it means long lines at times. But trust me, the food is worth it! Not only is the meat and food great, but so are the chimmis (free and unlimited), their homemade sauces!! which you can actually purchase to bring home.   Food:  - Parrillada Mix: NY Strip Steak, Grilled Chicken, and Chorizo with toast  -Beans & Greens: onions, shallots, white beans, wilted greens, and grilled lemon - Eggplant: chilled and marinated grilled eggplants, poblanos, garlic, oregano, sherry vinegar

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parrillada Mixta (beans &amp; eggplant sides pictured in background...along with the AWESOME sauces!)

W0mka3j7M4HhDeAi3OMY9g.text: In my opinion, this is good food, but not worth the insane wait times. Most frustrating about those long lines is that (a) in Pittsburgh there is about a 90% chance it's raining at any given moment, so chances are you are standing in line in the rain, and (b) there is really no discernible reason the line is THAT long except that the kitchen is just sort of slow.  All that said, the steak is really tasty, and very affordable for the quality. Potatoes make a great side, and the sauce (chimichurri in particular) go great with everything else.

Ul8_vBoP-m6pLDCsyM2KOg.text: Amazing restaurant with plentiful vegetarian options - at the top of my list of favorite Pittsburgh restaurants!  I normally get 2 empanadas (3 daily types of empanadas, with one of them always being vegetarian) and the Vegetale sandwich. As I am not a huge fan of mushrooms, I usually request that provolone cheese be used to replace the mushrooms in the sandwich, which the employees are always happy to oblige with, with no hassle or extra cost. Keep a look out for the seasonal pasta special as well, a good mix of tangy aioli sauce and vegetables. Also, the condiment sauces are to die for! Be sure to use these generously with any entree you order.  BYOB. I'd recommend going at off peak hours (for example, 5 PM for early dinners) to ensure the line does not get too long (since they don't take reservations).

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QR226EW2QIdeH_6boudQig.text: Lucked at and didn't have to wait long for the deliciousness that is Gaucho. I had my usual small flank steak. It's served with carmelized onions (delicious), salad and a piece of toast. The small is plenty for a meal.   My husband had the condero, which is smoked leg of lamb. He thought it was going to be lamb served how the steak is served, but it was actually more like a stew. Nonetheless, he seemed to enjoy it. Also served with a salad and a side. The side was a marinated eggplant salad served cold. I enjoyed it.  We also ordered two empanadas, one beef and one pork. The empanadas rotate regularly. They're small, but good. And the filling to dough ratio is near perfect (a little heavier on the dough).   Also love the selection of help yourself salsas and chimmis to accompany your meal. My go-tos are the garlic sauce and the chimmi.   I'm always impressed at how they manage the customer to table ratio. Maybe I've just been there at the right time, but we've never had a probably getting a table (after waiting to order our food, of course) and we've never felt rushed.

YgGCDfKqXjnvh3HqseWNLQ.text: Yup I went there but it didn't fully live up to the hype. Food WAS good, line was out the door and around the block (always a good decision!) atmosphere was a bit plain but ok, heads up it's a BYOB so be prepared and bing a cocktail!  The empanadas where Soooo Good the best being the veggie one  (as a devote meat guy you bring me a veggie anything that blows my mind it's worth talking about!!!). I love the little guy niche (ABC....Anything But Chain) restaurants. Why 4 not 5? Lunch for 2 people with a desert but NO alcohol and one of us drank tap water was $65. A bit steep seem like steak house prices.

a0pPdrARMt2uihqXYqFMgA.text: The food is very good. The atmosphere is wonderful. Their service is extraordinary! They were so  polite and thoughtful. This was especially evident when they didn't kick people out who had been lingering there for hours without ordering more food. This is a BYOB place. They do not make money from liquor sales. As a result, they have to turn over tables at a rather efficient rate. It was shocking to me how entitled bourgeois drunk people are so inappropriate to such a lovely staff. You can put a saddle on a jackass but it doesn't make it a racehorse. Bravo to you staff of Gaucho!

YrJcIzzBpf03NBLeLXlXJA.text: Classic spot to feed your inner Carnivore. One of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh. Great place for dates or groups, possibly even special occasions (i.e. family dinner over graduation).   My one annoyance is the loooong wait and cramped waiting area during busy times... The line will be outside wrapped around the corner. For example: Arrived on a Saturday at 8 PM and probably waited for an hour +. They don't take reservations unfortunately. HOWEVER, if you're willing to wait it out, it's completely WORTH it.   Gaucho delivers on the best beef, sauces, and other specialties (shrimp, pork, sides, etc). You can order plates or sandwiches. Seriously an overwhelming number of options. I've found that for two people, ordering two small plates and a side (potatoes, green beans, etc) is the perfect size to split and leave with a full belly. I recently split the Cerdo (roast pork), small plate of NY strip (median rare), and side of potatoes.  ALL delicious. The strip was perfectly pink / red. The pork wasn't dry but tender and flavorful. The Camarones (shrimp plate) and Carne Sandwich are both equally worthy. I have nothing negative to say in regards to the quality of food here. Out of the sauces (which are a must have regardless of your order), I obsess over the Ajo-Garlic (roasted garlic) and classic Chimmichurri-Yummy (Argentinian steak sauce).  BYOB

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potatoes, Cerdo, Small NY Strip

yjTUw-HgfULsaKDLK451DQ.text: So unbelievably good!  I had been to their previous location and loved the food, but the space was beyond small making getting your food to go the only viable option.   I was super excited to return once I learned that they had moved a couple doors down into a much larger space with two floors worth of seating, but every time I tried to get there the line to get in was literally around the block. The day we went there was actually no wait so we hurried up and parked and made a beeline to the door.  Once inside I was not only blown away by how much nicer the new space was, but by how much was added to the menu since we visited the original location. After about 10 minutes of staring at the menu board we were ready to order.  I chose a Carne ribeye steak sandwich which features your choice of steak with chimmichurri sauce, grilled peppers and caramelized onions. My steak was cooked perfectly. The steak was tender, very juicy and full of flavor. My wife chose the Pollo sandwich which features grilled chicken, pickled red onions, portobello mushrooms and ajo sauce. She absolutely loved it. Our daughter chose the steak burger which features a half pound burger, chimmichurri sauce and your choice of two topping. She added bacon and blue cheese. She loved her burger as well.  One thing that I have always loved about Gaucho is that they have always cooked whatever meat I have order just as I ask. It is so hard to get perfectly cooked meat now a days, unfortunately. Service was quick and very attentive. I also like the fact that there is an exit door on the second floor that makes it easy to avoid the line of waiting people downstairs when you are ready to leave.  Be sure to try each of their four sauces. Chimmichurri "Argentine Steak Sauce" which has fresh parsley and oregano, garlic, pepper flakes, red wine vinegar and olive oil. Ajo which has roasted garlic cloves with caramelized onions, parsley and pepper with olive oil. Pimenton which has grilled red bell peppers, fresh garlic, parsley, vinegar and olive oil. And Cebolla which has caramelized onion, vinegar, olive oil and parsley. Each sauce is very unique and different and all worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burger with bacon and blue cheese
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pollo Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Ribeye Sandwich

Y-eXyqETQMauyKij9jB6gQ.text: Attended a private function in the basement room. The space was so cool, like eating in an old European building or secret grotto in South America. Candles everywhere, and a great staff. The food was just amazing, can't say enough about the bread, the cooked meats, the Chimichurri sauces, the grilled vegetables, the dried meats, the cheeses...I ate everything but the shrimp (allergies) and each bite makes you moan and roll your eyes it's so good!  Can't wait to come back and try the main restaurant. The wait is worth it!!!!

lT-gmJn3WhjzZuYUMb0GWA.text: We visited Gaucho in the strip district after seeing many reviews and pictures on social media. We  were prepared for a long wait so we arrived early (and not hungry yet) on a Saturday night. We arrived around 4:45p and the wait was about an hour. Not bad and totally worth it - would have been a lot worse if we arrived famished !  Staff was nice and handed out waters to the line as we waited. My hubby and I  ordered the asado platter -- 5 cuts of meats, and the grilled vegetable plate. We just split both and it was the perfect amount and we loved that we got to try a bit of all cuts of steak they offer!  Amazing amazing amazing. And the four chimichurri sauces were the icing on the top of the cake. We will absolutely be back! We would love to see another gaucho location pop up in Pittsburgh so the wait times could decrease!! But 5/5 none the less !

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asado Plate, Vegetables, chimichurri
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asado Plate, Vegetables

VFIoXmVe1xerrxgk6gtwIw.text: Best meal I've had this year, maybe even ever.   We had steak, empanadas, charcuterie, potatoes, salads, good lord we had a lot of food and it was all amazing! All the sauces were great, we particularly loved the red sauce. (I'm obviously very cultured and that's definitely the proper name for the sauce)  You will probably have to wait in line but it is 100% worth it. I'll never go to Pittsburgh without going here.

NiWsSGOiEchS3vpZqLRi4g.text: So. Where to start. Well I'll start by saying, EVERYTHING was amazing. Like wow! First of all we did wait in line for a good 45 mins. But if any restaurant has a line. You KNOW it's gonna be good. We went at 4 and the line was still very long. But it got even longer as the night went on. But anyways for the food, I order the filet mignon, medium, and it was probably the best steak I've EVER had. They made it sooooo good. The outside of the steak had a nice char to it, but the middle had just enough pink. And it was just filled with juice. It was so freaking good. The salad that came with it was delicious. It was very fresh! And ya know how some salads are chewy when they use real greens, well this one wasn't! It was very light and tasty and just great. I also ordered the carrots with goat cheese, and omg. These were sooooo good. Idk where they get their cheese but holy crap. So good. It was like a dessert. And I also ordered an empanada and that was also delicious. But so if your deciding if you want to wait it out in that huge line, just do it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The line after we left
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef and veggie empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carrots with Goat Cheese. Make sure you order these!!

igKx5Fbg6-FuqlW2xZJ0wA.text: Third visit for my dear wife's birthday was again outstanding!  The carne asada skirt steak was amazing!  We tried the campfire yams that really blew our tastebuds away with super charred big marshmallows and potatoes that became uber carmelized in the fire.  OMG!  Just delicious!  And the beans and greens and side of mushrooms was stellar.  We love their sauces and their servers cannot be beat.  We arrived around 6pm on a Saturday and waited an hour to order and be seated.  It goes pretty quickly because there is always some primo people watching to be had.  Just love you Gaucho!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Campfire potatoes
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sides - shrooms &amp; beans n greens
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skirt steak

61KUtClwWsNfv5gNqX4IWQ.text: I was PLANNING on taking a picture of my food, but the second I got it, I started cutting. I don't want to exaggerate because I love steak, but this was probably the best steak I've ever had in my life. I had the sirloin and the potatoes and it was unbelievable. The steak was cooked perfectly, it was juicy, it was tender, it was flavorful. The potatoes were unbelievable as well. Don't listen to anyone who says anything other than 5 stars. The wait in the cold was abworth it!  Second time back and somehow it was better than the first time. Can I just go ahead and give this place 10 stars?

w4UWq0dg6LUB3ScKTLJqww.text: Honestly... worth the wait. My husband said the wait is the only thing he'd take stars off for, but he hates waiting more than 15 mins for anything so   The warnings about the line are real - expect to wait at least 20-30 minutes. We came on Cinco de Mayo weekend by accident (and this area of Pittsburgh has a weekend market going on, anyways) so parking was rough and the line was already winding around the building. We still only waited a little over 45 minutes, though, so I'd call that a win.   The prices are fair, especially for the amount of food that you get, but it's my opinion that you should skip the platters and just go for the sandwiches. Would maybe change my mind if I got the asada platter or the paella, but those are things I'd get only with a hungry group of friends. For just me, the steak sandwich + some empanadas are more than enough. Speaking of which, I want to shout out the empanadas... I've never had Argentinian empanadas and was expecting the Mexican masa variety, but these are more of a bread dough and almost more like an Asian bao?? Super good and wish we got more (at first, I was a little underwhelmed by how small they seemed, but with the bready dough and dense filling, they were the right amount of filling).   Also, big ups to the sauces... all of them are great, but the standouts are the chimmichuri (obviously previously raved about) and the smoked pepper. Honestly would have taken more to go if I wasn't so worried about little sauce containers spilling in my car.   Overall, great experience that genuinely feels local and warm. The service is great - efficient and used to dealing with crowds (love that they find your group tables so no one can hog/reserve more space than necessary) and extremely friendly. Looking forward to coming back (hopefully with a shorter line) and trying more on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BxdsSXa3spk7_FzxMdXuRw.text: I mean, obviously this review is going to be five star like every other review. So yummy. I was visiting Pittsburgh and our Uber driver recommended this place. When I yelped restaurants later on, it ended up also coming up. Sunday we decided to go, but turned out to be closed. Decided to go next day, Monday, but was closed to. We were able to eat before we headed out of Pittsburgh on Tuesday and it did not disappoint. We sat outside and our dog was welcomed and given a cold drink as well. Staff is very nice.

_wM8aQ_ULyTcEgtJMyjj2g.text: We had a party of 15, and despite the huge lines, were accommodated happily and efficiently. Food was delicious as well. Would 10/10 recommend.

JyvD6-FKo_F04C3ihZFZOw.text: This place, under most circumstances, would get five stars. The only downside is the long wait. During our most recent visit my wife and I spent 40 minutes in line. The food and service are amazing and well worth the wait! BUT, if you can get there right when the restaurant opens or go during the week you can avoid the lines.  I always get the Bondiola... roasted pork sandwich with a mustard sauce and caramelized onions. AMAZING! The bread is incredible...  My wife got the El Gaucho Salad with chicken added. She also gets QuiQui Rimichi sauce on the side. DELICIOUS!  BYOB!!  You won't be disappointed!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6Ff3Vr5EPbCs8vNZvu4eXw.text: If you are visiting Pittsburgh just add this to your list of restaurants you must eat at. Or if you live here and haven't dined here yet - get here ASAP. Just make sure you choose the time wisely. The hype is real and there will be a line. It does go fast though given the ordering set up.   I've dined at Gaucho twice now. The first time was in the summer when they had the shrimp and grilled veggies on the menu. This recent time I decided to get the carne sandwich and campfire yams. I have never ordered something I didn't like here. If you love yams, I highly recommend the campfire yams. I felt like I was out in the woods eating roasted marshmallows! Such a perfect fall dish. The sandwich was bigger than I expected which is why I cut it in half and made two meals out of it. You have your choice of meats and I picked the flank steak for my sandwich. Also, do not skip out on the sauces. They take your already delicious meal to the next level.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Sandwich and Campfire Yams
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xzD97g5EVXzS4FLg77tp6A.text: The pulled pork and caramelized onions are incredible. Try all the sauces. So good. Would highly recommend

IArgjltgphlDPDdHvauQtA.text: One of my FAVORITE restaurants in the Burgh!! Great food, casual, relaxed atmosphere and BYOB - what more could you ask for!!  We are FREQUENT visitors!! The food is always cooked to perfection and the ingredients are so FRESH!! EVERYONE - from those that assist you in finding a seat, to those that take your order, to those that act as severs - is SO friendly and accommodating!! We took my dad to Gaucho tonight to celebrate his birthday (he loves it there and always requests it) and, of course, it was a great experience. We brought a cake and they kept it in the fridge for us during dinner and then brought it out with a candle and sang Happy Birthday (I did not ask them to do that, they just did )  I have never had a bad meal at Gaucho!! Some of our favorites include the Qui Qui Chicken appetizer, the steak burger, the rosemary braised beef sandwich and the salads are AMAZING!!! So fresh and delicious!!  The only drawback to Gaucho is that they don't take reservations, so you may have to wait in line. We try to go at "off" times to avoid the line, but the food is DEFINITELY worth the wait if you must stand in line.  They have a great system in place and run like a well-oiled machine, though, so your wait will not be unpleasant in the least.  If you have never been there, RUN, don't walk!! I promise you will be glad you did!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OVu3UdE29u9r5GyAtDCo8w.text: The food here is a 5 so I'll start with that.   We started with the picada, which was a huge portion for an appetizer. It was enough for my husband and I to have it as an appetizer for two days. The picada included Serrano ham, Iberico Chorizo, provolone, cabrales (which is another word for amazing blue cheese), dulce de membrillo (which is another name for pear paste - I don't like pear, but thought it was tasty), marinated olives (green and kalamata type olives), toasted almonds and ciabatta toast. We love charcuterie plates and this was by far the best.   Next we shared the carne sandwich with flank steak. Originally, we were going to get either sirloin or skirt steak. Then I asked which steak would be the most tender and flavorful. A man who worked there said the flank steak would be the best for what I described. So happy we took his recommendation. It was delicious and made even better when I added chimichurri and some of the cabrales (blue cheese) from the picada. Absolutely delicious! We'd order both again in a heartbeat.   Now to the reason why I gave them 1 star less. Their ordering system is a disaster. There is always one person on the register who barely wants to be there. There may or may not be someone else there watching the giant line but not jumping on the second register. Then there is a girl giving out drinks. I think her time would be better spent on the second register ringing people up. There was a woman who took you to your table. Again this seems silly. Why can't she ring the second register and let people find their own seats? There were lots of them. It would be so much better if they just had table service. Then there is the crazy list of rules outside.   If you can deal with the dumb ordering process and waiting forever to get to the one person ringing the register, the food is so worth it.   You can also call ahead and come in for takeout. You can't eat there after though.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich with flank steak which was delicious.

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Picada: Serrano ham, Iberico Chorizo, provolone, cabrales (blue cheese), pear paste, marinated olives, toasted almonds and ciabatta toast.

yLk75uXMIKz0zXelgQ3Qnw.text: Amazing!!!! Food is so good and fresh! And it's byob. I wouldn't go when your extremely hungry because when we got there at around 8ish for dinner we waited in line for an hour. To me, I think the line is worth it for how good the food is. But I love good food.

KMbzcN_1KxmSjIWLWnBkqw.text: Came here for late brunch on a Friday. Our party of 10 was able to find seating quickly. We ordered everything from paella, sirloin steak, steak sandwiches, potato sides, and chorizo sampler dish. Everything was cooked very well. Meats were tender, juicy and well flavored. Potatoes had a nice garlic and thyme herb roasted taste to them. The salads had a variety of spinach and other greens your not limited to just ice burg lettuce.  Paella took about 30 minutes to prepare. Feeds around 5-8 people. They put plenty of sausage, chicken, mussels, shrimp, and clams in this dish. Shrimp was a lil overcooked and rice should've been cooked for another 5 minutes. Rice still had a lil of the hard texture to it.  One of my friends who lives in the area recommended this place and we were surprised we got seated quickly. They have a sauce and silver ware station. Sauce here is everything. They have this roasted pepper, chimichurri and pesto type sauce that everyone needs to try. It's so good that you need to try different combinations on all of your food. Everything seems to be self service, but the kind waiters do come out to clear plates, refill drinks and check in on you.  Highly recommend this place if your a big meat person and enjoy Argentinian dishes. Portions are reasonable, food is priced fairly and you get quality ingredients here. There is plenty of street parking in the area. I do hear the place can get crowded so expect a wait. Parties are first come first serve and you can't reserve seats

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Different sauce combinations

5IQwRr7QN3Nt8PS1mkVRqQ.text: Visit Pittsburgh every two weeks or so for work and thought we'd venture to the Strip.   After the crazy long line and all the hype, left the restaurant somewhat disappointed.   Stood in the line the meandered along the length of the building, on a narrow baking hot concrete sidewalk, directly abutting the tarmac street. Hostess wouldn't commit to how long of a wait, with a canned response for each who asked. Many rules to follow, explicitly stated along your route (aka, Seinfeld soup nazi). As you reach indoors, the highlight of the experience is a large lobby with views of attached kitchen and a large wall-sized board describing a multitude of culinary options. Many varieties of steaks, poultry and fish options. Helpful diagrams of how they cook their meats. Views of the kitchen as you order your food in the cafeteria line is entertaining. Very friendly cashiers. Wait for them to seat you.   Entering the dining area a bit of a letdown. Nondescript smallish and visually isolated back room that feels half basic coffee shop / half small town airport fast food sit down. Mix of recycled 80's and 90's office tables and chairs with seemingly little thought put into the room. The procession up to and including ordering is obviously the focus.   Had the 6 oz filet mignon ($23) with a roasted potato side ($3). Steak was sliced, decent but not spectacular, with a roasted garlic salad side.  Various dipping sauces. Finished with a tart and coffee for dessert.   As we left, passing the others anxiously waiting to place their order, and seeing how quickly visitors cycle through once they get seated, I could tell you exactly how long of a wait to expect for a given line length. Enjoyable experience, but for our group of 4, thinking not standing up to the hype.

Vde39zlPYQB4D3a0FWskaA.text: Food was good but that line! We'll go back to Fogo, which really isn't much more expensive and we can skip the standing around for over an hour.
