GzeIxDKPrV5w7a2A5_EOYg.text: A great spot with delicious wares, imperfect tables and utterly lovely staff. It's BYOB, so pick up wine before you come, if you're so inclined! Even on a Tuesday there was a bit of a wait standing in line, but it was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nutella stuffed bread pudding with house made crusty bread.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One veggie and one beef empanada in perfect doughy pockets
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One veggie and one beef empanada in perfect doughy pockets

aA2is57EKLQGaK-_H1GOEw.text: There is nothing bad to say about this place. I try to stop in for lunch whenever I am in the area. The dinner line scares me but not enough to rule this place out. Try all the sauces. BYOB. Order extra bread.

FKoTQ0kv-F_wG7Mbieyhvg.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Gaucho yet! The food is amazing, especially the sauces. I normally don't eat beef, but I do here, because it's so good. The menu is very reasonably priced for the quality and quantity you get, and it's not a concept that you see in every city (at least I don't know of any in Portland yet). I always take out of town guests here as a starting point in our food crawl/tour of Pittsburgh.   I try to come at off hours or order ahead for pick up. I stick to the steak or Rosemary braised beef sandwich. I've had the fish and chor y pan, but wasn't too impressed. Beef is definitely the star here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gaucho Vegetables (rataouille) and rosemary braised beef sandwich

8bKMdwkUTEYa7bikveDNIA.text: Absolutely amazing! Worth the wait. Extremely nice staff and food is mouth watering. One of my favorite places here in Pittsburgh!

O5MunZKoscP8gvrtTXAj7A.text: Lives up to the hype. I'd wait in line for a couple of hours to eat here.   We came at 3pm on a Friday. No line. #winning so hard. I think the magic starts here in two ways. First, the wood-fired oven they use (so the type of wood, and the high temp), and the freshness of the meat (which is all from regional providers). Beyond the meat, ALL of the ingredients were so fresh, and such high quality, that you wonder how the prices on the menu aren't higher.   Everything we had: empanadas, provoletta, chicken sandwich, and the gaucho platter were divine. Of course, their four housemade sauces are seemingly made by the hands of angels). My 3-year old niece begged us each day after to take her back here. This place could be a Paleo Paradise, but the bread is so so so good (from a local bakery, can't recall which one) that you're going to go all-in on the carbs. This is one of those times when each bite you take, you have a foodgasm (and you--perhaps awkwardly note--that everyone around you is experiencing the same thing).   Not cheap by any means, but you're getting top-quality food prepared with expert precision, so worth every penny. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pollo Con Pan (chicken sandwich?
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provoletta (large)
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gaucho Platter ($50)

5akyPIF6r7AnUXjoIWFDEw.text: I have been here twice. First time I went inside to sit, the second I ordered take out. I will warn those who are looking to sit down inside and eat, from 5pm on there is usually a wait and a line that wraps outside the door, I would recommend getting there early or for lunch.   The second time I ordered take out. This by passed the wait and you can walk right in and pick up your order. Food took 20 minutes, and the containers keep the food decently warm.   The pork chop, was cooked well nothing to rant or rave about, empanadas have a firm texture which felt like they had been overcooked a little, the vegetable filling was nothing crazy, but the pork filling was really good. The shrimp and corn we're excellent. I will definitely be back but will be ordering take out to skip the wait.

ANlEB9QqWtMNNmbnxT9nVw.text: Wow that was a lot of meat! We got there at around noon, and just missed the big rush. Once inside there is a huge line outside. This is definitely not a place for vegetarians. We got the braised Rosemary beef and the pulled pork sandwich, both huge, both delicious! Meat was perfectly cooked and the bread was perfectly toasted. We also had the empanadas as a starter which were amazing. Took our sandwiches to go, which we have been able to stay and enjoy all the different sauces. Definitely a must if you're in Pittsburgh.

T_KrtW3heeUECRlwW5Wp8A.text: There was a wait but it's definitely worth it. Would recommend getting the veggie empanada, they are amazing! It is a very comfortable setting and my family and I gushed over the food afterwards. I would recommend this place if you want to try something new but not to disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cerdo and steak

3Vexz1qo1I7VFQ4xwS3o8g.text: First time in for a quick lunch before a flight. I ordered the braised rosemary beef sandwich, the fried provolone to share, and my Lunch date ordered the lamb. The food was giant and just as tasty! The beef was squeezed between two buttery slices of bread and topped with a creamy horsey sauce  with caramelized shallots.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gKq1s73lSvszgtUA3SlVEg.text: I came here for my 24th birthday and have since been anticipating when we can come back. The steak is cooked to your preference...whatever you want. I hope to come back soon. This place is great.

4JHunmI9rEaN9JnP1ypbJw.text: The beef is more tight than the normal American style steak. I guess the meat has less marble. However, it is a pleasant experience to have the meat with several sauce together. I like the Argentina pesto the most.

cmBY0-XJBUFpBdvpxiToPQ.text: Very disappointing service.. we arrived and sat down only to be told there was no table service and to join the queue, which was by now longer than when we came in.. being there first, would have been nice to be advised earlier and escorted to the queue... rather than told oh you are now last as you missed your spot on the queue.. but there was no queue or line when we came in.. rude and definitely not Argentinean !! should be more organized and patron friendly.. this put us off and we left !!! Definitely won't be coming back !!!

lFTDwBrjBNS2JPej-hm2-w.text: The food that I ordered was good, 3 sides. Had to send back one of the sides because they gave me the wrong one. My daughter ordered the $55.00 steak platter that had no sides with it, was over seasoned, WAY OVER PRICED.They forgot the grilled bread had to ask  twice.   Would not go back.

6eRiab_R87hSMIuBdmf-yg.text: AMAZING! This one word describes it all.  This is a small joint located right before the market strip. Although underwhelming on the outside, the food offered inside was absolutely delicious.   The one thing that could've  used improvement that the great food made up for was definitely the service. Although the lady who took our order was not entirely rude, she wasn't the most helpful or friendly either. We were trying to get her opinion on what to order but she sort of gave us the "arms up" attitude and claimed it was all good. As there was a lot of items on the menu it was hard to decide. Everything was also written in Spanish so you really had to read the descriptions to know what you're getting yourself into especially if you don't know Spanish.   We ended up ordering a Rosemary braised beef sandwich, pork tenderloin with caramelized mushrooms and onions, a side of roasted potatoes and two empanadas to start. All of these items were absolutely to die for. The beef brisket sandwich came with a horse radish sauce that elevated the flavour to another level. The pork was so juicy and tender it practically melted in our mouths. Even the roasted potatoes were packed with flavour leaving no tastebuds behind! Our empanadas were also a great way to start our meal because the beef inside them was well seasoned and perfectly balanced.   During our meal one of the kitchen staff also came to ask us how our meal was and that definitely redeemed the initial service we had. Especially considering the layout of this restaurant is small and offers limited seating that is first come first serve with a order and bring your food to the table kind of vibe.   This place definitely knows their meat and they offer great flavours. If you're ever in town or have been thinking of making a visit. JUST DO IT. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The inside
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Special: pork tenderloin with caramelized onions and mushrooms

9Eacilh5dYSBJgVUOSt8Eg.text: Fantastic  I was looking for a healthy meal and the pescado plate (sword fish) hit the mark. Both the salad and fish were absolutely scrumptious.

CtsI2na1FlQ46A-nm39hhQ.text: I had lunch at Gaucho's today. Let's get the cold prickly's out of the way first:   This place is small. There are 6 uncomfortable stools with very limited counter space and it gets really crowded in that cramp space.  Not a very good place to go if you're looking for a nice sitdown meal.   It's also pretty expensive as far as a lunch sandwich goes.  My sandwich set me back $12.83... No sides, no drink.   Lastly, it's a bit of a hike if you work in town. To get here from town you would be walking past a number of other pretty good and much more comfortable eateries just to get here. And if you planned on take out, your sandwich would be cold by the time you walked back to you desk.   Now on to the "warm fuzzies":  The sandwich I had was unbelievably good! Quite possibly the very best sandwich in the Burg. I got the Carne with ribeye steak. It was a generous serving of real ribeye steak right off of the grill, not some shaved imposter.   I'm a bit shy when it comes to ordering steak when I go out.  I like mine well done and most places can't seem to comprehend what "well done" means.  This ribeye was grilled to perfection; no pink on the inside, no char on the outside. It was brown all the way through while still retaining its juiciness.  Topping the sandwich off was chimmi, caramelized onion & pepper all between a lightly toasted bun. Perfection!!! Well worth every penny I spent on it.   I was lucky enough to snag one of the six stools and enjoy my sandwich as soon as it came off the grill and while it was still warm.  If it weren't for the cramped and limited seating I'd give this place a five star rating. Unfortunately the accommodations knocked it down a notch.  *** NOTE (3/12/2015) ***  As Lisa G. mentioned in her review of Goucho's, they are planning on expanding their restaurant to include better seating accommodations.  I'm looking forward to the new and improved Goucho's... Thanks for addressing that Lisa!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Ribeye
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Special Sauce

crNoX9Mwm4gA9WTYdl4TSQ.text: First off, the trick with Gaucho is to order in advance, then skip the wait, walk and grab your food, and then hustle down to whatever apartment you call home and enjoy the delish. On my second night in Pittsburgh, my dad and I walked the 16th St. bridge after unpacking and proceeded to wait in line for just under two hours. After about an hour, we noticed that people were able to walk in, skip the line, and grab pre-ordered food to go and we looked at each other solemnly.  I have eaten at many good restaurants in some wonderful and underappreciated cities in my time. None of them, including Gaucho, is worth a two hour wait in line. Would I wait 30 minutes? Yes. The food IS good, but at some point the waiting time supersedes quality food. To be fair, the service staff and cooks do a great job of pushing the line and balancing between encouraging finished diners to depart while also giving you good service.  Regarding the food, it is very good like I said. The sandwiches are underwhelming though and need to be complimented with any of the wonderful sides. Personally, if I want some meat, I go with the wings now. They are sizeable, perfectly grilled, and have a delightful zest to them with fairly complex flavors. They are quite nice.  Many people love the grilled vegetables, but as someone who grills veggies at home with regularity, I don't see much difference. I do recommend the Papas Dulce and Fungos though.   The sauces are good, but again, waiting in line for two hours to order something you drench in sauce seems a bit unusual. Your mileage may vary though!

CS5uzs3T2qDOcGhu7bQaXQ.text: 3 of us went during the weekday lunch rush and we waited probably 10 minutes at most in line before we ordered and less than that to get our food once we sat down. The host/serving staff was friendly efficient to take our order and seat us. The kitchen staff was extremely knowledgeable when we asked about different dishes. I had the Argentino salad with steak, medium rare and it was prepared to perfection! The 4 different sauces they offer are all equally delicious and different!  The inside is clean, decorated well, and we love the yinzer vibe in there in addition to the authentic argentine feel.   5 stars and more! Love everything!

45oj38EgQs61nV3L_5I_BQ.text: Definitely one of our favorite restaurant of Pittsburgh. Good meal, good price and good service. The only problem is the long lines on Saturdays, so it's better get very early or after 2:00 p.m on Weekends. ;)

I1iRE5FI3aIZGwppBskmjw.text: Great atmosphere, very clean, staff very friendly.   I had the Cordero, medium rare. Two double lamb chops came out a perfect medium rare. There was a nice char on the outside, unfortunately this carried over to the frenched rib bones. Two were burnt off when it came out, the other two fell apart on the plate. Not appetizing. The meat was under-seasoned.   The accompanying small casa salad was tasty, especially liked the grilled grape tomatoes. Dressed perfectly, a little understated, as I prefer.   Grilled corn was under-seasoned as well, and there isn't any salt and pepper to be found. Could have used a bit of char on it. They could have used some of that tin foil it was wrapped in to protect the lamb rib bones....  Gaucho papas were delicious. Wouldn't change a thing. They were grilled perfectly, I loved the seasoning, and the oil was decadent. Nice-sized portion for three bucks. Plenty to share.   They have a small selection of self-serve sauces, well balanced and diverse. I thought they were very flexible and all complimented every menu item in a different fashion. Very oily, but great with the meats.   I will definitely go back. Baby Girl brought me a chicken sandwich home about a month ago, and I crushed it. Shredded chicken and ajo sauce on that grilled ciabatta. I was so full I couldn't eat the rest of the day. Killed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7ILBkN6zydwq-Pc6jWEIBA.text: I loved my first experience in the newly expanded, well-renowned Gaucho! I ordered the chicken sandwich, which came out on a toasty grilled ciabatta (crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside...yummm). I was unaware chicken could taste that good- obviously I shared only under duress.   My lunch partners ordered the skirt steak and the lamb rack. The skirt came out with an incredible marinade, with just the right preparation- an inspired performance. The lamb, while perfectly seasoned and cooked was the only reason for a star deduction! Compared to the other portions, which were huge, the lamb was a paltry 4 ribs and a tiny side salad. Perhaps they need to charge more and offer a larger amount of lamb, but we were very surprised by the notable difference in meat on that plate.   The ambiance is changed from the joint's humble(r) roots, and feels a bit more like the hip, buzzing restaurant it became. There is still a great view of the kitchen, and intimate seating, though you are no longer elbow-to-elbow with the next diner.   In summary: We loved it, we'll absolutely be back, just not for the lamb.

3qGCGQ1UwBfwUzb99Gnz_Q.text: Our steak was overcooked but they gave us a new one immediately and it was perfect. Love their sauces! We also had the grilled chicken which was tasty. Will def be back for their paella!

wf2vrKiXctvKdB7F2HPCAg.text: Fantastic food and good service!  The best steaks we've had in the 'Burgh!

BgV1ZhE7H7YvSIJM0Q409A.text: Delicious! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu! I ordered the flank steak sandwich with a side of potatoes. I would order it again!! The staff is super friendly, too with good tunes playing in the background! It's BYOB with a selection of soft drinks.   Be careful of when you go! For those of you that are not familiar, you wait in line to order your food and then you are seated. We went there around 7:30 on a Tuesday and only had to wait about 15 minutes in line (I'm sure it is much long on weekends). But it is worth the wait!!!   Definitely check this place out if you are looking for a good meaty meal!

SFR2Xbp6NVZ3yJGUMYEnMA.text: Amazing food. Definitely a must visit restaurant in Pittsburgh. It's in a location where parking can be difficult sometimes but it's worth a few circles around the block to find a parking spot. On a normal day you can find the line out the door.  BYOB which we didn't mind.  I had a a simple chicken sandwich and couldn't believe how flavorful it was! I also tried the chicken wings. Cooked to perfection.  I went with a party of 5 and we all tried something different. Everyone raved about their food.  My favorite part was trying all the different sauces they have.  No wonder this place is always packed. I can't wait to go back!

r3bwlXa_jfTp11OVcHAcfQ.text: SETTING Very small place with very limited bar stools along the wall for dining in. Menu is written on blackboards that stretch along the walls. More seating outside. Wood everywhere!  FOOD We ordered the top two recommended sandwiches: Ribeye sandwich (medium rare, unless you tell them otherwise) and the Rosemary braised beef sandwich.  Wow, the ribeye was perfection! Definitely a heavy sandwich with thick cuts of ribeye topped with roasted red peppers and onions on a ciabatta-type bread. The rosemary braised beef sandwich was delicious as well, a little lighter than the ribeye, but still filling. The horseradish sauce went very well with the beef and caramelized onions.   The four kinds of sauces they offer were excellent. Definitely try dipping your sandwiches in them for an extra kick!  SERVICE Despite the long lines, the food was made in a reasonable amount of time. To make the line more bearable, there was always loud and silly banter amongst the cooks and register. It was as if I was at an improv show! One customer was taking a photo and the cooks immediately struck a pose. Another was hugging his girlfriend, and the cooks joked out loud to their customers that he was actually "holding her up from falling down" due to the long wait. Hilarious! Order up front and they call your name once your order is ready.  IMPRESSIONS There aren't many places that serve such quality meat inside a sandwich at a reasonable price. Each meal comes with a side of laughs as well. Everyone there is happy and leaves with his stomach happy, this is why Gaucho's is a must visit...just be prepared to wait at least 20 minutes.

S-mtoNHLZkY9FWJGZgu8BA.text: I am usually that fool that doesn't end up going to places once there is so much hype about it but I have finally gone to Gaucho and I am proud to say that I am forever changed. I got the rosemary braised beef con pan and it was amazing!!! The sandwich was huge and the meat was delicious. However, what truly stole the show were the condiments. I ate all the chimi and pepper relishes and loved all of them!!! Everything was so bright and fresh tasting! I would never need another condiment in my life if I knew how to replicate one of these sauces!!

bw98r2MSb0AkD1ISrZRSpw.text: Omg looking at the pictures I took so I can post on Yelp and I'm drooling/salivating at 10:30pm...this sandwich was well worth my walk in the rain. I got lucky because there wasn't a line (came on a weekday around 4pm). I got the steak sandwich with onions on ciabatta. Bread was toasty and chewy. Steak was medium cooked goodness. Sauce was running through my fingers and hands. What more can one want from a sandwich. I should've ordered two although one is quite fulfilling. Yum...I need to be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

eFD0pqRCEhsWEi2KPMLzUg.text: I'm not sure what the hype is about this restaurant. It's crazy to wait in line forever in the cold. Food was average; nothing out of the blue - definitely NOT worth the wait.  Food: 3/5 Service: 2/5 Ambience: 3/5

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled shrimp
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sauces

M7lDSUeVHgtCmUxkPjlFeA.text: Get anything on the menu; it will be great. If you hate the line, call ahead and order for takeout.

T_iItoQ6spNksJJ35viQRw.text: Gaucho's doesn't need my review...but I will give it anyway!   LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!  WOW-  this place is really amazing!  The beef is crazy delicious, and the roasted veggies were seriously the best ever!  I know there is always a long wait and limited seating.  BUT - if you can visit during an off-time, like mid afternoon -  you can get right in and get a table.  We are lucky to have a fantastic creative restaurant like this in Pittsburgh!

u3ezks8_Rnn0LZI1XniH3Q.text: I couldn't believe there existed a restaurant with 200+ reviews and 5 stars so I had to check this place out. Of course I decided to do this on one of coldest days of this year. Despite the tiny space, the guys working there made me feel at home. With so many options to decide, my friend and I got all the options we wanted: jamon serrano, the meat and veggie empanada, gaucho papas, and rosemary braised beef sandwich.   My description of the food will never give it justice. I highly highly recommend the jamon serrano. All the components of the dish was picked out carefully to complement each other. I even took the left over goat cheese and picked onions and added to the rosemary braised beef sandwich. If you don't have time to sit down, the sandwich is your best option. Hearty and satisfying, it can even satiate a caveman. The meat and veggie emapanadas were seasoned well and the emapanada dough was flakey and buttery. I preferred the steak but I am also a meat lover so my preference is biased. The gaucho papas weren't anything special but served as a nice accompaniment to our meal.   I think their sauces deserve a separate paragraph. One of their workers explained to me the ingredients in all of the four sauces. Their main ingredients for each are: onion, parsley, onion, and red pepper. The chimirri (parsley based sauced) was  my favorite for it's potent flavor followed by the garlic, red pepper, and onion. Their sauces are great companions for any of the dishes. I personally enjoyed the chimirri with the bread and red pepper sauce for the potatoes.  Gaucho not only serves awesome food but is one of the few restaurants that have excellent service. The workers truly looked like they enjoyed their job and even offered my friend and I to warm ourselves up by their grill. Their antics along with the food makes Gaucho a must stop. You know I'll be there again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jamon serrano, gaucho papas, rosemary braised beef sandwich, and empanadas!

wvVEVYBR5xv1lW935uXlig.text: EDIT: This meal was from December. I was trying to add Gaucho to my BYOB list, and I realized I hadn't posted my draft. /end  The hype is real.   Ordered:  Bife de Chorizo | NY Strip, rare Los Sprahts | Brussel Sprouts, sweet peppered bacon, and cider reduction Caldo del Mar | Mussels, clams, squid, fried capers, lemon, garlic, tomato, and a secret ingredient.  My favorite part is that it's not ridiculously expensive. I recommend the steaks, and the brussels were really good. I was disappointed by the seafood, next time I'll just stick to the land meat.   I've looked through the many pictures, and I'd want to come back and try the sandwiches too.  The only downside or unimpressive part of Gaucho is that the eating area could be improved-- it feels like a McD's dining room. Wobbly chairs and tables.

T4ocIWuQQHON5CafYg09-Q.text: I pray to God that the owner sees this review, because I had briefly spoken with him once before and he seemed like a very genuine guy who cares about his business. So, here we go:  I must preface this review by stating the following: I enjoy the food from this place moreso than any restaurant in Pittsburgh. It really is delicious. Unfortunately this is the absolute worst managed restaurant I have ever been to or seen. If not for the unbelievable food I would never come here. The line during the busy hours in unbearable. I can understand and even apprecuate a place that has a line because the product dictates higher demand. That is not the entire cause of the problem here. Yes, thenfood is fantastic and yes that makes them busy, but these people have no interest whatsoever in helping alleviate the problem. There is only ever 1 register open with 1 person taking orders. ONE! Meanwhile there is a second register sitting right there that no one uses while 1 guy stands there and does nothing but offer u a glass of water while you lose your mind, another older guy sits on his ass at the end of the counter doing nothing, and guy number 3 who im assuming is the worlds worst restaurant manager concerns himself only with the shape of the que that has formed and whether or not the door is closed. OPEN THE SECOND REGISTER YOU WORTHLESS FOOL! I cannot get over how much i love the food here, but by the time i get to order I am so completely disgusted and frustrated after having watched these clowns do nothing for 45 minutes that I wish I could bring myself to stop eating here simply out of spite. I have never been so overcome by anger and frustration at any restaurant before and it happens EVERY SINGLE TIME i come here. Anthony, please! Hire a good manager. I know a few great people with plenty of experience. Lose the clowns and get some help. Your cooking deserves better from your staff.

hxsqxxyC2v2a5ekfaGludQ.text: I went  by this place when I was walking down to the Strip District in Pittsburgh. I wasn't sure what it was but there was a line all the way out the door and down the block. I found out It was a lot of local business people waiting to get in for lunch. An hour later I walked back by and the line had shortened somewhat. I decided I had to try it if that many local people were willing to wait. I then looked it up on Yelp and the ratings were fantastic. I had a steak sandwich with chimmichurri and it was fantastic. It is an Argentine type restaurant. The first place I have see fugazetta since Buenos Aires. This place is worth the wait. I looked at all the plates going by and they all looked fantastic. I'm sorry I don't have room for the chocolate coconut bread pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

67-20903lksfwVKzOmvd9A.text: Terrific meal!!!  Great location and atmosphere.  But food is outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

c8V6V2yf6QoKTco357-_UQ.text: If you happen to stumble upon my review over any of the other hundreds of reviews for Gaucho, look no further than the average rating for the restaurant and this piece of advice: Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is entirely worth the hype.  If you must read further, the story is this: I had been hoping to make it to Gaucho for months but could never squeeze it in during trips back home. Now that I'm back in the 412 for the foreseeable future, I legitimately hope to eat here multiple times a month. I came with a friend during the days immediately proceeding the re-opening. I hadn't seen the inside before the re-open, but I can say the new restaurant is gorgeous, modern, and well-ventilated (take a peek in the kitchen from the street, you'd never know there is a wood fire in there from the inside).  The day of my visit they had to close down early and re-open after prepping more food. This apparently had happened a few times and it feels like the restaurant is getting in its groove to accommodate the larger crowds. The line was long, but we were inside, had ordered, seated and fed within about 30 minutes. I don't think Gaucho will ever not be busy, so plan accordingly.  The staff was incredibly friendly and eager to talk about any piece of the menu. I had the rosemary braised beef con pan (sandwich) and my friend had the bife de gaucho (ribeye, cooked to order) con pan. Everything about my sandwich was perfect. The meat was cooked to tender perfection, the horsey sauce was not overpowering or overused, and the caramelized onion probably spoke to my soul. I only managed to steal one bite of the gaucho con pan, but I suspect I will be getting a whole one for myself in the near future. We shared a side of the corn pudding: a warm, savory and spicy dish that did well to complement the meaty sandwiches.  If you made it to the end of this review, I appreciate your patience, and for goodness' sake - go eat at Gaucho!

GmaU20KiRBbDPvPgBx1MXw.text: The food is soooooooooooo good here. Wow. One of the best places I have ever eaten at...

2ZvbLhgtI7AgIE1r8HTZ5g.text: This place has the hype and still knocks it out of the park. I got the ribeye steak sandwich and it was next level. No complaints. One of the best meals in Pittsburgh.

WQfC6dSLaszPKqu_py6ZVQ.text: Wow. Phenomenal place and truly worth the wait. I had a small Lomo (6oz filet mignon) and the Calabaza Asada (roasted acorn squash, pickled cranberries, arugula, and spiced pecans). Both were delicious. The Lomo came with two crispy slices of this amazing bread that you could dip in four sauces as well as a nice side salad. But about that filet - it was absolutely incredible. The steak was so tender and the flavor had thoroughly been marinated into the meat. And the Calabaza Asada was nice too - the acorn squash formed this lovely bowl for the arugula salad. The smokiness of the pecans and the acidity of the cranberries provided the perfect complements to the sweet squash. The restaurant was packed to the door, and for a reason. I was very happy with my experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Calabaza Asada
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lomo

6O8zUdqxGlAutAd0FFZLCg.text: Food was sub-par dinning facilities were dirty and full of wood chips and dust employees while friendly were unprofessional the kitchen staff was drinking alcohol and eating food while food was being prepared witnessed one employee chewing tobacco and spitting in a cup at his workspace there was a mouse dropping under our table. Well now onto the food. i ordered a burger medium well with BLT and mayo and my wife ordered a vegetable sandwich. My burger came out drenched in mayonnaise and under cooked and I say that kindly. My wife's sandwich was sloppy and fell apart and she had to eat it with a fork. That being said we waited in line for about 45 minutes then waited to order another 10 because the dinning area was full eat here if you'd like but I just don't see the reasoning behind the popularity.

J69CRIdEp6t00gMHtedFPA.text: Thoroughly unimpressed by this place, possibly due to all of the hype. I for the life of me cannot understand the process for ordering. You wait in line forever, but feel rushed to order because you can only ask questions once you get to the front of the line. And you don't want to be that customer that takes 5 minutes inquiring about the expansive menu. Everyone will hate you for it. To make things worse, they only have ONE cashier. This establishment should accommodate the vastly growing crowd. But it appears that they want customers to feel like they're dining at an exclusive place; they could make changes but they seem to think they don't need to. There is another guy at the front counter that strictly grabs drinks and uncorks wine bottles. He could be of much more use elsewhere, such as also taking orders. I don't like that you have to tip up front. Personally, I always tip 20%, but when you're forced to grab all of your own eating utensils and seat yourself, I'm not sure what service I was tipping for. The cashier also stated that "maybe someone will seat you if you stand at the bottom of the stairs but I don't really know what's going on right now." And when I went upstairs to find a seat the waitress was very rude in accommodating seating for us.  We ordered the wings and they did not disappoint. They were flavorful and needed no extra sauces. I got the ribeye platter with a side of corn on the cob and vegetables. I requested medium well steak and basically got medium instead. The guy at the counter stated that the ribeye tasted better as medium or medium rare, so I think they chose to cook my steak as they saw fit. The corn had no seasoning whatsoever. Not worth getting. The vegetables were cooked nicely on the grill, but then they were paired with a sweet sauce that did not complement the dish well. My boyfriend also had the ribeye platter with a side of corn mash and potatoes. A few of his pieces were so burnt that you couldn't even eat them. The potatoes had no seasoning and the mash was just okay.   Overall it seemed that other than having the grill flavor, there were no extra seasonings on most of the food. The wings were excellent and that's the only positive I could think from the experience. I agree with others when they say that you want to get your money's worth. I want to feel like I'm paying $65 for a meal and not at a fast food joint. Also, advertise on the website that you have a BYOB policy so that out of towners are aware. The service in general left a bitter taste in my mouth.

_OufaynvaSchFDoCF2NoFw.text: The food was very good thus the 5 stars.  But waiting in line is a deterrant to a repeat visit. Also having to BYOB is inconvenient.  We also felt rushed as it's hard to enjoy your meal seeing other patron's eyes on you waiting for you to move so they can sit and eat.  We went around 3 in the afternoon, so the line wasn't horrible, but we felt rushed to order when we finally got to the counter.  We got the Paella to share with our party of 6, as it was huge along with potatoes and the roots as sides.  In some ways this dining style reminds me of Chipotle, just at a higher level.  Food was tasty, just wish the place would expand into a bigger space.

Qa7ncQMjpKt_bIIi0NCbDA.text: We were recommended Gaucho by some friends and were not dissapointed, the food is delicious.  I had the sirloin and my gf had the pollo mmm mmm. The ordering is a little strange and it took us a bit to figure out what we wanted but it did not disappoint.

jmVhIjMw39ZHZXWUQvmneg.text: Love this place! Last time was there had a spicy chorizo sandwich and red potatoes. Sauces were all great atmosphere is great and it's incredibly close to home. I get confused as to if it's more like a serve yourself restaurant or a full service? However this doesn't dampen the food. If you like meat or you just like great food in general, go here!

5S573SfJPkR7Kmb9GvL3Ag.text: Not real Argentinian steak (in Argentina steak is always cooked well done) but still very tasty. Usually crowded but lines move fast. Great service. Not much more to say.

i0PDUnEHy28iNwIdN6W65A.text: I lived in Denver for 5 years before moving to the burgh and so I was spoiled with all the fast-casual restaurants to choose from. Pittsburgh REALLY needs more of these kinds of restaurants. My husband and I have been to Gauchos a few times now and have loved it every time. We enjoy just ordering our food at the counter, getting everything we need, eating amazing high quality food and leave at our leisure. Perfect when you have small kids. The food is top notch every time. We take our families here when they visit. It's in our top 3 places to eat in Pittsburgh. There is no negative things we have experienced with this place - the only down side that parking is street and paid.

j4h9SooG8DrOd9Kmcuf2JA.text: Made a trip here from Cleveland this past weekend.  First let me say that my wife is from Argentina, and I have visited there.  The food here was better than any restaurant that I visited while in Buenos Aires.  My wife loved it as well, although she said the empanadas were not as good as her mother makes.  We both had different steaks which were cooked to perfection. Long lines, but they moved quickly and the food is definitely worth it.  I only wish there was one in Cleveland.

cQRcVj6xD8gh-2-jDrY1vA.text: Hell yes!   This place is amazing every single time.  The line is a little bit annoying but I guess that's because everyone else figured out how awesome this joint is too.  Try to go there during off peak hours and you'll slip right in.

tlbpnE23s4UG9zvDhFbkaA.text: STELLAR! AWESOME! FANTASTICO!  Yeah, that's pretty much how we feel about Gaucho.  Just like our experience with Cure, the approach to the restaurant sets the stage for a great meal, since the wonderful smell of open fire grilling will set your tastebuds into a frenzy. All of their items we ordered were nothing short of stupendously delicious and of the highest quality. Here's what we had:  1) Empanadas - honestly, I don't know how you could even consider NOT ordering empanadas if you set foot into an Argentine eatery - shame on you if you didn't order these! They are wonderful, and are definitely the best I've ever had... even in Argentina!  2) Provoletta - Again, this is an authentic classic. If you don't order this, you should be committed to the insane asylum. Delicious. Comes with a very tasty arugula and lemon vinaigrette side salad. A nice option for a small bite for lunch.  3) Two filet sandwiches - These are huge! On our next visit, we are only going to order one and split it, but this time, we just took the extra one home and wolfed it down the next day.  I was instantaneously addicted to this place, and will definitely be back in the near future! Love it, love it, love it!

8-yE-I9E2aqwIrrKdDU4cQ.text: After yelping and checking out trip advisor, this seemed like a must go to when in town. Sure enough, with a group of people, we decided to check it out. Needless to say, we were not disappointed. There was a wait for about 30ish mins but it was worth it. We all got sandwiches and they were all really good, Crane sandwich had excellent reviews so I figured why, not. It really lived up to its reviews. We also got a set of empanadas on the side and *mouth watering* definitely a must!

8Zd8jLnNspJk09tOEKMH0w.text: Have been here twice now. I'd give it 4.37. This is compared to places in Chicago, Memphis and Austin, TX  First time, we took out. Was okay The past time, we ate in. Went New Year's Eve. It was delicious. We had the Gondola and Parrilla Mixta. The line wasn't too bad at 5:10pm. The other night it was out the door. By the time we left, it was out the door again. The difference between take out and dining in, the food was hot and delicious compared to take home being cold. The dipping sauces were great too.   Large dining area in the back. Helpful staff.   Will definitely go back and eat more and try other selections.   this is definitely one of the better restaurants in Pittsburgh

yRl7hnY82lczGGOrtvs3Rw.text: We had the rosemary steak sandwich with meat and cheese tray.  The meal was excellent as usually.  We brought a bottle of wine, they uncorked as we ordered.  They have wine glasses there for your use.  Order extra grilled toast their dipping sauces are terrific.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taking a Thursday vacation mental health day downtown on the strip having lunch at Gaucho with Karen  Geisler.

nrjKCHxmLemO26ahgcGw0g.text: We are here visiting Pittsburgh for a day and decided to give this place a try since a friend on FB recommended it. I've got to say, seriously!!!...this QuiQui Chicky is ridiculously addicting!!! I'm actually writing this review while still licking my fingers! This a must try dish! We also ordered some Empanadas, which were very tasty, but this chicken dish.....omg!!!!

Hyn22Gccv4wTo6UPZVjR4Q.text: Excellent! My favorite spot in the burgh. The sauces and flavors are unique and the meat is quality. The smoky flavor from the wood-fire grill compliments every item on the menu. Every time I am a this place I leave satisfied. It's one of those places you need to visit so many times to try everything!

dDTsT13G-akx_tgaZaoRrg.text: Absolutely our favorite place in Pittsburgh.  I cannot say enough good things - the staff is fun, the food is amazing.

WLt2Xxu-GmJgyt5D330mLg.text: This place is ridiculously good. Authentic, delicious wood fired treats. Everything Gaucho's serves is incredible. I make it a point to go there any time I'm within a reasonable distance of Pittsburgh. If you give Gaucho's anything less than a five star rating, I'm going to assume you're either a competitor, or some dummy who doesn't understand that you sometimes have to wait in line for things.

HuiHNAEyBOkG50tqtCNmkA.text: This is a unsung gem in Pittsburgh.  While the set up is a bit unconventional the food is great. When you come in you stand in a line and order off a wall sized chalkboard menu then pay. They then seat you after you order. It's a byob location. The food is so unique and delicious. Give this place a try!

7RQumT6dSJ7VYPySfdmDzw.text: Great service, AMAZING food! Loved the empanadas and the lamb chops... the steak sandwich was the best I've ever eaten.  Incredible chimchurri and garlic dipping sauce!

hOSxh6ElZuczQUUVwnz-Rg.text: The best Rosemary beef sandwich in the whole city. Just a heads up you going to be ready to wait in line for at least half an hour no matter what time of the day it is

dUjrV0SQoDcq4gsyrFJqNw.text: I have only been here once, it was an hour and a half wait in line for lunch, but it was amazing!! So good. And the atmosphere was excellent! Going back for sure!! TK

vHKxtfgQVW_FSF4CABJ2qg.text: Five stars; you decide. I just paid $23 for a side salad a sandwich and a small bottle of water. Keep in mind:  1. There is  no tableside service; you go to the counter and order, get your own silverware, your own napkins, your own hot sauce.   2.When you're done you get to clean up after yourself.   3. The menu board is confusing. A majority of it is written in Spanish. Anytime you need to move around to order, get your food or utensils, you have to navigate  your way around customers who are huddled in front of the board with confused looks on their faces. I guess they don't speak Spanish either. And why should they, this is America.  I caught them on opening night after their "big" remodel. Somehow it was easier to put up with these things when the place was just a little hole in the wall. At least it had character then. Now it's just un-personal and way overpriced. While they may come up with some thought provoking combinations of ingredients, the food is just not that great. Cut the prices by 40% and I would give this place four stars. As it is, I'll give them a two.

e1TZN0Bl_uHQnzLBaM2LcQ.text: Great place for any time of day. We got the meat sampler and were not disappointed. The only thing that wasn't that great was the empanada, kind of lacked flavor. If not for that would of gotten 5. Also it's a BRB

7ueGEML6H9LsNePZQgQE6w.text: Damn!!!! This place is awesome! Best bang for your buck in the city of Pittsburgh! Never had a bad meal and I LOVE the MEAT SWEATS this place give you! The sauces are impeccable! Everything is amazing!

pChkb8rABdhcmqTUe62GXw.text: I'm a huge fan of Gaucho and it's super easy to give them 5 stars.  The quality of the food is consistently awesome. Some of my favorites include the flank steak, humita, foccacia, the rosemary braised beef sandwich, seafood stew, grilled corn on the cob, the shrimp....honestly, I've never had a dish here that I didn't think was delicious. I love that the menu changes seasonally and combines familiar items with more adventurous ones.   This place is so fun for a family-style meal with a nice bottle or two of wine (BYOB) because you're going to be eating off each other's plates anyway.  The steak temperature can be somewhat inconsistent. I started ordering it rare after having a few instances where only the center piece of my steak serving was actually at medium-rare, but then ended up with an order of steak that was definitely the Pittsburgh definition of rare. Regardless of this, the steak is always, always delicious and I would probably eat it even if it showed up in a near-charcoal state (which it doesn't).  As you can see by other reviews, plenty of people are thrown by the ordering/seating strategy at Gaucho. There's really nothing wrong with it unless your expectations are a traditional "server-runs-to-my-table-for-every-little-thing" restaurant, in which case, you should give Gaucho a try when you're feeling a little more independent. At Gaucho, you line up near the door and in front of a huge blackboard menu to order, then seat yourself in the dining area. When your meal is ready, they will bring the food out to you. The line can get very long and there can be some competition for seating during busy times--so I definitely suggest you make your first visit at an off-time to really enjoy the experience. Still, we have NEVER failed to get a table and enjoy our meal. The staff are super friendly, helpful, and they really do circulate and make sure you have what you need.

QaqpDzqBGezj-4WlbQe9NQ.text: I gave the place (19/25=76%) and will look at the place from 5 different perspectives.  1. Food quality (5/5): it is by far one of the best pieces of steak I have ever eaten. Juicy, tender, well cook and seasoned to perfection. Similar to the steak you will get in a good restaurant in Buenos Aires.   2. Place (3/5): it is small and there is not enough space to sit. You can always order your food to go BUT it will get cold by the time you get home. Not setup for a large family or group of friends.  3. Service (4/5): we waited for at least 40 min before the steak arrived and there was only 2 parties waiting. I was getting pretty hungry and antsy and the salad was not helping.   4. Price (3/5). It is overprice. The price you pay in a restaurant is not only for the food quality but also for the comfort and atmosphere, and the service. I did not mind the tag because the food was awesome.  5. Parking (4/5): the place is located in the strip district and has not private parking. Therefore, eating there requires a bit of planning, a bit of driving around, or a bit of walking.  In summary, a GREAT place to eat AWESOME meat if you don't mind the parking, the small place, and the big price tag.

jxQryyYLevA7m_2MrLrUHw.text: One the best restaurants this city has to offer. Made even better by the pleasant staff. Despite the crowds and he lines they are always super happy and helpful. The rosemary braised beef sandwhich is amazing

C8xMIDePLrtslXMUFE4Qkg.text: I've been here twice, gotten the flank steak sandwich both times. The first experience was honestly life-changing and I probably hyped the memory too much for the second go-around; the steak was a little chewier the latter time. Still, such a simple concept but the flavors are amazing. Their grilled veggies are solid for friends who don't eat meat but their admittedly won't be much else for them.

Lhf9zEb6Zr-u7ZCmSFffng.text: Phenomenal. Saturday mornings/afternoons will be tough getting seats, but food is delicious!

Y4LIe0Q43889uPMMKH3daQ.text: D-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s place! You must try the empanadas, both pork and beef, with the red pepper sauce! The steak was really good, we ate parrilla mixta it was really good, a little bit small to share, but good, this plate cost $25. You must try everything, cause everything looks good :)

ARXtw82GFEcWOJSGGzermQ.text: Delicious rosemary beef sandwich!  Grits are amazing too.  Most savory sweet potatoes I have ever eaten. Perfectly spiced. You must try this place.

GjwSZ_qb66j_3_hLBsjCZg.text: always the long line in this place but it worth the wait!Ribeye is awalys my favorite

OLxXHh6NFEeC2hqWG4n-Lw.text: This place deserves six stars.  The rib eye, flank steak, strip, or any of the vaca plates are my go to, with sides of grilled veggies and papas. Perfectly cooked every time and their homemade sauce selections are excellent.   Loved this place before the remodel and even more after.  Only bad menu item we've tried is the corn pudding.

indPB8YW7_3jKDj6sxfX1w.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh, if not thee favorite.  I always go with a carne con pan (filet mIgnon medium rare) and I add goat cheese.   Cooked perfect every time, it might be the best sandwich I've ever had.

WFIsNdnM8BX4crNlqqUi_Q.text: Would have been higher without the annoying host making speeches every minute starting at 9pm about people in line potentially being denied service even though they close at 10pm.

Nt_hUAsJqbOTZVJKKX7xlQ.text: The food is amazing. I wish that there was more seating so it is hard to come here with a party larger than 2-4.

DFp_OFQ7gLZbfvxJWHeGug.text: Arrived at Gaucho for lunch, just after noon, and the line was already out the door and around the corner. I had heard so much about this place but apparently missed the concept, because I was very skeptical as to if this place could really be worth it.  This is not a traditional sit-down style restaurant; you order your food at the counter upon walking in and are then able to choose a seat (they do have an outdoor courtyard area, but with the heat we chose to stay indoors) where you will be served/cleaned up after. Thus, while the line outside is a little inconvenient, it moves quickly and is very deceiving of how long you will have to wait.  I was still skeptical of this style of dining at first, but for lunch it was great!   I was very overwhelmed with menu, mostly because everything sounds so good and all the salads/sandwiches/sides are very reasonably priced (approx $10 for a sandwich; there are a few bigger ticket items on the menu such as their paella and vaca (meat) platter, but by the sounds of it they would make it worth your dollar). The staff is very friendly and helpful explaining the menu and making recommendations. I decided to take a healthy route and got the argintino salad, which is the same as the gaucho salad but with more (this took me a minute to understand upon first look at the menu). You can pick really any cut of meat to add, and the host helped me decide on the flank steak. I guess I wasn't really paying attention to what I was reading, because when it came out I was veryyyyyy pleasantly surprised that their were also potatoes on the salad--like an Argentinian play on a Pittsburgh salad with fries.  My guest got the bondiolo sandwich, and said it was the best sandwich he's ever had--even though I only got the smallest bite, I would probably agree.  I wish I had more time in Pittsburgh to go back and try some of the others!  We left absolutely stuffed, excited to finish our leftovers later.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bondolio sandwich
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Argentino salad with steak

fzSuKj3jcwn57lX4nvREGg.text: Amazing food but prepare to wait in line before you will be able to get your hands on some. The staff is super friendly and helpful. They will answer any questions you have about the menu.   As for the food, it is one of the best places in Pittsburgh. All the ingredients are fresh and well prepared for all the dishes they serve. I am a big fan of their "sammiches" (sandwiches). They are made on crunchy, grilled bread and whatever else comes with that specific sandwich. Their empanadas are dank - sooo good. They come straight out of the oven and I wish I had one to eat while writing this. They also have four dipping sauces throughout the restaurant which are so good you can eat them with a spoon. Their shortbread cookies are also scrumptious for dessert.   All in all, Gaucho is deserving of more than just 5 stars for its food and service.

YVS28VDQXWd50uEq0-Tr6Q.text: Amazing! I can't believe how good the food is at Gaucho. I've only eaten here once but will definitely be back many more times. The veggie sandwich is one of the best veggie sandwiches I've ever had. The concept was pretty basic but they managed to make it taste SO good. Also the grilled corn on the cob..perfect! At first I was a little skeptical, when the food came out the corn looked really bland. But oh my goodness did it taste so good! Just the right amount of butter and grill flavor. The only dish I feel that was a little bit lacking was the Provoletta appetizer. It was just a piece of toasted bread with melted cheese on top and a side of arugula with a tiny bit of dressing. I feel the dish could have been a little more creative. I liked the grilled cheese concept but the bread was really hard and thick and the cheese could stand to be a little more gooey. And the arugula needed more dressing and maybe some diced grilled peppers or little pieces of fresh mozzarella..anything to add more flavor. Not worth ordering the Provoletta, try another appetizer instead.  Highly recommend Gaucho! Can't wait to go back.

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled corn..YUM!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provoletta, not worth getting.

zCsZkJsAZ1HCBAhaXmxB1w.text: Wow! Now I understand all the five-star reviews. If you've ever taken a bite out of a steak sandwich, and the whole thing came out, you'll appreciate the sandwiches at Gauchos.   I had the Carne con Pan with the Ribeye steak, pictured in front. Hubby had the Braised Beef with horsey sauce, pictured in the back of my photo.   Hubby also went back for a second ear of corn; it was that good.   Definitely recommend. And I'll most certainly be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Front: Carne con Pan with the Ribeye Steak. Back: Braised Beef con Pan with horsey sauce.

s3PTNLU8lPot3mk57NRQ5Q.text: My sister suggested I come here during a work trip. I was absolutely not disappointed. Very cool funky atmosphere and awesome employees. It's a quick service type place but they run your food out and bus tables. I got a small ny strip steak for $$11 and it was fantastic. Good portion size, cooked perfectly and came with a great salad and toasted bread. Wish I lived closer!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. NY strip steak. Small portion

Q3LCpQMpgkw8-wgA9d5CHA.text: Amazing cuts of meat but their provoleta is a glorified open-faced grill cheese. Not how it's authenticly done.

JG2vV4TMPDcitHGPH5VWig.text: Ridiculously good.  Worth the wait, be patient.  Chorizo is so good.  As I the roasted cauliflower.  Of course the steak and chicken is perfect. The 4 sauces are so good it's hard not to sample while waiting.  The staff is very good and friendly.  They do keep the line slow, but only to ensure everyone gets a seat.  Worth every second.

a4Giz3fKuO_PCM62QN2O1A.text: Although the wait was about an hour or so, we really enjoyed our lunch at Gaucho. The lamp chops were fantastic, and the sauces were delicious. The chicken was a bit dry, but the fish and other meats, as well as the salad, were very flavorful. The silverware, plates, and sauces are all self serve, and another customer accidentally spilled a large cup of sauce all over my white shoes. :( Thankfully, a waiter very graciously tried to clean it off with a washcloth and some solution. So kind! Loved the staff. Would definitely come back to try some other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hyNzwxPbYlneeRFpNZbZSw.text: This is a cute little restaurant in the strip district.  I was greeted by the ambassador with the name Don. He was very nice and explained to me all the dishes including his recommendations. I had the new York strip and it was cooked to my request.  The restaurant was small so the max capacity was around 10 ppl the most.  Overall the food was good and the kitchen staffs were very friendly.  This place is very small so don't be shock if you have to stand by the sauce and condiments table in the middle of the restaurant.  This is so great about these little neighborhood restaurants b/c you feel like you're at home.  I'm not sure about others, but I'm not here for the 5 stars ambience.  It's all about the food taste for me!  I ate at places where I have to sit on the curb, and the police chased after the food vendor for non-established restaurant.  If I have to sit on the sidewalk for Gaucho then SIDEWALK IT IS!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The ambassador Don and George!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sauces for the food.  You can mix them to your own taste.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. New York Strip plate.

pciXm_J7cdB5J5I1X6Dlaw.text: In my 4 years in Pittsburgh as a college student searching for the best local places to eat, none have come even close to Gaucho in terms of quality, price, and overall experience.  The 5 star rating accurately reflects how good this place is, and I would say without a doubt that it's the single best restaurant in Pittsburgh.  As you walk in the door, you are greeted by the glorious smell of a fantastic assortment of meats sizzling over a wood-fired grill. I have so far tried three different dishes, and honestly cannot choose a favorite, as they're all that good.  This is one of the first places I've ever been to where I actually want to make an honest attempt to try everything on the menu.    Prices are very reasonable, especially considering the quality. A lot of love goes into these dishes, and the chefs take great care in both cooking, and plating them.  The food itself is a work of art, and tastes absolutely every bit as good as it looks.  Everything that I have tried so far has been very well thought out, with all the pieces of the dish working exquisitely well with one another, creating a tantalizing dance of flavors that envelope your taste buds and give them a big warm hug that says "I love you".  Service was spectacular as well.  All the way from the chef to the cashier who will bring your prepared food to wherever you happen to be sitting, the service was flawless.  Very friendly, very efficient, and shows a great deal of caring about what they do, and making sure you as a customer get the fullest possible enjoyment out of your experience.  I honestly don't think I'll ever go anywhere else ever again for meats. Gaucho is so far above it's competition that they seem like cheap fast food in comparison.  Give this place a try, I guarantee you'll find something there that you'll love.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jamon Serrano, a symphony for the taste buds.

Ub-cwW3iQxJfMmTecfR_Ig.text: Not from Pittsburgh but I have heard a lot of great things about the place so I knew I had to check it out. Turns out to be well worth the hype and the wait- A 15 minute wait to order during lunch.  I couldn't make up my mind on what I wanted so I got the beef empanadas and the spicy chorizo sausage with toast.  The empanadas were filled very well and crispy with a lot of flavor packed in. Definitely something I would be getting again and among the best empanadas I've ever had.  The spicy chorizo didn't feel too hot at first but it had great late kick to it and was exactly what I was hoping for.   They had a bunch of other things on the menu that I would like to try another time, so I can guarantee that I'll be back on my next trip into town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kSmFTekxf6Z8YnauXw-v2w.text: Food taste awesome and have a great atmosphere. However, I felt  like portion of their food was relatively small for it's price.

DZYPleXPp7st8Sf6ZK6i0Q.text: I'm not quite sure I've had a REAL steak sandwich prior to my encounter with the ribeye carne steak sandwich here. My word...what do I say?   First off, let me say their customer service is AMAZING! I called for takeout within the hour before closing and apparently they've turned folks away in the past but the gentleman on the other end of the line made an exception for me. I'm SO glad they did! I placed my order for the carne and grilled corn and was a advised it would be about 15 minutes.   I arrived on the scene with my gangsta lean....oh wait, that's a song. Sorry not sorry?  Anyway, I walked in and was smacked in the face with the aroma of garlic and roasted, grilled meat. If they made a perfume out of that, I might be tempted to buy. I looked around and noticed the homemade chimichurri sauces. There was a group of 5 in front of me but the sweet guy at the counter looked around them to greet me and offer his help. I explained I was there for pickup and he turned to grab my bag of yum. He proceeded to explain each of the chimichurri sauce offerings and neatly packed up a hefty sample of each one to go. Did I say the customer service here is AMAZING!?!? I headed back to the car so I could head towards home to conquer and devour...  Once home, I opened my bag and pulled out the little parcels, each of which wreaked of yummy garlic. First I opened the sandwich which was huge. It had onions which were perfectly grilled and sweet. The red peppers added a subtle sweetness which complimented the sandwich. The meat was tender and the taste screamed Brazilian steakhouse. (Yes, I said Brazilian...carry on). I mean it was perfect! Even the bread was fresh and perfect for this meal. Oh God, I'm sweating and salivating just thinking about it. Now on to the corn. It wasn't the frozen stuff or baby corn on the cobb. It was a whole cobb of corn roasted to perfection and wrapped to go. Yummy!  Just about every other Yelper thinks the same...this place is AWESOME and it's officially on my faves list.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Juicy deliciousness
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne....ribeye
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum

Fk13QqlP-ZouVi0_7vgW8A.text: Definite 5 stars!!!!  I would even give them 10 or 100 stars if I could. If you haven't been then stop reading this and go!!! I had the Rosemary Beef sandwich. Oh my goodness!!  Lots and lots of goodness!  The sandwich was huge!  My husband and I split it. The beef had to have been marinated and then slow cooked. I don't like to cook but I would definitely want the recipe to make is. The bun held up to all of the roast beef. That was good because there was a lot of roast beef.  My husband ordered the Pollo ala Parilla. It is a grilled chicken, but it's not what we as Americans think of as grilled chicken. It had the skin on which was crispy. You could taste the lemon and thyme. The chicken fell right off the bone. And you definitely want to lick all of that goodness off of your fingers.  We shared coleslaw. It was a big helping. You start eating it and you are thinking of how good the crunchiness is and the sweet/sour combination and just as you swallow you start to sense the after burn. It's a deep spiciness. It was a compliment to both of our meals.  There are a lot of other options on the menu and we want to try them all but we really want to take friends back to try the Pallella.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

acfomQ4VD1yh5Uo1DjzUmg.text: The food is excellent as other reviewers have mentioned, but the experience isn't worth it for me. I've tried them twice and I wasn't satisfied with either visit, but my first experience was truly unique.  We went right before close on our first visit, so we weren't surprised that we had to wait in line. But I was surprised when they gave me a sign to hold and asked me to turn away any further customers in return for a free bread pudding. We had a few kids in our group and I didn't want to be argumentative, so I agreed to do it.  Most people left after an awkward interaction, but there was a group of douchebags who were too privileged for the rules to apply to them. I'm not gonna argue with douchebags for bread pudding, so I let the restaurant deal with them. Unfortunately, the restaurant let them stay, and we had to spend the rest of our time in line hearing them use profanity around our kids. It got even more awkward when more people showed up, and the restaurant let them stay too. I recommend just buying the bread pudding and saving yourself the hassle.  I went back today for a takeout order, and luckily was not tasked with anything other than waiting. The wait wasn't unreasonably long, but I could see what looked like my food sitting under the heat lamps as the employees in the kitchen appeared confused, moving items from one bag to another, looking at the receipts, then switching bags again. Finally, one employee who looked like he was doing everything came over and repackaged my order, which was indeed the food that had been sitting under the heat lamps.  On a positive note, the employees we spoke to were very nice. Also, that one employee was very good.

nQTDhpRcxrS0rKgiJxuHiA.text: Coming from our road trip from Chicago my fiance and I decided to stop by Pittsburgh and check out the city.   Arriving during lunch hours , I yelped for some restaurants and this came up.  I never had Argentinian food before, so what a great way to have it, plus I couldn't say no based on the  pictures and reviews I read.   We arrived at the restaurant right when it opened so we were greeted by a very friendly worker. The menu is written on a huge chalkboard on your right. Since it was my first time here, a helpful server was nice enough to take us through the menu and also telling me some of his favorites. The way it works is that you order from the menu, then you pay and then they bring the food to you. I ordered their el guacho salad with flank steak and a side of sweet chorizo. The fiance got the chicken and papas.   After you pay, you grab your untensils and your chimi sauces. We didn't wait long at all. The meat was delicious, season perfectly  well, juicy and tender. I asked for my flank steak to be cooked well done and I was even surprised that my meat was still juicy and not chewy at all. I got that small salad which was packed with lots of greens, corn, red radish, asparagus and few slices of avocado. The sweet chorizo was also juicy and perfect. I tried my finance chicken which was moist and season well. If you want to add more flavors you can dip your meat in their chimis.   I enjoyed my meal and I would highly recommend Guacho. I would advise to prepare yourself by looking at their menu before walking in and know what to order because the lines can get long fast. Other than that I give it a 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jkHuLR0J_ECwv2fd-l1tzQ.text: You can only log into Yelp so many times and see Gaucho listed on the main page as a "Best Restaurant" with a zillion 5 stars reviews before you start to feel like you might be missing out. I get it Yelp, I need to go to Gaucho. So to Gaucho I went.  The place is tiny with limited seating, but we went around 6:30 on a week night, and it was perfect...still quite a few customers, but not overwhelmingly busy at all. I ordered the pulled chicken sandwich and my husband got the rosemary braised beef -- it was described on the menu simply as "f**kin fantastic", which we got a kick out of. Then we split the veggie empanada, grilled corn, and potatoes as sides.  So, let's talk about this food. In this case I can only channel Janice from "Friends" and say OH. MY. GOD.  Have you ever been legitimately sad when your meal is over and all of your food is gone and wished that it was socially appropriate to order a second dinner? That is how I felt about my meal at Gaucho. The pulled chicken sandwich had tender, melt-in-your-mouth chicken, sweet caramelized onions, crunchy, well-seasoned potatoes, and meaty mushrooms, all mixed with their KILLER garlic ajo sauce and served on bread that was just the right balance of chewy and crispy. I didn't know it was possible for so many textures and flavors to be combined so perfectly into one delicious bite, but Gaucho managed to do it. As for the sides, the hands down favorite were the potatoes. Oh my, those potatoes were bursting with flavor, super crunchy on the outside but soft on the inside, and pretty much the best potato I have ever eaten. The grilled corn was also well done -- perfectly cooked and was especially yummy when smothered in one of their 4 sauces. And lastly, the veggie empanada, though the least favorite thing we'd ordered, was still damn tasty too. It was packed with tons of flavor, but it was little dry, so I'd recommend taking that for a dip in one of the sauces as well.  I asked my husband how his rosemary braised beef was, and he was shoveling it in his mouth so fast that all he could do was point to the menu board description where it says "f**kin fantastic."  Well said. When he finally could talk, the only thing he uttered was, "I'm having a love affair with this sandwich."  Ordinarily I might be worried, but hell, I'd understand if he leaves me for Gaucho.  Not only was the food out of this world, but the service and atmosphere were too. The guy running the counter (I assume he was the manager) was super friendly and clearly has a passion for the business and the food. He eagerly talked us through the menu, explained the different sauces to us, and even later checked in while we were eating to see what we thought of the food. And I love that we could see back behind the counter into the kitchen, where several bearded men were happily drinking their Yuenglings and grilling up our food. It felt like I was having a chill meal in someone's hip-but-cozy house instead of a restaurant.  It is maybe a touch on the pricey side, but so well worth it for the quality of the food. In fact, I'm pretty sure that I'd be willing to promise my first born in exchange for a gallon of their garlic ajo sauce. Btw -- a glorious bonus was that I was still able to taste the flavor of that sauce in my mouth for the rest of the night. I was really sad when it was time to brush my teeth before bed. Yep, it's good stuff.  Moral of the story: Go go go go go go go go go!

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted seasoned papas. Best potatoes I&#39;ve ever had!

5xzsGEZSv2b6sKj9zw4L8g.text: I went here a few weeks ago, and had a great time. The wait was about 30 minutes, and the line went out of the door, so if you can't stand for long periods, then maybe Gaucho Parrilla isn't for you. However, they did take our order while we waited. So, by the time we sat down, it was only a few more minutes before our food arrived. It was delicious, and worth the wait.

5vIf7A0qLFQ4IyJGvQFIeQ.text: Exceptional food!  Waited in line outside in freezing weather and don't regret it for one minute.

0f4ua5S0A19ecEQo1o5fiw.text: I can't say enough wonderful things about this place. The food was absolutely delicious!!. The only 'downside' was not knowing beforehand that it was BYOB. Other than that, perfection. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

6TfPlamnF-sanY8xY2lk5g.text: On the pricier side. If you aren't in the mood for meat you'll have trouble here. I cane here for my roommates birthday and had the Provoletta and two empanadas. Everything tasted good but I will probably not be back.

CI6d0QOG7LHlEAM54muEUg.text: Exceeded my expectations!  Had the Ribeye medium rare and it was excellent.  The beef and pork empanadas were also very good, I especially liked the pork.  We also had the mushrooms, spaghetti squash and sweet potatoes as sides all of which were nicely done.    The sauces are excellent as well.  I really like the red version.     Preserved the gaucho salad and it wasn't much more than the salad that already came with the steak.  It was just a couple extra beets and some avocado.  If you already have a house salad with your meal I would do other sides over this.    Great place.  Be prepared for a wait.

RGJVRAf7CFv7h1MALtCN0g.text: The food was good, but waiting in line for over an hour to be seated really ruined my experience. A little on the pricy side too, lunch for two was roughly $45. I had a steak sandwich, a side and she had the flank steak. Would I try them again? Yes, but definitely not during lunch hours on the weekend.   If you get a sandwich, you should know it basically arrives on an entire loaf of bread. Plenty for two people.

t5JUge9yRZ9Wnh17HA3LJQ.text: It's not Argentina but this place is close enough. It's a fast casual place so you order when you walk in and they call you by name when your order is up. Unfortunately they don't have a liquor license (which we didn't know until we got there) but it's BYOB with no corkage fee. All the utensils/plates are also self serve and located right after the order counter. Reynaldo have 4 sauces available, classic chimichurri, garlic, smokey pepper and onion.  We ordered the carne and rosemary beef sandwiches, beef empanada, red potatoes and of course the alfajores. The beef empanada was ok and could go without it.  Everything else were amazing though. Both sandwiches were great but I especially loved the carne. You get a choice of the cut of beef and how you want it cooked (just like any great steak place!). The sandwich had a great amount of nicely charred and perfectly cooked meat in it. The flavor is already great but I love garlic so I had to add some of their garlic sauce. Another amazing garlic surprise are the grilled garlic gloves that came with the potatoes. You can't go wrong with finishing up your amazing meal with some alfajores. They are very delicate though so they don't travel well.  Definitely a great place for meat, carb and garlic lovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The amazing sauce choice by the plate &amp; utensil shelf

Obivl_mCTNCaog8ihGDBwA.text: Amazing as always! In addition to great food, we brought along a bottle of wine (byob). The line to order and get seated can be a bit intimidating but it is well worth the wait!

eaHUcX5PMl8xmwtZ-HvvmQ.text: Gaucho is an amazing Argentina restaurant. If you want good steak this is where you should go. They also have amazing empanadas. They're different everyday and I've yet to have one that isn't amazing. Try them with all of gaucho's different sauces.

fHlwRjDrlQPaHMBGyFGP_w.text: I've always heard about people talking about gaucho, but never actually tried it until my third year in college. Each time I came I knew exactly what to expect, and gaucho never fails to deliver. The only downside is that the wait can be pretty long during primary dinner hours (7:00 pm and after), so if you go around 6:30 or earlier the wait time can be significantly reduced.   The main thing that I typically order is the Carne De Vaca, which is a meat platter consisting of a cut of meat of your choice (sirloin, flank, etc.), a side of salad, and bread. A few times, I have gotten two cuts of meat to split with my friend, one order of a large and another order of the small. This allows us to get a portion of meat in between a large and a small, and two cuts to try.   I have also gotten the Carne, which is a sandwich based on a meat of your choice. This has really good peppers that complement the meat well, but to me I personally prefer the platters because they are more filing and have more meat overall.  The last time I went, I shared the Asado plate with one other person, which gives you all five cuts of meat (25 oz total). It was a lot of meat and more pricey, but also very tasty and filling. In my opinion, though some cuts were more tender than others, I didn't think the difference was big enough for me to change my typical order of one of the cheaper meats in the platter.  Overall a great experience and a must try for all those who visit or live in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2CufhnTGk2p6dwtMeAnVsA.text: Amazing food and well worth the wait. We're from Mississippi but visit Pgh every year for a week. No matter what we have planned, this place is a must!

N8mxzrihv9TYD19L_sR00Q.text: This place is amazing! Don't be discouraged if there's a line outside because it's worth the wait. I ordered the flank steak and it was the most tender and flavorful meat I had and the bread was so crispy. I will definitely be coming back to this place. Don't forget to bring your bottle of wine!

DafgJd9_a_luWZ4ZxNs6Bw.text: Great restaurant. Argentinian steak house. First time trying an Argentinian steak house. Got the ribeye. Was cooked well. Came with salad and a piece of toast. Chimicurri was a nice touch. There are different chimicurri flavors you can try like smoked pepper and garlic. Service was good and restaurant had a nice vibe. Would visit again and try something new.
