9SiRP1njuvdHV3-DN1P5lg.text: Have you tried this place yet? If not what are you waiting for? I eat out often and maybe a bit to often if you ask some of my friends. But when I suggest we visit Gaucho everyone jumps to the opportunity.   If you like meat stop by and give this place a try you WILL NOT be disappointed........

S1dcRvtCAwQ2Ex3nGrN0xg.text: Had only 1 day in Pittsburgh and ate here for dinner. Steak was excellent, salad was perfect, but bread was super burnt. My meal was $24. Line took an hour at 7:30. Staff was nice. We ate outside and it was cute but loud from nearby club. BYOB is an awesome thing that I wish I had been prepared for... I'll have to go back someday with a bottle of Malbec.

Bm3UwJMkLBsSZu9fd8XUYw.text: This is our new favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. Despite the 45 minute wait to get a table, it is well worth the wait. The food came out quickly and it was done to perfection. I got the spicy chorizo sandwich which was incredible and my wife got the steak which was done to her liking.  Highly recommend but it is a first come and first serve. Well worth the wait

or9JdQemGTayaZ4ZChexIw.text: Great place and excellent food. Quality of the meat is top notch and the side dishes are awesome. No wonder its so busy all the time.  I will go back again very soon.

Ry4Z-pzY8KEi5nvYVddVhw.text: This place is amazing...I definitely recommend. We got Ribeye, chicken, and mussels, each was better than the other.

KCbN1oTuxauc88Js22herg.text: What an amazing dinner. I had the Pallida Mixta and Veggie Plate. Everything was cooked to perfection. The staff is incredibly pleasant and has a great attitude. Usually when a place is this busy someone doesn't have a smile on their face or you can tell that they don't enjoy their work. Well worth the wait in line that you will have to eat here.

k_f15IVks1mCroN9r8Ogvw.text: Great choice of meats and great flavors.   Paella needs more flavor but it was good. Wait times are pretty long but it's a really popular place. Even going for really late lunch times (3-4pm), it was somehow still busy.   Ambiance is great. Definitely a must-go place if you're visiting Pittsburgh.

i6e33VBCPq5RtD2HZPNFqw.text: When I came here, I got the corn on the cob and the Pescado special, which was an Arctic char. The Arctic char was incredible, one of the best pieces of fish I've had. Corn was excellent too! It's BYOB, so if you're looking for a drink, be sure to remember to bring your own. I can't say enough good things about the food quality and service. I'll definitely be back.

bA0eUaExp7kBN_nYOaTa7A.text: Cool experience, food was cooked and marinated so well. Loved the sauces - even purchase some To go. Would recommend & come back. Good prices!

rZsos8O8eGjGZv58jr72eg.text: Though I am not a steak person, I have been here on a few occasions and it has not disappointed! We are well aware that there will always be a line of customers streaming out of the front door, rain or shine, hot or cold. The restaurant does not take reservations and they are a BYOB establishment which adds to their appeal.   When entering the building, the menu is handwritten on a chalkboard wall. They have a variety of items ranging from salads, small plates, and sides, to sandwiches, exclusive plates, and specialty items such as paella. In addition they have a few pick up dessert items that they display nicely in glass containers as well as a few other options to have with a cup of coffee.  Once deciding on the order, you walk up to a counter where an employee takes your drink menu. We brought wine and some bottled beer and she kindly uncorked the wine (no fee) and provided an ice bucket for the beer, offering for the wine as well. She gave us glasses of water to go along with our select beverages. They do have a few drink items one being Red Ribbon, an old fashioned bottled soda found in a variety of flavors. Next is the order and checkout station, and since the restaurant was packed, we spent time chatting with the employee until our table was ready. She took our order, we paid, and she sent us on our way to our table. I ordered the deconstructed pollo sandwich with toast with a side of roasted spaghetti squash. The chicken came with pickled red onions, lettuce, and mushrooms. The deconstructed version appeared smaller in size than what you would receive on the sandwich (well duh, no bread but still), but with the side of squash and toast, it was enough. They offer four different types of sauces to put with your meal and they are all rather tasty! In the past, I have had the pulled pork sandwich and I think that nudged out the chicken by a hair. It was delicious!   This will be a place we will go occasionally. It is a fun restaurant to go to for an evening with a group of friends or couples and to not expect a rushed dining experience. The prices are so reasonable for a steak establishment, they allow you to bring your own beverages, and the food is fresh and made with care!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spaghetti Squash and Deconstructed Pollo

wiR_z6A4iX1R_4lDzu7Z7A.text: Worth the Wait! Waited in line for about 45 minutes in the sun and goodness every second we had to wait was worth it. They have a sign on the entrance explaining that space is limited so patience is key.   I had the steak burger (cooked medium rare) with grilled onions and bleu cheese. Super flavorful and perfectly cooked. The sandwich was the perfect amount of food.  If you have the time to wait in line I would certainly recommend checking out Gaucho the next time you are in Pittsburgh!

7HPQjVaf-RBi48SlRpUyZg.text: Always a line at this little establishment but worth the wait! The menu is extensive and does take 1 or 2 but really maybe 10 read through to figure out your final decision! :) empanadas- chicken was the best and veggie came in a close second.  The meats were well cooked - got chicken and steak and chorizo.  Season was strong but tasty!  What I absolutely will order again without a doubt is the flan!!! That was delicious! Service is very friendly!  Only thing I would prefer is traditional style table service rather than counter service!

17KF4DFSuMMap5FxqYH0_A.text: Great find while visiting Pittsburgh.   We arrived on a Wednesday evening just after 8pm. We were told they were closed because the line was already too long to close at 9pm.   I explained that I have specific dietary restrictions  that make it difficult to eat out and if I could I place a to go order and they obliged. We got our food by 8:30 and picnicked across the street.   The food was delicious! I was thankful they were accommodating.

-7RZqTnM6xSCgtBZGji8dQ.text: This place is a meat lovers heaven! I enjoyed my food and encourage everyone to visit this place when in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The corn was grilled to perfection!  I ordered the platter that 5 different meats, corn, and grilled vegetables.

G7xoGM6AZtMbldYQRjGEuA.text: My boyfriend and I had been trying to go to Gaucho for the longest time, but the line was always out the door and down the side of the building. But recently, we found out why. We went on a Saturday around 4:30 or so. There was a wait but it was completely reasonable, I think we waited 20 minutes tops. The staff was communicative to the crowd, stating they were waiting for more tables to open up before they seated other customers.   We got up to order our food and I ordered the chicken sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the pulled pork. We also got some empanadas to try. We sat at a table and decided to try out some of the sauces they had before our food came. The red pepper sauce is to die for, we actually took some home because we liked it so much. When our food came, we couldn't eat it fast enough. I added avocado to the chicken sandwich and it went perfectly with everything on the sandwich. The portions were huge and we were both full after each eating a half of a sandwich. As for the empandas, they were fantastic and a must have. I tried the veggie one which had goat cheese in it. The goat cheese was a nice addition and added freshness  I highly recommend a visit to Gaucho, I will be returning soon!!!

ncxGcYTpJxqkeOjCXg08VA.text: Certainly lives up to its reputation. Let me answer some questions: there is a wait as you probably already know... BUT the line honestly goes fast. A tip I used was also you could check the general time on google for the time you plan to go. The place is BYOB, dont miss out on that opportunity!  If its your first time, I suggest getting the platter with all the different meats so you can decide on your favorite. The chorizo and asado platter are so juicy and flavorful! When we went they kept raving about the toast.. but it was not good at all so I do not recommend that. YOU MUST also try all the sauces regardless! Probably note the best place for large groups because of the table setting. Highly recommend this place and I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vgXrOVIQAMDleW6qaudDDw.text: Food is really great once you order it comes fast but the line takes awhile and we had to wait outside for a considerable amount of time and it was really cold. They don't take reservations so keep that in mind. Overall, lots of choices and you can get 4 different complementary sauces, my favorite is the yummy one! Reasonably priced. Good place to go with a group. It's BYOB, don't forget! Good portion sizes as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flank stake small plate
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork tenderloin, chicken, and flank stake
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pulled pork sandwich

e6JofepzqkhpPLC8r9eSoQ.text: I really wanted to love this place. But I think I'm spoiled by the good food in the other places I've spent a lot of time. We walked the 7ish blocks in frigid weather and waited for about half an hour until we finally ordered the ribeye and lamb. The lamb was fine though a little cold by the time it got to our table. However, the (pricey, mind you) ribeye was a disappointment. It was so lean that we had to ask the server if the kitchen gave us the right cut. He wasn't sure she'd roll it back, only to come back to our table and say "oh it is ribeye, you can see a little bit of marbling there...but could have fooled me." *laugh* I didn't know what was funny about expecting (and paying for) ribeye and getting something that looked and tasted like sirloin, but okay... On a positive note, the sauces are delicious! The carmelized onion one was our fave. Not sure I'd return if I'm ever back in Pittsburgh. P.S. I post photos on instagram.com/letseatwit...

e-b_5jCg3PQHhpioX_nMWA.text: Gaucho offers almost *every* kind of meat, and it's my favorite spot in town for a cheap but delicious sandwich.  If you're unlucky you might have to wait for a bit (sometimes the line is ~30 people), but it's totally worth it and hopefully it's not raining outside. You order at the counter, and then wait for the order at your table.  I typically get the sandwiches like bondola or braised beef with a bunch of sauces. Salads are tasty and pretty big (this is about the small salad).

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised beef

A_Q0Xj1ODNuNBL2ytjRFXw.text: I've now been to Gaucho twice and I'm pretty sure I'll be back again. There is plenty of street parking(if you like to parallel park), and also a few public lots over on Smallman you can park in and walk over if you suck at parking like me!   Both times I've been there has been right around lunch time on a weekday and I have never waited more than 5 minutes to get to the counter. Everyone that works at Gaucho Parrilla is very friendly and very helpful. I appreciate the warmness and it's only surpassed by how good the food is. Every single dish that I've tried there has been fantastic. The meats are so flavorful and tender, the vegetables are grilled and seasoned to perfection, the dessert shortbread cookies are some of the best I've ever had. The chimichurri sauces that they offer are a great accompaniment to all these wonderful entrees.   It definitely isn't a cheap place to eat, but the food and the quality of the ingredients are definitely worth the price.   The best tip I would give for eating here is to pay attention to the menu board when you walk in, and maybe snap a picture on your phone for reference when you get to the register. If you don't remember what you want it's kind of a hassle to have to walk back over to check the board.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious Meal!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich and Maiz
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye Steak

cgSdSyuGnEdnllTt8OBgFg.text: I've only been able to go to Gaucho three times I think.  It's a tough place to get in because everyone wants to eat there.  The food is just so magical. It really is. I absolutely love the chicken sandwich and the roasted corn on the cob.  If I could eat here on a daily basis believe you me I certainly would.

fOuQIS-Tlx_Jz4Tu_K8Row.text: This place rocks, yes you have to wait in line but trust me goes quick and it is worth it!

-aHblvIHeSpTsm2zO4XzTg.text: As I am sure is the case for a lot of people, Gaucho was highly touted by many of my friends. I went on a Tuesday night at 7pm and had to wait for about 20 minutes. Thankfully the line didn't quite snake out of the door, and I was able to stay inside in the warmth.  The aroma of the wood fired grill and the somewhat rustic look of the interior combine to provide an inviting atmosphere. I liked the fact that part of the kitchen, namely the grill, is exposed to show a glimpse of the inner workings of the restaurant.   My party of 4 ordered the paella and the asado platter. The plate of meat went quickly, but we struggled through the paella. The steak was good, but my favorite part of the meal may have been the sauces; each of the four sauces are delicious and masterfully compliment the steak. One reviewer recommended ordering the paella as a group side dish, which I definitely agree with. Additionally, Gaucho is BYOB; I did not know this but, fortuitously, other members of my party did.  Overall, I felt that Gaucho was inviting, fairly priced, and had good food. I won't fault them for the wait time, as it isn't their fault that they're a hugely successful small restaurant. I will, however, admit that friends' prior praises of Gaucho placed lofty expectations in my head. While I felt Gaucho was good and maybe even worth another stop, I did not feel that it was exceptional. So, in a review of my expectations, Gaucho gets 4/5.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2J90v1Ns-Uj3oaJLFivcxA.text: My husband and I went here while I was on the keto diet. Lots of low carb options! He ordered the sandwich and said it was the best he ever had. I ordered the steak and that was good, but next time I will be sure to try the sandwich.  I love how they leave the sauces out so you can refill as much as you want. (Along with the water)   We can't wait to return !

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VQ4m5QOgS6II30mEXhNBfw.text: I have been hating to try this place for a very long time, had tried it about 6 months ago and had stood in line for about 45 minutes and line was not moving and we had a concert to go to so we had to leave so this time we made sure to get there well ahead of are plans for the evening. We only had to stand in line about 40 minutes and was in.  Just so you know you will have to wait anywhere from 30minutes to an hour to get in. You order you food at the counter and pay and then they will seat you. They have four different sauces for your meats all of them are delicious.  We started out with Oui Oui Chicken (2 legs and 2 thighs) My husband said it is the BEST chicken he has ever had! We also had 2 pieces of Empanadas one beef and one chicken, they were so delicious I could have just made a meal out of them! Then we both had Carne Sandwiches you pick your choice of steak and it also has peppers and caramelized onions, it was very good but it is very hard to eat as a sandwich because the bread it so big. I had to eat it as a open face sandwich, the bread is very good and fresh but just to big for a sandwich. They are closed on Sunday and Mondays, the restaurant is very clean and staff works very hard and very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside restaurant
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Sandwiches
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas and Oui Oui Chicken

D4cCA4rbgIfwX1jNjOlEwQ.text: One of the best restaurants in town as can be seen by the constant lines wrapped around the building. The food is a 10/10! The flavors and variety are out of this world. It was recommended to us to try a little bit of everything which is exactly what we did: empanadas, tostado, corn, carne, mushrooms, and all the sauces! Can't wait to return for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4iEoeywb51wtI4cfBrFPYQ.text: I have been to Gaucho's a few times now and it has been a consistently great experience each time! Great place to take people visiting out of town, right in the Strip District, very close to downtown. They don't take reservations and demand is high, so there are often lines and wait of upwards of 30 minutes on the weekends especially.  So, is the wait worth it? I'd say yes, although definitely recommend going on a weekday if you can. Their steak is flavorful and reasonably priced and served with bread and a salad. They have a variety of dipping sauces of which I always take back all four to the table even though I definitely have a favorite (I just always forget which one it is).   Their empanadas are amazing, especially the beef ones although the chicken ones are pretty good, too (not a fan of the vegetarian cheese ones I once tried) - the options rotate frequently, so there's always a new filling to try!   I've heard the dessert there is good as well, but have not had the chance to try yet :)

3BdJC6cqBoaiRgaWZ0siEg.text: It does not get any better for me than a piece of flavorful meat. I had the Carne with Hanger and Flank. My taste buds aren't that sophisticated so I can't tell you what the taste differences are though one was a little more chewy than the other. However that aside my mouth was singing with each bite of the sandwich. I also had to try all of the sauces available. My favorite was the Chimi which had a nice kick. The staff were incredibly friendly and I sat outside in the sun. Credit cards and oh hey diet rootbeer is available too!

lHUpHJH89FrwI1eJjPGsAA.text: I highly recommend Gaucho! All of their selections are very high quality, and it's a reasonable price. I have tried the Rosemary beef and the veggies, and they were both great!

qKMvavZ4_ZqLwelVBz96XQ.text: This place is wonderful. I was fortunate enough to get in during the lunch rush and ordered

C4igmJHxo4dc1pG8d4alMA.text: Believe the hype. Totally authentic vibe. Incredible smokey, grilled flavors. Delicious sauces and seasonings. This is a meat-lovers paradise.

kUSzaBFNxW9Nmas-Ww-O9A.text: Well, I suppose I'm going to be the voice of dissent here, but I was Not Impressed with this place. Being of partial Latin American descent (Guatemalan, but Mom spent part of her childhood in Buenos Aires), I am no stranger to grilled meats in this style, to chimichurri, to elotes- this is the food of the summers of my childhood. However, that food my father would so lovingly slave over the grill preparing for us differed from what I experienced at Gaucho in two ways: it was cooked properly, and even more importantly, IT WAS SEASONED. My daughter and I hit up Gaucho on a Thursday afternoon for lunch. I had heard great things, and it smelled wonderful, so we were super excited. On a recommendation from a friend, we ordered the Matambre (flank steak), Gaucho Papas (roasted potatoes), and the Gaucho Salad. With a drink and tip this came to about $25. NOT a cheap lunch, but you pay for good food, right? The wait for the food was long, but we thought it'd be worth it, and their patio is really very pleasant. Oh- and we loaded up on condiments, including chimichurri (an herb/garlic vinaigrette that is essential to any Latin steak meal) and some cebolla (a similar combo but with caramelized onions instead of herbs). So, the food finally came and upon the first glance I noticed that the flank steak was cut VERY sloppily, with connective tissue visible throughout. Secondly, the inside of the cuts were so rare that they were practically blue and still mooing. Listen, I yell at people who order even MEDIUM done steak. This was beyond rare. So rare and connective-y that most of it was hard to chew. And to add insult to injury, it lacked any seasoning. Nothing. So, I tried the chimi and the cebolla. Equally bland. I mean, like, no damned seasoning at all. I never reach for a salt shaker, but boy, I was looking for one to attempt to make these expensive strips of tough tartare edible. It was shocking how tasteless everything was, but I especially was floored about the chimichurri. Chimi should be a veritable palate explosion of fresh parsley, garlic, vinegar and citrus. This was not... that. Absolutely awful. The potatoes were seasoned, and hot. We liked those. The salad was not a $7 salad. Unseasoned, with just a few drops of balsamic vinegar, and some very brown and sad avocado slices. Also bad. Perhaps we didn't order the right things, perhaps it was an off day, but as a Latina, I am absolutely astonished at the widespread love this place gets. Pittsburgh seems to never get Latin American food right (with an exception for the tacos at Las Palmas), and it is a damned shame that a place as mediocre (or even poor) as Gaucho has people jumping for joy. If only you folks knew how good this food really can be. I wish I could have you all over for the real deal.

iYuNj-OL_1aOITOT1IkwtA.text: I had been to Gaucho a few times before they remodeled.  The food was always excellent, but there was barely any room to sit.  Last night (Saturday) was my first time back at Gaucho since the remodel.  The good news is that the food is still amazing and the prices are still the same.  Bad news is that the staff did not grow enough along with the renovation, so the service was ridiculously slow and the line to even get in the restaurant was extremely long.  My boyfriend and I waited about an hour to even get in the door, about 30 minutes in line inside the restaurant, and about 30 minutes after we ordered before we actually got our food.  Let me re-emphasize that the food was absolutely delicious, but I do not recommend going there on a weekend evening.

VLmST8SupVtPl9dsSKjc8Q.text: I went to Gaucho with 2 friends who were visiting from out of town, one of them has a father from Argentina.  As a vegetarian, I was prepared to just vicariously enjoy her enjoyment as I sat and had a minimal meal.  Not so!  I was very pleasantly surprised that this very meat-heavy restaurant also has plenty of vegetarian options that are extremely delicious!  It also has a fun vibe.  Just thinking about what I had there (one of every vegetarian side) makes me want to head back there soon.

LG2013lSO671RJdR4ZcK7Q.text: 5 stars, I'd give it 6 if I could. I had the pork and tried it with all of the amazing sauces available. The pork was cooked perfectly with tremendous flavor. The texture was something that could be imitated, but not mirrored. I will be back to this restaurant as soon as possible.

PUDx-uyQqsbXt25pLplQwA.text: This my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. I'm so sad that i didn't know it the time I moved here

aVyhFk__lJCrdx8Cw9Dudw.text: Gaucho doesn't look like much when you walk by, but dont be fooled.  This place is all about its wood fired grill and the aroma of burnt wood and food fills the air around the 16th Street Bridge. Currently, they are a small place that does better for take out. They do vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free and tons of meat selection for we carnivores. Put this place on you list to check out but dont expect to have a seat. Very limited seating - 6 high tops chairs. They bought the neighboring building and will have much more seating by the end of the summer though. Definitely looking forward to seeing what Gaucho has to offer in the future...obsessed already with their wood fired cuisine.

2Y-jNhJ2pdLkdZTvcl3XKQ.text: Upon reading the other reviews, we headed straight here. "No way could a place be this good!" we said. Our minds are blown. This place is fantastic. When in doubt, stick to simple meat dishes which is what they do best (we had carne sandwich with filet mignon, empanadas and mushroom appetizer). Simplicity and beauty. This place is a must.

9iLT_ZkpSpE0BZauFoySag.text: Sooooooo delicious whether you like meat or veggies. I've been in Pittsburgh a couple of times for business, and I try to make a stop here since I found out about this place thru yelp reviews last year.  Amazing sandwich combinations and quality meats. The last time I was there I got the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich, and it was absolutely delicious. Managed to finish the hefty sandwich because how tasty it was. Side veggies drizzled in balsamic vinegar was really good too. Definitely stop by this place if you're in town. Staff is super friendly too. I really didn't think Pittsburgh was such a culinary city.

hJlspkmjmySp5BsYi8Xl-w.text: Words cannot explain how much I love this place. The food is freaking delicious, and the service outstanding. They serve Argentinian wood fired meats, and man do they do it well. My favorite thing to get is Bife de Gaucho served medium rare. The steak is so juicy, flavorful, and tender. Drooling thinking about it. I have also tried the gaucho papas, empanadas, and carne. All delicious! They serve freshly made chimichurri and sauces that are served as sides. This is a must try restaurant, you won't be disappointed.

Dn9xOuvVsG42OSaBsR3vFw.text: Best place in pittsburgh.  Tons of variety. Went here when it first opened and didn't have the expansion it has now. With the extra room this place will be an extremely popular place to get food. The steak, chorizo, lamb are all outstanding. Sandwiches are equally as amazing and make a great lunch option. If one can eat here, it is optimal, but I have taken out from here quite a bit and the quality is still excellent. Hours are limited during weekdays to 7 pm so get there early.

SRuUHU5o6EHyse4pCYY7fw.text: Incredible food, a bit pricey too. For such a well reputed place I wanted to give it my all and got the $50 steak sampler which included every beef cut they serve. Each one was made to perfection medium rare. The seasonings of cilantro, onions and garlic was excellent. I don't recall the name of their one vinegar less sauce but that was to die for. The ribeye me was my favorite and if I go back I will get a sandwich of that now that I had the pleasure of trying all through the sampler. Despite the popularity and long line it moved surprisingly quickly. The place draws both locals and  Tourists alike. A must when visiting Pittsburgh.

T5UqpSj7LmJnYQ5Vls2AoQ.text: Had a really big meal with friend. Food were tasty and service was good. You have to go there early especially on Saturday since there would be a lot of people and a long waiting line for you.

K6LqYWVag4Ysb-1PISb2lA.text: 4.5 stars.  Flat out incredible.  I drove out of my way about 45 minutes to find a good place for lunch in Pittsburg and yelp hooked me up big time with this place.    Very small place that smells like heaven should smell like...beautiful food fired beef.  The ribeye platter was awesome and they season everything so perfectly.  Nothing here is lacking flavor.  The only reason why I knocked it down to 4.5 was the cooking temp of the ribeye.  I don't think they cook temp to order (I didn't ask, however) and everything seems to be cooked to med well.  If it was cooked to med rare I probably would have asked to sleep on the roof indefinitely.   The grilled corn was probably the best corn I've ever had and the potatoes were phenomenal - big seasoning there too.  My wife ordered the turkey sandwich and it really was special too.  Everything here is just very high quality and well prepared.    Let me say - the best thing possibly about this place are the 4 sauces they have sitting out that you can put on anything.  They are just dynamite.  We tried all the sauces on just about everything.  It really put the meal over the top.     If you are looking for lunch in the area and you go elsewhere you are cheating yourself.

4BuEZEfdGQMY3cGxdUuWHw.text: Great food. Be prepared to wait--in a line

Tf6-3RIM4JwJ6HQUJxsc4g.text: Absolutely love this place.  I've been going for a year or so now, and every time the food is fantastic.  The steak sandwiches are their main gig, but I highly recommend the braised beef sandwich as well.  The sides are delicious and the outdoor seating is perfect.  Great job, guys!

4uTMcdZB5UMGtaIVc7vrZg.text: Outstanding meat. I've been there twice, and I ordered the small flank steak plate both times. I wish I could say I'm going to branch out in the future, but it's so flavorful that I can't make that promise. The small portion is definitely enough for dinner if you have a moderate appetite. To round out the meal, order an appetizer. I've had the jamon plate with goat cheese (delicious), the roasted corn (delicious), and the fungos. The mushroom portion was a bit scant for 5$, but they tasted great in combination with the meat.  I definitely recommend stocking up on sauces while you wait for your food - the ajo is my favorite. Beware that there is essentially no/very little seating at the restaurant. If you can snag a table outside that's great, otherwise there is just a little counter space inside.  My one complaint is that there were a ton of flies on the patio area the first evening I was there. They were gross and distracted from the experience - but the food was good enough that I went back a second time within two weeks. BYOB.

9LkWs88z2o8t5pRRRXGRUw.text: I finally had an opportunity to visit Gaucho, during one of my frequent work trips to Pittsburgh and I'm happy that I did.....OMG!  The wait was long on a Wednesday night, so I can just imagine the weekend.  I waited for at least 45 minutes, starting at approx 7:00.  When I finally reached the front of the line, I had changed my mind about what I was going to order at least 10 times....lol!  I decided on the ribeye plate w/ 1/2 order of shrimp and grilled mushrooms.  I was then escorted to my table by one of the porters, and the second wait began, at least 20-25 minutes, but the food was absolutely worth the wait.  The steak was accompanied by the mixed gaucho salad which included caramelized onions and strips of carrots, in a house dressing, delicious.  There was also a slice of grilled ciabatta bread for dipping in those beautiful, housemade sauces.  I thought that my favorite would be the chimichurri, which I enjoyed, but my favorite was the garlic, also tried the onion and red pepper sauces.  The sauces were the perfect compliment to the entire meal.  The ribeye was cooked perfectly, between medium and medium well, just the right amount of fat, which I usually don't like, but in this instance, kept the meat, moist and juicy.  The shrimp were perfect as well.  Shout-out to the cashier, who helped me in choosing the desired "doneness" for both.  The entire staff was a bit laid back, in a good way, super nice and very helpful!   On the way out, I ordered the apple pecan bread pudding, which required "another" wait, approx 10 minutes, but it's baked to order, so I won't complain, and after tasting, I absolutely had no complaints.     I will ABSOLUTELY return!

jFLkG9wh6YjzGkl3nsgZXQ.text: Gaucho may be one of the best hole in the wall places in Pittsburgh. It's tiny any serves of the best beef around. They're a Argentinian meat/sandwich joint that's creating a quiet the buzz.  They have a special spice blend on their meats of filet, ribeye, flank, skirt with sauces such as chimmichurri. The sandwiches come on a toasted chiabatta bread which is perfect for steak sandwiches.    The wait is long if the weather is beautiful out, but I recommend calling ahead and getting it to go. That will let you avoid the line and get your food. This past Saturday it took 1 hour to wait in line, order and get our food.   A Suggestion: Have 1 person dedicated to sending out food. There's 1 person doing everything from ringing up orders, refilling sauces, refilling forks, sending out food. This slows everything down and can be frustrating when the line is extremely long.   Overall, can't wait to go back to this place. Wow.

fakaaOwTBxIEyb5WaHOKfg.text: The ordering system is a little much at first; I recommend going with someone who has been there so they can help you along.  The staff behind the counter was friendly and offered to answer any questions I had. There is an older fella (owner maybe?) who seemed a tad overbearing in terms of making sure customers were doing what they need to and going where the need to. I appreciated his direction, but he came off a little high strung.  I ordered the smoked pork belly special. It was tasty; excellent texture, nice mix of crunch and soft, gelatinous fatty goodness. Nice flavor, subtle smokiness and pretty salty. The potato side was forgettable, but the cabbage side was awesome. Great sweet/savory mix, with little crunchy pork bits throughout. Yum.

M-2U6uGJSl280C7ppVyF1A.text: 100% worth the wait, and even better if you're smart and order ahead or come on off-hours. It's so good, our downtown office orders ahead and  sends team members on the bus to go pick it up. My favorites are the chorizo sandwich and the provoletta, but all of their sandwiches are outstanding and a fantastic deal. Their sauce options enhance the whole experience and set this place head and shoulders above the rest.

8QvcNPBYhjGdOHwzl8n4mQ.text: Great food but the wait was CRAZY. Didn't order nearly enough food to quench my hangry-ness. Shrimp was fantastic but not quite filling.

afBvGbvoHiPHQFeqrj4qnQ.text: This is still one of my absolute favorite Pittsburgh restaurants, even after my going fully vegetarian a few years back.  Given that 80% of the menu is steak-related, I think that's a testament to the quality of all the food.  They have a wood-fired veggie sandwich that still makes me weep happy tears, and they have an always tasty veggie empanada-of-the-day (as well as a daily meat-focused one).  In addition, there are several side dishes that are vegetarian and excellent, including scrumptious salads, potatoes, and veggies.    I'm sure other reviews have mentioned how crowded it is, because the word is out about the ridiculous deliciousness of Gaucho. Most of the time you will be waiting in a long line spiraling outside the door.  I'ts still worth it.  They seem to move people inside and seat people at a good pace.  I tend to go right when they open for lunch when the line isn't too bad, and plan to heed the advice of others and call in a take-out order to avoid the wait.  Heavenly food.

n95oh13TbBdLhLccuRR1xQ.text: What makes this place unique is their originality. Rosemary and beef ? Who would have thought those flavors jive.  Be prepared to wait a bit . It's worth it.   All Sandwichs come on a freshly baked  Artisan made roll . Shazam !  Must check out when your in the strip district .

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hXymgs-cCFBW1KAzG4ppKw.text: With a seasonally changing menu, I would highly recommend the cuisine at Gaucho! Known for steak on an open wood fire grill, this restaurant features in house made everything from sauces to desserts. Non traditional restaurant style but cool, fun and worth the wait!   Fav: Rosemary Braised Beef, Vacio, El Gaucho Salad   Tip: Byob no cork fee, tipping is for the entire staff and don't be afraid to add fresh toppers to your plates!

VBFP31wnn6b5xrfeEnubtA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh.  Their steak, no matter what cut, is always perfectly cooked and flavorful.  The food is definitely worth the wait!  I don't really think you could go wrong with anything on the menu!

p_NlL1NQQLfuNlhcOI21aA.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. Wood fired grill and delicious meats. What else could you ask for? Oh, maybe the most tasty sauces you've ever tried? Yep they have those. Or maybe you aren't a carnivore and you are looking for something more herbivore'ish. Well they have a full veggie menu.  "What about desserts?" You say!  Each time I've been there they have been featuring a cleverly named dessert that was absolutely scrumptious!  My go to is the Rosemary braised beef sandwich. I was overwhelmed with emotion the first time I had it..it's unbelievable. Everything there is. I wish I could give it a higher rating. Go there. Please go now. What are you waiting for!?

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nnl_ipQlkFkmYYzZ-jOOrw.text: If you need to celebrate with a meat parade, they have the best prepared meats!  Get all of the meats and share with a big group!

CSBHAxsQBJBpB4fn5s5O1w.text: Came here with a group of 10 and had a great experience! They were able to seat us immediately after we ordered even though we had a huge party on a Friday at 6 pm. I got the sirloin steak cooked at medium rare and we got the paella to share. Everything was absolutely delicious! Love the sauces - especially the ajo. Definitely will be coming back here!

jI4mTHs_WnYelNGwjCYtKQ.text: The only downside to Gaucho is that the wait can be quite long during peak times. However, the food is amazing! The sandwiches are very generous portions and delicious. I love the sauces that you are able to help yourself to and add flavor to the meal! The sides are also delicious, especially the potatoes!

KVpkkTKAb5EtAYo-daxq0w.text: Food is excellent. We have tried most items on their menu and everything is delicious. Meat is perfectly seasoned. Grill vegetable is tasty. Their waiting staff is very attentive.   The only downside is the line can be very long and sometimes you need to wait for more than 30 minutes (people actually start drinking while waiting). They will not take your name and force you to actually stand in the line to dine here, which is extremely inefficient.

zCNlYBC4EtW_EycK1UHPsw.text: I loved the food here! Great taste and good variety in food. I only wish that the portions were bigger.

vvKWzKtxNeGYk1lZAB0QHw.text: Anything you order at Gaucho is delicious. I have tried different things here and was never disappointing. Seriously, everything is great. I cant even pick one dish over another.

mLXw7WIeM2U4RuMk4TNqjw.text: Went with my sister and brother for her birthday.  Had read a lot about this place and must say it was even better than expected.  Had heard about long lines - but we got lucky.  Arrived around 3 for late lunch/early dinner and spent a few minutes trying to decide what we wanted.  The plan was to get a lot of different plates and share.    Ordered way too much - but everything we had was great. The service and staff were awesome.  Had the ribeye and strip steaks - both were very good.  Tried all the sauces and they were very good with the red pepper my fave.    Liked the wings best of all - so much so that we got another order to go.  Had plenty of leftovers which the staff helped us pack up for our trip home  Now we have to go back to try the sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak platter - very good and the bread was very good with dipping sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp and empanadas - very yummy
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome wings - my fave

Kz1wP8EwX1jVYe5UDxGaow.text: Very good! Totally worth the wait. Also make sure you grab some of their sauces, they were awesome. We will definitely be returning.

cvE72fqJk92N8yomTI6tog.text: I brought my parents here after reading "Gaucho Parrilla Argentina was dubbed one of the top places to eat in the country" in the Pittsburgh Visitors Guide. The food definitely exceeded our expectations. It's kinda insane how good the food there was -- ESPECIALLY the sauces (chimichurri, garlic, onion, red pepper).

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The four sauces at Gaucho
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye Steak
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef Empanada

22zj402-48rEp7qAn6ElTg.text: This restaurant deserves all the success and lines out its door. One walks in and is instantly greeted by a giant chalkboard of food items listed divided into  to meats, salads, sandwiches, and sides. I decisively decided on their steak sandwich with filet and then a 6oz meat plate of flank (and it comes with a small side salad, toast, and tiny portion of grilled veggies). Depending on the cuts of meat prices vary. Strip steak is the cheapest to filet being the priciest. Ordered both meats to be cooked medium rare.   While ordering you can see all the cute young chefs working hard grilling those meats in a modern clean kitchen. Sauce is unlimited and this place is byob even though they also sell beer and other soft drinks. They have wine glasses and beer glasses on the shelf along with plates and cutlery... it's self seating but someone still brings the food to you and will clean up after you.   Oh man, the steak sandwich is good! They didnt skimp on the filet either. I knocked one star down because my flank steak was more of medium done than medium rare. Still very flavorful and not chewy. Affordable steaks here!

Ig_ZPwIAFLbpsB-kkxxzXg.text: The food was amazing. The menu is a little confusing if you have never been there. But so worth the wait

cNbZfS3BCTT7RiUeTS69tQ.text: Food was good, but since you order at a counter, you don't have a server, but someone will bring your food. Don't go expecting to sit, relax, dine, and talk with friends. They will start clearing around you. It's all about turning the tables.

g2Ofx5URByGBBXjCAIp31w.text: Food was delicious. Atmosphere was fun. We only had to wait in line for about ten minutes, but we got there early (around 5:30 p.m.) and it seemed to get a LOT more crowded soon after we arrived. I would highly recommend the experience, but maybe go early or be prepared to stand in line for a while.

oz5Dd86c-HDecLEju5Cm8Q.text: It was about six degrees today, so when we got to Gaucho and saw the line of people waiting outside I knew it had to be wonderful. My boyfriend and I shared the parrilla mixta, a side of papas, and some empanadas. It was the best meal I've ever eaten, and the sauces are absolutely amazing.

SWcDqQbwhznedFDFHBn9PA.text: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. Maybe it's cause I'm from LA and we have AMAZING food, but this place doesn't live up to the hype of its reviews. The meat itself was cooked and seasoned well, but the sandwich had no flavor. And I've never had a sadder empanada in my life. Dry and no flavor. Empanadas are supposed to make you happy and dying for more, we were fighting over who HAD to eat the last one.

nb_MvJBIuPwgay6jmzdm4A.text: Had steak sandwich, a little too fatty for me.  Kind of expensive. Small place, but fun.  Rest of meal was good to go.   Will definitely go back.

4RKN1KA2q2AfQgLT0BHhaw.text: Who said you can't get a little bit Argentina in Pittsburgh? If madonna stopped in to this spot she be singing oh Argentina all over again! All I can say is no matter what you eat here you are going to be blown away the steak sandwiches melting your mouth as do just about everything else I've tried, went on the strip get you a strip a steak at the Argentine!

h07yC-d0NE0BX5aysV6Myw.text: Went there feeling a bit adventurous and wanting to try something new and different. The line to order was a bit long so if you're in a hurry for to go, call ahead. I wanted to get a bit of everything so I got a steak empanada, chicken empanada, Gaucho Papas, and Tostados. The sauces were the best part! My personal favorites were the pimenton and the Cebolla. Also BYOB and no cork fee!

knJ4wRguzW6NCyJmQpiAVQ.text: Amazing food! Don't let the long lines stop you! Loved the tender well seasoned steaks and salads. Can't wait to go back.

FmnN775IBT8CQ6WPq1UA0w.text: If you like meat, this is the place! Everything we had was delicious and full of flavor. Best to call in an order than wait in the line. Oh, and BYOB. Enjoy!

OAO27SzXmiCDiItxgbr-4w.text: Wowsa!! Totally awesome food, great energy here! Servers so friendly. GM Mikey was so welcoming, engaging. Sauces, meats, food perfectly, freshly made. The "provolone" bread....yum!! The smell will bring u in here. BYOB, no corkage, lively environment. Been here twice in a week. Will be a return patron for sure.

qb7cdmD0MdX3b05E2EX34A.text: Delicious! A place I would take people to explore when they visit Pittsburgh!

ArOAsN4JJ3IMPYvZV225Ow.text: Typically I have fun eating out but rarely do I feel that the price is warranted given what I could make it home. This is the only restaurant I've ever been to where I felt like the price really represented something amazing-it was very cheap for the quality and some of the best food I've had in a long time. We came in well before 5 o'clock - probably 4:30 at least - and by 5 there was a huge line out the door.  Try the desserts, too! They are also amazing.

mVZTrOFEdboVlAa9nj9GqA.text: The reviews on here are all True. This restaurant is authentic, warm, welcoming and so tasty!! I was so satisfied with everything we had. The ribeye sandwich was juicy, flavorful and so easy to eat. The corn on the cob was the best I have ever had!! The different sauces were amazing! I would eat here every month if I could. Too bad we live out of state!

vP8uD7O-LdAFEgM5dyF-8A.text: I love the steak here. I have no idea how they keep the prices so reasonable. I went here for a loved one's anniversary and it was absolutely amazing. I love that I can order without sides and not waste anything! The sauces are all mind blowing! A new favorite for me! Meaty!

GB_5pEnG8F2Ip2Klolkz2A.text: The food here is really good.  You might have to wait in line to get in, but Gaucho takes the sting out of the wait if you've brought your own beverages by opening your bottle and giving you a cup.  The food, though, is the draw.  Customer service is good, and the atmosphere is fun.  Always fun.

2CVty-4UkFMZeKD6z8kmXg.text: I have been here a few times now.  I love the expansion on the side. Now you can order and eat, before it was a tiny place and you had to get it to go most times. The food always seems fresh and different than the usual burger/sandwich places.

TcokK4Ti5aMm2mLpF6Vnng.text: Worth waiting! I had the seafood soup and corn pudding, and I try the gilled chicken from the bbq mixta. The chicken was so good! The others are good too. My don't eat beaf but my friend told me it's good. I have to say everything is better than what I had in Argentina......

LVDeg-00sG61asn4gVmr0A.text: Got the lomo con pan (filet beef sandwich). Meat was like red bubblegum. Way too much fat. Couldn't eat it at all. The charm was definitely lost during the renovations. Service was pleasant.

9zcyjAeYgAPEqHODm7p6Eg.text: Allow me to chime in with the chorus of praise for Gaucho. My wife and I came here a few nights back. We enjoyed the flank steak (inexplicably cheaper than skirt, though the flank is higher quality in my opinion) and grilled vegetables. Clean plates, not a straggler left. The guys running the joint had great personality and a friend/customer/? had brought in some homebrew to share with the crowd. I would have given them five stars without the free beer, but it sure as hell doesn't hurt. Highly recommended.

YUXlVlFM6aKRr7SeXjGKtg.text: Great spot. The smoke from the wood fired grill grabs anyone's attention who is walking by. The staff is all very friendly.  The food is amazing...so much flavor packed in generous portions. You can taste that only top quality ingredients are used.  I try to go here at least once a month for lunch and it never disappoints. The line sometimes can get big but that's to be expected when you have such good food!

FTSOW47hB203ZOSs5ryRKA.text: Every bite is Awesome!!! Soooo Super Yummy! The roasted chicken and steak... Yummy! The mashed sweet potatoes and roasted red potatoes w/ garlic sooo yummy!

MZsBjECzVEAc4ML48_Yasg.text: HOLY CRAP.  This place is the place where food dreams come True.  This place right now is hard to find as it is in the smallest little whole in the wall you've ever seen that has zero seating and almost as much standing room but anyone who has tried this place would gladly stand and eat their food.  So stopped in here on an afternoon for the first time and got the rosemary braised beef with horsey sauce and caramelized onion on a baguette.  First off the bread, because anyone who knows me knows I'm all about the bread. A baguette can get hard sometimes and the roof of my mouth feels the paid after a few bites but NOT here. The baguette was soft and not too bready and was the PERFECT accompaniment to the meat.  Now onto the good stuff.  Walk anywhere within a miles distance of this place and the cooking meat will grab you by the nose, pick you up and drag you right into this restaurant where all your carnivore cravings will be satisfied.  The meat here is sublime. Juicy, flavorful, and they PACK it on!  I have never tasted braised beef like this in my life, and I'm not really sure I will ever again which makes me sad.  This place is amazing. I cannot tell you enough just how amazing this place is.  If you are a local or a tourist like myself, get in here, grab a sammie and fall in love with your food! You will not regret it!

SzSMsmri9eaewud3Nilg5g.text: The sandwiches are so, so good!  This is a place everyone has to check out. I prefer the chorizo or Rosemary-braised beef.

Fc2t8cUx-pF53-ODJu5eWQ.text: Gaucho is Pittsburgh's best restaurant. The sandwiches are incredible and reasonably priced. They have incredibly fresh ingredients and I have honestly never had a bad experience. The paella is delicious, even having had it homemade before from a True paella master from Spain. The steak platter (asado platter) is also incredible and is 5 different cuts of meat. The sides such as potatoes, rice, etc. are all also delicious pairings with the larger dishes.   My only negative experience at Gaucho came from the waiting process. The restaurant is extremely successful and after their expansion only became more popular. So popular, that most nights the line extends out the door onto the sidewalk outside. This wouldn't be a problem, except that it's poorly executed and often ends in frustration for several people standing in line. On top of that, what appeared to be an owner of manager addressed the crowd of willing, paying customers in a somewhat aggravated manner. It's obviously busy and people are confused. The last thing we want is to be yelled at by the staff before we have even ordered.   Other than the poorly executed waiting process, and slight confusion between employees and customers, Gaucho is a special place. It has surpassed my other favorite restaurants as of late.

Amrq8WbtQIZKC9h1jtsVTQ.text: It tastes as good as it smells when you walk by!  Had the cerdo (roast pulled pork), which was amazing.  The cut of meat, execution of the smoking, and mild rosemary flavor were all top shelf.  Cookies were good too.  Be sure to load up on the free dipping sauces, as they are also amazing.  This deserves to be the highest rated restaurant in Pittsburgh on Yelp (guess this region has better tastes than Ann Arbor, M!).

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cerdo
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vxLy2Hh_xfFtqnE9__0_Ng.text: Definitely one of the better restaurants I've tried in Pittsburgh. My ribeye was deliciously flavorful and cooked to the correct temperature. It was melt in your mouth delicious. The chimis were awesome. Can't wait to come back and try more of their other offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yasssssssss

bT1GENxpFZnWNJBqHwW-hg.text: My husband and I went there on a Saturday afternoon and it was absolutely packed. They had to stop taking orders for fifteen + minutes to allow the chefs to get caught up. The wait was certainly worth it! We ordered the ribeye sandwich, chicken sandwich, a side of vegetables and side of potatoes. Everything was cooked to perfection. I don't think I have ever had a better pulled chicken sandwich- the meat was juicy but still large bites, not shredded. It was truly delicious and everyone in there was raving about it.

vEIqzJ_Gq1ljiLfj8n250A.text: I thought the food was excellent.  The meats were cooked to perfection we ordered one of the steak dishes and the rosemary braised beef sandwich which was huge! I wish i ordered a whole bowl of the salad.  I been dreaming of this salad since I got back from my trip. All of the condiments were amazing!!!  The people cooking the food were friendly and waiving to all the patrons.  Why i took off two stars was because the person taking my order was rude.  The girl who rang up my order rolled her eyes at me because we didn't finish our order in the time i'm guessing she allotted for.  Driving 8 hours and looking forward to eating this place as our first stop in the burgh I let one of the runners know that and how delicious it was and all i got was a stare and she didn't acknowledge anything i said.  I guess we weren't hipster enough.

oAozj12s_UktbMrSGj_hUA.text: The food was on point. Big fan of the Brussel sprouts, empanadas & yams. Great addition to the strip district

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So tasty

t6tKIeo6YgRFx6Myh9bEFg.text: Great food and service. I'd avoid peak hours. The wait can be long but it's totally worth it.

7TlwMH6xJy00w4I05a2EqQ.text: It took me a long time to get to Gaucho, longer than I would have liked but the wait was well worth it and now with their expanded seating it makes it a bit easier to get a spot (unless It's a weekend then it's every person for themselves) but regardless once you get a spot the food is incredible. The flank steak is my favorite for sure but I really don't think you can go wrong on your choice. The staff also seem to truly enjoy what they are doing and are extremely kind. Now I just need to figure out when I'm going back next.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The delicious Arrechera flank steak plate. If I could eat this every single day, I would.

J99G8I0ACr49w_DZmXn0GA.text: I really have never been to a place like Gaucho. I was in town for the Steelers game and saw all of the glowing reviews on yelp. I felt compelled to comment on my experience. This was a regular lunch spot with high end meats. We do not have anything like this back here in Chicago.  We waited maybe 20 minutes, which wasn't bad. This place was absolutely worth the wait (some guy told us the same thing walking out). We ordered the Asado Plate, which were all 5 cuts of the steaks they offered. It included Flank, NY strip, Ribeye, Filet, & Sirloin, which were all incredible. My favorites were definitely the Ribeye and NY strip. The item on the menu, though, that made me feel compelled to write a review was the rack of lamb. I feel that if you add Lamb to your menu at any restaurant, you know what you are doing in prepping and preparing meats. This New Zealand Lamb was cooked perfectly and was the highlight of my trip. We also split a side of the veggies.   Overall, I would have to say this was one of my top 5 lunchtime meals that I've had in my life. Maybe, even, top 5 meals regardless of the time of day. No exaggeration. If you are in Pittsburgh you have to hit up this spot. I will be back next time I visit Pittsburgh.

Zp8mvjZ4nSz0l71MbhiS_g.text: Solid place, a must if you're in the Strip!  Got quick service on a Saturday night - uber-friendly staff, good atmosphere. They were out of bread (like, all bread), the pork, fish, and steak empanadas. Instead, the server suggested ordering the papas and getting the sandwich filling over the potatoes. I asked if we could do that for the sandwich price, but he said no. Seems goofy, bread is clearly an important part of a sandwich, a starchy substitute should be gratis, fellas. Still, the dish was fine for the extra few bucks, and the papas were delicious. The rosemary beef was very tasty, but oh MAN was it salty! I'm a big savory fan, but the beef was overseasoned. Veggie empanadas were not the soft, flaky pastry others have described, but were tough and barely warm. Nothing we were served was hot, which I wasn't a fan of.   Got the last package of lemon alfajores, which were BANGIN', SO GOOD!!   Definitely going to come back earlier in the week and give this place another go! I'll be happy to change this review with a great next visit.

ft7quC3SUvLRnGfNMN48zg.text: Happened to be in the strip and noticed there was NO line which is very unusual. Had skirt steak sandwich and officially fell in love with Gaucho Parrilla. AMAZING

3UkgK74y6yNA0GCCqnbFpQ.text: ALWAYS delicious!  I had a friend in from out of town this weekend and took him here - he is still talking about it days later!  Some of the best food in the city - by far!

wg6-01M-vFSv71TvNk2cVw.text: My absolute favorite restaurant in Pgh! The service was quick, and the food was out of this world

EQhhK6-yvaJRZIbzrF474g.text: This place was everything I read about and loved everything. I had the filet carne sammie and tried all the sauces which were all delicious. The empanadas were great had the beef and pork with the pork being the best.  The line had us waiting about 35 minutes but once inside were seated and food arrived within minutes. Definitely a must for everyone to try.

qcXgVOWIpuEgYpgivapMjQ.text: This was our second time being there and we wanted to get deeper into the menu and give it one more chance so we ordered steak, chicken, sausage, salads, fried cheese etc... to be honest I should have just went to wholeys and bought food to  cook at home. The food at Gaucho, especially for the price was lack luster, the meat came out semi warm with nothing but burnt cold sour dough bread slices as a topper. Let me just state that I have been to Argentina a few times and the food there makes gaucho look like a McDonald's, anyways the meats did not have any distinct flavors that would separate then from any other 2 star restaurant but the spicey chorizo sausage was the only good item we had. The portion size is almost about right, the presentation is acceptable which can sometimes make up for the lack of cooking skills the chiefs have. Everyone that works there is a brain washed hipster with dreads or long slick backed hair, no one in the kitchen is from Argentina. You of course can go there are try it for yourself but I wouldn't recommend it. Nothing is special about the place. Some people think it's the greatest place on earth and that's because they most likely never been anywhere else.

JT-JhypIdyyWR7Vi00hc_Q.text: Delicious!! Everything we ordered was great. Sirloin steak plate, potatoes, rice,  and Caramelized onions. Yum!   The menu was a little confusing and overwhelming, but the staff was very helpful and friendly.

wkz5RhJ0zK20aUIabLmwkA.text: I had to visit several times before I was ready to review. OK, so first off, Gaucho can be amazing. But you need to go with a group. It's not really the place to go as a couple or alone. The reason for going in a group is to try lots of what they have to offer. When I went the first time it was just me and my husband, and we were underwhelmed - it was expensive and we didn't really get much variety as you just order at a counter and your food comes to your table all at once so its not a coursed dining experience. That said, I have now gone several times with a large group, it's not expensive, and we get a ton of food to share. Get you and your friends a few Asado platters, some potatoes, some shrimp, provaletta, and dig into their sauces, which are amazing. Remember to bring your wine, and come early or be prepared to wait in a long line. Four and a half stars - if they had table service it would be five.

rckWKHbSktU7onH6tVfmXQ.text: This place is one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh!  I love to take people here if they haven't been here before. You can get a ton of food for the table to share for not a ton of money. The steak is always perfectly cooked.

gwf8u3zQmwLH1lKVhOEKFA.text: Great meats, cooked to perfection. Long wait, but service is friendly and they try to get it to you as soon as possible.  Get the meat sampler- it is amazing.

Uxf1My1rX_0hYeOJlcbyJA.text: My short-lived journey throughout Pittsburgh led me to Gaucho. Ironically, I walked past the location earlier in the day and returned after circling through the Steel City. I heard the lines would be long, so I called to see if I could place a carryout order. It was my lucky day because they allowed me today do so! Now, picture me walking past 50+ people as I head to the entrance: I'm sure more than half thought I was cutting the line. I picked up my order and overheard a few comments: "He's smart for carrying out", "good idea", and "that smells good". Momma always said that I was special. I proved her right that day.   The food: I ordered 6 empanadas. 3 beef. 3 chicken. If you want to know what heaven is like, order from Gaucho (using the carryout option, of course). Your stomach (and mother) will be proud of you.

kgB7ccmO-92Zp4JffzM49w.text: A terribly easy five stars to give.   I got the ribeye steak plate. It's an immaculate piece of perfectly cooked steak, thinly sliced on the bias, and served on a wooden board with a small side salad and a piece of flawlessly grilled bread.   The steak was incredible. The bread was very purposefully included to soak up the insanely good juices that run from the steak as you eat it, and the salad is a wonderful fresh accompaniment.   We also tried a side of humita which is described as "Corn pudding w/onions & fresh herbs." This was fantastic and added a nice contrast to the meal.   The only thing I didn't enjoy was the empanada, and my fellow diner agreed. The texture of the pastry was off and the filling tasted a bit funny.   But I still refuse, boldly refuse even, to give this place 4 stars, because the steak was so gut punchingly good that if I found myself within 100 miles of Pittsburgh at any point in time, I would drive out of my way to enjoy another meal at Gaucho.   Good thing we came in when we did, cause the line snaked inside the restaurant as we were eating. It was actually hard to leave... not just because people were blocking the door... but because I wanted more steak... and to live there... inside the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. DLicious
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rib eye
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sauces

ad27jPhQRfXM5X5FBT7fxQ.text: Great place.  Authentic food.  Great menu.  Right on the 16th street bridge.  NO PARKING so you have to hike a few blocks and prepare for parking meter hell coutesy of Pittsurgh parking authority.  Go later in the evening and forget paying since there is no enforcement.  Locals just wait until enforcement goes home for the evening.  Food is the actual deal.  For me, however, it is far too much per serving.  Good see see a new business in that spot.  Roy

B9yEbtSI-UEeyZU9EvBvpQ.text: Whoever thought it'd be okay to have a copious amount of meat for breakfast is just sick in the head, and I'm all for it. On a summer weekend road trip to Pittsburgh (said no one ever), 5 friends and I went on a food excursion through the city of steel. Gaucho was a big surprise to me having grew up in Los Angeles and not expecting such an eclectic array of eateries in a place like this. We lined up right before they opened and got in after around 20 minutes, just the perfect amount of time to build up an appetite. We got the sampler and a side of okra (just to appease my flexitarian appetite). Yum yum and yum. The meat has just the right amount of charcoal and steam, with its juice oozing out right before your eyes. You can feel the warmth of the slab of steak before taking a bite, what a treat. Do note that this was an incredibly sodium-tastic meal, I'd say they could use less salt for their dry marination. And don't forget the salsa, try em all!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. gaucho platter

m3lCaVbW75AE_KpGDGE0yg.text: The wait here was very long, but that is because the food is delicious! You order at the counter, and then you sit down and the staff brings you your food. The portion sizes are great and the food tastes amazing, especially the bread. My boyfriend got the steak sandwich (which you can choose your cut of steak) and I got the fish sandwich (made with fish of the day). Plus we split veggie and pork empanadas with some potatoes. There are small containers with 4 chimichurri sauces that you can bring to your table to sample. The price is very fair for the quality and taste of food. The casual atmosphere also is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and fish sandwiches. Plus veggie and pork empanadas with some potatoes... and 4 chimichurri sauces

0hfwu8PQdY0GAjuQ58AvMQ.text: What an experience ! The food was incredible , we ordered all 3 choices of empanadas, flank steak, and 2 sides...everything had a ton of flavor and was cooked perfectly. There was a huge line but the manager was very accommodating especially because we had a baby with us. Easy 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8-eppRrmf6jn-TO0ppQMUQ.text: I've had this place a few times but the way my mom and aunt talked about me yesterday you'd think I was a pro. I knew every answer to their questions (first timers always have questions lol) yesterday my mom and I split the ribeye steak (medium well) the pork chop (well done) the roasted potatoes with rosemary and the summer squash with breadcrumbs. The steak was flavorful and tender but it had parts that were a little too pink in certain areas and in other areas had too much char for me but in general it was a tasty steak . I got the bone part of the chop and loved it, it was juicy and delicious while my mom's main part was a little on the dryer but still tender. The squash was perfectly cooked and the bread crumbs on top were garlicky, which I like and crunchy. The potatoes could have been a little hotter because we asked for a side of butter and the butter wasn't really melting but not a big deal. I work at a hotel downtown and suggest it to anyone who will  listen!!! Long story short this place is worth the line you'll probably have to wait in to eat so go early and try the sauces they are all FABULOUS.

yugpMjv8aqOj2EkAW4PQ9g.text: 4.5 stars ... near perfect.  Loved the food!  The only small tiny item was cleanliness.. I think the wait is worth it considering how good the food is!  I am jealous on how Pittsburgh have it so good with this place... can I bring this back with me to Toronto? I'd trade it for a poutine, maple syrup, and a few peameal bacon sandwiches ... no? Didn't think so.  Honestly, I can see why it is so highly rated and super popular.  I arrived on a weekday at 6 pm and though there was a line inside the restaurant, that line kept growing and growing outside on the sidewalk.  This place is completely deserving of all the success cause it does Argentinian grilled meat so damn well.  Great thing about this place ... it shows love to all your vegetarian and vegan friends too so they don't feel left out.  Though you could look at them with pity for not enjoying the buttery tender bites of rib eye.  It's a fast casual dining style where you line up first cafeteria style, place and pay for your drink and meal orders upfront, and then be seated by the restaurant. Our wait in the line was only 15 minutes when we first waited just inside the door.  Quite reasonable seeing how busy the place is. The menu is a huge chalkboard offering everything your carnivorous friends could ever dream.  Prices here are so affordable that I had to double check ... grilled small ribeye for $15 only? Oh heck yeah.  The dining space is loud but not unreasonable and it's a vibrant, simple with a slightly rustic charm, and fairly clean.  Tables are a bit sticky ... so just be aware of what you're sitting on or putting your hands on.  Bathrooms are not bad but certainly could use a bit of a cleaning too.    One key thing after you order and before you sit down  ... pick up the 4 sauces that are along the wall right after your order area.  They are the kings of flavour here ... they made everything good be great and everything amazing become "oh lawd where has this been in my life ... Pittsburgh? well that's a bit of a trek from Toronto but I'd do it"  Chimmi, Ajo (garlic), pimenton (pepper), and cebolla (onion) - it should be said that no bite should be empty of any of these sauces.  They're addicting and I am so tempted to bring it back with my over the border.  Chimmi was bright vegetal parsley notes with the right acidic punch with good heat.  Ajo was a milder garlic than anticipated... think roasted garlic.  Pimenton was my favourite because it was roasted pepper sweet with an amazing smokey note.  I put this on everything ... rib eye, empanadas, all the vegetables, and it made everything great.  Cebolla was a nice sweet onion note.  5+/5  Chorizo - juicy, tender, meaty, and had a nice heat kick.  Probably one of the better chorizos I've had in a while.  I'm normally not a sausage lover on any type but this has me rethinking how I've ignored this on other menus.  For only $8, you got a nice medium sized plate and no its not enough to share but you could always try to steal a piece.  5/5  Rib eye - cooked medium (though we asked for medium rare), this grilled steak was very good.  Nice beefy flavour while still being tender ... probably my favourite cut and gaucho did it so well even being medium.  Add on the sauces and it's one of my favourite steaks of the year by far.  The fact its only $15 blows my mind.  5/5   Empanda (veg) - for only $3, you get a browned pastry filled with corn, peas, and pepper.  Without the sauces it's ok ... soft doughy crust cover a decent helping of veg.  I'd probably try something else next time 3.5/5 with the sauces  Argentino salad - generous helping of grilled vegetables and some avocados over a leafy salad.  I really loved how this salad was .. lots of smokey tender grilled vegetables.  Each bite was different and always flavourful.  4/5  Grilled vegetables - I didn't realize the same vegetables in this dish was on the Argentino salad! Oops... still good as it just let me enjoy more grilled veg for my dinner while being so ridiculously affordable.  $7 for a good medium sized plate of tender smokey grills veg? Yes please! 4/5  Blueberry and peach bread pudding - hot from the oven,  this bread pudding can be quite good.  Custard soaked pieces of chopped bread embedded with juicy bursting blueberries and peach slices.  The bread on the top just crisped up from the oven offering a nice sugary crunch to the creamy custard bread.  All the bites with blueberries were very good and I may have to try to stop hording them all...  I could share .. mostly.  One small thing ... not all bread pieces were soaked completely so the occasional piece was dry.  4/5  For the price we paid, I was pleasantly shocked on how good everything was.  Quickly served and oh so good... there's tons of the things on the menu to try and as long as you got those 4 sauces, nothing can be less than good.  I gotta find a way to bring this over the border!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The peach and blueberry bread pudding
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetables empanadas ... pretty good but best with one of the sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NlRgyWusVA82A5enHqSPbw.text: Come here if you want an overpriced super tough and chewy steak. Not sure if they were just serving crap because they knew a big conference was in town or its the Pittsburgh standard but very unimpressed. I'd steer clear regardless.  We ordered two ribeyes per the Nirvana loving head bobbing staff.  One was medium and other medium rare. It was a battle of sawing through meat fibers and spitting out gristle into the plentiful supply of napkins. No one ever came to ask how are orders were or seemed to care. The sauces/condiments on the other hand were quite good and needed to choke down their meat. I think I've had better steak at outback and I hate that place. Pass pass pass don't go here ever if you like good steak.

0vRx-2b1g_V1nWvaKrwdfQ.text: There is almost always a long wait for this place, but for good reason. The food is amazing, and they have all these different kinds of sauces that you can help yourself to. The desserts are great too, try the bread pudding!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate raspberry pecan bread pudding

EeykQB6Jgk8zyyS2n61LsA.text: Whenever I am asked for restaurant recommendations I always mention Gaucho! Meats are always perfectly cooked with a great selection of unique sauces that are all self-serve while dining, and can be bought for future use! The restaurant itself is relatively small making it chaotic in front of the register during their peak hours - over all the staff is excellent, atmosphere is fun, and they have one of the best & most affordable steak sandwiches in Pittsburgh!

A5xqYovoD0gpErKCdwFXnA.text: We arrived 40 minutes before closing time on a Friday night but they were already closed up.  Pathetic, don't waste your time.

vpcVSMKAvWvWZBOVdoGAUA.text: SOOOO GOOD. If you have the opportunity to go here, go!!! They have a really big menu, so there are plenty of different options.   It's a pretty relaxed restaurant environment as well. You get your drinks and you order at the front, and then you sit down wherever. A server will call your name when they have your order and they'll bring it over to your table. Also it's byob  I got the pescado sandwich which was amazing. The bread is grilled a little bit and the sandwich itself is very flavorful. They have additional sauces around the area that you can bring over to your table and make your order even more delicious! The empanadas are also really good, and they are adorably tiny. The flan was delicious, and comes with apples on top. Basically, the food is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jIR3GlIxeE8FdsoQoGp8nw.text: There is a line in front of the restaurant. But don't be scared, it shouldn't be that long. You need to order before you get seated. We order steak plate, carne sandwich and lasagna. We all think they are a little salty. I took a bite and drank some water afterwards. The restaurant is pretty big inside! Overall, good experience!

OB2zDU15MwoxX4XLaAfgjQ.text: I didn't review this place? I came here a year ago, and I'm STILL thinking about it. In fact, I was just browsing photos when I realized I didn't review it.  I live in Cleveland, but I am literally planning a trip to Pittsburgh just to eat at Gaucho!   I had the chicken, and it was the most amazing meal I've ever had. Well okay I don't know, but it sure was close. The best part is the 4 different sauces that you can have pretty much unlimited amounts of with your meal. I kept going back and getting more. I was even eating them with a fork.    Get here early or be prepared to wait a long time. The line was out the door at lunch time and we got the last table in the place. It's just that good!

lr5KQmjlUueHsH8tKzTF1A.text: Some of the best food you can get in Pittsburgh. They often have great desserts too. You can't go wrong with any dish- paella, chicken, steak, potatoes- it's all good. The portions are also pretty large; we always go home with leftovers. The staff are always friendly and energetic. Of course, this is a busy place, but if you plan to go on a weekday evening it's not as bad and the wait isn't too long.

a9-N1dmDXNkbpuhhu9-vJg.text: The price is a little bit high but they cook other meat to perfection. Their sauces are amazing. Honestly everything here is really great and I really recommend it for everyone to come here. All my friends who have visited here loved it and would not stop talking about it. If you have a large party I would suggest getting a seafood paella

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
