KeK_H9Dp0yWaJBlagaNhGw.text: While this is not a formal dining experience it is a good one.  Location very cool and food is very good.   The Argentine flavors are excellent.  Try the trio of sauces. If you are looking for something different give this place a try. Employees are extremely friendly.

F6UVlP4vXB0DcVRKoO30pg.text: To say this place lives up to the hype is an understatement. My co-worker and I decided to take a break from the ordinary and venture down to the strip to see what all the fuss about Gaucho really is.   We both ordered the Steak Burger and let me say it was one of the best things i've ever eaten. I tried all of the 4 homemade sauces on the 4 pieces I cut the huge sandwich into. (In my opinion this is truly the best way to eat everything here) The attention to detail in the preparation and presentation shows and shines through their product.  With the expansion of the restaurant occurring now I cannot wait to try it again. The much needed expansion will allow even more people to enjoy the amazing food Gaucho has to offer,

rkggAA7egot9nOBPHB6HAg.text: Hands down the best steak sandwich I've ever eaten and I travel coast to coast and consider myself a foodie. I got the ribeye and it,  along with the sauces, were amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pE_piyCa2ktjef48o71f2Q.text: Wow! Just WOW! This place is amazing. I got the ribeye sandwich and corn on the cob. It melted in my mouth. The meat was cooked perfectly. We got there 10 minutes after it opened and there was all ready a line. By 12:30 the line was out the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is the ribeye sandwich with side of corn on the cob.

secOEcS9WvSXAFyPNru7Rg.text: I went here for my birthday and had the Bodega experience hosted by Alberto! Omg doesn't even cut the amazing reaction we had to the amount of food, the service, and the taste. So much delicious bread and meat, and don't even get me started on the bread pudding.....LIFE CHANGING! If you like a fun family style atmosphere with smokey meat and delightful sides, then this is the place for you!

HObxbfIpsd82YCZT8glDAQ.text: What are you waiting for? Eat here already!  The steakburger may be the best burger patty you ever have. It comes on a big crunchy brioche bun which at first I thought was too much bread, but upon further reflection and analysis, I must conclude that a mere mortal burger bun would crumble and disintegrate against this burger's juiciness.     Tip: Come early on a weeknight. Like right after work. Do not attempt to come here on Friday, Saturday, or Sunday. It's too small a place to serve all the people who want to eat here.

1-jmTKk6gzfprOtSbl7e4Q.text: We are from Arizona, and can see why this place is so popular. It has a hip atmosphere, the people are very friendly, and the food was excellent. We enjoyed the sides of rice and corn, to go with our fish chicken and steak. We would come back if we lived in the Pittsburgh area.

fn_AIkwMJJp3iugv0QzTFg.text: The food at gaucho was awesome!!!! I had the Rosemary braised beef sandwich, which comes with caramelized onions and horseradish sauce. The meat was tender and flavorful, the onions were soft and sweet, the sauce added nice tang, and the bread was chewy on the outside and soft on the inside! I also split the grilled vegetables and the corn pudding as side dishes. The corn pudding was delicious! It was creamy, had great texture and spice, and was slightly smokey from the charred corn. The vegetables were my favorite part, hard to believe even for me! The platter came with red peppers, caramelized onions, zucchini, asparagus, and mushrooms. Each vegetable was grilled perfectly, seasoned extremely well, and had a delicious sauce. The peppers were also charred and had a wonderful smokey flavor. The sauces to choose from too also added unique flavor to everything we tried! The staff was friendly and accommodating in the great atmosphere the restaurant had to offer. However, the line was insanely long and it took almost 30 minutes to order, so I would either go early, go when you have a wide open schedule, or order ahead. Either way, it was well worth the wait! Definitely a place to try in the strip district of Pittsburgh!

54G-xtAEU-JoNUvPKr5vxA.text: Everything is amazing. I love all of the sauces. Just don't come here if your in a hurry at a prime eating time.

nsE9U-H_B7tujq-j4_Yf8w.text: I come to Pittsburgh annually for the Replay FX tournament at the convention center. I look forward to the tournament all year, but honestly, I look forward to walking over to Gaucho's every single lunch almost as much. The sandwiches are incredible- with bafflingly high quality meats, terrific sauces and great veggies. Friendly service too.  Expect a line, but it's totally worth the wait. Honestly, one of my favorite restaurants on the entire planet.

-zbnqggvbBivglY9kALoYg.text: FYI: This place is where to be.    The quaint counter style and simplicity of the interior have nothing in connection with the robust flavors and complex meals.  The employees are helpful when ordering and have great suggestions.  AND they have Coke in a bottle.  I ate the hanger steak and mushroom.  I got the small portion of both and still had almost a whole meal left.  BYOB if you are to eat there.  Be careful, there is limited seating, but the outside area is welcoming when it is nice out.   Do yourself a favor and check it out.

SOhBZDmVbud3tlJc1JP9uw.text: I found this very interesting, I've never had Argentinian food before. I ordered something that resembled a calzone, it had steak and corn and it was one of the best things I've ever eaten.  I would eat here again and look forward to trying some of their other dishes.

l8GidBLPevEgWsF2KsN3oA.text: The food was okay. It was very seasoned, kind of reminded me of Indian food. But I was really pissed that oil kept leaking from my sandwich all over my dress. Be careful people! You've been warned, so blame yourself if you get oil all over your outfit. The prices are highish too. I liked that you could try different sauces. Wouldn't recommend.

--lA9VpYgj9AG70i5syZTg.text: Absolutely the best steak and chicken sandwiches that I've ever had anywhere! Great grill flavor!

MW8c1W4d_q5sg6s5cSd70w.text: YAAAY!  This was the 2nd time my  honey and I went here and OMG AMAZING!!! My honey had the New York strip steak sandwich with that yummy corn that makes your mouth shout SECONDS PLEASE!!!!! I had a steak empanada with the roasted potatoes! I looooooove sauces so I went to the sauce bar and packed 4 little cups with different sauces to dip my potatoes in and they were yummazing!!!! Yaay!  I'll truly miss this gem in Pittsburgh, but back to New Orleans I go!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

h4HFiRVXK_M_VD6DFmyY7w.text: No words.  Haven't been back since they expanded, but the food is out of this world. The chimichurri sauces are unique, as is the concept.  Treat yourself!

Rnl0zI7YkYpoTuzjaQXcYw.text: Anyone who ever comes to Pittsburgh MUST eat here. It's absolutely amazing. I always get the some sort of steak and it's always made just right and with lots of flavor. I've also tried the Caldo Del Mar which was great as well but a smaller portion. And the shrimp was good but not sure it worth the price for only a few pieces. The lamb was also made really well and tasted amazing. For dessert we usually got whatever the special was which turns out well every time. Oh and best for last, the chicken wing appetizer was incredible. I don't think I've had better grilled wings before. You have to get them.

F0Iy6S5DRFtt34VoR6I8nA.text: Absolutely delicious authentic tasting food, sauces are too die for. I get a salad or a sandwich and it's always amazingly delicious. Lots of things on the menu I have yet to try but I can imagine it's all good. It can form quite a line sometimes but it's worth the wait.

TNvn-XE_m7SiM8G3Wk6I0g.text: I've never been compelled to leave a review for a restaurant. Especially a restaurant that has had so many favorable reviews. I came to Pittsburgh for a business trip and stumbled upon the Yelp reviews of best restaurants while looking for a place to dine. The reviews were so good that I thought I would be disappointed in the actual food. I lowered my expectations a tad bit simply so I wouldn't be disappointed. This restaurant blew away and surpassed all my expectations.  This place does simple and clean food, exceptionally well. And there is no better standard than that.  Also, I inadvertently  made sex noises while I ate the ribeye. This shit is real good. REAL GOOD FOOD.

TSB77bhh-E3Acet6-NomMw.text: Awesome sandwich. I recommend the sandwiches over the plates. I got the carne and it was absolutely delicious.

rEmU4qYfOUcTa0hUpvIz0Q.text: A friend who lives in Pittsburgh suggested I try this place while visiting for a long weekend. After waiting in the long line (outside I might add) for over an hour you have to order your food at the counter and cannot change once you order. The food was definitely delicious, but after waiting in the long line I was not nearly as hungry as I initially was. Two positives to the place is that it is BYOB and the menu has an enormous amount of options to chose from (some of which sell out rather quickly though but are constantly coming back as the night progresses)

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LbOY1mVAgQ-53BtnARDkBQ.text: it is nearly impossible to find a restaurant that accommodates my paleo diet - and isn't just a boring salad! Gaucho absolutely blew my mind in flavor & service, and our meal was prepared quickly (a relief because the smells in there made me salivate immediately!) My friend & I shared sides and an appetizer - do NOT skip the Provoleta, guys, seriously. We had the honey/goat cheese carrots & garlic potatoes which perfectly complimented our steaks; each was prepared to absolute perfection. I'm still dreaming about this meal, and almost went back the very next day for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious Gaucho feast

zTxtI_JnnceYQ2nnvYsSvQ.text: Meat cooked perfectly, service was excellent. we went here for lunch but I wish we would've came for dinner so I could order ten Million more things!! so flavorful. I definitely agree with this rating ! The sauces were SO good too! I understand now why they sell them by the jar!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas

WO4dgi7XF71q70hDrqyQFQ.text: Gaucho is great!  It's a very cool and unique dining experience.  The food has been consistently delicious every time I've gone.  I've always done some version of the meats, a salad, and I get the empanadas every time because they are amazing!  It is on the pricier side but worth it.  Their only downfall is the extremely long wait times on busier days.  I've waited for close to an hour before outside in the hot sun since the restaurant is so small.  My advice would be to find some way to expand or add more seating if at all possible.  It's worth waiting for but it would be nice if the lines didn't get so long!  Otherwise a great spot to check out a least once if you live in Pitt.

SyaCtK9_uzbdUhLdYkOTIw.text: Damn. Get anything. Get everything. It's all insanely good. Don't sleep on the bread pudding.

3gt2LdfCq0WEmTSo8yB0xg.text: Fives all around. Great price, great food, byob. Can't beat that. They keep the crowd moving. Be sure to try the rosemary beef sandwich.

JvxPs6bIUUzeGrfk_1EZfA.text: It may have been because of all the positive reviews, but I expected much more from Gaucho Parilla than it delivered. Don't get me wrong, the food was great, but not amazing.   I came here with my brother at what I thought would've been at an off-time. It was neither lunch nor dinner, right around 3:30pm; yet, there was still a long line outside the small entry way. Mind you, Pittsburgh had just received about a foot of snow the night before so most of the streets were empty; however, Gaucho Parilla must be doing something right for it to still have its patrons wanting it when it's freezing outside.   It being our first time here, and seeing how busy it was. We could only imagine it to be worth the wait. The prices were a little on the steeper end, but I wanted to try a little bit of everything so we shared the Parrillada Mixta (NY Strip steak, grilled chicken boob and spicy chorizo with 2 pieces of toast), an order of the beef empanadas, and a small El Gaucho salad.   The steak was prepared at a perfect medium rare and was delicious. The chicken boob [sic] was juicy and paired perfectly with the Pimenton-Red Pepper sauce. The spicy chorizo was also very tasty. The portion sizes weren't too large and honestly was the perfect amount of food.   The beef empanadas are highly recommended. The outer crust is very crispy with the innards seasoned well and yummy. I could've had just these empanadas and been perfectly satisfied, although it would've probably taken 10 of them.   I would recommend Gaucho Parilla to anyone visiting or even residing in Pittsburgh if it didn't take forever to get into the restaurant and order. I would not recommend if you're coming with a super large party, although they can very well accommodate for one.

qL19WPQ9IsqvvlUvRgtfUw.text: Came here for dinner last night for a friend's birthday. We wanted to come on a week night since the weekends are crazy packed. We got there around 6 and there was a little line. We waited in like for about 15 minutes. While we were in line a lady came around and asked how many people were in our party so that we could be seated once we ordered. I thought that was a nice touch. I ordered the small flank steak plate and an order of maiz (corn on the cob). Everything was delicious. My steak was tender and juicy. ( i got mine medium rare). The chimichurri they put on the steak is amazing! They have four sauces: a chimichurri, a garlic sauce, a Smokey pepper sauce and a carmelized onion sauce. All four were so good but the chimi and garlic are my favorite. This place is also BYOB with no corkage fee. This place is worth the visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small flank steak plate. Side of corn

73gZFB2G5pTSflrwFeZjcw.text: Best food in Pittsburgh bar none. BYOB with no corkage fee is a nice added bonus.  Whenever I have a visitor from out of town I make sure to bring them to Gaucho and they always love it. Waiting in line can be a little rough but give you the time to chitchat cause when the food comes out, it goes silent with people chowing down. Takeout is an option if you don't like waiting.  My favorites from here: - Chorizo. I wish I had known how delicious it was the first 6 or so times I've visited.  - Carne. steak sandwich with grilled onions/peppers.

bM9RvDuJmNTv7TzfA1zqNQ.text: Food is awesome at this place.  The toughest part about it is sometimes they get super busy and the wait time can get pretty long.  I've been a couple of times for lunch during off hours and got right in though.  The flank steak is incredible and I love all the different sauce options.

37G3EhLimVYGRFEG_bMXjw.text: We are visiting from out of state and let me tell you this is an AMAZING place !!! We waited around 25 mins to order and then another 20 mins for our food but it was totally worth it. We loved the vibe there, super casual with 5 star food. My boyfriend said it's definitely one of his top 3 restaurants and we have been to top restaurants all over the world! We got the Cerdo (shredded pork), papas al horno, flank steak plate and shrimp side. Everything was great but we both agreed that our fav was the shredded pork plate! Go there and enjoy ! It's worth the wait !

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cerdo Carne Gaucho Papas Camarones

t287TCydW-GBJIHrTfPs3g.text: Steak and empanadas were perfect. BYOB, come prepare to enjoy your liquid libations. Prepare for the wait during dinner but totally worth it. Will not disappoint. Staff were nice and courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye platter and empanadas

idq2ArnK6QkBTignABdgrQ.text: One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh! But forewarning, if you're going on Friday/Saturday night be prepared for long lines out the door! You wait in line to order and then are seated, where the food is brought to you. Well worth the wait though! I've been there a few times and love the skirt steak and chicken sandwiches. The meat is always so tender and the sauces that come with.... wow! Healthy, fresh, and oh so flavorful! A must eat in Pittsburgh !

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

w1WR4OA-OkxPqcvzLVtljw.text: Delicious steak and chicken dishes. I don't recall what we order but they were both really good. Chill atmosphere. Good for a hangout and a nice easy date

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

a04MEtuqyzMQ58Gso-Z6IA.text: Yesterday was my 5th time coming to this establishment.......never fails to delight.....unbelievable meat!  Great atmosphere and friendly, outgoing staff.  Only complaint would be the ordering process.... it is always a bit tedious, especially when the folks in front of you are new and not familiar with the menu

icuqOhdD-Qr3FPw3--AM1Q.text: If you're looking for a lively place with fun, flavorful dishes, Gaucho is for you! When you get inside, you need to wait until your whole party arrives before you can order, but you can pass the time by browsing the extensive menu on the board. The two times I've been there, the wait was under 15 minutes, but most nights, people wait out the door. However, the wait is really worth it! The food has so much flavor and the sauces are really yummy.   My first time there, I ordered the Qui Qui Chicky which is listed as a "small plate", but you get 4 pieces of chicken so it's forsure big enough for a meal. The next time I was there, I got the 6 oz flank steak plate. The steak was very tender and grilled perfectly! Both meals pair very well with any of the sauces. Also, there is a paella that I haven't gotten but I feel is worth it if you're in a large group of 5+ people.  Gaucho is great, and I'm only giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because I also had their empanadas which I heard really good reviews about, but I don't think they're anything to write home about.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Qui qui chicky with empanadas. The chicken by itself is a meal for under $10!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This flank steak was so tender and delicious just wow.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. flank steak plate with toast, salad, and all the sauces. Why choose one of the sauces when you can get all 4?

O5FtgzHfCl6vyrknKEwZqQ.text: We waited two hours here but every minute was SO WORTH IT! We ordered a tonnnn of food. We got the pork and vegetarian empanadas, chicken sandwich, potatoes (SO GOOD!), Qui Qui chicken, Proveletta (grilled provolone cheese), and the Cordero (braised leg of lamb). After all that food, we got flan for dessert, which was also really good! Gaucho is one of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flan
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5L4fkeV7RH77cD2uMVNjBw.text: Food= amazing, waiting in line to get into this place = not so amazing. Came on a Friday night with 4 other friends, and the line was clear outside and wrapped around the building. I've heard some great things about the food, so I decided to stick it out and wait. After about an hour and 15 minutes, we were ready to order.  I like the concept of this place, you wait in line and order and the food is brought out to your table. They also have a BYOB policy, which makes it really nice to just bring a bottle of wine to share.  Once the food arrived, I was amazed. The chicken empanada was perfectly flavorful. The chicken sandwich was absolutely huge and had the best fluffy bread. My favorite part of the entire meal though was the roasted pepper red sauce. I would put this sauce on anything and everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Look at that thicc bread
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken sandwich, chicken Empanadas, and all the sauces you can imagine

LpUzhhfYpqxT2vUgj6QAgg.text: Whenever you see a place on Yelp that has over 1200 reviews and 4.5 stars, you have to stop in and that's just what I did and I am SO glad!!!  Now I just have to convince them to open a Gaucho Parrilla in Columbus, Ohio!   For starters, if you're going to GPA, you need to get there as early as you can because the lines get really long, really quickly!  My group of four arrived at around 5pm on a Saturday night and the line was already out the door.    Once you're in the line, you can check out their chalkboard menu.  Be aware that they will erase items as soon as they're sold out of them so have a backup in mind just in case they run out before you can order.  After you place your order, the restaurant staff will hook you up with a table in their dining area.  The decor is really cool with an old western feel.  They have plenty of non-alcoholic drinks for your convenience but this is actually a BYOB establishment.  They will provide you with stemware and you can bring in whatever you want!  This is a great way to ensure you'll be able to drink what you want and it comes at a lesser cost!  They don't even charge a corkage fee.    Now for the best part: the food.  My meal at GPA ranks in the top ten meals I have ever consumed, in my life.  I am not exaggerating.  I ordered the sirloin with a side of grits.  My steak was cooked to perfection and had the most delicious seasoning.  It came with a side salad that was fresh and tasty.  I also enjoyed a piece of chargrilled toast and it was amazing!  Finally, the grits were the best I've ever had in my life and that is no tall tale.  This place gets ALL of the stars.    We all loved it and next time I go to Pittsburgh, I will likely eat all of my meals there because that city definitely has nothing that could top Gaucho Parillo Argentina.  Keep up the work, GPA!  See you next time I'm in town.  (Unless, of course, you decide to take up my offer to come to Ohio!!!)

J821gWrx4cWGoUHlIfXK5w.text: My boyfriend played tour guide for the weekend since he went to college at CMU and knew the area better than me. When I suggested this place for dinner, he said, "No way, Yinzers don't eat that." Well he was very wrong and we decided to come here at the advice of our Uber driver. We had the Asado Platter, grits, eggplant, beef and chicken empanadas. This was way too much food for two people but we had to try everything since we had limited time in Pittsburgh. The meat was perfectly charred and done medium-rare (per request) and the Asado Platter is a great way for trying all the cuts. I wish more steak houses had this option! The grits and eggplant sides were mediocre but necessary to balance out our very carnivorous meal. I felt the same way about the empanadas, there was a little too much breading for the amount of filling. In the end, my boyfriend also had to admit that this place was pretty great and that Pittsburgh has come a long way since his college days of fried mac and cheese bites, towering sandwiches, and spicy wings.   Tip: Dip everything in their 4 sauces and come early or be prepared to wait! We came 20 minutes before opening on Saturday and there was already a line of 10+ outside the door.

FLrm8cdwjy551stNMDYmjg.text: It's in the 20's and bitter cold. Place is small so with the crowd it took 15 min just to get inside. It was an hour to order (at the counter), be seated and served. It was worth the wait! I had a ribeye, sliced with chimichurri - fantastic. Potatoes with roasted garlic, very nice. And such a welcome surprise in flavor was the spaghetti squash with smoked honey and pecans. As we were eating the line waiting outside to get in was getting longer. It is worth the wait!

aLW99sT71Mnjs7NO2yQl6A.text: I cannot add much more than already was stated, but here it goes.  Waited in line for about 35 minutes to get in, but it was 65 degrees and it is February, so I did not care at all.  Walking in, greeted by a large chalkboard with all the menu items that are available.  Tons of options here and if you love meat options on your menu, then you came to right place.  We ordered two small flank steak platters (recommended by a fellow yelper) along with 6 Empanadas (2 Beef, 2 Chicken, 2 Veggie).  My steak was medium rare and was cooked perfectly.  The other half got medium and she was quite pleased.  The steak smells and tastes so darn good, lots of flavor.  The empanadas were also really good.  Nice and crisp, with flavorful 'guts' on the inside.  My favorite was the veggie, shocking for me, but it was spicy and tasty.  The staff here, for as busy as they are, are quite upbeat, fun, and courteous.  They really did a nice job.  The food was delivered within a very reasonable time-frame as well.    Though a tad on the pricier side, it is absolutely worth it.  It certainly has earned the praise it has gotten and it should continue to do so.  Go, wait in line, order up and enjoy, all worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small Flank Steak platter medium rare!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef, Chicken and Veggie Empanadas!

ZxeEaczcX4oqZgSn6JfcCw.text: This place has amazing steak. Good prices, excellent variety. Make sure to bring a nice bottle of wine with you. Will not be disappointed.

lAxwV46FPTclpflc1qhppg.text: Updating my review of the newer, bigger space!   Ample seating and review still holds True. Out of the 3 times I've come, there was only 1 time I didn't have to wait but trust me, you'll be very much rewarded for your patience.  The meat is perfectly cooked and stick to your guns; if you like rare go for it because they will get it perfect. Your veggies will be beautifully grilled and charred right to the point before it has that burnt taste. The 4 house made sauces will delight every part of your palate and try all 4 and see which one you like the best. The bread is always so crisp yet chewy...lightly brushed with olive oil, use it to soak up all the meat juice.  I'm getting hungry typing this but for all you people who can visit whenever, I envy you all. This is a must eat in Pittsburgh.

OJO236eAZk0vZ5z5Kh_Rpg.text: The only bad thing about Gaucho is how long the line can get. I've only been there a couple times because I never have time to wait in the huge line, but it would probably be worth it. The food is absolutely amazing. There aren't a ton of tables, but they seat you after you order so at least you'll know you have a place. Then they bring the food out to you too.  The sandwiches are all awesome. I love the Carne where you get to pick which cut of steak you want on your sandwich and it's paired with chimichurri, peppers and onions on delicious bread. It really holds up to the sandwich. I got NY Strip this most recent trip, but want to try them all. It was just a perfect sandwich. Depending on the sandwich you get, you'll be able to try some of their sauces. I loved the chimichurri that came with this, but also want to try one of the sandwiches where I can add my own sauce.  The roasted potato side is delicious. Also really good is the mushroom side. I'd trust any of their food. The alfajores are delicious and a great finish to your meal...if you even have room after all of the tasty food. We were told they were good with coffee, but chose not to get any this trip. I'll have to try it next time since I definitely plan to go back.

I2qjmk3GCicpCN8IU-8eKA.text: I lived in Argentina for a year and this is pretty damn authentic and unique. Highly recommend!

eo_ELQ0EcRbCu_GMqr5QPw.text: Delicious steak and vegetables roasted to perfection. Go on a weekday during off hours to avoid a wait. Friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

sIrZLufVAwq7ILn6kUvncw.text: Gaucho is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh! Every dish that I've tried there has been incredible. The employees are so nice and are happy to answer any questions about the menu. Note that Gaucho is BYOB and you'll most likely have a LONG wait outside of the restaurant.

em6uKGa3E7P05UCC_8t9CQ.text: Food is good, maybe somewhat overpriced but quality meats and delicious tasting food. I wish they had a bigger space, parking and a liquor license to serve, but some people may prefer the BYOB aspect of it.

dtU5Wlb17pn2WanSriDmHQ.text: After a busy day in Pittsburgh, nothing beats a great dinner with good food. Even though it was raining, we walked a few blocks to this place. A block away we saw a line winding out from a corner. No mistake, it was Gaucho Parrilla. Standing in the rain, I saw in the faces of the crowd resolution and passion for the upcoming dinner.  No sooner than one hour, we finally made our order and got sit down at a table. Waiting staff were very friendly. We brought a bottle of wine  and a server promptly asked how many wine glasses we need. Everything was ready, dinner was served.  Wife's Carne burger made with grilled ribeye, was truly great. She also had steak and chicken empanadas. Seeing my jealous look, she cut a small piece to share. It was good indeed. My parillada mixta was also terrific, with medium rare pink colored strip steak, blacken chicken and sausage, made a meat lover happy. I had to reluctantly share some with my wife in exchange for her generosity sharing the carne and empanadas.   Great food, reasonable price, byob no cork charge and with wine glass from the house, servers came a few times asking if need any help. Except the noise in the hall made by all the excited dinners and people waiting in line, this is a perfect dining experience for us. Five star and will be back if we are in Pittsburgh.

RXxNK44itJ3tpDl4lGBz8A.text: Amazing food. One of the best restaurants I've ever been to and well worth the wait in line. Get there early! It's byob. We ordered all the side vegetables and they did not disappoint. My favorite with the broccolini!! Wow I can't wait to go back!

pIFZPyqmpelBH9a98V2uNQ.text: All 4 times have been excellent dining experiences. Food is all so appetizing in its description on the menu, and in the finished product!  The only bizarre part of dining there is at the counter where you order and prepay, they have a big tip jar. They provide minimal assistance in table service (if you want to go back and grab dessert, you have to get back in the long line and order it yourself), so how they've earned a tip at time of prepayment, I have no idea! Pretty presumptuous!

XIBf7CLvslT2DKRFIwqwyA.text: My dad and I have heard lots of good reviews about this place so we decided to check it out today. We were told there is usually a long line so be prepared to wait. We arrived around 230 and there were only a few people in front of us which was awesome! The menu is huge and on a chalkboard wall right when you enter the restaurant. We played our order and were then seated in their upstairs dining area. Super friendly staff and an awesome environment.  We ordered two sandwiches: a pulled pork and a steak (ribeye). Both were DELICIOUS! The pulled pork came with mustard, which I am not a huge fan of, but it worked well on the sandwich. The steak was tender and soft, making it amazing on a sandwich with peppers and onions. We also got a side of corn, which comes on the cob! Super juicy and yummy! Overall an awesome experience and would definitely go back! I want to try one of the steak or fish platters the next time. The couple next to us ordered them and they looked super!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sandwiches and corn!

0xYzmYiWprEGq6b26oIQcQ.text: Hands up (for a high five) favorite place for food in Pittsburgh. Casual and fun, but most importantly DELICIOUS every time.   Meat is always cooked perfectly, and the vegetables and sides are rich and filling. The variety of self-serve sauces are a nice bonus to eat with anything and everything.  Environment inside is cozy and welcoming and extends to the back for extra seating. Small patio is also nice in good weather. BYOB -- don't forget your wines and beers.

C0cbTQLWYr7wUg0J4ghN-w.text: The food is too oily for my taste and i am not partial to the flavors. Atmosphere is nice. Just not for me.

r2Oy_FyN8EMvY_Ja7-6LDQ.text: I had really high expectations for this place, as I had heard about it from so many people. I knew we would have to wait in line, which we did, but the line went pretty fast and we were sitting down eating within a half an hour. The quality of the meat was very good, but it was not quite as delicious or flavorful as I expected. Regardless, the food was very good. It is a little on the expensive side, but worth it for the quality. Also dessert was fabulous!

pFylWYTnQYpknE51Bm4xQQ.text: This place is fantastic! I was lucky enough to come when the line was short, and even then it reached the door. I ordered the Parrillada Mixta which was a huge portion. You get a spicy or sweet sausage, grilled chicken, steak, and some crispy bread. All of the meat is extremely flavorful and juicy. The steak came out amazing tender and still had lots of juice. They give you salsas on the side that makes it taste even better. Everything is wood grilled so it has a smoky taste, too. I also ordered empanadas on the side, and total this meal was good enough for me for the day. I would love to come back, and my first time trying Argentinian food was very positive!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parrillada Mixta. Looking at this makes me salivate
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salsa station

WcLFd_mBm2eNEkkYwN2Fcw.text: That chalkboard I tell ya!! Ha jk...  The meats!!!!! AMAZING!! Seriously, if you haven't been here yet.. You're missing out!!  I was a block away and the savory aroma was sending signals to my brain directing my path.. "Come eat meat!!" Hahaha  If you don't know what to get I suggest trying the Asado Plate. It comes with 5 different cuts of meat. It's kind of pricey but worth every penny. Split it with a friend!  There are 4 different kinds of sauces. My personal favorite is the Chimichurri, a green sauce used for grilled meat! It's fantastic!  And don't leave without getting some Alfajores. It's dulce de leche sandwiched between two cookies. It's like the the French macaron of Argentina!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steakkkkk

V6H4HKRlTH4Jf3m7OtULVA.text: This place is absolutely AMAZING!!! The first time that I tried this place we came here for my birthday on a Saturday night around 6. The line was so long by then! I definitely didn't want to wait but my family insisted in waiting. We waited for about TWO hours before we ordered,  paid and sat at a table. You also grab your own plates and utensils. We had ordered the 5 different types of meat, a couple of empanadas and rice. The meal was not cheap but definitely worth it. I really enjoyed the sauces which you can grab yourself and have as much as you want. After this experience,  I came back a couple of times and tried the paella which was delicious! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone! It's a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ubinPxLHPrAHLuYdDMNtSg.text: Friendly, they know how to handle a lot of people at once (dinner rush). That is not to say it is fast. Take it easy and enjoy the time. The food came out terrific. We had bouilliabaisse, camarones, and a mushroom side. Great atmosphere. It is BYOB, btw.

FgY95GelbDvHaMMpEMW-pg.text: This restaurant is definitely a gem. The food is great and compared to other Argentine steakhouses, it is very affordable. However the line is very long, usually more than an hour on weekends so I recommend visiting only on weekdays, even then there might be a 15 minute line.

-mv0JRjjKvX_eOXz6Vsu3A.text: The steak burger was one of these meals i have ever had!!! BYOB and get ready to eat good! Great service too!

3nGYpCNK-kCT0sHzlQ6kbA.text: Best steaks you can get for a semi-affordable price. Meats are all very good, I recommend the sampler platter so you can get a taste for each type of meat! Seafood also does not disappoint either, the only reason I would give it 4 stars is because the food is a little too salty for me.

1FZ_SbfhaDk6x6XSJGfBkg.text: What an amazing ethnic restaurant and just sorry it took so long to finally stop in. The food menu is extensive and TAAAAAASTY! From the steak to the papas potatoes to the empanadas to the salad, everything was exceptional. The sauces are available to go, BUY SOME. Better than store bought hands down. The service is attentive and super friendly and helpful. You will have a wait to order but it's highly worth it. You will leave happy:)

LbDP5ujQj1Y61IH3Q7qLkg.text: Pretty good food. And the price is fair. But the wait is so weird. It took us an hour to move about 8 feet - from just outside the door to the counter. And there was almost no-one sitting.

Bp4dZ6uXne1vtXi_QvlJIQ.text: Amazing! A Pittsburgh favorite and must try! Love the food here. Genuine wood fired in an open-faced kitchen so you can see where the magic happens. Some of the tastiest meats and sides I've ever had. They DO NOT TAKE RESERVATIONS, so be prepared for lines around the block -- even in inclement weather! It's BYOB too -- I like to bring a nice bottle of Argentinian Malbec. Always a must-visit spot to bring guests from out of town. Has a young, hip vibe to it, freshly renovated space, loud, robust atmosphere, nothing fancy. Low key and relaxed but the food easily rivals some of the higher price point restaurants in the city. GO TO GAUCHO! You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Sq8CdSMDbUK2aj04FWmKQg.text: I welcome meat coma wholeheartedly when I dine at Gaucho.  Their sauces are phenomenon  (Chimmi and Ajo are my favorite).  I probably spent 25% of my dinner time contemplating about how to take some sauce home.  So standard procedure:  you can always expect a long line at Gaucho, except when it is raining on a random week night.  We waited about 20 minutes at 6:30 PM on a rainy week day.  Here's how the line works:  The line is for ordering food.  You are only allowed to order if they have a table for you.  For easy sharing, my party opted for no sandwich.  For starters, we got the chicky and beefy empanadas.  They are two-bites-and-done empanadas, so if you love empanadas then be selfish and get your own.  Knowing all the meat we were about to consume, we ordered the only non-salad vegetable on the menu:  the mushrooms. They were glazed with sauce and soft to the bite.  For the main courses, we ordered the lamp chop, ribeye, and NY strip (All small at 6 oz).  We ordered the meat at medium rare but the steak all came out a little over medium.  However, the sauces made all these problems go away.  The lamp chop was medium-rare and it was not gamey, thumbs up.  I would love to come back and try the flank, but we had a pretty amazing spread.  The special of the day was sopa de mariscos:  tomato-based soup with assorted seafood (clams, shrimp, mussels).  It's a great broth to dip your bread.  Oh, and this place is BYOB!  Apparently many restaurants are... guess we are still learning about Pittsburgh as we go.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The sauces!!!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas (chicky and beefy)
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The lamb chop

tIxjLvvO5QfazlgcTurPXA.text: My friend and I went here for her birthday today. I have never been here or heard of the place until the other day when my friend was talking about how good the food is. I decided to try it today to see for myself. I ordered the chicken and beef empanadas, the roasted carrots with goat cheese and the yerba mate tea. The empanadas were delicious very filling , the roasted carrots were probably the best I've ever had especially with the goat cheese on them they were perfect and the yerba mate tea was good it's unsweetened though so you have to add your own sweetener to it. They have salsas set up in the front of the restaurant you can get yourself to add to your food. I would definitely come back here they have so many different options on the menu I'd like to try more of them. They also have BYOB that's always a bonus!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted carrots with goat cheese and honey.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. On the right is the salsas and the empanadas and the left is the carrots with goat cheese and honey.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside seating!

KfsCMq7HtVJ3lR-lXAZFBQ.text: Gaucho has left me inspired. So inspired that I feel the need to write poetry.  A Haiku to Honor Gaucho: Meat meat meat meat meat/ Meat meat meat meat meat meat meat/ Meat meat meat meat. Yum./  AND  An Ode to Rosemary Braised Beef: Your beef is so juicy,  Your onion so sweet, Your bread is so lovely, You're the best thing to eat.  Your horseradish is horsey-- Every flavor in place. Now stop waxing poetic And get in my face!   Everything about Gaucho is perfection: the staff, the atmosphere, the sauces, and the food. There's always a line, of course, but it moves fairly quickly. This place is a well oiled machine. You order and pay at the register, grab your drinks, and give your name. Then you pray to the restaurant gods for an open table (Front of the house staff will help you with this endeavor).   Food is served up quickly and it's some of the best food that I've tasted in the Burgh. Meat is flavorful and cooked perfectly. The potatoes are little nuggets of happiness. Each of the four house sauces are exciting and distinctly delicious. I'm in love.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich: get in my face!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crème Brûlée. As delicious as it is pretty.

V6kiJQVdyoK_kccKxp9YoQ.text: So this was my first time here...it was a little different...when you first walk in there's a huge chalkboard with the entire menu of what they have to offer. Once you make your choice you can go to the cashier and place your order and they'll give you your drinks. You then proceed to another line (with drinks in hand) where you wait to be seated. When your food is ready they'll deliver it to your table and at that point you're on your own. If you want to order anything additional you have to go through the whole process all over again. For example, we thought about getting a dessert and were deterred because we didn't have the time. Outside of that the food was excellent! Everything was fresh and cooked well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burger

fOtTIRncJ4uo5nFVaC9j6Q.text: The best part for me is the BYOB policy and its nice location near the David McCullough bridge. The variety of food is great with vegetarian and pescetarian options to choose among. I had a huge fish sandwich which was yummy. The only thing I wish there was more sauce on the sandwich or to go with it. The service is different from other places - you don't get seated until you order.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish sandwich

By9eb9gJ-gTaq10di8jPkA.text: The only bad thing about this place is the LINE.  No reservation, first come first serve. The wait is about 1hr at 6pm, and more by 7pm and later.  Avoid game day (Steeler / Pirates / Pens).  It's going to be so packed, it's crazy.   Been here so many times. Sandwich on my first visit, Paella and Asado platter when I had a big party, and steak plate for 1 or 2.  If you have a big party and want to try everything, Paella and Asado platter is the way to go. Asado platter covers all the steaks they have. But Asado platter does not have salad, which individual steak plate do.    In terms of salads, go with the ones with roasted items.  I do like that hot-greens more than their mixed salad. You can add grilled items for a few dollars too. I normally get a grilled portobello for an extra dollar or two.  BYOB

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tC0HMDgNtYk0IpYc9kBW9g.text: This place is AWESOME!  If you love steak and are human, you have to make a stop at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina. Everything looked and sounded so good, so we ordered a little bit of everything. We ordered the Asado Platter which comes with all the varieties of steak that they offer, the Rusted Roots, the Chikki Empanadas and the Papas al Hornos. I wish I lived in Pittsburgh so that I can go here once a week, okay maybe everyday!  TIP...they don't serve beer/wine but they allow you to bring your own...

V5YNFdA0lWemhaCciVCS6g.text: Man! How did I forget to review this one! This was actually probably our favorite during our short stint in Pittsburgh. I heard they were expanding, but when we were there it was pretty much a small and tight space, which felt even smaller considering its rabid fans.  And you'll see why if you sample their meats. And their sauces... and just about anything they serve here. My recommendation is to get the meat platter with most of the meats... Perfect!

iCHmMYjzes-Gb8xTuXaVZw.text: Came here with my SO on a Pittsburgh trip and decided to try Gaucho Parrilla because of all the great reviews. While I was definitely INCREDIBLY impressed with the rib eye platter, and would come again on future trips solely for that, I found the sandwich and veggie platter disappointing.   We waited in line for about 45 minutes (the line is outside, beware on hot days) before were ordered and were able to sit. It seems that the hold up isn't so much space/seating as much as the fact that there is only one person taking orders, so hopefully the restaurant adds an additional register soon!   The food: -Rib eye platter: This is why you come, for the straight meat dishes. The rib eye was DELICIOUS and I'm not normally that into meat. It was cooked perfectly and was amazing on its own, but there are dipping sauces in case you want any extra flavor.  -Rosemary Beef Brisket: Good but VERY oily and very heavy. I would skip this and get one of the cuts of meat w/salad/bread instead.  -Small veggie platter: We ordered the veggie platter for something healthy in anticipation of eating way too much meat, but unfortunately the veggie platter itself was oily =/ -Peach cobbler: Solid, but no different than any other peach cobbler you've had.   *BYOB so come prepared!  *Come early to avoid the line!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosmary beef brisket
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Peach cobbler
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rib eye

u4cfvhW_Nni9vajVxsDTQg.text: So this place was good, don't get me wrong. The food came out well presented, and definitely tasty, but it was cold. I ordered a rib eye and it tasted like it had been left out on the counter for a few hours. After all the crazy raving reviews I had heard about this place, it definitely did not live up to expectations. We ordered a side of roasted red potatoes each and no one at the counter informed us that it was a larger helping that could definitely be shared. Needles to say, we didn't finish either. Bummed about this place for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6HmwLM6OCA5TrlUnM07f9A.text: My favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh. The food is fresh and well seasoned and/or marinated, without the typical overwhelming acidity or oiliness. The salads are everything -full of a variety of fresh veggies and subtlety dressed. The add-on's provide the most satisfying meal. My husband tries different items almost every time. We have never been disappointed.

y8mt5OsLRlYRVFHjSyekhQ.text: I am definitely in love with this place and enjoyed our dinner there. I would give it five stars if it was more of a sit down restaurant as I struggle with a place where you have to order at the counter and serve yourself things like the silverware and sauce.  We ordered a TON of food (empanadas, cheese appetizer, flank steak, ribeye, shrimp, pork, corn, rice, and potatoes) and it was a little over $100 - that is a deal in my book!  All the meets were incredible and the corn pudding was out of this world! The sauces are all good as well and between our group we couldn't agree on a favorite, everyone liked a different one and ultimately they were all good and complimented the meats differently.  We found a nearby wine shop where we could buy a bottle of wine as it is BYOB.  Also, I am sure this sounds crazy but the toasted bread that went along with every dish was SO good! Perfectly grilled and loaded with butter and seasoning.  The grilled corn was so good my daughter ordered a second cob after finishing the first.  If they could find a way to better serve the meats when you order it family style that would be appreciated.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Our assortment of meats and sides
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The sauces to choose from, they are all delicious!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas, delicious but not sure if I would waste the stomach space next time

qu_61EFNGVusD7NDVC52rg.text: The line out the door is totally worth it. Even in freezing temperatures. Ok, maybe not but hey, you can call and skip the line! (I totally didn't know that)  I've visited Gaucho once way before they expanded the space. I loved it then but I had to check out the new space before writing a review. Despite the added room, it's still rather an uncomfortable experience when coming here because of the cramped "waiting" area. However, there is a defined process for ordering and eating, but the board right outside the door will tell you exactly how it works which is great and prevents confusion and chaos. Usually there is a line out the door, which is dependent on when you come here of course. When there is a line out the door, the point from the door to time of ordering is about 30 minutes. Sounds crazy but it isn't that bad! Once you order and they seat you, food comes out in a snap. I think this makes up for the waiting time in line.   Anyway. Food: Everything is well seasoned to perfection here. As if the dishes weren't so bold and flavorful already, they have four sauces that are each out of this world. They're all tasty but if you aren't sure, ask them to describe what each sauce is. My favorite is the red one, Pimenton, which is a red pepper type sauce that is just great on everything. When coming here, you've got to try a steak, whether it's a plate or it's a sandwich; you can't go wrong either way. Personally, I like the plate because you still get bread plus a small salad. However, the sandwiches are huge! The sides are also absolutely amazing, especially the Brussels sprouts.   Overall, totally worth the hype (and wait) and it's not that expensive either. If there wasn't such a long line all the time, I'd probably come here much more often than I do. I highly recommend Gaucho if you haven't already tried it out for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QN15I88fr-7sfq5h8BEm9A.text: One of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh.  Every cut of meat is delicious here.  For lunch, go for one of the sandwiches.  For dinner, come with a group and order a combo platter of meat and the paella.  Best to arrive outside of meal time because the line can get long!

9cClh-u2dPjrOa_VJu1boA.text: Not only is the food amazing, but the staff are friendly and cool. Free flowing sauces as well! Rosemary Braised Beef Sammie with Horsey and Onions is my favorite!

3tArVIad_NTwR45NgykM_w.text: Best restaurant in Pittsburgh. Green sauce on the steaks was some of the best steak sauce I've ever had. Garlic bread and brussel sprouts were also A. Get yourself a nice bottle of red and enjoy a meal and wine at half the price of some of the nicest Steakhouses in Pittsburgh. Casual, fun.

NKpQjlylSZjBGxcNsSqxag.text: I had an high expectation when I visited Gaucho.  However, I was kind of disappointed with their seating and waiting system.  I have nothing to say about their food.   The food was amazing but seating was confusing.  I hope they improve their system.

XDZgMfpWQXa6Q_clYgwmOA.text: The food here is amazing. Really nice dipping sauces for your sandwiches.

4hr6o-jjndXI5U2jr7jgsg.text: Another 5 star little spot in Pittsburgh. My brother found this place on yelp when they came to visit me and we went before the remodel. It was a tiny place, only seating was outside but it was well worth the cramped quarters. I got the lomo (filet) sandwich and added some chimichuri sauce for a delish finish. The sandwich itself was a ton of meat, cooked to perfection and the chimichuri was a nice spicy/fresh finish. A+ on the sandwich. Loved the ambiance of the small place too, menu written on the chalkboard, loud cooks and a friendly guy taking my order.  I recently went back and found that they were remodeling. I didn't know and was disappointed that I didn't get to fulfill my Argentinian steakhouse sandwich needs for that day. BUT I went back and LOVE LOVE LOVE what they did with the place. They moved right next door into the vacant building that was next to them. I think it may have been another restaurant at some point. The decorations are adorable, very Latin American/retro. They have expanded their menu to include salads, appetizers, veggies and other items, including breakfast.  There was already a line at 11 on Sunday when they were getting ready to open. We were first in line and I couldn't help myself and had to get the Carne con Pan. So steak, bread, onions, red peppers and chimichurri. I had the filet again and my partner had the ribeye. Both were delish and spot on. I also ordered some grilled corn, which was also spot on.  Can't say enough good things about this place. Will continue to frequent and hope their business thrives, they deserve it!

2r7X9rO3k_fTycbQbNK9qw.text: The beef was top notch.  The sauces are great.  The non-beef was just okay.

Gz56SyZjxBl-ORdrH0SL6Q.text: Meat had good flavoring. Loved the variety of sauces available. Vegetable empanadas are the best. I also had chicken empanadas, but feel in love with the veggie. Sevice was excellent. Only gave it a 4 due to gnats near our table and sauces.

t-kzlxldchQi8QzIxRe5Eg.text: What an amazing restaurant. A few friends & I decided to stop here after walking around in the strip. I ordered the steak burger with avocado & bacon. The staff was so nice & can educate you on the food you're ordering. My friends & I sat outside on their patio - beautiful day outside. The burger I got was amazing. I will rave about it forever. It was juicy, wood fire grilled & I watched the cook cut the avocado that went on my burger. Everything was so fresh. 5 million stars for this place!!! I only wish it was bigger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burger with avocado &amp; bacon. Absolutely Amazing!!

K5O8LDHVzNAJWQY3GsqAww.text: Wow. That's all we could say after dinner at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina. It is WONDERFUL! We went on a Friday directly after work (got there about 4:45) and there was no line so we stood there and chatted with the guy manning the counter and the guys in the back added their two cents as well. I order the chicken sandwich and it was amazing. I am so glad this places as popped up! It's a must try for anyone in Pittsburgh!

H3v1S6m_K5PAwwQ_hc7nVQ.text: Absolutely love Gaucho. Got the steak sandwich with a side of the empanadas. I'd been wanting to try their empanadas for awhile but towards the end of the week they sometimes run out. But not this time! Unfortunately I found the empanadas a bit on the salty side, so I'm not sure I'd get them again. However, the steak sandwich was fabulous. The bread was wonderfully crunchy and the meat was done perfectly. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ChSU5TF_xlSeVZ0-xHPX4Q.text: This place gets better every time we come. Haven't had one bad dish and everyone working here is happy and helpful. Definitely one of our regulars on the food rotation!

pgvPmwYZdJnwUDDesWDsxg.text: The chocolate is out of this world! Tried the bacon chocolate and pretzels they both were amazing!

d2dEAtp4FFyH8C_ZOHef3A.text: Food is good and I appreciate that they don't have a cork fee.The food is pretty heavy and the sauces are oily so I always have a kinda upset stomach the day after. :(

mUf40JeeJQC8BRPOPgg4hw.text: Just stumbled across Gaucho when down in the strip. Tried the Veggie Con Pan and was a huge fan of the wood grilled taste.  Lots of flavor and several vegetarian options.  Nice to have a new lunch option in the strip a short walk from the office.

BSu1ZThSFC56WC6yuuZXDg.text: Huge line on Saturday night. We waited 45 minutes outside on the street before stepping in to order. I had a ribeye sandwich and she had a pork platter. The ribeye was juicy, but tough and not trimmed of the gristle and silver skin. Huge sandwich on ciabatta bread with roasted peppers and chimichurri sauce. Difficult to hold and eat. The pork platter was shredded and was served with grilled onions and a salad. The meal was ok, but not worth 45 minutes in the cold with the exhaust from the broiler blowing all over us. Maybe better on a warm evening and different menu selections. (The staff looked like they had gotten off from their day jobs at Trader Joe's and come straight to the restaurant: A lot of colorful hair, piercings and ink.)

yOeDCHzbfFW0510eM8sJrg.text: The food was very average...I felt like I spent way too much on something that I could have prepared better at home. On our way out the door we noticed that it smelled like a dirty mop. It was just not worth the money or the trip!

FUQlSuhN56D7KWzjX1QLHg.text: Closest you will ever get to Buenos Aires, Argentina.  Great Job!!!

QL9NOE6TqyE-HkiyQBDcdQ.text: 5 star rating? Well worth it. They are currently expanding to larger location incorporating the next door location. Tried the Bondiola and Ribeye steak sandwich. For apps we did steak empanadas with papas cuna. Came out excellent. Service was phenomenal. Well worth it and will come back next time I'm in town.

e8DLNoXBcABISEUbha0Smg.text: I really really enjoy this place. I think the food is just simply wonderful. My husband and I typically get the same feast every time we go: we'll start with the provoletta and picada, and we'll both typically get the rosemary braised beef sammy. OMG to all of the above, especially the provoletta and the sandwiches. Great place.

PNk6SdWYtx8bxh_1-xW1qw.text: I've been meaning to try Gaucho for some time now but they're only open on certain days and they close so early. Well, it was definitely worth the wait because the sandwiches are AMAZING! The skirt steak sandwich melted in my mouth and the roasted tomatoes and sauces complemented the sandwich perfectly. Highly recommended!

IqKhG_1t4wkPfAQq5T8TtQ.text: Amazing.  Amazing steak, amazing steak and amazing sauces.  My rating is for the food.  My review of everytthing else. There is very little seating (a surprise), and the seating there is, it is outside and uncovered.  There must be room for eight people to sit inside and that includes 8-10 barstools at counters. It appeared that most of the customers get their food take out. There are no servers, really, although someone nice nice came to our table and delivered the food.

RJrKYAsDFSNiUnmci9Gj-Q.text: In town for a visit from a Maryland. Decided to venture to Gaucho for the Carne sandwich. It was one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. Also enjoyed the papas, in all of the 4 different sauces, and the spicy chorizo.  This will become a regular stop when in the area.

0sYAwS-s3BBBfyI5OaPC6w.text: The filet mignon carne con pan is one of the best sandwiches I've had anywhere.  Also the braised beef, and caldo del mar are delicious as well.

ZjpOHayh1XHQf1WAOPeHxw.text: This is easily the best food I have ever had in my entire life!  A lingering warmth is left behind for hours after I eat here.  Seriously, that does happen!  The cost is more than reasonable with this quality and quantity.  I have eaten a variety of dishes but my standby is the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich.  Eating any other sandwich anywhere else at this point is blasphemy.

tT3EUGVKBM63pJnYDieBmw.text: Amazing sandwiches! Had to stand to eat, but worth it anyways. The empanadas Haf a great spice to them. We also tried the skirt steak and spicy chorizo sandwich which were awesome - both had peppers and caramelized notions, yum. The bread is fantastic, and the chimichurri is sooo good.

J3LVNh5jIAqu_puNt-HR9A.text: Believe the hype. Carne sandwich is amazing. Try all four sauces. I can't decide which is my favorite. They are all distinct and amazing. Get the toast for a buck and dip in all the sauces. Staff is super friendly and helpful. Awesome spot.

C_2kxkH2temf4cEscqu55w.text: We went here on a Saturday afternoon. We had to wait about 20 minutes to order, which wasn't too bad. I like the set-up of ordering first and being given beverages at the front counter before you're seated. It's pretty efficient. However, given that there aren't actual servers I would expect the place to be a little cleaner. I realize it was super busy, but we had to "clean" off our own table using a napkin. Seating is limited and first-come first-serve. I can't imagine trying to eat here with a party bigger than 2-4 people. Next time, I'd order food to go, instead of eating on top of someone else's food remains. I'm generally not picky about a few left-behind crumbs, but this was particularly messy and there was also garbage on the floor. On a positive note, the carne sandwiches were fantastic and perfectly cooked to our liking. We got the flank sandwich and the New York Strip sandwich. We preferred the flank since the Strip was a little harder to eat on a sandwich and had a lot of fat. We also got an order of papas, which were okay. There wasn't really anything special about them. I really liked the different self-serve sauces.  I'll definitely be returning for sandwiches to go.

aUDqe65cyCVMLjW-DqBdFQ.text: I took an older gentleman for lunch at the Gaucho Parrilla Argentina. The remodeling that was done to the restaurant allowed for comfortable seating and the service was great. I felt the sandwich's we ordered were over priced for what you got.....yes they are big sandwich's but are mostly a bread bun with not a lot of meat (not satisfying for big meat eater's). I ordered a braised beef which was very tasty and my friend ordered a roasted pork sandwich which he felt was over cooked (dry). A server recommended next time to get a "disassembeled" sandwich on a plate which she said would have more meat on it since the meat is not stacked between the bun.

rvwzmXRgEEsvIdDr2iqQwQ.text: Great food - worth the wait! We arrived at 6:30 on a Saturday night and waited in line for an hour, 45 minutes of which was outside. We made friends with other people in line and started the party. We opened our wine, which made the time go faster. Bring cups and an opener! For our meal, the four of us shared everything. Universally, I'd say that the smoky, charred flavor from the oven carried through deliciously across all dishes. -Asado Platter - Fabulous. I would take a piece of the steak on the toast with some sauce - the red pepper was my favorite. -Sprauhts - Perfection -Campfire Yams - Unexpected favorite. This was unbelievably sweat and delicious. -Argentino Ensalada - Great balance to all of the meat we enjoyed. -Empanadas (chicken and beef) - The only disappointment. There was a lot of dough and wasn't all that flavorful. The next time we come, I would arrive earlier to avoid the line. Also, I would not get the Empanadas and instead try the chorizo or shrimp.

bgHD4bL6yoMf24F-QrJkyQ.text: Perfect.  Friendly atmosphere and just top-notch food.  The steak sandwich, the camerones, the grilled vegetables, etc.  The best I can say about it is that I am so torn between wanting to tell the world about this place and wanting to keep it my little secret!  Highly recommended.

1nYoA9YalS7HtQcUS1Wrdg.text: This place is tiny but well worth the trip.  This is one of the best meals I have had in Pittsburgh ever!!!  We got the mixed plate with steak, chicken and chorizo and every bite was amazing.  Best steak I have had in years!!!  Some yelpers said pricey for a walk in shop with no tables but the quality of the food far surpasses many fine dining places in Pittsburgh!!!  This meal would easily cost you $100.00 at a fine dining establishment.  If you go out to eat for the food above all else this is the place to go.  Amazing & I have been thinking all week about my next visit!!!  YUM!!!

4q7tOlIx642F-xjXIbixpg.text: A must visit in PIttsburgh.  Wish I lived closer so I could eat here every week!

9ivraKIbi3KeuseqG_vKSw.text: My friend took the guy she was seeing at the time and said it had awesome food and was BYOB. Its hard to tell if the food is good because my friend is a vegan but she was completely right about Gaucho. The sandwiches are amazing and big! We had arrived there around 3:30 on a Saturday and most of the food was sold out, especially the bread.  We had ordered the chorizo which was unlike any chorizo I had ever tried. It was suppose to come with bread but because they wanted to save the bread for sandwiches, so no bread. But we had also ordered a steak sandwich and grilled corn. The corn was amazing. Sweet, char-grilled. So good. The steak sandwich was good too and with the added sauces that they have out. One, if not the best steak sandwich. I can't wait to go back! I also love the smell driving past Gaucho! If that aroma doesn't get you, there's something wrong with you! Hahaha.

f_D8UPpDnUi2E8C0_S0QnA.text: Wow, what unique food at a wonderful value! Does it get any better?! Friends urged us to try the Gaucho Parrilla Argentina food at a Yelp! event and it was absolutely mouth watering. The staff was very helpful and nice and served us even though there was 10 minutes left to go of the event. I tried the Rosemary Braised Beef: "Horsey sauce and caramelized onion" and the Chanchito: "pork tenderloin, pickled onion, mushroom and arugula." The Rosemary Braised Beef was pretty good. I pretty much love anything with caramelized onion, so I knew I wouldn't be disappointed, but I didn't know that this beef dressed with horse radish was going to be so good! The horse radish flavor was subtle but you definitely tasted it every bite. I'm not a usual fan of horse radish, but the hint of it on the beef really made the dish exquisite. I favored the Chanchito dish over the beef though. The pork with the arugula, pickled onion and mushroom was just the perfect amount of flavors that complimented each other in a way that most palettes haven't been accustomed to! It was a unique way to dress up pork and a flavor experience like none other! I am so happy this Yelp! event introduced me to Gaucho's amazing eats! I already have my eye on a couple dishes and I cannot wait to try more food from Gaucho!

sUV607wOVKmUOUstK6SqVA.text: I thought this was a sit down restaurant and so asked 3 other couples to meet us there. Luckily we got there early enough to secure an outside table for 8.  The staff there were SUPER helpful and friendly.  We had 3 hardcore vegetarians in the group and we had plenty for us. The carnivores could not talk enough about how amazing the meat was. Super affordable.  LOVE THIS PLACE!  The portions are great. Its BYOB - which we loved.  We ordered the porkchops,steak, shrimp, and everything was amazing.

mOWIccw5Xb2YG6xFnaAbGA.text: I didn't believe this place could live up to my expectations but my food was simply incredible. After much internal debate I got the skirt steak sandwich. Perfect grilled bread and tender meat at just the right temp.   Service was also fantastic. The guy taking orders came out from behind the counter and gave us a thorough run down of the menu. His enthusiasm was refreshing and a great example of what service should be like.  Can't wait to try this place again.

qzFcdAO3EsiYY-jXT_UpMg.text: Perfect in every way. Simple plates, amazingly prepared. If you don't try this place, you all sorts of crazy.

E9ITOv0CzYSHnWI48EtY-A.text: Best food in Pittsburgh. Their steak sandwiches are awesome and totally worth the price. Also, they recently expanded the size of the restaurant so it can fit more people.

Sc7VD00ZOwdnIM3pJR-1sw.text: Wow is this place as great as everyone says!  I need to figure out a way to eat at this place more often!!!

UeW2z-edls8fsEh6-7jdhQ.text: Really good steak try the steak burger.   Sauces are incredible and the price is good.

lQzqDZ3_PZ0jiAlJGAO7IA.text: I heard great things about this place and that it was a "must" when visiting Pittsburgh. After waiting nearly an hour in line, we finally ordered from their giant menu of items. (Its an order first, then sit down and we bring the food to you place). The only thing I can appreciate, but would rather have them do differently is the presentation of the menu. It's on a giant blackboard when you walk in and they use odd words for simple ingredients, so you're standing there just trying to figure out what's in the food (for example: shrooms = mushrooms, grass = asparagus).   Aside from the menu, the service was nice up front (great manager, he will always find a seat for you and your party), however the servers that wait the tables are very unprofessional. All the staff where whatever they want and it's not very helpful when you need to flag someone down. There was a woman with half her stomach hanging out in very short shorts...not pleasant.   On to the food...the salad I ordered was amazing & very tasty. The empanadas were bland and too pricey ($3/ea.) I still agree that if you're in the area, you must come try the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KsdndetFK7z9HFcf2BGr5g.text: What can I say that already hasn't been said? It's True, everyone loves Gaucho for a reason. It could be the atmosphere, it could be the food, it could be the incredibly friendly service, chefs, staff, anyone you end up meeting or cramming next to for lunch.  If you eat meat, get some meat. If you don't eat meat, you have fantastic options. Regardless of your (possibly non-)carnivorous preferences, get some corn. Honestly, you can't go wrong closing your eyes and just choosing anything on the menu at random. Come with a few more people and convince them you know what you're doing so you don't feel too guilty choosing more than one thing at random.  What makes a great restaurant? I'm not so sure, but I think Gaucho has it figured out. This is the best restaurant in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. spicy chorizo, pepper, onion

dN5vnKd8klg_Fl500tHh5Q.text: The food here...wow! If you don't like this something is wrong with your taste buds, the food is excellent and I mean everything on the menu, we had a party of 6 and we ate a lot of food but it was all amazing, I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food!!!

D9_J_c6Ei1LfuSHLkEXLEQ.text: This place is amazing! I really was contemplating walking out of the 30 minute line, but boy am I glad I sucked it up and waited. I've since come back 2x! So yes, you'll probably have to wait in line, and as a heads up you need to order all your food at once and pay for it right there. So plan in our 30 min wait on everything that you want to eat.   One of the great things about Gaucho is that they are a BYOB. I've failed at remembering this both times, but hopefully someone reading this will benefit from this! Bring your wine or beer, they do not serve alcohol.  Hmm recommendations on what to get - beef empanadas, shrimp, steak.. and as I'm writing this I'm realizing I don't think you can go wrong with anything you order.  But the shrimp is some of the best I've had, and we got the party/group order of steak. Can't remember what it is called but comes with all the cuts of meats they serve - it was phenomenal and great for sharing with a group.   They have the best salsas and sauces so don't forget to get some of these, chimichurri, garlic, and 2 others that I can't remember off the top of my head. All were very tasty and went well with the meats.  You can also order take out, but beware when you walk in to pick up your food and people are standing in line waiting they will give you the evil eye as you walk out with their food while their bellies are rumbling, of course I didn't do that ;).

6vzqleNrsZ6UqrEerq3cnQ.text: After reading about this place for a couple years I was finally able to visit while I was in Pittsburgh on business. After waiting in line for 90 minutes by myself I finally ordered the ribeye. Oh my. This steak was on the short list of best things I've ever eaten. I went back the next day well aware of the wait and ordered the steak sampler. It was really good, but I definitely recommend sticking with the ribeye. This place is a must visit if you like steak and you're in Pittsburgh.

oJAPJxAHnyflB78AiSybfg.text: Three stars because the line is stupid. Figure out the serving system. Is it McDonald's or is it a sit down restaurant?   When you finally get into a seat - after waiting an ungodly amount of time, regardless of how long you perceived the line to be (it's always longer than you estimate) - you feel guilty for staying and enjoying yourself for even a second because you have the thought of the other hangry patrons waiting in that stupid line.   Buck up and be a regular restaurant. It makes no sense and doesn't cater to the regular person who enjoys your food tremendously but doesn't have the time to sit and wait for it. The food is good but is it worth that wait? Probs not more than once or twice.

xnGAqGQ6AOrIfroNjCAl5Q.text: This was an amazing find in Pittsburgh! The most delish salad and topped with filet mignon. Everything looks delish here. Yummy veggies and proteins. Excellent service! And to top it off no cork fee! If your in the city it's a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9mWCrBnMf3fP5aDiZrmXhg.text: Gaucho had been on my radar since they first opened,however, I was unable to visit until recently on a trip back to my hometown to visit my family. My mom and I stopped by on a Friday around 12:30pm. The line was relatively short at this time , but by the time we left it was out the door and around the block. When you finally make it past the front door, you are met with a chalkboard featuring the menu-all of which made me salivate while reading it.   My mom and I, after a few questions about the menu to the lovely cashier, decided to split the Rosemary braised beef sandwich with carmelized onions and horsey sauce. The beef was perfectly seasoned and quite tender. The carmelized onions added a nice sweetness complemented by the kick from the horsey sauce. They have sauces you can choose from and I highly recommend the garlic as it went well with this sandwich. The bread was fresh and was a stealthy vessel for the beef. We also split a side of mushrooms with shallots and rosemary. While these were excellent on their own, I'd recommend adding them to the braised beef for extra flavor. Gaucho is BYOB and I noticed several tables, even on a Friday afternoon, taking advantage of this. We both got Diet Coke and never experienced less than half full glasses. Service was top notch and we were checked on a couple of times throughout our meal. I definitely buy into the hype here and would absolutely return on my next trip back to the Burgh!
