The quality of this food cannot be surpassed considering time and price.   As a paleo-eater, this is going to be a mainstay this Summer. I can't wait to enjoy the outdoor space!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. We ordered the triple meat plate to share - chorizo, chicken, and steak. So. Good.

NeTja8EUfxlVAdJ31LLnaA.text: I came here with my mom on a Tuesday night, around 7:45pm. When we arrived, the smell outside was amazing and there was a line around the corner, so we knew this place must be good!  The wait was pretty long - probably about 30 - 45 minutes (which is pretty popping, for a Tuesday!) When you get inside, you order your food and drinks at the counter, get a seat, and they bring your food to you.   We ordered the small flank steak plate, a steak sandwich, and an order of the carrots. All of the food was 10/10 - tasty, well prepared, plated beautifully, and well worth the wait! You get a lot of food for your money (it was $30 for all that!).  Overall, I would definitely recommend this place as an affordable but exciting dinner spot!

2jOxJyHpzdMaMbTAQbomzg.text: I can't add anything other reviewers haven't already covered.  These folks know how to make an amazing sandwich, and it doesn't cost a million dollars.  Hopefully you aren't a vegetarian.

xC02KFg2gj9XqiQRsS7Rzg.text: Amazing food, cute space, and efficient even when they are super busy and have a long line. This place is an absolute must in Pittsburgh!

MQaqiVCVd6mzFrypYO8H-A.text: It's a very hot summer afternoon. We walked into the place which had a nice crowd. We discussed a few minutes before ordering.  The order system is order at counter then they ca your name then delivery to your table.  We ordered pork and steak small dinner which was 6 oz of meat and it's plenty.  We also ordered potatoes, corn and empanadas as appetizers. We tried all 4 sources and all every wonderful. Highly recommend this place for a causal place. I do a complaint was the music might be too loud. The table was pretty big so we couldn't hear our conversation too well. Other then that food was excellent.  I do love the pickled onion in the salad and the real caramelized onions on the side with the pork.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 4 different sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork and steak dinner. Potato, corn and empanadas as side dish

XLcMzpW70iOMloXJX-r8Rw.text: OMG! What can I say.  The food is awesome. We started off with the Provoletta (delicious), and then had the NY strip large plate and the Camarones (shrimp) large plate.  Husband and I shared; and loved both meals. Each plate had buttery toasted bread and a leafy salad.  The center table had 4 different sauces to choose.  All were wonderful.  Every bite of food is nicely seasoned.  Wanted to try the potatoes but they had ran out and didn't know if they would be ready for the meal so we had to pass on them.  We almost walked out because there are only several stools to sit on or you can stand at the small table in the center but the aroma kept us there.  There were non-stop people coming in too.  But we honestly didn't wait all that long.  The good news is they are renovating the bldg next door which is supposed to be the restaurant part and where they are currently is going to be just the kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. New York Strip large plate &amp; Camarones large plate; Gaucho Parilla Argentina
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provoletta, Gaucho Parilla Argentina

t1wg0lN7-M-2YTfYKzYF0Q.text: Argentinian meats are soooo good!   Great atmosphere and decor, BYOB, great service and cleanliness for the shear volume of people that get food here. It has quickly climbed the ranks of Pittsburgh and established itself as one of the top restaurants in the city. Best part its affordable, they are not fluffing you witch extra cost or lack of food.   I have always gotten the sandwiches and the empenadas. My favorite sandwiches:  1.Braised Beef  2. Carne  3.Pollo  4.Fish       Empenadas are all really good..   Dont forget to taste the sauces and use the favorite on your food!  Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the Burgh, I always bring people here .

RzAPJcos0NjQn5ho8qvIqg.text: Um..YUM! Every sauce was awesome, best potatoes ever, how do I make those?? I'm going home to try! The staff was friendly, our food came quickly and I wish I lived closer so I could try more items!

1sS8VEqQ381qRtqLkYyqfQ.text: Yep, Gaucho is about as good as it gets. I went last night with 4 of us. 5 total. We waited in line outside for about 25 minutes before we made it in. I've had some sandwiches before here, so I know how good it is. Everyone else knows also I guess. We brought a bottle of wine which they corked for us for free. I got the house Paella. It was amazing. It says feeds 4-8. 2 of us got that as our meal and I gave a leftover box for all 5 of us. Carne sandwich, Shrimp side with sage and butter, Fish sandwich and a burger. Everything was awesome. The servers are fast and there to fill up your drink. Everyone is friendly. I highly recommend this place. Not expensive, great food, great service. One of my fav spots in the burgh.

EV2aT6204CG99PCQDbUIdQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh!  Just wonderful.  everyone I take there thanks me with amusement.  Food is delicious, fresh, well prepared, staff is nice and cordial.  I just wish they took reservations because the line is quite long at times, but don't be discouraged.  It is worth the wait!!

6Cslu6craOnwSoi2Pw4NvQ.text: Good food. However the owner was rude. We walked in and started to look at the menu on the wall and he immediately came over and started barking about keeping the path clear for existing customers. I won't go back because of that d***, no matter how good the food was.

W4EaUlH_7ubERF1rDor9-g.text: Great Service and wonderful food! Finished every last bite wishing that there was more. A little bit pricey for your typical college student but definitely a great place to BYOB and chill with some close friends. It's a nice and chic updated place they got there.   If you're a fan of meat, it is a must that you go here.

-UsDOnY4skfXktq-HWYWSQ.text: Visiting Pitt from Philly and this is easily the best restaurant I've ever been to. Everything on the menu is amazing and perfect, from the meats to the salads to the side dishes. The atmosphere is friendly and warm and the lines are definitely worth it.

0cDcaU5vxmZrDTVwmHSZRQ.text: Great food. Very casual with a friendly staff. The roasted vegetables were amazing. I will definitely be back.

WPaoUF5WwEN0Ntqy1DoK1g.text: I'm Argentinian, so when I heard there was a restaurant in Pittsburgh that served Argentinian meat, I was ecstatic. It's really hard to find beef and steaks in America that match the texture and flavor of Argentinian steak. There is a world of difference between how cows are grazed, and therefore how they taste, in America and in Argentina. A few details: 1. Argentinian cows are actually of a different breed than American cows. 2. Argentinian cows eat zero corn. Nothing. None. Cows can't process corn well, which is why in America cows need a ton of antibiotics to survive. 3. Argentinian cows live in large, flat plots of green and healthy land, rather than in cages or small plots of land. Because of these reasons, no matter how you cook American beef, it will never taste like Argentinian beef. The food at El Gaucho is pretty good, don't get me wrong, but it would be a stretch to call it Argentinian. I couldn't recognize at least half the items in the menu. The chimichurri, as well as the chorizo, didn't taste quite like it does back home. I heard the owner is American and actually lived in Brazil for a long time, so this may explain the inauthenticity of the food.  I bet that for someone who has never been to Argentina, this restaurant will be a good place to eat meat. But for the Argentinians expecting to get a taste of home... don't come, you'll be disappointed.

ErFyBNZd97kOUAhw9bfz6w.text: I was sold on this place the minute I walked in the door and was greeted by the heavenly aroma of grilled meats.  If I had it to do all over again, I would order differently; but this place is awesome.   I ordered the skirt steak sandwich, the grilled corn, and the fried potatoes.  All were absolutely delicious!     So why would I order differently?  One - because I'd want to try more stuff.   But mostly because I ordered way too much food and I'd prefer something a little easier to eat.   The sandwich was great.  Flavorful, and nicely commplimented by charred red peppers and onions.   The ciabatta bread was a nice choice, but skirt steak is a tougher cut, which perhaps would have been better in a non-sandwich form.   It was tasty, but really hard to eat.   Next time, I would order the filet or something that is a little more tender - or get it in a salad or something.   The corn was served with the folded back husk as a handle.   Would absolutely order that again.  The potatoes were also good, but completely unnecessary.  The sandwich and the corn were more than enough.    Overall, this place is a winner.  Not good for groups, since it is tiny.  Maybe six seats inside and eight tables outside.   Staff members weree super friendly and took the time to explain everything - including the four complimentary sauces (all of which were good).

i6DWSEQDYtv68iDfM40Zeg.text: Popped in while looking for a quick bite. This place is simply amazing. Isabel was great in guiding us towards the beast meats and explained in detail the different cuts. We opted for flank steak with fungos and vegetables and we couldn't be more happy.  Great meal, best in Pittsburgh so far!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing flank steak!

vxfm28BRgkkRxjwL5aWGhw.text: Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is one of the absolute best restaurants I've ever had the pleasure of eating at. This is our go to place and is well worth waiting in line to get in. The food quality is always superb and the service is always friendly and fun. They do a great job of keeping the food consistent every time and keeping the quality very high even though they are always swamped.   The rosemary braised beef is one of my favorites and always has a delicious wood fired taste with great caramelized onions, a delicious horseradish sauce and homemade bun. I like to put their AJO sauce on it for an extra bite.   The provoletta dish of melted provolone cheese on top of house made bread with an assortment of olives and arugula is also a delicious side to any meal and their wood roasted corn is to die for!  When I first moved back home to Pittsburgh after an extended stay in Florida the first place we went on the way home from the airport was Gaucho.

O-gIwPSBvoyt1_tigqXvgg.text: Definitely one of the best Restaurants in Pittsburgh. Quality is consistent. Also extremely friendly and eclectic staff. The boy with the pink hair was really cute and nice. Great place for lunch or to take the fam to in the early evening.

eanTF1LCOl-9iT6fPU9O7Q.text: This go around, I was a bit hungrier so I ordered the steak burger ($10) medium well with candied bacon and Spanish blue cheese as my freebie toppings (additional toppings are 50 cents ea.). The burger was served neatly between two thick slices of bread (not sure of the type). In addition to the burger, I also ordered a side of their brussel sprouts and rice. A plentiful amount of sprouts are served with candied bacon. They're quite tasty, but I'm not sure I'd give them the award for best sprouts in the city. The rice was quite bland and flavorless. The majority of the rice was soft, but some pieces were crunchy and ultimately got stuck in my teeth - unsure if that's the way the rice is meant to be served. Brought my own wine and wasn't charged a corkage fee (unsure if they even charge one).   Sat in the back of the restaurant. What should be a 4/5 experience became a 3-3.5 due to a number of fruit flies swarming around the table. Originally sat in the back right corner, but moved a bit closer to the center of the room in an effort to avoid them - unfortunately, this didn't help as they just followed my trail. By the time we finished up, we had caught two flies in a wine glass. I mentioned something to one of the employees who seemed shocked and noted that she had been at the restaurant since 10A and hadn't seen any (strange?). Anyway, she said she'd mention something to one of the managers.   The place started to get busy closer to 7:30 and I could tell we were subtly being pushed out the door when two employees started cleaning everything off the table. We got the hint and left.

BE6zc1GkQJciOzF_-vf-Kg.text: If the line is out the door and half way around the block... WAIT!! It will be worth it! I got the flank steak sandwich and it was one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten. The steak and chimichurri sauce is the perfect combination. The sandwiches are all on focaccia bread which is delicious, but I highly recommend getting it "de con" (without bread) as it's actually hard to eat as a sandwich. I pulled mine apart and ate the meat and grilled vegetables with chimichurri  then dipped the bread in the sauces separately as a side. They have 4 great sauces for you to try with your meal. They're set out so you can take as much or little as you'd like of them.  Tip - Call your order in for take-out so you can skip the line!

EPu9UZDNMeIov6jaIH7K2w.text: Came here with a friend based on recommendations of other friends. This place lives up to the hype! I ordered the NY strip steak medium rare. My only complaint was that the steak came out medium, not medium rare. Regardless, it tasted delicious with all the sauces available. The salad and the toasted bread were also good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

V0bWVyRaFfUFDE9BxDvBMQ.text: The food is delicious, as good as it gets.  The set up, trying to get a table can be a little taxing.  We had seven and all the tables and counters were taken and it did not look like any table was ready to leave so we shared a little table on the patio and were offered a few extra seats from a couple of other tables. We shared the NY strip, ribeye, flank steak, veggie platter, potatoes, corn pudding and shrimp, and pork.  All very good, cooked perfectly and with a nice wood smoke flavor.   The four condiments were good on everything and are made in house.  BYOb and enjoy!

VWmrRvWZUW2FodVJTjhE4g.text: On my way to Pittsburgh one of the places that I was really looking forward to was Gaucho. We came here on a Saturday, standing in the line with a 12 pack as the smell of their wood fired grill was taking over the whole street. Apparently there is always a line here. We waited for 45 minutes (and yes it is worth it). As I was standing in the line, I couldn't help myself not hearing how locals exalt this place. I ordered their filet sandwich and the rosemary braised beef sandwich (for to go). The winner was the filet, but with a small difference. The first bite that I took from my filet sandwich, was overwhelmingly tasty. The meat was cooked to perfection, and the roasted peppers in the sandwich had this unbelievable smoky flavor which added a lot to the sandwich. The sandwiches here are served on ciabatta which makes them even more delicious.   As far as the appetizers go here, we got the Caldo del Mar (seafood soup) and the Papas Cuna (potato salad) . Both were truly mouth watering and tasty. The Papas Cuna is a must. Probably one of the best potato salad I've ever had! I have no idea how can a potato salad taste so rich and creamy.   The service here is relatively fast, and the staff here are very friendly. You order at the register, and sit yourself and they bring it to you. The atmosphere inside is trendy, and pretty cool. But, again I don't think it's necessarily for me to talk more about the atmosphere. Who goes there for the atmosphere. I wish we had Gaucho in the Bay Area.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood soup
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potato salad
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet sandwich

O7p2Zn5I8EAlZUd55YbIDw.text: Did I really forget to review this place?! Been here a couple times (I very rarely get to the Strip, but I have much more of a reason to go now that I've found this place!). LOVE the grilled veggies. I feel like their "thing" is meat, but wow these veggies are amazing. I am not the type to choose a veggie sandwich, but after having some of them on a salad on my first trip, I went for it the next trip--and I didn't miss the meat. I also love their bread. I love unique eats, and this fits the bill. Nothing too bizarre, but def not your usual fare, either. Wish I could go more often!

DQswnfQQCsWedwqiOWR2Bg.text: I went to Gaucho Parilla two weekends in a row -- the first time was forgettable (I got the rosemary braised beef sandwich which was only ok), but the second time was soooo good.  I hear that they used to be much smaller and not really have seating, but the new place, although there is a wait, has basic seating after you've ordered at the front, and the servers are all so nice and helpful.  As everyone has said: GET THE STEAK SANDWICH. We got the ribeye cut, and it was a spectacular slab of beef. Juicy, tender, delicious. All the adjectives of greatness for a steak.  We also got a pretty well-dressed and well-seasoned salad, which was as satisfying as a side salad can get, and the humita (corn pudding with chilis and fresh herbs). The humita was addictive, a bit sweet, a bit savory, a bit spicy, and entirely delicious. I'd highly recommend that as well.  4.5 stars rounded up because the steak sandwich and the humita are truly remarkable.

eTePTchOzfjAAN895a8wZg.text: Amazing!  We were visiting Pittsburgh for a weekend and were Yelping places to eat. My boyfriend couldn't wait to try Gaucho because he's a major carnivore.  The line was out the door when we got here on a Friday night for dinner. The spot looks small at first, but there is seating all the way to the back of the restaurant as you walk in more.  The menu is written on one entire wall that you can view when you walk into the restaurant.   The process of ordering is pretty simple.  You pick what you want, order it, pay, and then someone will bring it to your table when it's ready.  There are little stations with their delicious chimichurri sauces: regular, garlic, onion, and red pepper. Loved all of them, but red pepper was probably at the bottom of my list.  We couldn't get enough of the chimichurri!  I had a small flank steak (6oz) and my boyfriend had the small NY Strip.  We also got a side of roasted potatoes along with some beef & chicken empanadas.  The meat plates came with the best bread and a small side salad. Everything was absolutely delicious!  We are still dreaming about Gaucho today. Can't wait to come back so we can eat here again. Wish they sold their sauces in bottles!

W7attJrxVZ5hGVBgFpGwAw.text: This place is perfect and completely worth the long wait you'll have in line. They also have surprisingly good vegetarian options! I have thoroughly enjoyed every meal I've had here. The staff is friendly and welcoming and the decor is adorable. Pro tip: Go at 11:00 and the line is much shorter.

w87YYCIczMfgOsNovKROeQ.text: Everything we got was delicious. The line wasn't too long. We only waiting 15 minutes or less. The meats were all amazing. The corn on the cob was my favorite part of the meal. Will definitely go again. Would have given 5 stars, but it was a little pricy. Wonderful food though.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb, assorted meats, corn on the cob, and potatoes. That sauces were key!

8jfexS1ADjPLJ729VLuI3w.text: There's always a line, but they deserve it. I stopped eating beef when I moved to Pittsburgh from the Midwest. Tried my husband's filet sandwich on our first visit, and it's now on my regular rotation of places to go and things to eat while working in the Strip District. Very tasty, high quality food. Grilled veggies are also fabulous. Try to get there when they open for lunch to beat the line.

M22np2yHoJjBG9G0ImPSTg.text: Love love love love!!!  My husband and I ate inside here on the hottest, nastiest day of the year so far.  We were quite literally sweating our you-know-whats off, but despite that, Gaucho is an awesome experience.  Everything here is wood-fired and super delicious.  My husband ordered a steak sandwich and they offered him like eight different cuts of steak to choose from.  I'm kind of a veg-head myself and was delighted to find woodfired asparagus and caramelized onions on my salad. YUM!  All their condiments are delicious as well--if you love them as much as I did, you can take home a jar for $5! :)  We will come back again and again and again--it's BYOB as well, which we didn't know (plus we were there for lunch), and I know we'll be spending plenty of fall nights on the cute little patio enjoying delicious food and a bottle of malbec!  Seriously, so awesome!!! It's kind of off-the-beaten-strip-district-path, but SO worth a try!!

tn_wkfLKcG6aAcqmbhsLRw.text: Took a bunch of guys here again and it universally got the nod as one of the best steak sandwiches every one had ever eaten...  I don't know if I even remembered to breathe while inhaling its deliciousness.  KEEP IT UP!

nFFgQ_P2jiX2EYqDKwNsTA.text: amazing, delicious food! new favorite place to eat and definitely a must if you're in Pittsburgh.

ymOGEOdkh5UyzjTdOim_iQ.text: There is a reason why Gaucho is the top Yelp rated restaurant in PGH- the steak and really everything on the menu is fantastic.  Even if you're carb adverse, enjoy one of their sandwiches with chimichurri and enjoy.  Oh, and the line that's absolutely going to be out the door is totally worth the wait.

Y7N4i8LT07b0Ze_kOc8RSg.text: As soon as you drive in front of Gaucho Parrilla your stomach starts growling because the Argentinian grill smell that comes from this place is just awesome.   I shared the asado plate with my wife on my first (and only visit so far) to Pittsburgh and I thought it was just delicious. Being on a low carb diet, it is hard finding good stake dishes without all the other very tempting sides but this one needs no sides.  The only temptation was the buttery bread that came with the dish that my wife and son were raving about.   All five cuts of beef served were great quality tasting meat, very tender, very juicy, and perfectly cooked (I like my steak medium/medium rare).   On a plate with NY strip, filet, sirloin, and flank, I thought the skirt stake was the winner. I would love to try their chorizo. I can't wait to return.   The restaurant is very informal without waiters (you order at the counter and they bring the food to you) so seating space could be an issue. But it wasn't for us.   All I have to say is that (given I am on a high protein low carb diet) I would be going to this place every single day if they opened this restaurant in the DC metro area. But, for now, I will be content with the fact that I can only eat here when I visit Pittsburgh so this is a required stop for us when we return.

wkzMrbY6BQqwNwaOMQMSsw.text: This place is stellar. We've been here a couple of times and stopped in today while running errands in the Strip. Like always, there were numerous people eating and then experiencing food nirvana--you know, when your eyes flutter and roll in the back of your head, and you can't speak for a solid minute because your taste buds are break dancing. Nirvana.  We got the Chanchito, the Ribeye with the casa salad, a steak empanada and the fungus side dish. We ate it at the store and I collected all of the little dips that they offer. The ajo sauce (just pure garlic goodness) was hands down my favorite. They had another sauce, a red color, that was pureed sweet red peppers, which was equally amazing.  The atmosphere was really positive also. The owner is usually at the front of the house, making sure that everyone is having a pleasant time and continually shouts out positive affirmations.   All in all, the food is spectacular and it was an awesome time! Definitely will be back!!

F2NoDDx_gopMHYwIC71qTg.text: Gaucho is so, so good. I've been there several times and they have failed to disappoint. Although it is Argentinian BBQ, I am a vegetarian and I have never had a problem ordering! Their seafood and veggies are out of this world. THIS PLACE IS A MUST!! The employees are also very friendly.

VhAtBDGkGpxi8DfzWpv-vA.text: Food is easily 5 stars--steak, sandwiches, tasty sides...there's not much more to say on this front. However, I have tried to go to GPA many more times than I have successfully eaten there...and I've only ever attempted takeout. Even with the expansion, seating is a scarce commodity, but more frustrating is the takeout policy. On several occasions they have completely failed to answer their phone for stretches of time, rendering us unable to place a takeout order; on others, we have gotten through only to be told they wouldn't do takeout orders at that time due to long lines at the restaurant. I'd much rather be told "it'll be 90 minutes because of long lines" rather then "no food for you."

0raS_w2lVFfpOPDRcpHJ5A.text: This place has 5 stars for a reason. The chorizo sandwich was excellent and cooked to perfection. The fire roasted red pepper on it was not burnt and the ciabatta that it came on was very soft and fresh. The dipping sauces are very bold in flavor and you can get a side of tasty seasoned potatoes for only $2. Service is very friendly and the outdoor seating is clean and comfortable. I recommend this place to anyone in the Strip District who is looking for a quick bite to eat. The quality of the food can be compared to that of an upscale bistro.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kwc_AVg3806uutrkm9OHnA.text: Long wait, but totally worth it. Everything we ate was seasoned perfectly. Price is very reasonable. The sauces are perfect, especially the chimmichuri.  The only negatives are 1) the wait and 2) how small and cramped it can get. Think of it like the ultimate food truck. You order your food, then take it to the seating area behind the restaurant. Had to wait about 40 minutes for our food. Probably wouldn't have minded so much, had we been seated and sipping on a brew.

3uqIL1rhmB5H8lXz0pmdLw.text: Stopped by for lunch. Amazing quality and flavor for such a quick meal. Choice of four sauces which were delicious. Cool atmosphere as well. This place should be a role model for the burgeoning Pittsburgh foodie scene.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich with flank steak

7UIdWEor7hWmbbWr8evE0g.text: It's definitely a great place but not deserve 5 stars rating. I ordered fish of the day plate and it was very salty. The NY strip plate was good but not much special. If it wouldn't take me 40minutes to wait in line, I'll give 4 stars.

BVlJP4lgl8jZBHx_eale5w.text: Excellent AUTHENTIC cuisine... Their homemade sauces are amazing.

uulUYUI48_c120POKO-mzQ.text: How can people be so friendly!!?? Haha! Everyone who worked there was cheery and welcoming. The food was yummy and unique too!

mm51gi73v6bW5ucWat6BYg.text: I wanted to love Gaucho based on everything I've read. I didn't. I'll chalk it up to ordering the wrong thing - flank steak sandwich, requested rare and got meat I couldn't chew. I've grilled flank steak to rare many times (always marinated to break down muscle fibers), so it surprised me to get a piece of meat that was resistant to my teeth. I'll probably try Gaucho again as everything on other diners' plates looked good, but will stay away from the flank or skirt steak options.

YTIRqypwNBs-d7j2aNegng.text: Go here immediately...  The meats are amazing. They are cooked to perfection. Make sure to get a cup of each sauce so you can dip your meat and bread into it. The grilled corn was so good. I tried the filet and flank steak and they were full of flavor. I don't think that you could make a bad decision when ordering from here.  There is a reason this place had five stars. I am craving it like crazy.

Q2dD3hk--U6fphlr7LMLzQ.text: One of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh. We are here for few days and we got lucky the day was very nice and sunny. Long line in the restaurant but was well worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef sandwich with roasted peppers and onions
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork with salad. The best yams ever

kj4t3MbKPmJzJ4hvlyMuTQ.text: I rarely review but Gaucho is extraordinary.  The employees are super nice, the food is unreal (i want to swim in that green sauce whatever it is).  Haven't done the bodga yet but can't wait to try it.  Love it.

U-T2T4NLWyvyDdB9ETiVPw.text: Oh my gosh, this is just outrageous, literally one of  the best things I have ever tasted.  The sauces are on another level and the meat is to die for.  I ordered my steak burger medium but it came out medium well; who cares it still tasted like heaven on earth.  Huge caramelized onions, melt in your mouth cheese, delicious meet and some of the best sauce I have ever had.  I'm upset that I have been waiting so long to try Gaucho out.  The line is always crazy so I chose to call ahead for take out. This could be one of, if not the best places in Pittsburgh. Try all the sauces and do not hesitate to order large portions, you will absolutely crush your meal.   I am so excited to go back and try different things.  Please go to Gaucho it is worth the wait, the prices are fair and the food is unmatched.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yes yes yes

6LRi_eh-pigYdUZAKjcbgw.text: Hi, the food is excellent here, but service is horrible. We ordered to-go and the cashier said it is courteous to tip on to-go orders. Since I'm ballin, I dropped a $20. Then, when I ate the to-go order in their outdoor patio, which smelled like trash, they had the audacity to say that I was not welcomed since it was a to-go order. There was plenty of open seating.

K64xUoinj9LAVMQDK-QfoA.text: Incredible steak cuts.  Sauces are even better.  Get there early or stand in line outside...

FZjEU8uPViGOzadR5acB0Q.text: Love the food at Gaucho, but was super disappointed when we showed up at 9:05 PM on a Saturday night and were told by the last couple in line that they weren't taking any additional patrons (they have him a red stick to hold to show they were the last table of the night). Given they list they're closing time at 10:00, I would have expected getting in a short line at 9:05 would have been fine.

C3Kg9mYRkO8fZFJSngEYzQ.text: It's been 3 years and the physical shop has greatly expanded to a very warm, inviting space.  Although the place is packed, the tables are spacious with fresh flowers and a napkin dispenser.  Cause you may need a lot of napkins. Beef can be messy.  Wash your hands before you start, finger licking will commence.  The Provoletta is still spectacular. Steak sandwich, flavorful and delicious. Mashed sweet potatoes as lovely as they are tasty. Rosemary beef sandwich, a mile high and so, so yummy.  A lot has changed, but the important stuff is exactly the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne carnage
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary braised beef
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burger with arugula and blue cheese

5E1QdJU1GFr0e_NSONkJ0Q.text: Let me just start by saying if you haven't been to Gaucho yet you need to get there ASAP! All the hype is real. I was hesitant to give this restaurant a try as I am not a big meat eater and the menu is mostly meat. However, I had to give it a try since it's the #1 rated restaurant in Pittsburgh for 2015.   My first visit I got the Bondiola sandwich. The meat paired with the ciabatta bread was just spectacular. It was made even better by dipping it in the dipping sauces they have available. I also tried one of the steak empanadas which was also delicious.   My second visit I tried the pollo sandwich but I wasn't as impressed with it. I also tried my friends grilled veggies which I would highly recommend.   As for the service and environment...the service is very quick and we did not wait long to get our food either time. I've heard a lot of people say the line here gets crazy so keep that in mind because my guess is the line moves fairly quickly. I personally had no wait because I got there at 4:30 and 6pm before the rush started. The restaurant is very cute but not really a place for a big group.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bondiola sandwich
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside of the Bondiola sandwich

w_VpUdV5wi_1DQ-evSKSBQ.text: Over hyped.  Dishes are too expensive for what you get.  Got a salad with shrimp for over $18.  Got four pieces of shrimp, very small slice of avocado, and little else.  The atmosphere is decent.  I don't know what else you want me to say.

r0tQpUUwHoxTf1nN4-6uig.text: Gaucho Parrilla is more hip then Argentinian.  Every second I knew I was in the Strip district and not in Argentina.  No Argentinian drinks but BOB. The food was prepared with care - spices complimented each type of 3 meat platter. Servers are energetic but nobody really checks on you when you get it.  The line is long and it creates False sense of amazing things to come. Sausage was a bit too spicy but maybe that is a standard because I do not know anything about Argentinian spices. The crowd's estimated age average was 30 - I was at the high end of age scale.  I did it - I do not regret it-it was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Long line of people waiting to get seated.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from the restaurant window
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 3 meat platter

A8JVj_y1zkFwMuVeIoikFw.text: Holy hell, thank you for Gaucho! Meat is life. Meat is good. Meat is my savior.  For all the millennials...meat is  (don't judge me)  ... Bae.  Anyway, I used to drive by Gaucho all the time when I lived in the Strip District, naturally. After I got off the bridge and headed straight, let's just say my nares hit Liberty Street before I did.  All the worries of a stressed out resident physician in Pittsburgh were relinquished when the smell of Buenos Aires markets hit my nose.   The smell of a slow parilla style roast of our good friend who "moo's" overwhelmed me everytime I would pass by.   My go to? The asado platter - all the meats from our farmer friend cooked to perfection. The meat is some of the most succulent I have had in Pittsburgh and I have to say, Pittsburgh does meat pretty damn well. My second favorite, the Paella. Let's put it this way, I am allergic to clams and mussels but if ever I had a craving, an epi pen is going straight into my right thigh before I devour this pot of edible gold. The saffron gives the rice such a airy spice that it takes me back to flavors of Spain (though this is Argentina we are talking about). Regardless, well done!  Kudos Gaucho, thank you for being here!  Highlights: Meat cooked to perfection, parilla style layout (outdoor, garage type feel like some of the places I've visited in Argentina), beautiful spices and herbs with a strong melange Pros: Above Cons: sometimes the wait is BRUTAL. But well worth it Recommend to a friend: Yes Recommend to family: No (because we have been all over and obviously have had authentic style food in South America and they will probably not go anyway). Just being honest Go again: I go once a week at least.

GGu55jgBTqQFFQVvdDyP-A.text: This place is 5 star. Everything was delicious. I came at lunch and got here early enough I only had to wait in line behind 3 ppl. I ordered a chicken sandwich, mashed sweet potatoes side, and a provoletta. Love the mini salsa bar & will definitely return.  I do recommend reading the menu on their website ahead of time as it can be confusing & hard to see depending on lighting etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provoletta, chicken sandwhich, mashed sweet potatoes
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZRSdQoct9_Ahz9PDNtgIVA.text: There's likely to be a line, and you'll wait while smelling some of the grill scents and watching happy people leave the restaurant. Around 1 PM on a weekend, we waited about 25-30 minutes. Once inside, you get to see the full menu - by that point I was so hungry I wanted everything. We got lamb and shrimp plus a large side of vegetables.  I was surprised. The food was uniformly perfectly cooked. The shrimp were juicy, the lamb was tender and the vegetables were perfectly smokey yet still crispy. We cleaned our plates.  The staff was friendly and helpful despite the constant crowd, the food came out reasonably quick, and the variety of seating makes it a social environment. Gaucho is a must try on any trip to Pittsburgh.

dnqLyQssP1I_zqg7KY95WA.text: Long wait for good food but not great. There are a lot of rules you have to follow too. I didn't like any of the sauces.

eDAQvO1DLSwvoy4a5LFc9w.text: Came across an old picture of the amazing food from this place, so I figured I'd write up a quick (and long overdue) review.  We ordered the Cerdo (Pork) and Camarones (Shrimp) extra special plates as well as side orders of Pork Empanadas and Gaucho Papas. The Cerdo plate was comprised of pork tenderloin, caramelized onion, spicy mustard, small salad, and toast.  The pork tenderloin tasted amazing atop the toast with the onions and spicy mustard sauce mixed in. I'm more of a carnivore, so I left the salad for my girlfriend. The Camarones were also really good...simple and clean.  The potatoes were nothing special on their own, but fortunately there were 4 really yummy sauces to dip into: Chimmi, Ajo, Pimenton, and Cebolla. We were both obsessed with the Ajo (which I think means garlic). The Empanadas were probably the least remarkable thing we ate, although they weren't bad by any stretch.  Another really cool feature of this place is the BYOB policy. It was our first time here, so we were woefully unprepared, but we saw plenty of patrons taking advantage.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cerdo, Camarones, Pork Empanadas, and Gaucho Papas with each of the sauces

AeVcPiaDgXdfXG52JDFegQ.text: Amazing food! We found this place on yelp and decided to try it given all the rave reviews. It was a fantastic meal. We tried steak, chicken, shrimp, cauliflower, and salad and everything was delicious. Don't worry about what to order. Order small plates so you can try lots of variety.

mXrXTEdyU9ARO0YNubloJg.text: I can't say enough about this place. I spent my birthday dinner here and it exceeded my already high expectations. First, byob is a huge plus! Second, every single thing I tried was just so good! The grilled vegetable platter was my favorite and I'm a huge fan of all of their dipping sauces at your disposal.   The service and staff were all friendly and the casual dining atmosphere was great. I can't wait to go back.   Make sure you get there early!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Papas, campfire yams, grilled veggies, empanadas, Argentina salad... And wine of course.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Campfire yams - SO good

53cSoyKtvNazW1kJr8gmEQ.text: I'd rather avoid the long lines (and BYOB) and go to a good Brazilian BBQ place.  The food here is fine, but just not worth the wait and ensuing chaos.

8nyB787rcliYEUgK7CjakQ.text: So good!! I don't think you can go wrong with the menu. That said, it's a little overwhelming to read it all and make a quick choice so I'd recommend browsing the menu ahead of time on their website to you have an idea of what you want. They have a great system, as far as ordering, seating, service. They were knowledgeable and accommodating to a severe gluten allergy in our group.  I got one of the empanadas of the day (chicken, scallion, and lime if I remember correctly), which was awesome. The spicy chorizo with peppers and the fire grilled toast was equally delicious.  They have 4 signature dipping sauces you can help yourself to. Each one is unique and it was fun to try new flavors with every bite.  Plan to go back to try more of the menu- first visit did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken empanada, spicy chorizo, and papas al horno (rosemary garlic potatoes)

B8nDTxYkMBdAl3pk1a7zmg.text: The best example of open wood fired grilling.  You stand in line (Which I find hard to do with the exception of this place) order from a chalk board.  Believe me, it is the one place worth standing in line  for unless your in the military waiting to get into the chow hall.  BYOB, take a few friends, have a glass while waiting.  It's worth the wait.  I'd suggest the fillet.  It comes out sliced and layered perfectly.

F6vG5b5U1bThEWVBHJcinw.text: There's a good justifiable reason this place is Yelp rated. I have more than enjoyed every single thing I have gotten here.   My review is a bit late but here goes:  When you walk in it may be overwhelming at first to understand but there is always an employee there to explain. You stand in line, while looking at a huge chalkboard menu and then order at the front register area. This is also where you'll get your wine uncorked if you're participating in the BYOB (which is FREE!!!!)   Seating is all self service, and during lunch and weekends it gets pretty busy!   So far I've gotten the below: Grilled vegetables-some of the most amazing veggies ever  Rosemary braised beef sandwich- probably a 4 star sandwich but still absolutely excellent  Corn on the cob- always good  Flank steak and ribeye (both half portions and plenty for one person with the salad and bread)- ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE. I got them cooked medium and they were perfect every time.   Definitely check this place out and in the summer they have outside patio seating as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary braised beef sandwich, corn, veggies, and flank steak (I think, I can&#39;t completely remember what we got this time)

7QcB_YXxLeNpnzJsSYZoZA.text: Service: everyone is nice and friendly. Awesome overall. Employees wear regular everyday clothes so a lot of times  I actually mistook an employee for a patron. Ha! Service is also fast and we didn't wait long to receive our food.   Price: pretty expensive.   Food: so good! Sauce is delicious and I love that it is self serve. I can grab as much as I need. Steak is a must!   How to order: check out the menu while you're waiting in line and walk up to the counter to order. Go sit down, servers will bring you plates and utensils. Wait to hear your name be called and the server will bring your food to your table.   Kids: I had my 7 year old daughter with me and immediately after sitting, an employee approached us with a book and a toy to keep my daughter entertained. Awesome!   Will definitely be back!

q6b7snt-OccUnSSNxSD-Lg.text: LOVE Gaucho.  The Bondiola sandwich is my favorite.  Great service, excellent food.

Uoz7soRjG4GJkXsCePuLiw.text: This food will punch your mouth in the face! Big. Bold. Freaking delicious. The menu is a little confusing at first and the ordering system feels clumsy...but the food. I had the chicken small plate, husband had a sirloin. Best steak ever. So tender, so juicy. The sauces are all great but the red pepper is the best. If you are visiting, put this on your must-do list.

ybQNwB_GWoY84HCVH29POw.text: I've never loved a lunch more than my lunch at Gaucho. So my suggestion to you is that you should go with a group of people and just order one of everything because everything was so amazing. Chicken empanadas- yes. Shrimp with rosemary- YES get 12. Steak- yup. Salad- even that was remarkably delicious. Melted cheese on grilled bread- get 2.   What I'm trying to say is that there is nothing on the menu here that could possibly be bad. If I could give it extra stars, I would. And I've eaten a lot of food in my day.   If you're in Pittsburgh, please make it a point to stop here for a meal. I hear there are lines out the door though so maybe plan to go for late afternoon snacking.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ykajPlnoKM7fHR26Xr12zw.text: This is arguably the greatest spot in the city. Everytime someone from out of town comes to visit Pittsburgh, I take them here. Be prepared to wait a long time because this place seemingly always has a long line. My roommate often orders carry out from here to avoid the line but sometimes they're so busy he can't get anyone on the phone to order.   This set up is a bit odd. You order and pay at the counter and wait to be seated. Food runners will then bring you your order and fill up your water and collect plates and such. This place is also BYOB.   I've explored the menu quite a bit. My favorite thing to get is the rib-eye steak (small portion unless you're sharing) with a side of either the potatoes or the mushrooms. The steak is cooked and seasoned to perfection as it melts in your mouth with the delicious chumichurra sauce. The red potatoes are that perfect level of soft but not too soft and the mushrooms are cooked in this vinegar sauce that is quite unique.   If potatoes and mushrooms aren't your thing, they have a few other delicious side options that are all very good. I also recommend getting the steak sandwich. Its huge and I could not finish it in one sitting but it will blow you away. Do not sleep on the beef empanadas either.   If you're looking for a more classic restaurant experience, this place also offers a Bodega dining experience that you must book in advance. I believe its 50 dollars per person and it is a pre fixed menu that explores all the different foods on the menu. Be prepared to eat a lot though because its quite filling. Again its BYOB with free cork service.   This place is a must if you're in Pitt and the wait may be long but it is definitely worth it every time. Its amazing to me how this place does so many things so well.

0ZDes8shpIcwQZ_1VGaJEg.text: Absolutely fantastic. Charming atmosphere, excellent steak, clever menu that honestly almost made me assume the place was too gimmicky. But I asked a local and they raved about it. Got there around noon on a Saturday which turned out to be *just* in time. The line was out the door about 20 minutes after we showed up. Three of us split the Asado platter and chorizo sandwich with a small side, and didn't even get through that. Well worth the entirely reasonable price.

GJYAMv8nN_KH-axS_Xp5nQ.text: I had the Palletina Decornado (I forget the spelling). The grill lamb strip was not what I expected.  But the Empanadas was fantastic!

gFgbMOi43jDFiZB3VsJfOQ.text: Visited on a weekday when it was less crowded: ordered 12 empanadas for $18, for our family of 5.  Food came out immediately, probably due to what we ordered.  Others with more complex meals waited longer than us for their food.  Many yummy sauces available to dip, adding to the adventure for our family.  Drove by on a Saturday 3:30pm and a line was out the door - be ware.  Filled to the brim with hipsters eating hip food!  Not a problem, but we are square 40-something suburbanites!  Joke: "How do you get rid of a hipster?  Throw him in the main stream."

ugbXNObpLJou_LqHLhlR-A.text: Gaucho's new and expanded space is awesome.  It's really great to be able to enjoy this incredible food without feeling super cramped. Plus, the BYOB aspect is much more appealing now that they are open for dinners and you can really settle into your own table.  All of their food is absolutely fantastic.  After coming back from a backpacking trip to South America, I still thought Gaucho's food was amazing.  My favorite item to get for the value is their Steakburger, which is really just a giant smoked burger with two of your choices of fixins (cheese is a little extra, I think). It's a big burger and will satisfy even the hungriest of us eaters. If you're looking to splurge and love steak, you cannot go wrong with one of their platters.  I want to mention two more highlights of Gaucho. They recently added wings to the appetizer section, and DAMN are they good.  They are cooked on a wood-fired grill like much of the rest of the menu, then tossed in some kind of magically delicious hot pepper oil and scallion sauce, with grilled lemons on the side.  If you haven't tried them yet, go and get some!  Finally... their sauces. Oh my gosh their sauces are DELICIOUS. And they are self-serve, so try them all and then load up on your favorite one!

KWjENUzk6BgRY07L-lTzuA.text: The steak is top notch!! Really chill atmosphere. A great place to go with a group!!!

VUYqrdTD5aYw-RPDelg_Xw.text: Great sandwiches!! The second we walked in, we knew we were in for a great experience.  We had the salmon, carne and pollo.  The grill on the sourdough bread is fantastic!

eATndvaf2EaSdNY_hoQHhg.text: Yum yum yum! I love some good sandwiches!  Took a random day trip to Pittsburgh and was searching for a place to meet up with an old friend for lunch. After seeing the hundreds of reviews for this place, we had to check it out.  We were able to find parking right down the street from the restaurant. I was a little scared that the line would be one of those agonizing, way too long lines, where your stomach just hurts from being too hungry...... but at 12:30pm on a sunny Saturday afternoon, we only stood in line for 30 minutes. Quite impressive in my opinion. I had read one review that stated that you would wait in line for one hour.... but it moved along at a decent pace, in my opinion.  Essentially, you order at the cashier, and then you sit down, waiting for your food to be brought out. The whole process actually moves quite fast. Perhaps because people realize there are others waiting in line... I'm not sure, but the rate of people eating, then leaving behind seats for others who are coming in, is quite fluid. It was actually very impressive.  Anyways, I decided on the carne sandwich. On the chalkboard menu, it stated, "choice of vaca", which we then had to google translate, and for those who are interested, it means beef. I chose the arrechera, cooked medium. The others chose the rosemary braised beef.  We sat down in a midst of people eating their big sandwiches or big ears of corn. Now this is my kind of place! I thought.   Results: - My arrechera sandwich: DELICIOUS. First, the meat was very tender and flavorful. It was cooked a perfect medium- almost more to a medium rare, however, I probably should have had it cooked more, so I wouldn't have to chew so hard to break it down. Nonetheless, the flank was good. And the BREAD it came on. Wow, that's good bread- a little bit of garlic in it, but just so fluffy and tasty.... a good bread really makes a sandwich. - Their rosemary braised beef- apparently, this beef cooks for 7 hours before they serve it to you...and you can tell. Their instant responses after biting into the sandwiches were, "MmmmmMMMMMM!!!". The meat was so moist and tender- that was a good sandwich. On top of it, the bread again, was a stellar winner.  Definitely make a stop at this place if you're in the area. It's reallllly tasty.

hKvi3TMCx7sjH4CrbglUiQ.text: Had the Rosemary beef and the shredded pork sandwich. They were both so good. The bread is fresh and crispy. The meat was juicy and so tender.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum!

Ei16m1n86hDKKfU9QSYNlQ.text: Basing my opinion on a one meal experience, this place is overrated. I ordered the sirloin medium rare (small $14). This was the only good part of the meal. A piece of burnt, tough bread was served with the meal. The salad that came with the meal was fair.   I've passed this place several times when they were busy and chose 3:00 PM on a weekday to try it. The menu is varied but if all the bread is burnt and tough I doubt if a return trip will happen.

XAz_JH7ZZUXHMuZGKn2Teg.text: There's really not a lot to say about Gaucho that hasn't already been said elsewhere, better.  Great food!  I always make time for a stop here when I visit Pittsburgh!  The wait times can be long, so go prepared.  And by go prepared I mean look at Google.  We went on 4:30 on a Thursday, and walked right up to the counter.  I realize many may not have that kind of flexibility, but if you do then it really helps!

_f-55MNEFMeCfLQTufwDSg.text: The steaks are great, the sauces are a 5/5, and the atmosphere is awesome! The line does get long though, so plan ahead (get there early or order takeout to avoid a long line!)

wmOPOp2ieODSoHG6wviGIQ.text: I have been waiting a long time to write this! The first thing I can say is, it was worth the wait! Walking down pen avenue toward the bridge the sweet smell of wood fire and grilling hits you about a block away! The line for lunch can be a bit long at times, but it moves pretty fast so don't give up. The chalk written menu is easy to follow, small plates, salads, main dishes specials and grilled beef and pork! For lunch I have been waiting to try the braised beef with rosemary and horsey sauce on a fresh focaccia. It was everything I could have imagined and more. The beef was tender and juicy and the rosary and grilled opinions were a perfect addition without hiding the flavor or the star of the show! I also had the pork empanadas which were the best I've ever had... Period. I can't wait to try everything.  My goal is the paella which serves 3-6 humans!! I am sure I can find a few volunteers for that mission!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Drx6SF72dVjLVIt4Eg87iw.text: Really long line to get in but that's part of the experience to some extent. Went there about a year ago exactly and still remember how good the quality of the food was

11Qy1nlWXPvaAFjFHuFCHA.text: This place was just a few blocks from the hotel. As we got there on foot at 4pm there were people lined up out the door. It was just 30degrees. You wait online and give your order at the counter, then they seat you and will bring your food when ready.  It is BYOB.  The entire kitchen staff, I think, is in their 20s, but MAN can they cook! We had the 6oz strip and ribeye with potatoes and grilled spaghetti squash. It was the most enjoyable steak I have ever had. It took us an hour from arrival to seating but it was Sooo worth the wait, even in the very cold (I definitely wasn't dressed for it), I would do it all over again. This is a definite MUST eat here if you visit Pittsburgh!.

TCegCph8kJ3WQFHV3PaTiQ.text: Maybe the best restaurant in Pittsburgh. I really can't get enough. No one in the city is doing what they do and I've never ordered something that wasn't fantastic. Don't get turned off by the wait--it's worth it and moves faster than you'd think--make sure to try their empanadas.

Kkl6HiQ37mG_MYga1YF0VQ.text: Gaucho is one of the best restaurants in town! Very down to earth and quick. The line is always long, but well worth the wait. My boyfriend and I had the cheese bread and a small meat platter. The meat was so tender and flavorful, it was so delicious! The employees were helpful and patient as well as informative. We will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

blr-EbbkyBGMSEeB-BfM6g.text: One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh, worth the wait! Love their sauces!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provoletta
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2QmNnMXhc32LeyddI4NRUQ.text: Wow, my favorite place for steak without a doubt. Argentinian style steak so highly seasoned and a great char. Small location and usually about a half hour wait. No seating in restaurant but a few high tops for eating. I would definitely recommend eating at the location as on the 2 occasions that I have gotten takeout my beautiful medium rare has turned to medium well due to carryover in the box.   Amazing food and people a must visit!

hjd2zHwYqIcvz0kOczk4GA.text: I don't eat steak, but I ate this steak and I loved it.  The sandwich was flavorful and delicious.  The kind of sandwich that you eat without putting down once.  The only downside was how small the place was.  I was able to get their early and have a seat but most people had to have their sandwich to go.  The small size says nothing to the flavor of the sandwich was was HUGE and fantastic. highly reccomend.

GDUFjuJpMSZAClzoU8gXJw.text: Just what this place needs... another 5 star review.  What can I say?  The people working are super nice and sweet The meat is out of this world incredible The sauces make you melt The bread is squishy and chewy and full of flavor The veggies are crisp and grilled to perfection  Believe the hype.  Go there now!

I3BKkT3IPtjCVd4PysFRqg.text: delicious steak. cool, casual atmosphere. long lines but when you're standig in them with friends, they go by fast.

0_1qY6qPUT59RjoOxM6F5g.text: I was really looking forward to this place since we recently moved from Philly and would love a good sandwich.  We ordered the sandwich with filet, side of potatoes and the side of rice.  The staff was really friendly and helpful.   I wish the sauces had a description written down on the menu or somewhere so you know what's in them.  They were all full of flavor. The flavors in the sandwich were really good.  The onion, meat and bread together tasted great.  The meat was seasoned and cooked well.  The wood flavor is really enjoyable.  What I didn't like was that the sandwich was hard to eat because the meat was hard to eat.  If they sliced the meat thinner it would be easier to eat. Overall, good sandwich but meat is hard to eat.  Great staff!

p-sT8d-_ieJR107qLCXnHA.text: So another positive review of this place?  YES. The steak is so good. Seasoned perfectly and cooked just right. I got the steak sandwich with NY strip steak. It was a lot of food and was delicious. My wife got the flank steak on a plate and about ate the plate that came with it.   The yellow rice unfortunately left something to be desired. It was bland and relatively flavorless but the steak more than made up for it.   There are other meats on the list as well but I don't know if I will ever try them because of how good the steak is.   Mmmmmmmm.

1yhZJNX8adp3441Nk_dorw.text: l read a really positive review in a local newspaper about a year ago and decided to go there. The staff there was very helpful and personable and I ordered the braised rosemary beef sandwich to go. l liked the sandwich but the taste didn't blow me away so a few days later l ordered the carne with ribeye steak. First the focia bread was the best l ever tasted and was a perfect match for the delicious steak grilled medium rare over a wood fire. The fire roasted red pepper and grilled onion perfectly complimented the sandwich along with the chimicurrie.  Well to make a long story short l made it my go to place for lunch after my dialysis every week. After trying out about half the menu  I settled on the carne with the fillet medium rare with provolone and saffron rice . l rarely give reviews but gauchos really set a new standard for quality and taste for a restaurant and is very deserving of all the superlatives they receive.

oufSeTufIvoCaV4-dvjn9Q.text: A bit pricey for the amount of food you get. I heard lots of great things about it, but it didn't live up to the hype in my opinion.

r3a3Ha2O-i1CE77r2xV0Tw.text: I've been a huge fan of gaucho even before they expanded to the building next door and waiting in line forever became common. I really like their meat and side dishes. They somehow always manage to arrange for big groups even though it's super crowded most of the time.  I am not giving gaucho five stars, though, because they removed the most delicious grilled vegetales from their menu. They also seem to be experimenting with other dishes. The potatoes are not as good as they used to be :(

aQg9gPAwA3qTv9qfddrr9A.text: I go here with my gf and when the food comes, we literally do not speak to each other until the food is all gone.

xzfMlCjzHrAUb85seID3CA.text: We made a special trip to the Strip District to try out this Argentine steak place and it was worth it!  You order your food at the counter, which saves money and time.  We came for lunch and the line was short with plenty of seating.  Recommend checking out the menu before you go as it can be a bit intimidating with people waiting in line behind you.  Not knowing what to order, we started with the Picada (sampler of cured meats, cheeses, fruit, bread) and Empanadas.  The sandwiches were huge, but looked like too much bread for us.  We then ordered the Parillada Mixta, which was 1 lb of grilled meats (steak, chicken) and chorizo- absolutely delicious!  Meat was moist and perfectly seasoned.  Will definitely return and will stick with the meats.

QaDa5U2n-FlsZ6uAVFUL6g.text: My steak had a lot of silver skin on it, which made it chewy.  Expected better based on all the 5 star ratings.

dby8__hMCFthc8-etKMS9Q.text: AMAZING!! The wait outside was soooo worth it!! Everything from the meat to the sauces to the vegetables, salad, even the toast, everything was amazing!! The food was excellent!! We will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

36oyt51YvXB2Blu-KpLnLg.text: Gaucho Parrilla Argentina would make an excellent ambassador for Pittsburgh's food scene to any transplants or tourists arriving in the city.  It's simultaneously (a) one of the best sandwich makers in the city that stands out from the crowd and (b) a restaurant that fits right in with the growing and diverse offerings of an increasingly delicious Strip District.  With many cuts of steak available in sandwich or platter form (I'm a fan of the sandwiches myself), none of the options are bad choices.  You could make random selections from this menu and still be just as happy as if you put hours into crafting your order.  It's all great stuff, and I have no advice to visitors other than "get a steak sandwich and anything else that looks good to you."  You won't be disappointed.  The primary drawback is space; it can be hard to find a place to eat once your food is ready, especially if the weather closes the outdoor seating area.  Still, it's worth the wait in line and the hassle of seating (though it's still a far cry from being "good for groups").

27YJITmYo7DmblXf8rFpTg.text: It's truly the best restaurant in Pittsburgh. The people are friendly, the food and sauces are awesome and the brussel sprouts with bacon are to-die for! It's sort of a pain having to wait in line but its so worth it.

Hgv1ZG6AsV4iCTbp6v9RRg.text: Great people, delicious food, and cool vibes. Also, you must try every sauce they have out in the mason jars! Get there early because the line ends up out the door.

-nE-3tyNfPEQWZtBYA17tg.text: My favorite dream is when I eat 15 of these steak sandwiches covered in every sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

K-X248qvmYBBdoD9G7pXRQ.text: We had a delicious meal here.  It took awhile for the dishes to arrive but they were worth the wait.  Definitely, go with the filet, the corn pudding, vegetables and the grilled corn.  The only disappointment were the clams, which were in a great sauce but many of them weren't opened when they hit the table, which means we had to send them back. They took them back..with a smile. Definitely, try it out.  It's a cool vibe and a great meal.

c8xcAJ3kFOXJMa7hrrShiw.text: Asked for a recommendation and the gentleman at the counter said to get the steak sandwich with ribeye or skirt. I went with the skirt steak medium rare. Honestly might be the best steak sandwich I've ever had. Served in a paper wrapping, topped with roasted red bell peppers, carmelized onions, and chimichurri sauce. Phenomenal!

w93Rg99Nj0l0BJ8wLdxOng.text: The food is absolutely amazing. Be sure to try any of the BBQ, and get plenty of sides to try everything! Each ingredient is so well thought through and executed perfectly. I've also ate from their food truck which was just as fantastic! The only reason I gave 4 stars is because of the set up of the restaurant. You have to wait so long in line, which usually goes out the door. I prefer the traditional restaurant seating of being able to sit first and then order from the menu, so you don't have to wait upwards of an hour in a cramped line. It is still worth it to taste this wonderful Argentinian food!

Ym7Pb7J_b1SqgVmnoKzIbg.text: I know I'm going against the grain because most people seem to love this place. We found it to be a mixed bag. First of all, they have a unique way of handling customers.  You wait in line to get to a counter and place your order and pay for your food and drinks. They then seat you. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly.   I ordered the Skirt Steak. The small portion was $22. The large portion would have been $40. It was very flavorful,  probably one of the better steaks I've had. The small salad was good, but was tiny. I also got the beef soup, but it was too salty for my taste. My wife took it to go.  My wife ordered the ribs. They had little meat and she found them dry, with little meat on the bone. Her ratatouille was flavorful and she thought that was the best part of the meal. It was too spicy for my taste.  Clearly based upon the size of the crowd they are doing something right,  though I thought that they were overpriced for what you got. The approach of having you order and pay at the counter before being seated results in long lines snaking out the door at peak times.   I'm glad we went, but it will probably be a while before we return.

tdd_PjzumiYhFh5c4pBssA.text: I concur with most of the reviews that rave about the quality of the food. However, the overall dining experience in both of the 2 times I've eaten here would have to be ranked somewhere between unsatisfactory and downright unpleasant.    The wait time for actually ordering food is so out far out of control as to defy belief. If there is a line of any length outside the door, be prepared for at least a 45 minute wait to reach your turn to order. As someone who designs and re-engineers processes, it was a particularly painful experience to observe such a complete lack of competence in this restaurant's food ordering procedure. Unless the intention is to actually limit revenue, management would be well served by hiring a consultant to streamline the process (there is so much hanging fruit) or at least visit and learn from restaurants that use line flow best practices.

SpxqV6RjdocBpBHkYU7y5g.text: Went for lunch on a Tuesday, line wasn't bad at all. Had the small filet plate, beef and pork empanada and arroz rice. The filet melts in your mouth and tastes amazing with the chimmi. The empanadas were the best I've ever had. Definitely will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small filet plate, beef and pork empanada and arroz rice.

n1LwUM9BIPL5m5u9khnUiQ.text: My husband and I stopped by this gem on a Saturday evening around 5:30pm or so, and boy am I glad we went when we did. When we went to go back in (we were seated outside) to grab some sauces, the line was wrapped around the building. Speaking of sauces, they all went well with the sandwiches we ordered. Sweet Sausage and the steak sandwich with flank. The sandwiches are a bit messy, but very delicious. We also tried the beef and pork empanadas, yum! I don't think anything on their menu would be a wrong decision.

-VEtNQ2baN-p6J5Pt7rfow.text: Smoky, meaty, authentic food.  Really amazing cuisine served up by a friendly staff.  I had the steak sandwich (rib eye) with potatoes.  There are only about 7 seats inside but also some tables on the outside.  The decor is nothing fancy, but the food is the real deal. I would give them 5 stars, but I had a half hour wait in line, then a 35 minute wait for my food.

v4IatFqdT2BUZnT4Pncv6Q.text: Gaucho's meat-sex shop is a MUST.  I mean, this place was voted in a top-ten spot on some national foodie list (I really don't feel like googling what list right now).  And you might be thinking...well, I don't know, how good could a little local Pittsburgh area steak shop actually be?  Why don't I just go to some chain restaurant that I know can cook the BEST filet mignon...with butter!....well....Gaucho's is much much different, my friend.   I think Gaucho is actually from Argentina.  He must be, because I never tasted flavor like this in my LIFE.  Whatever his prep process is from his meats, it's 100% grade prime material. Really talented stuff this guy does.    On separate occasions I've stopped by Gaucho's.  Expect to wait, the line is usually out the door - even after he expanded his little stand-up shop into a sit-down, libation serving restaurant.  All of my trips to this joint consisted of me ordering his steak sandwich for lunch. You can order straight-up steak plates but for the $$ I'll save that for a dinner some other time.   I mentioned he runs a meat-sex shop, because his sandwiches are created as if they were put together in such a place. He combines the perfect amount of steak-juice-bread combination you could ever want in your mouth.

cXNdzImcnxNHyMC6Qw8baA.text: The food is worth EVERY MINUTE of waiting in the line that frequently wraps around the building. I've been to Gaucho for both lunch and dinner; both were equally out-of-this-world.   The lunch portions are just right. I had the ribeye served mediun and it was excellent. I love the appeal of the wooden plates. I tried the Argentino salad for dinner, which is essentially Argentina meets Yinzer, as it is a salad with steak, avocado and papas. I plan on visiting again with a group to experience the paella (PS: great double-date idea) and to take advantage of their BYOB policy!

Y0G95d1XIe0zGx0m_-vR9w.text: A solid 4.5 star. I got here at 11am on Saturday just when it opened to avoid the wait. I made the right decision because when I got out of here at 11:40am, there were people waiting out the door. Anyways, I ordered the Carne sammich with sirloin meat medium rare, which also contained the chimmi sauce, caramelized onion, and roasted peppers. The meat was really tender and juicy, and it was just the right amount of 'medium rare'. I could really appreciate the wood-fired grill taste in the meat. Also, the roasted peppers were definitely a plus because they made the sammich that much more flavorful. The sammich was a 5-star. Now, the Gaucho Slaw was mediocre at best. It lacked somewhat of a flavor, and it wasn't the best slaw I've had at a place like this. To conclude, if there's one thing I'm jealous of Pittsburgh, it will be the fact that they have Gaucho Parrilla in their town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne with sirloin meat medium rare &amp; Gaucho slaw
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

J9W5RzNDnIrpLXhIoGC6gw.text: Amazing place.  As Mr Trump would say GREAT...HUGE....THE BEST!!!  We had the Asado platter and the Mixta plate. The meat was cooked perfectly with a great fire BBQ taste.  The sauces were delicious and very light - a great compliment to the perfectly cooked meats.  Come hungry as the plates were HUGE.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. ASADO platter and Mixta
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

H3jIqMoIvsZ3ImI4z4zfrQ.text: Excellent steak sandwiches at a great price! The staff is also very helpful at recommending a dish for you if you're unsure. They'll happily explain anything on the menu. They also offer great sides.   The only negative of this place is the line and seating as a result of its popularity. If you can, try to go outside of the lunch hour. They recently expanded, but it still can't contain the horde. My hope is they keep up with their success without ever diminishing the quality.  This place is amazing

Lap5ilXPEW765e1nXOe8-w.text: Very tasty! Love the baked corn, very sweet, and the chief told us no butter on it, just boiled in water and then on wood fire.   First time tried the plate, a little too much for two, but after that you'll get to know which one u like the best.   Owners invite us to join their every night after work drink beer and shot, and talk to one of the owners, very nice.   Gaucho should be one of the must do's in Pittsburgh!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sample plate
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet mignon &amp; NY strip

7k_iDQqP9B74wkDKm0cqNw.text: Pre-wedding weekend bliss with my soon to be bride. We shared the ribeye platter which was INCREDIBLE! We opted for the large, 12oz, which was plenty to feed us both. My girl is a meat fan, but one of the best things she put on her plate was the sun-dried grilled tomatoes in the salad. We liked them so much we asked for extra! The ribeye was tender and flavorful and grilled to perfection. The smoked red pepper sauce was our personal favorite, but all of the sauces were fresh and flavorful. We also ordered the grilled pineapple with blackberries, mint, and creme fresh. My lady had never had grilled pineapple before but I can tell by her reaction she will have it again!   I've read some yelpers had long waits, I can see why there is a line out the door on most weekends. We came on a Thursday afternoon and maybe had a 15 minute wait to order then probably another 15 minutes for our food.   The biggest applause should go to the staff. Super friendly and helpful. The cooks have a thankless job over a hot grill but are masterful at their jobs and produce a fantastic product.   The best advice I can give is talk to Dillon when you get here. He was extremely helpful and professional, and clearly enjoys his work. Great customer service and I'm already looking forward to our next trip to this gem!

a5lUjJEmxnxxRKV1YEUQuQ.text: unique sandwiches and other dishes that have all been tasty. reasonable prices considering the popularity

a5Llj6RydugVRYNKqMk9eA.text: I've been wanting to try Gaucho for a long time.  I've heard so many good things, and it completely exceeded my expectations!  The menu is extensive, there were many options to choose from.  I went with the Parrillada Mixta so I could sample as much as possible; it includes NY strip, chorizo, and chicken with sauces and toast.  Due to a minor mix-up we also ended up with the Camerones (shrimp).  Everything was delicious!  The food was amazing, I'm kind of mad at myself for waiting so long to try it out.   We arrived around 6pm on a Friday and had a small wait to order food, and ended up sitting at the counter to eat because there were no open tables.  There were only two of us so this worked out well.  The service was great.  We didn't have to wait long for the food after we ordered and the servers were attentive but not intrusive.  The line was growing out the door by the time we left, so I would recommend arriving as early as possible.  Otherwise, you can expect a long wait (especially with larger groups).  All in all it was a great experience- I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.

6gVnbhibp8m-7QZ0KHfEDQ.text: The meat choices perfect, busy place, very good flavour s.but what threw me off a little bit was the char the meat.the pulled pork was absolutely perfect and the chicken wings were Really good.i could do with a tad spicier but if I were to go again these would be the dishes I d order

6e_cj35hGA3D45ufB1HYcQ.text: Holy Hell Pittsburgh! Drop everything you're doing and get down to this place! Doesn't matter how long a line, it is worth any wait. Been eating here since it opened and has never never ceased to amaze, satiate and delight. I mean, how can a place make a slice of grilled bread taste so good? Like that you think about it and crave it and can't believe you are eating it? But they do. To say nothing of the steak. Have gone through a fair portion of the menu but can't beat the steaks served any way you want them. A crown jewel for Pittsburgh dining. Holds its own with anyplace I've eaten in any city including San Francisco etc where I lived for 30 years. Just amazing.

hPEyL6WpRcRNzB3TpZKKEg.text: The quality of the food at Gaucho is outstanding. I tried the NY strip, pork, cauliflower, potatoes, and empanadas, all of which were delicious. We waited in line outside for a hour on a Saturday night and it was worth every minute. After we finally reached the counter and ordered we were quickly seated and our food arrived about ten minutes later.  Gaucho is BYOB and we brought a bottle of wine which they opened and poured for us.  An excellent overall dining experience made exceptional by the amazing quality of the food.

IYJOdx1u_cMcO-pmiI_uHQ.text: There were four of us so we tried the Asado platter which gave everyone a taste of five different cuts of beef (flank steak, filet mignon, sirloin, ribeye and one more). The filet and sirloin were considered the tastiest but all were good. We added corn, potatoes and mushroom sides. Perfect combo along with our mate iced tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Busy but efficient kitchen. Well informed staff.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu infused with humor.

vtG4K_69yaYic02RO-IbPA.text: Sooooooo good! Service was great! Totally worth the wait! The best only bad thing, is that I now want one of those sandwiches like everyday! Haha

7807xbEODPzSUTCh8EmsTg.text: There is no way to overestimate how good this place is. The steak sandwiches are juicy and delicious. We've tried the filet mignon, ribeye and skirt steak sandwiches and it really just comes down to what cut you prefer.   We tried the provoletta and it should not be missed, grilled and melty sharp provolone is placed atop grilled ciabatta bread, it's as delicious as it sounds.   The house made sauces are amazing, this trip we bought a container to bring home with us.   The place is small so either eat off hours, plan on waiting for a table outside or get it to go.   Eat here now.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Far is the ribeye steak sandwich. Near is the steakburger with grilled portabellas and bacon. In the middle is the provoletta.
