Ji1WEZ6MH5k0EBmzBlBXgg.text: This was the best meal in my life. Really, I consider myself a professional fat guy, and this place blew my mind.

UgHPnezgFwBt_YvpRHz5lw.text: I came here after walking around the Strip on a weekday afternoon with a friend. After some Yelping it seemed like this was the place to be - I've rarely seen so many 5 star reviews before, and when I arrived (this was around 1:30PM) there was a line outside the door.   The place - the restaurant is bigger than it looks on the outside- when you first enter you wait inline and place your order at the counter. You then grab a seat and the food will be brought out to you. The interior feels very hipster-chic - there's a giant chalkboard menu, lots of solid wood furnishings, high ceilings, mason jars, iron embellishments... it's well lit and pleasant.   The food- I went with the rosemary beef sandwich- DELICIOUS. The ciabatta bread was nicely toasted and the beef was savory, flavorful and decadent. There was a LOT of meat, so I wouldn't recommend it if you are an office worker looking to avoid an afternoon food coma. That said, the meat got a little drier towards the end of the sandwich. This is where the sauces came in handy. There are four restaurant-made sauces available for everyone by the cutlery. I sampled all four and they were great sandwich condiments.   The service- fantastic. Everyone had a smile on their faces, and eager to help. The woman who brought out our sandwiches went out of her way to introduce us to the sauces and explain.   Overall, it was a great experience! I put four instead of five stars just because I wasn't as mind-blown by the sandwich as I thought I would be - but overall I would definitely come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu at Gaucho
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary beef steak sandwich

LIAdVRUMU5NNWHPk8xahog.text: It's awesome!! Great service, great taste, great smell, and great atmosphere!! You must try!  The indoor space is limited, and the restaurant is very popular, so try to arrive there 11:00am if you want to have lunch there on weekend.  I love the shrimps and salmon (today's fish)! Sandwich and salad are also good. There are a lot I want to try, so I will go there again definitely. Do not forget to get some sauce on the table! It fit all meat!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Today&#39;s fish - salmon!!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad w/ ribeye steak
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Must-eat camarones

qC-LieeZIGtNnstCXLdWxw.text: A gem in the rough! We came here on a whim (finally!) and it was about 7pm and we were already waiting outside, the line didn't seem too long, so we didn't mind. However, the line did move pretty incredibly slow, for the not so huge menu people ordering off of. I should have checked that this was BYOB, no fees! Which would have made standing in line with our 3yo a breeze. Once we ordered, the waitress checking us out was incredibly nice and professional. Additionally, every worker there thereafter were extremely great, made sure your water was tipped off, and worked collectively great together. I ordered the chicken "boob" sandwich, my fiance ordered the steak burger. It did not disappoint. Incredibly filling! Chicken was very tender and well seasoned, his burger made medium was perfectly juicy topped with avocado instead of cheese. It was honestly half an avocado. While we waited for our food, we tried the sauces with some toast. 1) the toast was perfection, it had the real wood burning toast flavor but without it tasting burnt! A real skill. 2) there is not one flavor of sauce I did not like. It was hard choosing a favorite! Ultimately, i liked the chimmy, and the roasted red pepper... oh and the garlic, shoot, the ajo was fine too! Honestly, i would give this a solid 5, but I am going solely off my first experience (waiting, no options for my picky 3yo) but clearly we know how to be prepared next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shredded Chicken breast sandwich with mashed rosemary potatoes and caramelized onions &amp; shrooms.. incredibly filling!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burger with avocado instead of cheese.

6u__IemtsWJLsFXma3Ol1A.text: Hopping place.  Long line but nice to talk to people.  Very neat menu, so many choices!   Ordered Asado platter.  A lot of steak!  Sauces are delicious.  Chino sauce is especially tasty, but pimento has roasted red pimento peppers in vinegar.  These light up all of your tastebuds.  Roasted vegetales round out the meal.  Nice spot in the Strip, close to the city.   Great for date night.   The sauces bring out the flavor of the meat and sensations stimulate the palate.  The portobello mushroom was exquisite.  This is a must visit restaurant in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Look at that large meal.  Leftovers for tomorrow!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Only seat left in the house.

wWN4HKK1zmp93cHF0am2VQ.text: Super fresh tasting food. BYO. Order at counter. Vibe of restaurant is laid back, unrushed. I'd check menu before hand. Lots to choose from and hard to decide at a counter when you're in a line with people waiting behind you. The chimmi sauces are really clean and fresh tasting. Got the Gaucho salad and had some toast and broccolini.  Even though there's a lot of meat on menu, you can go all-veggie and be super satisfied.

Jr34VxO3_3o2rXod9nPmXQ.text: Be prepared to wait.  There are no reservations and the line is out the door on a Saturday night.   We waited about two hours.   I loved the food and there is a choice of small and big portions, so nice to not have too much food .  I had a veggie sandwich and my hubby had a yummy steak.   The potatoes and chimi sauce was great.   Bring your own bottle and everyone does. You order in line and food is brought to you.   Even seated, service is a little slow.  But food was great and I would return.  A fun place and very friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QYWPemCovYem--7-6Y47Ew.text: Get take out to skip the wait.  It's still good when you bring it home but make sure you get the sauces.  If you like fire and meat, then this place is for you.  All dishes (except sandwiches) are cut for you and are very good to share.  The meat is typically cooked medium rare without having to be asked, and the place is BYOB.

2h2IVOa8rUlWytCW2vfFQg.text: It doesn't surprise me at all that this is the #1 Yelp restaurant and has been for quite some time. Whenever anyone visits from out of town, I try to take them here. The food is AMAZING. Seriously some of the best meat I have ever had. I've had a bunch of different cuts and none of them have been disappointing. I usually go for one of the steak platters, although they have sandwiches and some other dishes as well. The platters are a great value since it is a good portion of very high quality meat, a piece of toast and a small salad. I've occasionally gotten a side of veggies or brussel sprouts to share and YUM.  Seating was a nightmare when it was about half its size, but now that they have expanded, there is much more. I have occasionally had to wait for a table, especially with a larger party if going during peak hours. I've driven past this place when there is a line out the door! I would try to go during non-peak meal hours, but it is worth the wait anytime!   The staff are always pleasant and extremely friendly. This place is A+ all around and I can't wait to go back for more!

ay1X7agb3-775B9nnvNgag.text: Great place for delicious steak in a low key atmosphere. Also had salad and roasted vegetables which I also enjoyed. Aside from generally being a tasty choice, if your dietary persuasion is of the paleo/keto variety, this place should be 1-A on the list.

1K-GPlPyE51FLJE4xEf0lA.text: This place is so good.  Having spent 6 months in Argentina, I  do love a good parrilla (w/ bomb chimichurri!) and this is legit. And BYOB! However, the timing is key, since there are no reservations and the line can be insane.  When they do the basement chef's tasting menu, you can reserve in advance, and skip the line (worth it!).

ziHadzTTyz0TJ7vC3IMmsQ.text: I'm really unsure why there is such a hype about this place. I talked to my Spanish professors and friends about it and no one seemed impressed either. But yelp says otherwise. I came here for my friends birthday and thought I would give it a try despite the things I have heard. But it ended up being disappointing for me.  The customer service is amazing. However, the food is not quite as good as I wanted it to be. I tried the yams and they tried to put some spices that just made it taste like flowers. The bread was dry, the fish I got was dry. The flavors were greasy and off. It was very heavy. They give a lot of food, but I didn't even want to finish it.  They give you sandwiches in wrappers but then they give you plates anyways. So you just unwrap your sandwich and but it on your plate. What's the point of wasting that paper?  Its definitely not worth the amount I paid. I got empanadas too. The meat was good but I've had better empanadas other places for much less the price.   Overall it was disappointing but the experience got two stars because of the great service.

nM7Srq3CEzvekWT1Tv6sIw.text: We showed up at the perfect time -- 11:20 am on a Saturday just before the lines started to form.  The food that was served is as good as the hype that surrounds this restaurant.  We shared orders of the pork and caramelized onions, Broccolini, grits, steak sandwich, and pollo sandwich. The food came out hot, fast, and it was very good.  I would definitely go back.  I thought the prices were reasonable given the amount of food we were given.

SNTj_ce2UKlQ7a8nVdVQGw.text: Food was great and worthy of all the 5 star reviews. We ordered an assortment of meats and sides which really hit the spot. My party also made good timing (arrived on a Friday at ~6pm) and ordered/seated relatively quickly. When we left at 7pm, the line was out the door.

OZo7pBTGrkJC4m2c_AjvKg.text: At Burgh, this is quite a great establishment, as both the meat and the decor are good. However, the long waiting line is partially due to the popularity, which I understand, but also due to an inefficient order system. If they can seat people, it will be much quicker... anyway, none of my business. Beef is above average though not outstanding, but lamb is recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Left entrée is small ribeye, while the right is lamb.

3Syp2-LHqcmsr5UpGQXHHw.text: There's not much I can say that hasn't been said, but I've been a Gaucho fan for a long time. A couple years ago I was walking through the Strip and smelled something delicious. I followed my nose and found Gaucho (I like to think I discovered it before it got big). I've been at least 5 times since then and have told all of my friends, co-workers, family, and out-of-town guests.   The corn on the cob is simple and tasty. I usually get a steak sandwich and load it up with some of their fresh made sauces (chimichurri is great). The papas, shrimp, and salads are all good too.   As Gaucho has gotten more popular, the lines have been out of control, even after they expanded. The last 2 times I've tried to go to Gaucho, I've turned around and gone elsewhere due to the line. I hope they can figure out a way to expedite food a bit faster while maintaining quality - for their sake and ours!

6wrqTk5MT_h5ggjcT6aZoQ.text: If you love steak, you will love this place. Everything we ordered was fantastic, I suggest ordering smaller portions of the steak so that you can try more cuts and really figure out what you like. BYOB is a fantastic perk. My boyfriend and I did not have to wait for more than 5 minutes to get a table on a Thursday night, which was great!

HUSd__UIKMhjbVnFtrGZcA.text: Spent 4 days in Pitt had to eat here twice. Food service atmosphere are awesome. Everything on this menu is simple fresh and amazing. Try the piscada starter and any meat dish. You will not be disappointed or mind that you waited on a huge line to get in. BTW it's BYOB so bring a bottle the staff is more than happy to uncork you and supply glasses. I have three things more to say: GO HERE, go here, GO HERE. Returned back on 10/14/16 it's as good as ever !!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. It&#39;s worth the wait
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing food

PdX_0YFpMISnavVosY3H0Q.text: When our production crew and I were in town for work, we were told in reverential tones about this place...and wow! Glad we decided to brave the line. I've not found a great deal of Argentinian steak places in the US that aren't out west, but this one was a gem.   First thing to know, it's not really a sit-down (inside) place. They have a couple of counters with a few seats, and then a nice little patio around the building's corner, but otherwise it looks like a carry-out place. We weren't aware of this, but found patio spots regardless.  As you'd expect from a place specializing in Argentinian beef, the thing to order is steak. Or as it's written on the chalkboard "CARNE!!!" I had the ribeye sandwich with onions and tomatoes along with 2 different types of very subtly different chimichurri sauces. In a word, outstanding. Most of the guys had various types and cuts of beef and all were just perfectly seasoned and the flavor hits you immediately. Can't decide what kind of chimichurri to try? No worries, there is a large table in front of the register that has several large jars of all the different made-from-scratch options they offer! Take as many as you like to try. They also have a good selection of side dishes to share, try the grilled potatoes.  One last element can't go unmentioned. If you're thinking this place looks good but you have a vegetarian with you, no problem! We tried to order the meat-based empanadas (Can't remember what kind of meat) but for some reason they were out of the cut they usually do them with. So...with very skeptical attitudes, we opted for the vegetarian empanadas...and they were AMAZING. Just the right mixture of ingredients, perfect texture, served piping hot. They FAR exceeded all expectations for a pack of carnivores like us. Pittsburgh, you've got a real winner here!

ZqNRBXZzQy9n-g1izjXrzg.text: Damn this place is so good.  But those lines man, those lines.  The meats, the flavors, the everything make it worth it.  If you drive by and don't see the line out the door, then get out of your car and go inside.

M5hE2Cwq8rWbGTPi8ed0Vg.text: Very good, always a line, but worth the wait.  Hanger Steak, Flank Steak, Grilled Vegetables and Potatoes were all very good.  The different sauces they have are awesome.  This place lives up to everything that is said/written.  Must visit...it's pretty much a take out place, but they do have limited counter seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4mBodw_Gnl1NicVsOjxoUQ.text: Okay okay....I'm glad I came back here, well I didn't really come back, I made a coworker bring me back something for lunch. I got the rosemary braised beef sandwich and it was really out of this world. Large sandwich, tons of meat, a perfect balance of flavor. I didn't have to deal with the ambiance which probably helps my review. Solid A.

HnRf1FkjfS5xPM90cg-tyg.text: I think I am in the minority here, but I can't help but think this place is a bit overrated.  Too much oil, too much fanfare, too little meat, too pricey for my liking.  My qualms:   1. Why have Flank and Skirt steak? Seems a bit redundant and the two times I have ordered the Asado plate I could not distinguish them. The Asado plate is also expensive and a bit of a let down.  2. The Empanadas. Ugh, maybe I caught them on a bad day. I certainly hope so. It was dry, crusty and crumbled at the touch. I am a huge fan of meat pastries from every culinary persuasion and this was a surprising folly for a place so highly touted.  3. The salads. Skip the Argentino with steak. Never had the heart for any of the others because this was just floating in oil.  Overall, I still can't help but love this place. I can't. You don't find places like this in Pittsburgh and it is so refreshing to have the option for a "high end" steak sandwich in the strip. Still, I am just not into paying 25 bucks for lunch...in Pittsburgh...from anywhere.  If the line is short and your pockets a little too heavy I would definitely recommend. Nice people too!

RqI-8qwqT2Jq6C7MQoqt5A.text: One of the truly authentic great restaurants in Pittsburgh. The food is delicious and the staff is courteous and engaging.  The desserts are delicious too!  Is it any wonder why this place is packed and so popular?

PSuUqcQWmRScsUP9tN21zw.text: We went to the Strip just to try Gaucho because there has been so much hype about the restaurant. I ordered the burger and it definitely did not disappoint. I really like how you wait in line to order before being seated. That really sped up the process. We got our food pretty quickly and it wasn't too crowded until noon. By the time we left, the line wrapped around the side of the building.

rhSYI9pQtvRExXaX7Hd6mg.text: In town from Los Angeles, where there have been some really excellent Argentinian restaurants over the years (in particular the Gaucho Grill).  Stop the presses!  The Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is the new champ, lucky those of you who live in Pittsburgh, or are visitors!  I had the half Pollo, with the roasted potatoes, and the delicious selection of chimichurri (Mr. Atkinson, you have some competition).  The prices were reasonable, the portions generous.  Can't wait to return!!!

fThAwRrJuFqXtbQLmT4v-Q.text: The food is amazing. The atmosphere is nice.  Friendly service from the moment we walked in.  They explained the menu and gave great recommendations.  I had the ribeye my friend got the flank steak and shared an order of grilled vegetables.  Everything down to the grilled toast was some of the best food I've had.   I will definitely be back on my next trip to Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best in Pittsburgh

6PpjDsyjdQ-U3Z0cScayAA.text: Steak is perfectly cooked medium rare over a wood-fired grill, and thrown on a thick, garlicky, buttered, grilled ciabatta bun with red peppers, onions, and your choice of an Argentinian sauce. The Ribeye is my favorite when they got rid of the skirt. Love the flank, strip, and filet too. Easily in my top 3 sandwiches ever. If you haven't gone yet, well shame on you.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skirt steak sandwich!

8OnUc3zP5dh-y9gIgaZ-IQ.text: GREAT!!  Be prepared to wait there is always a line which speaks to how good the food is.

EPtSSAAvexHLdDsDf5iKZQ.text: I couldn't help noticing that I was the only female in line on a busy Friday lunch hour.  I guess it makes some sense since this is place is known for their steak sandwich and men love their meat.    Since I'm not much of a beef eater, I went with the small plate of shrimp (carones) and the potatoes (papas).  The shrimp and potatoes were lightly seasoned but you could definitely taste the fire grilled taste - YUM!  I'm a big fan of grilled food so this is a place to keep in mind when you have a craving for some fired food!  They do have a selection of sauces and I got to try a few of them (can't remember the names) - the one I liked the best had cilantro and chillies...it was also the one that was nearly done so it must be popular.    Next time I go, I'd like to try the grilled veggie sandwich!

B-QpWjgwRULigG6hhOXePg.text: Meats and sauces. Boom. Just out of downtown, this place serves up the goods. Pork sandwich on my plate and steak sandwiches for my friends. All given rave reviews. Additionally, loved the empanada and potatoes, and the service was outstanding.   Seriously, order as much as you can afford and gorge yourself.

QWFUQMM_ocacJG93Rh4pWQ.text: Gaucho's food is absolutely amazing.  I'd strongly recommend one of the combinations of multiple kinds of meats.  I love them all.  As far as vegetables, I'd recommend the grilled corn on the cob.  The only real downside to the place is the lack of indoor seating.  If the weather is nice, you have to try this place.

TjyFs42EnNYQZ-F_StXWBQ.text: Really, Really, Really Good!!!  I had the El Gaucho salad with Chicken.  It was awesome.  Also had the grilled corn.  It was perfect.   My friend had the ribeye sandwich, it was amazing.  The roasted potatoes were great too.   A hidden gem in Pittsburgh.

bHwQgia7lEcbnqrJUYEzkw.text: Do yourself a favor and get down to Gaucho!  Everything on the menu is amazing. I highly recommend the wings they are phenomenal!!!!

uj5weXgBf_VFIW7_6m1m3A.text: The food was beyond excellent and service was phenomenal. I lost my CA drivers license on our east coast trip and had no idea where I lost it. I apparently somehow dropped in in this restaurant since they were kind enough to mail it to me. I already had a replacement for my license when I received it but having my original license in hand gives me peace of mind. Thanks for taking the time to mail my license to me! You guys are amazing. Wish we could go back as the food and service there is awesome!

I00qVUpoCSVATcq8Vcu8Dw.text: Wonderful choices, cooked perfectly... Large menu but they manage it well and there are no bad choices! The lines have been mentioned... Go right at 5 if you want an early dinner, rain also helps!

uXoLjKxDxu7lBL3477lS7w.text: This place is absolutely amazing! I've lived in the Strip for a few months and it wasn't until just recently that I ate here for the first time, and I've already gone back since.... It's totally worth the 2 hour wait that extends out the door! So if you're starving and see the line, maybe opt for it some other time. The second time I went knowing there would be a long wait, so didn't show up hungry.   I had  the chicken sandwich which was delicious and tried out the assortment of sauces they have on hand and I was very impressed by them all!  It's also BYOB, so if you're in the long line it's wise to bring a cooler. We forgot and they let us put our beers in their fridge, so they are also great in terms of customer service!

4WdyWnEAic2R6LQa7v8XCA.text: Great food.  Worth the wait.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Well thought out--nice touch is the wine glasses for the BYOB customers--and NO CORKAGE FEE.  I shall return!

hJhNwPYURcvCPonIiTVhdw.text: Love this place. The only downside is that long impending wait for a table. Other than that, best BYOB place in town I would say. The food is great and very fairly priced. Grab your favorite bottle of wine and get there early so you can be seated quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great dinner portion.

_0CdRSgz0UDhOewE-F5v3g.text: This place has excellent steak and the smell is amazing.  There can be a long wait, but it's worth it!

GZVTV79B-zluI7J3ax33jQ.text: Gaucho is probably the most highly rated place to eat in the burgh.. And that's because they god damn deserve it!   I first experienced Gaucho at Pittsburgh Winery for a Yelp event. I tried their braised roast beef with horseradish sauce and was in love. The sauce complemented the beef so well and it was so unique! I also tried their chanchito- pork tenderloin with arugula, pickled red onion and mushrooms. Incredible. By far my favorite. The last item I had that night was their grilled shrimp with rice. I honestly don't know if I have ever had shrimp that juicy before and the flavors were out of this world good.   Tonight I had the opportunity to go to Gaucho for the first time! Located at the beginning of the strip (close to downtown)- it's not very large at all. There were enough seats for about 8 people, bar style. It was around 530 when we arrived and we didn't have to wait too long for some seats to open up. I ordered a steak plate- 6 oz hanger steak with a small salad and toasted bread. I also ordered some grilled maiz (corn). The boyfriend ordered the braised roast beef sandwich and my friend Nick ordered the carne sandwich- flank steak with red peppers on ciabatta.   I had the chance to try everything... Wow. The braised roast beef sandwich was incredible- my boyfriend was obsessed with the sauce and had to ask for extra. Nick let me try his sandwich and the flank steak was awesome! So juicy and went so well with the peppers.   My steak plate was crazy good!! Charred and smoky with tons of spices and super juicy. The grilled corn was amazing too! My mouth is watering just thinking about it.   This place is worth the hype. It's insanely delicious. Go there. Now.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. In love
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Heaven!!!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sauce station. They are all delicious

rf_tLBGab7jXjOk8TQ9x8w.text: i have nothing to complain about for this place. the people are very welcoming and they have a system that works great. the menu is filled with delicious options for everyone and i walked out feeling stuffed after only one sandwich. i recommend the carne sandwich but add an egg. the chimichurri is also tasty and adds a lot to the sandwich. i wouldn't recommend if you are planning on coming with a party of more than 4 people.

l1K-PW28zRFa3IF-mOfXvA.text: Gaucho does have some great food, but my last visit was quite disappointing. My burger was so salty it was difficult to eat, my dining companion noticed the same. I always worry that cooks add more sat when something is wrong with the food...... I don't expect restaurant food to be necessarily healthy, but when the salt burns your lips...something is really wrong. Whats wrong with regular seasoning, not going overboard?

aUJTqGBP0G_URsLQd2bcYg.text: Such a long wait for bad service and an unnecessarily expensive meal. The waiters were eh

0TV8NY1b6AOzaVAHySI2Ow.text: This place is ridiculous. Visiting Pittsburgh for a day and saw how highly rated it was, so wanted to try for lunch. OH MAN. What a good decision. The food is SO GOOD. We got a flank steak plate and a tilapia (the fish of the day) plate. Both were presented beautifully and were above and beyond our expectations. The four sauce accompaniments that are available are incredible, and I took a special liking to the ajo.  We came during off hours on a Tuesday, so there was no wait at all for a table which we were very happy about, having heard people warn of long wait times. The entire meal for the two of us was $34, which is beyond reasonable for the quantity of the food. For the quality they provide, $34 for those two plates is cheeeeeap!  I wish this place were in NYC - I'm trying to convince my boyfriend we should go back for lunch before we leave tomorrow!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. SO GOOD. flank steak on the left, tilapia on the right. Gorgeous and every single thing on the plate is delicious.

wagYI6Yskh6aqioETU4yuA.text: Great lunch ... counter service ordering is a little confusing but steak was great .. so was deconstructed sandwich

udX7TkfvlD_fM51vRgk_Uw.text: My friends brought me here to try Argentinian food. I was EXTREMELY disappointed because I ordered steak medium cooked and it had little to no seasoning. I don't recommend ordering steak from this place. Order something else like their sandwiches. Also, there's no seasoning on the table so you eat what they serve you. You pay ahead as well even if you don't like your food. So they rob you if you aren't satisfied with your order. I don't agree with this business model whatsoever especially since you are required to tip ahead of time even without being served first! Who does that?!?

lncC14kw_dCizJNsd5At4Q.text: This place is so small you probably can miss it if you're walking down the street.  What you won't miss is the smell.  The odor of wood burning and meat can be experienced well down the street.  You know how smell and taste senses are tied together?  Yes, that...  The place is really tight inside.  There's only bar stool seating along the perimeter of the dining area and a table in the middle with sauces.  The set up can be a bit uncomfortable in a sense that everybody is facing a wall or outside and there are people waiting for their orders and or seats to open up.  I was in line and my wife took the only 2 seats that were available for myself and her as I was in line waiting to order.  Another couple was ahead of me ordering their food and I wasn't sure if they were eating in or taking out.  Another person waiting around was waiting for his take out.  Well after that couple ahead of us had finished ordering they had nowhere to go just standing in the middle of the floor as all the stools were taken and some other customers that were done eating seemed to just be sitting around and talking and not really making room for new customers looking to have a seat and eat their food.  I had ordered a chicken sandwich and a steak (rib eye) sandwich.  While the flavors of these sandwiches were absolutely amazing the steak we both had a hard time with (we split each sandwich in half and shared each).  The steak seemed to be really tough to bite through chew.  Don't get me wrong the taste was absolutely amazing but the meat seemed rather tough to bite and chew for rib eye.  The portions are very generous.  The amount of meat on these sandwiches are NOT skimped at all.    Along with the sandwiches I had ordered a corn and the roasted potatoes (papas).  The potatoes were amazing but I really had to wait a while for them to cool off as they were really hot.  I guess the tip for future is steak is good but not in a sandwich because it's juicy and the bread gets a little mushy and the meat is too hard to bite.  A plate that we can cut with a knife and fork would probably be better.  I'm not sure of the rib eye as the meat was generous and thick cut, the meat seemed less tender than I as expecting for rib eye steak.    If it wasn't for the toughness of the steak sandwich I could easily grant 5 stars for Gaucho.  I would love to try the pork loin next time.  For the 2 sandwiches, potatoes, corn and one Limonata the bill came out to just under 29 bucks.  Not a bad deal for the quality they pump out of this hot spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rib eye steak

azR2XnGnMX9MtBn5FKOBjw.text: Wow!! I've never had anything like this, so delicious! I got the Carne sandwich with flank steak and it was so flavorful. The atmosphere was really cool and the employees were really helpful in pointing out their recommendations which ensured this great meal. My husband got the rosemary braised beef sandwich and it was so good too. We're not sure whose sandwich was better, but boy did they hit the spot on a cold day.

XetVeRJoFp2wBk4-uKO-3g.text: The food at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is literally other-worldly. I'm so happy for the Yelp event that introduced me to this restaurant!  My coworker and I came here for her birthday in late January. We were a little surprised to walk into the restaurant and find seating for less than 10 people. Thankfully, a lot of people ordering were picking up takeout to take back to their offices, so we were able to snag some bar stools.  We began chatting it up with the... owner? I forget... who had also been at the Yelp event several months prior, telling him that we had to check out the restaurant after tasting the food at the event. He is such a friendly, outgoing, eccentric kind of guy and is a lot of fun to talk to. He told us all about Gaucho's expansion plans. I can't wait for Gaucho to take over the neighboring space so that there will be more seating in the restaurant.  Let's get to the food... We ordered Steak Empenadas, Provoletta, Vegetales, Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich, and Camarones. Even though we had enough food to feed 5 people, we somehow inhaled almost all of it. The Steak Empenadas were wrapped in a flaky pastry and filled with a flavorful steak mixture. The Vegetales were tasty, roasted vegetables covered in balsamic vinegar. The Camarones were flavorful shrimp cooked in simple seasonings. My friend ordered the Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich, but since I'm not a horseradish fan, I only stole a bite or two and let her enjoy the rest. The only item that didn't totally knock my socks off was the Provoletta. There was nothing wrong with the dish - toast covered in provolone with arugula on the side - but it just didn't impress me like the other items did.  The food was so good that we just couldn't resist getting dessert. When Gaucho heard that it was my friend's birthday, they gave her the Alfajores cookies. We didn't try them until we had returned to work that afternoon, and they were the perfect hit-the-spot melt-in-your-mouth afternoon treat. The Panqueques were sweet crepes filled with a whole lot of caramel and topped with chocolate drizzle. This dessert just requires a love of caramel! The Crema Quemada - aka Creme Brulee - was perfectly smooth and creamy and crunchy.  I can't wait to return to Gaucho and bring my husband here to try all the delicious food. He was disappointed that I came without him, and I know that he'll be blown away the same way that I was.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crema Quemada and Panqueques
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetales, Carmarones, Steak Empenadas, Proveletta, and Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich

5CaCfpOTjJRviWpscqFA8A.text: We traveled all the way from Houston and wanted to eat here for dinner. Despite our best efforts, we showed up right at 9pm and the white haired older guy grumbled about letting me in. Then while I was ordering he came behind the counter and grumbled to the guy who was in the middle of taking my order, "damn, it looks like we're going to have to stay until 11 again!"  Ok...   I really like the concept of this place.  We ordered the Parrillada Mixta (New York steak, chicken breast, spicy chorizo). This was the most lacking of all of the dishes. The meats were all cold and the chicken was dry but the flavors were good. Perhaps this is due to us showing up late.  We also had the large grilled vegetables which were EXCELLENT and the Caldo Del Mar which was also EXCELLENT. It was steaming hot and definitely hit the spot.  All the serve-yourself accompanying sauces were pretty great too.   I would have given this place 4 stars if the "older guy" didn't leave such a bad taste in my mouth. Everyone else was very friendly but it just takes one bad apple in a restaurant service.  Later we heard him grumble that they only made "72" today to another worker. Don't know what that means exactly except that he's a big grumble pot.

nZ32AQzTQ09xN4Yoor7UAQ.text: THE Question to ask yourself at this place is: does the good food make up for the Mean Nazi like seating system that requires customers to wait outside in 10 degree temps ( and don't block the effing  entrance) versus being seated in any of the abundant empty tables?   The old man acting bossy boss was downright rude from the moment I walked in!  How bout kindly saying "hey, do you mind sitting at a bar stool till your food is ready?  I'm seating people who have gotten food already in these tables." ( my spouse was in line ordering)instead he was aggressive and rude. Stupid system and mean customer service.  Rudeness can easily outweigh good food.  Answer:  not worth it

029sWrVkReY8-BSo88FOjQ.text: Very rude customer service and not accommodating to serve me. The restaurant closes at 9pm during the week. I showed up at the restaurant at 830pm and was refused service with only 4 people in line ahead of me and I was a single eater. I talked with one of the employees and she said that I could not be served, I even offered to take it to-go. Please do not waste your time with customer service such as this. I had been waiting for about 3 months to get off of work in time to try this place out. Never again.

GwPE4F_c-WIOqUP1wPUD8g.text: Amazing food at decent prices but they need to change their ordering/seating procedure.

yW8AGTlofWlED-wJ_b5arA.text: Favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh, handsdown! The only hang up is that there is always a line. Trust me, it's worth the wait. The steak is always cooked perfectly and the i highly recommend getting the seasonal sides like the corn.

3t_SuS2LIAjs1RBLQFFB8A.text: I went to Gaucho's with a friend at around 5:30pm so we didn't have to wait long to get seated. We ordered a large NY strip steak to share, as well as a side dish of mushrooms. The mushrooms were really good and aromatic. However, the steak that we had requested to be cooked medium came out to be too well done. When we told our waitress about it, she agreed with us that it was too well done and went to get her manager. The manager then came, apologized and offered to remake our steak. They were both extremely polite and friendly and handled the situation very well. The steak we ended up getting was perfectly juicy and tender!

Sy0Ay6p6fVBjbV3MbBNZyA.text: I've been here a while ago and just writing a review. Definitely come early in the morning, every other time it is packed!! Line stretches a block down! Delicious food! Nice portions! Definitely come with friends and have a great time!

JbwEf4lFEhF-Cz8_FP-8GQ.text: You cannot believe your own heart. You cannot deny your own mind. You cannot free yourself From the memory Of beef Of beef like this Between two pieces Of bread Like ass cheeks  Of salted yeast  Tender as starlight  Real as a circus animal's desertion Savoury as the last drop of sweat released, expunged in a faraway land, still clinging to your sunbeaten brow. You gaze at the vast endless new territory Of the rest of your life. You have arrived ...but can you leave?

VDPMqIftzlGHkPJ-seO6sg.text: This is one of my favorite Pittsburgh restaurants. I only go at 5 PM on a weekday to beat the crowds. I love that the byob has no charge and that the food is consistent. The Ajo sauce is my favorite so make sure to try it

Qbaxweupy0hA5utgbndp4g.text: I have heard, read and witnessed raving reviews about Gaucho but every time I drove past the line was way too long for me to wait. Not because I didn't think it was worth it, but mostly becasue when I go eat I am usually already starving to death.   Tuesday, 2pm I ventured to the strip to gather some fresh fruits and veggies and for the first time ever there was no line. I parked nearby and thought to myself "no line, probably closed." Nope! They were open and ready to feed my soul!   I walked in, glanced at the enormous menu and asked the kid behind the counter what he recommended. I settled on the carne ribeye steak sandwich. My order was up within a few minutes. The sandwich came wrapped in paper like a butcher would do. I was directed to the sauces (4 in total) I scooped a small scoop of each in the container and went to the table.   The sandwich was excellent! All the sauces were to die for and the steak was just so succulent and cooked to perfection. The only negative thing I can think of was that I was still a bit hungry after the sandwich, I didn't realize it came alone with no sides :-( I assumed for $12 It would have come with fries, chips or even a pickle!   I will surely go back to gaucho but I will also be sure to order more food so I don't leave hungry next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Rib Eye Steak Sandwich.

_9mFFQhgKm9BLl569EL_VQ.text: Seriously good meat. Extensive menu and efficient ordering process. We had a weekday lunch and were seated very quickly.   The flavour of the steak was intense and delicious. It was cooked perfectly to order. Also shared a beautiful burger.  Can't wait to go back next time we are in Pittsburgh. Hopefully my Aussie $5 note is on the wall!

kWnZ5jlXy9qj7UotUdrxmA.text: I've been meaning to come to this place years ago when they first opened but never had the opportunity to do so.. either because something came up or the long was awfully long. However the opportunity presented it self as I had to visit Heinz History Center for a morning event. Since it was only few minutes walk from the center, it was the perfect excuse and time to finally pay Gaucho a visit.  Although there wasn't any line outside, the inside line was a different story. The order line was pretty cramped and right around to a point where any additional people would have to wait outside. As I was standing on the line - the long list of menu on the chalk board was somewhat overwhelming but you can always ask to the people before or after you for recommendation. And pretty much everyone will recommend something different. I looked up on Yelp and since I was craving beef - I went with the Rosemary Roasted Beef. I also ordered a "Dog Bone" .. Yes you heard me correct - A Dog Bone for my new puppy :)  The folks behind the counter are super friendly and helpful. Once you order, someone will guide you to a seat and your food will be at the table in no time. If you are with someone - I would recommend both ordering something different since the sandwiches are pretty big that you can actually split among the two. However, I cleaned out the entire sandwich by myself. The roast beef juicy, well seasoned and just cooked to perfection. Caramelized onion and horsey sauce made it just perfect without overpowering the roast beef. If you want more variety of flavors there are 4 specialty sauces that you can add.  The atmosphere here is very casual, industrial like or may be I should say farmhouse like (specially with all the stacked woods) and lively. Everything is reasonably priced especially for the portion you get. Like me don't let the long lines discourage you. It's definitely worth a visit.

ZBDrOX9CmoiDOAMFX_TU7w.text: The food here is of really great quality and has great flavor. The biggest issue is the waiting to order and sit. We waited in line for over an hour. In this day and age, they should be able to have a system to text you when it's your turn to order so you can walk around and enjoy your evening. For this reason, we would not return even though the food was very good.

oZSEGMPbYkEXvyPip0hoBw.text: The food was absolutely outstanding. We had the pork chops, shrimp , empanada , and meat and cheese plate.  Probably in the top ten places I have eaten.   This place really makes fine dining accessible   We will be back again ..... tomorrow

GSeeOA76wIhEY77LLW77dw.text: Waited in line for an hour and 40 minutes on a Saturday during dinner time...but let me tell you it was so worth it!!   I feel like Gaucho is not just a place where you go to eat food, but more for the overall experience. The environment is bustling, warm, and very up and coming. I loved being able to pay for my meal in advance before we sat down so that when it was time to leave we didn't have to wave down the server for the check.   We went for the Asato platter and it was a lot of meat. It was cooked amazingly well. I'm not a steak fan actually but it was delicious I would say get sides if you go with this platter otherwise the meat is a little too overwhelming. Would recommend the potatoes and vegetables! Will be returning to try the paella.   Expect to be there for much longer than a typical dinner because of the wait. But definitively one of the best places in Pittsburgh. 10/10 would recommend to a friend

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asato Platter with Potatoes!

T3BO3jYxvddH924NksDlUA.text: The staff here is absolutely amazing...second only to the unbelievably delicious food .....my cravings continue and anytime I'm in the strip I have to make a stop at Gaucho.  If you can...try to get there at an off time (harder and harder to find an "off time" as the place is super popular).....however it is definitely worth the wait in line.   I have always said..."I will NEVER stand in a line to wait to get into a restaurant"  ....but for Gaucho I have and will ...absolutely worth it!

gxmF-CYHlf9eCpY7w4YUGg.text: Fantastic grilled meat: Visiting Pittsburgh and was told we had to visit. Initially put off by the neighborhood, The Strip is not much to look at. Any reservations we had about the neighborhood were quickly put to rest once we smelled the food! Started with three varieties of empanadas all of which were savory and delicious.  For entrees we had a gorgeous burger served on ciabatta toast, perfect lamb chops and a grilled assortment platter with steak, chicken and sausage.  Desert was available but we were too full.  Friendly staff, quirky decor.  Finally, BYO so don't forget a hearty red.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Assorted sauces for your carne.

M4AF1AjCeslcuHhcXaA8Ew.text: Excellent flavors, and nice staff! I had the small New York steak (Bife de chorizo) and a couple of empanadas. The grilled meats are cooked to your taste. Make sure you get each of the four sauces and try them with your food. The place is Zagat rated. I found the prices very reasonable for quality food.

TBRksXueR2pUVjU1U9VGiQ.text: The 55$ steak came with no sides except bread which I had to ask for twice and was over salted. The portion was very small too. Very disappointed

Rusq04wGSKTSirknSMPJBw.text: I like Gaucho sandwiches as much as the next person, but I can't give it 5 stars because I haven't found a holy grail item that I'd like to order again and again.  This place takes really good care of making your sandwich, whether it be the smoked meat, variety of sauces to try, or fresh bread.   The interior is coolly decorated and it's definitely a chill place to hang out. I've gotten the rosemary sandwich, which was decent. Up for trying the burger out next!

ku-LNtAu8oZhx5QZg2CDxA.text: I have been here for lunch and dinner. I have to say the food has always been great! Fair warning, there are no reservations nor a waitlist. You have to stand in line (usually wrapping the building) outside. That being said it is completely worth it!

4Ln2iaTlRaRBsQaP0Lt-lg.text: Empanadas are truly great. BYOB policy is pretty nice, they offer glasses and will open your drinks for you at no extra fee :)  atmosphere is inviting and relaxed and staff is friendly

EEEvSzAXfPcFtpZroangMQ.text: Just, yes! I took my 6 years old, there was nothing left on his plate. Great salad, sauce and everything else was a delight. So so fun & delicious. Glad to have tried it - worth going on a splurge or spending less. You'll be happy.

dznJDkI1FwjCFIrVuYlmag.text: Rosemary Briased Beef and ALL THE SAUCES!! Gaucho has quickly and easily become one of my all time favorite restaurants in the area. If you catch it at the right time, there is no wait. If you go when it's busy be prepared to wait- but it's always so worth it! This is a great place for date night, family night, girls night out and lunch! Still haven't tried the Brussels sprouts but hope to on one of my many return trips!

xIyWVExE9ugch-tfEd3N9g.text: Great food. The Parrilla Mixta was great! Please give it a try. The meats were tender and delicioso! The people there were very friendly and attentive. I would return to this place. I recommend it.

EreIEBBiPZ_1j3m8G3SU8Q.text: Everytime I go there is always a wait but it is well worth it. To avoid the wait go at 11am on a weekday but by noon there is a line. Taste a little bit of everything, you wont be disappointed.

1X3-eLIwFvmrs6ywnFRiHg.text: Their food is always perfectly cooked and full of flavor. The staff is ahead of the game. I would say I wish the place was bigger but I don't think it would matter. Their food is so good it is worth waiting for and I think there would always be a line.

Bc1fQH73CjO9KyLL6IqVDA.text: Gaucho Parilla Argentina is a hidden gem in the Strip District! We grabbed lunch here before visiting the Heinz History Center and loved our meal! This is a foodie place at VERY reasonable prices! We had the 12 empanadas, beef, chicken and veggies, and they were delicious! They were traditional Argentinian empanadas with very flavorful filling and nice crust. Our favorite were the beef which had a little bit of spice. For dessert we tried the chocolate chip almond cookie, and it was an elevated gourmet cookie.   Great service, delicious food, and VERY reasonable prices

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A glimpse at the menu. Next time we are in Pittsburgh we are trying the Paella

CEoKPA2__Am2llSbWVElhA.text: Awesome stuff.  The sauces though .. um, so great, but they get really nasty when 75 people have made their way through them.  I got sick the next day, possibly from the heavy grease of this meal!  Was so tasty though

UganApWGs8HthQBIYGs2kA.text: This is the kind of food that makes you happy. It is that good. I had the Carne Sandwich with ribeye steak, caramelize onions and grill pepper with chimichurri sauce and let me tell you that it was amazing. I ordered by phone because usually the line in this place are very long.  Now I know why. The smell in this place makes you hungry. The employees are very friendly. I can't wait to go back and try other stuff in the menu. Excellent food.

SfjpCglapI1qbbwBLYaOtw.text: After reading reviews and seeing a line out the door the day before we visited, hubby was a little disappointed. I thought it was great. We tried a few different items from the menu. Everyone is raving about the Rosemary beef. I enjoyed the pork more. Excellent burger (though we did have to send back to cook longer - it was for one of the kids). Spicy chorizo was excellent - and spicy! The sauces are excellent - the chimmi was our favorite.

MvR9sMQ0SvZYm3lm5LKtYQ.text: This place was great! Food was delicious and their sauces were on point! I recommend this place to anyone. Chicken was a little dry but other than that everything was great! Will def come back if I'm ever in the area again!

TVxRMAjY93Koir309LdTGw.text: Quite possibly the best Hamburger I ever had.  The meat was seasoned perfectly.  Try the various dips they have to add some extra flavor.

nLtulpZ-1FI3k8jbJWJxQA.text: Absolutely my favorite place to come to when I visit Pittsburgh. The flavors are amazing, you can't go wrong with any meal.

euvC0KB_vrK84gXpR3RArg.text: It was my first time at an Argentine place. I must say the steak was very good.  Seating arrangements can be a little problematic, but overall this place is great.

cQ9gRCaWQn9tC1a1bodPww.text: Great food. Meat Meat and Meat what's not to love. The staff was very friendly and helpful as the menu is overwhelming for a first timer. I would go back again anytime I return to Pittsburgh. I only wish I would have know it was BYOB.

hJklTbvxhJCHbfwZ6N4unA.text: OMG, the meat is to die for, never have I had meat taste this good. I dream of the meat here, never tasted so good, can't wait to return, don't care if there is a line out the door, I will wait in line to savor the food, I'm salivating right now just thinking about it.

uSVdd-IZMhQ8KtpobBT04Q.text: The food smells great from a block away, and the staff is super friendly!  Be prepared to wait in line, though, and BYOB for that line, because you'll be there for a long while.

73d8NpfCzNOgm9Vb7lKduA.text: We just had Argentinian food in downtown Pittsburg... amazingly tender meats,  wonderful vegetables and tasty sauces. The owner chef is very kind and personable. His assistant is very fast too. Food is better tasting than many more far more expensive steak houses we have been to. There is a reason why this place had a all 5 star ratings ..... WELL DESERVED 5 STARS !!

1dGmYyj2i_Sa3Ze4yBZtiQ.text: Awesome!  The lines around the corner tell the story--great Argentinian grilled meats, and everything to go with them.  Nice bright space in a building that sat empty for too long.  Can't wait to go back!

DXbr81Y9zLGJSWNhaHH5bg.text: The smell outside of this place is enough to make you want to come inside and wait (as long as it takes) and place an order of your own. I should stress the need for patience in here. Lunch time the place is slammed. The menu is very extensive. It's a unique place to have in Pittsburgh. I do think it's a bit way over-hyped, in most cases overpriced. I would recommend that someone try the samplers they offer so that you are better able to get an good idea of the offerings. As a fairly well travelled person, I find that it's simply incredibly hard to reproduce any ethnic offering outside of the originating country. Can I say that? The meats are just a bit high on the sodium count - this was my personal experience. I'd go back for sure, but not often. I particularly liked the Brussel sprouts with bacon topped over them but it was for sure fairly NaCl+ed. Good thing is the byob, too. Make sure you bring lots. You may need it not only for the reasons mentioned, but also to help drown out the noise levels. No one said it would be quiet.

JK6ITX1H4txpLy0U6i4X2w.text: Amazing, just amazing and very tasty. Had this been in nyc or sf they could easily get 1.5x the current pricing. I'd say that this is the one of the best steak restaurants i've had in nyc, pit and sf combined. The vibe is cool hip casual, easily could be the best place in the strip for a date or if you want to pamper yourself with great food.

_ToW0TA1zL8vFxOziShvTA.text: Really good for the meat eater. I loved the salsas especially.  I'll definitely be back!

qN1Yz9O2EvpCn5rcfsHbSg.text: This place is overrated. My steak sandwich was burnt. The vietnamese restaurant nearby has better sandwich.

azeRriHRUdQhrombbiwohA.text: Dang well deserving of the five stars. Sat outside, BYO B, awesome staff who was enthusiastic, and some of the best meat I've ever had in my life.   10/10 would take a detour into Pitt again just for the steak.

onJcrbGtSzujQfZdkz8BEQ.text: Hands down, best sandwich I have ever had.  Carne Sandwich with Skirt Steak is my go to.  Perfectly cooked steak on fluffy ciabatta that soaks up all of the goodness.  Topped with caramelized onions and roasted red peppers.  The staff is always friendly, no matter how busy it is... and man can it be busy on the weekends.  Call ahead to order and you dont have to wait in the long line.  The owner is very cool, gave me a beer once (its BYOB but he had a growler of some East End Big Hop), which was awesome.    Plus, they have dog bones for a buck that my dog goes absolutely crazy for... sorta like I do for the sammie.  Get there... it is worth it!

-I8zgnqjUbRQxBFXmiSfyw.text: Ridiculos! So tasty.  Treat yourself to this little gem before the line reaches Argentina.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlicky toast.  Friggin fungos. Roast veggies.  Flank steak slathered in chimichurri.

aCgOjX9qHF-VHTtJHtA3Pw.text: The food is really good. I love the seafood soup and the ribeye. The price is a bit high for the amount of food you get but it is worth it.

SALXGfkzQUweJvTV3tqhDA.text: The wait is usually pretty long, but food is literally amazing.

FVLuFYpyLCf2oQKfHo6u-Q.text: I'm impressed with the smoked wood aroma that ultimately made us turn back in our tracks to go see what this place had to offer.  You step in and immediately you're in clear view of the grill with the wonderful & tasty creations going on right before your eyes.  Staff is knowledgeable and explained the menu quite well as this was our first time here.   Our order was taken promptly and we headed out to the quaint patio to choose our table as the place was quickly getting busy. They offer a delectable choice of sauces to complement the main entree. The garlic was by far my favorite. Although, each sauce added a certain flair to every bite of steak. We ordered a regular size order of the skirt steak- the portions were more than plenty. A side of rice,  and a roasted corn completed our meal. Presentation was great. They used wooden oblong plates that added a certain element to the dish.  Our order was brought out to our table surprisingly fast.  The skirt steak was tender, juicy and seasoned just right and served with a fresh baby greens salad and a slice of buttery toast. The roasted corn was tasty. The yellow saffron rice was good. The empanadas were okay. Overall,  the food was delectable and I will be back to try the rest of the menu offerings. (I'm giving it four stars due to the fact that they didn't have a bathroom for patrons)...

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HM20U_vvHci-UPD9gI0-7w.text: I actually hated this place. Although the spices were authentic to Spanish culture, the menu was extremely confusing and overwhelming. I ended up ordering something extremely bland because everything said it was "spicy." Also, I don't understand why I have to order paella for a family of 6 and pay $55 dollars for it.

SzJ31pq7srxUiWR4iDc5yA.text: One of the tastiest meals I've ever had. I got the bon mi sandwich (pork loin), papas (potatoes), and maiz (corn on the cob). There was a long line but it was well worth the wait. It actually gave me enough time to look over the entire menu.   Everything was delicious! That may have been the best corn on the cob ever! The restaurant was clean with a rustic look & casual feel. The staff was very friendly & attentive   All four of the homemade sauces are incredible, and you can take to-go cups. I particularly like the pimenton (spicy pepper) and ajo (garlic). They don't serve alcohol but you can BYOB, and there is no cork fee if you bring wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bōn mi, papas, maiz

Py11T38oDmMjt_KBzxBVxQ.text: Oh Gaucho, how I love thee.  I've been to Gaucho a few times now, but most recently to celebrate my dad's birthday following all of the renovations.  For the building space they acquired, the amount of seating inside is surprisingly sparse.  But who cares how close to other people you are when everyone is shoving their mouths full of wonderful, beautiful, perfectly cooked beef?  We went with my parents' friends and ended up ordering TWO carne platters and essentially every side on the menu, as well as some grilled shrimp.  It's hard to pick a favorite out of everything, but I think that of the beef cuts, the ribeye was the winner, and the sides, the spicy corn pulled ahead as the most unique.  That said, there wasn't a single bite that wasn't spectacular.  They recently applied for a liquor license, which is at once exciting and disappointing.  I do love the fact that they are BYO without a corkage fee, but can imagine that they will come up with some uniquely Argentine cocktails to accompany the fare.  I wonder where, exactly, the bar will be going?

Qv4xs53LJt1kHsF3Ay3atQ.text: This place is probably one of THE MOST delicious restaurants I've ever had the pleasure of patroning. A M A Z I N G. I will definitely be back on my next trip to the Burgh!

sRcLTGwvu72CNZT2Mgbr6A.text: Fantastic! The ribeye was juicy and flavorful.  The bread was soaked in steak drippings. But in a good way! I would go back in a heartbeat. Could eat that sandwich weekly! Great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The ribeye!

pLot1IKbBZwuogZg_4e4BQ.text: Loved this restaurant. Casual atmosphere with high end food. So unique. Great experience.

pC8ExSN8GSSV0V-p_3hV1g.text: Dis place has some downright good tastin victuals, it does. I was almost hoping I wouldn't be impressed with Gaucho. But I must say, believe the hype. Ok so it's 7th in the 2015 Yelp Top 100. That means that it is the 7th best rated restaurant in the U.S. That is impressive. So here I am writing the 400th and some 5 star review. Pthth (eye roll). Pointless. But I'm a fan. I want it to stay up there on the list.   So I was wondering, what could possibly be so outstanding about Gaucho (the meaning of gaucho is, a cowboy of the South American pampas ((which is an extensive treeless plain in South America (((South America is where Argentina is and Argentina is where good food cooking gauchos live))) )) )? It couldn't be That amazing. The simple answer to that question is, everything. Everything about it is good.   FOOD: Famous for steak sandwiches, Rosemary braised beef sandwiches (what I got) or just meat in general, not only beef. I also got a side of humita which is a corn pudding. The sandwich was huge with lots of bread and lots of flavor. It was slightly dry but that is fixed with the addition of one of the four wonderful chimmis. The chimmis are a complete winner here.   THE PLACE:  I was expecting a little hole in the wall joint but that's not what it is anymore since they did a massive redo. It's got a great atmosphere now. It's a super cool place with lots of wood design. Stacks of fire wood along the wall, wood floor, wood tables, and they bring your food out in wooden dishes. Your food is prepared fairly quickly and the service is great and the people are pleasant.   Yes, every aspect of this place is nearly perfect. Everyone from foodies to farmers, hoodlums to hipsters (guess not much different there) will be impressed. There's no way you Couldn't like it. I now can understand why it's got such rave reviews.

SKBzMmWokeDFrXuLOCbb8Q.text: I realized I've been too liberal with my star rating. From now on, my mind has to be blown to get a 5-star review. Gaucho Parilla wasn't mind-blowing but the food was OUT-DANG-STANDING!  I took my fiance there for his birthday last night and WOW!  What a different experience. I got a steak burger, I'm not sure what his entree was, and we got empanadas. Everything was so good, especially my steak burger. That was a GREAT burger! Downsides - it was a little bit intimidating for an introvert like myself. You walk in, stand in line and order and pay for your food right away. Then you find a table yourself and your food is brought to you by some waiter coming into the dining room and yelling your name. I didn't like this. I want to be seated, have a waiter and a menu. But that's just my personal preference. I'll go back for the food.

r5IrHnf5TlXkfzbhJVjbcw.text: Very tasty food and friendly service. You might be in for a wait for a table - but that's because it's delicious and well priced. Great casual ambiance. Excellent lunch spot.

4ijuo8js_WW67y5nmeEdYw.text: We got here just after 5 pm and got right in. The menu is on a huge chalkboard as you come in. Lots of good stuff to chose from. Every thing we had was great. Good service, great atmosphere.  It's BYOB but that's ok.  The sauces are really good too. We had a great time and great food!! When your in Pittsburgh and in the strip district this is a must !#

5en6JrbJX67oh7rf6HtwKQ.text: If I worked closer, I'd have my lunch here daily. Filet sandwich hit the spot but the sides are the real deal. We had the roasted red potatoes, mushrooms and corn. Delicious! Plus, all the homemade sauce options are bottomless. Try as many as you want, and get as much as you want! What's better than not having to ask for extra extra extra extra hot sauce?

wCgomutadtGSSZENtwgY2w.text: I went here with two co-workers for lunch on a Friday afternoon.  We had to drive around the block a few times to find a parking space as the Strip gets very busy around lunch time.  My co-worker said this is his favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh so I had high expectations.  We had to wait outside because if was very crowded for the lunch hour.  I thought this was a good sign.  I don't eat red meat and none of the sandwiches appealed to me so I ordered a large side of grilled vegetables, roasted potatoes, and grilled corn on the cob.  The vegetables were black and mushy because they were so overcooked.  They had a good flavor and the optional sauces were tasty, but it was hard to overcome that they were so grossly overdone.  The potatoes were also overcooked and blackened with way too much rosemary seasoning.  I had to brush a lot of the seasoning off of them so they could even be edible.  The corn was the best part of the meal as it was the only thing cooked and seasoned appropriately.  My other co-worker ordered the carne sandwich and was happy with it.  His potatoes were also overdone and over-seasoned.  My vegetarian co-worker ordered the same thing as I did and also commented that the vegetables were overcooked.  I think this place is probably great if you're a meat-lover, but probably not the best choice for vegetarians.  If I go again, I'll give the chicken sandwich a try, but with so many other great options in this area I'm not sure if I'll be back.

24KFWZ8yMZh3oVVBOVc5pw.text: There's no rave I can make that hasn't been made here already. BUT, the accolades bear repeating. Get to Gaucho and get yourself the best beef in the 'Burgh! Bar none. Holy cow (pun not originally intended, but okay, I'll roll with it), this place is amazing!  In the mood for a steak sandwich? Well, what kind? Your choice of flank steak, skirt steak, ribeye, strip or filet? Or how about chicken? Or shrimp? Chorizo your thing? Or possibly the fish of the day? All piled high on a HUGE ciabatta-style bread with your choice of toppings..and sauces. Chimichurri, pimienton, garlic...I can't remember what the other one is. Want some grilled veggies on that? There are too many to list...just ask for what you want, chances are they'll have it.  Going light and want a salad instead? I had the Gaucho salad with the skirt steak, grilled tomatoes, carrot, avocado, asparagus and roasted corn all piled high on fresh, beautiful greens. Or maybe you'd prefer the Argentino with roasted potatoes and portobellos?  Get ready for sides of corn on the cob roasted in the husk over the wood-fired grill. Oh! All the meats and proteins are grilled over wood that you'll see stacked in the back and in the front under some of the counters. That's part of the secret of the flavor!  Desserts, too, are pretty darn special.  Not much seating, but there are a few stool and counters inside and a few tables outside. Get there while the weather is beautiful...come to think of it, it might still be worth it sitting in 32 degree weather in your parka just to savor the flavor of smoky summer-ish goodness!

I5LIA1rqPrPLU2HCyH6JdA.text: Believe the hype.  All. Of. The. Hype.  Gaucho is that good.  I made my maiden voyage to this meat mecca on a warm muggy Friday afternoon.  The line was out the door - all in all about a 20-25 minute wait.  The queue fits surprisingly little few people indoors, which might be my only gripe about the place.  Ambience: From the outside, you would not know this place existed.  Tucked away on the far end of the vibrant Strip District, I actually mistook the kitchen entrance as the front door.  Once inside, you find a really tastefully done interior.  Wood finishing is prevalent throughout, covering everything from the the condiment islands to the plates that the meals are served on.  Taken all together, it's a great match for the food that Gaucho serves.  Service: In two words - friendly and attentive.  Despite being an order-at-the-counter establishment, the table bussers appear to double as "servers", checking in on us several times after we sat down, doing everything from offering silverware to refilling water.  Great model.  Food: Nothing I've written would have mattered if the food didn't match in quality - and boy did it.  Collectively, our group ordered 3 sandwiches (ribeye, fish, and pork), a side of potatoes, and an empanada.  The potatoes were golden and crisp on the outside, creamy on the inside.  Perfect for dipping into one of their 4 sauces.  (sauce sidebar: try them all, over and over and over.  Each one was delicious in its own right, from a classic chimichurri to a roasted red pepper.  The right dip to bite ratio is 1:1 - just trust me).  Ok, back to the food.  I ordered the fish sandwich, which came with perfectly charred white fish (cod, perhaps?), sweet carmelized onions, and a soft chewy bun.  Great bun to meat ratio, great balance of flavors.  Each sandwich came with the same bun, but slight variants on the meat accompaniments (peppers for the steak, mustard for the pork) - all were delicious.

xJIdm8Q8gGnn5dBu8x2pZA.text: Hands down my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh- it never disappoints.   I always take people from out of town here and it's always a crowd pleaser. Just be prepared to wait in line for an hour if you go on the weekend at any time!

_jusZ9V624Ml9rnxSWEd6Q.text: Opening tip: try mid afternoon!  We arrived around 2:30 on a Friday afternoon. I loved the experience of walking into the space- hardwood floors, brick walls, wrought iron chandeliers, high ceilings, chalk board menu and well-merchandised sauces. There's so much from which to choose that we decided on three menu items, but be prepared to order your drinks first. I had the small flank steak, which was around $12. He had the small ribeye which was $13, I think. We also ordered the small camarones for $10. They ask for your name and then you find a seat. Before you grab your seat, grab silverware. We didn't have a problem finding a place and opted to sit upstairs, which was open and had a variety of tables, some that could accommodate 8-10 (maybe more), so you can easily dine with groups. At each table you will find a napkin dispenser and a fresh flower. Note: you WILL NOT find steak sauce, salt or pepper so don't be that person...  Our steaks were ordered (and arrived) medium and served with ciabatta bread and salata with an amazing balsamic dressing. The ciabatta was hard so I let it soak up some of the chimichurri sauce. The steaks were perfectly prepared and sliced. The presentation on the wooden platters was clean and inviting. We shared a bite of our steaks and we preferred our own. I loved the camarones doused with lemon.   Highly recommend Gaucho to anyone!

irdtVv7K8CQawDYHDsJTpw.text: You order at the counter and pay first, but the restaurant is nicer than that sounds. This place a cool vibe and good service,  but the food is why this place has a line out the door.   The empanadas are not the traditional ones I'm used to, (I've been to Argentina several times) but they are good. We liked the pork one the best. The rosemary and garlic red-skin potatoes were awesome!  Much more flavor than normal boring potatoes. The steak was  really good, and the bread was crispy and spot on. The sauces were tasty and plentiful too.   I highly recommend this restaurant when in Pittsburgh.

WocO8TmKbD57b2i40cU5EQ.text: Never have been disappointed here! You can smell it a block away and that only makes you want it more!   Everything from the steak to chicken to fish is all incredible!   Staff is beyond friendly and down to earth. They get they're a small place and they make people feel appreciated and welcomed even with a line out the door!   Can't wait for their expansion!  Ps- secret patio seating on the side and its BYOB! Just hard to find a seat!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummmmmy plates
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smokey goodness

_qC34zB-LFf9oCN-m8yIwQ.text: Do not come here unless you are willing to swallow your food and leave immediately after!  Because the food was delicious, my friends and I kept ordering more without hesitation, tipping generously along the way.  Clearly the wait staff did not care about allowing us to enjoy our meals and desserts and attempted numerous times to clear our plates when it was obvious that we were not finished eating.  At one point, as were drinking our coffee, one server gave us "a 10 minute warning".  When I contacted management, they made excuses and said they would give us a gift certificate, but never followed through.  Arrogant and tacky :(

Bs3jc0pVTE8gM-MezGffFw.text: Padilla Gaucho is a---mazing. saw it listed as a top 100 Yelps actually 17 in PITTSBURGH?? YUP Pittsburgh!!  I grew up in Pitt, and have been back and forth once every few years for about 25 years. I had to try it. I went yesterday 2/27 with my sister, I had an idea where it was, I knew the area very well, beginning of the  strip, old old building,(they are expanding into the next space this spring and have a pation on the opposite side weather permitting)  If you are not going right to it and know its there you would walk by 99 out of 100 times. FIRST THING;  if the braised beef is available do not hesitate, eat this sandwich.  Flavors out of this world. Caramelized onions. Horseradish sauce. You will not eat s better sandwich.  But get there early they do sell out of this one. Ate this sandwich on my third visit because it was sold out the first two times I was there.    I had the Tilapia plate fire grilled 2 nice size portions, with carmelized onions,  greens, asparagus, grilled tomato they have a little sauce bar (4 mason jars) but do your self a favor and try each on your meal / sandwich, they each have solid flavors.   Tilapia was grilled perfectly, which is not easy to do with this very thin white fish. also ordered the Provelleta, sharp provolone on crisp grilled bread, Sister ordered the steak burger well done and it was again made perfectly hanging right on the edge of well and medium. they give you many options for add ons, she had greens and pickled onions and sharp prov. I could not even speak when the food came out it looked amazing and tasted even better. The staff was so friendly and talkative, never felt like we were being rushed or bothering them. George took our order and walked us thru the whole process again never trying to move us along even as the small area was filling up behind us. He was very kind to every single person that came thru.   well folks, the next day, I had to go back this place is addictive, took niece and sister back in today and was greeted with "two days in a row Bob" George greeted us, sister (creature of habit) had the steak  burger again but with some different add ons, I went for the Spanish prosciutto, and niece had the picked chicken (pulled) all these have lived up to the billing as this place makes nothing shabby, Spanish prosciutto is a tad less salty than US or Italian, sharp provolone tops it and I added carmelized onions.  Picked chicken was moist and exploding with flavor, we actually cut the sandwiches in 3rds so we could try each one.  EAT HERE!!!!!!   PERIOD!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aLTEiZxr-vWFHwkP4QfqdQ.text: Pretty amazing.  JUST GET YOUR ASS THERE.  Their Rosemary braised beef sandwich was pretty bangin, like all the reviewers said.  Man, it's the perfect bread... The way all the juices squeeze right into the bouncy sandwich, omggggg...  The gentleman forgot to ask me the temperatures of my meat and I totally forgot to tell him.  I soooo didn't want my meat medium or well done.  It's okay though, the flavor was incredible regardless.  Next time...  We ate so fast, I thought my stomach was gonna explode.  All you hear inside is silence.  It is THAT good, ya'll.  Love their vegetable dish drizzled with balsamic redux.  I literally saw my veggies being rubbed with olive oil and going on the grill, I loved that.  Roasted plum tomato was a perfect touch!  Their salad greens were incredibly fresh and well seasoned, something I really appreciate.  Radish and carrots were shaved to order, not pre-shaved and stored in water, thank you for that.  Really.  Oh, and the caramelized onion is definitely the hidden gem.  Last time I had those was like, 100 yrs ago, ugh, love them.  And the 4 special sauces??? Forget about it, man, Jesus Christ.  If you've never been there, I feel sorry for you!!!!  MOVE UR ASS SOLDIER!!!!
