Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Warm grilled vegetable platter drizzled w balsamic (small) So good ya&#39;ll!!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 6oz hanger, 6oz flank oh my lordy.....Mmmmm

R4DSkz3aNYu1saaEAw5dBQ.text: First time there. Will be back as the chorizo small plate was delicious, the Caramones were on point and the sauces I used on everything!  There is a wait but definitely worth it PLUS it is a BYOB!

OvifWKHzLlJqa5FFXdzBqQ.text: OK, with 276 reviews and a solid 5 star rating on Yelp, there is no question the food here is outstanding.  Not because I am saying so, but because 275 other people are saying so.    So I am going to choose to not speak about the delicious morsels we consumed for lunch nor show you photos of those morsels, but rather to express a bit about Anthony, the owner of Gaucho, who was behind the counter taking our order and running the register when we stopped in today.   Go to Gaucho because of Anthony.  It is a rarity to meet someone like him in the restaurant business.  Because the beauty of a great meal is not only about the food, but it is the "experience" that comes with that food.    In addition to really having a winning personality and a top notch customer service touch, Anthony has a passion for his menu, his kitchen, his food and his staff.  Although he does not seem like the kind of guy who is ever going to flash his culinary credentials, after prodding it out of him a bit, clearly he has a great pedigree in the business and it is to Pittsburgh's great fortune that he has chosen to share the culmination of this experience and his craft here in the Strip District.  He was sincerely welcoming, genuinely interested in sharing his knowledge about the food from his kitchen and exuded respect, fun and flair with us and also with his staff.    Go to Gaucho because it is a worthy unique opportunity to taste something special.  More importantly though, go to Gaucho because you want to meet Anthony and support this good guy and his great staff who are really doing something special in the food world.

SAFt2wavt_4bqmgUQoEYiw.text: Oh.my.god. Yes! This place smells AMAZING as you walk up to it, I was excited before entering bc I knew it was going to be good. The place is tiny inside. There's outdoor seating, but it was raining, and there are maybe 8 bar stool spots indoors. So there's that, but that doesnt take away from the 5 star rating, and I overheard someone say they are moving into a larger space next door. My father ordered the ribeye with a side of mushrooms, and I had the flank steak sandwich. Both were amazing. Smoky, moist, flavorful, these adjectives sound so creepy used together but it was like a cornucopia of delicious on my place. I can't believe I haven't been here sooner. I declared that from now on, I only eat at Gaucho but then my bank account was like, "LOL, no." This place isn't cheap but who wants discount meat? Don't even get me started about the chimmichurri sauce. It was divine. You need to eat here, trust me.

toqWyR67Z39ol7Gkkawn5g.text: I HATE waiting for anything. Here, I stood out in line in the blistering sun. Then waited more at my table. And WOW was it worth it. The steak is spectacular. Everything is so well executed. Highly recommended.

K7Pl9T_PLdTx7uwoCh_CjA.text: The meat is so nicely seasoned. Anything you eat here will satisfy you. I tried almost everything from the menu and I never got disappointed. Only downside is the usual line you have to wait to get your hands so some nicely cooked meat.

ECBZAdLHA3f8OfkrPi0HYw.text: Came for a late lunch and only a small line. They have a huge menu with so many choices, but settled on a medium-rare ribeye sandwich (well-prepared, but a little chewy). Also ordered empanadas (chicken, pork, and veggie) and they were all excellent. The different sauces were also very good, but my favorites were the red pepper and sweet onion. Would come back to try something different when in Pittsburgh.

3HsingeBpFmn87DOGgKC2A.text: We'd gone a couple years ago before the renovation and it was one of the best meals ever. We live pretty close so I'm not sure how this didn't turn into a go to after that... However, we went last week with friends. I know the waits get long here but it was early evening and we thought we'd be safe. From line to food, it was probably 35-40 minutes. Kudos to these guys for having a devoted following! However there isn't enough room to accommodate the folks waiting; it's cramped and in front of the door which blocks thru traffic. I loved that they offer Mexican coke- something I treat myself to every time I see it! Meal wise: we were all obsessed with the toast. Man, is that good! Between the four of us we got a huge chunk of the menu- the sides are definitely a strength here! The potatoes, bread, grits-- all really good. My steak was unfortunately stringy and the small platter it was all served on was pretty small for the amount of food on there. The service was thoughtful and kind. Tbh, this probably would've been a four if some of the details (waits and serveware) were a little more thought out. I would definitely go back but in a more obscure hour, for sure.

0XD4LZY2LfSaVDqGHuiijA.text: This place is delicious! I went on a Wednesday night around 7 and the line was maybe 10 people long (not bad!)- I would avoid peak hours on weekends so your wait isn't too long!  I had a flank steak sandwich and potatoes! It was SOOOO good. The sandwich can get a little messy. If you want steak but don't want a mess, I would suggest just ordering the steak. It comes with toast and a side.   Everyone at our table loved their food! No complaints!  The workers are great! Everyone is very friendly and helpful!   BYOB!

Lr6U_JpnCFkblCGfW5HZvw.text: Not only delicious, affordable food, but an incredibly pleasant staff. Looking forward to their expansions as the only problem right now is the lack of seating. I would avoid it during the peak lunch hours as you will have to wait a decent amount of time.  Favorite is the skirt steak sandwich with a side of corn.

QSpP2BNc933bifqW3Bau7g.text: 3.5 stars. Worth the hype? Not really. Delicious? Yes. There are 5 tables outside here folks. So if you're lucky enough to get one there are constantly people staring at you because they want your seats. When there is a line its mass chaos inside and while the employees are friendly there's a hipster vibe (or something) that didn't feel welcoming. The menu is on a chalkboard right before you order so you have to make a quick decision even though you were standing in line quite a while already.  The smells in this place are fantastic and really increased the anticipation. We had the carne sandwich with filet (excellent), the hangar steak lunch (very good and with a salad), veggie empanadas (just ok) and fungos (solid). Portions were generous. Overall, I'd go back but I'm not going to be raving to anyone about the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Large order of veggie empanadas. Very average and kind of bland... Sauces helped though.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small order of fungos. Pretty good - nothing special.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich with filet. VERY GOOD.

6MSyD1ivNQaSQBLChMaqDg.text: Believe the hype.  Not much to add from other reviewers.  Plan to wait in line.  It moves fast but there  is always a line.  Bring a bottle of wine, no corkage fee.  Get the mushrooms side dish.  I'd try to recommend other items but everything I've had is equally delicious.  It's also extremely reasonable pricing.  Go and enjoy.

5fV3PBQ8GscDv0MwoN4pXw.text: If you find yourself anywhere near Pittsburg and crave mad flavor meat. Arrive here. An out of stater, next time I'm bringing a cooler to stock up on massive leftovers. Since I gave up buying sides of beef years ago (lllllong hairy story) my freezer has the room.

zMs5HRDQluA9e6P050pmMQ.text: Really everything I've tried here so far has been amazing.  Definitely try the grilled chicken along with ajo.  Another recommendation is the mixed grilled platter. It gives you a chance to sample the chicken, steak and the chorizo. The next time you visit you can 'home' in on your meat of choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#39;Parilloda Mixta&#39;

f3sBziAzrD7dSPon489FcA.text: WORTH THE WAIT. I think this was one of the only dinners that was eaten in complete silence because we were enjoying the food that much. Seriously one of the best meals I've ever had.  The large rib eye, the rosemary braised beef sandwich, a small order of vegetables, and grilled corn was perfect to leave us very satisfied.   I think the flavors of the meat and veggies were so amazing that when we tried the empanada, it was just average so I'll skip that the next time.

rMAgmDJxYBJHQwdkbvuaOg.text: This place is the bomb! Food is cooked to perfection and the flavor is phenomenal! Line is always way too long but they do a good job of keeping it moving. Food is fresh and delicious! Staff is really friendly too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Argentina Salad with grilled shrimp

I9ZE1VbuOQezCZ3IWgcwNQ.text: Holly mother of Cool!!  I can say that this was one of the best steaks .... Top 10 I have had.  If you in Pittsburgh, head to the strip and eat some great food.   OK that was the good.... The bad... Well seating IS limited.. And service is.. Well not much once your seated.  It is a laid back Seattle grunge vibe. Its a trendy 20s something place. But it is well worth the time.  Cost... It's cheep especially for what and how well the food is.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kitchen hard at work

LkQ3K0ozB9tST6ifzkLstw.text: Came here after a day's work and finishing a job site. Let me tell you this food just made me sooooo happy!   We had the Pollo al a parilla with a beautifully cooked flank steak with corn pudding.  The food was sooo good!! The service and staff was excellent as well the decor was homey and earthy.   I will definitely be coming back here!

J_i08_EhONadeIlgz6CD8A.text: Great Steaks, pork chops, chicken, basically any protein you can think of that can be grilled, cooked over a open wood grill, you just can't beat this quality of food for 1/3 of the price of your high end steak house. The Provoletta is great and a must try as well, if your in the strip, stop at Gaucho and grab a sandwich or steak, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xNk6BpqRv5uNtETX1p35TQ.text: It's possible to get here when the line isn't impossibly long, but you have to time it right. Every steak I've gotten here from every cut has been delicious. Obviously it's not a place to take a vegetarian for their birthday, but if you like steak you have to go at least once.

fiH_9lmfD8ASDMKpAn0fmg.text: The best meals in the strip district! Their meats were so well seasoned and cooked to perfection. You even get to pick from four different sauces. I enjoyed all of them.  There's always a long line so I would suggest going on an off time to not have to wait outside. We had a few people looking at our meals and asked us what we order. Here's what to get:  Argentina small salad ($8) and add steak ($5) for the best of it all.  I got a beef empanadas ($3) added too and it was delicious.  Sixteen dollars for an amazing meal!   I would say I'm confused on the set up of ordering first at the counter and then they seat you. You don't see staff often for refills so I wasn't sure if this was a wait staff or just workers dropping off our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small Argentina salad with ribeye steak and a beef empanadas - $16 amazing food

kpETS4MCyJrE4QqRPh5AXQ.text: Great unique spot in Pittsburgh strip district. The people working there are super organized and friendly. So much tasty choices to order from. Don't forget the home made yummy sauces you get yourself and try on your food. If you order the plates instead of the sandwich, get the toast on the side. So many meat options to order. They also carry fish of the day and had mahi mahi when I went. Satisfying, flavorful meal!

FXN9ip-X01EhSZ6A8JnO6A.text: Not thrilled at all. After a wait of 40 minutes approx, the food was burnt in parts. By burnt I mean charred black. The only good tasty thing I liked were the four kinds of sauce available here unlimited. Instead of forcing customers to stand in line may be a registry service would have been more convenient and time saving for the customers. The table service was nice. Not going back and won't recommend this place. I have been to other non-over rated restaurants which serve better food with a similar menu

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

H9oL52Ah_VGWI6bsK0DUTQ.text: Went on a Saturday around 12:30...waited in line for about 30 minutes before we were inside the restaurant to place the order. Ordered the Asado platter for medium rare but 80% of the meat was well done to medium well. The temperature of the meat also wasn't as hot or fresh as expected. The potato salad is good. I would go back to try other things.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potato salad!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asado platter

DVcZJRmktptKQedGRLwO-Q.text: IN LOVE. Hands down the best restaurant in Pittsburgh. We always take our friends/family from out of town here to show off our city's great cuisine!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Camerone&#39;s, Potatoes, steak

XNvQqlEIUr_Bd75GkzfkiQ.text: Not impressed at all. Tried their steak sandwich, and found the meat to be hard and dry. It was very hard to chew. Also tried their sauces, and I would say I am not impressed. Food wise I would just give it a threr star.   Probably reading the previous reviews set my expectations too high and I don't find it live up to the hype. Also rather pricey. The long wait makes this place overall 2 star for me.

peJQwQ7gxhW9Y3BkqVy1SQ.text: My girlfriend and I stopped by Gaucho on a Friday night, and surprisingly it wasn't too busy. There was a bit of a wait however because of a private party being held. Even so, the wait wasn't terrible. The waitstaff was friendly and they seem to be organized.  I ordered the Arrachera (flank steak) and my girlfriend ordered the Bife de Gaucho (ribeye). Both of the steaks were well-cooked and flavorful. While they were not nearly the best steaks I've had, the quality for the price is great.  I'd definitely recommend Gaucho to any meat-lover, but be prepared for a bit of a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bife de Gaucho (Ribeye)
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arrachera (Flank Steak)

tjt1MywhB2APgp5_Guxz6Q.text: Awesome Food but there is a line (it does move quickly).     Okay - I may get grilled (no pun intended) with this review.   Imagine Brazilian Steak House meats served on a plate as an entree with a variety of sauces.     This is what you get at Gaucho.    We had several plates.  My meal was $25 and I had 4 ounces of each chicken, beef, and chorizo.    The food was done very well and tasted great.   The place was busy the food was good but the price was a little steep comparative to other like places I have visited considering what I purchased.    It is 4 stars and I recommend but drink in the experience.  The line is fast.   The service is fast (in my opinion).   The drinks are good   We were in and out in about 35 minutes off to our next stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2BoQ4Zz8JUbHdCTRmoE1GA.text: My husband and I went and there was a long line to get in but it wasn't a problem. The menu is very vegetarian friendly.  The sauces are great. The bread for the sandwiches was a little thick, but the sandwiches tasted great. The flan was the best I've ever had (and I hate flan)! Great service! Would definitely go back again!

QnF3jPsq6bM5ysN9OvkdSA.text: First visit of hopefully many!  Initial shock was seeing a line going out the door and around the curb for 50 feet at 6pm on a Saturday. It took us 85 minutes to get to the counter to order our food. Long wait, but well worth it.  We ordered an Asado plate which includes all five cuts of their steaks for $50. We also ordered two empanadas, pork and chicken as well as roasted cauliflower and potatoes as sides. Not that we needed it, but just because of reviews and pictures, we ordered a steak burger sandwich, a small provoleta, and flans for dessert.  Steak burger was the best! Asado was great. Flan was very good. Roasted cauliflower was also good. The rest not as much.  Prices are reasonable. Their system of ordering and paying at the counter first is interesting and efficient. All staff and servers were friendly, helpful and efficient. Sauces were good but not really needed - steaks are good on their own.  All in all, it was a nice experience, and we will stop by the next time we are in Pittsburgh for sure.  And, remember that line at 6pm? It was still there at 9pm when we were leaving ... not the same people but equally enthusiastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asado plate, steak burger sandwich and flan. Provoleta, roasted cauliflower and potatoes next to Asado plate on left. Great food!

DqFWXNYFbItcNno7Q7B4BA.text: The food was amazing. Spent the four days in Pittsburgh for my birthday and this was the best spot by far. Meat cooked to perfection. It seemed like every ingredient was of the best quality. Definitely worth the price!

uGQJGbrQGrNgwAnun9dY3Q.text: If you are a lover of grilled meats--and really, I am convinced that those who say they aren't are liars--....  Apparently this is how I started a review of Gaucho in 2015 and then never finished, according to Yelp. Whoops! Well, all I can say is that I love this place--their meats, their sauces, their ambiance. This is the place I tend to take out-of-towners for a lovely informal dinner. So, so good.

MEhABNAFFCgG3uKEojSp5g.text: First time in Pittsburgh and this place was all everyone recommended. The food was excellent, service was excellent, prices were reasonable.  It's a quick meal though. Dont go if your looking for a nice sit down dinner. Your in and out quite quickly.

P4DQquq-DMuYoezQNrUuPg.text: The concept of this small corner restaurant is so peculiar to me! You order in advance from a huge selection, that serves to any palate and diet; and then, proceed to be seated and wait for a staff member come into the room, call out your name, and deliver your meal.   Even though the place can get crowded, the atmosphere is tranquil, modern, and enjoyable.  The food was extremely good. I had the Arracera (hanger steak) served with La Casa salad (house salad) and substituted the ciabatta bread it offers for a side of avocado (at no expense). The meat was cooked to perfection, with a rich flavorful grilled taste! The house salsas (sauces) are a must have item to try when you go visit this adorable restaurant!   The staff is friendly, the interior is clean, and the food is amazing! I don't think there is more I could right to not want to make you go eat here.   Definitely will come back during my next visit to Pittsburgh

7-QIOFMlps5okE7YP4WGAA.text: The flank steak is the best. The chicken was also good. The empanadas and cauliflower I would not order again. Cute spot. Counter service. One of the better places we tried in Pittsburgh.

IKntPSGH6tAnEXUCuQOpLQ.text: Omg.    I am so glad we waited in the line to get into this place.  We showed up a little after 3 o clock on a Saturday and the line was out the door, we briefly considered going somewhere else but sucked it up and waited.  You order and pay at the counter then they take you to your seat and a porter brings your food.  There are not a lot of vegetarian mains on the menu, just a veggie sandwich, but tons of veggie sides.  So i did what any insane person would do and ordered all the veggie sides and a side of toast.  They were all amazing.  Potatoes are always great, carrots with honey and goat cheese - amazing, mushrooms - fantastic.  Will definitely go back and gladly wait in line again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qbKhR6hnkSXnMpt8YZ9LeQ.text: The wait was long, but it was soooooo worth it!   I got the Lamb Shank with roasted vegetables and grits. This dish was phenomenal!! The lamb was cooked perfectly falling off the bone. The vegetables were soft and yummy, and the grits were just perfect. They were perfectly seasoned and didn't have too much butter.   Overall, it was honestly one of the best I've ever had.   I also got the spicy chorizo small plate, which came with toast and caramelized/grilled onions and red peppers. It was so flavorful and had enough spice. Just get a good bite of bread with the chorizo and red peppers and you're good to go.   I absolutely loved all of the chimichuri sauces. All 4 are flavorful and compliments the foods we got. I really liked the green one and the red one.   If I need to come back to Pittsburgh again, I will definitely be coming back to try some of their other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

J7ugGCHqW5tM5TWW0RWRUA.text: Hands down best meal in Pittsburgh. You more than likely will wait in a ridiculously long line on the weekend but this is one of the few restaurants I would always wait for. The prices are amazing for the quality of the meal. Not to mention the service is outstanding! The steak was cooked to perfection, the shrimp were the best I've ever had - grilled and seasoned wonderfully. They offer three homemade sauces you can help yourself to. I basically wanted to drink them. The atmosphere of the restaurant only adds to the experience the food already provides - eager, helpful and happy staff, happy customers, delicious food. Gaucho is a must!

p_9RdYT3CwJT_bIMh8rQ5w.text: Simply outstanding food. I'm now going to out myself as one of those avid Yelp users who has relied on Yelp 100 times (literally), all throughout the country, and recommends the app to everyone ... and yet I've never written a review. Today, I was inspired to do so by a phenomenal meal at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina.  I can't remember previously seeing a full 5-star review on Yelp with 50+ reviews. This restaurant deserves that status. My son and I had two steak sandwiches (one ribeye, one NY Strip) and both were absolutely delicious -- perfect bread, excellent steak, killer sauces, and a just-right balance of onion, pepper, and seasoning. Really, hard to make a sandwich much better. Sides were also absolutely top notch:  shrimp, corn, and papas. Each were legitimately world-class. If it sounds like I'm exaggerating, I'm not. My wife is a classically-trained French chef and we're fortunate enough to have really high quality food pretty much every day. We've eaten at terrific restaurants all over the country (and beyond).  This place merits a five-star review.   I'll also say that from a service perspective, every person we interacted with there was kind, knowledgeable, and willing to talk about the history behind the place.  They went above and beyond.   A few caveats, just to manage expectations. First, BYOB. No corkage fee, but no alcohol there. Also, the place is charming but teeny -- it probably seats less than eight people on counters and stools. If anything, this is more of a takeout place; definitely not white-table cloth. Effectively, we're talking 28+ on food, albeit with a limited menu, but a 14 on decor. Finally, be aware that Gaucho Parrilla Argentina closes at 7 PM and is closed on Sunday and Monday.   So, if you understand the limitations of the place beforehand, make sure you come. You'll walk out saying that it was some of the best food you've ever eaten. While I'm from Pittsburgh originally, I live in Boston and in town for the Steeler game. I'll certainly be back at Gaucho the next time I'm in the Burgh. A classic Yelp gem.

Ey6KoT3K8RtIVvJvhugumg.text: If you like meat, you must try Gaucho.  Wonderful flavors!

32C4wEeVu22TBMArx3pvIw.text: What can really be said that hasn't already?  Went for my birthday. Had wine, had meat, had sides, had A BLAST!!!!!!   It was incredible.

Awn8rPWgDiRgawBnt8DBlw.text: There's always a wait, but it's so worth it. One of my favorite lunch spots in the whole city. Everything is tender and cooked to perfection.

Mm5TDISps8W7ekPYp5utDA.text: This little hole in the wall in the Strip is serving up some yummy grilled food. The first time we tried to go here they were out of chicken, and I don't usually eat beef, so we went elsewhere. I thought about docking them a star for this, as actually having the food that's being offered on the menu is a big part of running a successful restaurant, but, after having eaten here, I think the place is 4 star worthy.   There is no table service here, and really no tables other than the ones on the patio outside. There are a few barstools inside, but the comfort level is low, as you have people milling about, either standing in line or waiting for their to go orders, and the space underneath the stools where your legs and feet would normally go is taken up by stacked wood. As a side note I'll say that it's too bad there's no place in the Strip, such as a small park or some other public area, where people can go and congregate...it would be a nice addition to the neighborhood, and there are a couple of take out places that could benefit. The outside tables were all taken when we arrived, so we ate at the counter on the barstools. We ordered the chicken from the "hambre" side of the menu, and sides of the grilled veggies and gaucho potatoes. This was a good amount of food for the two of us. The chicken comes "picked" and served with their onion sauce, a delicious concoction of caramelized onions that have been pureed and seasoned. The veggies were grilled perfectly, and the potatoes were delicious. We helped ourselves to the sauces they offer...a roaster red pepper sauce, a garlicky ajo and their version of chimichurri, that Argentinian staple. All were very good. They really know how to cook here, and the food is delicious. I hope they become successful enough to afford a move to roomier digs at some point in the future. In the meantime, I'll still go and hope for an empty barstool.

9oVy2EvHW3xj4TD0GpE8Gg.text: If you're a carnivore, Gaucho is as good as it gets. Even if you're not, there's an amazing Vegetable sandwich that comes on ciabatta bread- gets me every time. They recently expanded into a bigger area, but I haven't been there since. It's actually challenging for me to eat here, because there are so many delicious options. To top off each selection, they provide different sauces (my favorite is the chimichuri) that you can choose from to compliment your sandwich. However, I have found that the sandwiches are bursting with so much flavor do not even need the sauces! There is nothing like going to the strip Saturday morning and walking into gaucho for an early lunch... I've never been to Argentina, but smelling the aroma of the meats and just the friendly atmosphere that the employees create, makes me feel like I've walked off of Penn Ave and right into another country. A winner for me is the filet mingnon sandwich with roasted red peppers, caramelized onions on fresh, homemade ciabatta bread. Trust me, you can't go wrong. Stop in and treat yo'self!

sZIi9QszysNOzqihF34S9w.text: This place has been the highest rated restaurant in Pittsburgh for a while and I've been hyped to find out why. The lines have been a problem though. However, I decided to brave out the line, and was it worth it. The steak is beautifully done. The Cerdo (pulled pork) was also amazing, with the super sharp mustard on the side. The Chorizo was great, as were the Papas. In all, we probably ordered way too much food for two but we gulfed it all down. Did I say that their breads are amazing. This restaurant really made us feel like visiting Argentina soon.

-mNqm5ZCxVBy82DxKYQRqg.text: The food was great - the line & wait for ordering, not so much.  Terribly thought out flow of queuing, ordering & seating, that makes the wait far longer than it needs to be.  We have to grab our own silverware, etc., which is kinda silly.  Having said that, the food was excellent, and worth a try.  I'd suggest a weeknight to help avoid the unnecessary line & wait.

qyoLVkaXhvl3RrwSSAlnKw.text: Time to add the umpteenth 5-star review for the Gaucho!  The place was bumping even at an off-time (mid-afternoon on a Saturday) but fortunately we grabbed one of the few seats in the rustic eating area.  Enjoyed a three-meat combo plate with delicious steak, grilled chicken and sausage.  The best part was the grilled bread - toasty and salty with olive oil drizzled on top.  Definitely seek this place out in the Strip District - es muy bueno!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-jVw1PJV7-fpdpe06oMQOw.text: My new favorite place in Pittsburgh! Food was amazing, staff very friendly and outgoing..... well wirth the wait!

hBXB-VLQXPu166QbwoEJ4w.text: This place is a gem... More then a gem it is everything that is good about eating.  You smell this place before you see it. The aroma is mouthwatering.  The meat is perfect. If Francis mallman were here he would shake Anthony's hand. I have never tasted a more well balanced chimichuri.  Thank you for added this to the Pittsburgh landscape.  Bottom line. The food and service will change your taste buds forever.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flank steak sandwich. And it is amazing

bjxEngpKD8DDRQXtHTAiRQ.text: Group we were with wanted to go, so thought we would give it another shot. Prices are way too high and the food quality is still mediocre. This time though our food was accompanied by a side of fruit flies. We told the waiter who said they would tell the manager, which did not help our situation but hopefully they get that addressed.

ObOxZOFDLjtzyG0xSvgpVA.text: Stopped by at about 3pm on a Saturday and only waited for a few minutes.  Ribeye steak was delicious as well as the beef empanada. One of the best meals I've had in Pittsburgh!

NrMGhy3nq7kCtAI7695toQ.text: Definitely a 5 star restaurant.  The line went quick and the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable on the menu.  The steak was well seasoned and cooked to perfection.  The salad and potatoes were a perfect side and the right amount.  I will return to try this place for dinner.

_sX-j_3uMZgRiPT6Ve4nng.text: Once you get past the extremely long wait, yummy food awaits you.  I thought the food was tasty, especially the grilled vegetables but I thought the portions were kind of small overall.  The small grilled vegetables was supposed to feed two as a side but I could have devoured that thing myself in addition to the small flank steak plate I ordered.  If I ever visit Pittsburgh again, I would definitely like to come back and try the asado plate/steak sampler.

v-470iDJZLZ4DewbZ2uhjg.text: I was walking from the hotel out to Primanti Brothers in the Strip District when I noticed this little restaurant. "Hey, it's new to me," I thought. "Let's try it!" I'd never been to an Argentinian place before but fortunately, the menu lists all the ingredients for each entree. I had Bife de Chorizo, one of the steak platters. I thought it was pretty good and decently seasoned. I also enjoyed the special condiments from the condiments bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bife de Cttorizo

tDBJEbMeRLQkBkuWt_tIEg.text: Great environment and food tastes great. It's like a party here. Terrible drink selection and not much on vegetables, but everything else was amazing.

_L-0G73TWUCJnCbwS_1wzQ.text: The food and wait staff were excellent but the experience was more than puzzling/frustrating. The MENU BOARD NEEDS TO GO! It's a cluster@#$% of confusion! You are standing in a TINY little space trying to read this massive handwritten menu that is all OVER the place while people behind you hover. The ambiance is LOUD and hurried. My party barely talked to each other because no one could hear anything. So, Food A+....Experience D-. Get it to go and you'll probably love it.

t7ydTLoPQOvZbUBMTfbjxQ.text: Surprise, surprise...  another five star review!  It's worthy of the hype. Go here, immediately. And bring a growler of your favorite beer or a bottle of wine.   We ordered the steak sandwich (filet cut) with the grilled corn, along with the rib eye platter. Both were cooked and flavored perfectly. Which is a "shame"  because their sauces are out of this world (still managed to use them to dip the bread). Speaking of the bread... it's wonderful. A perfectly baked ciabatta, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.   The staff was extremely friendly, and clearly loved their jobs. The manager walked around and asked everyone how their meals and experiences were, and was quite friendly.   Can I go back now?

BryHU7lyzjz13hEvY9pHYg.text: Probably one of my favorite restaurants anywhere. To say the food is great would be an understatement. Everything is fresh and full of flavor. If you havent been here, go. Its easy to see why theres always a line around the block to get into the place, but once you do, you wont be disappointed

NRJ55YoJDUDTpvDjMt2VHA.text: Instead of some lackluster happy hour, go to the state store, get a heavy Chilean Red and your whiskey of choice, and get your hangry ass to Gaucho before 6pm on a weekday.  If it's your first time, the front of house experience is a bit awkward. It's not bad, it's just weird. You order at the counter as a group, but can split your check. After that, you can order more from your table and get table service. Tip well and be loved. The entire staff splits tips. I wish they'd just raise prices and wages, but we're just not there yet as a nation. One thing at a time.  Look at the menu ahead of time and know what you want. For the love of god: don't keep Pittsburgh waiting outside for Gaucho because you were live tweeting the wait instead of thinking about what you wanted to eat, you heathen. Or Snapchatting. You were snapping, weren't you. On that note, this place is small. Please be considerate of those in line once you recover from the meat sweats.   Open the wine. You can't go wrong here, but get the flank steak and carrots. The flank steak is impressive but the carrots are a spiritual experience. You can eat the large, but get the small because bread pudding. Get rare to medium or you're dead to me. Try all the sauces but you only need ajo (garlic sauce) for your toast. Finish the wine or give the rest to a table in need.   Walk down to Leaf & Bean, open the whiskey, and revel in the privilege of a cool summer's eve in the city o' ahrn. If you don't know what you like, get a Leaf by Oscar with the Connecticut wrapper. Enjoy, but do not finish the whiskey. Get home safe.

xRwFudTAIpaEMGhqSxPL4g.text: This place was hoppin, not like a fogo de chow, this is pick from a board and get your drink, head to the table they bring your food, and it was superb. Steak and chimi chiri was excellent, pepper and onion were the best! Only thing was not impressed with were the empenada, had steak and chicken kinda dry. Veggies were awsome. Will definitely go back. Staff was great as well!

fNZl2FUdsy_Qm4TLzOLyZA.text: This was probably the best meal I have had in Pittsburgh and I cannot say enough good things about this place. I got the steak burger with avocado and pickled onions and it was cooked to perfection. And the toasted bread that it was served on was also fresh and delicious. The burger was so flavorful on its own, though they do offer a nice array of sauces to add more flavor. They have 4 sauces that you can try as much as you want of, and each sauce is tailored to a specific kind of meat, though you can combine how ever you want. I liked all of them, but the one that was meant for the red meats was my favorite.  The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a system where you order as a whole group up at the register, you sit at a table, and then you will get all of your food at the same time. I personally like this system better than the typical waiting for the check system.  My friend and I got there at about 5:30 on a Thursday, and we got there just as crowds stared to pour in. This place gets super crowded, so I would recommend getting there before 5:30 on Thursdays-Saturdays at least.  Overall, one of the best meals I've ever had and definitely the best in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burger with avocado and pickled onions

nONhCLEZMt_ozZ82bobU-w.text: Truly enjoyed my experience tonight! My pro-tip would be to come on a week night and early (5:30ish if you can) as there isn't ever a wait. Because there was no line, my wife and I had like five minutes to drool over the menu on the wall before going up to the counter and spending the next five minutes working with the ultra friendly and helpful staff to get their recommendations. (Let it be known that I always look for recommendations on Yelp, but when everybody loves everything on here, it's hard to whittle it down.)   Per the staff's recommendations we got the sirloin sandwich medium rare and the chory pan sandwich. Additionally, we decided to get two empanadas and a alfajore cookie.   The meat was cooked expertly and the empanadas were surprisingly good. I don't care for goat cheese but the pork and cheese empanada was actually my favorite! The alfajore cookie tasted kind of like a shortbread cookie with caramel and coconut which wasn't my fave, but we came here to celebrate my wife and she can have whatever she wants :)   Will definitely be back on a week night at 5:30 for more

7LMoAtNUOLbK2DTcOZOUdA.text: As good as it gets! I would gladly go back to Pittsburgh just to have this steak again. My friend used this place to cater her wedding, so with that kind of recommendation I knew I had to check it out. There's street and lot parking nearby. BYOB but also keep in mind that a lot of liquor stores nearby close by 7 pm. Be prepared to wait in line (which is 10000% worth it!)  I split the Asado Platter with another person which was honestly the best case scenario. We loved being able to sample all the types of steak and taste the difference between all of them. Out of the five, the loma was my favorite but I would get all of them again just for the experience. Make sure to get all the self serve sauces as well! I would also highly recommend the bread pudding! Such a nice way to end a meal.

c8QjaUhk6qhLrZWN5CfzoQ.text: The meat here is excellent. That deserves a five star. The ordering process makes some sense for the business based on how they operate . However for the customer it's just confusing. I had about four to employees invoked in between ordering, serving, and clearing my table. They were all nice so while confusing still five stars.   I ordered the sandwich. Too much bread .. but other than that delicious. So my tip just order the meat. Forget the sandwich. Delicious but what you really want is the meat.  This place is one of those amazingly good restaurants with some stupid quirks.   Oh and Jesus... Great bathrooms. Literally smelled fresher in the bathroom than outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy ribeye sandwich

HGub2booDFC6t8172YawSA.text: I love steak and Gaucho is a great place for it! We shared the Asado Platter, 6 pieces of Empanadas, and the Veggie Plate between 4 of us. This was the perfect amount and we were all decently full after the meal despite getting HUNGRY from the wait. We came at around 1pm on a Friday and had to wait about 30 minutes before we could put in our order and be seated.  The steak was very flavorful and came perfectly medium rare as we had requested. If anything, some of the pieces were more on the raw side, which I didn't mind but some people might. I loved that I was able to try all the different cuts, and since all 4 of us had different favorites, I was able to get a few pieces of my favorite cuts.  The empanadas weren't bursting with flavor but they were tasty in a homey way, especially the pastry part! For $11, I expected the Veggie Plate to be a bit bigger, but the vegetables were delicious. My friend who normally dislikes veggies became a veggie monster!  Gaucho is a good place to have a bit of good steak for a decent price and still have enough left in your budget to get a little bit of something else. I can see myself coming back next time I'm in the area!

EXWodwtIr7hP2fVfaxry6Q.text: We found this great gem via Yelp and it had rave reviews.  We went for dinner while visiting the Pittsburgh area for a college visit.  As everyone mentions,  be sure to arrive early as lines do form and service is first come,  first serve.  The porters do a fabulous job of seating you and checking up on you throughout your meal. Gaucho is BYOB so if that's your thing,  bring a bottle or two.  The food was spectacular! We tried the beef empanadas,  rosemary beef sandwich,  artic char sandwich,  veggie platter and carrots roasted in honey with brie cheese.  No complaints,  but the noise level from time to time was a bit much.  We'd definitely return and highly recommend Gaucho to anyone visiting the area.

PdagDTpx8R3wSMdnqvDKuA.text: The girlfriend and I have been wanting to go to Gaucho as soon as we found out about it from Yelp. We actually did try to go one time but as we pulled up the line was out the door and around the corner. We stood in line with some friends for about 10 minutes before we realized the line wasn't budging. Granted, we didn't stay in line that long, but we were very hungry and restaurant week was currently happening so we decided to go elsewhere. We recently went back and figure out why there is so much hype about Gaucho!  The first tip I would give to you would be to be prepared to wait in line depending on the day/time you go and the second tip would be to bring alcohol because it is BYOB! The second time we went we waited for about 20 minutes before being seated. The staff was very helpful and made sure everyone knew the wait times, they even told us that they were stopping taking orders since there were no tables to seat customers at the time. The way the restaurant works is very interesting, you decide what you want on the way to the cashier (gives you something to do while your waiting as well) and then you order and get shown to your seat by a host.   We ended up ordering the some empanadas, cheesy bread, a chicken sandwich, and pulled pork sandwich. The food came out super quickly which was great because we were very hungry. They also offer a number of sauces which we tried in line and fell in love with the red pepper sauce. The empanadas were wonderful and tasted authentic and fresh as well as the cheesy bread which was surprisingly better than it sounded on the menu board. The sandwiches were huge and we ended up having to take them home but they were also amazing and stuffed with meats.   I am looking forward to going back here and trying out the other wonderful things the menu had to offer!

MMdde-p1gwxKWNEBfpET_w.text: 4 of 5 stars:  Top 4 reasons to go: 1) food is fantastic 2) staff is wonderful 3) cost vs what you get is awesome 4)  although the line is long, it moves very quickly  one reason not to go: 1) parking can be extremely difficult

YCTIvNfrHal6FjRe2V8WOA.text: I'm always in the mood for Gaucho. I just moved to the Pittsburgh area, and this is the first place that my girlfriend took me as a welcome-to-the-city meal. I couldn't have been happier.   I got the carne sandwich. Amazing steak. The bread doesn't get waterlogged and the paper wrapping doesn't make a mess like it looks like it might.   The sauces are incredible, but the sandwiches don't need them.   This is the go-to place for a treat-yourself meal for me. Now that I'm in the area, I expect I'll see Gaucho a lot more.

b8oyaOtdp2Ppm6GnbGjDEA.text: The meats are phenomenal here. I always go for the asado platter which is full of flavor and juicy. The food is always fresh and the atmosphere is wonderful. The sauces that come in huge mason jars are so tasty. You must try all of them! They are all unique and delightful.   The interior is full of vibrant colors and warm wood. It makes me feel at peace and happy whenever I'm here. I'm always satisfied when I come here. My only complaint is that parking is difficult here there is not a parking lot and sometimes if you're lucky- there will be street parking nearby.   The customer service is great here! Everyone is always so smiley and accommodating. I also appreciate the order first then wait for your food process at Gaucho. It's very efficient and helps with the almost always long line here.

u_SOO6YkouL8SFJzlokTqA.text: I've been here twice now when visiting Pittsburgh. And I must say, it has solidified itself as a go-to for steak. Both times I had the Ribeye, medium rare. And both times it was perfectly cooked and seasoned. I like the variety of dipping sauces. I'd recommend that you go with the beef cut that you like (I personally like Ribeye). Others in my party ordered salads and added steak to it, they looked really good. I will need to go that route next time.  We also ordered the empanadas, I liked the veggie and the beef.

d1lbRf50fPdZqNiHzWVPNw.text: Full marks for food and service, less half a star for the wait time - even though the food was more worth it.  I couldn't tell you how we got to Gaucho Parrilla, or where it is, but I can tell you from the moment I began researching places to eat for our Pittsburgh trip there was no place I wanted to be more. At first looking at the level of the care and quality used to make the food in the pictures and the name, I expected this place to be uber fancy and pricey - not so. GPA is a little more than a takeaway joint just with seating (not enough mind you... but seating nonetheless).  You basically should prepare yourself for a 30-45 min + wait time, not inside... outside. You brave that and you've essentially earned the right to dine here. We braved it, despite grumbling tummies and hangry door blocking to ensure no one got in ahead of us or skipped line.  We went a bit crazy for our order but shared everything so we could try as many things as possible. In no particular order:  Pork empanadas - more batter than meat, well cooked and flavourful but not super memorable tbh  Spicy Chorizo - the fire roasted bread and peppers served make my mouth water all on their own but that chorizo was a spicy little gift. Could have just eaten 3-4 of these and been totally content.  Rosemary Beef sandwich - HOLYYEEEEEE. So big, so juicy, so. much. beef. It was so good I wanted to press my face in between the buns and motorboat that meat - judge me if you must but eat here first and then come back to me. Easily top 5 sandwiches of my life.  Large Ribeye - and as if I wasn't already praising glory be to the Argentinian meat gods on high after the sandwich, they go ahead and perfectly cook, slice and season a glorious ribeye steak and smother it with sauce - EF. ME. UP right here. I'd stab someone if they got in the way of me eating this.. So succulent, dripping with fatty flavours and cooked perfectly.  All in this is definitely no veggie-vegan friendly but carnivores beware this is your happy place - it sure was mine. First stop when I'm back in town for a Steelers game next year is GPA!  Eatcrest Out

1wShUW0dxnk_ta0rhW4jHg.text: Surprisingly met Expectations on both visits. Beef is cooked near perfectly. Wish the steaks could be ordered in larger than 6oz and 12oz but no big deal.  Facts:  Four types of chimichurries  Steaks and steak sandwiches At least one type of fish on menu 4-6 sides ranging from beans and greens to potatoes to eggplant to mushrooms Homemade empanadas (slightly overrated)  Drinks are BYOB, wish they served glasses of house wine  Lines anywhere from 15mins - 2hrs  Staff is nice and pretty attentive.   Recommendations: make it easier to get back in line for ordering dessert/drink/etc and serve house wine by glass, BYOB is much appreciated but not everyone plans ahead, plus you would make a lot more money.

5pMK4SS8HlyRNU115AMsuw.text: Tried Gaucho at lunch and was very pleased by the food and the service-  two 20 somethings held down the crowd that was exploding on to Penn.  I had a braised beef, carmalized onion and horseradish delight.  Also tried the spicy Chorizo,  a side of tatters and washed it all down with a blood orange soda.  They sell out of empenadas so I missed testing.  Food was great only complaint is no room to enjoy dining in.  I had a seat but the crowded space and setting was sub prime.

aiWCi9QShuKaod8qKtYJSQ.text: There are enough reviews here that I don't need to get too lengthy. The food is amazing here. Just go. You won't regret it.

nkaru74qUJdCRvh1G5f_sw.text: I've had basically everything on the menu here. I suggest getting a sandwich, it is truly one of the greatest I have ever had. The veggies are a must too. This place just blows it out of the water every time. Affordable and amazing. One of the best places to eat in the city, hands down.

RrJZGn_N0emJy-rpz0vn-g.text: Unbelievably good. I had the flank steak and roasted vegetables. The steak was thinly sliced, pink in the center and a great, salty, smokey bark and delicious sauces. The veggies were charred beautifully and drizzled with balsamic vinegar. Caramelized onions, asparagus, tomatoes and zucchini. We went at 6:30 on a Tuesday and there was no wait. Staff was super friendly and helpful. We ate out on a nice patio lined with plants and firewood. I'm from out of town but I will definitely make a point of returning.

t-lN3uWCQHFza4fOdhPOvg.text: I found heaven... Its the steak burger with portobello and caramelized onions! I've never been to a restaurants were everything I try is amazing. Until you go, your life isn't complete.

vd85iAJw-NeeOc-YB2v5Xg.text: My favorite sandwich place in pittsburgh. I like both the fish and chicken sandwiches. Fresh ! One time I asked for chicken empanadas, but the guy at the counter said he is currently making beef, so I was disappointed, but then in about 10 minutes he said he popped in a chicken empanada also for me :) I was pleased :) he is very nice. The meat is perfectly grilled on a wood fired grill.

GpYp7QuqZbEoOs7fzNPdkQ.text: Tiny restaurant on the corner at the far end of the Strip District. You can smell the delicious smoke from half a block away. When you walk in the, the staff is extremely friendly and give their advice on what to order. I went hungry and left extremely full with left overs. We ordered a side of potatoes because the empanada maker was sadly out of order and this was enough for both of us to share. I ordered the rosemary braised beef with caramelized onions and horseradish sauce and it came on a nice soft roll. I will say that I wish that there was a little more horseradish but I just know for next time what to ask for. My husband ordered the rib eye with peppers, onions and chimmi churri sauce on a hard roll and he loved it.   If you're looking to go as a group or to sit down, just note that there are bar stools and small counters inside. They do have outdoor seating but depending on the weather, you may just want to take your food to go or back to your office.  Thoroughly impressed and would highly recommend. The smells alone will get you to walk in =)

lhBJRKTCW_Y_rQVEj2-JtQ.text: Be prepared for a little tiny space. The staff is vey friendly and helpful. The food is very good. We brought our own bottle of wine and they supplied some wine glasses. A lot of fun.

9UUhYpLNs-0641NiXzkHrg.text: The staff are super upbeat, fun and very welcoming.   Everything that we ordered was very delicious.  It really made waiting in line worth it.  I've been to a lot of restaurants (I'm from Chicago) but never to one that made a 100% positive impression in all points.  I only wish they had one in Chicago or northern Illinois.

1DReWuzGfKZNeNlN6c8sTA.text: Amazing food and super friendly staff, definitely worth the wait! I love the empanada and the small meatball plate. Also the sauces there are amazing, definitely try them all!

3ICGiKTk5Ac0qRtPmN-EJg.text: You have to come here! We had a couple of flank steak sandwiches. Very well seasoned, you can tell steak was marinated overnight. On great chibada bread with peppers and onions. Small place but they know what there doing!

bImW_P1Qx3T7LHEygdTbbg.text: I'm sorry, I can't write a review about this place. Why?? Because there is only one word. AMAZING!!!!! I mean so amazing that I'm speechless.  I'm only in Pittsburgh to visit but I don't think I'll ever find steak like this again. The wood burning grill, the service, and the FOOD!!! Check it out!! Owner said they are expanding soon!!

zwPfKeE5FweX3KyzyjvV1A.text: While visiting the Strip District a few weeks ago, I stopped in for lunch at Gaucho on a whim. It turned out to be the best decision I made that day. It's a small place (it can hold 10-12 people max), and it's easy to miss if you're walking by.  The first thing you notice when you walk in is the aroma from the grill; your mouth is already watering before you sit down. I ordered the carne sandwich with ribeye, which comes topped with grilled peppers & onions and chimmichurri sauce. The meat was well seasoned and cooked perfectly - juicy and tender, with a really nice char. I washed it down with a cold Mexican Coke. It's not the cheapest sandwich you'll find, ringing in at $12, but it's more than worth it. I came in hungry and left full.  Besides the food itself, what really made my visit great was the excellent service. The owner of the place was super friendly and very patient, explaining the various items on the menu. They also did all the little things that take customer service from just good to exceptional. For example, one customer walked in and placed a $150 order to go. Gaucho gives a 10% discount if you call ahead with your takeout order (pro tip), but they went ahead gave him the discount anyway and helped him walk his  order out to his car in the snowy conditions. That is how you do customer service.

Nk1jW5KgpTrQ1-PyM8Fi6g.text: Probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. A must try is the steak - which you can get in any cut - on toasted ciabatta with the roasted veggies, add avocado and dip heavily into any of their 4 luscious housemade chimmichurries. Amazing. I Can only eat half and save the rest for a later snack or meal :)

u6dsIuAaddnQAqj-lO5M-w.text: Definitely amazing. A little on the greasy size, but you have to expect that with meals largely made of meat. The grilled vegetales and entragna were INCREDIBLE! Seriously, best skirt steak I've ever had. The owner is really cool and does the rounds of the (tiny) restaurant. They're expanding into the space next door eventually. Also, it's BYOB so don't forget to bring your booze.

O8rd5IZHcmPzEndWtvMOqg.text: Been twice now. Always during lunch. Heard it was an insane wait if you went on a weekend night. Everyone is super nice. Food is DELICIOUS. Not a lot of seating.

PogX2hVplObx0J6E6N1nBQ.text: The meat here is so good it will convert vegetarians back to reality.   Yelp Girls like to say "hidden gem".  This is is not a hidden gem.  This is a shining beacon to carnivores everywhere to come partake in beef bliss.    And the prices are great.  All the taste of a high end steak house for half the cost and none of the pretentiousness.  Dine in a relaxed atmosphere with brick walls, hardwood floors, and exposed heat pipes and abundant natural lighting.  Did I mention BYOB with no cork charge?  If you forget, the friendly staff will tell you where you can buy drinks near by.  This place is ranked #7 in the Yelp Top 100 in the Country.  Its not a fluke. Click your Bookmark button.  Even if you're a Prius driving Vegan.   You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So much goodness for 10.95

WziKu3lO_gSoF501GKym0Q.text: Gaucho is pretty good. Having gone a handful of times, I can't say it's line-out-the-door good, but it's definitely worth checking out.  I've almost always ordered the Parrilloda Mixta in order to try a bunch of meats, but every time I kind of regret my decision, mainly because of the how tough the NY Strip is to get through. The chicken is good, but doesn't have too much flavor, so you'll be using their sauces to get through it (their sauces are excellent!). If you're going with the red meat, I'd definitely recommend the flank or lomo. They always seem to come out cooked to perfection. They season their meats with salt (traditional Argentine technique), so expect a sodium overload on flavor, and if you don't like salty, you probably won't like a lot of their food.  The sides are hit-or-miss for me. The empanadas are okay, but they've been pretty dry whenever I've tried them. My favorite side is the Guacho Papas. I could eat these all day. Perfectly roasted potatoes! The humita is also phenomenal. I'd definitely recommend the papas and humita if you're on the fence when ordering. I've never had either of those let me down!  Ultimately, where Gaucho succeeds is their great, personable staff, fast service, and mostly better-than-average food. Also their newer, expanded space is beautiful! Gaucho's struggles rest with inconsistent meat preparation (especially the oft-overcooked, tough strip), being too salty for the salt-averse customer, long lines on the weekends, and price (don't expect to leave Gaucho will a cheap bill). If you can get there in off-hours (right after work, for example), the wait will be short and you can be in and out quickly, but I wouldn't put Gaucho in the must-eat category that's necessary to justify standing in a line that wraps around the building. It's good, but it's never been THAT good. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixta

IlMhVC7jZKsW8k4npdhOKA.text: This is the story of a girl.  A girl with a dream.  A dream about steak.  A week before I had a random Wednesday-Thursday off, I decided that Thursday would be it.  The day I finally made my way to Gaucho.  Of course I've heard the hype.  Who in the Pittsburgh Yelpiverse hasn't?  Clearly at this point Gaucho is well established.  I didn't expect to be disappointed.  The question was just how happy could a lunch at Gaucho make me?  I knew I had to do my research.  I drooled over the menu several times ahead of time trying to narrow down the choices so I wouldn't panic when I ordered.  I read several of the hundreds of Yelp reviews looking to learn the ins and outs of how to order (at the counter, take a seat and wait for your name to be called), when to arrive (since it seems to always be busy, often with a line out the door), how the service was (friendly) and what people thought of the food itself (amazing).    The night before I had attended a Yelp Elite event at a local brewery.  I hit up three local breweries that day (it's kind of my thing) and came home with an IPA that I thought would pair well with the steak I was anticipating.  And then the waiting....  I planned to arrive at Gaucho when they first opened at 11am.  I scored rock star parking just in front of their location.  I got out of my car and could immediately smell that wood fired grill. The outside patio was intriguing but it was a little muggy so I decided on dining inside.  I went to the corner entry door (don't be fooled by the two other doors that are not entrances for patrons) and made my way inside.  The inside is welcoming and the huge menu greets you as you approach the counter to place your order.  I was the first to arrive, but only long enough to place my order and pick my seat.  I kindly told the first girl who asked me if I wanted a drink that all I needed was a glass since I brought my own beer.  She happily obliged and the girl next to her took my order.  I went with the small skirt steak plate, medium.  I took my seat in a corner table so I could watch the magic behind the scenes.  I watched the efficient symphony of servers emerging from the kitchen, dancing through the dining room calling out names to deliver food to anticipating diners and clearing tables for incoming patrons while another employee transferred wood from the dining area to the grill in order to keep the fire going.    My meal was delivered to me within 15 minutes and it was such a thing of beauty that it brought a tear to my eye.  I almost didn't want to eat this work of art.  Gaucho is simple but captivating with its presentation, in this case my medium skirt steak with chimmi, toast and salad.  I took my time to savor every bite and every angle.  I tried the 4 different sauces they had on the counter as well and liked them all, but found the meat did not need any extras.  Good steak like this stands on its own.    It might seem questionable as to why I only gave 4 stars.  The overall experience of Gaucho is definitely not to be missed, don't get me wrong.  But I think I would have been confused about how and what to order if I hadn't prepared myself ahead of time.  I also think that despite the efficiency in service it can be disruptive when names are yelled out through the whole restaurant.  I guess what this really means is I'll have to go back again and try something else to see if I can have an even better experience.  Sigh.  If I must.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. small skirt steak plate (byob of Voodoo&#39;s American IPA)

TtPfx6eZCyOD4GsFO_64vA.text: Just get the steak burger and all your troubles will disappear. Awesome outdoor seating as well! I will definitely be coming back.

Mfc61YVweJSlt4gRtd9Feg.text: 2 trips thus far and this place has been very consistent. Wonderful food and selection. Long wait times to be seated. The steaks themselves have always been perfectly done, the one knock on the place is that you can definitely tell that you arent eating a premium steak. The quality of the meat just isnt the same as most higher end steakhouses, which they dont claim to be. Will continue to return whenever I visit Pitt.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yda2XRAAbwRBXtNg6o5nyw.text: Made it back and was so happy I did. If you are looking for the entrance it is easy to spot. Just look for the line of people curling around the on ramp to the 16th St Bridge.  My only problem was parking. I managed to snag a spot but the meter wouldn't take my credit  card and I had just enough quarters for a little over an hour. I hurried over and got in line. They had a new girl who was polling the lines to answer any questions I had concerning the menu. I asked her for the fastest options since I was contemplating having to take my sandwich and run. She suggested the braised beef or the pollo(chicken) sandwich, or the pulled pork.  Since I had my mind set on the braised beef with caramelized onions and horseradish that would be an easy choice. I really couldn't see much of the restaurant except that I noticed it did have outdoor seating as well as table and high top seating. I waited approx 30 minutes to order my sandwich and then asked how long would it take. They told me just 2 minutes and they gave me change in quarters to run out and "feed the meter" while they prepared it.  I ran out and back and found that my sandwich was ready and waiting for me! I decided to order the Argentine cookies as a small dessert since I knew that bread was thick. It was almost like eating a sandwich from a NY deli. The beef was just right with the toppings added on it. They did have an area where you could add different sauces to your sandwich. If you want additional toppings then you would need to add $.50 according to the chalkboard menu.  While i was enjoying my sandwich the manage came around and addressed me by name and asked how I was liking my meal. I replied "very good" and asked him about my recent visit during the renovations. He explained to me that during that time they were expanding and with the line completely out the door I could see why.  They had apologized that they did not have the chocolate or coffee cookies but I was happy with the shortbread ones. They were macaroon filled cookies and they had coconut on them. It was just enough and very good to finish off my meal. Staff is very friendly and helpful.  I was able to make it back to my car with time to spare and head on my way. My advice is to allow at least 2 hours if you are visiting this place since it would have normally taken (I was told) 15-20 minutes. Take out is available but the wait time is just the same. If you are planning to visit it along with shopping in the strip district then I would suggest a parking lot or garage.

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The line
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Argentine cookies

mjkzERzyFuOee3tZr9KUPA.text: I've been here for lunch three times in 2018 during the week and on the weekend. The food is always amazingly awesome, but the line to order takes a lifetime and seriously detracts from the overall experience.

__ICEHqzs1rahSRG27e8fw.text: The food is absolutely 5 Star! Long line(typically) and tight/difficult seating take the overall experience down a notch. There are not too many non-chain authentic South American cuisine places to eat in Pittsburgh, this by far is one of the best! BYOB makes it an ideal place for a date night with friends to enjoy a bottle of cab!

oUYbdcGw2k-kqDR69zMxlw.text: This is must see spot for everyone in Pittsburgh--locals or visitors. A unique menu, great atmosphere and great workers.  We love the Picasso and the Provoletta. Don't miss this place!!

9hs8171Win_27xRx8nkq0Q.text: I came here on a work trip to Pittsburgh. The ordering process is a tad overwhelming, the menu is written on a chalkboard behind the cashier register and you have to make a choice QUICK. I recommend looking over he menu before you arrive.  I ordered a flank steak which comes with a tossed salad, toast and chimichurri. I also ordered the Papas Dulce as a side. The only con to the menu is they don't serve alcohol. They have four dipping sauces which are all equally delicious, so good I was dipping with my fork before my meal came out!  ***TIP: Grab extra napkins, you will need them

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flank Steak &amp; Papas Dulce

bTUdncLixU7rqNcJKOZ_Rw.text: Steak - Amazing  Sauces - Robust  Sandwich - Delicious   Empanadas - Heavenly  Atmosphere - Charming  Service - Pay/order at counter  Is it the finest food out there? Maybe not, but everything combined makes this one of the best restaurant experiences anywhere.

Uu8My6c9X3QYFJrmk8n96A.text: Overall: Solid steaks. Good flavors!  Very casual ambiance. Was slightly confused about ordering food first then being seated. But I actually liked that it's not like swanky steakhouse. Like sauces are self-serve and they have to-go bags to grab so you don't have to wait for the waitstaff to get your cheque/to-go boxes!  Food: Asado Platter - ribeye was the winner for me. To be honest, I didn't care too much for other cuts. But my friends each liked different cuts so it worked out :) Ribeye is the fattiest. Flank was leanest. Skirt was thick-cut and juicy. Ny strip was somewhere in the middle in terms of fatty and lean. The fifth cut whose name I cannot remember was also very lean and most meaty/gamey imo. Good for sharing! The only caveat is that their medium rare was more like rare...idk if you like that, great. But wasn't fan of how tough the raw center was to chew.  Shrimps on skewers are off-the-menu item that are also great - grilled and herbed.   Sides: good portion for the price. Beef Empanadas were great! Sweet potato with caraway seeds and sunflower seeds were the group's least liked. We wish we got something else instead.   Desserts: dulce de leche shortbread cookies were so good! Could eat that every meal. Shortbread is very soft and dulce de leche isn't too sweet. And the whole cookie is coated with toasted coconut shreds!   Sauces: prob the second best thing after steak. 4 different kinds. All delish. Kinda wish they served tortilla chips so I can dip them in.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Closer up
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu as of feb 2017
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flank - part of asado platter

tVvyQdC9MHFi8_oDg5znag.text: This place is ranked #7 on America's top 100 in 2015 by Yelp itself.  For good reasons. When we arrived on a Friday around 3:30 PM there was still a line out the door... I can only imagine how busy it is during prime lunch and dinner hours.  The atmosphere is pretty hip and casual, and the restaurant looks newly renovated.   We were in a rush so we opted for sandwiches (ribeye and rosemary braised beef). These are now my favorite sandwiches without any exaggeration. Since they make their meat to order expect to wait around 15 minutes for takeout, but it is certainly worth it.  They do their sandwiches extremely well - from the bun through the meat - everything is perfectly thought out.  Probably now my favorite food place in Pittsburgh.
