Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WYZka5RMgcaI0rDuuI_7dA.text: Always a wait and with good reason. I went for lunch and had the rosemary braised beef sandwich which was quite a lot with fresh ciabatta bread, excellent. We started with empanadas which had a nice crusty shell. These were tasty. We split a side of the roasted potatoes which were well prepared and quite a large side. The sandwiches are quite large and probably could be split between 2 people. The service was very good and we left very happy. Highly recommended.

48fV4DKQHKYos2NB0j-BpQ.text: If you are ordering lunch get it Togo if possible. I didn't know either that while ordering a Togo order you do not have to stand in the long line that will be wrapped around the block, but it is sooo worth it! I recommend the ribeye, corn, shrimp and grilled veggies. Food is pricy but you get what you pay for. The steaks are always tender and packed with flavor. Spices are heavy and the chimichurri is delicious. I would recommend taking one of each sauces and using them all for dipping. You won't be disappointed!

WsEjIiMsKtvP_FAAhyv2HA.text: This place is amazing and everything on the menu is excellent. However, the most cost efficent is the steak burger and always call in to skip the line!

mBoZP3qT1w0tWFt8rdParw.text: The food ! The. Food ! The food ! Do it ! Yes ! Worth the wait ! Did I say the food !??  Wow ! No words just wow !!!!  Our 10 and two 14 year old boys loved it !!  Suggestion. Just order a lot of small plates and start sharing.  After you sit you can very quickly order more of what you love !! Try as many dishes as possible.  The entrees were nice but when we got back it will be ordering in this style.  Trying is key !!  We had the best experience

zQ6QK6uwejl8TsUE4pZbyQ.text: The food is good, but I'm not sure it is quite worth the price and the wait when the dining area is so loud.  The hard surfaces make it difficult to have a conversation when the restaurant is full.

7TlQYHuCgMFkx-axQswPqg.text: Tbh don't really have words for this place. The food is ridiculous. Insane.  I got the carne sandwich and my boyfriend got the lamb chops...both done perfectly with just the right amount of pink. The sauces help to make the meal, try all 4...you really can't go wrong!! Service was also extremely friendly, attentive and always ready to answer your questions and help you in any way possible. The only downside (and the reason it didn't get 5 stars) was the wait. I spent a total of 2 hours there, most of them which was waiting for the cold, but that isn't really their fault..and it's obvious that the food is just so good that everyone is willing to wait. I cannot wait to go back but preferably not on a Saturday night this time so I don't have to wait 500 years

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich! Looks really pink in the picture but it was perfectly done

ojbAc7UIKhUmnxf5QtpvVA.text: Amazing!!  My new favorite go-to restaurant.  Just had the Pescado sandwich , potatoes, and corn.  Everything was so delicious and fresh.  True Argentina style cooking.  All the sauces were delicious & fresh.  Seating was limited during lunch but I enjoyed the casual atmosphere of pulling up a barstool and enjoying delicious food.

awmGwxhsNUoNDCa_ICuGUA.text: This place is awesome.  Try the steak sandwich.  You wont regret it.  Great place for a quick lunch.  The food is awesome and the service is quick and friendly.

ECPQjCRf8XZ3HmDd28Lz5Q.text: I came here because a coworker told me to check it out and he was right. This place is the best lunch spot. The steak sammiches are amazing! Highly recommend!

HLw_POEZai7iTnxkmuhpEQ.text: This review isn't about the food, which is mostly excellent based on the two times that I've been previously. I tried to go tonight for takeout and was told that I would have to wait in the long line for people actually sitting at the restaurant to order my food because I hadn't called ahead. It's beyond preposterous to make people wait all that time simply to order takeout. I've never heard of this happening at other restaurants. On top of that the employee was brusque and even a little bit rude. I understand that places like this restaurant are really popular and as a result the staff often get overworked, but this policy doesn't make any sense. If you're going to prevent walk up customers from ordering takeout at the restaurant itself in a timely manner, then you shouldn't offer takeout any longer. And if your staff are overworked and having to stay late every night (as other posters have mentioned), maybe you should adjust the closing time accordingly.

DahtFmjfwiJuP9vo-gwQHg.text: Gaucho Parrilla did not disappoint. I had high hopes after reading all the five star reviews and it met them. I had the carne sandwich with rare fillet. It was so flavorful. The smoked taste of the meat combined with the sweetness of the caramelized onion and the roasted red pepper was a perfect blend. The chewy bread adds a nice texture too. I added a side of horseradish for a nice kick. The owner was working and was so friendly to everyone. Overall this was a great experience and I can not wait to return. Give this place a try and you too will see that it deserves the hype.

F3q7uI1CHRDWBlxURxXZEQ.text: I ate at Gaucho's for the first time on a date this weekend.  We didn't get there until after six, so we waited a while in the line outside, but the food was definitely worth the wait, even considering the cold.  The restaurant is BYOB so come prepared with your favorite cerveza.  We ordered the Parrilloda Mixta, the Provoletta and the Gaucho Papas.  I promise you everything was exceedingly delicious.  We ordered the steak medium rare and it was cooked perfectly.  The chorizo was perhaps the best I've ever had and the chicken was well seasoned and tasty.  Once we ordered, we did not wait long for our food.  You order at the counter, collect your plates and sauces and then find a seat.  I think we probably waited 10-12 minutes for the food.  I must say it's a shame they're closed on Sunday, because as I write this review, I want more Gauchos!  Also, they have some really original Pittsburgh art on the walls that is for sale- just an extra touch I thought added to the overall appeal.  Great pick John.

gRKoGvp6M2t4x6BU8Yhg9w.text: This place is fabulous!  I got two sandwiches so I could share with my friend.  This place is more for take away or outside dining which is kind of small.  The day I went it was very hot outside.  And at around 2 pm there were 2 people in there waiting until I showed up then the small store front got packed and even hotter when they fired up that wood grill.   The man who took my order was very friendly. The sandwiches were delicious.  I got the filet sandwich and the chicken and can honestly say these were the best sandwiches we have had in a long time.  I tried most of the sauces and they were very flavorful.  I dropped the sandwich halves to my friend who was working and he texted me to say "how much he loved them and how good the sauces were"!  This place is a must try! I can't wait to try more of their items.

cxwseV-w7IcyqjQ9ywYqIg.text: This local restaurant was absolutely amazing. I have the vegetable sandwich! The bread was nice and crispy and vegetables were full of flavor! I would definitely eat there again!!!!

SgOiQfjRyaKYAaDl7BZsTw.text: I've been going here since it opened a few years ago. Best food in Pittsburgh. They're always adding to the menu, so it never gets boring. Too crowded on a Sat. Best to go during the week or early evenings on the weekends.

NsR9qiUq0Gpg97uISwH5mw.text: Always excellent! I remember when it was a small place but the renovation is nice with lots of searing. Great thing is that even when its a 1 hour wait, the food quality is still A+, never had a bad meal here. Be sure to go on an off hour so you dont get caught in the lunch line. Other than that, friendly & awesome food!

8DUSILL71S-Fz8uppCpICg.text: This place is absolutely amazing.  I travelled to Pittsburgh for ~4 months for work, eating out twice a day for the entire time.  This is absolutely my favorite restaurant of all that I tried during that time.    Suggestion: The meat is really amazing, so I would suggest that you separate it from the bread in the sandwich.  The bread is great by itself as well.

4b3m36_EiKO6hguowGC4VA.text: Best food in Pittsburgh. Went with a group of 7 and each one of us left so full. The steak burger was awesome. The only negative is the wait but that's because of the high demand, well worth the wait!

ZHiNwoYl8du1hKLPoQLwXQ.text: I've heard so much hype about this place that I was half expecting it to fall short of my expectations but it blew me away.  I got the steak burger with a side of veggies... Great combo because you can add whatever veggies you like to the burger.  Both were out of this world on their own though.  The burger is also quite a meal so be prepared for a lot of food.

T9RXdJh8VQFaGEBmNTJEUA.text: Great good great personality. Would go back anytime and I strongly recommend this place for a great meal

9QwGwrbwn_FsrZRmChk8MA.text: This is the best steak sandwich I have ever had. We go here almost every Saturday. Their sauces are quire exquisite as well.   There is very limited seating inside, and a bit of a wait, but it's so worth it!!

wf6u98FZvx5EswWquL6vRw.text: we had empanadas.  When we asked the flavors, we were told the main protien but not what else was included - some of which we do not eat.

DjluTyvlEsaHmJV6NPeZ4Q.text: The food was very good. My flank steak was grilled perfectly and I loved the seasoning ! We had chocolate bread pudding and cookies for dessert. A great way to end a great meal. Really amazing ! The best thing about Guacho was the staff working there !!!! Excellent !!!! They were friendly and very helpful. We were very impressed with Isabel !!!! My friends and l will be back due to great food, and even better service

dlvUG2GL0zHzYmIoNcuB1Q.text: Best steak sandwich I've ever had and really good chimichurri. $12 for a sandwich but worth it.

_0NNsahubHDr8Xywd5qMMg.text: Great service, incredible food and very experienced staff! You can't find this anywhere else in Pittsburgh.

GjX52Zttg9CyqAv2jj0Xwg.text: Oh yes. Real grilled meat.  Skirt Steak is my favorite.  Delicious.  Pricy thou.

7ktnVF7cc6tP_AjCa9pTDw.text: Love this place! Unique but amazing food with a cool atmosphere. Just be aware they don't take reservations and the line on weekends can take hours. Great price for what you get!

R901IZbl8i6sTxiySvD_uw.text: As everyone knows by now, this is no longer a well kept secret in the Strip District. Gaucho certainly has a cult following and its worth the wait in line up the street! I would recommend going with a smaller group because the seating is limited and we had to wait about 15 minutes until a table opened. It's all first come, first serve seating, but the staff was more than accommodating to assist you as you waited. They opened our wine and consistently checked on tables to be aware of the status. If you're looking for a leisurely meal, this isn't the spot, but you're only coming here for the food and it is truly excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

L6beUCechEGkEOWBCNUeag.text: I took my boss there who has been to a lot of restaurants, around the world and he said "that's the best restaurant I have ever been to"

ipuPCnCnqO8PW80ug7fk1g.text: It's worth the wait. The sauces are all tasty. Excellent sandwiches, large enough for left overs.

Pi2QNKuAdxchM7YtBOrvtQ.text: This is one of the BEST sandwiches I've had. I came here after splitting a primanti brothers sandwich and we both agreed this was WAYYY better.  The guy working here is super friendly and helpful. We even got to try a sample of soup for free. We split the "Carne" sandwich and I got the filet cut (several cuts of steak are available to you). It came out very moist and flavorful. Seasoned very well (must have been marinated i guess) and cooked on the grill it was great. It also came with some roasted peppers. If I lived here I'd eat it all the time.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich with the filet cut

-kL-mx7PZTkP7kOQEt2cog.text: What's a Baltimore girl doing while shes driving 5 hours to get to Pittsburgh? She's dreaming about the amazing food she's going to get once she finally makes it to Gaucho. This is my first stop as soon as I get into the city. And it almost made me move there. The smell as soon as you get within a block is incredible. The firewood stacked along all the walls scream of authenticity, and the people who work there are so cool. I'm a fan of the steak burger, and its been consistently good. Last time I had it with some bacon, and the bacon was way overcooked to the point of being charcoal. I would say to stick to veggie toppings on the burger, but it wasn't egregous enough for me to knock off a star, and I'm sure that if I had said something they would have fixed it immediately. A word of caution, it does get hot inside. Great for the winter, not as fun in the summer.

LcS7kWZbkNX-hgsSDs3yMA.text: If you love meat,simply the best. Take a bottle of wine (or a 6 pack) and enjoy.  While we have loved the Asado platter on many occasions, the steak burger is simply delectable. Take out is also a possibility. Worth the wait (which wraps around onto the 16th St bridge and not Penn Ave, FYI!).

F58Fp1u0RX7AEM6jvbb8pA.text: Oh man, is this place good. I had to wait about 45 minutes outside before I got up to order, but it was so worth the wait. Would defiantly recommend this. Mm mm good!

chK9gG7ae7fZqGxAuPw3tg.text: Like this place needs it's 783rd review.  Lines are out the door already, right?  Well I'm glad I was in line and I'd get in line again, as the place is really good and a unique experience.  People super nice.  Food is interesting and high quality.    Note this is BYOB...i'm fine with water but I kinda which I'd rolled in with a bottle of Rioja, that would have been the bomb.

RWkFw-RteUNSb7GZ0-mCXQ.text: We have been to this place twice now. After this time we will never return. To start with the food is not very good at all. Second, the place is way over priced. Third, the service is terrible and five minutes after we were finished eating we were asked to leave so they could use the table.  The place is super small but they are supposed to have a private banquet facility downstairs. Why not open that up to seating so your not kicking you customers out. $125 for dinner and we were promptly kicked out. Don't go, this place isn't worth it at all!!!

kMn0iV19-vBPuH6AxCyoRA.text: Believe the hype.  I ordered the carne sandwich with filet mignon steak and was astounded! The steak was cooked to a juicy medium rare. The peppers were charcoaled perfectly. The caramelized onions were sweet and savory. The chimichurri added a nice bitter taste. And the bread absorbed all the juices and allowed all of the different flavors to stand out in unison.  This was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. It's undoubtedly the best sandwich I've had in Pittsburgh. I'm not even sure we should refer to it as a sandwich considering how transcendental it is.

LjMQv8X31vgH1g6DqGtlPA.text: Soooo good. Lots of flavor.  I would definitely recommend the empanadas. Try with all the dipping sauces. The corn on the cob was grilled and excellent compliment to the fish sandwich I had. I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas are key.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Excellent lunch spot.

JNwzUvxiQR4NgE5Xc5WQYw.text: Gaucho was AMAZING! This was my second visit, and both times have been incredible. The first time, I got the steak sandwich- the meat was cooked perfectly and the bread is perfectly crusty yet soft on the inside. Tonight I got the fish sandwich, and I can honestly say it was the best sandwich I have ever had. The fish of the day (I believe it was walleye) was flaky and seasoned nicely, and went perfectly with all the flavorful sauces. Also, the potatoes are delicious as well. YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Perfect fish sandwich

InopzJFQdXGtu7tg2mgRug.text: I finally got a chance to try Gaucho Parrilla Argentina. I'd heard the buzz and I really wanted to check it out. I am pleased to say that all the reports I'd heard are correct.  This. Is. Good. Food.  For what it's worth, I went on Tuesday night.  I'd tried to go before, but the lines can be VERY long on certain evenings, especially weekends.  So long, in fact, that it is possible the last person in line will be holding a sign stating something to the effect that once s/he orders no more orders will be taken.  So go on an off night, or early.  If you go on the weekend plan to wait in line.  It's BYOB, so bring good beer or red wine.  For my first excursion two of us ate, and we were able to share a few of the apps and entrees. I can now vouch for the fact that the chicken empanadas are tasty morsels baked into a delicious pastry shell. I can also vouch that the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich is quite tasty, although the one I tried was ever-so-slightly too dry. That was easily fixed by dipping it into any one of the tasty house-made sauces you can get at Gaucho.  However, the winner was the Bondiola sandwich. Perfectly roasted and juicy pork, with spicy mustard and caramelized onion on ciabatta. This sandwich was absolutely a "WOW!" My fellow partner and I both declared the Bondiola to be the best sandwich we'd tasted in quite some time.  We will be going back, and while I love to try new things each time I visit a restaurant I'm going to be hard-pressed not to order the Bondiola again.  For dessert they also served a lemon pound-cake. It was the perfect ending to an excellent meal although I can't vouch for whether this is a standard item or whether it was special that night. I therefore have to suggest that if it is available, get it.  Overall the restaurant is comfortable, the menu is fantastic (albeit daunting in actual size as well as content), and the food was excellent. Gaucho Parrilla Argentina does it right!

DkpwUjAev0ceF-oemrdB_A.text: There are so many reviews on this place so I will make it short and sweet.   Just eat here, eat anything that sounds good, and you won't be sad. You will be full, happy and in love!!  The staff take their time to help recommend something that you will love and I didn't feel rushed at all to make a choice. I want to work here just so I can eat here everyday!

a7GSk-g4Ss0bZ27lStC7Hg.text: Gaucho.  Who doesn't love to say Gaucho?  And what meat eaters wouldn't love this tiny little spot in the Strip?  We arrived early on a Saturday morning.  And Chef Anthony Falcon was already performing for the crowd!  Yes, this man is a performer, describing the menu, giving tips on what to order and truly thrilling the crowd!  So, here is a bit of the condensed version of the story of this grill spot.  A gaucho is an Argentina cowboy.  These gauchos would grill beef over a wood fire, giving the meat an incredible flavor.  Chef Anthony's great grandfather was a gaucho in Argentina.  Be sure to search the restaurant wall for a photo of him dressed in gaucho garb.  Well, on to the story.  Chef Anthony's uncle visited Pittsburgh from Argentina and said, you have got to put a restaurant in the Strip.  And so, here we are today.    It's interesting to enter and see stacks of natural hardwood everywhere.  All cooking it done by fire.  No oven.  No stove.  And definitely no microwave.  It's almost prehistoric.  Wood, fire, meat.  The day we visited, Chef Anthony was not cooking, he was entertaining and waiting on the crowd.  Not being super hungry, we opted to order simple items.  I got a cob of corn and steak empanadas.  OMG.  Can't say enough about the awesome flavors here.  BJ got a chorizo sandwich with peppers, onion & pimenton.  So good.  Also, I added the pimenton to my empanadas.  Spectacular.    Clearly, we need to return with an appetite.  And try more of the menu.  Can't wait for that!

FdplkojjaVtDhAc6wW6Yrw.text: I tried Gaucho about a week ago and it was a very interesting and satisfying experience. I went on a Thursday evening and was able to enjoy a table with 7 other friends comfortably in a relaxed and inviting atmosphere. This being my first experience it is one that I recommend to anyone looking for something different in the city. I had the red snapper filet and it was delicious. The four sauce choices made a big difference and he roasted potatoes complimented the snapper seamlessly. Check out Gaucho Parrilla Argentina!

9AJpwtY9jlxNk6bUJHEwwA.text: Brought our son and his friend here for dinner before the Pirate game. When I looked at the menu I was worried the kids wouldn't like it. Boy was I wrong, they devoured everything on their plate! My husbands chicken sandwich was very good and my Rosemary braised beef sandwich was to die for.  On top of the delicious food the staff were all so friendly and helpful. A most enjoyable dinner! The DeCarlo's will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary braised beef sandwich. So good

v4sWws0LiAnCGlL8sGVwAQ.text: Bottom line, if you visit Pittsburgh you have got to stop at this place!  This might be one of the best restaurants I've been to in years! Waited in line for 20 minutes outside and an additional 15 minutes inside, the food was slow to come out. All of this usually would result in two to three stars. But the food was amazing and well worth the wait. I had the pork it was out of this world I ordered the small portion and it was more than enough I left full. The flank steak was also very good, as were the beef and pork empanadas. They also give you side of toast with your meal which is great dipped in their sauces.

PSq2V5YsoriyfF9BZ9Vzyg.text: Hands down, my favorite place in Pittsburgh. You can't get better food quality for this price! And the restaurant allows BYOB! You seriously can't go wrong. There is always a line that wraps around the building itself, so I recommend that you go on non-popular dining times to really enjoy! I recommend filet sandwich and use all of the toppings that are offered to dip the bread and meat in at the table! The mussels are to die for as well!

8QjcT69EN6y6qieQhmKq4g.text: First time visiting Gaucho after hearing great things from friends. It lived up to the hype. It is so hard to decide what to order because everything looks great. We enjoyed it all, amazing flavors. I'd recommend Gaucho to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

O7iYQmnQxAjKXvRElKe8aQ.text: It was our first time there yesterday. The food was absolutely amazing, I had the steak burger and my friend had the pork sandwich! Strongly recommend Gaucho, the staff is very helpful and friendly.  We will definitely be back soon!

yeXxuEtUws1-BuOsuDMGrw.text: I was just visiting a friend in the area and had no expectations about Gaucho.  On a Saturday evening, we waited in line for a little more than an hour, maybe an hour and a half.  The line moved quickly and everyone around us was friendly.  The weather was great and this place is BYOB, so we busted out the cups of sangria while in line.  Once inside, the two of us ordered a selection of things including the Zanahoria bebe (baby carrots), chorizos, provoletta, and the qui qui chicky.  The qui qui chicky is amazing, I literally had a dream about it.  The provoletta was also delicious.  I don't remember for certain, but I think our total came to under $40 including tip.  I would highly recommend!

H65VME2chAQlIjNHaboSiw.text: I recommend ordering the salad, either regular size or share the large size, plus ask add on the steak or braised beef. You can also buy "toast" it's like a large crispy crostini. Good quality meat. Casual, cool place to eat. Metered street parking was easy to find during the weekday.

3aP4hEthVd3efVdex4l0kA.text: I am sorry but after much anticipation and high expectations based on all the positive feedback we read I just can't write a good review about our experience here.  On a busy Friday evening we waited in line a half hour and my wife ordered the flank steak and I ordered the ribeye.  We also ordered the clam, mussel and squid appetizer.  Both steaks came out barely warm, almost cold and the appetizer was scalding hot, way too hot to eat clams or mussels.  The taste wasn't bad but it was hard to judge because of the missed temperatures.  Another uneasy moment happened in the kitchen which is easily visible when ordering your food.  One of the chefs exited the cooler with a tray of the salad that is served with many of the meals.  There was another tray of raw foods in a dirty container laid on top of the greens.  He shouted out "who did this?!" And the entire staff started pointing fingers at one another.  That should have been our cue to leave.  Kitchen cleanliness is no laughing matter.  I would bet our bad experience was due to how busy they were but it will be our first and last visit.

gh283eTeF4bKsf_MoTs0Mw.text: walked out after twenty minutes waiting with ONE party out of at least ten other parties inside visibly having ordered  someone came around to offer "skipping the line" and get the $50/head prix fixe menu - are you kidding me?  who in their right mind goes anywhere offering a prix fixe menu that makes you wait in the damn street?  nothing, NOTHING is good enough to justify that line, that wait, and a terse sign at the door whining about how "we know it's cold out, that's why coats were invented"  get a bigger venue - sizing down for "exclusivity" just makes you look like a dick

-ZXofNMfRkTipDnmlLi7GA.text: BYOB. No cork charge. Definitely a bonus, food is very delicious and staff is very friendly and fun!

JaPDyOhAxPQdn4F2rkX2kw.text: Steak sampler was disappointing.  Every cut of meat tasted the same. All the meat was "blue".  I understand rare but this was flat raw.  I'll give it another chance in the future because I've heard many good things.  My experience was a let down.

ZTl5NpuNORAZWvV9nRUYhQ.text: Amazing food!!! The sandwiches are HUGE. The meat is always tender and the sweet potatoes are to die for! It can get expensive but it is worth it.

tjrced5jFSHOPw_H23ErAA.text: Lines out the door, but the food is amazing. If they are busy. They will kick you out as soon as your done eating to get your table, so be prepared for that. BYOB! No corkage fees. Would  return.

V3-nS--ydnzf-BeGYEm_2w.text: Over an hour wait in the rain but worth it. The staff was pleasant and our food came fast. The food was delicious.

tjDZAFz5T4RmM67TTrtQ7w.text: Incredible food, by far my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. Usually I need extreme spice to enjoy my food whether in the form of peppers or hot sauce but the medley of flavors in these dishes is perfect and no spice is necessary! The braised beef with horseradish is a must try and any of the salads with any of the steaks (i love the flank).  BUT they do have lots of delicious of sauces if you need something to perfectly compliment your dishes (see photos)    New on the menu are the scallops, which I love more than anything they serve, especially the fresh grapefruit mixed in with the seafood dish.   I could go on but essentially anything I've ordered at this place has been phenomenal. And they now have outdoor seating as opposed to just the small space available inside.

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious sauces

tgm_aexgj5OoE_cQdQep9Q.text: I was blown away by the entire early dinner experience Husband and I had here last night.  Always nice when expectations and hype are met!  Allow me to add to Gaucho Parrilla Argentina's accolades...  We ordered the Asado Plate, which is a grilled heap of all 5 of Gaucho's available cuts of beef.  Our decision to order this dish was a fantastic one.  Sure, I've experienced each of these meats before, but it was really cool to have all the grilled meats labeled side by side and compare them visually as well as by taste.  A nice surprise was that the portion was bigger than I expected.  I anticipated I'd love the filet, which I did, and was surprised by how delicious the skirt was--a nice amount of fat and very tender.  The other cuts--NY, flank, and ribeye--were all nicely executed and good, but the filet and skirt stood out to me.  Also ordered the large portion of Vegetales, which is essentially a beautiful plate of mixed grilled veggies.  I thought some of the vegetables tasted kind of plain, but then something dawned on me.  Read on.  Gaucho's condiments are what really take this place to the next level.  The 4 complimentary condiments--chimmi churri, pimenton, ajo, and cebolla--can be dished up fresh from jars in the ordering area, or you can purchase 8oz. for $5.  The condiments are killer and really give the already-yummy food some oomph, and I liked that none of the condiments are spicy.  Pimenton was my favorite, followed closely by cebolla.  The ajo was a little salty for me but still delicious, and the chimmi churri, though flavorful and tangy like chimmi churri usually is, was surprisingly thin.  This place rocks.  I love everything about it.  Every aspect of our dinner--quality of food, portion size, decor, price point--was right on and beyond reproach.  Service was extremely friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable.  Hell, even the weather was perfect for eating outside on the little patio facing Penn Avenue!  A very, very easy 5 stars.

4JtaledeABwE1UqggoODfg.text: I had to check this place called Gaucho out and I did read a ton of reviews on here. I also had a friend who kept telling me to try it. So, you all did a great job.    Let me give some kudos to the staff. They could see it was my "maiden voyage" in the shop and they were helpful and informative.  I went with the Carne Steak sandwich with NY strip in it. They add fried onions, red bell pepper and a special steak sauce. It was delish! I added a side of potatoes and loaded up on some sauces.   I can't wait to go back and try another dish.

4y9UOD2-gA2tFpglHbEpBw.text: The hype is real!  I think I just ate one of the best sandwiches, The Carne, I've ever had in my entire life!  SUPER friendly and FUN staff!  Great menu! Generous portions!  Incredibly delicious food!  The place is a small, meat Mecca.    It offers relatively confined indoor seating or a charming, street-side patio right next to the place.  Plus, they effortlessly handled an ever-growing line of hungry customers quite quickly.   Gaucho is instantly on my "favorites" list, as I can't wait to be a return customer.  Believe the hype...5 Star, Rock Stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Super-delicious sandwich!  Looking forward to enjoying more of these in the future.

zMmoJroyqug48cTws34rrg.text: Awesome food, worth the wait in line. I have eaten here a handful of times and definitely will go back!

ENeLzALoC-NnoHPzRAz7Iw.text: Unlike the other reviews we were very lucky and had no wait. The food was fantastic!  Thank goodness the staff was extremely helpful in what to order because the menu was a little tough to choose from with a line of people behind you.  I suggest checking the menu before you arrive and have some order while you grab a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Idk it was the lady taking my order&#39;s favorite. I didn&#39;t ask the name.

6kpXy7GlkCu_adCe3JIErA.text: If you like delicious food, Gaucho is an absolute must try! I live in the Strip District and drive past Gaucho daily and the wonderful smells that come out of this place are hard to resist, so I don't! The last time I went, I ordered the Carne, a fantastic steak sandwich with your choice of steak, marinated and grilled peppers and onions, served on a fresh bun that's doused with some delicious oil/butter/garlic combo. It was heavenly! The prices here are extremely reasonable and it's BYOB, so it's well worth the long wait in line that wraps outside the building that you will probably encounter (ours was 75 minutes on a very cold day). So bring your booze and someone fun to talk to in line and enjoy your experience at Gaucho!!

RCsNFjUt357roA_WvOv6vA.text: Not much new to say, as the overwhelmingly positive reviews are 100% accurate; the food is incredible. Everyone in Pittsburgh should try it if they haven't yet.  That said, it appears that everyone in Pittsburgh IS trying to have it, so getting into the restaurant is roughly as hard as getting an unannounced table for eight at Noodlehead on a Saturday night. But the food is so incredible that I can't take a star off for the awful wait you will undoubtedly have. It's still worth it.   Go early, go with a small crowd, and go hungry. You won't regret it.

iGXG6qk1Tzq2Re1RbaCRBg.text: Wow; awesome. Just go. Food is incredible for carnivores and omnivores alike. Staff helps guide through the menu as you wait in a line (that is there for very good reason).

WxUaIrfku2kBMagaga4jkg.text: I think that Gaucho might be my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh, which is a little strange; even though their new space is about 500% larger than their old one, it's still not a comfortable place to sit!  But the food is just *so good* that it doesn't matter. I will come back again and again.    It's not fine dining, but my favorite thing on the menu is the steak sandwich made with ribeye steak.  Nearly all of the food is cooked directly over their incomparable wood-fired grill.  The house-made authentically Argentinian sauces complete the sandwich, so don't be shy and be sure to try them all!  I can't decide if I like the pimenton (smoky red pepper) or ajo (garlic) better!  If you'd looking for a side dish, I can't recommend the grilled veggies enough.  Who knew that something so simple could be so delicious?  Also: I say skip the paella.  It was fun to eat as a group, but it lacked so much in flavor.  Arrive early or in the middle of the afternoon to beat the wait.  BYOB!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The disappointing paella.  It looked beautiful but didn&#39;t taste like much.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled veggies and potatoes (papas)
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sauces galore.

uE-k2dRbNhGHvXDCIiVvTA.text: Stopped here for lunch after a long morning  shopping at the Strip.  Let me start off by saying the food is pretty darn good. It is inventive and full of flavors. They also have an area of a few homemade sauces (chimichurri, Etc) along the side that you can go get. The bathroom is clean and spacious, though theres only 2 single-person bathrooms, which draw a line quickly when the restaurant fills up. But to me it just wasn't enough to overcome the lackluster experience.  First, the menu is huge and written on the wall in chalk. Well, if there's anyone behind you, you have no time to crane your neck enough to be able to pick something that sounds like it would be okay.  Then you are given all your drinks up front, while paying and tipping at the register. I didn't know that. So my boyfriend left to get a table and set our bags down, and I was left juggling drinks and my purse and a few shopping bags up the stairs to the dining area. Our food was brought to us, a plus. But, we didn't know how to get a drink refill; do we go back up to the register? Is there a waiter? We were so confused. So we waited and waited and someone came and asked if we wanted refills, and took at least 10 minutes to bring them back, I am guessing because the restaurant was pretty full and they were also taking food orders out.  I also can appreciate quality food and ingredients, but I did think the prices were a bit high on some items. I got the Large melted provolone appetizer for the table, but it came out as 2 small slices of bread with cheese on it, which we had to cut into pieces to feed all of us. The side of broccolini was 2 long florets and a couple green onions. I just didn't get it, to be honest. The rosemary beef sandwich was pretty excellent but was too dry without some kind of condiment so I used the homemade chimichurri to dip it in and it definitely elevated the sandwich a bit.   Maybe its something I need to get used to. I just didn't realize it was that kind of place from the reviews and from the exterior/interior look and feel of the establishment.  I might give it a shot again....maybe.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side of broccolini
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Large melted provolone appetizer

HQ1x0qEWHDxXxbfXJz1ZZg.text: We had our eyes on this place for about a year before we worked it out to stop in. We were down in Pgh to see Phantom of the Opera (without the kids) so the timing was perfect. We ended up ordering several empanadas and a couple sampler plates then sharing everything. Don't miss the dipping sauces in the dining area, lots of tasty combos to try. The plates are simple but they're delicious and more filling than they look like. If you can, try a variety and share.

GTl6fjjiHml0CKmQ_JQEnA.text: My boyfriend and I both really liked Gaucho. He got the Carne sandwich and 1 piece of sweet steak and I got the beans and greens and Provoletta. We were both pleased with the amount of food and LOVED the AJO-GARLIC sauce! yum! Would go back because the prices are fair, BYOB is a plus and it's different from our typical cuisine.

gdqZK8fYo41ZcMMSexfw7Q.text: I am staying at the Omni William Penn for work and was looking for something different than room service... I was not disappointed! The sauces are so flavorful and the right amount of spicy. I had two pork empanadas and kicked myself for not getting more! The flank steak was cooked to medium perfection and so flavorful. I've been to Pittsburgh many times and this is by far my favorite restaurant. I will definitely be back to try more menu items! Oh, and the service was excellent!

E5t8HU19lkUC2C2Uy0-y1g.text: The food here is UNREAL!!! Absolutely delicious meats. My only grievance is that you can't sit down until you order (and there is usually a very lengthy line) so you end up standing for about an hour before you eat and then feel a little rushed as you eat what you've been waiting for.

JWYTbyBr9R8R4G-gJOabcA.text: Quite simply, the meal was off the charts. Couple that with a modern seating area and fair pricing so if I could give a score higher than 5 stars I would.  Just be aware, the ordering process is when you walk in NOT at the table.  So I would recommend reviewing the menu via their website before visiting.

wtoMb2MX0vuvpml1YjMSJw.text: Amazing! Great food and lovely atmosphere.  We had the Ribeye Steak plates and lemon bread pudding.  The staff was friendly, pleasant and the service was good.  We can't wait to return!  When we got there,  it was just before close and the line was long but it went pretty quickly and we got into a conversation with some other first timers,  we all had heard good things and were excited.   I caught up with them after their meal and it turns out we all had the same thing.   They were raving about it as much as we were!!  Parking was a challenge but well worth it!

_Kvbhbns2eFjzQbz2IgEyg.text: Maybe I need to go here a few more times and try more things. Ultimately, I liked my steak sandwich, but I think my expectations were too high. We arrived early on a weekday and there was no line. I really didn't have time to read or understand the menu as we didn't wait in any line. The menu to me was confusing with too many options. I got the steak sandwich with hangar steak. The bread was very good. It was so messy though, I think I went through about 25 napkins. I don't recommend this for a first date or a lunch during the work day. We also had the cauliflower which was ok also. I have had much better. If I lived in the area, I would give it another shot. Maybe I just didn't have the right thing.

plQmdqDk1iwuo3loGHaLiA.text: What to get: deconstructed steak sandwich, grilled vegetables Service: 5/5 Atmosphere: trendy, casual Wait: 20 mins (Tuesday 6PM for 1) Parking: street  The Experience: [August 2016] One of the best meals I've had to date. It was worth the visit from out of town. I'd visit Pittsburgh again for this place.  Located in the Strip District(?), this street is filled with ethnically diverse shops and restaurants.  There's a lot of one way streets in the area, so you may have to loop around like me to find a spot. I'm a chicken when it comes to city parking, so I parked hella far from the restaurant, but it was street parking. Walking to the restaurant, Penn Ave is reminiscent of a smaller Chinatown, but a lot more than cultures. The place is at the very end of the street.  If you think coming with a tiny group (aka party of 1) will get you seated faster, you're wrong. The line weaves in and then out of the entrance along the sidewalk. I'm no stranger to long waits, but just a heads up if you want to come with people. If it weren't so popular and busy, I'd come here with the girls for a girls' night out with an accompaniment of wine. It certainly looked like the thing to do when I was eating there and all the groups were merrily dining and drinking wine around me.  I chose the deconstructed steak sandwich and a plate of grilled vegetables for some variety. The meat was PHENOMENAL. I need to learn better vocabulary for food descriptions, but the steak was perfectly marinated and flavorful. I could have just eaten steak for my entire meal! The crisp toast and marinated and grilled vegetables were a fantastic complement to the beef. Only way to improve this meal was to have a glass of red wine to go with it.  I still drool over my pictures of the dinner I ate there and I wish other cities were blessed with this kind of luxury as well. I'd say this is one of the key places to visit while in Pittsburgh. Nothing short of amazing.

fGVSsKqcuC8DGhw-DSI3Gw.text: The place is good! Great food with reasonable price. While you have to wait in long line to get served, but it's easy to get seated, because there is plenty of space outside, and on the upper stairs. Easy to find parking lots, but not free.

9Q2N2X4d9QD1359G2idV7w.text: I literally have no idea why this place has so many good reviews. The portions are extremely small. I always need a to go container when I eat out, but I was still hungry after this meal. The food was okay, nothing grand at all. Way too expensive for the small portions and nothing special taste.

fVBaQqLgRIx7M4iUcn1FhA.text: The food is pretty good - no doubt - but the menu is pretty limited if you don't eat beef & pork like me. There are plenty of beef options so if your only restriction is pork, you'll find that the selection is pretty good.   More than the actual dishes, what I absolutely love here are the three sauces that are offered. My favorite one, hands down, is the chimichurri sauce (it's green). It's amazing and I  fill up multiple sauce cups of it because it is amazing with the lamb.   The line on weekends is usually out the door and I don't think they take reservations. To avoid the lines, I tend to go at awkward times like 3-4 pm before the dinner rush starts. The first time I went, we waited for 1.5 hours outside and then an additional 1 hour for food but we went on a Friday night, I believe. The subsequent times, I went at around 3-4 pm and there was no wait or line.   Overall, a great place!

Jzd8CqVD2Qb_MMfneLzutQ.text: You will be in HEAVEN after having a meal at Gaucho. There is always a wait out the door but the food is so worth it! The menu has so much to offer (at all reasonable prices) but you can never go wrong with anything you order. I've been twice and both times enjoyed the steak sandwich. The meat is so flavorful it tastes great in any dish! They also offer a variety of sauces that are good to try! Try to come early to beat the crowds!

KseWK4NiAgNQydR_VEqaLw.text: Nice little place in the heart of downtown, Pittsburgh.   Ordered the mixed meat platter (steak, chicken and spicy sausage). The food was cooked well and pretty tasty.  Line up wasn't bad when I came in, maybe 10-15 mins. Leaving the restaurant the line up was out the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The infamous blackboard

tKGOMOjpoP2H5wutEusMKg.text: Delicious food! This place is worth the wait , friendly staff & quality food. I went here for my birthday in May & loved every bite !

FenHPXs7inIYFzRdtvIfVg.text: This place is so delicious. Packed with people as always so the wait time is a bit long. But the staff has always been very friendly and the meats are super tender and juicy.

Iy4sdVpbn_zdGo82cYbLlA.text: Amazing food & super friendly staff! The first time I stopped in, I was surprised at how affordable it was.  I've only dined inside so far & it's been perfect - comfy, clean, pleasant atmosphere. Can't wait to visit again in the warmer weather to try out their outdoor dining.

1oUZ6KpL_BOcE8PUYGwWSA.text: In town for the weekend and heard great things about this place. Called ahead on a Saturday around 7pm to see how long the line was to get in and it was about 2 hours. This place does not take reservations and you have to wait in line for seating. Called back later on and line died down. Got there and was seated within 30min deff worth the wait. Great steaks and Argentinean flavor. It is BYOB and liquor stores close early around here so come prepared! I really enjoyed their set up, how you order and pay first at the counter then get seated, very different.

-oNQmZFrKmj4ewyFIXpqxg.text: If you like waiting in line for an iPhone this is about the same experience with no phone at the end.. just some tired feet.  The key which I didn't know but know now is to just be rude and push past the line saying a friend is already inside. This happened to me tonight and I'll never go back.  I waited here for almost 2 hours and I had one Guy in front of me.. then his 7 friends show up and I let it slide thinking ok he saved a spot for his friends but yeah 8 of them all Pitt students.  So I let it go and the line slowly moves and right before I got inside a lady and her kid come around the bend and pushed right in.. then I didn't make it in the door and they shut the door on me..  and no this kid wasn't young or crippled or in any way shape and form couldn't wait the dang 2 hours i had to wait.  another 20 minutes of me waiting went by all the time I see the lady and kid go to the counter now to order.. finally I wised up and went to Kuhn's and bought my own flank steak for 8 dollars and 2 dollars of seasoning.  People are probably still waiting in line there now and I already ate.  This place has by far the worst system I've ever seen for a restaurant.  Next time I'll know to fake throwing up and just run inside.  Anywhere else it would probably have lots of fights from the poor queue system

w8rFIp-l9k2Udk9JxbZ3uQ.text: Hands down my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh! If you love steak you must eat here. The meat is divine - tender, juicy and made to perfection just the way you like it. You can get your favorite cut of steak in small or large size. Also comes with salad, toast, and chimmichurri. And don't forget to try their 4 different sauces!!  You order at the counter and then your food is delivered in a pretty quick fashion. The food is served on these cute wooden platters and the whole restaurant has a rustic hip kind of vibe.   If you want an app, get the roasted carrots which are amazing - marinated with smoked honey and goat cheese, so yum! Heard the sammies are delicious as well so will have to try them the next time I'm in Pittsburgh.   On top of that it is BYOB so how can this place get any better?  Note: they do not accept reservations so come early!

LqoydJwL1OwskL6rnjKGyw.text: Hits and misses for sure at Gaucho Parrilla.  We went for the Parrillada Mixta since we wanted to try a lot of things.  Came with NY Strip steak, grilled chicken, and chorizo, as well as 2 pieces of toast.  The steak was great, cooked perfectly.  When you pair it with the chimmichurri, it's just perfect.  There's actually 4 sauces, but in the end we both thought the chimmichurri was the best.  The chorizo was also very good, but the chicken was a huge let down down - very dry and not much flavor.   We also got an Argentino salad to share.  The salad was great.  Loved the grilled flavor on the veggies.  The large on its own is definitely a filler, especially if you add protein to it.  For some reason we didn't care for the empanadas.  Both the chicken and the beef were just alright.    Saw a bunch of people ordering sandwiches and it looked amazing.  The toast we had was great so I can only assume the bread on the sandwiches are just as good.  In hindsight, probably should've went with that or just the steak haha.  Be prepared to wait in line.  Apparently we were lucky and only waited for 20-25 minutes.

E7w9-2kg9D3UImbSgfqQ2A.text: I've been dying to try Gaucho for so long now. So much hype surrounding this place and I must say it did not disappoint. However, I'm not the biggest fan of the first come first serve concept.   First let's talk food, to simply put it....amazing and absolutely delicious! We tried the beef and chicken empanadas, both were really good but I felt the chicken was a little dry so I dipped it in sauce but still really good and I'd get again. They have a few different choices for empanadas and they are written up front so they change them out. We also had the grilled shrimp and they are grilled to perfection. They have that perfect char grilled tastes. You get 6 shrimp and they are a good size. We opted for the summer squash because we wanted a veggie side and it was good. A nice size side perfect for 2 people and only $6 so definitely worth it. For the main course we had the parrillada mixta which consists of strip steak, chicken, and your choice of sweet or spicy chorizo (we chose the spicy). This dish also comes with 2 pieces of grilled bread which is fantastic. I wanted more bread! The steak was cooked perfectly. The chicken was my least favorite there just wasn't a wow factor for me. Spicy chorizo is also delicious. This dish was a great combo to get your first time to try the different meats so I recommend. It's a big portion too, we had leftovers to take home. They have 4 different sauces for dipping and all of them are amazing. Honestly, the sauces may have been my favorite part. I can't pick a favorite cause they all are so good. I dipped everything we got in each one. Gaucho is also a byob establishment. I think our total was around $50 for all that food which really isn't bad for a good meal.   Gaucho is located in the strip district which means finding parking can be an issue. It is also first come first serve, no reservations. Since this place is so good there is often a line that wraps around the side of the building which is my least favorite part. I wish they took reservations and you didn't have to wait but there is obviously a method to this madness because it's always busy and a very successful establishment. Since it's byob I feel like people will also sit longer to finish their alcohol which makes the line longer. They have a sign that indicates 3-4pm is shift change and they have to feed their employees so the restaurant runs much slower, I went on a Saturday and got in line around 3:20 and was inside and ordered about 45 minutes later which was not too bad. I will say I wouldn't wait much longer. Food is great but I don't want to wait in line any longer than an hour for it.   The inside is small which is also another reason the line can take long. You order at the counter, they seat you and bring the food to your table but you do not have a server. The employees all seemed super friendly and everyone had a smile on their face. The vibe is super casual and relaxed.   I do recommend trying Gaucho if you haven't. The food is unlike any other food I've had in the city. I will def be back but maybe on a week night when the line isn't so long.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Summer squash
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parrillada Mixta...strip steak, chicken, chorizo, and toast

hnZmIN0PnQVo7ooUOpPjzw.text: This is a unique twist on an Argentine classic! $55 for 25oz and 5x different cuts of meat decent price. The summer squash side was very good with caramelized onions, the best part was mixing the pepper sauce with the garlic give it a try!  Service - everyone was friend / this isn't a restaurant with servers  Ambiance- very modern with hipsters all over  Price $67 for the entree, side and drink Value - worth it  Taste - steak was cooked well

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mix the pepper sauce with garlic
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $55 - 25oz - 5 cuts of beef(ribeye, fillet, ny strip, etc)

cormykP4vwm4YfQb1xXzCQ.text: This is one of the best steakhouses I've been to, Ordered the New York strip and the flank steak ,large portions and it's perfect for a group of 4 ppl , I like the BYOB option although I won't complain if they have drinks onsite as we may run short of drinks sometimes !, outside is the best place to eat specially on a bright sunny day in Pittsburgh!5 on 5 , please visit if you're fan of steaks !

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. New York strips and flank
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

I_DhG8linwINwMWVXpGh6Q.text: Wow! Gaucho has some of the best steak. We came around 1 pm on a Friday afternoon, so there was a bit of a line. With maybe 15-20 or so people in front of us, the line moved pretty quickly.   After ordering in the front, they tell you what table to sit at. When your order is ready they call your name. All of the sauces are so flavorful and fresh. I liked the caramelized onion and of course the chimichurri too.   The steak in the sirloin was delicious! So flavorful, juicy and that perfect smokiness from the wood oven.   It's well worth it, and Gaucho has great vibes too. Don't miss it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. chicky empanada
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. steak sandwich (sirloin-medium)

77N_btpRJqtU0bpihS1G5A.text: Gaucho Parrilla Argentina offered a delicious meal and a wonderfulunique dining experience. For those of you who want a short review: yes, eat here, amazing, great service, best steak burger I've ever had, just do it.  To be more detailed about Gaucho, it's enticing from the start. You walk in and order as if you were at a coffee shop. The lines are usually long enough to peruse the entire chalk board menu. They even have guides on what gaucho defines how they cook their meats. From there, you pay upfront and get seated. While you wait for your food, you have the ability to choose different types of sauces that will complement whatever entree you ordered. I sampled every single one.  The food comes (and is outstanding), the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is inviting. The burger was a little more rare than I had expected but still perfection. I can't wait to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak Burger

T0KvSasP1b_tcKsO2DgOrA.text: After attending CMU from 2009-2013, I was not expecting to find a place like Gaucho.  Maybe I matured past bar food, maybe Pixburgh has really stepped into its own, or maybe a combination of both.  Any which way, this is a must-stop destination after you get in your obligatory run through Primanti's.  My gf and I ordered the asado platter (all five cuts of steak) - there was no way we were going to limit ourselves to a couple cuts.  We also got empanadas, a side of grits, and a side of greens.  Obviously the steak was the best part of the meal.  Very cool experience to taste the subtle differences and textures between the different cuts - highly recommend.  Also, gotta love the bread on top.  The grits and greens were standard, not a must-order but you will want some type of flavor break from the mound of meat.  The empanadas were good, but ultimately it's hard for anything to hold a candle to the steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asado Plate with sides of grits and greens

LaZXl_kXn4PSDYqRmaxTfg.text: Come visit if you're in Pittsburgh! Wanted to give a 4.5 stars, but they don't have an option for that unfortunately. This is some honest to goodness Argentinian food that will satiate the meat cravings that everybody has once in a while.  We ordered the asado plate (a sampler of all the meats for $50) along with 2 empanadas ($5), one of the beef and one of the vegetarian kind. You get a 24 or 25 oz total of NY strip, flank, sirloin, ribeye, and filet mignon (we asked for medium rare, but some of the pieces were cooked a bit more well-done - no complaints here!).  You can dip the meats in 4 different sauces (the chimichurri sauce is honestly the best) along with a couple loaves of bread that is little bit too burnt for my liking. The empanadas were great (especially the beef empanada) but the vegetarian one is somewhat bland and may have needed some more flavoring.  Overall, a great experience and good place to bring a date. I recommend you come early to avoid a line (we went at around 4:30 - 5 PM on a weekday)

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas and Asado Plate

UFyayPb5rGFtqkPdS-fDNg.text: Overhyped? After walking past the restaurant many times, often seeing a line out the door, we finally had a meal there. The steaks (sirloin and ribeye) were well prepared. The roasted carrots were also good. The ordering process is deliberately slow to align with the preparation time. The result is a long queue in a cramped space. I have no complaints about anything that I ate. However, nothing was so good that I want to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted carrots
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The rules
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Large ribeye

7OkboJSQCLWvP5J4jctHWg.text: Came here on a Tuesday afternoon for lunch. Gaucho opens at 11:00AM, and I arrived at 10:55. I was second in line. The staff was great. They were extremely friendly and helpful.  For the food I ordered the Sirloin plate, and asked for medium rare. The meat was super tough to chew through which was disappointing but had great seasoning. I'd recommend trying all of there sauces that compliment the steak. Besides the meat being tough to chew everything was amazing!  Overall this place is a unique place for Pittsburgh and has a wide variety of Argentinian food. Dispite my meat being tough to chew through I will still return to try the rest of the menu due to the reputation of the restaurant for quality food, and quality customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sirloin Steak Plate
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sirloin Steak Plate

Y0fT9IVxSXIE62YAKCPoDg.text: This Pittsburgh place is an amazing find of exotic cuisine that is freshly prepared for reasonable prices. I'm definitely planning on going back again before leaving.   Mexican corn Steamed mussels Sauted shrimp in rosemary and garlic Large flanksteak Flan with blueberries and cantelope.  Drink  $60

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flank steak, shrimp, mussels, and corn.

bAvJkqYcua6JF0Scrgip0A.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants in the 'burgh.  If you're looking for a fancy meal, this ain't it, but the food is unreal. Make sure to go at an off-time - meaning, not at lunch time during the week or dinner on the weekend, or be prepared to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich

BVG4alLO-xBiaKCaIzhQhw.text: I had been eyeing this place since a brief trip over a year ago, but did not have time to wait in the line that wrapped around the block. Luckily, when I walked by most recently, there were only about 10 people waiting to get in. It was my lucky day!  The menu had so many wonderful options that it was hard to choose. I ultimately went with the 12oz "Vacio" sirloin plate, and it was amazing! I loved everything on that plate, from the fresh side salad, to the delicious toasted artisan bread, to the caramelized onions, and finally, to the star of the show - the steak, which was cooked medium as I ordered, with a nice char on the outside. There were a variety of sauces for the steak, but my favorite was the chimichurri sauce. It was nicely herby and garlicky, and its acidity complemented well with the steak.   This platter was definitely a lot of food for one person, but I was so hungry that I finished it. For dessert, I tried some alfajores - one vanilla and one chocolate. I've tried alfajores a few times before, and these were the best I've had! I believe they make them fresh.   The service was great - everyone on staff was so friendly and helpful. They really exuded warm Argentinian hospitality! With such great food and great vibes, I can definitely see why this is a crowd favorite in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Alfajores
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vacio (Sirloin) Platter

HwnwdaaKTeEnu64p7QfMeg.text: Absolutely amazing meal, the best we had while visiting Pittsburgh. Went on a Saturday around 1 and had to wait about 25 mins on the line before we got to order, totally worth it. We tried the sirloin steak platter (medium rare), the sweet and spicy sausages, empanadas, and a flan for dessert. The steak was amazing and perfectly cooked. The sauces are really fun to try and dip the steak in. Really loved the sausages, preferred the spicy ones. I got too full to even try to empanadas. The flan was just Okay, would skip this next time

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak platter (large)
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flan

KzsBxGlNL0aRuXdAIN3wuQ.text: Please open a location in Milwaukee!! This place was amazing!! I love how it can be an easy-going casual lunch or you could BYOB for a pricier dinner. The sauces were delightful; steak sandwich delightful; empanadas delightful. Anyone who comes to Pittsburgh I am suggesting that they come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak sandwich, all the sauces, empanadas

9DSzfxlIOzGR8ny12nYyNw.text: I dont know how I didn't rate this place before. This is one of my top 5 restaurants of all times. I'm so happy we got to go. The line was about 30 deep outside the restaurant. We attempted to go one day but we didn't want to wait in the long line so we came earlier... and I'm sooooo happy we did. The meat... the meat.... omg... I cant even tell yall how perfectly cooked it was. Juicy. Seasoned so well. The wood burning grill makes the steaks sooooooooooooo good.  Ive looked everywhere in DC, Maryland, TX -- and pretty much all the places I visit to see if there is anything like this place and I can't find anywhere... I  think I even looked up Los Ang-- and was  unable to find anywhere... I need to make this place apart of my regular eats... somehow... OWNERS-- COME BUILD ONE in TX!!   Also, despite the 30 deep that I saw on my way out... I'd wait in a line for this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Q6lU_tUv1QndN2SMxSg7RA.text: Worst service and host please do not go to this restaurant. They are liars and trash. Have no representation of Argentinian culture or people.  Please spit on them!!

BaTAAmgSCJJrFQ_9tIWXWw.text: I can't say enough about this place. I LIVE for empanadas and these are soooooooo good! The braised beef is....making me drool thinking about it now. Shrimp was perfect. And the house made chimichurri sauces are yum!  This place is always busy, as it should be because it's awesome. Plan to be patient. And enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas Rosemary Braised Beef Shrimp

BA1MxDm6bMx3LLLa0tYBMg.text: We flew into Pittsburgh as part of multi-cities driving trip. We only have one day here before we had to go to the next city. We thought the best way to know the city is to, yes..., go on the double-decker city bus tour.   The tour guide/bus took us to one of many neighborhood in Pittsburgh, including the street that Gaucho was on. It was around lunch time and the line to Gaucho was noticeably long! The wonderful smell of grilled meat emanated from Gaucho's building. My son and I decided to check it out for lunch.  By the time we finished our city tour, made it back to Gaucho, it was almost 3 pm. There was still a line, albeit shorter, to wait for a seat. The wait was absolutely worth it.  We ordered a salad and 6 empanadas. All were good. And we were absolutely stuffed. Our favorite were the beef empanadas.   Had we live in the area, I'd want to come back here often to try out other items in their menu!

d3WN13kInA-l1sAT9gbPrA.text: Food gets 5 Stars as long as you like meat!  However and not to be negative but line is long (1 hour with my 87 year old mother in law). They seem to cater to the young crowd only. No menu outside so people in line could have already decided. Too long to order.

4xFPYdx6dvrgMP3OrS2Xzg.text: When I went here, it was my first time having Argentinean steak, so I wasn't too sure what to expect. The first impressions weren't too great--lunchtime on a weekend made the already small place quite crowded, so there was little room to navigate or try to understand the somewhat confusing menu without getting in someone's way.   The menu was clear in what we could order, but the layout made it hard to read (especially the appetizers and veggies going down the side on the left) unless we were already in line, which wasn't optimal since we haven't decided on anything yet. As embarrassing as it was, we could not figure out the difference between the meats by themselves (was it just meat with nothing else?) and the steak sandwich (meat plus.. peppers and onions). And why were some of the pequenos just as expensive as the sandwiches...? We saw a lot of people going with grilled corn, which looked delicious, but we couldn't find it on the menu either (later we realized we could've just added it on). And an extra buck per vegetable on the sandwich?? Call me spoiled but a really nice suggestion would be to just create some combo orders that include something like a sandwich, a small dish, and a drink (water didn't seem to be an option btw).  Okay so we were probably mostly just being silly in failing to navigate the menu properly or get help, but we did end up with two quite delicious steak sandwiches of ribeye and skirt steak. Luckily we were able to find a table outside, and the steak did make up for the confusing experience at the beginning. It was juicy with a touch of char, and the entire sandwich was pretty tender. Next time we'll be sure to know what's going on and know what to order ahead of time.

iHip-vidkkBPtc3GxW4GpQ.text: Gaucho is the best restaurant in Pittsburgh. I am not speaking in hyperbole. I've been to almost all of the trendy restaurants in the city  (i.e. Eleven, butcher and the rye, salt, soba, etc.) and I would pick Gaucho each and every time. When I leave this great city I will come back to visit friends and gaucho. Try the steak sandwich with skirt or flank steak and some empanadas.

S2qow7u-Z02wBiW41qZpqg.text: Service was awesome. Food arrived to the table fast. We ordered a BUNCH of different stuff and shared. It was all delicious. A bit pricey (70 + tip for 3) but well worth it

am60C0Evkni_tLV931KcrQ.text: Incredible Flavor. Girlfriend and I had to stop in after seeing all the great reviews and it's all so True. The steak is extremely flavorful and tender (skirt steak sandwich). The best steak sandwich I can ever remember having. Great chimichurri sauce to. Girlfriend had the shrimp which was very fresh and you could taste the grilling which I find really nice. We also tried for apps the grilled vegetables and chorizo sausage. Everything was excellent. We will be back very very soon!!

aqp7txm8XWlnxQ3KnaQ8AQ.text: O. M. G. Best food I've eaten out in like forever. Terrific service too. Fun ambiance. You go here. You go here now.

4Ea0yawX8P7ICKinIqvqYQ.text: It took me awhile to get here because I thought it would not be vegan friendly - BUT I finally made it and the veggie sandwich is amazingly good! I also got a small salad which was perfectly fresh and delicious, though unnecessary because the sandwich was huge. I really love all the sauces they have available, too. The service really takes Gaucho Parilla over the top - so so so genuinely enthusiastic and friendly! The space is rustically cozy and the sandwiches are a bit messy; all part of the fun. Yep, this place is fun!

DZc4B9J_syC8H2dh8PD6MQ.text: Went for a Sat. family lunch, and Gaucho surpassed our high expectations, based on all the glowing reviews here. The "small" steak plates -- with salad & grilled bread -- are a great value, and our 9 y.o. devoured hers like a tiger. Mom loved her ribeye, and my hanger steak sandwich with roasted red peppers was perfect.  We split sides of patatas bravas & yellow rice, ideal for mopping up the juices.  Don't miss the salsas -- ajo and chimichurri were our favorites, but the pepper and the onion were both tasty & distinctive, too.  The staff were terrific (helpful with a dash of humor), and the snug indoor eating space (a handful of stools and some standing room) is fun if you're willing to be flexible & friendly.  We'll bring a bottle of tinto to take advantage of the BYOB policy next time!

ByzvqoQA917ur59iW-Y_Xw.text: Hear a lot about it and finally decided to try. Awesome food, service was great. Fast, helpful, and very willing to accommodate/change up their options. Would love to go back.

VRB_JZfQ7VZw2Btq1raxYA.text: AMAZING FOOD!!! Sauces were fresh and yummy. Would go every week if I ever moved to Pittsburgh!!!

2ttzndopDdZ6Jb5SMmptWg.text: After eating here today I now know why they are ranked #7 on America's top 100 by Yelp. I ordered the carne sandwich with a side of potatoes; both were very filling and the chimmi sauce really kicked it up a notch. It can be a little pricey, but it's definitely worth it. Between the extremely helpful service, cozy atmosphere, and great food, this is my new favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh!

f51pBaSl2ApyLSBf9HOJJQ.text: This place is great. I work nearby. They are extremely friendly on the phone as well as in person. The food is prepares in a timely manner. The food us absolutely delicious. I recommend the steak burger. I get carry out here in the reg. It's great to eat outside during the summer as well.

EBv43EukPOzappwPL2d9CQ.text: Man this place is good. I've been here several times and I've always had to wait at least 20-30 minutes. However, the wait is well worth it.  I haven't been disappointed with anything I've ordered and for what you get, the price is super reasonable. I will keep going back.

t5Lmi4id3nC-nxzBG-0bVw.text: I am a little confused as to why there are so many over-the-top excellent reviews for this restaurant.  This was my first visit today and I absolutely had to try it when so many people gave it a five star review.  It definitely is a hip, cool restaurant for the Pittsburgh scene and maybe that is what is clouding people's judgment.  The sandwiches were good but definitely not spectacular.  I has the pulled chicken which was more like pieces of chicken breast meat, definitely not pulled, which was a disappointment.  The Provoletta appetizer was o.k. but basically just melted cheese on top of toast, really nothing overly special.  The sauces that are provided for free were good but, again, nothing outstanding.    It was very pricey with a lunch for two costing $35.  Also, we grabbed the only two remaining seats in the place which were bar stools crammed in the hallway between the kitchen area and upstairs dining area.  Underneath the stools is stacked wood which makes this seating area awkward.  There is no place to stick your legs while eating so sitting sideways is somewhat mandatory.  Plus, my husband bummed his knees a couple of times off of the wood.  I'm not sure who's idea this was but they maybe should have rethought it.    I am glad that I went for the experience but won't be back.

Sty7qqEFD-307YGOFrGryQ.text: Truly incredible food.  Any of their meat dishes are excellent. The newly remodeled and re-opened space is beautiful and allows for indoor seating.

M5vDuzrMC5R6NVWcQRkg5Q.text: Super small place (fits seven people at best) their expanding next door early 2015 though! BYOB, no charge. I got the rib eye to go and was amazed.. Good portion sizes too. Definitely a place to try if not make a top spot once a month ;)

EcPE5r9GpzXKOlqEr_LFiw.text: The servers told us that they wouldn't take our order until our entire group had arrived. Since the plan was for part of the group not to eat, this made no sense. A different person in the group went up and ordered and we 'snuck through their defenses" We got the sandwiches and sat in the back room.  we pulled a few chairs together so we could all sit together. The owner / manager came over and took the chairs from our table to put them at an empty table next to us.  We took the chairs back and he took them from our table again.  We took some chairs from a different table, and for some reason, this seemed ok in his pea-brain and he stopped taking the chairs. After this, the food was pretty mundane. I had a steak sandwich that was sliced so thick, it was like eating a steak between two slices of bread. No one at the table was impressed witht he food, and the rude treatment topped it off. No way will we ever go back there.  There are lots of other sandwich shops  that are actually happy to take your money...

a9fu_TD0hooPNzWXUGqU3A.text: Absolutely delicious. We ate here for a rehearsal dinner and it was easily one of the best meals I have ever had in the city.  Service was fantastic, and the meat and potatoes were amazing.   Will definitely come back again!

VEUocJQIMtq0WXiTcesAtQ.text: If you were to relate restaurants to the human body, Gaucho would be the heart and soul.  It's kinda built out of the way, but you know you're there by the smell of firewood.  The place itself is small, but boy is the food and service great!  They brought the food straight to us, which is very nice considering I have a broken wrist at the moment.  We got two steak sandwiches, which was a mistake! Even though it is SUPER delicious, we couldn't finish it all! We also both got Cokes, which the cashier informed us was made in Mexico, so it was made with pure cane sugar and no HFCS. Man was it good!  We even felt the need to take a small cup of chimmichurri with us! Probably the best steak sandwich I have EVER eaten! If you need a place to eat, come to Gaucho Parrilla Argentina!

uYox0-ln94T-nHdh_zN4kQ.text: Amazing! There is really nothing I can say about this place that hasn't already been said. All I can do is agree with every single wonderful life changing sentiment. It's really that good. It must be owned by magical unicorns.

6spZgVsTIbK8jv-ynzM5vA.text: Str8 fire. Need to go there if you're in town or haven't been yet. Courteous staff, reasonable prices, great food. Try all the sauces!

DY1X_E-4PEeTWKxi1EZb9w.text: Best meat in the city. I usually always pick the skirt steak. The only downside is that it's quite small so there is usually a wait and not much seating. These guys should definitely expand their restaurant size -- they have plenty of customers to fill it up.

3VXju82HQOGSrVjXsE5UTg.text: Lives up to all the hype. Best sandwich I have ever had in my entire life. Just go there.

eOFe4QHacssZi6b2SmPx6g.text: So, so, so good. And now that they've expanded, you can actually sit in the restaurant (yay!) The patio looks awesome, but on our last visit we chose to sit inside. We had our 6-month-old with us, and the owner and wait staff were very welcoming. She loved the ribeye and braised beef, as did we. I see that this is the highest rated restaurant in Pittsburgh on Yelp, and deservedly so. It's fantastic.

BPftbTkGGsAZop0_ENmQjQ.text: Went for lunch on a Saturday and sat outside.  The food is well done while the atmosphere is a bit frenetic.  Grilled meats do not disappoint.  BYOB is a plus as we brought a nice bottle of Malbec.  It's a good place, but, as some contend, one of the best in town, not really.  But would definitely recommend.

SHEDnwrcL4R-yughwEREVA.text: My parents got steaks, I got the El Guacho salad. I like salads but this salad was really bad, it was just lettuce and oil and barely anything else. I didn't really want to eat it but it kind of seemed like a move-it-along place so I didn't want to take it back. My parents steaks were really good although they where on teeny tiny plates. I know everything else there is probably better than the salad I got but I'm not really dying to go back.

oC0IU-al9VscusJDfxG2uQ.text: great food, people, and atmosphere. If you truly want to enjoy every bit of it i would suggest only going during the week. On the weekend it is just way too busy and if it's your first time it may be a bit confusing and you may not get the full experience.

K5gKWN2OmWXAbaTaFjiF3A.text: if I can, I will eat Gaucho everyday. EVERY DAY! the steak burger is out of the world! for 10 bucks, i'm the happiest person on this planet. after the renovation, they have introduced some new dishes. I have tried Parrilloda Mixta and the potato salad. they are both really yummy! it's definitely one of the best restaurants in pittsburgh.

7YiCfxJBj549Q4EfvPqRcQ.text: A friend and I stop down for a Saturday lunch the wait was a little long (30min) the line was out the door however, the food was excellent. I will definitely go again; the sandwich was on thick sour dough bread and they were very generous with the meat portions. Fantastic Argentinian food!!!

SqdR9Qe_R4I6yNSQ9c1wUg.text: It is hard to open your mouth wide enough to fit the sandwich!! GREAT authentic food.... My son said it was his FAVORITE place that I took him to eat on our international, gastronomic tour of the Burgh..
