8oTVYz0_Cm3ICWeZN5YrHg.text: This place is awesome!!! Best place for steaks in Pittsburgh. I got a filet mingon sandwich and it was done perfectly. The seasoning that they use on their meats is great. They use a lot of rosemary which adds a lot of flavor. I only wish that they were open later during the week and I wish that they were open on Sundays.

AaJka40GCdqeYrAs0Sm-_w.text: Cant say enough about this gem in the strip. If you want a great sandwich that is done correctly go to Gaucho Parrilla Argentina. Everything is done over the smoky fire pit they use in the kitchen. The owner a young gentlemen who works the customers in the front of the house is extremely knowledgeable and is a complete pleasure to talk to. I came into this amazing place on sat morning before they opened and hung out and talk to employees for a second and got a good feeling about the place. I took the advice of one of the cooks and got the Flank Sandwich with roasted peppers on a chibata  roll and was AMAZING, The thin stacked meat was cooked perfectly and just feel apart when biting into it. The meat was smoky but not overly smoky and could sill taste the Beef. The sauce they put on it was out of this world. Over All I give it 2 thumbs up. I cant wait to go back. Matter of fact may be going back today!

x3A77HQm17eKc9wvY2-p6g.text: Like a previous reviewer, I too put off trying Gaucho for fear of not having any vegan options. Turns out there are at least three on the menu, no modifications necessary. It tastes as great as it smells. Very helpful and very sweet staff. Amazing sauces, too. Will return!

j30I5773dCN5-6--mNYhBQ.text: A group of 6 of us decided to try this for lunch today. The owner was enthusiastic and gave us a great run down of the menu and what everything was. I had the pollo sandwich with pulled chicken, mushrooms, potatoes, and onions on a focaccia type bread. The bread was delcious and the sandwich alone was enough to fill me up. Most of the other people in our group also got sandwiches and also said they were great along with the grilled corn. Someone got a salad and added shrimp to it. She said the shrimp and dressing were delicious. My only complaint/observation about this place is that there is very limited seating. There is almost no seating inside, so while it was great to eat on their patio during August, I'm not sure how much business they will do in the winter months. I think the food is great and the employees and service was exceptional, I just hope they can find a way to keep it running without seating in the winter.

alSLOmsxOg3uZWCSISqCSg.text: Best place in the Burgh by far! Food is amazing and the flavor is just as good (if not better) than the restaurants I visited in Argentina.  Not only is the food great, the staff is awesome as well. If you haven't tried it yet, this one is must visit.

dA4vt9WJ5MSjW_EbQaA4HQ.text: What can be said that hasn't been said already.  Great staff, great owner, and excellent food.  Try to time your visit outside of the peak hours if you don't want to be in the crowds.  Can't wait for the weather to warm up so I can sit outside.   I walk all the way from downtown to the strip for lunch even in the winter for the sandwiches and now I have the office hooked.  Bring a bottle wine or a six pack and enjoy.

S-C0uV6qhEg7lf_YEtBjFA.text: What a wonderful place to catch in the strip district! When in Pittsburgh this is a must have stop. You will always hear the typical if having the Pittsburgh staple Primanti sandwich but this is also one heavy delicious sandwich. I had the ribeye sandwich with grilled corn and it was the best steak sandwich I've ever had. The employees there are also wonderful! Very friendly and fun atmosphere. It is a small location but if you can catch a seat outside then I would recommend  to do so.

Eb7KjoHFPmbyNewQU9A1sA.text: Wouldn't have known about it if it wasn't for Yelp. Believe the hype. This place kicks serious butt. I'd drive hours out of my way to eat here again. The skirt steak is to die for the homemade sauces are ridiculous.

_MDK1OfbGJR2a8ZYTf4CVQ.text: We ate there on Aug 31st and it was phenomenal. The sauces, the meats, the sides, boom.  It was great.  I do not recommend wearing overly nice clothing as the deliciousness drips off the sandwich and can easily get on you.  The staff was very friendly and helpful with questions on the menu choices.  I anticipate they will need a larger location very soon. Well done.

avBqoly3tiq9JIcL2fHctQ.text: Want to know how to cook steak? Take a lesson from these guys. The steak sandwich here was excellent, I loved the chimichurri sauce, the bread, the whole thing. Only complaint is it could have been a bit bigger OR less expensive. Also, I wish there were things on the menu in general that were more lunch prices than dinner prices. For non red meat eaters, they also serve a tilapia sandwich. I went back one day to try and get more of that delicious beef in my mouth, but alas though the place was supposed to be open, I (along with other surprised customers) found it closed. It's a pretty serious pet peeve of mine, going somewhere and thinking it will be open but it's not. It's pretty unprofessional, yet many places here do it. I am sure there were reasons etc. and I didn't starve to death since Vietnam's Pho is nearby and a pork sandwich there is half the price and also good, I just went there. But just a note to businesses: your customers notice when you are not open during your regular hours!

Sl2fZfVKTnaf88x0MW1-wA.text: Stopped in to Gaucho while walking around the strip. You cannot resist the wood fired smell as you pass by. The service is friendly at this small amazing Argentinian cafe. Wood- fired grilled steaks, chorizo and seafood, sandwiches , small bites and entrees. Help yourself to 4 unique sauces and a lot of great food. Don't miss Gaucho

B1aLtyWEcVlEp0RavA3D4Q.text: As Michael L. noted, it is quite uncommon for a restaurant with 50+ reviews to have a 5-star rating; after my recent visit I understand why Gaucho Parilla is in this rarefied air. There's not much I can add that hasn't already been said by other reviewers, so I'll just say that their steak sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I've had in my long and illustrious sandwich-eating career. How such a small, ordinary kitchen produces such extraordinary food is beyond me. Just writing this review is making me hungry, so I'll end it now before I get drool all over my nice work shirt.

rVF56Yo5A5T1wW4Bw64sug.text: Stopped in for dinner and at first I was a bit unsure of what I had gotten into. The decode is interesting with a huge menu up on the wall with a short walk to the counter. There isn't really anywhere to give the menu a wince over and make your choices. That however is the only negative I encountered. The staff, when we ordered we're super nice and helpful. We were shown a table and went to gather our extra plates and tableware. The floor staff made sure our drinks were filled and knew our name for the order to be delivered. When the food arrived it was perfectly cooked, I got the 5 steak option. All seasoned great with perfect char and tender. Wee has the potatoes with roasted garlic cloves , so good. Mushrooms and risotto both were hard to stop eating. There was also pulled pork at the table that was enormous and absolutely excellent. Ended with the chocolate cyan cookie... wow was that good. Really glad we went here and will absolutely go back.

hP_yAwxju35Fv8Eu3kuHkw.text: Today was our first time here and from the service to the food to the decor of the tiny place we give it 5 stars! This is a must visit if you are in Pittsburgh. I highly recommend the con pan Carne with skirt steak! Yum

SWOIxxK0_mQWI10cvhGIAA.text: So much hype that it was VERY hard to get my husband to go with me.  The silence as we devoured our steak sandwich said it all.  The hype is True... the food is amazingly delicious.

QN4W7Xg9V5QKXqfWHCz4rA.text: Honestly, this has got to be the best restaurant in pittsburgh. The meat is flavorful and just perfect. The sauces are incredible and make you lick your fingers. The bread is divine! My only problem is the lack of seating, reservations, or some smooth run system. You may wait 45 minutes (or more) in line just to order and wait even longer to get a table. Take out is not always a possibility :( Gaucho, expand!! This place will become a Pgh staple pretty soon.

jmSVnzCXcNWJ1ODuhodmGw.text: Not much to say that hasn't already been said here.  Outstanding food, great service, fun atmosphere.  Prices are a little steep but the amount of flavor packed in each meal is well worth it.  Awesome little joint.

6GBZi4Wm7YHe8jr66aPRhw.text: I wish there was a 0 star score.  I wouldn't feed this to my dog, if I had one.  I got a pulled chicken sandwich.  First three bites had a chicken bone in each bite- one piece was nearly an inch long.  Then, there's the charred-beyond-all-recognition things (maybe onions??) in the sandwich.  Further examination showed undercooked (pink) pieces of chicken.  How they scorched some of it and undercooked some of it is quite a mystery.   Unfortunately, I got my food to go, so I can't complain there.  If you want to risk it, eat there and examine your food carefully before you bite in.     I have a picture of the mess, if I can figure out how to upload.

esGVqrSf4e41RFDFZ25FCA.text: Helpful friendly staff great food very much a step above the short rib AP is hands down perfect for a warm summer afternoon

f7_Y9QX3bKzvoYGJRKEmSw.text: We went to Pittsburgh to visit our daughter and her husband. They took us to Gaucho's for lunch. Although meat is their specialty, I was more in the mood for a salad. I had a roasted veggie salad which was excellent. If you're having the salad for a meal, make sure you get a large. There wasn't much seating so go when it won't be crowded or get your meal to go. Everyone else got pork, beef or shrimp. My hubby got a pork sandwich. I had a bite and it was really good too. This place is really popular and is expanding soon. The ppl who owned the place and who worked there seemed like they were very happy to be there. That always makes for a good dining experience.

xUlNEMYG9lVj7UKqpIIDKg.text: Went at 1230 on a Friday.  I was not in a hurry, but if you are call ahead.  The place has some character to it which I really enjoyed.  I got the steak sandwhich (ribeye).  It was very good, as well as the ciabatta bread.  I also got a side of the potatoes.  They were slightly above average, as the rosemary was somewhat overpowering.  I will be back again and will likely try them empanadas (sp?) and a different cut of meet.  I would give it 3.5 but they get the benefit of the doubt.

mqrrpa2DMsfOMfsTV5kQGw.text: Just super. We were visiting Pittsburgh for the weekend and tried this place the first night. The steak was so amazing we went back the next day for lunch. All 5 cuts are well worth the money.

WKh0D_wbKHOobAMhu4QrcA.text: Good food. Steak sandwiches of all kinds with good sauces. Employees are jerks though. One big bald guy tried to run me over outside, and by the time I go to the front of the line, guess who was putting his apron on? Not just that one encounter though. Aside from a great sandwich, all you get here is attitude. Granted, it is a pretty great sandwich...

vr32lYzENJrICXhj2zGyPw.text: Great ambience. Friendly, knowledgable staff. Fast service. I tried the El Gaucho, which was delicious but I must confess kind of small for $10 that I paid for it (ordered the large). Will definitely go back. I can't wait to try the steak!

zCR5-QszCTP6gxTaw64G5Q.text: This place was incredible!!! Definitely get the rosemary braised beef (especially if you like horseradish) and the surf and turf was great!!! The shrimp was cooked perfectly and flank steak was excellent. All four of their sauces went great with the meat and shrimp, I especially liked the chimichurri sauce! Really friendly staff and it's BYOB!!! Bring some extra beer (or whiskey) for the staff there and they will treat you right!!! Overall, great experience and I will definitely coming back!!!

cKEQwRrWQJxq7ZZSmX_7vA.text: I loved Gaucho Parilla! The rosemary beef was really good and with a little sauce, it was amazing. Easily the best food I've had since moving to Pittsburgh in 6 months.

xGPpT_GeTCxKYEKPfR0m6A.text: Food is pretty good. Went with friends and am vegetarian. Had the veggie sandwich and potato empanadas. Good bread, veggies were grilled and a bit soggy, so I removed some. Empanadas were more bland than preferred, but they offer delicious sauces to add a kick to them. Friendly staff and services. I would try something else going back.

acbsk3w156Ygvs3jFMaBtw.text: Wow! Where do I start? Great food and seasoned well! Great service! Permanti Bros is great, but gaucho is top notch! Highly recommend while in strip district!

RqFazIAh3Br25SRmlnPs3Q.text: Loved this joint! Really nice staff there and always yummy food!

Vcp6tyEH0kKq-gsl3g0U6w.text: Food was awesome. Seating was very limited, and the ordering process wasn't the most efficient.

3hIN15hIaYzgMKct0NY0Pg.text: Hands down best food in pittsburgh.  Fresh and high quality ingredients. I got the Argentino salad with a side of toast. Must try the chimmichurri sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Argentina salad with shrimp

HuJpVP_edWn7ovQVjUTMrw.text: Wow I've not had a better sandwich in a long time.   The bread is soft and delicious. It's not one of those sandwiches you need to fight with to get the job done ... it just cooperates! Your teeth slice right through but it's not mushy ... it's just perfect.   The meat is flavored/marinated all the way through. And the wood fired grill makes anything they throw on it taste delicious.   And the sauces! My goodness they are to die for. Try every single one. Chimichurri is of course a winner, but favorite is the white garlic one!   Bonus: I love the fact that they achieve super savory and flavorful food without tons of mayo and cheese. (At least the cheese is optional.) I love that most things are olive oil/herb/garlic based.   We ordered the chicken with a side of grilled vegetables which was obviously tasty, and I hope to get back to try the steak.   Disclaimer: If you are looking for a place for sit down service this is not for you! It's a small cozy space with a few stools inside and tables outside and you order at the register. I can't wait to get down when the weather is nicer!

bJTRSBWhttzeAD5x3t1XGg.text: This place was phenomenal!! I went with my friend and her mom and we all got different things and shared and everything was so delicious. Very filling without being too heavy. And I thought it was pretty reasonably priced. Definitely worth the wait!! Can't wait to go back!!

rPoMaiB0Haq3WhJAS4YyVQ.text: If I could eat here everyday I would. I studies abroad in Argentina and this place is as close you can get to argentine food without actually being there. Their empanadas are the best! It's great that's it's byob and you can take your favorite argentine wine to pair with the food. My only complaint is their is always a line so be prepared to wait a bit to order. You can open your wine and enjoy while you are waiting though.

nFrP_b8lldbTuWDNA87VlQ.text: Absolutely love this place!!  Even for the non-meat eater you have options.  Mikey, the manager is always friendly and in a very good mood.  The food is fantastic and the portions and price are fair.  Make sure you have your entire party together before going since you order in a line and then pick out a table, instead of table service.

cmHqJZljog_Z-0vhif48sg.text: Ahhhh so worth waiting in the line. Great atmosphere and super friendly staff. I got an order of the lamb and went up to order seconds. Portions were smaller than I expected but so delicious I did not mind having to get up and get more.

owr-NlXRav4zv7nu2kMV1w.text: Beautiful food. Beautiful space. Wonderful service.  Absolutely awesome concept- Argentinian meats/sandwiches/salads. We got the steak sandwich with flank (you get to chose your cut) for $12 and the rosemary beef brisket with horseradish $10 and roasted corn on the cob $2.  -Steak sandwich was impeccable- amazing bread, chimichurri, high quality meat with a char that I'll be drooling about for days and deliciously grilled veggies.  -Brisket sandwich was also tasty- my only complaint was that I wish there was about 3x the amount of horseradish sauce. I was so into that sauce, y'all.  -Corn on da cob was amazing! Grilled to perfection and served with the husk.   HUGE portions as well.  I loved my experience here. I will be rushing back!

EzgCIz6MNJbGZoSL_ydILw.text: Wow. Absolutely delicious food at great prices. The carne sandwich was awesome --  filet mignon, chimi sauce, onions, and peppers stuffed into a ciabatta. Service is very fast and friendly. They have good looking veggie options here, too. If you're in Pittsburg, you should come here.

55cXICrhWJqcKxEhd5FYBQ.text: I will preface this review by saying that I am an Ohio girl giving something in the Burgh 5 stars. On that fact alone, everyone should go...it is that good! And i you come here, you too will realize that there is no other rating you can give Gaucho's. From the smell alone when you walk in the door, you know you are about to have a good time.   Upon entering in from the rain, we were greeted very warmly by almost everyone that worked there. As we were deciding what to order, they happily walked us through everything on the menu to help us make good selections since unfortunately, you can't actually eat everything on the menu....but you will want to!  We got the skirt, the rib-eye, the shrimp, mixed veggies, and corn - and every single thing was OUTSTANDING. I didn't realize that I hadn't taken the obligatory "food photo" until the plates were already empty (oops, sorry yelpers!)   Pro tip: you might be tempted to overlook it, but make sure to get an ear of corn. I know it sounds simple, but it is amazing...and you too will not believe you when they tell you there is no butter on it! It's also BYOB, but make sure you bring some to share!

c248XGNSHY9TH7QBgcFiYw.text: The immediate and subsequent surprises you experience when visiting Gaucho Parrilla are more than enough to warrant the five stars that this place has so deservingly received.  I'd heard tell of this place from a few friends, but for some reason when I hear 'sandwich shop' and 'the strip' I can only imagine Primanti Brothers. Sadly that image isn't as appetizing to me is it may be to other Pittsburghers.  Nonetheless, on a whim, my wife and I decided to drop in here to see what's up and it has since completely rewritten the aforementioned image.   Gaucho is the sandwich shop that the-city-that doesn't-need-another-sandwich-shop needed.   For starters, the wood fired grill is expertly manned and the resulting meat and veggie creations are tender and flavorful.   For enders, the guys running the joint are super friendly and seemingly unflappable -- even in the face of a line out the door during a Saturday lunch rush.  Great food, sweet vibe, and friendly service. What more do you want. Stop wasting your money on sub-par, unhealthy sammies.

RwkIBrgYusLJNh0QKfiWxw.text: The wait kinda sucked...1.5 hour wait...but totally worth it the food was freakin amazing!! Next time, I'll bring a six pack for the wait. Believe the hype!!

AE6bCUFcnVgezr_zhyQ2rg.text: My absolute favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. Great wood fired food, BYOB, and decent prices.

5MpU_9zNyqGfnFZG_pjWrw.text: I've been to Guaucho twice now for lunch, once with my fiance and most recently this past Tuesday with my father.  The inside of this restaurant is quite small and probably seats only around 10 people with seating for 15 or more outside next to the restaurant.  There's not too many decorations inside either although there is a chalkboard menu which you can order from and then on a center table there is an area where you can grab your utensils or serve yourself any of their four sauces.  Both of the times that I was at Gaucho I ended up ordering the Carne for my entree.  The Carne is their steak sandwich which allows you to choose between one of the 5 cuts of steak that they serve and that comes with roasted red peppers and onions on a nice ciabbata roll.  The first time that I was there I ordered the skirt steak but I heard the owner mentioning this last time that it is no longer on the menu and has been replaced by the hangar steak.  So this last time I ended up choosing the rib-eye as the cut of steak that I wanted.  As with all of the meat that I have tried here it had the wonderful wood smoked flavor to it.  My only complaint about it is that it was a bit tougher than I expected and so made for some hard chewing.  We also ended up ordering the large portion of vegetables which I have had both times that I have visited now.  They consist of onions, roasted red peppers, zucchini and asparagus. Surprisingly, this ended up producing my favorite part of the meal as the roasted red peppers have a great natural sweetness to them and when combined with the sweet balsamic drizzle on top, makes for the perfect counterpoint to the wood-smoked flavor.  Honestly, I could probably eat those red peppers all day.  The rest of the vegetables were good as well and most had a hint of the smokiness but none came close to what the peppers absorbed.  My dad was also a big fan of the bread, both the ciabatta that my sandwich came on and also the crostini-like object that came with his meal.  He really enjoyed dipping them into a few of the four sauces that they have laid out for you to taste and even passed up eating more steak to dip some more bread.  The bottom line for me is that I would definitely come back here again in the future.  While it has a downside of only being open 10-7 Tuesday-Saturday and also is small, it is well worth the trip to the Strip District.  Their food is pretty amazing and I especially love the smoky flavor on everything that comes out of Gaucho.

IVfoKPxS0lqCzhDPm1gJ9g.text: It's 2014, right? The experience with a restaurant begins when you look online. Outdated menu, no menu, shitty website.. your anticipation drops. Restaurants: if we have to wait for approval on email reservation "requests", forget about it. This seems comparatively more common in Pittsburgh than DC, Baltimore.. Use opentable or have a person answering the phone.  My first minute with Gaucho..  1) Look up ph# on yelp 2) Phone rings 3 times, get a real person. 3) "GAUCHO!" "What are your hours?" "11-7" "We'll be by later" "Ok. Byob BROTHER!"  I'm already smiling about my meal. Haven't seen the place yet. That's how it's done.  Roll in to the 12-seat spot and the smoky fire hits your nose immediately. You salivate. Your eyes drift across the orange paint and sparse-yet-rustic decorations that give off the gaucho vibe. The wood is stacked high. Orders are placed at the register where friendly service awaits with recommendations and attention.  Food takes a while, the scent teasing you. The oily chorizo app arrived with sandwiches, should have come first. That's about all I can complain about. The chorizo is salty and awesome, if needing some grain mustard though the accompanying toast cuts it. The skirt steak sandwich (got talked out of the ribeye) was INTENSE. Delicious char, perfect temps and medium-rare without request. The house chimi drips onto your plate alongside the healthy dose of onions and peppers, which are all-pro except lightly soft. The bread borders the crunch/soft levels perfectly.   Seriously, best steak sandwich in Pittsburgh. Maybe ever.

HfsyAfyPKVtrARVeOnUTeg.text: Absolutely amazing food.  We were lucky enough to get there when it wasn't super busy and were able to get a table.  I had the chicken sandwich and it had an amazing smokey flavor and was very juicy.  Definitely will come back.

TTNq6mqsBxVmqfWjz6zEcg.text: I could live without red meat. Chicken and fish, I need, but not red meat. So this review is partly mine and partly my devoted carnivore boyfriend's...  The meat is really tender and seasoned really well. We've had the lomo (filet) with chimichurri, the flank steak with some pepper sauce, and the lomo sandwich. They were all really good. The only issue for me is that the cooking temperatures are not very consistent. I ordered a dish of lomo and my boyfriend ordered a lomo sandwich and mine was medium rare and his was well done... maybe between medium-well and well. He will eat any meat, but I am pretty strictly a medium to medium-well person, so the medium rare was way too raw for me.   He also usually gets a side order of the potatoes and I get the grilled bread. I love that grilled bread. I would install that grill in my home just so I could paint bread with olive oil and grill it like they do.   The guys who work at Gaucho Parillla are total hipsters, but really friendly guys. We've gone around closing before and they've walked out (to smoke? chat? get some air?) and said "don't steal anything while we're gone!" and just walked out for a few minutes.   Now, I just asked my boyfriend "what do you want me to say about the Gaucho place?" as he has been urging me to write a review. He said "best meat ever" and "it's wonderful" and when I said "why?" (looking for more details), he said "psht. What do you mean why? You know why!" So he's not very helpful, but definitely a fan, so take that as you will.   Tip: It's BYOB and the nice guys cooking your meat would enjoy a beer from your 6-pack.

PHowEqkXXL4DNMA_USEekg.text: Lost a star due to the setup. You walk in, get in line (sometimes out the door), order at a counter, then have to find free-for-all seating while your meal is prepared. Pretty annoying set up when it's crowded. Would have 5 stars if it was traditional restaurant service.  Menu could also be more descriptive. One of my party thought they were getting some kind of fries and we got something more like potato salad.  Aside from that, everything was fantastic. Got the lamb and it was cooked pretty rare (which they warn you about and which I was okay with) but it had a nice char and amazing flavor. Other people I was with both got the ribeye option, which was also fantastic, and had a fantastic char, providing the right amount of crisp.  A nice little touch was the side/dipping sauces they provide. There's a garlicy/softrito style sauce that's out of this world.

vV-jSv63EE_SRhDFt4WJ2Q.text: I don't know if there's a better place in Pittsburgh to eat red meat. This place is wonderful. The inside is small and isn't truly "sit down" (though there are a few places to sit/stand), the patio next door does provide seating and is a great place to eat some meat. Added bonus: it's BYOB, and the staff is always a pleasure.  The steak samplers are the way to go with sides of potatoes, corn on the cob, mushrooms, and/or vegetables. The lazy susan with their sauces is amazing and they are all delicious. We've had less luck with the sandwiches, which are still good, but I thought the rosemary braised beef had too much meat / was too soggy and needed a crunchy ingredient, such as pickled onions or arugula. I also though the empanadas were a little ho-hum.  My biggest wish is that they'd extend their weekend hours later!

azS9uAXDkGpRGg4IvlqD7A.text: OUTSTANDING. This trendy little place lived up to the hype and was the highlight of my trip to Pittsburgh.   For $12-20 you'll enjoy a prime cut of phenomenal steak, served with a deliciously simple salad and bread. Our first bites had my buddy and I shaking our heads in disbelief. Soooo good. The chimchurri sauces (4 different kinds) are simple, fresh and wonderful; these are a MUST to get the full spectrum of flavor.  Brand-wise, these guys are doing everything right. They've shown a lot of attention to detail, from the sleek wooden plates to the chalkboard walls and hand-stamped take-out bags.   My favorite part, however, was the staff. They were COOL AS #*(%. We came in on off-peak hours and pretty much the whole kitchen greeted us. The manager was obviously as passionate about food as he is about the restaurant. He energetically talked us through the whole menu and spent a good 10 minutes giving us the scoop on other great restaurants when we asked for local recommendations.   Seriously loved Gaucho's.

rmSUo8yqR7NoCVm_BYIp_w.text: My new fav restaurant! Not for everyone, though.  The only seating is a ledge around the outside of the small room.  There are a few stools.   The food is incredible!  Rosemary beef sandwich... Yum.   Chorizo... Tasty.   Greens, very good.  I really did start to crave more the next day...  I only regret I didn't bring any beer for the staff :)

3ICHS3Y9X3bMRLm7OPJVHg.text: Fabulous! Loved the iced yerba mate tea, sirloin, potatoes and empanadas. The sauce Station was wow. Left with some alfajores to go. Great service and amazing food. Wish I lived in Pittsburgh. If I ever visit I'll definitely be coming back!

aEt6OS5p_TZ5Bw2MI_HGiA.text: Any place that calls vegetables and other green stuff grass, has to be fun. When I walked in I thought this is an gimmicky type place. You know I don't like Chucky cheese you don't go there for the food. However, everything I happened to have Will bring me back when I'm back in Pittsburgh.  I enjoyed the lamb cooked medium rare with some grass. LOL I also had a beefy empanada that I think was prepared right before they brought it to me and was not sitting in the back waiting to be warmed up. It was crispy on the outside yummy, juicy and delicious on the inside. Accompanied with the choice of sauces that they have this place is phenomenal.  I did enjoy the fun atmosphere. That also is why it only has four stars. A bit strange for the cost of the food. The quality of the food is definitely worth the price even with the strange set up.

jtt97RXmK0KahKau2FxncQ.text: Sandwich and salads so good that they're addictive!!! The line usually out the door but so worth the wait!!!

9b_lCqfvVkFND_NGVzMITQ.text: How long has this place been hiding in plain sight in the Strip District??? I had just crossed over the 16th St bridge and bam! There it was. The line was to the door, so I walked around a bit before coming back around 2:30 on a Wednesday. Very small line at that time.  The menu is a bit huge and overwhelming, but I decided pretty quickly on the Carne sandwich. What I was not prepared for was the cashier then asking me to choose between a whole list of meat cuts. I selected the filet, and I'm glad I did.   This steak was tremendous. It made me question why I only eat steak 2-3 times per year. It made me question my whole life. Cooked medium, it was like biting through soft butter. Excellent feel, excellent flavor. The bread had the right amount of interior softness and exterior crunch, and I'm always a fan of caramelized onions (next time I'll probably ask for extra). The sandwich also came with one lone, small pepper right in the middle, and some sauce.  Get to the Strip and eat a sandwich that's not Primanti's.

kUBSfyNIarZn2HUAHPsXZQ.text: I am in love with Gaucho.  I have to get the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich every time I go. Please never take it off the menu!  Nothing should stop you from sampling this sweet deliciousness. The reviews speak for themselves.

1HvhgzwWK02ztLFyGjvMqA.text: Never disappoints ( except the long lines outside ). Always an excellent go to with vegetarian options available in addition to delicious perfectly cooked meat options as well.

YRjlo3gul-1J1nROHvJ6ig.text: Gaucho is awesome! Wish they'd build another location. There is always a line out of the door and for a good reason. The food is exceptionally flavorful. Get one of the steaks, and try a couple of different menu items. I also really liked the empanadas and the vegetables. It takes patience to wait in that line, but you won't regret it.

sp2D0szmuZXoK76EYW80MQ.text: I can see why this place has so many reviews. The steak was just meaty perfection especially dipped in the abundant garlic and chimichurri sauces. The empanada was okay. We tried the chicken chorizo. I loved the cauliflower side dish too. We got the hanger steak and the sirloin steak and it came with salad and charred bread and the heavenly sauces.

TfMsF9mPYPuDTKNu7OD-7Q.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh.  You have to try the amazing grilled meats here.  I ordered the sampler of 5 different types of steak.  The Sirloin was my favorite.  They have 4 different types of homemade, authentic Argentinian sauces.  The red sauce and the chimichurri were my favorite.  They are BYOB, so bring a bottle of wine and try their food.  You will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Asado Sampler with 5 different types of steak.  It was amazing!!

Smagq2MwnvSVm5R7BtkKyg.text: Not worth the hype (and waiting in line). The food is good, but it feels like a high end Panera with nicer ingredients. I have no complaints about the food, but everything is just so pricey for what they are.

UXfDEYy6yS8OogK4pgbqog.text: Good good and great service. Busy place so you may have to wait for a short time. The food is worth the wait.

i5BnVNZrf1d2iELY6IL5pg.text: The food was amazing.  I'm here for a conference and stumbled upon this gem of a restaurant. It's a must try. You do have to wait in line and then they seat you. There was a young lady that came out and went through the line to answer questions.  It made the time fast and honestly I didn't mind after the amazing food was presented   I had the beet salad with shrimp, empanada and roasted cauliflower. It was all amazing. The food is prepped per order.  My co worker had a steak that he said was awesome.  It's a must try. Be patent it's worth the wait.

uq9A_7NRmpBkPPsAMEbi-A.text: One word: YUM. Bring a bottle of wine and come here. The food is FABULOUS!

KFdWpGzJyBiIrmhsVLEjLQ.text: What can I add to the other reviews? What a great restaurant. Everyone I talked to loved their meals. I had the Cerdo (pork) plate with a Papas Dulce side. The small plate was more than enough for me and had wonderful tastes. Don't miss this Argentine treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

F9UYCEapUo0KCPug7s2U_Q.text: After much hype and reading the reviews, I decided to go here with my friends for. A nice Friday evening out. To be honest, it was disappointing. We were there early, and I always wondered why there was a line out the door. The reason being that you order and pay up front and hope they have a table. The menu is a giant chalkboard that is kind of hard to read. We luckily were one of a few groups there so we didn't have any trouble.   We got 3 entrees for 3 people. The Large Shrimp, Pork Chop, and the Lamb Shank. We did not get any drinks, sides: or apps. Our total bill before tip $55.00. Now after paying that much, sitting at the table, and getting the sauces. Our food came. The pork chop was a nice portion size that came with a little salad. The lamb shank was a small size that came with some orzo, and the shrimp. 10 little shrimp. Was the food tasty---yes. Was it worth the money? That's another story.  Now listen, I cook a variety of dishes regularly. I' m a novice baker. I'm a foodie and appreciate great tasting food. I understand that portion sizes may be smaller at some places. I have paid for small portions and felt that it was worth the money. But for $18 and to get 10 shrimp that is supposed to be an entree (aka main course)--no matter how good is disheartening. Everyone of us was not satisfied. We all left hungry.   In short--expect a wait, expect to drop a pretty penny, and don't order the shrimp.

XgBWhMu6n-WZwEtKIM8MRA.text: Fantastic food coming from a Texan. The Qui Qui Chicken and shrimp was delicious. The customer service is on point. Everything about this place makes me want to fly back to the lame Steelers nation just to eat at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

lZpRgaaV1QkUUAylGi_FDw.text: Love this restaurant! The grilled meats, veggies, salsas, tostados are very good.  The indoor decors are festive and colorful.  Get the Parillada Mixta, a sampler plate of meats. The meat empanadas are best!  The salsas are great, especially the Ajillo one.  There is always a long line to be seated, so be patient, or come in at non-peak hours.

UFSB2XJEaGFROKVQxnLfow.text: Guacho has one of the best steak sandwiches in Pittsburgh. They serve authentic Argentinian cuisine in a hip, casual setting. This particular time I ordered the Argentino salad with ribeye, and a side of provoletta. All of our food came out in a timely matter and everything was delicious, especially the ribeye. Their friendly staff, cool setting & delicious menu make this restaurant one of the best in the Strip. I can't wait to come back and try more of their incredible food options--although it will be hard to switch up my order when the steak is so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3kPRC7c5PvmeVFg3XEIYKA.text: It's so worth the wait in line! Delicious!   (Also.. Please open another spot with parking as it's so hard to find a place to park near your Strip location)

gU3sHSwvg93K5xuPR7JJIg.text: Great food and friendly staff! I recommend coming a little earlier than when you want to eat as the wait is a bit and there is no reservation mechanism. Once you've order though food comes out quick! Definitely recommend!

E2UcyTutzWPHz5wBYTBVNg.text: I have to start by saying I did not like how they tell you to know what you want when you get to the counter, no menus outside so that you can figure that out. That almost made me pick a different restaurant.  I don't like carrying my drinks to the table.  And I don't like a TIP jar at the register.  How do you know if you are going to TIP 20% before you have received service. But then I took my first bite.  I am hooked.  My husband and I ordered the empanadas, cauliflower, green beans, beef with rosemary, and the pork sandwich.  We shared everything.  Every single bite was delicious.  It was way too much food for the two of us.  But we managed to eat every bite.  It was that good.  I will definitely be a return customer.

FYXYGDx0QzrcrVNhvBONWQ.text: This was quite possibly the best lunch we have ever had! The line to get in on a child, rainy Saturday morning was not too bad, the menu was easy to follow and quite impressive, and the staff were very welcoming! They even ask if you have questions before you order and one guy showed us a picture of one of the meals! We could tell they are all proud of where they work! On to the food! The roasted pork was one of the most delicious things I have ever put in my mouth and the sausage (spicy) was delicious as well with the red peppers and onions. We would go here again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZsNolhWKSaC71FXoqVy2lA.text: Ate here on a trip to Pittsburgh for work.  The service was great, food was even better.  Only minus for me was that they don't sell any alcohol.  You walk in and stand in line in front of their huge menu on a chalk board.  You order your drinks first, then the next step in line is ordering your food.  Someone else will ask how many people in your party and then go ready a table.  I had the large ribeye, medium rare with a side of the roasted red potatoes.  My friend had the steak sandwich.  Both got to our table quickly and were cooked how we ordered them.  The salad that came with my steak was terrific, as were the potatoes.  The ribeye was seasoned nicely and sliced, and had two toasted slices of bread laid in top.  The whole thing was a great experience, helpful staff and great food.    I will add that I found it amusing that the 'hipster' (apologies for lack of a better term) appearing staff work at a steak house.  In Seattle,  twenty somethings that look like them would only serve vegan fair trade farm to table food that tastes awful!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu board as of April 11, 2017

H9puFOI34R0Rl0LNbn86IQ.text: This place is #1 on the Yelp 2015 list of places to eat in america, why haven't you been here yet?!?!  This place is also BYOB and the service style is different which is a nice change of pace.  You stand in line (get there before 6pm for dinner) you will only have about a 10 minute wait.  If you wait later you could wait for a LONG time.  You place your order, find a table, get all your sauces to each on the side, crack your bottle of wine, beer, etc and relax.  Servers will call your order's name and bring it to you.  The last time we were there the servers were super friendly and accommodating.    I have had the meat plate with skirt steak, brussels (spicy and sweet), a filet sandwich, and a skirt steak sandwich in my 3 times there.  The bread they serve the deliciously favored meat on is reason to go alone.  The only thing to be aware of is they serve the meat pretty close to rare/mid rare, so if you don't like meat cooked that way, let then know when you are ordering.  I love the red sauce and the garlic one, but try them all and pick your favorite. This place really is great, so get there sooner than later :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skirt steak sandwich with avocado
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skirt steak, small and Brussels

QlOLy93bzO_3uWMnO8sbNA.text: Carnivore paradise.  Surprised that this place doesn't open more locations or other tried to copy the formula -- line up, order and pay for your food at the counter, grab your little placard, fetch your utensils and sauces,  and wait for a big plate of meat to be dropped off at your table.  The place is BYOB as well.  Outside of the sauces (they are good), I don't really know what makes this place Argentinian -- it could have just as easily be an American grill.  And I hear the lineups get pretty insane, but when we came when there was basically no line.  I got the Parrillada Mixta (NY strip, pulled chicken and chorizo) for $25 for a sampling.  On the menu, it says it's enough for 2... but I'm a glutton.  No complaints, just a good plate of meat and all the various sauces kept it interesting as I went to work.  The service is EXCELLENT despite the order-at-the-counter approach.  The servers kept coming back to top off our water and checking in.  There is a lot of hype attached to this place -- but I think it's good in the fact that it simply doesn't fuck anything up and does it in a very self-serve casual style.  You're probably not going to get the 'best' anything here - and you should expect it for the pricepoint.  But this is definitely a place I would frequent if I lived in Pittsburgh.

BDc3e1e-vZWekjbHI0u62g.text: traveled to Pittsburgh with my bf who had a business trip to the city.  Came in around 1pm on a Tuesday afternoon for a late lunch.  I ordered a "porky" empanada, small rib eye with chimmichurri (sub salad with oven roasted red skin potatoes), and the campfire yams. It was all so good. Loved the taste of the char on the outer edges of the meat which was tender and flavorful. the potatoes were awesome- slightly crunchy on outside, buttery and soft on the inside the way a good baked potato should be, the empanada was fantastic- nice and tender pastry, flavorful filling, the yams were good my only critique would be that they could've used some butter. All these things were great on their own, but what sent it over the top was the selection of sauces that you can add on.  my personal favorite was the pimenton- red pepper sauce.  OMG- I could put this on anything and everything.  It was sooooo good. Lastly, the staff (I interacted with about 5 different people while I was there) were all super helpful and friendly- they made the restaurant a warm and inviting place to be. I don't know when I'll be in Pittsburgh again, but I sure hope to make another trip back here when I do!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Porky empanada, ribeye with potatoes, campfire yams (yes- those are torched marshmallows on top!)
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy sauces!! Mixing them is good too!

Adjja6zukJOQCEiEctWxoA.text: I love the food, the staff, and that you can bring your own booze! Luckily I did not have to wait in much of a line to order. The key is visiting this place on weeknights or early evening to avoid a line. Make sure you try all of their house-made sauces.

fcJ5eY4H8IlNv3tgn2x5Cw.text: Believe the hype. It is absolutely as good as everyone says it is.

zXYqtX1SAXIqKNzK6wJISg.text: We had the opportunity to check out Gaucho Parilla late last summer. We were there with our two boys (age 12 and 14). My wife and younger son waited in line while my older son and I went to a local wine shop to grab an adult beverage for the meal. The staff at the restaurant was extremely friendly and helpful. The restaurant was packed but the staff never appeared flustered or made us feel rushed. We were seated and served fairly quickly. We ordered empanada appetizer main courses of beef, chicken and veggies, The food was fabulous and was the dining experience.   We were so impressed that we recently reached out to the restaurant staff to help us with our family Christmas Day meal planning. We wanted to "mix things up a bit" for this German/Polish family by switching the dinner to a traditional New Mexican theme.   We wanted to include empanadas but did not feel confident preparing them ourselves. Gaucho enthusiastically helped us customize the empanada ingredients and offered their expertise regarding the best way for us to pick them up on Friday as we drove through Pittsburgh on our trip to Buffalo NY. They "par-cooked"the empanadas and packed them up for us. When I arrived at Gaucho to pick them up, the chef brought them out to me himself and took the time to give me his recommendations for completing the cooking process on Christmas Day. He also hand picked and packed up sauces for the empanadas. Very reasonable price.   I was extremely impressed with the attention to detail demonstrated by all the staff, and the care they took to make sure their peice of our family dinner was a success. Our family meal was begun with the empanadas as I pulled them from the oven. They were golden brown and piping hot. The dough was perfectly flaky and the fillings were flavorful and moist. They really set the stage for the rest of the meal.   Thanks so much to all the staff at Gaucho Parilla Argentina for the wonderful product you put on the table, the friendly and casual  atmosphere you create in your dining room and the obvious devotion you show to your customers.   No wonder there's always such a long line of eager diners at their door! It's mostly definitely worth the wait.

n3SisfR0VEku2HgL9EgEzQ.text: I am from out of state and wanted to try this place. It said it closes at 9. I attempted to go 2 times... got there at 8:15 wasn't able to eat. The next day got there at 8, still couldn't!!! Like wow

g0IycSncd23jVbev3XELzg.text: Oh man, the food here is so so so good. Like, just... oh man. The staff is great, the menu is on the wall, you come in, order and grab a table. I had a pork sandwich and some potatoes and something else (I've forgotten, it's been a week), the person I was with got stake and some veggies and a bunch of other things. The empanadas are so good. I got some kind of cookie thing for desert, and my friend got a fruit crumble thing. Just, everything was so good, eat here, come hungry, it is so worth it.

wIXLQM5UF0TgPdIc1aFqaA.text: This place was AMAZING. The food was spectacular, the ambience cute, people extremely nice and service fast. All around easily a 5 star experience. This will be the thing I remember from my trip to Pittsburg. It was easily the highlight and if I make it back to this city, I would eat here again in a heartbeat.

OOqA68SWShf4ftwOenQxHg.text: Absolutely the best place I ever eaten in Pittsburgh! The place is a little hard to get and finding parking relies on luck, but once you are there, the food is divine!  The atmosphere is a classy, hipster type and the different types of food from snack dishes, to salad, sandwiches or real steak and desserts are there to make up for all the hassle you have to go through to get there. My SO had ribeye steak and I had a steak sandwich. I had to say, the steak was really good...moist and juicy and cooked to your desired level. However, what amazed me was the seasoning they put on the sandwich bread that made me go ooh-aah while eating it. Most of the time, the sandwich places make their fillings taste good but fail miserably with seasoning the buns/condiments that go with it. With Gaucho Parrilla Argentina, however, they get both right!! Even my SO still raved about this place and the place stood out in both our minds when we thought about the best meal we had in Pittsburgh as well!  Price was really reasonable, especially with the portion and such awesome taste you get. The waiter/cashier were super helpful, too. It does also help that the atmosphere is classy/super inviting, too! Go, if you are in Pittsburgh...and definitely make a case to stop and eat at this place even if you are just a visitor in town! Next time I'm back in Pittsburgh...I will hike my way there again! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye steak sandwich..nom nom...the toasted bread was very well seasoned, too!

m9j3eOyIqANRgEZWB8DR3g.text: I mean...what is there not to love about Gaucho?! This weekend we had guests from out of town visiting us and knew that we had to take them here. I was excited to come back because I haven't been here since it first opened a few years ago- I was impressed when I saw the amazing work that they had to the inside. We ended up getting here around 1:00 PM on a beautiful Saturday afternoon in PGH. The strip district was buzzing- so I was sure it would be packed here. Luckily, there was only about 10-15 people in line ahead of us and it seemed like the crowd followed us as we stood in line. We only ended up waiting about 25-30 minutes, which worked out great.   When we finally got inside to see the menu, we were overwhelmed with the menu and how amazing everything sounded. We ended up deciding to order a few dishes to split between the 4 of us- this is a great idea if you are coming here with a group so you can get a taste of everything. We decided on an order of 2 each of the empanadas (vegetables, pork, and beef),  side of potatoes, the Parrillada Mixta (NY strip steak, chicken, and spicy chorizo), and the vegetable sandwich (we ordered it deconstructed).  Where do I even begin? Everything was mouth-watering. The meats were all cooked to perfection and were accompanied by the fabulous self serving sauces that they have. You can tell that all the food is super fresh & it all has the perfect amount of char to give it a unique & delicious taste. The empanadas were all amazing and I loved to try the variety of them! They were unique from any other empanadas that I have had before. Even their bread is phenomenal!! My ONLY complaint is that they got rid of the vegetable dish that was on their older menu. We ended up ordering the vegetable sandwich as a replacement but I didn't love it as much as the older vegetable dish- please bring it back!!   Aside from the fabulous food, the interior of Gaucho is also a winner. As I said before, the renovations that they have done in the last few years are outstanding! I love that they are able to fit more people inside and it is still super spacious and a comfortable environment. The staff is also helpful and very kind here. Most importantly... Gaucho is BYOB! I always love a good BYOB spot. I promise you- if you see a line here, stand it, and wait... it is so worth it! Can't wait to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas, potatoes, vegetable sandwich, and the parrillada
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Enjoying Gaucho!

QNGODwomFwYPOusXWB6oMA.text: My favorite eatery in the Burgh. Delicious, Argentinean fare, no pretension, long waits, and totally worth it.   Everything is fresh, seasoned perfectly, and their chimichurri and other sauces taste like the meaning of life.

ckiisFYPoqQzhNNyj4nhpA.text: I was in Pittsburgh for business and visited Gaucho twice for dinner, despite the 30-45 minute wait to get it. The flavor here is incredible. If you have a problem with waiting in line (or you're that person that will endure but complain about the line to everyone waiting), don't kill the vibe and head down to McDonald's... You can see it from the line.  Also, it's BYOB. So grab a bottle of wine on your way. Or two, one for dinner, one for the line.

bGKc9C1VHGcWi6OAtvU1rA.text: Lots of talk about this place. My brother and his wife have attempted it a few times but the line was always too long. Another friend said it's one of his favorite places but you have to go early or on a week night.   After browsing the strip for an hour or two, we made our way here around 330 on a Saturday. The line had about 15 people waiting outside so we went for it. I mean, a line means one of two things: slow, poor service and being unable to serve your diners in a reasonable manner, or the food is THAT good that it's worth the wait and that's why so many people are willing to wait. Judging by the reviews, I was assuming the second.   It took us about 45 minutes to get to the ordering part finally. I got what my friend recommended, carne sandwich with sirloin. I split it with my husband and my friend got the pollo sandwich for herself. After ordering, we got sat right away. Our food came out in under 15 minutes. There were 2-3 empty tables in the dining area we were in during the entire time we were seated and eating, so this is where I begin to beg the question--why the wait? It took 2-3 minutes to order and we literally got seated right after. As did the group in front of us and the group after us. Food comes out quick. You eat quick and go. It's in between fast food style dining and normal dining so again, why is there this extreme wait? Yeah, the place is small. But it's a quick turnover. You get up and can refill your own water and grab your own sauces, extra plates, napkins etc so service time isn't the answer either. It just baffled us.   Back to the food, it was pretty good. The steak was seasoned well and cooked to medium rare like we asked. I will say, I understood upon first bite why they have the deconstructed sandwich option. My friend's chicken sandwich was no hassle, but every bite I took into mine pulled the entire slab of steak right off the sandwich. And the onions and peppers. So I basically ate mine deconstructed style, though it was unintentional. I'd recommend ordering any carne sandwich that way for future reference.   I'd say the sauces were the game changer and kept this from being an overall 2 experience. Pretty unique and all clearly freshly made. There was a sweet onion one, a roasted red pepper one, a garlic butter one (think Papa John's garlic butter dip on crack), and one just called "yummy" which cracked us up, but was indeed yummy. Reminded me of an Italian dressing, as it was thinner than the others. Having those flavor options to dip and spread made a difference.   I wanted to be wowed by this place and have it be a definite 5-stars. While we all agreed it was good, that's it. Just good. Not good and worth the long wait. Not good and unique atmosphere or something quirky to set the place apart because it's much like any hipster, exposed-beam-decor place popping up in any city. Not good and I'm already planning my next visit. Just good with some pretty cool sauces. Lots of people were getting takeout orders while we waited in the long line, perhaps that's the secret?

6kTMB0Yyyw1UnSK4rc8A0w.text: This place is honestly overrated. The steak was tough to cut, and the sauces were too oily. The paella was so salty to the point where we could not eat it. It didn't have a lot of shrimp and mussels in it, either. Save your money and go somewhere else. It's not worth standing in a line for an hour for subpar food.

sq2g_HtyMfRC334PewtfcQ.text: After reading all the amazing reviews, I had to try it! The line was out the door. Everyone seemed to be talking about how good the food is while waiting! Total about 30 minutes wait. The staff were all so pleasant, I wouldn't have guessed they were busy if I couldn't see it for myself. The space is small, but we had no trouble finding a table. There's an outdoor space as well. The windows make the atmosphere so light and airy.   We ordered the vegetable plate to split. Yum! Chicken and beef Empanadas were alright... i preferred the beef. The real star was the pork sandwich house special. Lucky for hubby, he ordered it! It was tender and favorful. I really liked it! I had the Carne flank cooked medium rare. Both sandwiches had so much meat! The sauces and spices added flavor, not super spicy like I thought! See pictures for more info!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne with flank steak cooked medium rare. Delicious
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The star of the show!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas and sauces! Wonderful

bgWYJ5JOrufKEp-3kLCpXQ.text: Oh ma wurd. How did I not come here sooner? This place is fantastic! Stellar service and amaaaazing MEAT! I had the large "el gaucho" salad with filet done medium well. Perfection. Sat on the patio with friends as well and it was a nice experience. My friend had one of the "chicky" empanadas and it was super yummy. Would come back here in a heartbeat.  I appreciated how the employee who explained the meat choices did so very carefully and was considerate about taking his time with me and my friends. We weren't rushed and felt very welcomed.  Get here early. The line forms out the door quickly.

UcsHPglyjIkrvfef-raTlg.text: Don't understand the hype. The food was ok but I paid over $20 for a small steak sandwich not really what I expected.

4hAKQZ_cpT3Pzq7EwWh7Ww.text: Read a lot about the wait and it was out the door when we got here. Get here about an hour before close as they stop the line near that point. Also BYOB. All that said the food is worth the wait. The steak was cooked just right and had a great spice.

QC9Fj-qdQyVhRvi79Q7f_Q.text: After reading about how great his restaurant was, my girlfriend and I went here and have been making it a monthly destination since.  While the seating situation isn't really optimal, the quality of food and the attitude of the people working there really makes up for it.  There's something great about having an expertly cooked steak sandwich while you smell the wood that they use to fire their grills.  The food is a little on the expensive side, but as long as you can get a seat it's definitely worth it to come here.  I'd recommend coming a bit off of normal eating hours since it quickly gets mobbed on the weekends.

H-fV9pKAWHoDRpX4Hbax5A.text: Loved this place! BYOB (including boxed wine!!) I don't believe there was even a corking fee. The fish of the day sounded too out there for me so I stuck with the shrimp. Date had the pork chops and they were spicy! But delicious. Will be back soon!

R7KPSWFHatCxoRmamkvyKA.text: Just ate a lomo sandwich spirited to Philadelphia courtesy of a tried, True, and tested partner. The sauces arrived as well. Let's just say that I am in bliss, my chubby cheeks still evoking my recent flight to the far off heavens.

_fCv3ry9DoJMaZKBTsHVDA.text: Unlike Yelp, this place is amazing. Order a thing from the menu, eat it and be happy.

vshXNLKEFuaAhvM3gMev2g.text: The food was delicious as were the dipping sauces. As you will read in many reviews, this place is jumping so there is often a wait. Try to go at off times during the day and you'll enjoy the experience much more.

t8i5fPaJN8rWVggGW40g-w.text: The steak plate is always my favorite!!!!! And I can't remember which dessert I had but it was absolutely astounding!

clvJ6JK4GwCM68BmbZmeVQ.text: I really can't say it any better than all of those before me have, its just hands down amazing! Simple food cooked perfectly, seasoned perfectly, and served in a fun environment. I kind of hate myself for not coming sooner.  Go with the sampler Parrillada Mixta, a sampler of chicken, steak, and chorizo served with olive oil soaked grilled bread. Its great for splitting with two people. Make sure you get all of the sauces so you can mix and match flavors.

9brGKQLHIvSe-iZJFHME_A.text: Absolute best steak sandwich I've had in years.  People of Pittsburgh should flock to this place and be lining up out the door.  The sandwiches, salads, and apps are amazing.  The sauces to accompany the empanadas and sandwiches are also delicious.   Wow is all I can say!

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pulled chicken salad was awesome and had great flavor.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak sandwich on fantastic ciabatta break with unreal roasted peppers and world class flavor and au jus from the steak.

XRZ4s2AM6DsQ-aSAMsiQkA.text: I have eaten only twice here but both meals made it to my top meals ever in Pittsburgh. I have eaten sandwiches, empanadas, chicken wings, and the alfareho cookies amongst other things. There was not a single thing I didn't like. The food is packed with rich deep Flavors, the meat is unbelievably juicy, soft and tender. The only problem is waiting in the long line after searching for a parking spot!

WJ_Rl3Ih3VNitA6RmQVN9w.text: Gaucho never disappoints. The steak is obviously fantastic but a hidden gem on the menu is the grilled camerones. Perfection every time

Mmtwh3k4b6ghEr_lvMgpzA.text: Seriously - Why I don't go here weekly is insane.  I've only been here once and I completely understand why it is so highly rated. The food is some of the best I've ever had.  My flank steak was cooked to perfection. Heck, the smoked toast was even the best toast I have ever had.  Try and go at an off time, because the line wraps around the door.  I will be sure to come back here quite a bit!

hsFcMw23d53NKMLLMCMPTA.text: Absolutely love.  Very friendly staff and great food.

_PniVQQMtzbH53Uv-I4P2w.text: I am not one for hyperbole.  But damn, Gaucho Parrilla prepared one of the best sandwiches I have ever had in my life.  Please do yourself a favor and check this place out.  The food was spectacular.  I had the Steak Burger and an empanada.  The empanada was just OK in my opinion.  I have never been one for Argentine style empanadas so this is probably just bias, still the sandwich was so good I had to give this place 5 stars.   I went with a couple of co workers and we all kind of sat around in contemplative silence when we finished, brains working hard to recall a better sandwich.   We all had different sandwiches but left with the same feeling, so I would say feel free to try any, these guys take real pride in what they prepare.  I look forward to going back there today and check out another item on the menu before leaving Pitt.

jA1zbJgQyM-QvNFdxgTAQQ.text: If you're one of those people that enjoys finding unsuspecting, delicious, hole in the wall places... you will LOVE Gaucho. Settled in an unsuspecting part of the Strip District, it is a restaurant full of vibrant food, and people to match.  Don't expect to sit inside, there are only about 5 or 6 seats to choose from. I got the El  Pavo sandwich with grilled corn and it cost me about $14. Not bad!  The staff seemed excited to see us and were genuinely happy to be there. They checked up on us outside to make sure we were happy with everything.   I didn't get to take a picture-- I was too busy enjoying the meal :)  TL;DR -- Great food, Great staff. Food with integrity. A must go-to in Pittsburgh!

Fp3OlCLykKMwTM6Snuc_8A.text: By far the best steak sandwich in the city, toppings are on point and they never fail to cook it to perfection. I could eat here every day.

Zl1B7unIi2rrC26C5po1zw.text: Ahhhhhhmazing! I was out with some people at the history center and we all caught the hungry train so we jetted down to the strip and snuck into this place. It was crowded but the smells coming out of the kitchen were worth the rather quick wait to the register to order. There were five of us there so one person ran outside by the place to secure a spot to sit so by the time we all ordered we had enough chairs to sit down and enjoy. I got the carne sandwich with lomo and it was more than enough to fulfill my dreams. I enjoyed every bite and intend to go back to try the rest of the menu! Highly recommend!

Z_92p9a97n0DNwEiFMV3Xg.text: My boyfriend and I were passing through Pittsburgh on the way to the airport and needed lunch. Thanks to yelp, we went to Gaucho and were extremely happy. Between the two of us, we had the hanger steak, rosemary braised beef sandwich, steak empanadas, and maiz. Everything was delicious, we will definitely be going back if we are ever in Pittsburgh again. The place is quaint and cute, the staff very friendly. I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hanger steak and an empanada.

Y_nQB2cmPXdM98_66-byIw.text: Hmm..after having read so many reviews I probably had very high expectations . I am not saying the food wasn't good but probably not as much as I read about it. Or it could probably be that I didn't order their signature Rosemary steak.. I ordered Pollo (chicken) sandwich and it was very average . The red sauce was good but one of the sauce was terrible.. I really loved the cookie and infact bought a few more to go as well. Will try their steak next time to be fair .. But for whatever I ate today I will give only 4..

uYvb7GiTvg0Tf-FEQXRcNw.text: We love it.  I have tried to find fault, but the food is consistent, the chimmi is flavorful, fresh and free, the settings is clean and casual.    I am usually frustrated with how stodgy Pittsburgh is when it comes to convention and I'm glad to see Gaucho break with the typical, "sit down and wait an hour for your food" routine.  As in Nashville and other foodie cities, you line up at the counter, with a large printed menu on the wall to look at as you wait, then you place your order and choose your own seat.  They'll hand you your drinks on the spot and bring your food out when it's ready and usually, that's not too long.  I gave it 5 stars because the food is as good as it gets, but there is one notable flaw. The line is insanely long.   I wouldn't say Gaucho is to blame for such a long line (other than producing a hit restaurant) but they generally have exactly 1 person working the line/ringing people up even if nearly 100 people are waiting. Sometimes the same person gets all the drinks, takes all the orders, and rings each person up.  If a party of 4 pays separately and asks questions about the menu or for recommendations, you might wait 15 minutes for one table of people to place an order.  This makes the wait longer than necessary, even with Gaucho's great popularity. I can't think of another business where that flies.    I can see that if they had more than one register, there might not be enough tables, but we've never been forced out without a seat but we have waited for over an hour to place our order...   Keep up the excellent food, Gaucho.  You've already broken with tradition, but tweaking the way you take orders is in order.  No restaurant, no matter how lauded, is guaranteed permanent success and it's always a good move to consider your customers first.

qqPYeXkGvvIDcVhAldUyZA.text: it's about time i review my favorite spot in the burgh... gaucho never disappoints! amazing food every single time, even when I order blindly. The staff is super friendly and approachable. easy 100%

nraZG6iVT7EQzQt1PK3tZg.text: We had the empanadas and carne sandwich. The sauces are incredible. Killer atmosphere - very clean.

zv01Ke_hbKdcwwYwqVQXjQ.text: Incredible meat!!! And I love the street corn and all of the sides. I haven't been in a while and I can't wait to get back there, I'm so happy to see that they have added more seating because it used to be really small with only a few stools. The sauces that they have to put on your food are out of this world. They were so good I had to take a couple to bring home with me ;)

oFdORizQ8qn8VQKQtyIt2w.text: I'm never disappointed leaving Gaucho. I have been visiting the restaurant for a couple of years now - ever since they just had the little spot with the nice patio! Everything is delicious. And they have treats for dogs, too :)

_e_2oG7KBWYgLmqyxCjGZw.text: Great food and service. Menu written on the wall looks busy and can be a bit confusing at first. Great variety of sauces. Will definitely return and would recommend.

FwwV0w0gdG2sLwg6rVWMLg.text: With all of the 5 star reviews I guess I was expecting more. It was very confusing as soon as we walked in. One sign says wait to be seated and another sign says don't stand here. With no hostess in sight we were left trying to read the huge black board menu. At least half of it is in another language. Finally some from behind the counter filling water glasses gave us the scoop. This is actually like a fast food restaurant. You have to pick your drinks, order your food, and then find yourself a table. Now we realize there isn't any silverware or plates, you have to get them yourself too. I had the ribeye which was good but it was over cooked to med-well when I ordered med. The salad that came with, it was served actually on top of the steak and was drenched in some oily dressing. Terrible. I guess that was something else nobody told us about, and we forgot to ask with all of the confusion. You can't pick your own salad dressing. Next time I'll pick an american themed restaurant.

3DYSKcpa-ai8HIGwt_K1UA.text: Seriously one of the best sandwiches I ever ate, and if you getting lunch make sure you there before 11 or you will be staying in 30 minutes line

-dLt3sWBYLfx0GAO0ftS2w.text: Amazing food, nice atmosphere. The line is long so be prepared to wait for an hour or so before ordering.

Y6P9V_CuPj92kuGHcFBvFw.text: My husband and I are new to Pittsburgh and we eaten their twice in less than two weeks!  Great menu, excellent quality, service and value.  There is always a line, but it is well worth the wait!

XVCPW2m1KH1yCknHTkS4Tg.text: Very good meats. With such a high rating, we had to try this place. It wasn't very busy, but we did show up half an hour before they closed. The person taking our order did a great job of answering all of our questions. The menu was on a chalk board and there were some things that didn't have an explanation of what they were/what was in them. They were out of bread, so there was no bread for sandwiches or to accompany the plates.  I ordered the flank steak plate. The meat was seared well to lock in the juices. It was very juicy and tender with a wonderful crispy outside. It could have been fine on its own, but I couldn't pass up the flavors in the sauces they have available as condiments. They made fantastic accents to the meat. Since they didn't have bread to accompany the meal, I got a bowl of saffron rice. I thought it was pretty bland. I traded a piece of flank steak for a piece of NY Strip on my colleague's plate. They NY Strip was just as good if not slightly better.

Ez0zoQhiUBr0kQXKBFqNLw.text: Do not miss this place if you are in PGH! Probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever had! Do not miss our on the Rosemary braised beef. You will not be disappointed.

LNozRFbVUjMGT0N6TykFTw.text: Yes the line speaks for itself.   I don't care for the line... but the food is so delicious.   There is definitely attention to details.   Had about 10 different things here... all meats are well seasoned and aromatically open fire grilling... hmmm    Greens on the side are well dressed.  Vegetables are nicely roasted.  All sauces could literally be consumed with a spoon (kidding, of course).  Staff is very engaging and hip... seems happy also.... which is a nice environment to be in.  The checkout and order line is a bit slow.    Could use a business consultant to increase efficiency..

0p3NyNzKZTx5ThaAxGtk3Q.text: Reviews do this place justice. I ha e gone there 20+ timesand I still have only ordered one thing off the menu. The carne! Basically the best tasting sandwhich I have ever had. Guys that work there are very nice, they explain the food the sauces etc.   Everyone I have ever gone with has loved it. If you haven't gone you should. Check the schedule because it's not open all the time

xjzXMMnXeQmsWs7a-53H0g.text: A small restaurant where people are standing and eating. Why are they all smiling. They know something that when you walk in off the street you could not know . The food is excellent and fresh introducing you to many new flavores. The shrimp is some of the best I have ever eaten. The service is pleasant and helpful and fun. Don't pass up this one .
