Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Be0U8H04RZTaMj46Fgz9EA.text: The approach to this review deserves the same respect parrilla master Anthony gives his food... simple and straightforward.  Gaucho's menu is based on a few great quality ingredients, traditional bold flavored condimentos, and simple preparation - the very antithesis of typical Pittsburgh food.    For those that may not be familiar with Argentinian cuisine it leans pretty heavily toward meat, particularly beef, given the amount of livestock raised (average yearly individual consumption is north of 200 pounds).  I'd say that's a good start to any menu concept.  The range of beef cuts allows for varied textures and flavors to be experienced, anywhere from fattier and tender ribeye to a lean and moist filet - all with a bit of char on the edges.  What separates Gaucho from most restaurants in this city is the means in which all menu items are cooked.  The continuously stoked hardwood coals of the parrilla impart a flavor and texture that can only be achieved by the hands of a great pit master... simplicity is key in preparation and grilling, but it takes a great amount of skill to execute perfection on each cut of steak, chicken, shrimp, or fish.  If you're not in the mood for a great piece of steak (I say this in jest, as I don't believe this is a possibility) or aren't fully prepared to devote the next 4 hours of your day to a food induced coma, there are plenty of other menu items to entice your palate and [potentially] not weigh you down.  The following are a few favorites:  Gaucho Papas - one may think potatoes are just filler, but the intensity of flavor from the hardwood roasting complimented by fresh rosemary will slap you across the face for not considering them as a primary option.  Empanadas - different than most other Latin American varieties which are usually fried or baked in a typical oven, these are charred just slightly from the parrilla to give you a whole different flavor profile from what may be expected. tender meat, sweetness from charred vegetables, and a perfect amount of salt from the olive.  bite off the tip and drizzle in the condimentos... the roof of your mouth and your taste buds will both thank you.    Provoletta - it's grilled provolone with oil, herbs, and lemon. i don't think this needs further explanaton.  Vegetales - few places get me excited about vegetables. the balance of char to natural sweetness is taken to another level with a fig drizzle. great variety of vegetables in the mix to give you a few different textures.  Camarones - sweet, plump, translucent and crisp.  charred with rosemary and olive oil.  words cannot describe.  Chorizo - simple and well made, mellow heat in the spicy type and a well rounded flavor in the garlic version.  not phenomenal, but solid.  Carne con pan - the best deal you can find here.  your choice of any cut of steak topped with charred peppers and onions, slathered with chimichurri, and sandwiched between two pieces of toasted ciabatta.  meat juices and chimichurri unite to soften the bread and give you the best bite they have to offer.  I'm almost sad to say that I haven't ventured into the realm of pollo (damn you chicken latino for always being the first door I pass in that direction) or pescado yet, but timing is everything... they only supply enough to get through the day, and it's usually gone if you get there later in the evening.  I respect them that much more knowing that things are going to be fresh whenever I do get the chance to eat it.  Condimentos - in all honesty if these weren't part of the Gaucho experience, the menu would still be successful, albeit significantly less flavorful.  luckily they are part of it, and you would be selling yourself short if you didn't try all 4 of them on some toast, a sandwich, meat, potatoes, a spoon, the floor, or just drink straight from the mason jar (don't do that, out of respect for Anthony and co.)  traditional flavors to enhance any of the aforementioned items... don't be surprised when you're taken aback by how critical these are to your meal, and don't hesitate to mix them: a) chimichurri - made the way god intended by way of fresh herbs, salmuera (salt brine), red wine vinegar, and just the right amount of garlic and chili flake to make you reconsider why you put ketchup on anything. b) ajo - roasted garlic, fresh thyme, oregano, rosemary, olive oil and salt (don't quote me, I'm trying to reverse engineer his recipe).  this should be the modern day mayo, thankfully it's not because there may be a garlic shortage in the world if that were the case. c) cebolla - caramelized onions and herbs with vinegar and oil.  sweeter and less assertive than the ajo. d)pimenton - sweet roasted pepper flavor with herbs and a hint of char.  There is only one way to appreciate the balance and complexity of flavors produced at Gaucho - stop in just once, and I can just about guarantee you'll be back to try everything they offer.

oC5dSsjy_Ba7gxpbc-k21Q.text: As a top-rated spot in PGH I decided to finally give it a try.  After reading about long lines and waits of up to an hour, I decided to order take out and go at lunch time. I called up to place my order and was told by a young woman that "we are very busy and might not be able to get to it." After picking my jaw up off the floor, I vowed I wouldn't go back.  But after a few weeks of jonesing for the grilled veggies, I decided to give them one more try.  This time a very pleasant young man took my order.  Although there was a line of 8 people perusing the chalkboard menu, I got to scoot right up to the far side of the register, pay, and scoot right home. The grilled veggies were excellent. I also got a rosemary braised beef sandwich which was also very good, albeit a bit on the soggy side, even though I only live about 10 minutes away.  Parking on Penn was a little tough, you might have to park a block or two away.  They might want to consider getting a hold of the empty (but blocked off) lot next door.

F2_yYluC7e2Qdnc9v1jwGQ.text: Several friends recommended Gaucho so i decided to check things out for my self.   The first thing that caught my attention was the wood smoke aroma.    theres some seating along the walls.  With Additional seating outside.  So I ordered a steak carna sandwich; and it was frigging amazing.   The bread had the perfect texture. Not too heavy, kinda springy .   The steak had been perfectly cooked, and had great smoked flavor  That wasn't overpowering.  Overall great balance of smokey and spicy.  If you plan to come around noon during the week , be prepared to wait as the line might be out the door.  Yes , the wait is a slight inconvenience .  But well worth the wait .   if ya want to avoid the lunch rush I suggest   comming  around 11:30 or closer to 1 .

56i0YLR4VY90gT3lSq-_lQ.text: We arrived at 11:45, hoping to avoid the lunch crowd.  It took us about 15 minutes to order and another 10-15 minutes to receive our food.  It was well worth the wait.  The pork sandwich and roasted corn were amazing!  Just make sure you get there early - the line was out the door as we were leaving.

XB69p0l_QprDO9S3bBUo2Q.text: mind. EXPLOSION.  i had the grilled chicken sandwich! it even had some potatoes in there. BREAD IS AMAZING. next time, gonna get involved with some STEAK.  my friend got the corn on the cob and it looked so legit. he wouldnt even share.  I DREAM OF THIS TYPE OF FOOD

P8uDqTMdfHZF4V4xZu8KPg.text: When the line is out the door at 3:00 pm on a rainy Saturday afternoon, you know it must be good. It is a one table in and one table out with no reservations kind of deal... but worth the wait.  I ordered a couple of small plates as my entree. The empanadas were really good but a bit tiny for the price. The roasted vegetables were on point. The only disappointment was after salivating over photos of the brussel sprouts on yelp and then learning they were out of season. Bummer.  If I am in Pittsburgh again I would return. But next time I would know to come about an hour before I want to eat, given frequent line.

-eg1FJ1h-lnkVARxO_JuIg.text: This was my first time here. I came with a group of friends most had been here before. I had the barn mi which was a pork butt sandwich on a delicious crusty baguette. We ordered root veggies and cauliflower sides both of which were delicious. It was not a particularly long wait- we came in later on a sat night and they close at ten.  All of the meals were scrumptious- my vegetarian friend had a melted roasted cheese dish which she ate every bite of. The sauces were very tasty my favorite being the garlic one. All in all a great experience- I will be back!

by5PldjAQ68LMDQgjecbMg.text: Good meat! I'm still not sure if it worths the wait, something that makes me not want to go back but the food was great!

afOzAGPEI0WjQF_WZlMHCA.text: What a pleasant surprise. I have never had Argentine food and it was absolutely delicious. Love that they have smaller versions of most items. This way you can try a few different items. My friend and I tried 6 different things all unique and equally delicious highly recommend this place. Don't be afraid to try the different sauces all very good and unique in taste

HsbGwSVwnjbbKZFrkb2FhA.text: Gaucho is my far one is my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh. We obviously had to wait in line but it is worth the wait. The portion size of the sandwich is perfect, the service is prompt, and it's nice that you pay up front so you don't have to wait around for a check. The food is so incredibly flavorful and the sauces are to die for.

ZVlvko73x79aAE0anA8ViA.text: Be prepared to wait in a long line that wraps around outside the business. But it is well worth the wait. We came about 4pm and only had to wait 30 minutes to order which I hear is towards the shorter end. The staff are all super friendly and helpful so be sure to tip because they all share tips and they definitely deserve it! We got empanadas, a carne sammich with skirt steak, and a small skirt steak plate. THE BEST PART IS THEY HAVE 4 SAUCES THAT ARE ALL AMAZING AND YOU CAN HAVE AS MUCH AS YOU DESIRE!! We also got our food fast and it was so delicious. My mouth is still full of flavor! Definitely recommend but don't go at peak lunch or dinner time if you don't want to wait a long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The view from the counter into the kitchen
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sammich with skirt steak and red peppers and chimmi sauce.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small medium rare skirt steak plate that comes with a side salad.

V2ZPgmafgAMicLLszlaOTA.text: I wanted to be much more impressed with this place. It just didn't live up to the hype. We figured the long lines meant great food but left feeling like we missed something...all the reviews said the food was super tasty and flavorful but I found it to be bland. I mean, I do have unique tastebuds since I'm from the Caribbean, but I felt like I could make better food at home.

dXihT7pk-CpkuiA_hWFT8A.text: Visited at 1pm just as the lunch rush was leaving. Probably 25 people in line. Immediately greeted by a gentleman in line taking # of people in each party. The long line actually gives you time to browse the amazing menu wish so many choices. It's BYOB with no corkage fee but this was lunch. The guy filling drinks was helping people on what to order and showing pictures of meals on his. phone. As I was checking out the girl at the register was giving me tips about the place.  You get your own silverware and sauces off the wall that was a first.  Waiters and Servers stopped by several times to check on my drink even while this place is packed. Food was immaculate. People continued to check on my meal and refill my drink.  Highly recommend to anyone

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bJnomoCuwKqDJZi_Epss2Q.text: I've waited in a line outside for an hour and half to eat at this place before and I'd do it again...maybe even if it was raining   ....Surprised I haven't written a review about this place yet!   I've gone to gaucho a handful of times now and I've NEVER been disappointed. Not only is the food incredible the staff is amazing and I always try and leave them a glass or two of wine (( everyone loves BYOB!)).  There are a ton of options. Sandwiches, meat platters, salads, small bites and you honestly CANNOT go wrong. For first timers, I recommend the parrillada mixta (a platter of various meats gaucho has) with a bunch of whatever sides you want. It's a great way to get a feel for what this place is capable of!  Yesterday my boyfriend and I went and got the asada platter (incredible) , the mussels (also incredible), and the camarones* make sure you squeeze the lemon on top*  (did I say incredible?).   There are only 2 things I'm not a fan of  1:  The chicken. I'm super picky about the way chicken prepared and unfortunately, on several occasions I've found it a little dry here. Sucks because chicken is great.  2. At night I wish they would dim the lighting to create a more intimate/cozy atmosphere   HOWEVER, don't get it twisted ladies and gentlemen! This place still deserves 5stars for its deliciousness, friendly staff, and consistency.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mussels, camarones, and asado platter. LOVE.

NAE6HKmTeJ6r2z6JNj-eAw.text: Very nice and cozy  place. with delicious food . we got Lamb chops ,and whole wing it's was amazing.  you can bring your own Bottle lot of interesting people dining here. very crowded so come in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZwAQH9hKtoPrGBOFJho-dA.text: Just do it.  Come for a great meal great service great fun.  What an adventure of flavors.  What an amazing menu.  It is truly a wonderful experience.  I look forward to my next meal here.  Thank you Gaucho team this was a great food taste explosion.

JLOGxXfODSfV3aDlhToQGg.text: The food here is delicious and fairly priced. You can also have a sit down meal in less than an hour which is rare. Get the rosemary braised beef sandwich and load up on the sauces!

mo4NUkc7CHBhWc7W1Mwr-w.text: Had the steak sandwich and the Plates Pork Platter.  Absolutely worth every penny.  Have had similar food in NYC and Miami.  This place definitely compares. May even be better. Top notch!!!

tbgiuX0xzpeLSSpZDQ9mIw.text: To be completely honest I thought there was no way Gaucho would live up-to my expectations. I have yet to hear a bad thing about the place and maybe I'm a pessimist... but I didn't believe anything could be that perfect.  I drove nearly 5 hours non-stop from North East Pennsylvania... landed in the Strip District and immediately walked up the street to Gaucho Parrilla. I ordered the steak burger with onions and peppers. It was large, it was mouthwatering good, and although I was completely full and satisfied, I had to debate with myself on why I shouldn't order a second one to scarf down!  Gaucho is perfection. I can't imagine why anyone would go anywhere else. From the friendly staff, to the most delicious steak I've ever tasted, to the interior and layout. Everything is perfect. The 5-star rating isn't a fluke... it's that good.

T87dtrg6ThhvITB1bJJoKg.text: An ok place when there's nothing else around.  In the midst of the city so parking is at a premium.  Decent sandwiches and small plates.  Very accommodating service as we had a wheelchair bound person with us. Long lines and limited seating though.  BYOB.

CiuoDrjOrqfFdh4TT_lyDw.text: This is my "go-to" restaurant when I'm anywhere within an hour's drive of Gauchos. It's a reason for me to look forward to business travel to the area.   As a former Pittsburgh resident, it's just yet another reason for me to miss the city. If you don't go because it's terrific go for those of us who can't go as often as we would like! You won't be disappointed.

WLpwcQLWkgRa2UmZx29K-g.text: I'm obsessed with this place, always a wait because the food is so good. BYOB and reasonable places

aVT6N0mvnM5vmr2_igf1QQ.text: My wife and I made an unexpected overnight stay in Pittsburgh on our way home from Niagara Falls recently. After checking into our hotel, we hit up Yelp to find a great place to eat in the Steel City. I used the search filters and found Gaucho Parrilla by searching "highest rating." As soon as I started looking at the pictures, it dawned on me that I had stalked their page within the past year because I had seen their restaurant named on the Yelp top 100 list (#7). We immediately made plans to head straight to Gaucho. After driving around the block a few times, I wasn't too sure if we would be able to find a parking spot for the massive SUV rental, but we were finally able to get a good spot on the street just down a bit.  We loaded up the parking meter and started making our way towards Gaucho... as we got closer and closer, I could smell the meats cooking in all of their meaty glory. I wasn't particularly hungry that day, but the smells emanating from the place took care of that in no time. Upon entering, everyone was super friendly and very helpful when it came to introducing us to their menu and pointing out a couple of options that would be great for first time Gaucho-ers. We tried the meat platter (Beef, Chicken, and Sausage) as well as the pulled pork with caramelized onions (My personal favorite). I have to say, I would be hard pressed to remember a meal that I enjoyed more than the one we had that night... the flavors at Gaucho are on another level of amazingness. If you are anywhere near Pittsburgh, go out of your way to try Gaucho, you will not be disappointed.

DfnqZn1rg-NZjv7sk5jShw.text: Walked in there with our own craft beer, the rib eye was sooo good. Every thing like the empanadas and the dessert were great! Is totally recommend this place to anyone looking to try out a legit Argentinian place.

qvE0-rhd5DuTOq7FKgLEfQ.text: One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh. While the wait may seem intimidating, it is always extremely worth it. The staff is friendly and always bring out the food in a timely manner. Can't wait to go again.

AOQ5R1ptq0PSX4ojSPiEow.text: I absolutely love this place. Given its popularity, the lines can get long during peak hours but I can assure you it is totally worth it.   I've had the cordero (lamb) which comes with a crostini, side salad, and some sort of pickled mustard seed spread. I've also had the pollo a la parilla (half roasted chicken) which I really loved the even though it didn't come with any sides. But the chicken was cooked so perfectly that it didn't matter that it didn't have any sides. The empanadas have always been really good too. My favorite ones are the veggie. Both times I went, they did not have the chicken wings which I have been told is a must try.   This place can get expensive depending on what you order. The lamb was $16 while the chicken was $12 (I liked the chicken a lot better). Even though it's really busy and crowded, the service has always been great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pollo a la parilla and veggie empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cordero (lamb) comes with side salad, crostini, and pickled mustard seeds

7HLtA_jxCL70TCUprwLV4w.text: Okay yelpsters failed me. Im trying to figure out why this place has 4.5 stars? The place is a cool hipster place, staff was extremely friendly; however, this place is flawed in a few but major ways. First of all, the menu is this HUGE "mural" written on the wall in chalk. I think this menu is a little extensive to be written on a chalk wall and luckily it wasnt crowded or we would have felt super rushed trying to figure out what we wanted in line. Secondly, I personally dont think ordering filet mignon at a counter and waiting on your food to arrive is acceptable. It felt so weird ordering 65 dollars worth of food and going to sit down to wait for your order to arrive. At least they actually brought it to us I guess. But dont expect to get asked if you need anything. Its self service after that. And lastly the food was good but not bragging good in my opinion.   I CAN say that the filet would have been amazing had it actually been cooked to medium well as we requsted. One of them was definitely on the lower end of the medium spectrum and the other one was closer to medium well but not quite. Since the steak was sliced already  and topped with chimichurri, I didnt want to send it back but clearly was not medium well and I think cooks should be able to recognize this before sending it out, especially with it being sliced already. Flaws aside, this goes in the book as one of the most tender, juicy, and most flavorful pieces of filet mignon I've ever eaten and Ive eaten a lot of filet mignon in my lifetime. The chimmichurri paired very well with it. It complimented it unlike a lot of places that serve chimi as a necessity to cover up lack of flavor.   I also had two beef empanadas. The cashier told me that the beef wasnt  just shredded beef and it was pulsed through a blender so I was expecting a "picadillo style" filling but made with pulsed beef instead of ground beef for a more gourmet filling; however, I was disappointed to find it filled with dry, long chunky pieces of shredded beef. There were a couple of olives mixed in but the beef empanada didnt make the cut at all in my  book. It was very dry inside.  And lastly, the proveleta. This was very good. Ive never had anything like it before but it is a thick slice of provolone cheese, seasoned with herbs and fried on each side leaving a delicious crisp on the outside and chewy goodness through the middle. It is served on grilled toast. I ate it with the chilled grilled vegetable medley that came with my steak plate to make "bruschetta" and it was very good that way.   Overall, this place has some decent eats but not good enough to write back home about. Obviously im in the minority with this opinion so I guess this is one of those try it yourself places....you might love it.

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The proveleta with a chunk missing already :-)

wexsJXil5iNRlbgwQn5F8g.text: This is truly a great restaurant. The steaks were perfectly cooked. Very tender. We got the small plate ribeye. The grilled shrimp was out of this world delicious. The roasted red potatoes were so tender you could smash them with a fork. The wait staff was extremely attentive and friendly. I was also very impressed with the manager as she was helping clear tables and sweeping the floor. Great example for her staff. Will definitely go here again. A word of advice..for dinner try to get there before 5 or you will be in line forever.

JO3UsSmXwR85X-TICTb4HA.text: This was my first time here. Since I have moved from Pittsburgh they have definitely done an amazing upgrade to its foodie scene and this place fits right in. If you come here though you are most likely going to have to wait in a long line that usually goes fast (that's if their POS system doesn't go down like it did tonight) that was the only down fall lol they said last time it was down for 2 hours. We waited for 90 min but the food is definitely worth it. They have flavorful selections cuts of steak cooked to your liking. I chose the steak medium well and it wasn't over cooked and was tender. They have difference sauces you can use to put on your food. My favorite was the garlic one. I also got the roasted vegetables with a fig dressing that was very good. And the peanut butter bread pudding was a perfect ending. It wasn't too sweet and very soft.

yQtc-QqEYgZW3BlJ0uMT7A.text: Got the steak sampler. It was amazing.  This place gets crazy busy and it's pretty evident why once you've had their food.  The employees are funny and always cracking jokes to make the wait seem a little less long.   They also have some great sauces to put on the steaks.

dIkejojj8Q-CeVT7NcX_Ig.text: This place is amazing! The food is out of this world - I dream about it on a weekly basis!

l14zfQ1o4jR8Xi7NGORnZw.text: The food is 110% worth the wait!! Great atmosphere and food. Obviously it would be nice if the space was a bit bigger (so the line is shorter) but I also think it adds to the uniqueness and small business feel. I ordered the carne asada and it was absolutely wonderful. Very tender. Love the fact that it's BYOB too. Would highly recommend.

eGlJiIiFG0kR6flGvg94mA.text: This place is absolutely amazing and worth it's #7 national yelp spot. Came on a Saturday so there was a bit of a wait [surprisingly only about 30 minutes total though which is unexpected]  They have their menu up on a chalkboard when you come in and a few people pop in and out from behind the bar in order to make sure that you understand or can assist you with the menu. Be prepared to eat bread covered in delicious meat. The steak is absolutely phenomenal. I opted for the con carne sandwich on ciabatta with the arrechera [flank steak] meat [which isn't even the lomo filet] and I was amazed. It's also covered in Chimi and caramelized onions, which I adore. I had a side of a chicken empanada [which wasn't my favorite] but for those who wants a tad of spiciness in their selection, a good option to have.   KB has destined for a bread binge. Each portion of Tostados are 2 large supple pieces of toast grilled in olive oil just waiting for that great opportunity to be dunked in one of gaucho's 4 ridiculously well-crafted dipping sauces. We overzealously ordered 3 orders of Tostados. That's a lot of bread and a lot of dipping sauce. But SO worth it. In general, this WHOLE PLACE is SO worth it.  The only downside to this place is that my picutre of my meal did not get more likes on Instagram, but i think that may be outside gaucho's control. Loving it. Gaucho, you make Pittsburgh proud!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1n6DQJzouqXB6B1qrb0AAQ.text: Yesterday a friend texted, "Want to try Gaucho's?" I'll go anywhere and my hubs said people have been talkin' about this place so unbeknownst to what I was getting myself into, I agreed.  This place does not take any reservations. For that fact alone, I wanted to go at 3pm. Especially because it was Saturday. I said to my friend, "Only crazy people go to a good place during dinner time on a Saturday." Well - we turned into those crazy people. Not necessarily on purpose, but as the events of the evening unfolded, our party of 4 became THOSE PEOPLE who went to Gaucho's on a Saturday night. At 7pm-ish. And we wind up arriving to find a massive line around the block.  I have not stood in any line like this EVER in Pittsburgh. Correction - I have - just once - for preschool sign-up - but even still I was done with that in 20 minutes. This line? We waited in it for 1 hour and 50 minutes (just to order). In the rain. I mean we arrived, I saw this line, and I said to my friends, "What the hell have you gotten me into?" I had not researched this place. I did not see it's insanely long list of positive Yelp reviews. I felt like I was back in high school waiting for concert tickets. Fortunately, I wasn't yet hungry so I didn't care.  With all those details (long line, long wait, rain, etc) - I feel strongly there is no one other than me that had the highest of expectations for this meal. Did it deliver? Absolutely. And in exciting news, even though the wait was painful - the food was delivered fast after we were seated. For the delicious food, I would give this location 5 stars. If there's no wait - read this review as 5 stars and then go. But for the insanely painful wait and the wish that they could figure out some better solution so no one has to wait 2 hours? That's why I subtracted a star. I mean, the way this location is set up, if you're waiting, you can see the people inside eating. And you're like 4 feet away from them. While we were in this 2 hour line, I saw a man inside take 6 minutes to eat his last bite of salad. Everyone else in this party of 4 was done eating and this one person WOULD NOT STOP TALKING and just HAD to finish the last bite of salad on his plate. Fine! But you know what? When people are standing outside in the rain, waiting to eat, we're giving you death stares from the window thinking, "STOP TALKING, TAKE YOUR DAMN BITE, and be on your way!" - The fact that any restaurant could entice this kind of emotion or thought process is why I subtracted a star. I mean - our party of 4 had a fun experience but sometimes you don't want an *experience* - sometimes you just want to eat a delicious meal.   So here's the summary: 5 star food 5 star employees No reservations - so plan your time and hunger accordingly BYOB - don't forget a bottle opener FYI on those nights when the wait is insane, most people start drinking in the line ... one poor party of 4 ahead of us DROPPED THEIR BOTTLE OF WINE - it was terribly sad. Don't leave the butterfingers in your group in charge of the only thing that will keep you sane while you subject yourself to the weather and hunger games. And if you so decide to be those crazy people who go on a Saturday night like us at dinner time, bring LOTS of BYOB but do yourself a favor, don't forget some plastic cups and/or class it up by have your pregame prepared with SOMETHING in a travel coffee mug. I can't even remotely condone public drinking - I would actually be scared to open beer or wine while in line (we waited until we were inside) but I regretted not having something in hand for 2 hours.  Oh yeah - and that peanut butter bread pudding dessert? JUST SAY YES

dbXxIjgevGNaDcTx-YMbXg.text: Not typical of an Argentinean restaurant but man was it some of the best meat I've eaten.  I had the rosemary braised beef Sammy and it was to die for.  They have chimichurri  sauce and 3 others you can choose to add to your food. They were a grilled onion sauce, a red pepper and tomato sauce and a garlic sauce. The only one I didn't use was the pepper/tomato sauce. The other three were an excellent addition. I also tried the vegi empanada which I wasn't fond of but I'm an empanada snob so my expectations are high especially when you use the word empanada which shouldn't have been used here. It was more like a vegi turnover but if they called it that I would have never ordered it.  The employees are so friendly and helpful. They had big smiles and that goes along way.  The line was long but seemed to go fast. It was definitely worth the wait. The only thing I was disappointed in was the sides. They really could do better with the options.  It was very unique that you could buy a bone for your dog for $1. Awesome way to keep from wasting them.   I can't wait until the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The platter was delicious.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary braised beef. Excellent! In the back is an empanada.

GSgpV5FN8yRuYLVwWEUxow.text: Wow, they have great steaks! Gaucho is a must-try restaurant in Pittsburgh.   There is a great variety of meal choices here listed on the front wall. Most of them are priced well. I suggest you try one of the empanadas, which are all unique and flavorful. The side of charred bread is so good.   Please keep in mind that there is usually a long wait that wraps around the outside of Gaucho's front door. Dress warm in the winter months. It's worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Mp7IzP28PzmejdN9PJVOlw.text: This place was incredible.    Ordered the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich and Roasted Cauliflower which were both unbelievable in there own right.  Top these two things off with their Ajo and pimenton sauces, and if I lived in Pittsburgh, this would be the only place I'd ever eat lunch.  *Also, I really liked how the owner found people a place to sit before they ordered their food.  This service was very much appreciated, especially when your in a very busy restaurant.

HlJm73gB0QudwHdmVMPC0Q.text: The line is usually out the door, but it's worth the wait! The food here is amazing! You can't go wrong whether you get a steak or a sandwich. The quality of the desserts is a pleasant surprise. And the prices are reasonable, especially considering the location and the food quality! Don't get scared away by the line and you'll have one of the best meals Pittaburgh has to offer! Gaucho apparently opened a food truck as well, so keep an eye out around town for your Gaucho fix.

MvFPtRViIoAPma_ebsHAWw.text: I feel like I arrived pretty late to this party. At least we're there now! Clearly it was better late than never.   I held off in the beginning because past experience with Argentinean restaurants had been underwhelming - typical seemed to always be piles upon piles of mediocre meat. Well I stand corrected! This isn't what they deliver at Gaucho. Here you get incredible flavors infused into their meat dishes with well thought out sides and enhancements also packing a punch for your taste buds.   We had the good fortune to sample 3 of their dishes at a Yelp Elite event held at The Pittsburgh Winery. The guys from Gaucho were memorable in personality and their food was absolutely unforgettable.   I ordered their skirt steak which comes with a salad and bread at their restaurant the other day and honestly I may have to order it several more times before I'll be able to stray to other menu items. Yep, that perfect!  I have no idea how much effort goes into making that skirt steak taste this amazing but I know I certainly will be eating this again & again! It came served over mushrooms and onions that were also infused with all that flavor. Home run!  It's very obvious that the team who works here love what they do and their enthusiasm is pretty contagious. They are beyond thrilled that something they enjoy doing so much has been so well received by our city. They started off with such a small space that it's been tough to get in - another reason it took us so long to get here. Soon that will change when they expand their space next door. It's a classic success story: start small doing amazing food, crowds will come & you grow your business.   We will return to Gaucho & next time it won't take so long!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hangar Steak with mushrooms &amp; onions, salad &amp; bread. $12 Delight!!!!

LasaFPb29_77BUKyVgLiFw.text: Just love it,I have been 2 years ago and come back last night.Food is phenomenal.The best steak place in the city

AQojbubZt_uQgtwWCRYlNg.text: SO GOOD! My boyfriend and I were extremely ambitious and we got a small Casa Salad and an Asado Platter to share between the both of us. The salad was $5 and really tasty with red curly leaf lettuce, radish, grape tomatoes and shaved carrots. It had a yummy but not heavy salad dressing, which I really enjoyed. The Asado Platter was $50 and included a small portion of each of the five cuts of meat. Flank, sirloin, filet mignon, NY strip, and ribeye. My favorite was the filet and my boyfriend's favorite was the sirloin. Every cut was super tender. The chimichurri sauce was the best of all the sauces. Also, the Asado Platter is absolutely way too much food for two people. It's a 4 person portion and comes with toast. Definitely recommend this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El Casa Salad &amp; Asado Platter

aGFTo4JmklolG1-cwRH95Q.text: Really bad experience, I got to the restaurant an hour before closing and the door was already locked. So if you are planning to go and have dinner make sure you arrive a few hours before. They should post it on their web. closing time is not accurate!

nXD2UqLhlC2C9i5M5emL-Q.text: Steak sandwich is ridiculously good, seasonal sides are amazing...only downside here is the line, but also totally worth it

g0j1A9RKV9BaY7YWoYE94A.text: By far my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh right now! Such a cool experience and the food is AMAZING! Definitely recommend to do with friends or date night, it's so unique! Bonus it's BYOB. Can't wait to go back!!

7s0Kug39HjtAcdEYuRch0A.text: A great twist to Argentina food! Grilled to perfection a very relaxed atmosphere and easy to share plates. You get to choose the best meal for you!

wBdoaGZ_3LapiRthsug2mQ.text: Amazing quality and taste.  Most restaurants lack consistency of  execution. Not here.  Every item comes out consistently well cooked and seasoned.  If there is a negative it's the lack of space to accommodate the ever growing crowds that galdy wait in line for a taste of heaven.

63hpScjN-IglV-alzo4Mzw.text: We waited forever, and I expected to be underwhelmed. I was not, this place is worth the wait--the meat well cooked, the veggies seasoned perfectly, and on top of that it is just a fun scene to sit with friends and enjoy a meal.

AKFqcmC5_baATyH4Yk7LUQ.text: We really enjoyed our meal here. The brisket sandwich and the coleslaw were amazing. The lamb chops were also good but not as standout as the sandwich. I found the potatoes to be somewhat dry. This is a fun, casual, BYOB venue with outdoor seating (with a fireplace) and good food.

2QRAf1n0R53brnEe9bJruA.text: Super delicious. I've had the arrachera meal a couple times and the meat is perfectly cooked. The brussels sprouts are also amazing.

9sD_0V9ahkiItlAVvn7ivw.text: Amazing food - worth the wait.  Every single item melts in your mouth.  I don't know how they manage to consistently produce excellent food with amazing flavor.  We come back again and again.  You can't go wrong here.

m7u-HYBRD53YVQb8X0hPyw.text: Delicious. Based on the staff recommendation, I had the steak sandwich with filet minion. It was fabulous. Very well-seasoned and the bread was soft without being all soggy. I also love that the sauces are available separately because I'm a spice-a-phobe, but my boyfriend isn't, so we can both be happy. The sides were also excellent. The grilled corn they had in the summer was great, but every side I've tried has been good.  I was tempted to deduct a star for the lack of seating, but the food is just too good! Just be ready to eat it standing up. This place is tiny. It is better in the summer when they have the outdoor seating available.

iUGppspKSSpYuAEto8aWJA.text: The line was unreal but so was the food! I am giving them the benefit of the doubt on the line considering it was the Strip Music Festival. If it wasn't for that, I'd definitely give this a 5 star!

-4d1ry2R3kee2cDG59bKTA.text: Best steak experience I've had in a long time. A little bit of a wait, but worth it as the atmosphere more than makes up for it. Would go again.

WWSytIbgvMhJdmL_gNDlaA.text: Dined here about 3 months ago, the owner personally came up and said hello to us.  Fun atmosphere delicious sandwiches.  Great service and atmosphere vibrant fun place!

WVWCPuxw4GuSvo9W9z7dEQ.text: I'd heard about Gaucho through the grapevine for a while now. After eating there twice now (once in March and another just last week) I can honestly say I'm going to go back as often as possible as long as they'll have me. There's a reason the line is out the door every time I arrive, and it's well worth the wait. This is my first and only Yelp review because I can't think of any other establishment worthy of such praise.

G_f8n7nJpWvu5oG0FLwfFw.text: Absolutely fabulous place!!! I travel an hour, plus willingly stand on line... Every time! It's delicious, family friendly, and great service! A must place to visit in Pittsburgh!

rB-sG9sm1Huf5fSt4ogSFA.text: Yum. Great food. AWESOME service. Cheap, easy, fun little place and Pittsburgh needs like ten other spots to open that's run by these guys. Highly recommend.

ybL_dYhiSCn-iPM6me0TTA.text: I would eat here daily if I lived here.  It was incredible.  Try the corn when in season! And BYOM (Bring Your Own Malbec!)  I had the flank steak salad and it was KILLER.  The bacon on my date's BLT was smoked on that magic grill to perfection.  Happiness ensued.

AZAV1gmMfCSpLIARIlVz_g.text: Aaaammmmaaazing! I can't express how awesome this place is. I have the rosemary braised beef sandwich with empanadas and papas. I want to bring this place back to ny with me. Best sandwich I have ever had.

xVk58oKzdBVnQ-gY_rxf1w.text: Best sandwich I've had in Pittsburgh by far! So we walked past this place today and the smell of woodfire BBQ stopped us in our tracks! It's a tiny spot and it was a bit of a wait but oh man was it worth. We got the pollo con pan. Pulled chicken sandwich it was phenomenal! Tasty chicken and potatoes,The bread was amazing. Also must try the dipping sauces they have out! All of them were bursting with flavor. I also ordered the alfasmorez which was a twist on a s'more nilla wafers,marshmallow, chocolate, and ready for it? Dulce de leche! (Caramel) sooooo heavenly! (Must have a sweet tooth for this though)  While waiting I saw a bunch if delicious things being served. I also realized we should have came earlier in the day because since everything seems to be in house made they run out later In the evening. First come, first serve. Everything looked and smelled great! Service was also friendly and funny! All in all a gem I never expected to find. Will be returning soon.

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Camarones, papas gaucho, panqueues

NRtOzJf01br9k_3a1s3qYg.text: LOVE this restaurant!  The food is always phenomenal and the employees are polite.  The line gets pretty long at times but it is well worth the wait.

pdqwqfeIp3IbNx7lcCIejQ.text: Gigantic amazing sandwiches.  Yeah.  Freaking good meat.  I love the apps too.  Soooo good.

AZeIUE_uVE1s83UMtc2FVQ.text: Drive by this place twice a day and before going in I would always make fun of the people standing in line. After stopping in in the late afternoon I will undoubtedly be one of those people that I used to make fun of. Everything about the meal that we had was phenomenal. Great atmosphere to match. Definitely returning as much as possible.

_4KEqnONcKxzcMLLi5-iRg.text: Eat here!!!! It's amazing. Great for a fun night out to wear a cute outfit for sure but you can totally go there wearing and feeling whatever. It's perfect. Food is amazing. Style is unique. I dig it!

OTzFz5GOvUNkmM39NZZ_Tg.text: WOW!!! The food and service were amazing... We were in Pittsburg for the Society for Applied Anthropology Conference & found it on Yelp and the rest is history... The food was so so so good... The sauces were fabulous and I feel like we just made great friends in the staff... I've been to Argentina and nothing there could compare to this... I just wish they were in California... However next time my son and his girlfriend come to Pittsburgh to visit her family I'm placing my order!!!!

_oiIMTkg64Kxx4ZaM9e2Cg.text: Mmm mmm mmm this place is the best place to go for lunch in the 'burgh ... best known for their Argentinian wood-grilled meat, breads, sandwiches, and steak. Sandwiches are really to die for ... this is one of the few joints that I know that knows how to do sandwich bread just right. In particular my favorite sandwiches are the carne and the rosemary braised beef varieties. Any of the steak meat cuts you choose is guaranteed to be tender, lean, and juicy ... go for medium rare (you won't regret it). I also really liked their corn ... never knew that a cob cooked over a wood fire grill could be so delicious. Good small eats include the gauchos papas (seasoned roasted potatoes), which taste amazing due to the seasonings that they put on those potatoes, and camarones (shrimp), which are just impeccable with the seasonings and lemon juice.

ZYW8BsVaHLfn-f53KIV9sw.text: Definitely a new favorite! The Ribeye was cooked perfectly, the fire roasted peppers and onions were delicious, all on Ciabatta bread, which is my favorite. The small plate potatoes were perfection. They have four dipping sauces that are all fire roasted and delicious! The fire roasted corn in the husk was sweet and delicious!!! When they say their food is cooked with love, that is exactly what it is. I will frequent Gaucho often!!!!

gfqzUi97crVLbF1PVh6irw.text: Amazing- love the food quality and the presentation makes it phenom. Felt like a hipster with the crowd there LOL, but the food was worth the trip. Loved the environment and setup- an all-around A+ experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aqNKia5igaJpXs1nF-xttQ.text: A little tough to find and not a lot of parking around and not much for seating but the food was delicious. Plenty of options on the blackboard and everything seemed to be freshly prepared, I can't remember what I had but it was great and I'd be glad to go back and try something new.

psxKzYeAL2daqrByMHRnmg.text: I been around trying food over and you cannot go wrong with this place. It's a Gem. It's a little piece of heaven when it comes about meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Just half of the menu

CwwgB9XUkuu0gsC0ePexhQ.text: Busy, eccentric place in the Strip. A must try to everyone living or visiting Pittsburgh. Everything we've tried was awesome. Be willing to wait outside when you go, but that's part of the fun..... Can't wait to go again. Oh and they do take out too!

4hLrRge-Do_xR9uoDdrBYQ.text: This place is dynamite! We got the meat platter that offered an assortment of the steaks they have. Some were better than others but they were all great. Also, the sauces were phenomenal! The only thing I do not like is that you order at the front, get your own sauces, etc. It is kind of a fast casual vibe but it is a little higher priced so I did not like that we had to serve ourself for some stuff. But we will be back!

esmwfKdybxluPp_uA444KQ.text: One star off because I'm jealous there's not one in Los Angeles.  Community and fresh, organic food.  I must now make more friends in Pittsburg so I can hangout here.  Super sad.  I just ate Patty's before I got here, so just to accompany my co-worker who was running late.  So I snacked on a simple beef "delicious" empanada, while he had their recommend sandwich.  Needless to say on his first bite the look in his eyes was a "whoa" then the next bites that proceeded was of pure joy.  This is the reason main reason to come to town.

xWBwQkq-4PIbbkFOk0KgpA.text: Hands down best bit of ribeye i have ever had...   Get the humitas too if you like a little spice   everything here is cooked to perfection

s997OXZfy7zQnUWuOqPH9w.text: Went to Gaucho for the first time today and it certainly won't be my last. The food was delicious, especially the Rosemary braised beef sandwich. Yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. On recommendation tried the Rosemary braised beef sandwich and it did not disappoint.

V3bUqTgAZBN9qDl6t2Y81g.text: We were only in Pittsburgh off one night and wanted to find something different to try.  Based on the excellent rating and reviews, we tried this out. We were NOT disappointed! The food we excellent. The staff was very friendly and made a point to converse with us throughout the meal (but definitely not in an annoying way). Also the atmosphere was casual and fun and very communal in nature. This would be a great place to take a group and share several entrees with the table.

nPJdAJ_TsDM9w31B4qjQQA.text: Absolutely delicious! The line is always worth the wait. If you like meat, this is your place. The empanadas are always tasty. Definitely add this restaurant to your list.

AYZeqrfsKlkz_fo44aHNRg.text: I have a new favorite place to eat!  Order the Rosemary Braised Beef. You won't be disappointed.

tCNFZ8c32nPNRZFEFmHamQ.text: Great steak and great sandwich. You can smell the grill upon entering the restaurant. First time I had a great fish sandwich. All the herbs are fresh too. The staff is friendly. Not too much can be said since our experiences have always been great. Maybe they should stock up on corn so they don't run out when business is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye steak

9OkzavcizbmfudX92n_x5g.text: Best steak sandwiches I've ever had.  Staff is very knowledgeable and always friendly.  The chef Kurt D. is one of the most talented in the city.  Always a pleasure to visit.

hp-2rNBsO2b-10WfgVMgRg.text: Came here because of the Yelp hype...and yeah, they lived up to it.  Got garlic chorizo, chicken, and carne (filet option) sandwiches, and they were sublime.  Rich, bold flavors that complemented each other and accented the meat well.   Its a small place at the end of the strip, without much seating.  I would recommend calling ahead and ordering for carryout.

oAxeXS4tTFxPGPWuzj_HsQ.text: My friend and I were coming back from West Virginia from his residency interview and we decided to stop by Pittsburgh to see the sights and grab food on the way back to NY.   We found this cozy little Argentinian grub hub. We were immediately greeted by the staff and one girl promptly came to help us decipher the menu choices.   I had the chanchito sandwich (cuz I love arugula) and my pal had the carne (choice meat was rib eye) sandwich.   It came promptly and my my, it was delicious. Pork was tender, right amount of tangy from the pickles onion and bitter from the arugula. I inhaled my sandwich.   My friend thought his beef over seasoned and both meat and bread was a bit burned. He did enjoy it tho.   T'was a nice visit to Pittsburgh, def recommendation. Surrounded by nice chill spots on the Strip. Too bad we had to leave early. Beautiful city, black and yellow painted all over.

kuDh3Wg5qGFKW5ZU8duP7g.text: I was saving my 100th Yelp review for somewhere special, and Gaucho deserves my triple digit cherry.  You smell Gaucho before you see it, freshly prepared tender meats and chimichurri sauce massage your nose from a block away.    Gaucho means cowboy in spanish, and you will eat a cow worth of the juiciest steak you've ever had in your life.  Everything on the menu is delicious and perfectly walks the line between traditional and inventive.  Very reasonable prices, friendly accommodating staff, a fun, unique style, and generous portions (My steakburger was roughly the size of my head, and yes, I still managed to eat the whole thing).  The only thing they could do better is get bigger and expand for more seating, but since they do discounted take out, I'd be glad to take it home and be a Coucho Gaucho in the comfort of my living room!

qqliTp3qDMkw6Hjz0B5BSg.text: Just amazing food! It's delicious, the portions are huge, and the prices worth it. It's very small and cozy, the staff very Friendly and welcoming, with a hipster vibe. Definitely worth stopping by. Try anything on the menu! I'd recommend one of the small streaked with a pequeno on the side: the Jamon Serrano was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious!

4jevqQY7ZPZmVeur_eULFg.text: We went for a private party and, oh my god, it was fantastic. I will definitely be going back. The sauces and vegetables and desserts were truly outstanding and the meat was perfect. Really great restaurant. Highly recommend.

DjAghEwugMUzssGW5PA4_w.text: I had the steak burger and it was very good. Nice size lunch portion. Little pricey, but worth it. Nice people working there. Go and enjoy.

ecYNEw_q-_ZbIF2XiUfm7Q.text: Love it! Food- fantastic! Even after expanding the restaurant the quality and taste remains  worth it! The service we had was better than 9 out of 10 of the best local restaurants in Pgh.  You order at the counter and the staff helps find a seat for your party.  There are no reservations and you are not seated by a hostess but these guys have it down. They serve your food make sure everything is cool and check in on you. If you want additional items they'll place the order for you vs having to stand in line again. Lucky to have in Pgh!

ICueUHKeqreM7kTWJ5zPpw.text: This review is long overdue.  I came to this place earlier on this year while I was in Pittsburgh working.  This food is unreal.  I came with a couple friends and we shared the meat sampler plate, which comes with all the different types of meat they sell. we also got a veggie sampler plate and two sides of potatoes.  Everything was amazing.  Especially their homemade sauces.  The flavors are incredible.  I want to come back to Pittsburgh just so I can eat at this place again.  Seriously. Go eat there now.

CNaBaIpk7w-unFztFxoKHw.text: forget about. Best eats in Pittsburgh. Bar none. Come early though, especially for lunch. This place is crowded from open until close

zKJZXxH5XllAW09vLj88LA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh.  The food is good and flavorful and the staff is friendly.  We take all our friends and family here when they come to visit!

8MQ1tyNUwz3dIH9fvqrSmg.text: Absolutely great place for lunch or weekend shopping. It's a little cramped inside, but worth it. Everything on the menu that I've had has been delicious so you really can't go wrong. Definitely try all the sauces they have set out. Worth the price.

_8ZhVKnaT6jbmwtMeih6fw.text: The restaurant has a nice atmosphere, laid back. Staff is friendly. The food is good.

UhJ9iRCLMh8QdgdgDCE4nA.text: Everyone I talked to said this was the the best place for a carnivore in Pittsburgh. If anything, they undersold. Went there before the expansion, so had to stand in line outside in the rain, but was worth it. The staff came out and handed out umbrellas! Who does that? I'm glad the line was so long, because it took me awhile to narrow down the choices. Will definitely go back.

qDZWlc_2vzSJRq1QiTQT5Q.text: Talk about awesome and tasty food! I loved this place when it was a small hole in the wall and the quality definitely did not suffer when they expanded. Highly recommend eating here - especially the Rosemary Braised Beef.

qrwAomL6ALfN6R3z8bWxVg.text: Delicious!! One of our favorite places to eat.  It definitely deserves the high ratings it receives.

oOYmZiHD4YDzeefNiUsZOQ.text: Everything is great. Just be warned that the lamb dinner is three scrumptious but tiny medallions. You will be left chewing the bones for more food.

8FI5D0-IWrbjFYo68eH_zw.text: Best decision I've made in recent memory. I had passed by Gaucho numerous times while in the strip and I made a mental note to try it. I was somewhat concerned it was going  to be like the Brazilian and argentine steak houses with massive amounts of meat and prices to match. Oh but how wrong I was. I came in on a Tuesday evening after deciding eating at 9pm reservation was way too late for my five year old. I was overwhelmed by all the meat options and somehow ended up getting a gaucho salad ( don't judge I love meat) after asking the charismatic chef for recommendations . My salad had fancy lettuce, avocado, roasted corn carmelized onions and other stuff . Somehow I missed that it didn't have meat . Boooo my reading skills suck. My guy ordered the rosemary steak sandwich and I tried his . My salad was good but I coveted that steak sandwich like it was salvation or an invisibility cloak. It was so tender and flavorful with great bread. This is definitely a place I'll take friends family when I wanna show them the best Pgh has to offer.

qWReSBtWsZlREqtlaGnxhA.text: One of only a handful of "must try" restaurants in the Pitt.  This place is tits.

SRtgh0Yugj-1o4ytA8mj5A.text: What an experience!! The food, the atmosphere, the courteous staff - you can't beat this restaurant!! The pulled pork and corn pudding were outstanding! I highly recommend trying this restaurant. You will not be disappointed.

AaSsEwmuQB9r4XeNI-mK6Q.text: Ok, I do really really like this place, food is fantastic &  been there I bunch of times.  But....  They do need to work on the experience.   I can accept waiting outside in the rain because they have nowhere for customers to wait, and I can accept setting my own table once you claim one.   Last night my wife and I made the trip into the city to hit one of our goto places, we arrived at 8:35 to a pretty short line, great right!  Nope, the poor schmuck at the end of the line had the unpleasant job of telling anyone who comes in the he was the end of the line while holding a giant end of line sign.  Really!  it's 8:30 and they  advertise closing at 9.  I found the whole thing just stupid.  Now it's late and we have to find somewhere else to go.   I get this is one of those places who's thing is all about the food that you can't get anywhere else & it grew out of that self serve concept which is kind of cool the first few times.   Now it's annoying.  BTW,our flank steak with chimichurri with red beans and farofa recipe is pretty awesome... Look out! haha.

iwIzYJdMLXkCugJkn65pWw.text: Seriously, don't waste your time reading this review. Get your butt in line, now! Try the corn & chicken sandwich! Amazing. Honest.. just get there.

Kt4vGW0i2SIzVXbIzARRhw.text: This was our first time traveling to Pittsburgh and this was the one restaurant we wanted to try. At first the menu is overwhelming, but the staff came around and offered assistance to help us with our order. There were 3 of us, so we ordered the Asado Plate to split. It is 5 cuts of beef (filet mignon, skirt, NY strip, flank and ribeye) cooked to your desired temp. We also ordered the Papas Cuna, which is potato salad, and an order of the mixed vegetables. The food was amazing. This was by far our favorite restaurant that we ate at while in town. Highly recommend going here. Note: they don't serve alcohol, so bring your own wine or beer with you.

FK4lK-38EygOK7bKwzm0Lg.text: The food here is delicious, but the last couple times I have been here it seems like the size of the sandwich is continually decreasing. I usually get the rosemary beef, and when I first started eating here the sandwich was almost twice the size it is now. I'm not sure it's worth what they charge any more, very disappointing.

1w8wnz1eOzNpn2aLv9msbw.text: Best food ever!!! Do not forget to order grilled corn and potatoes on the side.

GU4WOCZHsBUvxbAD9hQkuA.text: I've been about 6 times. good sandwich and meats. they can get a little too charred. i don't see why its such a high rating...its not a full service restaurant.

ybilOdUBTghQrA8kzRvVEQ.text: Excellent quality meats and food. Very friendly staff as well. Not big so it's either a take out place or you can eat on the patio outside if it's nice out.

8NgbHtW4PGARUyZ0V53wiA.text: The food is excellent and I am so happy about the expanded seating area!    I love this place - I've never had a bad meal.

23t14mgC3L-xqnLbjrOKBg.text: The food is wonderful. A nice addition to the strip

XgnlzgKmVaLExQw_l3lUgw.text: Believe the hype... I've only been in twice, both times with a line out the door, and most recently had one of the most deeply satisfying Filet con pan (sandwich) I can ever recall, along with a side of spicy caramelized brussel sprouts, I share the overwhelming love expressed for Gaucho.

LJMsN3yC0oHTBqG37kSx1Q.text: Heard great things but was average in my opinion. Unique but price was expensive for what I got

TFH98Ij--w_7J2aP-r4w-g.text: I'll be brief...this is the best tasting, highest quality steak sandwich I have ever eaten!  The guys were EXTREMELY friendly, and even offered us beers right before they closed.  I can't wait to fly back to Pittsburgh just to eat here again.

6yRtm2TEIsZ_1GurwhvuVA.text: If you're a meat lover and you happen to be in Pittsburgh even for one day you have to try this place! Everything is grilled to perfection on a wood fired grille! Staff are friendly and nice! Prices are very reasonable. I'll give 5 out of 5 stars for sure!

yDhgdnjvS2ze107WXsvVeQ.text: If you are willing to wait for a while, you will not be disappointed.  The food is really good and you get a great amount for the price.  I recommend the pork sandwich with onions and spicy mustard.  Great atmosphere and the staff were friendly and helpful.  Would go back for sure.

Hm_zAxMn4P6Kd5xZHUbnlQ.text: Had the rosemary shrimp, grilled veggies, and the rosemary beef brisket. It was good but there are better places to stop in Pittsburgh. Sit outside and make sure you grab some spices if you want them. It's BYOB too.

lvUBezPFEgZSGHDMGy1z6w.text: Amazing! I could smell the place 2 blocks away. I'm assume that this is what heaven will smell like.  The line way a bit long but the anticipation of the food made it tolerable. An emploee explained the different sandwiches to me and even convinced me to get the carmelized onions (i had informed her that i don't like onions). I ordered 3 sandwiches to go (steak burger w/arrugula & provolone cheese, pork w/ carmelized onions & spicey mustard & rosemary braised beef w/ carmelized onions). The steak burger & pork were incredible.  The pork sandwich was maybe the best sandwich I've ever had.  Can't wait to try the rosemary beef later.

ywOJmpTsyWvwrYTOX5tEMA.text: I really would have liked to give these guys 4 or 5 starts but in spite of great appetizers, reasonable prices, and friendly service, the flank steak entree I had was pretty lacking. It just tasted charred. I intend to go back and try a different dish because I have a really good feeling about this place and I think they may have just messed up my order. But I was not impressed with the first steak I had.

8BNW5N2Q-N56RreC6UBYLQ.text: Great food and nice ambiance! Customer service is amazing!

N18MHnrBc12DqmWCBlD2Mw.text: Ordered the steak burger with Caramelized onions and mushrooms! Sandwich was huge! Could feed 2. Anthony is awesome, friendly and upbeat staff!

n-ebhT0eqfZsQtSf12yOlg.text: Best steak sandwich anywhere.  The pork sandwich is even better.  Food, service and atmosphere are all about as good as you can get.   Pricing is pretty good too.  There is nothing on the menu that I've tried that hasn't been fabulous.  Finally tried the burger here and it is so good you will want to go to every burger place you have ever been to and demand an apology.   I used to think burgatory was the benchmark but Gauchos has elevated the burger game to new heights.  It's almost unfair to the rest.

37M2qk1CgM88uP3wLltTGA.text: Amazing!!! Some of the best food I've had in awhile and a great deal. Definitely returning here!

_gLepTXkq6meP6Zy-_vvZA.text: Come by around 7pm and they were out of half the items we wanted. We were staying in a hotel with an infant, so we decided to get take out. We ordered a few sides and the Ribeye Vaca (large). We were assured it came salad as stated on the menu. When we got back to our hotel we noticed it was clearly absent and weren't about to walk back to the store for a salad.  The relatively small steak and toast were not worth the price paid.  Last time we went, in their old facility, it was one of the best meals I have had.  Sad.

owSa_A7Ila5YjLt3R0ZD7g.text: I regret not trying this place sooner. Just the smell when you first walk in is intoxicating. Just as a warning there is not much seating area so I would recommend going for take out or go during an off time.    I ordered the hanger steak which came with a salad and toast and some sort of sauteed onions. This dish was very, very flavorful and looked as amazing as it tasted. I usually take a picture of every dis I order, however, I was too hungry and the smell was just too good for me to waste any time taking a picture. It is basically medium rare though so if you are not into that then maybe try something else or ask for it to be cooked more. It was certainly an adventure for me because I am more of a medium person and like seeing pink not red. My friend ordered the Carne sandwich with rib-eye and man it was bigger than I thought it would be. It. Was. Incredible! I would for sure recommend this dish to try first. There are also 4 sauces to choose from on a table and since I am a big fan of sauce and it was my first time I decided to try them all as a dip to the sandwich and toast that came with the hanger steak. They all add even more depth and tastiness to the food. Either way the flavors are there.   Lastly, The service was great and comforting. I don't know if it was the manager or the owner of the place that asked how the flavors were and made sure we were happy with our dishes, but it was a great surprise to see someone care so much for the outcome of everyone's food. Basically just go and go now!

KJnW9Kw_fsFstY7kcHdegg.text: The only thing I'm disappointed with is my not knowing of Gaucho's existence sooner.  My friend and I both had the carne sandwich (mine filet; his skirt), and they were simply melt-in-your-mouth fantastic.  The sauces were also incredibly fresh and tasty, so good in fact that we purchased a container to go.  Great food, friendly staff, unique environment--what more could you ask for?  A carnivore foodie's heaven.

Bp9EzS5VAOt7fV3q0DL9gQ.text: Don't be discouraged by the line around the block- that's a good sign. Probably one of the best restaurants in the city- I brought an out-of-town friend here a few months ago and when he came back recently, he specifically requested dinner here again.  I did the regular menu for my first one or or two visits, but last week a group of us were offered the chance to skip the line and do the prix fixe menu downstairs in their private events room.  Great decision- definitely more expensive, but fun for a change.  The servers were really knowledgeable and personable and seemed concerned with us having a good experience. I'll be back.

ohxEvPIy2gZGrBHV86t6Dw.text: There's really nothing I could say that hasn't already been said about the great food this place has. Oh wait, they don't take Amex! Lol. Great food!

238sYYGlgxbJKJ5KzbrhpA.text: Best pollo in town. Friendly staff, affordable price with amazing food.   Dont miss to try out their house special sauces.

-uPiIh5vZAHEd13KNUzVLw.text: So I was in town for the weekend and stumbled on this 4.5/5 review on yelp and never tried Argentine food so figure I check it out. I read the previous reviews and it said that this place gets busy, I called ahead and they said it was a hour half wait. I went because people swear by this place. And the line was wrapped onto the street and it was pretty cold. I ended up waiting for about an hour half like she said. I ended up ordering the carne sandwich with rib eye medium rare with the peppers and caramelized onions. I gotta say it was a 7/10? It was good and it had this bomb red sauce on the side you could pair it with. They gave a generous portion, I couldn't even finish it. But the steak was cooked good, it was hard for me to cut my knife into the bread of the sandwich but overall it was okay, the hot cocoa bread pudding was a little of a let down. 6.5/10? I love bread pudding but this didn't blow me away whatsoever. But overall I wasn't completely disappointed with the place. Staff there is super nice. And it's tight on seating too. I don't know if I'd be back but I didn't think it was worth that long wait,  I give this place a 7/10 overall.

RcLtidpEzFLt0IClxOIoqg.text: It says this place closes at 9pm. Got there at 8:24pm and was told that they were not taking anymore dine-in, just carry-out only. Also, they have the last dine-in customer in line tell other people that they are not taking anymore dine-in customers. Shouldn't their staff be doing that?! You all are too nice. As a patron, I would not want to take on the stress of turning down other customers and dealing with their complaints. No way. That is management's job. Very unprofessional of this establishment.   While I was talking with my partner debating what to do, a staff member locked the door at 8:30pm. Again, this place is supposed to close at 9pm. We were then told that they were no longer taking dine-in or carryout orders. Not sure if this is a Pittsburgh thing, but in every city that I have lived in, I have never seen an establishment lock their doors before closing time. Very unprofessional.  Definitely not going back.

9X4p3JRomyQjxGQDUI1VfA.text: Went here on a first date and couldn't have asked for a better experience, from food to servers to the wait line that wrapped around the building - this place left such warm memories. The food was fantastic, of course! The environment was lively and servers so personable. Thank you for a wonderful time!

NVmAoVu1BPE_e6Z5IM6TVw.text: There's two people Pittsburgh that I truly trust when it comes to food, and Gaucho was the first restaurant that both of them mentioned as a must-visit for me.  And they were right.  Whether you're getting a sandwich, a salad, or a plate, be prepared for charred meaty goodness, and absolutely gigantic flavors.  A few reasons I knew I was going to like Gaucho BEFORE I even got my food:  1. There was a gang of grandmas on bikes leaving when we walked in. I've  never seen a gang of grandmas on bikes before, so as far as I know these grandmas only eat at Gaucho. Which seems like a strong endorsement.  2. The nice young woman behind the counter was wearing a necklace/scarf made of receipt paper, and making it look good. Basically, everyone that works here seems like they enjoy their job, which is always a good sign.  3. The menu is full of all the things I want in my life.  A few reasons I really, really loved Gaucho AFTER I got my food.  1. The Carne Sandwich. This comes with your choice of steak; I went ribeye, which was a juicy, fatty, perfect medium rare, sliced up and slapped onto that amazing bread with char-grilled peppers. If they put more chimichurri on it, it would've been perfect. Luckily, they have jars of chimichurri* available. I put more on, and it was perfect.  2. The Paletilla de Cordero. This is a roasted lamb shank with root vegetables in a phenomenal gravy, over grits, with a charred piece of bread to top it off. It is impossible to decide whether this dish was more beautiful or delicious, because it was so beautiful, and so delicious.  3. The Gaucho Salad. This fresh and colorful salad is the exact thing to order on top of two disgustingly meaty dishes to make you feel like you didn't beast too hard at lunch. But you did. You really, really did.  4. The sauces. Yes, the chimichurri is fantastic and I want to slather it on everything. But don't sleep on the other sauces! This joint knows flavor, and I would gladly drink the ajo, the pimenton, and of course, the always enigmatic quiquirimichi.  In case you didn't realize, my list of things I love after I got my food was all of my food. Because all the food here is delicious. Don't miss it. ____________  *It turns out chimichurri is autocorrected to 'chino hurry.' Which is racist, Apple. But chinos and everyone else should probably hurry to Gaucho before they run out of meat. (I don't think they ever run out of meat.)

iLmg2n2WghYDd_G817J0XQ.text: This is a BYOB establishment. The food was different yet not different. Menu is LARGE. Atmosphere is inviting and warm.

0TUG6S7S0dVP6MEkUEOBCQ.text: Expertly executed beef with deep maillard crust, fresh beef flavor, exquisite sauces, and big soft garlicky bread. Executed in the Argentinian "Gaucho" tradition.   Expect to wait in line for this meal. It's well worth it. I ordered the Carne Sandwich with the Ribeye option. The Ribeye was perfectly tender, cooked exactly to my medium rare preference. The crust was salty, deeply savoury, and slightly reminiscent of green aromatics. This is some of the best beef I've ever had. It is unquestionably worth the price just for this beef.   The sandwich comes on a buttery type of foccacia slathered in garlic sauce. The bread is soft and chewy. It's quite excellent. However, I found it to hide the flavors of the ribeye too much. So I pulled apart the sandwich and ate it in pieces.   The sandwich is topped with carmelized onions and red peppers which balanced the sandwich's flavor profile with sweet and acidic notes.   I tried the Ajo and chimi sauces. I found the chimi sauce to be a bit too "green" for the ribeye. I much preferred to dip into the Ajo (Garlic).   Gaucho is clearly an iconic part of the contemporary moderately-priced Pittsburgh food landscape. The attention to detail and respect for natural flavors is executed at a world-class level. If you come to Pittsburgh and like food, skip all the carby sandwiches and come first to Gaucho.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye Sandwich

uEvFn6zlCnjWJfFFPjmfmg.text: Came for lunch around 1230 and waited maybe 10 min, when they took our order the line was around the corner! So we came at good time. We had the braised beef sandwich and ribeye steak, and grilled sweet corn. All delicious. The salads looked amazing. I'd love it they had seating outside or rooftop. Cool place, but felt a little rushed. Service was good, nice staff

iTJZvR0hKtnylexxgQl1Hw.text: My first time here after hearing a lot of hype and it didn't disappoint! The line snaked outside on a Saturday afternoon but it moved quickly and as soon as we entered the building we could smell the delicious aroma. The menu was extensive and we had difficulty deciding what to get!! We settled on the seared shrimp ("camarones") to share and I got the Carne sandwich, one of their staples. All was delicious and service was quick!! Would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Camarones
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Sandwich

ObAR02DyR_V32UE27ikXNg.text: Definitely a place to go with out-of-towners and show them one of Pittsburgh's best restaurants.  We took a group here and they talked about it for the rest of the weekend!  If you can, get to Gaucho early because it gets very crowded and you will have to wait in a line out the door and around the corner!  The staff has the whole line, ordering, seating thing down to a science, so while it may take a little while, they are very efficient at getting everyone in as fast as they can.  I'm not that much of a steak eater, so I ordered the steak burger which was $12 and enormous, it was a little dry, but the sauces at Gaucho are delicious and were the perfect topper to the burger.  Other members of my group ordered the Asado platter which is 5 different cuts of steak and served with toast.  They loved being able to try the different types of steak and enjoyed them all!  The side dishes here are just as good as the main dishes, we tried the beans n greens and the papas al horno and I could not get enough of either.  Gaucho has so much good food and it is really reasonably priced.  This will continue to be a place to share with others and to come for a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Asado platter! 5 different cuts of steak!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. These shrimp were so good!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burger topped with egg and arugula $12

v3-tz2B71bvE8ydxWTz7pQ.text: I have never left Gaucho hungry or disappointed.  Wood fired meats and munchies, all world class. It was one of the few places we could eat out while doing Whole30 and it was well worth the effort. I've had much of the menu and absolutely nothing here will let you down.   The Empanadas here are phenomenal. Generous portions and so, so flavorful.  The El Gaucho salad is a delight, as it adds roasted Beets and Avocado to the already excellent La Casa salad. Get it with the Braised Beef and do a tiny happy dance while you eat it.  Speaking of Beef, meats!  They are most well known for their meats here and they deliver every time. Get that Asado Platter and share it with someone you love. Nothing brings people together like 5 cuts of steak.  One last thing: Sauces. GET. THEM. ALL.

1ensT25j2E-tV5Vfcf-8Ow.text: Long line up but moves quick. Amazing steak, first time for us to try chorizo empanadas. Bread pudding is great as well. Nice location, just next to a bridge and river.

cvTECuG6Wt5eo3M1Jg4UdA.text: Wow what an amazing meal.  The steak was perfectly cooked and so flavorful.  The sauces were delicious.  The food makes up for the weird way you order and get seated but for food that good, I'd swim across the Allegheny in January if they asked.  If you love meat this place will give you the good type of meat sweats.  Definitely will be going there more often.

njkJWXVsAyGv5A9iH4fCqQ.text: We went here for the first time for my husbands birthday this year. When we arrived we had already known there would be a wait, considering it's very popular and there's always a line. We waited about a hour and finally got up to order. We ordered the meat platter with all 5 types of steak. Our favorite part about trying the meats is to see which we like the best, and to compare. It was a little disappointing when the food finally came out, they had forgot to label each meat. The waiter that delivered it also didn't know which was which....so we just ate a big pile of meat lol. Made it a little fun trying to guess what each cut was.  The food was EXCELLENT though regardless of not knowing what we were exactly eating. Will be returning again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

r-dRGJVVTpSxy0k-Qk6SFw.text: Gaucho is one of those must stop places in Pittsburgh.  You can smell the wood fired cooking from down the block in the Strip..... and usually see the line forming to get food atleast 30 minutes prior to them opening.  I usually get the Braised Beef Sandwich with Horseradish when I eat here and honestly, it is fantastic. They have a selection of 3-4 condiments for you to apply to your food that are all amazing.... from hot pepper to chimichurri sauce!  Just make sure you get there early, and be ready to jump on a table when it opens bc the restaurant is too small for the amount of business that pushes through on a daily basis.   Stay open minded and give them a shot!

R1insbIbBDrbfCHq_EYo8g.text: Firstly the smell is mouth watering just like their food. Choice of meat, how it's cooked, variety, vegetarians can find food here. I had the carne and it was full of flavor. Thick bread so I pulled some of it out. Will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4HeWUXKPRSao88ybJFHJbg.text: What can I say, Gaucho is amazing. You're going to have to wait in line, but that's a given and it's well worth it! My best suggestion is to go at an "off" time, for both of my Gaucho experiences I've arrived around 2 or 3 in the afternoon and the line is pretty manageable.   You can't go wrong with the steak plates, which come in small (6 oz) or large (12 oz). They come with a Gaucho salad and bread. The steak sandwich is also amazing if you're in the mood for a sandwich. You can pile the sandwich up with just about any topping you'd like. Additionally, they do different empanadas daily; we tried the chicken and they were pretty yummy.   After getting seated and while waiting for your food, load up on all of the sauces. They're all delicious in their own way, but the chimi is my go-to. By the time you have your sauces, your food will arrive.
