It's crazy fast, which is great after waiting in a long line of anticipation.   The only thing I noticed is their meat is a bit under cooked. I always order a medium steak, but at Gaucho I would go with a medium-well just to make sure the meat isn't too red.   Another win for Gaucho is their food truck Asado which can be found at popular breweries in the area throughout the week.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sirloin carne sandwich, NY strip plate, ribeye plate, and chicken empanadas.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. NY strip (large) steak plate is a huge portion!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Don&#39;t miss out on all of their delicious sauces!

I9mJYy8mvtAnsmDeSERRXg.text: Food: Great - Their meats and sauces are incredible. Hands down best Argentinean resturant in the city. Must try and definitely worth the wait. Bread pudding is delicious.  Service: Excellent - Everyone is very attentive and prides themselves in serving, even the owner.  Overall: Highly Recommend - If you're only In the city for a short time and want a memorable food experience, this should be the first place you try.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dF-sa1TBEcO_kjZNnKtV8Q.text: Great little restaurant if you like Argentinian food, the quality of the food is sublime and the sandwitches have fresh bread. Alot of sauces to choose from and the dishes are pretty unique if you are unfamiliar with Argentinian food. I would start with a couple different steak sandwiches and work my way through the menu.  FYI the lines here can get alittle ridiculous, especially during dinner time so go a couple hours before to prevent standing in line for 40 mins. Although the wait is worth it!

oiWERONom5tsiGlPGNVLpA.text: I'm pretty much just piling on at this point, but everything you read about this place is True. It's ridiculously good. The filet was the most tender steak I ever had. My wife and I split everything, we also got a flank steak sandwich which was very good, and some empanadas which were also tasty. The sauces are king here, my favorite was the Ajo (garlic) but they are all good. Be prepared to wait, but it's BYOB so just drink outside while you wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flank steak carne sandwich
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet. Potatoes. Corn
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Choc chip cookie

PowUlyz2LHY650lg7zLOgw.text: There's no flaws in the menu.  Not a single thing I've had here has been disappointing. The experience is interesting as you pay before you are seated and there is no waiter service. This takes away from the restaurant feel but also gives you the privacy of not being bothered during your meal. The drawback here is that you can't really add to your order if you under ordered. This can be remedied by over ordering which is encouraged because as I mentioned before, there are NO flaws in the menu.   Fish, good. Shrimp great. Everything cooked to perfection. That being said, I'd recommend getting it a little bit more towards the medium/ medium rare side then the rare side...because they will serve it RARE...like raw. Even so, it is delectably delightful meat and all the sides and sauces compliment well and are all more than reasonably priced. BYOB only makes this the best place to bring a date.   It's only a little bit upsetting that I wanted more but waiting in the line for potatoes or more vegetables was just not worth it and you can't just cut everyone and add to your meal or ask your waiter. So order everything.

D3d8UVQxPWhvmqKbIOdd4A.text: Wonderful sandwiches and a cool vibe!! We've been fortunate to get here at off peak times so the lines aren't horrendous. Love the green salsa. Thought the paella was okay, it really didn't hold up to the hype or the price--definitely better meats!

SnkPNdxkguznfm6oiNzXNQ.text: The food at Gaucho is well worth the wait in line. We had the steak sampler (can't remember what it's called), the paella and empanadas, all were outstanding, both in taste and presentation.

_84qIUCxXdAEZIJytgqQ0A.text: Fun atmosphere and good food. The empanadas were excellent. I ordered the Cerdo (pulled pork). It had excellent flavor, but was a bit salty. The roasted cauliflower and red potato sides were OK, but I'd skip them in the future so I had more room for the main course. The peanut butter and chocolate bread pudding was also great! The staff was friendly and efficient. There was a line out the door when we got there, but we moved through pretty quickly and were given a table as soon as we ordered. Definitely a fun place and worth the visit.

ZQ4IBXpZCwCUBWoNlrCZjQ.text: Maybe the best food in Pittsburgh.  So much flavor.  You're paying for quality at this place, and you get it, every time.    The salsas (probably not called that) are all amazing.  If it wasn't socially inappropriate, I would put a straw in those pitchers and use that as a drink with my meal.

zLqDjVJWvW1JJ81wUfEY1g.text: Food amazing, ambiance amazing and did I mention the food is amazing?? The staff is friendly and quick. It's a byob so that is a huge plus

mDUzWg7PI0p4O5EuqfZ8PA.text: I love this place.  I'm shocked it took me so long to finally give this place a chance.  Just walking by the smell tries to lure me in.  Finally- we decided to go after being told we have to. I'm so glad we did.  They have some of the yummiest meat here... And I'm a sucker for good steak.  I have tried the NY Strip, Flank and Strip and have zero complaints. Everything we have had here has been great actually (papas bravas, provoletta, corn on the cob, etc).   The only complaints are hours... Some days I just can't get here before 7pm.  Seating- in the winter, it will be tough unless they expand (that is unless you get it to go). I'm sure that these are a possible change as they evolve.  I can't wait to come back!

yxNcMlctJ1zOcV5zSwPWsg.text: BYOB but not cash-only. Amazing food. Known for the meats but don't skimp on the sides, either!

0DJE4KwXSwkH6uWK8pQcHQ.text: There is something about Gaucho that makes me drool.  Just standing outside you smell the amazing scent of  their grill and hunger takes over.  There is usually a line forming, but that's how good it is.  I'd wait an hour in line for the delicious good at Gaucho.    I ordered "Pollo con Pan" or their chicken sandwich with onions, peppers, and so much flavor that you cannot stop eating it till it's gone... Hence why I  don't have a picture :)  Their Rosemary Beef Sandwich is also amazing.    If you're going to the Strip and crave something delicious, stop at Gaucho.  If you're not in the Strip, I suggest you go and try the amazing food at Gaucho... You can thank me later.

QdJT92m0SJsyQvhgQQ4WWg.text: So what good is another 5-star review? But I must review it- I'm obsessed with this place! I tried it for the first time a few weeks ago, and I took crazy pictures and sent it to all my friends. I told them they had to visit just for the sandwich alone!  The steak sandwich is truly their best thing. It's grilled and seasoned perfectly! Although they have a sauce station, it really isn't necessary. The broiche bun is also chewy, and it doesn't get soggy. The papas (potatoes) are done well, and the grilled corn- a must as well.  I loved, loved it. I've had similar offerings in other major cities, and this is one of best sandwiches I've tried. Who knew that Pittsburgh had the best Argentinian steak sandwich?  Oh yeah, BYOB with no corking fee. Score!

M56YDm_x-agchBQ44oR73w.text: Get the flank steak, and add chimichurri. That is my advice. You can't go wrong here! Everything is amazing. They have 4 sauces that you can help yourself too, but the chimichurri is easily the best. All of their entrees are fantastic but I can't stray away from their steak! The potatoes are a perfect side dish. I've never been disappointed here!

SMgIw7_YgJigxHkV9v0bHQ.text: Went here for dinner.  A little skeptical due to the line.  It took a while to get in. But the menu looked good.  Once we got in it was quick.  The lamb was amazing.  The staff was great.  The flank steak was very good.  The staff was very knowledge.  Awesome.

NXJwGHyJLx5ICMo6Qs-Pvw.text: Great authentic food. A must do when you're in Pittsburg! Party of 7 and everything was delicious!!

NLv8g9U8fN3y2pb1NRI85w.text: This is definitely top 5 restaurant in Pittsburgh for food. Their grilled meat, especially steak is absolutely amazing. The only gripe I have is that it is almost impossible to get a seat there. Every time I drive by there is a huge line. No reservations , no No Wait app.....only option is to stand in line. I just don't want to wait in line for 1-2 hours for a restaurant. I just had their food truck (Asado), and it was amazing as well. Great lamb sandwich. Top 5 for sure, but who knows when I will be able to enjoy it again.

2KkePTnmga5ZEaU6zwgZCg.text: Small, and I mean really small restaurant at the end of the strip district. Specialty is Argentinean style meats. If you are a meat lover, this place is a must  although they do have some vegetarian options. Try the sauces, they compliment the meats.  Love the place, only negative is that they close rather early. 7:00 p.m.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iKhdsim-ZdXAOxSQYnXl9g.text: This is an experience I would recommend. It's a tiny, tiny, TINY place at the edge of the Strip toward downtown. There are maybe 8 seats in the entire place, and at popular times, there are people lined up out the door. The reason they're all lined up is that the food is quite good. We had a rosemary braised beef sandwich and a gaucho salad. Both were quite good. The former was well seasoned and balanced by some cheese and grilled onion. The latter was a collection of a variety of veggies.   The food isn't too cheap, but the quality is very high.

o_0jgwNLzrRIVkIUHOE8-w.text: Im on the bandwagon..... im in the military and stopped here on my way to the airport. I was in uniform and the cashier literally pulled out his credit card and paid for my meal. Extremely unecessary, but i am unbelievably greatful. I got a strip steak sandwich to go so I didnt get to experience sitting down, but next time that will be happening. The crew members joked around with me and all seemed extremely pleasant. From a service standpoint definently a 10 out of 5. Lets get to the sandwich.... the bread. So fresh so delicious just absolutely incredible. The steak? Cooked perfectly and again, delicious. The peppers and onions? They had some sort of sweet glaze or sauce with it, which blended perfectly. Oh my goodness. To say it was amazing is such a huge understatement! Im a big eater and the sandwich was enough to make me feel content (trust me.... it took all my effort to not gorge myself to death of extra food.....). Anyways, please excuse me as i go take a food coma nap.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aJvrBSyVQhAQfl8yhLA7jw.text: Wow. Great place.  We both had burgers and loved them.   Sat out on the porch and enjoyed the patio.  Absolutely will be back!

sOQtHoChDv6VGsl7nPifUQ.text: Seriously? More than a 100 reviews, and an average 5 star rating on Yelp? It's certainly rare to find a restaurant with 5 stars after this number of reviews.  I had to try it to believe it.  Food (9.5/10) = Simply incredible.  The first time I visited Gaucho, I went with the most frequently mentioned Yelp item - the carne (steak) sandwich.  This sandwich is HUGE!  Generous portions of a cut of your choice.  I go for the ribeye, which is a great choice for flavor.  Other components of the sandwich include roasted red bell peppers, onions, chimmi churri sauce.  The bread just absorbs all the juices from the meat and roasted peppers, not letting any flavor go to waste.  If a sandwich is not your thing, there's certainly a variety of other proteins for your choosing, both from the land and sea.  I was surprised and impressed with how absolutely delicious Gaucho's camarones (shrimp) were.  I'm always weary of ordering seafood if I'm not near the coast line, with the concern for freshness.  But goddamn, these shrimps were hella succulent.  Sooo succulent.  Other worthy proteins include the chorizo, chicken, and flank steak.  If you're in the mood for some vegetables, Gaucho's grilled corn, and their mix of asparagus, portabello, onions, peppers, zuchinni, are also great choices.  If you still need more flavor, there are 4 sauces to help enhance the experience:   1) chimmi churri (fresh herbs, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, vinegars), 2) pimenton (charred pepper, garlic, fresh herbs, extra virgin olive oil), 3) ajo (roasted garlic, fresh herbs & extra virgin olive oil), 4) cebolla (carmelized onion, rosemary, thyme, vinegars & extra virgin olive oil)  Service (10/10) = Family owned business are always great.  The two brothers running this joint never fail in making you feel welcome, and are full of energy and enthusiasm for the food they prepare.  Ambiance (8.0/10) = The place is small and cozy, and unfortunately there are only a handful of stools for people to sit on, as they enjoy the greatness of Gaucho.  Overall Opinion = Incredible food.  Awesome service.  What more could you possibly want?  Well, my only annoyance with this place are their business hours and the very limited number of seats for people to chill out and enjoy their food.  I heard they are about to expand, so this will solve the latter issue.  Their business hours were a major influence on why it took me more than half a year after moving to Pittsburgh to finally visit this place.  It would be great if they opened until at least 8 or 9 pm.  It would also be great if they opened on Sundays.  Nevertheless, their business is thriving, and certainly not short on customers.  Like I said in the beginning of this review, Gaucho had an average of 5 stars after 100 reviews.  I now understand why.  It is TRUTH!  Now make your pilgrimage to this fine establishment in the Strip District.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gaucho papas - seasoned roasted potatoes
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak empanadas

N09LxgBh3uknF5VFZr6B0w.text: Food is amazing!  The meats are incredible and the sandwiches are outta this world.  However I do hate the lines!

jAXk0OJvXwQXORb8C5LJCQ.text: The food is all that it's cracked up to be.  Not only is everything cooked to perfection, the spice combinations are new (to most of us) and delicious.  It's a little like the experience of the first time you dive into Indian food.  The service is also super friendly and helpful.  Very reasonable prices for what you get.  The only thing not to like is the weird order, wait, sit, set up that has to be learned.  It doesn't ruin the experience, but it would be so much more relaxing to be seated and then order.  I hate seat insecurity, it's something that goes back to the high school cafeteria.  You know it's not ideal when there are signs warning you to relax before you enter.  BTW, that's not a problem if you want take-out.

Jw3FIhMyFALdFqQPNsxUUQ.text: After hearing all of the hype about Gaucho Parrilla, I decided to finally check it out after months of wanting to go. There was a group of six of us that decided to go on a Wednesday evening at 7pm. The line was out the door and down the street when we got there (and it was pretty cold out!) We waited in line for a total of about an hour before we ended up ordering our food and getting a table. The staff was very nice and when we got through the door, they offered to get open our wine for us and get us wine glasses while we waited. Gaucho is BYOB with no corkage fee, which is a huge plus. The six of us brought a total of four bottles of wine to split between us.  I ordered  the large Provoletta as an appetizer. My fiance and I decided to split our meals, so I ordered the large Cordero (lamb) and the large Bire de Chorizo (NY strip) for us. Both were cooked perfectly! I loved all of the flavors! Make sure to try all of the sauces that they have. They compliment the meal perfectly. I have no complaints at all about Gaucho, and I would highly recommend visiting, even if it includes having to wait outside in the cold in line! Gaucho definitely lived up to all the hype and I will be returning in the future!

R5IzKzHpTJAmnPrO8QdzEw.text: Amazing! Worth the wait in line! Everyone is friendly and helpful! I've loved everything I have had from Gaucho!

njMPHCqCFq2I-R9WX5hkKQ.text: It is by far one of the most tasty places I've been too, not to mention the price is very fair. I got shrimp and pork chop here. I think the meat here is excellent however seafood is prob not their best (perhaps due to their geographic location?). I would come back here in a heart beat and try out other cuts of meat.

W1JkhglryIMdnhJZ5qC5og.text: The food is pretty good. The way to go is two smaller plates instead of an entree. It's a little confusing in the sequence of ordering b-4 u r seated but just roll with it.

x1518IhVU3YfH5grtzsELw.text: Omnomnom. The empanadas were the best, especially with the pimenton sauce (roasted red pepper with olive oil and balsamic vinegar and other stuff...) poured into each bite. My boyfriend got the steak sandwich with the ride year and loved it. His dad got the steak burger and loved it too. The sauces are all amazing, try all of them! There's also grilled veggies that are yummy for the vegetarians (or health conscious)   There are only 8 seats or so inside, but when we went it wasn't crowded so it wasn't a problem. There's tables outside for the summer.   The owner is a long time restaurateur who finally decided to settle down and cook his family's native cuisine. And I, for one, am appreciative that he did.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The inside with 2/3 of the menu

qsWPesekJlAUdAJSO1KjwQ.text: As good as advertised. They close at 9pm and i was there around 8 and they still had a line to the door. I ordered the mixed plate and two empanads,  definitely a pound of meat, the steak was cooked perfectly and very juicy, chicken the same.  The sausage was very tender and had a nice spice to it as well.  Must go in Pitt

qkvzGgeZvKSKXiLfoJKiYQ.text: Yelp led me here... THANK YOU!! This has to be one of the BEST sandwiches I have ever had.  You can smell the wood burning stove before you see the place! And it smells like heaven! They have a lovely little patio that uses their wood pile as a backdrop. Inside is small but the space is used wisely. It has minimal but special decor. There is a huge overwhelming (read-you will want it all) chalkboard of choices.  At the island in the middle are 4 sauces that pair with all of the food nicely.  I am not sure what they are exactly, but each one was better than last!!  The girl at the register was very helpful and explained what things were and gave a helpful suggestion for a fist timer. I placed my order for the filet mignon, roasted red pepper, caramelized onion on ciabatta with a sauce... The owner/manager brought it out and chatted with me a little about the concept and the space.   He even "apologized" in advance for the cravings I would have!  I thought we will see.... He was not lying!! I told my husband the next day I wanted to go again! It is that good!!!   You will be very glad you tried it! I can't wait to go again! I want to try the roasted corn!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet mignon, roasted red peppers, caramelized onions on ciabatta with a yummy sauce!

q0YjPKM6ds4fuDpqKwEs6w.text: This place was so incredibly good! I've never eaten such delicious food. Went with a big group and they were able to accommodate us. It does get very packed anytime after 6. My only regret is that I did not order all the empanadas!

lA779w-FdDgq67tVjt6iTw.text: Even an hour wait for dinner could not detract from this amazing place. The service should train everyone else in the business on "how to provide the best service." They were caring, kind, attentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable, honest and made the night. Oh, and the food! We came for the paella and LOVED it!! It takes about 30 minutes so we ordered the wings too. Flavorful, slightly spicy and incredibly tender. Would love to return to try EVERYTHING! Great night!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2RsXnBnzNDyQJzcPMvwpzw.text: Stopped in the newly expanded joint on Saturday for lunch and it was just as delish and magical as the first time I went! I love the new set up, and particularly all the windows! Its also such a cool concept where you seat and sorta serve yourself, but there is also staff that comes around to check on you and refill drinks.  LOVE this place, as always!! If you haven't come here yet, what are you waiting for? I will say that you should get their early. We arrived around 11:30 and there was a line, but by the time we left around 12:30 the line was out the door.

PwlaetVeKzuBv0V5CqhIDw.text: The food was pretty good. If I was to go again I would call for take out and just pick it up instead of waiting in line

7-cNlNWv8oR-YNAqqBPU8g.text: V good! You line up, order your food and you get seated. For us, the line started just outside the door but it still took us 45 minutes to get through the whole process. My friend and I shared the pulled pork, 2 empanadas, the papas side, and the grilled shrimp. Everything was so delicious! The pulled pork was so juicy and flavorful, the papas were very soft and garlic-y, and the shrimp had that wonderful charcoal slightly burnt taste. For the empanadas we got the chicken and the beef. Beef was alright, but the chicken was good. The dough was a bit dry though. We also shared the nutella crumble (I forget the exact name) but it was nutella bread pudding with a cookie crumble and hazelnuts. Kind of too sweet but really good. The staff is very nice and helpful during the ordering process and it's a good medium noise level so you can have fun with friends.

V7tceoXXPltAq_KsYbkhdA.text: Tasty spot with a variety of great looking options.  The sauces were all excellent, and the mixed grill platter was good...sausage, chicken and steak all flavorful and well cooked, although mine came out a little on the cold side, which was kind of a disappointment.  Empanadas were pretty good as well, although they did not blow me away.  Overall, I would like to try some other items on the menu, and I enjoyed the things I did have, although my major complaint would be that it is a tad overpriced.  Not terribly expensive mind you, but just a bid overpriced for what you get.  Would I return?  Yes.

TJm19rluyOpmxpbC9ToUPQ.text: The food is great, but the super trendy and hip environment is frustrating for someone like me. You walk in to a chalk board with a menu and random people asking if your ready then you feel rushed to read the chalk board menu wall. After all that you order and sit at a table where others can sit at and then yell your name.. great food but the ambience is not for me

h22cPAnVXhVnB8nLj1tcqg.text: Yum! I'm in love! what we had: Ribeye, wings, beef empanadas, wings, potatoes, corn, brown sugar pineapple bread pudding ! Amazing! Worth waiting in line. BYOB if you want alcohol. The line moves really fast & the service was good! Excellent first experience. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6hOKSnenGDqqclriHKv4kQ.text: Easily one of, if not my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. You pretty much can't go wrong with anything here, I've had the steak (ribeye and flank), shrimp, chicken, and roasted pulled pork (my favorite) and they have all been fantastic. This may sound weird to say about a steakhouse, but the salads and grilled veggies are actually my favorite dishes and some of the best that I've had period. The beet salad and their caramelized onions in particular are great, as you can really taste the wood fired smoke on the onions which pairs well with their sweetness. Trust me you want to get these on your sandwich, salad, meat, pretty much any dish! The staff there are also always really friendly and attentive, and are more than willing to help you out when ordering from the big board menu. Yes the line can be long at times, but it is definitely worth the wait.

VgSHvZMPr6OyxpowEJF7ng.text: Wow, this place was amazing! The line was really long, if you've ever driven past it usually is, but the food comes out very quick. The food was so delicious! We got the Picado that had meats, cheeses, fruits, and almonds. I got the Cerdo and my aunt got the Ribeye, they were both amazing. The carmelized onions (onyinz) were phenomenal, the toast was great, the salad was good, I can't think of one bad thing to say. The service was great as well. SOOOOOOOO worth the wait!

dRGwBzUhj117nQ9cQXAvvg.text: I've been here several times and each time, the food is delicious! Having to wait in line for so long is the only downfall and why we don't go here more often.

JQ-AM__uzk-rKqRM6WqHAQ.text: I love Gaucho.  Whether for lunch or a special event, they have been fabulous.  I only wish that they were open 7 days a week.

so8d3KR-5oAEhKGCumpe0Q.text: This place is amazing!  Definitely deserves all 5 stars.  We had the carne sandwich with the ribeye  (you can choose with 5 different cuts of meat).  It had chimichurri sauce and was served on ciabatta bread and it was amazing!  It was cooked and seasoned perfectly and was one of the most delicious steaks I've ever had.  We also had the potatoes papas which were perfectly crisped and seasoned to perfection, and the meat empanadas were also delicious.  They also had a number of sauces you could choose to add and we sampled them all, and all were quite delicious.  The staff were also super friendly and attentive, even though this wasn't a full service restaurant (they kept checking on us to make sure we were happy).  They seemed to really pride themselves in their product.  They don't have much seating area inside, but it was warm and cozy.  It was too cold for the outdoor patio but it looked like a beautiful area overlooking the bridge that would be nice to enjoy lunch outside.  Portions are also huge and very affordable given the amount of food and the quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

z9J5P53lspWlSEgFWAbi6Q.text: On a recent business trip I purposely stayed close to Gaucho rather than closer to my meetings downtown.  It was worth the walk in the snow, ice floes drifting down the river. The chanchito is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had anywhere.    Also, there were two burly men who had literally driven from Ohio to eat here, and while they were they were calling their friends telling them to do the same.    Ridiculous?  Yes.  That is, until you've eaten their food...

jDeLNBFlvKIf3kN2T6a0Aw.text: When I first came to Gaucho, it was because the smells of meat caught my nose and I followed it.  My girlfriend and I came in and we were the only people there. So we were greeted with a loud "HELLO" from all of the staff. As soon as we told them that it was our first time, they took us through the menu and answered every question. The whole time, everyone was smiling, music was playing in the background, and there was one guy just dancing. The whole vibe made me happy and couldn't help but smile.  Gaucho does meat right. Steaks were juicy, tender, and seasoned perfectly. Seriously, other people should take note: good quality food, good technique, good flavors. I didn't care how messy the sandwiches were. I didn't care that it was wrapped up in paper and not served on a shovel/chalkboard/etc. What I got was honest, fantastic cooking. No fancy stuff to trick you into thinking something tastes good.  I've come back multiple times and each time has never disappointed. The have expanded recently and I haven't had a chance to go. However, the line going down the street speaks to how their passion for food has paid off.

2RjnBFdTy0fnr4BjkzNmJw.text: This place is absolutely gorgeous! We went to this place on a Saturday night. We've been waiting in a line for about 20mins. The mix steak sample(6 different steaks, 6oz for each) are awesome! The grilled shrimp is also great! The size of the salad is really big! The fish of the day was tilapia which is not very impressive. The service was excellent! Definitely will go back for the steak and desert

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mix steak sample. I will go back for it!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled shrimp! Perfect!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish of the day - tilapia

ex5_eBkDEfyQWyZ0owphWQ.text: Yuuu-up. This spot is the *ish*!! This was one of our last meals in the great state of Pennsylvania and we couldn't have ended on a higher note.  The staff is outstandingly rad, the food is truly executed to perfection and the atmosphere is so casual cool that you'll think you're on a picnic.  We had: - New York strip - bone in chicken (breast and thigh... I know what Chef Boyfriend likes) - house made chorizo  - grilled veggies - and ALL the sauces.   My only regret is that we hadn't brought a baller bottle of Argentinean Malbec to wash down all this smoky, meaty goodness. The shop is BYOB and you definitely should!  They'll be closed for a bit while they expand the restaurant (yay!!) but as soon as they reopen, so yourself a solid and get yer butt down there!

cb_byHM_YcL5K5ThhRUuEg.text: Great food! They've been mixing up their counter service table service but it's always fantastic food and it can either be a splurge or an everyday meal.

z-xEjvD_KA44nL2jnA4OAg.text: This is a place where food definitely trumps service.  They have a takeout option, but no one seems to answer the phone, so you'd have to come in a wait in line anyway.  With the length of the line for this place on any day, you can see this business can't really handle the volume of customers it serves or even a possibly growing customer base.

xHu8paxIaIxFqR1lx3Ifew.text: Absurdly great ribeye steak sandwich.  This restaurant is sensational.  Can I give 6 stars?  Please?

E8nwRuPNKYeaTfXG69t-nQ.text: Omg! This food is amazing! The portions are large so you can share with your family and friends. You must order the mixed veggies. They have a great assortment of house made sauces. The staff is also very kind and accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Deliciousness

ux0BldCmFGub2ClqPzXTiw.text: The new standard in what a restaurant should be. The steak will blow you away. Everything I have tried there has been great. This is the one place that never fails to meat (that's a pun) or exceed my expectations. This is hands down my favorite restaurant in all of Pittsburgh. If you try it once I'm sure it will be your new favorite as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak out of this world!

4DYvklAFFN3yPgATYKqAxw.text: Amazing food.   Great people.   Worth the wait but I prefer take out that way I don't have to wait!   Yummy!

BS9n-_7HVX1p0UnF7KofFQ.text: Line was very long and parking was difficult on Saturday. But the food was amazing and totally worth it. Got the flank steak. It was perfectly cooked and the flavor was excellent.

GBNjGXQMi7YTAHBnMapkdw.text: Gaucho is my favorite place and I will definitely go there often. We went on a Tuesday afternoon around 4:30ish. We had no wait.  Our family from San Diego was in town and said they wish they weren't leaving the next day so they could go back.  We ordered the pasta salad with baby peas, each of the empanadas, a charcuterie board, lamb, shrimp, cauliflower, green beans and tostadas and we loved every dish. Our only disappointment was that we got full and could not eat all of it. Every dish we tried was flavorful and amazing enough to stand on its own but even more amazing with the "salsa". We tried all the sauces with each dish and were excited about the way every sauce complimented every dish in  the most delicious ways. We each had our favorites.  I ordered a bread pudding to go and was just slightly disappointed as it was not as amazing and over the top delicious as the meal we had. That's ok though. I still give Gaucho a 5 star review!

xOyhjUAVY5cj0Sb6kZd0-w.text: I was here with a group of six very picky eaters, one might be the pickiest eater I have ever meet. After the meal was all done everyone had great comments about there meals. No one had a single complaint. As far as my meal I had the ribeye cooked medium rare with the chorizo and empanadas as an appetizer. The steak was perfectly cooked and had great flavor especially with the house sauces provided chimichurri sauce was my favorite but the ajo sauce and pimento sauce where also good (caution: pimento is a hot sauce not terribly hot but if you don't like any heat beware.)

dWv58vdsofpmzn45_DLjYA.text: Well, I had high hopes based on all the hype. Arrived today and waited for quite awhile in line. Staff was friendly and place looked nice with the new addition. Food didn't live up to the hype though. Sandwiches were ok. I liked the roll/bread. It was fresh and tasty. The steak was ok, not as good as I hoped. Or at least not as good as all the reviews would lead you to believe. I liked the sauces however they offered. The empanadas were not good at all. Skip them, bland and just not worth it. Corn on the cob was good and potatoes were ok. All in all I felt it was expensive for what we received. Soft drinks were a bargain however at $2 with free refills. All in all it was decent but just didn't live up to the hype for me. I would not make it a priority to come back and would select other places over this.

XibZnJXggdRBLYP7nTRJBA.text: Great food! Got a bit of a buzz drinking some craft beers with my doctor friends, so I don't remember what I ordered. I do remember it was meaty and good! Your belly will appreciate coming here. I would have given it 5 stars but I was a bit tipsy when I went and don't remember some of the night....

ofAXZDXJzOYvOdAe08jRXg.text: So...wow.   Normally, I write lengthy reviews on food, service, aesthetics, atmosphere, etc., but I will get right to the point.   This place is amazing in every way. Go.

WDlGqqD1jlLNK5pNtNT2Og.text: Long wait line, too much talk At the registry that affect the wait line. Food was okay and the utincils were not clean, waitress was too rude when I showed her grease on the plates, forks and knives, she acted as giving me a lesson on how to clean them by wiping it with napkins!

Nj0Wee40OZGDY_nV-QFjBQ.text: I have been following this restaurant for a while. I can remember when it had about 60 reviews at a solid five stars. And now it's over 200 and its 5-star rating hasn't budged.   Finally got a chance to visit today. I had the pollo sandwich and grilled corn. It was incredibly good. Reviews are hands-down accurate. You must go. That is all.

7R0-ZRQWzVc4vfSej2Alvg.text: I had the lamb and my brother had the tilapia. Both were AMAZING! Great flavoring and ate every bite. They give u options of different sauces with the meats and they are so delicious! I can't wait to come back and try something else! Highly recommended.

qHFSc4RaF7MNZ908COmD-A.text: REVIEW #1000  5 stars. Gaucho lives up to the hype. My goodness . . . Everything is great and cooked perfectly. Honestly, this is also one of the best value meals in the city. The quality to cost ratio is really amazing for the consumer.   Here's what I recommend: Carne Sandwich (Ribeye cooked medium rare). Any two sides (they change seasonally). Empanadas (mix). You won't be sorry!   The food is a 5 stars, the atmosphere is a 4 stars, the seating is a 2 star. So, if you get there any time after 5:15 - get ready to wait. Like . . . Kennywood, Phantom's Revenge on field trip day wait. The wait is long. BUT that makes your dining experience really nice because the main dining room is small and not overcrowded. I still give 5 stars because this food . . . Heavenly.   Tipping is up to your discretion because you pay up front. It's a laid back environment. Great sauces. Everything is amazing.   Go to Gaucho. Seriously, go now.

tTUcOg9fY-uPWcxL-2SAVA.text: Wow. This place is amazing! Hands down the best food I have eaten since visiting Pittsburgh. Take the recommendations from staff they will not steer you wrong. I went in at closing and they still were well stocked with the menu items and everything was so fresh. I had the salmon and it was amazing. The yams were like dessert and they have free refills on soda. The place is BYOB so grab your drinks and put one back for me too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This guy in the blue standing next to the counter is the nicest worker there. Listen to his recommendations.

x4UXDUTFgg4yYzsveiBRRQ.text: Went here with some friends on a Saturday. Waited in line for about 1.5 hours. It's byob so we had some drinks and it was fun. The people were nice and the food was outstanding. Worth the wait! Love it

y40VFaI1R3luTSbcRQjnGw.text: The food here is amazing, hands down. I remember when this place was a matchbox and now that the repairs and expansions are done it's a marvelous sit in spot. Great food and great quality for the price especially the sandwiches in particular. The carne sandwich comes with your choice of type of beef and it's delicious and tender and well cooked with tons of flavor. The ciabatta bread soaks in so much wonderful juices and is just tasty. My younger sis got the burger and it was a beast in size.   Ordering is kind of chaotic and the menu is super expansive now. Expect a line out the door on Friday dinner time But once you get use to it it's not only convenient but run by such sweet and understanding people. They know how to make your service interesting. All their recommendations hit the spot. Also enjoy the numerous sauce station. They are greatttttt.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Look at this mammoth sandwich. Bad angle but rest assured there&#39;s enough meat to knock you into food coma territory

r5jku6PpAEHC25FpUlbvdA.text: I still remember this place when it was a hole-in-the-wall walk-in shop with deliciousness that you can smell from down the street.  The shop has expanded, but it's still hands down as good as it gets when you get a steak sandwich topped with their house made chimi's (my favorite flank topped with garlic).  My wife and I have tried most of their items on the menu and all of their entrees are great including the steak salads, chicken and fish. Their sides can be hit or miss at times, but a lot of times that's because they experiment with new offerings.  One thing to watch out for is their lines. It's always out the door, but definitely worth the wait. The service is always extremely friendly and it's BYOB.

KJin4j5rP7EWdsNG_8PG7Q.text: Gaucho's is a must stop while in the 'Burgh.  Absolutely delicious meats and sides (herbed potatoes and grilled vegetable platter were both awesome).  We had the Asado Platter which at $50 gives you slices of 5 of their different meats.  This was enough meat for our family of 5 when paired with sides and of course a side order of chorizo.  For chorizo, go with the spicy selection which in my book was perfection.  The set up here is you wait on line to order.  On a Thursday night around 6pm we waited about 35 minutes ... Once you order the food comes quickly.  Wait staff helps finds you a table and you help yourselves to sauces, plates and silverware.  Be sure to BYOB and keep in mind I wasn't able to find a liquor store in the immediate area.  Desserts are delicious - the cinnamon bread pudding was exceptional.  Only minuses for us were: 1.  Our waitress dumped our food across the floor when she lost her grip on a serving tray.  This isn't typical and she almost cried which made me feel bad for her.  They apologized up and down and brought a replacement within minutes.  Hey, it happens. 2.  They encourage you to order dessert up front and that they'll hold it for you until your ready ... They dropped it at our table mid-meal so it was starting to cool when we were ready for it.  They need to get this better sorted or simply wait to order it.  Despite these minuses, I still give it a solid 4 stars for what it is... Meaty awesomeness.  Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu ... Asado platter gives you all 5 meat selections... Awesome for sharing
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The ordering counter... Cinnamon bread pudding is one awesome dessert!!!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Food PORN illness... Love it

qvz6um4RP_vluJ7LQvp9uA.text: Not sure what else can be said about this place.  The burger I just had was excellent and rivals anything in Pittsburgh. The meat had a twinge of wood smokiness that was balanced great with caramelized onions, arugula, and chimichurri. (You pick your extras). The sweet potatoes were out of this world and I will now seek to replicate them. The service is something I would liken to a bee hive: organized chaos.  The prices are more than fair.  5 stars.

TRUr8ezxfxNdYvCP7fV9Eg.text: Got the steak sandwich. It was super meaty and I was definitely in love with the vegetables in there.   The empanadas were a bit "doughy" and dry. Maybe because I'm used to fried ones? I'd skip out on them.   The people working here were super nice!

3AGH7yAk_BlSf0-q_jloFw.text: The ribeye was outrageously good. Chicken wings were huge, juicy and generously seasoned. The toasted bread was awesome. The dipping sauces were all amazing - tried all 6 of them! The saffron rice was very tasty. It did seem odd that the salad didn't come with anything on top. Was I supposed to dress it?   Even though it's a self serve place, the employees kept coming by and checking in. Felt very welcome and attended to. So the service was great!  The upper room is nicer but the first room is fun too, to see the action at the register.  I was only not impressed with the dessert. The creme brulee with a dollop of butterscotch and a few fruits. Not very good at all, but the other stuff was so mind-blowing, I can see all why all the fuss.   Luckily got there before 7 because the line was out the door for the rest of the evening, even on a terribly rainy day.

HGmzkF5zIvA_c38fYZ39lQ.text: This place is really good.  GOOD: - The FOOD is just great.  Pork sandwich, roasted potatoes, grilled brussels sprouts with bacon, La Casa salad - all really tasty and well prepared.  The bread on the sandwiches is delicious, especially when toasted. - The setting is fresh, clean, and un-cluttered. - The service is great.  Everybody is helpful and cheerful.  OPPORTUNITIES: - The entryway and ordering area is too small.  Even a short line goes to the door, so you sometimes can't really walk in. - The chalk-board menu looks nice, but is hard to read quickly.  Confusing or fuzzy menus can create anxiety for some patrons, especially when the line is short and you sort of have to order now.  Overall, this place is great.  If you have not been here, give it a try.

7SwIX-hCO3cLIYCEgDuHPg.text: Favorite Pittsburgh lunch spot! I've never had a bad experience! Staff is friendly, meat is top quality and perfectly cooked, the sauces are to die for, and it's byob! Red meat and red wine is winning combo in my book. The prices are also very reasonable when you consider the quality. It's def worth standing in line!

xT432wJnr92zSdKa7YlJMw.text: As everyone here has already mentioned, Gaucho is amazing. The wait outside moves fairly quickly and is completely worth every second. Once inside, the atmosphere is fantastic - the staff does a wonderful job of keeping it relaxed, hipster-ish, and low key. They answered all of our questions and eased us into the entire experience. And so suave.  I love that they provide seating but allow the customer to grab their own place settings, glasses and sauces. No cork fee! And the sauces are all delicious (and not spicy!!). The music is amazing too, like old school, early 2000s hip hop.  Waiting for our food, all we could do was stare at everyone else's dinners with longing eyes. Totally acceptable behavior at Gaucho, btw. I did the Rosemary braised sandwich and it was magnificent. And we split three empanadas. Next time, and there will definitely be a next time, I'm definitely going for the grilled corn and an open faced cut that includes a tostado and a side salad. Because I almost attacked my friend's plate for it. The veggies will help break up all the meat and bread.  I don't really have to mention it, but everyone needs to stop by. You absolutely won't regret it. Five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. liiiine
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. sauce city!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. almost forgot to take a photo because I was too busy engulfing this

W_1bkLEeH-UlPPIki3S9TQ.text: Food was okay. Steak was close to warm instead of hot and the char was just a tad bitter. Had better authentic Argentinian food in other cites.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef and Pork empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carrots with goat cheese and honey

EeZtUGvcqzMWC3REaUf-7Q.text: Always a line out the door. Super popular joint. Call ahead for takeout! The food is worth the wait.

C7dEX-0RC9u1G6M0VXAEyg.text: The food here is fantastic! We ordered family style. We chose 2 meat dishes and two sides which was more than enough for 3 people! I don't remember the names of the dishes - the first was a mix of chicken, chorizo and steak. All amazing! The second was the chorizo three ways. Again, perfect. Like always my favorite part was the side dishes. We had the brussel sprouts that were sauteed in bacon and brown sugar. I loved them so much that I've been making this at home ever since! The second was the sweet potatoes topped with marshmallow. This was the highlight of the meal. I think with all the intensely flavored meats and salt you need this sweet and savoury dish to balance the meal. I live for a BYOB- remember to get your own glasses from the side bar and have a drink while waiting for the line to die down!

3F4GYnaS5542zbg-KUADgw.text: Wait was stupid long 1hr...on a day that was raining like hell.  Atmosphere was good.  Staff was friendly.  My steak was supposed to be medium, but came rare.  It was very good overall, but not really worth a hr wait.  Prices were very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye...yummmm...
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cool decor.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tT-ohcosUFo2jmPk2ygChg.text: Amazing a bit of a wait but so totally worth it! Done forget to bring your own alcohol!!!

-e9pg5ybteTlfhB0fAuJfQ.text: Food has ALWAYS been on point, I just wish the space was bigger. So much love for the meats but the crazy lines 24/7 are a bit of a deterrent.

LgelYThQMEe89UVtqph7JA.text: Why 3 stars? Because I was so sadly disappointed.     ---   ---   ---  On a 1-10 scale, my anticipatory hype for visiting this place was a 40. I love red meat. I love Argentinian food. The menu was basically if I were able to custom design my favorite 15 things in the world. How could this go wrong???  Ugh. The meat was oh so burnt. I went with the Carne Sandwich, and to be totally honest, it was barely edible. Even my peppers were burnt to a crisp. I should have gone back and asked them to re-make it, but I was in a hurry to get to the Pirates game.  So why 3 stars, and not 1 or 2? Because I try to be fair and not kill a business based on one experience that seems to clearly not be the norm.   If I'm ever in Pittsburgh again, this will be my first stop. I have faith that I had a bizzaro world experience.

0VDht7_Ul9asAcxxIDOiww.text: My boyfriend kept raving to me about this place for sometime and I finally got to go any try it! First of all this is a nice little corner restaurant that is way bigger than it looks upon entering. You order from a menu that's written on a chalk board which can be a bit overwhelming especially if it's your first time there. Took me a while to figure out what everything was but they have awesome staff that was very willing to help you out. After you figure out your menu you order up front, get your drink, and then they seat you. We sat in the back which was a nice open spaced area. The place was busy but not to the point where we had to wait long at all. Also we found out that it is a B.Y.O.B. establishment too!  As for our dinner it was AMAZING! I was surprisingly impressed since all I kept hearing about was "how good their steak sandwiches are". Me and my boyfriend got small steak plates. I got the ribeye and he got the NY Strip. They both were to die for. They each come on a long wooden board with an individualized salad for what meat you get. Then along side is a grilled crusted piece of Italian bread. I swear I couldn't get it in my mouth fast enough lol. The ribeye was good but I preferred the NY Strip and it just melted in your mouth. Each meal was just enough and I didn't feel guilty of overeating to much. Also we got a side of Fungos which were pan roasted cremini mushrooms with shallots, rosemary and sherry wine vinegar. Who does like steak and mushrooms right! These were delicious and paired perfectly with our steak.  I absolutely can not wait to get back here to try out other things! The food I watched come out of the kitchen as we were eating looked so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small Ribeye steak plate
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fungos

JkJ-W5O4UYae3QoFb6_7MQ.text: I still love this place! They moved to a bigger spot with more room and more seating but the food still tastes amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Root veggies side dish

x_NC4jqlMWv6NYiulGnBDg.text: If you're in Pittsburgh for any numerous reasons, you HAVE to come here. The lines can get long but with great company and BYOB, it goes by quickly. My friends and I have all heard stellar reviews of this place and they're all wholly valid. We ordered a variety of things off the menu but we left wishing we had more stomach to try everything else. Basically can't go wrong!!

9u5xAsENBatghO73M_Z3OA.text: Just as good! Definitely crowded on a Saturday afternoon. I got in at 11:45 and had to wait in line to order but when I left the line was out the door and around the corner!   I need to remember to get my steak medium. I usually get medium well but I was served well done.   This time around I tried the wings which were very good, the potatoes which were overly seasoned probably wouldn't get again, and the grilled corn which was so good!   There sauces are amazing and found out that you can purchase them to take home. I'm going to use that on everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El Gaucho large salad with flank
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small sirloin with a side of caramelized mushrooms.

i7P8fisxPzUO9Kf4A37SWQ.text: The food here is great.  Don't let the line scare you, well worth the wait.  We enjoyed the flank steak, the NY strip and the pig and pickles (various picked veggies with roasted pork and a yummy aoili).    The ear of corn was cooked to perfection and seasoned wonderfully.  The steaks were grilled nicely and full of flavor.  We also tried the grilled wings, which easily could have been the best wings this eater has ever enjoyed.  Oh,  and there sauces..the traditional chimichurri and 3 others....the garlic one was awesome.  You wont be mad or diappointed if you stand in line.  This place does not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled chicken wings

sOhmrs7wJdgv3yM7Vh4LIw.text: Really great restaurant!!!  Unusual set up-- you wait in line to view the menu, order your drinks at one counter, then order your food at another counter, then they seat you, and they call your name when your food is ready but deliver it to your table.  Steaks were melt-in-your-mouth good!  Highly recommend the Garlic & Rosemary Shrimp too!  Atmosphere was kind of hipster... way too clean to be considered a dive!  Really good dinner choice for my husband, our 1.5 year old daughter, and myself during a short visit to Pittsburgh!

oYp4wiREPBpIwMile0T7kw.text: Great Argentinian food for a fair price! This is a fast casual type of place so you order at the counter, they seat you, and then they bring out your food. Everything we had was very good, though the highlight was probably their 4 homemade sauces that you can put on everything - a chimichurri sauce, a carmelized onion sauce, a smoked pepper sauce, and a garlic sauce. They have sandwiches, salads, plates of meat, empanadas, and sides of veggies. I don't think you can really go wrong but I recommend some type of steak and something with bread so that you can dip it in all the sauces.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Their 4 sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side of mushrooms
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The camarones entree

gVZpPbLZdA19KT9b5QxLGQ.text: I hate to be a Debbie Downer with this review, but I believe in being honest and not feeding into the hype because it's trending. I don't really understand the #1 rating for this place.   I'll begin by saying the food is actually pretty good. It is certainly not the best we have ever had, but it was decent if you are a meat lover. They offer a variety of options located on the chalk board at the entrance of the restaurant. No menus. (At least we were never offered any) Don't worry, you will have PLENTY of time to look at it as you will likely stand in line for a LONG time waiting to place your order at the counter. (More on that to come.  We, the party of 2, ordered the following:  Mixed Grill which consisted of a presentable offering of chorizo sausage, chicken and sirloin. No sides. The sausage was the best, the chicken was very juicy and tender, the steak was just ok, but a bit chewy.  Ribeye grill which included a small salad on the plate which was tasty. The ribeye was pretty good too.   Since there are no real sides offered with either meal, we selected the corn pudding to share. It was also prepared well, but I thought could have used a bit more seasoning.  We ordered water with lemon.  Overall, the food was tasty, but the next segment of this review is what left a bad taste in my mouth. ("Wah - Wah" - enter Debbie Downer)  Here is where I take issue with this place. There is a complete lack of structure for their patrons to place orders and be seated. We spent more time in line waiting to get in the place than actually consuming our meal! It is set up like waiting at an extremely busy high priced fast food joint with better quality food. Hey, if you are into these trendy BYOB places and don't mind spending more time in line while you watch empty tables calling your name while you stand in line forever, go for it.  Seriously, when we were finally seated, we watched several tables that were never occupied whilie dozens of folks continued to stand in line to order and wrap around the sidewalk outside. In my opinion, the message here is that the CUSTOMER's time is clearly the last thing on their mind. I will certainly keep that in my mind if and when we would ever consider going here again. Sadly, I doubt we will.  I enjoy good food, but not at the expense of my time waiting in a long line and inflated prices. Just my 2 cents, or in this case $50 for dinner and no drinks, only water. I would give the food an 8; but the long and nonsensical system to be seated gets a 2. Sadly, I would give this place a final overall rating 5 just because of how frustrating the ordering process is set up. However, to end on a positive note, the servers were all friendly and laid back. But as I stated, I doubt we would go back. "Wah - Wah"

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside, where you need to be prepared to spend most of your time during peak periods.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed grill - Chorizo, Chicken and sirloin
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corn pudding and some sauces

ziA0uBZY60nyCn16VLkn1w.text: This place rocks the Steakburger. The beef tastes like the delicious beef of my youth. This reminds us of the steakhouses of B A, Argentina.  You must order the Papas al Homo.

lj2Mi8gfYIipka0a6orCwA.text: Unique restaurant. Had flank, the meat was fresh and cooked to perfection. Call in for a table as at times it is busy and has long Q. BYOB, so be prepared if you plan to.

TbAoZzq3mfy0rm66GmvpWQ.text: Still by far the best steak in Pittsburgh! If you leave here hungry it is your own fault.

G9OMUCDUVbb6P0oqf24ICw.text: Amazing!  The service, the food and the atmosphere were all top notch.  Service was amazingly fast.  My kids really liked it because the flavors are exceptional.   Can't wait to grab a bottle of wine for a date night another night soon.

JXP80ymozs-XHALrN_VzCQ.text: One of my favorite spots in town, Gaucho never disappoints. The food is amazing and reasonably priced, well worth the wait in line. Bring a couple friends and order the Asado platter.

6rjxhcshdyh3gG2NpvknTg.text: Fantastic sandwiches and salads, line wasn't too long but we waited awhile be prepared to wait outside if the line is long! Order and pay then are seated and they bring you your food. Unique menu great variety of sauces and flavors. My sandwich was fabulous and we loved the empanadas as well!  Great variety, casual , trendy decor great place to eat if your shopping in the strip

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NajDD0CwdJWS0d894mnnWA.text: Had been eager to try this place after seeing it be in the top 100 yelp restaurants. Even on a Tuesday night around 8:30, there was a line still to get in. Do not come at 9, because they lock the doors around 8:45.   I had ordered the chicken wings and a small lamb chops. The wings were amazing and will definitely be back for them. They were marinated very well and had a great tangy flavor. It was five whole wings so it was good to split. The wings were so flavorful I didn't need to use any of the extra sauces.   The lamb chops were also cooked well with a mustard seed dressing. The salad and tostado was a nice break from all the meat. My friend got the chicken and said it was fine but not great--a little dry. She preferred the wings over the chicken platter.   Overall, I know I will be coming back. Simple food with great flavor!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gaucho Ribeye platter
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Top to bottom: Cordero lamb chops, Alitas de pollo chicken wings, and pollo a la parilla.

9ic-JtDNTTHGCKgLx6m4_w.text: Went to Gaucho on a beautiful day and was able to enjoy my meal in the outside sitting area. My friend and I had gone for dinner on the earlier side to avoid long lines and wait time. Despite being early, we did have to wait in line to put in order.   I ordered the vegetale sandwich, which has grilled asparagus, grilled onions, roasted red peppers, roasted potatoes, as well as mushrooms served on a ciabatta bun. Along with the sandwich, I got a veggie empanada which was nice and fluffy on the outside and the filling on the inside, was spiced just right. Both of these options paired wonderfully with Gaucho's 4 homemade sauce. These sauces really took the flavor to the next level. For dessert, I got the alfajores. I expected them to be hard on the outside, soft on the inside, but the cookie was delicate and melted in your mouth. It was exquisite.    Gaucho is a great option to get some quality food is Pittsburgh. It is definitely on the pricer side, but you won't leave unsatisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Alfajores
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guacho&#39;s 4 sauces
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie Empanada

EbWeG_2WpyJtg5h5tdiipQ.text: Made a day trip to Pittsburg with the family. Checked yelp and trip advisor for places to eat and Guacho's was on the top of the list. And rightfully so I must say. So many positive things about Guacho's:  1. The super friendly service from all the staff. We probably spoke with 4 or 5 different staff members throughout our time there, and they were all so friendly! We were afraid that we might be forgotten because we were the obly ones sitting outside, but in fact it seemed almost as if we were getting very personalized service!  2. They are dog friendly! Seriously, major + for that! We had to sit outside but it's all shaded and even on this 85 degree day, it was very comfortable. 3. Finally, the food, drooooool! For 4 for us (pup included), we ordered the asado platter (5 different types of meat @ 25 oz and 3 pieces of their delicious bread), the argentino salad and the mussles/clams. My husband is very particular about food, especially his meats, and he absolutely loved it. My mom and I loved the salad, it had super fresh ingredients ans the grilled vegetables in it were so tasty!   The only downfall would be the wait, as it always seems as if there is one. But it was well worth it! We went around 4:20 pm hoping to beat the dinner rush. Waited around 25 minutes to get to the front of the line and then another 20 minutes for our food.   We're unfortunately not locals but would definitely go out of our way for another visit to Guacho's!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Close up of the asado platter. Drool!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Don&#39;t forget about me&#34; -Joy
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. They are puppy friendly!! Major +++++++!!!!!

yZJsaB_FhvC7cFbo7mGjMA.text: I will definitely go back- It was delicious, the service was good. Dessert took a little long, but we got it.

qMzO-q7mfMI-y5rjkLvRPA.text: Stopped by Gaucho on a Saturday night date! It was a holiday weekend so the line was extra long. It took us, a party of two, about an hour and a half to get seated. When we were seated we realized there were tons of empty tables and that the congestion was at the ordering register rather than the lack of tables available.   I ordered the carne sandwich with the lomo steak. The bread, peppers and onions on the sandwich were wonderful. I thought the steak was good but a lot of it was too charred for my taste.   My husband got the chorizos - one spicy and one sweet. He really enjoyed it. He also got a pork empanada which was fresh and yummy. I tried a bit of his sweet chorizo. I am not a sausage person but the flavors were great.   I definitely recommend ordering a side of tostada so you can dip the bread in the sauces. There were four sauces at the sauce bar - cebolla, chimmi, ajo and a red pepper sauce. My favorite was the ajo which was garlicky. My husband liked the chimmi sauce which was oily and cilantroy and also good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Two chorizos and an empanada
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne de pan (Carne sandwich) with the lomo steak

5cen9m85LQzCN9LVfUHQCw.text: Good not great. Going to this place for the first time I had extremely high expectations based on the reviews that I read. My date and I each got a speciality sandwich along with an appetizer and everything was just okay.  Other than the meat being cooked to perfection, nothing was out of this world. We are looking to go back to this place soon to give them a second chance and to try something not from the sandwich menu.    I would like to point out that the BYOB aspect of this place is great and the service was very good!

YhSHznkdrTihboqR3R2YUA.text: Very nice, and not just beef, which is about all you get in Argentina. Try to get there about 10:30 a.m. on weekend mornings, or you'll be sorry...

c3Q67S5aIXje4m6UviTPWg.text: Everything is so delicious! Highly recommend then corn on the cob and rosemary braised beef!

8fmvrK8ouGK9FpeASYm-PA.text: Long wait and they don't serve wine  there.  Website does not mention this..  If you don't know it's BYOB then you're wine less in an Argentine  restaurant which  in Argentina would never be acceptable!! Writing this for FYI for future customers.

flJm5Q0HPCYYM1Hz3VVelw.text: Rosemary braised beef or ribeye Sammie. No need for talk, just go now and thank me later

p3D5xwRJT9RFwx0z1VlGAw.text: Best steak sandwich I've ever had! Although the ribeye sandwich I had was thoroughly cooked, it was still very tender and flavorful. The prices are not cheap, but it is worth every bite. I wish I had the chance to try more from their menu. The new restaurant is very nice. The decor gives the right ambiance for the type of food they are serving. Would recommend this to anyone who's visiting Pittsburgh.

lTkWtrr9phoLshODpYljjA.text: This place was a pleasant surprise find in Pittsburgh. Meat was cooked perfectly and had great flavor and the chimichurri sauces were all delicious.  For sides I had the gaucho potatoes and the maiz (corn on the cob) and they were both really good. To my surprise though, the prices seemed a bit much for Pittsburgh, coming from San Francisco, I'm used to paying a bit more for things, and this was comparable to the prices we see out in SF. Besides that though, the place had a good vibe, it appeared to be pretty popular and I'm glad I found it for when I come back next time!

era2yALS72XgiSuvMwiPQQ.text: This place is terrific. For those of us who are unfamiliar with Argentinean food, the menu may require some explanation. The staff was very helpful in making recommendations. I wound up with the pulled chicken sandwich and grilled corn on the cob. Both were great. Although there is limited counter seating in the restaurant, there is a very nice outdoor patio.  A great addition to the Strip.  Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pollo con pan (pulled chicken sandwich) with grilled corn on cob.

iseCp_Zfv3HuBvHrnENEKw.text: Having salivated by Gaucho on several occasions, I had no choice but to walk in on Thursday afternoon when the ever-present line was missing. I knew the cupboards were bare at home, and I wanted to bring the hubs something savory. Serious thanks to the nice young man at the counter - I told him I wanted "steak and potatoes" and he helped me translate that into a great to-go order. I got the rib eye, but - per his suggestion - kept it rare. It reheated perfectly to a nice medium rare. The small red potatoes came with garlic and herbs. Delicious! And, there was a nice side salad (radishes, carrots, tomatoes) which I ate the next day. Seriously good food and a big shout out for being so nice to me about my initially non-special order.

iLLLM7v3Nm58t_fF85nxiw.text: Do NOT go at typical dining hours. I went around 7 and waited almost 2 hours and thought the food was overrated. There's nowhere to wait so you have to stand outside and wait in a line that wraps around the building. Didn't care for the atmosphere either and overall not sure why people like it as much as they do.

OQ7B5JTWUNuMECC7ik0PxQ.text: Delicious!  Everything we ordered left us wanting more.  It does take a little bit of time to get your food once you order, but the quality is well worth it.  The staff was very attentive, and the employee who took our order took the time to explain all of the sauces and package up a container of each for us to try.  He even told us a little bit about the origin of the restaurant and mentioned that they had converted their small parking lot into a little bit of outdoor seating.  Definitely make the stop!

v7COUOpEwgpMqJMrfH_AAg.text: Dementiel as we said in French ! Everything in this place is perfect, the atmosphere of course, the decoration, the staff and last but not least the food. Burger delicioso, chicken, chorizo, pork even the quality of the vinaigrette can be spotted.

ismlVSeRcwe3uDplCYnt4A.text: Oh man. This place, guys. Well worth the weekend 45+ minute lunchtime wait, but Gaucho can also be the source of overwhelming joy when you find (as I did) an empty sitting room awaiting you and a buddy on an overcast pre-summer weekday in the 'Burgh. The rosemary braised beef sandwich is absolutely out of this world. If you are a horseradish fan as I am (read: this classy lady will take some horsey sauce with her fried zucchini at your average nondescript yinzer suburban strip mall pizza joint, yes please and thank you ma'am), you will love this sandwich, but the star of the show is most definitely the melt-in-your-mouth beef. The sandwich is big enough for leftovers, but you might find yourself going in for that second half whether you're still hungry or not. Would also highly recommend checking out the sides (which I believe are seasonal), especially if you're with a friend--on another visit in sunny summer, we split a corn salad of sorts which was as fresh as can be. Absolutely love me some Gaucho!

wWxGGAR8WmuLFqAO4RSooQ.text: Superb! Everything I tried was excellent. Will return again and again! The shrimp was excellent, the meats cooked to perfection and everything had so much flavor. Fresh ingredients does that to food. Can't wait to return and bring a few friends!

EpquA9W4PTh9_QULLc6Y1g.text: My sandwich was awesome & the grilled veggies were phenomenal. I'll definitely be back!

rhAYnorsGFakMla37KLcYA.text: Top notch place. Space, food, staff, and atmosphere are all excellent.   I went to Argentina a few years ago, and have been starving to get my hands on more. Seeing that Gaucho had opened excited me, and it exceeded the lofty expectations I had. Upon entering, it was very obvious that Anthony was excited about what he was cooking and wanted to share it with us. The menu is vast, with salads, sandwiches, small plates, and entrees to fit any time of day or budget. I had the papas (potatoes), flank steak, and empanadas. All were cooked to perfection, and the ingredients were fresh.   It's a great place for lunch, and they have tables you are able to stand at in the restaurant. They are working on outdoor seating for when the weather improves, and it's going to be quite exciting.  All the food is cooked over wood fire on the parilla, thus making all the flavors immense and very complex. The owner and staff are very knowledgeable and have really built a great place in Pittsburgh.

vN3WqbersGb4Z4biCNsZ_w.text: I'm from Argentina, and while the food is certainly not authentic, it is extremely delicious. We go there as often as we can. The Americans friends we've taken there were very impressed, whereas the Argentinean ones not so much (the meat is too pink, and the food too spicy for Argentinian standards). We love the asado plate, the filet Mignon sandwich, the sauces, the spicy seafood soup, and all of the sides. Their empanadas are not my favorite, they're too dry and the meat is ground too much. I'm excited to try their paella! All in all, this is an awesome restaurant with amazing and fresh food.

LmT1yF074MexGV2cgb5x8Q.text: So delicious. Long lines move quickly. The staff is so friendly and fun, even play games with you while you wait. Great salsas to choose from and creative flavors.

wCexhVSoUbwuWJa8kN4l5Q.text: Ridiculously delicious steak sandwich.  Flank steak with chimichurri is the way to go.  Only downside is the big line and somewhat limited seating.  But you can call ahead for takeout and skip the line!

dwZe0m8gwD-LaGl-zhzJ3g.text: The 5 stars for this place is well deserved! It's hard to put into words how good it really is. My advice to those who haven't been here before is to come at an off-peak time (if that's really a thing) because the line can grow very long really fast. Back to the food....ordered the pork sandwich with the corn pudding. Melts in your mouth! Don't take my words for it JUST GO:)

2MS-MuVMEKm_2fFSmdOUxw.text: There was a line out the door when we arrived but the folks in front of us had already been and  said it was worth the wait. After about an hour and a half, we finally got to order. The food was so good it actually erased all memory of the wait. Everything was fresh and made with with care. The waitstaff is super friendly and the vibe is perfect.

VR6Cx-G8oQe0ElqtJ5IQ9w.text: I have always seen a line outside but I didn't even know what the restaurant was. My boyfriend and I were going to try the sushi place next door tonight but when we got there all we could smell was the food coming from Gaucho. My mouth literally was watering. The line was decent so we decided to give it a go. SO FREAKING GOOD!!! The shrimp was honestly the best I have ever had, it was grilled to perfection! My boyfriend got the Parrillada Mixta(steak, chicken, chorizo). The steak and chorizo were amazing, the chicken wasn't anything spectacular (compared to the rest that is). We also got a side of red skin potatoes and mushrooms - DELISH!! It was a perfect date night! We will for sure be going back with friends! =)

zT3pCDdDqm-KIlG558b5ew.text: I miss the old Gaucho.  This new Gaucho has adopted the Portland concept of slow ordering to create a massive line so that you appear popular.  It is disrespectful to your customers.

Nf081nsGLUu5lhPd4N6_oA.text: So I have walked by this place numerous times and the line is insane. Today I finally got lucky. Walked in no lime and so glad that I did. Staff is very friendly. I ordered the half chicken with garlic and rosemary red potatoes. I took it home and it was phenomenal. I will definitely eat there again. The Mexican Coca-Cola was a good twist.

U4ub7cqHvxzNA-S0xOK74Q.text: Definitely lives up to the hype!  I ordered the steak sandwich, with a choice of steak meat (I got the filet!). For $12 that's hard to beat, economically speaking. The portion was plenty for me for dinner. The ciabatta bread was very fresh and tasty, and the meat was seasoned and cooked as ordered (medium rare).The onions were nicely caramelized, and the peppers had a great char/roasted flavor to them.  A friend and I split sides of papas and some kind of corn dish, which complimented our meals well.  There are several sauces (self serve) which you can add to your meal. I added some to both my sandwich and papas. I especially liked the red sauce - a tad of spice with a lot of flavor from all of the fresh herbs.

K2y0SXbVGIU5kKnzdaevRA.text: I've been here twice and am overall very pleased with my experiences. I went around lunch and there was a long line but it moved quickly. The staff was nice and accommodating. I was pleasantly surprised that even though it's not a server based model, they still walk around and check on how the food is and if you need more water. The space is beautiful and modern; exposed brick, chalkboards, hardwood floors, subway tile; textbook hip restaurant. I had a Rosemary braised beef sandwich that hit the spot; I took a tip from a regular and used some of the sauces/oils they make available. The bread was crusty and fresh, the beef was flavorful and rich; I felt like I was eating a really good meal. You definitely feel like you're getting a good value for your money.  I wasn't blown away but I was totally satisfied.   Parking is tough because... Strip District, no sides included, it's hard to find a seat bc they're so popular.

OKERp_tSqu54pmxib1kYzQ.text: *sigh* I really wanted to love this place.  Really.  The food is decent. The beef empanadas were really good. That sauce that's so talked about (chimi) is worthy of taking a bottle home for dipping on garlic bread and putting it on just about everything!  But that's where the good time stopped for us.  I'm not one to put down a place just because the wait time is crazy long as long as the wait is worth it...but this just didn't ever feel worth it to us.  The restaurant was so loud I could barely speak to my boyfriend. Everyone is kinda crammed together but there's no real "friendly" atmosphere here. It's very disjointed and chaotic. We got there on what seemed like a rather "slow" night and still waited a good hour to order and sit. Like I said, the food was just MEH...(those beef empanandas I would have totally taken 12 of those home with me and been content, though...with the chimi sauce).  I had the pork, boyfriend had the steak burger. The bread was burnt to almost unrecognizable consistency and I've honestly had pork just as good, if not better in other places. If I were you, I'd skip the hype, stop waiting outside for hours in all kinds of weather, and go find another of the million great places to eat in Pittsburgh.

5UIF6QKhA9xY8R2j0d3h_A.text: Food is great. Waiting too much for my order. Almost 25 minutes to order and another 20 minutes to receive it. I really do not recommend this place if you hungry.   Because the I was alone the waitress asked me to move to a smaller table, that's fine. I got all my stuff and went upstairs and oops the other table was taken by other people. She was polite and apologized. I think they need more personals to fasten things.

qPwMe4G5WNBS2JT7A_INSA.text: Outstanding food and service. The flavor profiles are out of this world. The wait isn't too long so don't be fool by the long line which is usually out the door.   My favorite meal is the flank steak with a side of the small veggies and a glass of Guinness or red wine.  btw It's also BYOB!

1nK2jdicrOZ4ueEIq7MkCQ.text: Alright, so it's not like this place needs anymore fantastic reviews, but after a meal as delicious as the one I had here, I feel like I should add one anyway.
