My mom and I came here for lunch at the end of the rush hour, so we chose to order a bunch of things (since we figured it wouldn't take very long) and take leftovers home. Each of us got small El Gaucho salads with skirt steak, plus the Provoletta app, a 2 pc sweet and hot chorizo app, and a side of "rusted roots." The salads were awesome - the veggies were crisp, the flavors meshed well, and the steak was truly amazing. I always order rare steak and this place cooked it perfectly. The quality of the meat was excellent, as well. The Provoletta app was delicious and perfectly melty... however, I took half home and had it for dinner, cold, and the cheese was still a stand-out (even cold). We could barely take more than a few bites of the chorizo app and the rusted roots, but not for lack of trying. The chorizo (I preferred the spicy but the sweet was good too) was juicy and had a great blend of spices. Finally, one of the things that made me want to try this place in the first place was the veggie pictures, and I was not disappointed by the rusted roots. This place proves that you can be "meat-centered" but still serve up some amazing veggie dishes. I highly recommend the parsnips but frankly all of the veggies in the mix were excellent. One more note about food - try ALL OF THE HOMEMADE SAUCES. On your veggies, on the toast, on the meat - they are all different and so, so good. The service was great (although again, we came at a slow time). A little on the pricier end, but not horrible - you'd probably end up spending about the same if you went to Panera Bread, and there is no comparison to the quality here. I will definitely be a repeat customer!

Tjl2fVN2votHoLfPkIDB8Q.text: Unbelievable food. I make an effort to stop here whenever I'm in Pittsburgh. Delicious smoked meats and a great selection of authentic chimichuri. At lunch hours there is a line out the door so it is best to visit at an off lunch hour time.

uOaAquO7brbygfc7KC_Flw.text: Totally insane, an amazing experience. I think the rest of the reviews on here confirm the meal that I enjoyed

P3HsNZMklNxNikOWx5BVlg.text: What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said. Not much I'm guessing.  The meats are flavorful and have a great char. The bread is fresh and toasted. My favorite part are the grilled veggies. I would come here just for them. The sauces are flavorful. My favorite is the chimmi. I look forward to trying the empanadas and grilled corn next time. Yes the space is small but they are working on an expansion. If in the area this is a MUST try.

xIKxi8R4H5-1n3fSzD8Ksw.text: The Gaucho is one of those special spots where taste and value are synchronized. The mixed grill with smoky sausage, chicken, and steak was oh so good and cooked to perfection.        Even with my own delicious good in front of me. I couldn't help creep on our neighbors fatty 12 dollar sandwiches. It could easily find myself eating his multiple times a week after a good workout and not have my wallet empty. What more could you ask for??

GkXjKcWbZhF_oHr4z3gzeg.text: Very tasty sandwich. Can be very busy with limited seating, but worth it. Make sure you have time.

qeHiFV9Nx15ai7UyvMMoLg.text: Absolutely incredible. Efficiently run restaurant with an incredible menu. I had the blue marlin pescado sandwich with the cheesy toast and roasted potatoes, which were all amazing. Would definitely recommend, well be back!

ub_reJc_Mf83aPp8aqn04A.text: I was in town for one day and saw that Gaucho had been getting rave reviews. Boy were they correct. I ordered the Rosemary braised beef sandwich which was juicy and every bit as delicious as I imagined. Definitely a go to spot in Pittsburg.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary braised beef sandwich

kih4blex0Bc_xUXW6kkbdg.text: Outdoor seating has been reopened! Best time to come is late afternoon though because who doesn't want to enjoy the outdoors on the 'Burgh? Really appreciate the table aide service, even though we are outdoors. And as always the food was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GBoDggn-vZjO3QWIV6UI0w.text: Gaucho is always fantastic.  This trip three of us shared the paella.  Paella is served in a 15-inch pan, which was more than enough for all of us for a total of $50.  We did not get any bread or sides.  With apps or sides the paella dish would feed 4-6 people.  The dish itself was very good with a nice amount of mussels, shrimp and clams along with chicken and sausage.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Paella was very good. Enough to feed 4, more if you get some sides or bread.

l5LSNLJT3zOH_OqcrzHGUA.text: It basically doesn't matter what you order, I can guarantee it'll be delicious. As soon as you get within a couple blocks of the place, your mouth will start watering as you smell the smoke and cooking meat.

x83NyjqldDhJwYFzzBjeEA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. Always worth the wait. Ask for the bread not to be too toasted and the carne is always good. If they have muscles, order them, the best I have ever had in the US. The potatoes always good as sides.

vaBYkgjkMgJvy54XnTpnyw.text: Service is absolutely AWFUL. My roommate and I went with our mothers and we are 20 & 21. We told our order several times at the front (keep in mind the line was non existent, so they weren't rushed or busy). They were so distracted by my roommates real ID that they forgot half of our order. They seemed very suspicious of her ID even though it was real and she was with her mother. Then we got four wine glasses at the table, and the woman came over again and asked to see our IDs when I clearly was not drinking. Best part, they asked us to leave immediately after we finished because there was a short line. No one else around us was asked to leave, and there were people who were there longer than us. Good food, but absolutely not acceptable behavior. I work in the restaurant business and that is the first rule, you cannot ask people to leave. I do not recommend.

by7TsTxF8ehsxBjLPD6YHg.text: The line extended out the doorway and wrapped around the side of the restaurant and it always will unless you go on a off hour. Then the line will only extend out the threshold.   I waited an hour and didn't regret a thing. This was one of the best meals I've had in Pittsburgh and have gone twice since. Their rosemary braised beef so juicy and tender but I enjoyed the pollo more! The pollo has everything I love, mushrooms, onions, chicken, and most importantly...potatoes.   Tip: Always, always, always get their gaucho papas and dip it into every sauce that they offer.

hyZkcSLjOsZal_O2ETdvpg.text: No matter what time of the day going here starts with a line! Yes the food is amazing, but the line especially if it rains or it is cold is annoying, sorry! The good thing is, when you get in the door the process of ordering and getting a table is quick. We had the Carne and the Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich, both good but the Rosemary was my favorite, the bread is really good too. We also tried the Chorizos and Empanadas both flavorful and delicious. My absolute favorite comes last we had Nutella Breadpudding and Horchata Ricepudding if your a Dessert lover you have to have it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Horchata rice pudding, it&#39;s for you if you like cinnamon
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nutella bread pudding, loved it
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Sandwich was very juicy

12-2ITHmp9ftv-YiOWl7SQ.text: our best meal during our stay in pittsburgh.  the carne sandwich was fantastic.  the sauces were exquisite.  you may as well make a few orders of tostados (toast) simply to enjoy the sauces.  the empanadas were really good, and my wife enjoyed her heirloom tomato salad.  her only regret?  not getting steak on it.  logistics are a bit tricky.  it's fast casual in the sense that you wait in line (usually a long time), order, and pay.  but then the staff seats you, and you're welcome to stay as long as you want.  nobody rushes you, even though there is a long line.  there are obvious ways that the restaurant could increase their bottom line (more tables closer together, working more quickly, etc.) but it's quite charming as-is.  highly recommended.  and, yes, i'll wait in line next time, too.

yW1-WU8B8Vh9mb1fJS2pEg.text: First thing's first- Gaucho has some of the best food in Pittsburgh. It's ridiculously delicious, which makes it really hard to write a poor review.  Let's talk about their line system. They don't let you make reservations or write your name on a list. You have to stand in a line waiting, not to order, but for a table. I get it. It's their thing, their gimmick; it makes them seem exclusive and peaks people's curiosity. A few months ago I waited in that line for about an hour, and the quality of their food was worth the wait.   HOWEVER, when it is a 90+ degree August day, the line borders on inhumane. They have no Disney World-esque signs to give you an indication of how long the line will be, which keeps people waiting because they think it can't *possibly* be that long. We stood in the baking sun for an hour and a half before even getting into the building, then waited for an extra half hour inside the restaurant. I watched people in line get serious sunburns as we waited. I watched a woman with a handicap struggle to literally stand up as she waited, which really made the whole thing feel borderline ableist. A worker came out with a tray of about ten waters, so at least ten people out of god-knows-how-many were able to hydrate. They have signs that say that you can't hold people's places in line, so there are really no good options. The whole thing was a nightmare this time, and seemed like a lawsuit waiting to happen. I don't care how good their food is, no food is worth that.  Also, I am the most easy going restaurant patron in the world, and would NEVER dream of complaining online when my order gets messed up. But when you wait in the baking sun for an hour and a half and they forget to put in your dessert order, then get it wrong when it finally comes out a half hour later while you watch the staff goof around, it really feels like an extra kick in the shins. I loved Gaucho but I can't imagine ever coming back, or ever suggesting it to anyone, until they figure out a more humane, kind, and handicap-friendly ordering system.

3iPdXUNmSK2Vq9MTyZPu4g.text: Really loved Gaucho! Came with friends on a sunny day. The wait was about an hour (which is usual for this place), so make sure you don't come starving. I got the flank steak plate which is served with salad, a slice of toast and sauce. The steak was cooked perfectly and was super flavorful! All four sauces are really good and complimented the steak. Also got a side of roasted cauliflower that was delicious and seasoned to perfection. I definitely recommend Gaucho and cannot wait to go back and try more!

J2D4k8OHNPKtxcAy1kXw_A.text: Fantastic food and atmosphere.  Worth the wait and its byob.  Absolutely loved it.  The steak platter was amazing. And the paella was filled with fresh seafood.  Don't get me started on the sauces. Chimicurri and garlic are the best I've ever had.  Will definitely go back and try the sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and paella
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parlla
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak platter

sXALG7iOqMzFV6hFrfQpig.text: Best food in city to pair with wine. Go early to avoid line. Steak is out if this world.

zB9PpWLwDOAkxp7JHqoIhA.text: Been living in Pittsburgh for almost a year and after a few failed attempts of coming here on a Sunday and also coming way to close to closing time, we finally made it!!! And the line was long! But we finally got our carne and bondiola sandwiches, and they were absolutely delicious!!!  I asked the girl who took me order what she would recommend for my carne sandwich, and she said the sirloin, which was a little tough. I will get the ribeye next time. My husband had the bondiola and he loved it more than the carne. My only wish was that they didnt serve it on ciabatta bread. We also got the gaucho papas and maiz, which was fine, we'll just be sticking to the meats and sandwiches in the future though, because they are incredibly filling... and I would much prefer not making room for anything else other than my carne sandwich. And the sauces!!!! My favorite is the garlic.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich

o1sDLyK2tkVSgfbuSkGVQA.text: So after waiting so long to come to this wonderful establishment I am glad to say I finally made it!  I ended up paying this place a visit over the weekend at around 3 pm when the lunch crowds had dissipated and the dinner crowd was yet to show up.   Came here with hubby and the in-laws when they were visiting from GA. Anyway I was initially overwhelmed by their menu but we started with the empanadas and fungos (mushrooms). For mains, my husband had the seafood soup and I had the Argentinian salad with filet.   The empanadas were delicious, and were highly complimented by the various chimichurris they had. Chicken went really great with ajo (garlic sauce)) and the beef went great with the regular chimichurri.   My salad was excellent, it had greens, tomatos, mushrooms, onion, bell peppers, and some other stuff I dont remember along with a perfectly cooked filet. It was beautiful, it was tasty, and it was a great bang for your buck. I will have that again.  As for hubbys soup, it had all sorts of sea monsters: clams, muscles, and calamari in a delicious broth which had a bit of a kick to it.   Alll dishes had impeccable presentation, the whole establishment had an extremely clean feel and the wait staff was very helpful and attentive. I honestly could not ask more.   I can't wait to go back.

JI33uz9mkRQW4qIoRZvtDg.text: Delicious. I ordered the braised Rosemary beef sandwich. The meat was flavored perfectly with lots of Rosemary. I was lucky and there wasn't a line. But I've heard there are long lines. It's worth it.  Also it is byob. I can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu. They make there own sauces too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Rosemary beef sandwich

ZYNbXyRhlQdQ-tv94oNHrg.text: Food was spot on delicious. There's a reason the line is out for door for this joint.

GBekjHJ7PC_pogqPMB8LOw.text: Gaucho's has an average rating of 5 stars! How can we NOT stop by?  This place is bustling all hours of the day. We drove past Gaucho's multiple times during our stay in Pittsburgh and there was a line out the door every.single.time! Rain or shine. Don't be afraid- the line goes quick! I felt like it went a bit TOO quick cause I was still gaping at the wonderful menu plastered on the chalkboard wall.   Con pan carne (ribeye steak sandwich) $12: AMAZING! I didn't expect too much from a sandwich that simply has steak, chimmi, onion & peppers- but boy did they serve me wrong. The tangy-ness from the chimmi is captured well with the sweet & spiciness of the onion & peppers. Such great harmony! You're probably laughing at my review, but you just don't know. All I can advise is for you to try it!  Arrechera (flank steak combo): Steak plate served with salad & toast. Shoot I didn't even bother with the salad & toast cause the flank had me captivated. It was so juicy & tender! All 5 of gaucho's sauces paired well with the steak and brought out a different charm with each one. I was just a bit upset that the steak came out more medium well than medium rare as requested.  Empanada (2 for $5): The reason why this review is bumped down to a 4. It was probably the most untasty empanada I ever had. There was no big difference between the chicken & beef because they both had the same overpowering bitter taste presumably from one of the veggies they used. The chimmi couldn't even save it.   The interior is beautifully decorated with cute hippy accents around the restaurant. There is limited seating. If you go to the back room, there is a super low table you can eat on. The bench is higher than the table so you're basically crouching down over your food. Keep in mind that you can NOT sit down until you ordered. They highly enforce the "drinks must be on the table" rule so someone in your party can't save a spot while you order. Keep that in mind~

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FhnUf-VXs267XNLp3yMWsA.text: Absolutely love the food at Gaucho, everything was excellent! The decor and food is very nostalgic of Argentina. However, to keep in line with the Latin way of dining and improve the overall experience, redesign is needed. Gaucho, in an attempt to reduce costs, with limited space and staffing requires customers wait in line to order food (including dessert) then be seated. The wait is often very long, making it not ideal for the elderly or disabled or those of us that want to sit down with a glass of wine and enjoy a scrumptious meal without standing in line.

dewPm0yWxsFn0bbjSF70wg.text: I'm going to sound a little insane, but I was stalking this place for a while. I'd heard good things about it from my friend, who described it as "that godly place in the Strip that has five stars on Yelp." Naturally, I was a little curious. I swear, I checked their Facebook page every few days while it was closed for renovations to see when they'd be back up.   Well, as you guess by this review, I finally made it! And it was worth it.   ATMOSPHERE: while I hadn't been to the old one, the new interior is lovely and has many different seating options. Unfortunately, this place can get full quickly, so we were stuck at a table where the setting sun shone directly into our eyes.  SERVICE: amazing!! While we were waiting in line, one of the staff came out and asked if anyone had questions. I asked about one of the sauces on the menu, and he brought out said sauce with a small spoon for me to try it. If you're intimidated by the Spanish on the menu, just ask for help. Also, one of my friends wanted to switch out one of his sides for corn on the cob, and they were totally cool with it.   FOOD: my rosemary braised beef sandwich was delicious! I am a huge fan of crusty bread with big beautiful air pockets, and the meat was cooked to perfection. If you're at this place, it is basically assumed you love meat, so be ready to eat plenty of meat. However, two pieces of bread and all that beef was too much for me to bite at once, so I did an open-face sort of thing and used the other piece of bread to dip in their various sauces. I encourage you to test all the sauces and find your favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rosemary braised beef sandwich! Quite a mouthful
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The huge chalkboard menu

1qawTOkDFINaPVfYvSuPCQ.text: This place was a solid find. A bit off the beaten path, it's a trek from the convention center but well worth it.   Their menu is loaded with authentic argentine dishes and can suit any taste. The queuing/tanking system is a bit unorthodox but at lunch it didn't really matter.   I had the flank steak meal - it was cooked well and the side salad and veggies were amazing. Make sure you try the chimichurri sauce on your steak and bread.

dHNBewm-8cA-aQ6RdTG-rw.text: This restaurant has excellent beef items. If friends visit Pittsburgh and are looking to visit the Strip district and want a casual meat restaurant this is the place to go. They are cooked to perfection. The drawbacks are parking as well as having to wait in line, which at times can be long,

-RlWwcySh6X2nQsKswX40w.text: This place rocks! Great atmosphere, cool layout that adds to the vibe, great service, and down right well cooked food!  I just stopped in Pittsburgh for the day and was pointed in the right direction with this place.  Had a large order of med. Rare Flank covered in Chimichurri, side salad, Toast, and a side order of shrooms. Definitely will be back the next time I'm in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Buh9JjaDIzhLkWBvR_oEYQ.text: The renovated and recently reopened Gaucho is bright, airy and spacious, yet retains the warm and welcoming feel of its former, more intimate, dwelling. I've been talking this joint up to my family for months, and my dad and I took advantage of a Saturday morning tour of the Strip to pop into Gaucho at 11, hoping to avoid the scores of shoppers who'll undoubtedly invade the place later in the day.   Gaucho lived up to my bragging, impressing even my culinarily-spoiled pops. I enjoyed the super juicy flank steak sandwich, smothered in roasted red peppers and caramelized onions and soaked in Gaucho's signature Chimichurri. The steak was flavorful and tender and, while undeniably messy, combined with the veggies and bread to create a masterpiece on a bun. We split the spicy chorizo plate which was the perfect way to sample another one of Gaucho's selections. The chorizo was complexly flavorful with a mild heat and an intriguing mixture of spices. My dad raved about the lamb, tender and cooked to rare perfection. We washed down all the meats with Mexican Coke and exited onto a busy Penn Avenue stuffed, content and with plans for our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. #allthemeats

Wwcbi7y5uhqsWaW4xLGE5A.text: The ecstatic reviews do not over hype this place - it is the best steak sandwich I have ever had.   We didn't even know this place existed until we were walking down the street and saw a line out the door. Out of curiosity, we stepped up like sheep to see what treats could attract such a crowd. A line out the door always leaves me worried, but it moved pretty quickly. All in all, we were in line about 30 minutes before ordering, and it was another 10 before we got the food. It was absolutely worth the wait.   We got 2 chicken empanadas and two steak sandwiches, one with flank steak and one with NY strip. I love that you can choose your steak, and they have 6 or 7 to choose from.  The sandwiches come cooked fresh, on soft fresh bread, with delicious caramelized onions and roasted red peppers. The mix of flavors is phenomenal, and the juices from the steak are literally dripping off the sandwiches and getting soaked up by the bread. They also put a chimmi (don't call it chimmichurri) sauce on it that was real tasty and added to the wonderful complexity. There is a decent amount of seating in back, and despite the line, there was plenty of open space. If you're in town, do not skip it.

MfBGzxcN0JOa-B2xxVy2qQ.text: As an Argentinean, I had the bar set pretty high for Gaucho; they did not disappoint! Each cut of meat is flavorful, tender and fresh. The chorizo is so satisfying! The simple salads provide a fresh pause in between bites. And the alfajores satisfy your sweet tooth to close the meal. The one thing I missed: flan and churros!!   Hoping they expand soon! The line can get pretty long around dinner time.

LX7FJOL3OSyNV9VhYVMFjg.text: Always an amazing experience with fantastic food. Sad bc they were out of filet mignon but can't complain much. Nice people wonderful experience and the most excellent quality food

2QJnyqM0YyhBE2SLftHnCw.text: This place is tasty and unique. It is one my favorite places that I like to go to during their not so busy times. I eat out a lot so I'm not accustom to waiting in long lines . People love this place so at popular lunch and dinner times there will be a line out the door and around the corner.  I get it though !!!!

ekUMmFZB1-aadq8vmgTIbw.text: This was Gaucho Marx's favourite eatery in the damn world. He and I joined the rewards club here but then quit immediately, as we did not want to belong to any club that would accept us as members.  They have different prices for girls and boys. I went with my friends Tom and Tina. Tom paid next to nothing, whereas you should've seen what they were Chargin'-Tina!  What to get: The Steak Sandwich, with the Lomo Steak, and all 4 types of sauces to try. What else: A lot of the customers here are airheads, but they're Buenos Airheads, so it's cool. And: Thanks to my many Yelp friends including Laura and Lisa that forced me to come here. You were absolutely right and it pains me greatly in my nether regions to admit that. Ow. Anything else: The bathroom can get a bit Messi and the radio is always playing "Like A Prayer" by Maradona.  In a Parrillal Universe, I would have tried the "authentic Latin spot" that every white person I know in Pittsburgh insisted I try, and I would have said, "authentic my left testicle" and given it a 3 star review for 2 star food and 1 star hipster services and 0 star prices bumped up to 3 stars because it's locally owned. However, in this Universe, something else entirely happened.  What happened is that the restaurant in Pittsburgh most beloved by Hipsters, the Latin spot most championed by white folk, the trendy "#1 on Yelp" option... actually... is... amazing. One of the best sandwiches I've had in my life. Several of the best sauces I've tasted in my life. Authentic as a motherf****er but with a real flair and innovation about it too. Gaucho has it all. I am humbled and delighted to say: it deserves every single one of the plaudits.  So you can cry. Cry as much as you want. But don't cry for Gaucho Parrilla Argentina. The truth is, if they've never served you, all through your wild eating days, your mad overweight existence, then please make this promise: and go the distance. To Gaucho. And try their sandwiches. And sauces. And then we'll talk. If you want. Which you probably shouldn't. Because I really do have the tendency to go the f*** on a bit too much.  The sandwiches and sauces here are on a Parr with the best you've ever had, anywhere. The Rosemary Beef sandwich is good, and worth a try, but it doesn't come close to the steaks.  And make sure you try ALL THE SAUCES. I hate to use caps and I rarely do but that just emphasizes how important it is that you try ALL THE SAUCES. They will give you ALL THE FEELS.  I like that they don't Price Gauch you here. Okay, well they kind of do a little bit, but the portions are large and food is spectacularly delicious, so you probably won't feel as ripped off as you would if it were typical sh** hipster food. Service, also, is wonderful here, both by phone and in person.  Of course it's Argentinian food, not "Latin" food and that really helps, because when Hipster crap is sold under the comprehensive all-inclusive Latin banner, it usually isn't Latin at all. Every Latin country has a completely different cuisine, and not only is Argentina's amazing, but it's also really hard to find in the USA. This is the best Argentinian food I have ever had outside South America. Hands down.  No really, hands down. The cops are more likely to shoot you and say your Gaucho sandwich was a gun if you put your hands up like that. Friendly advice.  I don't even like steaks. If I lived in Argentina, I damn well would. That's for sure. Famous story about then-Southampton FC manager Pochettino being given authentic Argentinian steaks flown in from his homeland. That's how good they are. They fly that sh** in across the world. So there's that.  I also like that this place doesn't have any Aires and graces. Well it kind of does because all the pretentious people go here. But for once, they have good taste. Now I don't expect to see them down on Brookline at Las Palmas, getting the Ribeye Taco from the street cart out front (one of the best tacos in the US, and 99% of Pittsburgh has probably never even heard of it, let alone tried it). But let's not cry about what we do not have. Let's cry about what we do have: amazing recognition for an authentic, incredible restaurant that - in normal circumstances - would go completely unnoticed in favour of the fake stuff that usually does well.  Don't just bring your friends here. Bring your Peron-tal units here too.  Not only did Yelp help put Gaucho on the map, but it's inside the top 10 of the "best 100 places to eat in North America" according to Yelp. And for a city as un-trendy (despite being amazing) as Pitt, that is quite a feat.  I was going to be all Patriotic (since I'm English) and mention our war with Argentina, but then I realized: I don't actually give a Falk.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Who doesn&#39;t love a close up of hot meat
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One of the best sandwiches I ever had. Oh I meant with those two guys in Pittsburgh.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gaucho has more amazing delicious sauce than my bedroom on a Friday night

ik-wuh-PUVnoo0pRTKwklw.text: BYOB! Had a NY strip plate. Very flavorfully marinated meat, nicely charred, very tender likely topped with herb sauce. There are upstairs tables and few tables downstairs and counter seating. The line builds up fast during rush hours, expect a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bife de Gaucho plate

Kx-_7nUFYXc7UPzvonS30Q.text: Another Pittsburgh institution I had to wait in a long line to enter but, oh man, this time it was DEFINITELY worth it.   First off, BYOB. Don't wait until you get here to try and find liquor, as there's no shops in the immediate vicinity. We resorted to East End Brewery for some beers which is around the corner. If you want wine, come prepared!   I was with a group of five, so we decided to split the asado plate: FIVE cuts of steak on one plate with toast and chimichurri. On the side, we ordered a house salad (eat your greens!), smashed sweet potatoes, roasted potatoes, and empanadas. We chose to sit outside and they happily gave us an ice bucket for our beers which was a great touch. After a little bit of a wait, our food starting rolling in...   HOLY MEAT. Be sure to ask for the sauces so you can try them all, but really, the steak can stand alone. I honestly don't know which cut I was eating when, but each was as delicious as the last. The smashed sweet potatoes with vanilla and caraway and sunflower seeds was probably my favorite side, but the salad was actually a refreshing addition. I wish we got more toast to soak up the juices of the steak, but it's probably for the best we didn't. All that food was certainly enough for the five of to roll out full and happy.   Wait in line. Order all the meat. Eat all the meat. Dream about the day you can return.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asado platter
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. La Casa salad
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted potatoes

snJAyzme-ycS6hVsqYov6g.text: We came here for dinner but discouraged by a long queue outside the restaurant in a cold weather, we left to eat somewhere else. We came the next day for lunch and surprisingly the queue was not that long and we got to wait inside the restaurant which was promising. We ordered everything veg in their menu which tasted like little treats for our taste buds. We were excited by the four different house-made dipping sauces which were packed with flavors. They noticed our curiosity and helped us with the details of each one of them. All four sauces were uniquely distinct in their taste and not to be missed during your visit. The garlic one is my least favorite though my friend loved it. I loved the herbs (Chimmi) one the most. Hot pepper and onion ones were equally good for me. We had them with tostado but they can go well with anything on their menu. The sweetness of vegetables came through well in the vegetable empanada. And the sandwich was also good. I would go back anytime for their dipping sauces. But you might want to go back for charge-less BYOB or order their's. They are absolutely awesome in their service and the hype is all what they deserve!!

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sampler of chimmi, ajo, pimenton , cebolla
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uHwWq0rf4jIr3LnhyJ_xjg.text: The empanadas are unbelievably awesome. The chorizo sandwich was delicious. Seriously, not a single bad thing to say. Even the guy at the counter where we ordered was incredibly friendly. Love this place!

nWONdma92PeW4Wp-xnR83Q.text: I don't see what the big hype is.  If you like under seasoned, over cooked, over priced steak, than this place is for you.  Ordered multiple medium rare rib eyes for the table and every one was grey on the inside and basically tasted only of charcoal unless slathered in the house sauces. Chicken was pretty good though!  Lol

q3_hAlkHxsaI1M2_2NNaHA.text: So good- we went twice on our visit.  Bring your own wine.  We shared the chicken- awesome!  Their garlic sauce is off the hook, well- all of the sauces are.  We also split a salad.  Again- very well done.  It's nice to see a restaurant where the staff works together.

jqhal3qnYdHC90vqEt2FFQ.text: Rachel was amazing, great host. Made the time pass easily as it was a long wait, expected at such a famous place. Overall great spot

dR5kd7yuuRh_x05NvRaqPw.text: Highly recommend this to anyone!!! Best foods I've tried so far on my trip! Thanks for such a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best.Food.Ever!!! Spaghetti squash, red potatoes, sweet potatoe wirh marshmallows and skirt steak with bread and salad!!!

_WRy32IMW01-4Ue2jN0X9Q.text: The best steak you can get out. The seasonings and wood fired taste is amazing. Call ahead and pickup is best choice during busy times. My go to place when I'm in the strip district.

i_lBdUC-21LymmMS6u9iYA.text: Definitely my favorite spot in Pittsburgh. Everytime I'm in town this spot is a must stop. This place is very different from your normal restaurant. They are a "crash the counter" restaurant meaning that you come in, order & pay first & then you're seated. I love this kind of style because you know the food is going to be amazing & the food here is beyond that. I also love the open kitchen. You can see all the cooks making everything & they use a REAL DEAL Argentinian grill. If you think you're gonna mosey into this place or make a reservation as well you're in for a rude awakening. Make sure you get there earlier than planned because the line is always long. Yes the food is that good. Also don't expect to see beer or wine on their menu because this place doesn't have a liquor license. The True beauty about this place is that it is BYOB!! They also provide wine & beer glasses for you which is awesome. They are one of the only restaurants I've ever been to that serves Yerba Matte, which won my heart lol. The menu changes from season to season I believe so make sure you go in to catch them when they have the rack of lamb it is TO DIE FOR. They also have a little sauce station with different homemade sauces which are excellent. They have a killer chimichurri & garlic sauce for their steaks. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu everything is great but I would definitely recommend their rack of lamb. It's a little over 40 bucks but I promise it's worth every penny. Like I said, it's my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh & I stop there whenever I can. Check this place out if you ever catch yourself in the Strip District & don't forget.... its BYOB

lvjQa2h9az5iMlWvd14GBQ.text: The food here is awesome. It is a very unique vibe. It brought me back to my days spent at the Beehive. It is an interesting setup. You go to the front counter and order your food and pay. Then, you go to your seat and they bring your food to your table. We had the mixta, which comes with steak, chicken and your choice of sweet or hot chorizo. We got the sweet. We also got an order of provoletta and pork empanadas. We got sides of yams, mushrooms and greens and beans. I did not eat the yams, so I won't comment on those, though my wife did love them. The mushrooms were fine, nothing spectacular. The greens and beans were very good, if you like garlic, which I do. The steak was great with a really nice char on it, which gave it a really nice and smoky flavor. The chicken was good, a little bland. But let me just talk a bit about the chorizo. I love good chorizo. This was among the best chorizo I have ever had. It was packed with flavor. The provoletta was awesome and I wish we had gotten a large versus a small. The empanadas were good, if not a little dry, which is fine. There is a self service bar to get dipping sauces. They are all great. It just depends on what you like. We got the bread pudding for dessert, which was incredible.  The only thing that dings it for me is that if you want dessert, you have to rely on one of the waitstaff to get the dessert for you, which they will do. In which case you have to pay separately for that. My wife did make a good point that because they bring out all the food at the same time it does start to get cold, especially since the serve them on wooden plates, which is very pleasing, but it doesn't help retain heat. But once you are done, you can just leave and you are not waiting for your check.

jF-ViYvJS2AP6q2LFYeu9g.text: This place is Argentinian. Argentina is located in South America. This restaurant is in Pittsburgh, not South America but it is still good. The capitol of Argentina is Buenos Aires. Argentina borders Chile, Brazil, and Uruguay.

sEBmSs4LhVwHXxGaKDpEGw.text: The steaks here are best in town !!  We had waited almost an hour to be seated but it was completely worth it, this place has waiting so make sure to arrive soon and u won't be disappointed as the food served is awesome. The sauces were real good, it's a must visit place and unique menu.

6blxXlDdMNYRDEaip9LMTg.text: There's a reason there is a line out the door of this place nearly every time you go there! Everything I've had from Gaucho including veggies, potatoes (papas) and especially the meat has been absolutely wonderful. I'm a person that usually goes for chicken over red meat, but order the steak here, you just have to. Their Chimichurri sauce is amazing. Another place you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Try to hit it this place on the off-hours though there really aren't any.

GC3a7LmPDf-dlGmU72Fu6w.text: Stumbled upon this little gem based on the recommendation of our hotel driver!  The curb appeal us simple with cute homemade signs but the olfactory appeal was off the chart.  We were told that the line often wraps around the building.  Not knowing what Argentinian food entailed, we went in, read the giant chalkboard menu...and we were hooked.  Tried the pollo sandwich and the rosemary beef sandwich as well as shareable sides...carrots with hot honey and goat cheese...roasted red potatoes and corn roasted in olive oil.  Portions were huge...prices were low.  This is a bring your own alcohol restaurant if you choose to imbibe.  You order and pay at the counter, then given a table (may be shared) and then served.  While ordering the kitchen is in plain view...I observed everyone sharing space and humming like a well oiled machine.  Everything we ordered was delicious...our entrees came on very dense bread which we discarded but could have been ordered deconstructed.  Overall this was indeed a restaurant we shall revisit and would highly recommend.  Noted that weekend lines can be long!  We got lucky!  Go!

p2xOMEC_s7MeAKcjsS_hLg.text: This is probably my favorite place to eat! I had a small filet and it was delicious. The sauces are so good. Grilled corn and cauliflower was superb. Will go back and wait in line because it's just plain worth it. Friendly staff! Clean! Love love love this place!

TNXdRlWzimecGO9_vtoBUQ.text: Great value for your buck. The shrimp is amazing, the sauces too. The red meat was good but it hasn't blown my mind. I only get the sirloin so maybe I didn't hit the right cut with them.

bCAPgXvU3bHK0YElRAdrCg.text: El Gauchos is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The steak is always cooked perfectly, and it has such a beautiful char to it that makes it irresistible. If you're with a group of people, the asado platter is a MUST - all the cuts are delicious. All of their food is amazing and worth trying!   Also, if you like bread, this place has some of the most amazing grilled bread you'll ever have. Trust me. It's better than garlic bread. That's how good it is!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rb8YETAjh9CYsZ7s4f3PXw.text: Slow and overpriced. The food was good but not outstanding. We waited in line an hour to find more than half the tables were empty inside. They need to improve efficiencies. I may try again with a takeout order but will never wait in that line again.

8rLfLUcqoSYwxvQSvR_g2A.text: I don't know how to express how AMAZING Gaucho is.  The food, the ambiance, the staff - it is a well oiled machine and worth every second of the wait outside.   The steak is so delicious... and the sides (I highly recommend the carrots!) and the people are super nice and the BYOB makes it even better.  We had a large party and they took great care of us and I think it was probably one of the best meals I have had on my visits to Pittsburgh.   Don't be scared off by the wait - it may be long but it is worth every second!!!!

D84MuzSS6fvl4hg5GsxgEg.text: 1,549 reviews with an average rating of 4.5. Does this place really need another bangin' review? DUH! Lol. I need a story to go with all the cool pictures I want to post! In town on business and I wanted a unique place to eat so I do what I normally do. I find out what the most reviewed place is in the area and go there! Here I am, 45 minutes before they closed and there was a line out the door a little up the block. Fun Fact: Before closing someone will come outside to assess the line. They will then hand the last person a medium-sized board with a Johnny Bravo picture on it that says "End of the Line". With this great power comes great responsibility. It's their job to turn everyone who tries to get in line, away. You get a free t-shirt out the deal. It was hilarious and I had never seen anything like it before. The funny part is, people actually respected the sign, being held by an ordinary customer whom they've never met before. People CAN be kinda awesome.  Atmosphere/Appearance: Set right on the corner of Penn Ave and the David McCullough Bridge is this place. Apartments above it and a very simple concept. Walk up to the counter, order your food then you go sit down and wait for it to come to you. The menu is GIGANTIC in size and posted as soon as you walk in the door. You can see it for pretty much down the street. Lol. High ceilings, bright woods and a few plants decorate the inside. There are 2 main eating areas. One in the front right by the menu and the second is up some stairs toward the back. As busy as it was, it wasn't very loud. Just the sound of normal conversation.  Service: Like I mentioned earlier there isn't much service. You order and it gets brought to you. Cuts out the need for a tip right? Lol. Everyone was very friendly though and super helpful explaining the things on the menu if you struggle with ordering.  Food: I wanted to try several things since I can't remember what Argentinian food may taste like. I ordered all of these at once and here they are in no particular order. The Qui Qui Chicky is "two chicken legs and two thighs with ancient alien quiquirimichi sauce from outer space and grilled lemons." It was phenomenal. I don't think I've ever had grilled chicken that was so tasty, so seasoned and so... awesome! Chorizos were next up. They're hefty sausages. You can get them in a sweet or spicy variety. The come with grilled red peppers, caramelized onions, toast and pimenton sauce. They come in orders of 1, 2 or 3. These were also incredible. Like, can this place just not disappoint?! Moving on. I also ordered the Camarones which are cast iron seared shrimp with rosemary, garlic and lemon. They come in a small and large portion. I wound up with the small since I was trying a variety of other things, but they were quite good. Shrimp can be hard to season. I probably would stray away from these in the future, but give them a try. I needed my vegetables so I tried the roasted cauliflower which comes with chili oil, scallions and lemon juice. Delightful. Light, flavorful and you don't feel bad eating a lot of it. Lol. Last, but not least was their Maiz. it's basically street corn that's grilled with olive oil, salt and pepper! The food was all incredible. I want to try everything on their menu, but my eye is set on that quintuplet of steaks next time!  Value: Not too bad, but can get spend-y if you wanna try multiple things. Maiz = $3.00 Roasted Cauliflower = $4.20 Camarones = Small/$11.00 Large/$19.00 Chorizos = 1/$5.00 2/$9.00 3/$13.00 Qui Qui Chicky = $11.00  This place was freaking awesome. I was able to dine with 2 gentleman I randomly met in line so we all shared a table, not food. Lol. I'd love to come back here time and time again to explore the rest of the menu.

a37IEzi0dU4enQaz5A8coQ.text: Went here and got one of the steak sandwiches. After all the reviews, my expectations were sky high. Cool environment right on the strip and staff is exactly as you'd expect: friendly, helpful, and conversational. It was extremely hot outside but the restaurant held cool.  The food was good but left a little to be desired. There is a sauce bar (?) at the front of the back room for you to combine different sauces for the entrees. My steak sandwich was a little tough, bread was piled high, etc. overall good meal, just didn't blow me away. I will probably go back and try a different sandwich.

K8tjFkyvL30kNvsy6py68A.text: I had 24 hours in Pittsburgh and this is the place that my dad and I really wanted to try.  Many Yelp reviews mention the option to call in an order to take out so I was going to try that as our flight arrived after 7pm on a Saturday night and I wasn't sure if we would make it by the time we drove down there and had to wait in line.  However, when I called the restaurant to place my order literally as soon as I got into my rental car, the person who picked up the phone said that THEY DO NOT DO TAKE OUT ORDERS ON SATURDAY NIGHTS as they don't want to cut the people waiting in line.  I guess I can understand that logic, but I haven't seen a Yelp review that mentioned this and there are no mentions of it on their website either.  I was definitely bummed, as I explained that I was visiting from CA and when he said that I should visit again on another day, I told him that I would be out of town by the time they opened again (they are closed on Sun-Mon).  I'm sure the food here is amazing, but just had to let the Yelp world know that at least on Saturdays they better plan their schedule to wait in line instead of hoping for take out as you won't have that option!

Y2mzpEwAK8BVWj-LPXtkLw.text: We arrived right around opening on a Saturday afternoon and the line was already out the door. By the time we finished and came out, the line was wrapped around to the bridge (so come early or be prepared to wait!). The food was fresh and made to order. They have a system where you order first and are seated afterwards as tables open up. We tried the bife de gaucho (cooked perfectly to medium rare), gaucho salad, empanadas (one of each) and the chorizo. They also had a variety of sauces to try with the food. We didn't think our order would be enough for 4 people, but we were stuffed by the end of the meal. Everything was delicious and we'd definitely love to come back if we're ever in Pittsburgh again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gaucho salad, bife de gaucho (medium), chorizo (sweet &amp; spicy), empanadas - all so delicious

gK6UHCWNNSmx2s_RARL-Og.text: Actually, I had my reservations because I was worried this place was "just hype" ... however, Gaucho's goes beyond just "meat-ing" your expectations! For anyone who argues otherwise is mis-"steak"-en, trust me.  There tends to be a long line out the door for a reason. The food speaks for itself. For the quality of the meats, prices are very modest. There's no unnecessary "fluff" when it comes to Gaucho's. It's authentic, raw (pun unintended) and straightforward. You want well-cooked, nicely seasoned meat? Go to Gaucho's!  [FOOD] I tried the "Asado Platter" which features 5 different types of meat (about 4-5 pieces each) cooked medium rare (the only way meat should be cooked) -- delicious! If I were to be more critical, some of the meat was a little overcooked, but this didn't discourage me from eating everything. Needless to say, I didn't really have a reason to complain. The accompanying sauces (which were in cute mason jars) were also great. I personally liked them all. I had a lot of fun pairing certain cuts with different sauces. I wish I had a salad or something acidic to cut through the heartiness of the meats -- but again, this isn't something I'm complaining about (more so me planning my next trip).  [SERVICE] The workers were very chill and friendly. They definitely know how to handle "hangry" people professionally.  [ATMOSPHERE] Although I didn't get to see the "upstairs" or elevated platform, I enjoyed the "vibes" of the place. Everything felt rustic, raw (again, pun unintended) and warm.  Would I go again? Yes, but I'll be sure to go on an empty stomach (portions are very generous, in my opinion).

JAvWQyYIBlKsqOQjme3v0w.text: Bon appetit!! Being as this was my first time dining here after hearing all the hype, I have to admit that everything that has been said is True. The food was nothing short of phenomenal. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. I especially appreciate the ease of ordering, being seating and the numerous options of entrees and chimichurri.   I arrived with a party of 8 and was delighted that we had a table ready for us. What eas even better was our food was coming to us hot and steamy no more than 5 minuted later. I found it impressive to prepare appetizers and entrees for 8 in such an efficient time.  I ordered the small plate of shrimp, 6 total, the roasted potatoes and a veggie empanada. All were amazing. I'm ready to come back here next week, and how could I forget BYOB completely complimentary!

_9GAxMJtA3fe-zWTFzHMkg.text: I did a roadtrip from Chicago with a friend over 5 days and this was my favorite restaurant by far! We got the rosemary braised beef sandwich, chicken empanada, and argentino salad with flank beef added as a side. Minds blown. The chicken empanada and the Argentino salad were stellar. The beef sandwich was great, 4/5, but the other ones were 6/5, especially with the different sauces (we tried them all and they were all so good!). Highly, highly recommend. Wish they would open a location in Chicago.... there's nothing like it here!

L-77Oa_y_O3BGj3Gr4LkpA.text: I read a lot of hype about this place so we decided to check it out.  The line was extremely long, wrapping around the building.  It was over an hour wait just to get in the front door.     I was told they would like for us to be seated outside on a patio area next door to their business/building.  They told us it had nothing to do with us having a service dog, however with a line wrapped around the building, nobody else occupying several tables on the patio except for us, it did seem that way.    We specifically asked when putting our order in at the front counter if we should order extra sodas now or if someone would be by to refill our drinks on the patio.  They assured us that someone would be by to check on us and refill drinks.  That didn't happen, nobody checked on us once, while our drinks sat empty.    The food was mediocre.  I didn't think the meat was great quality and was sorta blah in taste.  One of the slices of meat was undercooked for 'medium'.  The potatoes and the corn were just ok.  I wasn't wow'ed and probably wouldn't wait that long to eat here again.

0O-uUGzh4yuks1ZrlwHxGw.text: Absolutely perfect for meat lovers! This place has such a different vibe and even though it's always busy, the line moves super fast! I tried the ribeye and the beef and chicken empanadas. They were fantastic!! I have always loved this place and wish I would of wrote a review sooner!! Spent a nice evening alone with a great atmosphere and great food

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4iiAj6W8vnwbFL4l2yzgOg.text: Elevator Review: Long line, but deliciously worth the wait for meat lovers. (Or order takeout!)  Gaucho is fantastic. On our first visit we waited in line for more than 2 hours. And it was worth it.  I had the Cerdo (roasted pork with roasted onions, greens and grilled bread). This was quite possibly the greatest pork I have ever had. Juicy, flavorful and paired perfectly with sides.  My wife had the small strip steak - again perfectly cooked.  We shared roasted vegetables and empanadas - both delicious.  But to me, the real star is the dipping sauces. My wife is obsessed with the chimichurri, while I love the garlic and roasted onion.   Tip 1: Gaucho doesn't serve alcohol, but they don't have corkage fees and encourage you to bring your own. Bring wine (which many people did) or walk down the street to one of the many fine purveyors of alcohol in the Strip District (we went to East End Brewing Company).   Tip 2: If you don't want to wait, just order for carry out. Call early and walk right to the front of the line and take your order home.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cerdo (near camera), small strip (top of frame), empanadas and roasted veggies in the middle.

mxeY8n09Q3MM5kLFJ_puhg.text: Wow. I love Gaucho! I've only been here twice but I crave it constantly. My coworkers and I have ordered from here and it's ridiculous because it's so much food during the middle of the day. But we can't help ourselves.   We've all only have gotten sandwiches and salads. The bread is out of this world! Tasty, soft and crunchy at the same time. How is that possible?! and the meat is literally cooked perfectly. It tastes so good, as well. It tastes exactly like it should.   This is a hard review for me to write because it's hard to explain how great the food here tastes. It's just really high quality and no BS. Definitely will be coming here as much as I can. Please do yourself a favor and visit when you can!

CeMyWzXNrtWLHawU6eRVaA.text: Can't think of how the steak could be better and trust me, we tried all of them. Went to capital grill during the same trip and wished we had returned  to this strip neighbourhood meatetarian  heaven. Waiting on the long like to get in is uncivilised and worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and more steak
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and more steak
