jx_6-6dMOflkzjongdp8zQ.text: I couldn't possibly recommend this place more.   In the heart of the Strip District, it's the perfect way to end a day perusing through Pittsburgh's favorite Food District. And it's an ending that will certainly not disappointment.   It's an "order at the counter" establishment, which can sometimes lead to a bit of a line-backup that leads you outside of the restaurant doors, but for the most part the line moves quicker than you would expect.   Whether you are sharing a dish (steak platter or paella), or hand-picking some of your personal favorites, you are sure to find something that you will decide you can no longer live without.    I'm a big fan of the pollo con pan, cauliflower side, and the empanadas.   Push the flavor boundaries a bit and experiment with one, or all, of their house side sauces. (The Ajo is my favorite)

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gaucho for the win.

RguGMegF119E4W3WvmErYg.text: Although this is a fun and casual place for dinner with friends, I think the seasoning on the food here is overwhelming. The steaks are also pretty expensive for the amount you get (about 4-5 slices for small, which typically runs me $15).   Their sauces are colorful and interesting, but way too oily. I also don't understand why they would serve the steaks with chimichurri sauce if they think we would also like to try their other sauces. The rub for the meat is also too salty anyway. I wish I could appreciate all the flavors in their sauces, but I think to save on costs they dilute the sauces down with oil. I have tried to reproduce some of their sauces at home and I can guarantee they are more interesting with less oil.   Food also takes awhile to be served, but they are BYOB so drink it up while you wait it out.   Overall, I keep coming back mostly for the cool vibes and decor, but the steaks could be so much more.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

350aH_vjlvNi3eOLjFr1Og.text: Gaucho has made a name for itself in recent years in the Pittsburgh food scene. Drive by later in the week/on the weekend, you'll see a crowd of people wrapped around the outside of the building. Expect a long wait if you go at peak hours. However, I am always impressed with how efficient they are at running the place, they manage their dining room and seating patrons very well. You'll have long forgotten about your wait once you're seated with your food. The menu is very large, always tough what to order! Awesome that their sides make for great share plates, so always fun to get a variety of options for the table. An Argentinian restaurant is obviously heavy on and known for their meat, but expect to be impressed by everything else from their salads, rotating vegetables, sandwiches, etc. I was in last month and inquired about vegan options and was so happy to hear they use oil for ALL of their cooking. So any of the vegetables, breads, salads, etc., can be made vegan or vegetarian. My most recent visit I had the vegetable sandwich and I will say it was WAY too much bread, tough to eat and the fillings got lost. Salads are delicious and fresh, and all their sides are worth trying at some point. Potatoes used to be better years ago they were so crispy and really cooked well, but I wasn't too impressed with them this last time. You must get a sampling of all four of their sauces because each one is super flavorful and unique. A chimmichurri, ajo-garlic, pimento-red pepper, and cebolla-onyinz a caramelized onion sauce, all available for take-out as well. BYOB so come with a group and enjoy good company. Lovely ambiance inside with all the rustic wood.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side of mushrooms and potatoes. They cook everything in olive oil so no concerns with butter if you&#39;re dairy free :)

GNILLJntPAcGPEr74DPaAg.text: Amazing steak sandwiches! Loved the atmosphere! Very clean and the service was great! I highly recommend to anyone in the mood for a tasty meat sandwich

bjwQz40UqwVc_HrhIAkBSQ.text: Food was good but long waits and VERY loud environment. Had a meat tray of variety and a lamb tray. No alcohol served on site but they do allow BYOB. Wish they served as we didn't realize this prior to arrival.

LVXIuua9pF6WaC6lX9gs1Q.text: Attended an event in the lower level.  Food was terrific and owner was there to make sure all went smoothly.  Great mixed drinks and an over all good experience.

DMcuNZscOyA5f1ifO--rXQ.text: Great food! Love the grilled veggies.  Assorted sauces are great and I recommend you try them all- can't go wrong.  Service is fast and friendly! Hope they expand soon for more seating.

lZVTi5qcRQNEYsS6KLqEcg.text: In terms of combining amazing food and a great atmosphere, Gaucho Parrilla Argentina stood out head and shoulders above the rest of the (very good) restaurants I tried on a recent trip to Pittsburgh. Plusses: amazing food, both vegetarian and meatetarian; hilarious staff, who were yelling and singing and just having a blast the entire time; like, imagine the happy townsfolk at the beginning of some Disney movie. Minuses: Gaucho Parrilla Argentina exists only in the world and not inside us; as in, to return I will have to return to Pittsburgh.

rNnZkUH5vbWl4RSs_5af9Q.text: The burger was delicious.  Not your typical American hamburger.  It's super flavorful, big (you can split with someone), and has a great crusty bread instead of a bun.  Price is well worth it, but expect to wait in line since the restaurant is so popular.

oMFoDDOqx1MQBq8oucwimQ.text: This place has 5 stars for good reasons! :) The food is extraordinary and the service as well. Very complex tastes. We tried the Pollo sandwich, the fillet steak plate and a grilled corn. All were out of this world. Best steak I've ever had! Don't miss their food if you're in Pittsburgh.

UTPuxSZnP-xWAyp20J5-cA.text: Great set up. Food is delicious and I am glad this type of cuisine showed up in Pittsburgh. Worth the wait and the money

aEYxmx63nmv-1yFyIsSAiw.text: Let me start by saying that I am Argentine.  I recently moved to Pittsburgh and I was VERY hesitant to eat here.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The Chorizo is not authentic Argentine Chorizo, but the Chimichuri, and the steak sandwich was phenomenal.  The service was great and the menu was quite impressive considering the size of the restaurant.  I will be back for sure.

AgcH5mLhGnHF6MwhGqhYkg.text: So the line for a Thursday was crazy, so they started offering (limited) spots in Bodega, downstairs, where they happened to be hosting a 4 course fixed menu. It was my husbands birthday, and we had heard so many great things about the food, we decided to give it a try.  Bodega offers a slightly elevated atmosphere with the same flavors of Gaucho...it did not disappoint.   The first course was a cross between chorizo and salami, Serrano ham, chevre, manchego, kalamata and caselveltrano olives.  It was served with grilled bread and chimmichurri.  Then was an heirloom tomato salad with a delicious pork/beef meatball.  Then the entree, grilled steak, corn on the cob, shrimp, more grilled bread and a variety of vegetables.  The Rosemary onions with the steak was out of this world.  They brought out our pineapple cobbler (so ridiculous!) with a candle for my husbands birthday...a very nice touch. We will definitely be making reservations for downstairs in the future!

ebFwvNqonfdsbFVek0huoQ.text: SO delicious.  SO good.  The meat is beyond tender.  The space is a bit cramped, but the hospitality warm and food is delicious.  There is a rumor they are expanding soon.  That will make this an ideal place for a lunch,BYOB happy hour, or quick dinner.

aZ3Q-4FOGklY7MsqDBZ1sQ.text: Outstanding every time! My husband is from Argentina, and he swears by Gaucho. The empanadas are just like you eat in Argentina, and the provoleta is amazing. Be sure to leave room for dessert as the alfajores are awesome.   We started going shortly after they opened when it was counter service only. They expanded to the next building, and the new look is beautiful!

HKqt2aL2P5-HrL52AQwwxQ.text: The only bad thing to say about this place is the long line but that's testament to the great food, great customer service, and good times you'll have (once you get your food).

Bd7zUqI5tgClMFMynbcPiQ.text: The food is sooo good! I just wish the restaurant was different, they don't take reservations, don't have waiters, you have to get your own plates and silverware... It makes things so complicated. Also, since the place is so popular you might end up having to stand outside for an hour or more just to eat. It's just too complicated, I want to have a nice dinner, not a stressful one which is what I get after standing outside in line and having to serve myself.

6ejRT8PKS6jzVN9cDtBB1Q.text: I don't feel the need to say anything more than what has already been said time and time again about this place.  The best steak sandwich I have ever had.  Period.  Ribeye steak sandwich, don't mess around, put chimichurri on it.  The end.

mh1Ia8NZkUvsR9ElHag0jQ.text: Top five sandwiches I've had anywhere in the world. Chicken or beef. Doesn't matter everything is awesome.

0Nes3mVXi55uKHm9WZUhZw.text: I really like the idea of this place and was excited to try it. We ordered the ribeye steak and the camarones (shrimp). The steak was tasty and was cooked properly, and the side salad with grilled vegetables was nice. The shrimp were good but a little on the small side; I was expecting bigger shrimp for the price. Overall, it was good and I like the idea a lot, but the price is high for what you get.

BdCOMRUnvjn-x41lhyLmVA.text: The best (and only) argentinian cuts you can have in Pittsburgh. The flavor is amazing, the presentation subtle and the portions have the perfect size. If I could I would go there every week. The sandwiches are great but what really worth is having one of their amazing cuts. BYOB. Take your favorite red and enjoy.

5lIKxpOo1oyoDK1AiGDWGw.text: Gaucho is a tiny spot with big, BIG smoky flavor.  Walking in is like being immersed in a forest fire that all of Bambi's delicious friends have failed to escape.  Me and my brother went here for his birthday dinner, and the first thing that struck us, aside from the size and the smoke, is the minimalist staff: one guy on the register, one guy in the kitchen.  But both of them are seriously good at what they do.  The guy up front was warm, funny, and knowledgeable, providing atypically excellent service while the guy in the back works the grill like a friggin artist.  Here's the breakdown of our meal:  We ordered three sandwiches: the skirt steak, the fish of the day (mako shark), and the steak burger.  The skirt steak was cooked astonishingly well.  Generally when SLABS of steak and not those paper thin slices are used in a sandwich, it doesn't eat well, doesn't break apart nicely when you bite into it so the sandwich falls apart or you end up pulling out more meat than you intended.  The steak at Gaucho eats well, and is wonderfully tender.  Our only complaint was that the steak itself was a bit underseasoned and was overpowered by the caramelized onions and red peppers.  The mako shark was also cooked perfectly and seasoned very well, tasting lightly of lemon but still recognizable as shark.  If you've been disappointed by tough or bland shark in the past, I definitely recommend trying Gaucho's take on it.  Finally, the steakburger was the smokiest burger I've had in Pittsburgh, and in terms of sheer carnivorous sublimity ranks up there with the best.  The smoke complimented the flavor of the meat perfectly, giving it depth and nuance that all the toppings in the world could not.  Of course all of these sandwiches were served on delicious bread that held up to the juices dripping out of the proteins.    All in all, these sandwiches are pricy, but they are damn well worth it.  The executions are excellent and the flavors are generally well-balanced.  I'd also recommend trying the four condiments they have available, with my personal favorites being the chimmi and the ajo.  I have to say, existence of this place gives me much hope.  Here is truly good food and good cooking without pretense, striking a balance (and a striking balance) between artistry and accessibility.

-qmajOh-m6OgVlOjnqoJvA.text: If you haven't been here, you need to make this restaurant a priority. Just walk in and get the smells and you'll know what I mean. I don't even know what else to add. I don't even want to get too wordy with a flowery description. Gaucho doesn't need it. They're just amazing. Why are you still reading this?! GO NOW.

B_YQ4zRcFIHIDeBKWG3WXw.text: Fantastic food. Highly recommend the wings!  The customer service could use some work. Manager/owner looking guy was rude when I came in the door, rude when I asked about seating and rude when I requested that they add avocado to my salad (since I had paid for it and it was nowhere to be found). He ruined my experience.

TT6Kfk2-qGyzOu9WYmQ-tA.text: Great food!  Worth stopping by!  The mahi mahi and steak dinner were wonderfully made!

TPALPVmHmTp5oVODjBTdzQ.text: Excellent! Excellent! Great meat and great flavor. Even the vegetables were grilled to perfection. And an incredibly friendly and helpful staff! I look forward to eating there again!

JMNAbiMtrNCHrYOnHsvI3g.text: Drove through Pittsburgh from NYC to Memphis. Looked up on yelp the best rated place that would be open, in the area and $$. This amazing little gem was the only one with 5 stars and it definitively deserved it's 5 stars. Nice staff, super good and charming environment.

-0eOmW7S91gsxa_5dEzZew.text: Since I enter this place I really like it. Gaucho is a small restaurant with really polite and warm people. The food is just amazing, one of the best I have tried in Pittsburgh. The meat is juicy and so soft, I truly recommended. The corn is just  barbecued perfectly.

tJ_1Tx7BEsJZ6I--rkamTA.text: This place is amazing!!! We were at pittsburgh for a conference and found this place on yelp with 5/5 rating! It is absolutely one of the best restaurants i have ever tried! I had the flank steak and it was great!!!

snTeUjGw-jzYwZ32mOkjqw.text: Love these guys. Anthony knows what he's doing. Steak Burger is best burger in town and I stand by that. Killer Americana twist on classic Argentina Specialties. Only one problem! I can't get enough! Awesome awesome food.

dlGhBOEQnxefGzXfdSG93A.text: The food is close to authentic Argentine and very tasty but it is very clear the management has a ridiculous view of themselves.  I have been there four times since they reopened and the disorganized approach towards serving customers is laughable.  The skinny blond guy in the baseball cap walks around swigging Yuengling while lecturing customers why they should wait and why it is "cool" they have run out of all the popular items. Twice i have witnessed him explaining to customers how wrong they are while holding up a long line, all while holding a beer in his hand.   Meanwhile it is total chaos with one young lady trying to take orders with a long line while two order stations go unmanned because managers are sitting with customers drinking beer or laughing it up in the back of the house, which avtually disrupts the cooks.  I hope these aren't owners but maybe just relatives .... so they can fire these guys and hire people that know the front of the house.  If not, I am confident they will lose the buzz of new restaraunt popularity and be out of business in a year because of the hideous customer experience.

rhWTANHizKvVK_m7kFA0vA.text: my son loves this place tasty food good service and very clean...

wYKjDlmIuOENF4ZXe_KY4g.text: This restaurant has the best steak in Pittsburgh.  No kidding.  It is prepared over a genuine wood grill, not gas, not even charcoal, but wood, then cut in thin strips for serving.  Seasoning is simple salt and pepper but when combined with the wood flavor, it is phenomenal.  The various chimichurri sauces are good, but unnecessary.  In addition to the beef, Gaucho Parrilla offers excellent grilled vegetables, toast and sandwiches.  The only seating is in the outdoor garden.  There is no indoor seating, only counters to stand at.  Come, enjoy the smells and defiantly the beef!

Ir8wDKOUOk5nJJvGPitNnA.text: Food is honestly amazing. Unbelievable flavor. This should be a must stop for anyone in town.

ssos3J72Yu-I4j2TOpnjJQ.text: Unbelievably good?  One of the best foods I ever put in my mouth.  I had camarones, choriza, 1/4lb ribeye, veggies, and extra grilled bread, which comes with all four sauces for dipping.  It was so fresh, flavorful.  Everything was herby, smoky, salty, sweet, and sour in the right proportions.  The steak was high quality and cooked perfectly.  THe atmosphere is so much better than you would expect.  The cashier was so helpful and the chef/owner chatted me up and was entertaining and delightful.  I recommend everybody gives them business asap.  I will definitely be back.

_AyRK3eAzA02iGZ_JbjUUw.text: great food. the steak platter is awesome

h-C4N3ncfByONI_-hLda7g.text: So good!   Just got takeout, the grilled skirt steak and vegetables were incredible!   Looking forward to future visits and trying more of the menu!

IyJcLxKBoJ6EnBl_EswWuQ.text: This place is so good that I signed up for a yelp account! While traveling through PA we stopped at this gem. Unique food with flair. The service was outstanding! The atmosphere was more casual then expected, but the food did not disappoint. If I am in Pittsburgh again I will come back for sure!

yfBu6F6bN-TGzjtclgzjWw.text: Caramelized Onion Soup with Portobello and a side toasted cheese bread was fantastic. And the Chorizo sandwich with their "Chimmi-Churri" (homemade dressing with TONS of fresh herbs!!) was ridiculously flavorful  ...Love this small little GEM! I just happened to stumble across this place in the Strip. The friendly staff was also great and helpful in explaining the menu if I had any questions!  I will definitely be trying it again!

sJQIV46PwY4VWxAy_0XaCQ.text: There is a good reason for the 5 stars review. It is just awesome. The sandwiches are spectacular and so tasty. Great job guys

sYjkf2Spz8hvz21Si17Uew.text: This place is awesome.  And they have surprisingly good fish sandwiches for your enjoyment over Lent.

3D4RZLpWtQNXj1dn8IA7MQ.text: this place is awesome. go there so they will stay in business and I can continue eating delicious steak for a long time.

RBC-qkwktHRn_8BnTKrvGw.text: The food is fantastic especailly if you are a meat lover,the servings are large and filling the place really has an awesome look and feel, and the service is beyond great.. Thumbs up

O7yngbI2sjLMt87mVKvzBA.text: Delicious! Had rib eye plate, we tried all the sauces each one had awesome flavors. Also had an order of veggies and potatoes. All I can say is everything was incredible. So happy we stopped there!!

34l5cQ0PMIBbd8mbCNT07Q.text: Always have a good experience here. The employees are always excitable and kind. Food is always delicious. I love the flank steak, shrimp, toast, and the dipping oils!

9yec7UlO7hRBKB9xecNF1w.text: Might be one of the best places to eat downtown period. Love the chimichurri's and bread. The meat is ok too. I need to try the chorizos next they looked awesome. I would say half of the employees were really nice.

xJgSXOF933cYpcSbgIfYSg.text: Amazing!! Safe to say this is the best lunch I've ever had. I got a perfectly cooked steak sandwich. Try it with the sauces! Large portion and great price too. I can't wait until I'm back in town to eat there again!

WPJyKiP1mpA--7FI8yv3JA.text: Momijis is one of the best gems in Florida!!! They made me fall in love even deeper with sushi!! My favorites are the Russian revolution sushi and the hibachi scallop and chicken over noodles!!! It is to die for!! Also, It's a great family restaurant that's elegant yet very hip and very cool.  Furthermore, I see that the manager WORKS VERY hard to please her customers. She is very nice, sweet, personable, fun, a cool person. I give a big thumbs up!!!

JEkJHvcj-Cm4tMXGJKroag.text: The prices were quite reasonable and the food very delectable. The empanadas were a little underwhelming the day after. Remember to bring your own drink if wanted.

MhP67DCKDqQM2hf0-wH94g.text: This is by FAR the best restaurant in Pittsburgh. Bug claim I know but everything is amazing. A bit pricey but worth it. Great flavor, BBQ, South American fusion food.

FGY0SukgfK1RRfR11CloPw.text: Went here for lunch and didn't realize it's all about the sandwich! You really need to know the food so you can make a choice/selection. Meat was tasty buy need further review

B11q23Terj59eUGmVRJ_vg.text: This place is amazing. I had to drag my boyfriend here but he was thanking me afterwards! Skip the filet mignon cut and get the steak sandwich with ribeye cut. Ribeye just tastes better than filet mignon on bread. It comes with roasted red peppers and caramelized onion on ciabatta bread. Dip it in the fantastic chimmi churri for a good time.

QqiGZlsXRGUIQ6f9SY9OLw.text: My biggest question is why they bought such a small space for this restaurant?!?  This place is packed with people and super popular and for good reason!   We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and the rain held off long enough for us to get our sandwiches and sit outside to eat.  Thank goodness!  They only have about 5 seats inside and a small area outside the restaurant to eat.  The menu is up on the wall, and I wish we had tried some of the small appetizers, bc they looked awesome!  The grilled corn on the cob looked amazing and I was having big time food envy!  But, we only ordered sandwiches, which were more than enough for lunch!  This place is known for their meats, so I am here to let the veggie heads know they can also enjoy a sandwich here as well!  The veggie sandwich is huge, with lots of great slices of different grilled veggies. They also have all the salsas out on the counter so you can try them all!  (Which I did!)  My husband got one of the steak sandwiches and was silent for about 4 minutes while he inhaled it.....which means it was awesome!   My advice is to call ahead with your order and pick it up to go.  That is what we will be doing the next time we go, which will be sooner than later!  It is great, but the seating is a pain!

UJWfVzs2hZNs6PCnp6fO3w.text: Delicious food, quick service and reasonable prices! Such an amazing find, I'm glad the doctor (not to be mistaken for The Doctor that travels through time and space, though with a new regeneration cycle, it's maybe possible that it was him)recommended this place! Do not miss out, seriously, go eat there now, you won't regret it!

Aore0CbHtkhyK_zsG2CMCw.text: Get the Parilloda Mixta - heaven on earth and you get to try a wide variety of meats.  This place is BYO which I love.  Hands down the best steak in Pittsburgh.  I have yet to find higher quality elsewhere and the service is great every time.  Be prepared to order at he counter.  Chalkboard kind of deal and then they bring the food to you at your seat.  Incredible experience.  Wow!

EWfq1zjVdtL7UxJVYZTRPQ.text: Worth a visit to give it a try.  Atmosphere very noisy food quite good.   Pittsburgh has a lot  of good places to eat and this would not be a place I would go again.   We were a group of 6 and none of us was impressed with our meals.

IHPkSj3rrEhNIHcuYbIIbg.text: It is hard for me to write this because I really wanted to enjoy this place. We ordered the ribeye, mixed veggies, the mixed plate of meat, and brussels sprouts. It cost about $50. The food came promptly and we dug in, only to find all of the meat cold. Not warm, cold as if it had been laying around for an hour. We were starving after having driven 5 hours from Allentown, so we just ate it anyway. It did taste pretty good. We told the busboy about the coldness when he asked, and he offered a free dessert, but as I am diabetic, I said no. So, I would have given this place maybe 3 or 4 stars, but then I got sick. Not food-poisoning level sick, but bloated, gassy, and indigestion all day. A bit nauseous as well. I have a stomach of steel, too. I almost never get sick from food.  Just know that this place isn't all that it is cracked up to be, even the cuts of strip steak had tons of fat and the veggies were unevenly cooked. And, if your food is cold, get your money back and run! We probably just had a fluke of a meal but still...

LXchwrR0yS3yDWVfo1fKmQ.text: This is one of the BEST restaurants in Pittsburgh. The food is awesome. The flavors and quality are what sets this place apart. I've had several types of steak. All were excellent. Probably the best steak salad I've ever had. Chicken is also excellent. Must try the homemade sauces. Service is good for a place where you order at a counter. But even with lines of customers out the door, service moves relatively quickly.

M-AHUxK_v5ldfT2d41f_lQ.text: Outdoor seating & BYOB.  I had high expectations of this place with all the rave reviews and 5 stars;  I was NOT disappointed.  I have a feeling that the "word" is getting out fast about this place.  Their menu was full of delicious sounding creations it was hard for us to decide.  We asked if they could just put us together some mixed grilled vegetables and meats.  That they did.  We enjoyed a platter of mixed meats with shrimp, a large salad, toasted bread, grilled vegetables and delicious sauces.  Everything was so flavorful and cooked perfectly and their home made sauces went well with everything.  The staff was super friendly and accommodating.  It was nice enough to sit outdoors and we enjoyed the atmosphere and the food.  It is a small place, some may describe as a "hole in the wall", but I disagree, it is small but, charming.  Their food is unique and tasty, tasty, tasty and BYOB, well that is just fantastic.  We will be back to try some of their other items.  YUM !!!

Y1WqPxhRnmL7WHulN1kzKQ.text: Wow. Easily the best ribeye steak sandwich I've had. The chimmi sauce is incredible and should be put on everything

4zglv6YE6QQFPXdV0oZQNg.text: I love this place. I eat here at least once a week. Prompt service and great food! Get the grilled corn and any of the steak plates.

zeHnQH5F_-aywSAT_AxiSQ.text: Very different restaurant from 2 years ago. Did enjoyed it tremendously most recently. Restaurant has changed. Bigger more ample seating. Highly recommended. It is worth the wait.

35nq1YIVtR-kzKfdufq36w.text: Gaucho is a great and offers some of the best menu items in Pittsburgh. We ordered the Paella and three empanadas. The Paella is sized for 6-8 people but reasonably for 4-6 people. Advice for the next time is to use the paella as a side dish, not a meal! The steak looks too good to resist and use the paella as a massive side dish!

Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FYEMhqAltkdrfk8mq7dlmA.text: Always great food and a wonderful atmosphere. I have never had a bad meal here! Every steak is excellent and cooked to perfection! When in season, I highly recommend the roasted corn on the cob! You are always treated as family here!

NV8OECpwohXVMY6mUh9VCw.text: Everyone said this was THE place to try. Come early, especially for lunch and dinner. Otherwise, be prepared to wait in line for 45-60 minutes. And yes, that line goes outside and around the side of the building, rain or shine or snow and bitter cold. They take debit/credit cards.   Food: We had the lamb, a NY strip steak, and a ribeye. All the meats were prepared to the requested level of doneness. Lamb has a bit too much salt for my liking, but otherwise fresh and flavorful. Good char on all the meat. No one in our party of three cared for the charred bread accompanying the meats. Salads that came with each meat were lightly dressed in a vinaigrette. Empanadas were amazing! The pork empanada was our fave. Sides of cauliflower, broccolini, and green beans were simple and tasty.   Service: You line up and order from the main counter. There is NO TABLE service. Drinks first, then food. Staff are proficient in explaining what's on the menu, which is a massive chalkboard on a wall as you enter. Based on your time in line, you should have plenty of time to review what's on the menu. Specials are posted lower on smaller individual chalkboards near the front of the line.   Cost: A small lamb, 6oz. ribeye, and 6oz. NY strip steak with side salads, 6 pc. shrimp appetizer, sides of cauliflower, green beans, and broccolini, with a pork empanada and a chicken empanada ran us about $85 after tax. Not cheap and portions are so-so.   Overall: I wouldn't line up for it again, but it's worth a try. They do have a sign for the last group to be seated to hold noting they are the end of the line. This is so more folks don't wait in line in case they run out of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8jKtwOpu0Q0HIxcyn6ixYQ.text: One of Pittsburgh's most talked about spots did not disappoint at all! We went for a date Friday night around 4:30 and did not have to wait at all. We split a chorizo, chicken, and steak dish. Plus we ordered potatoes and shrimp. It was the perfect portion for us to split. My favorite was definitely the chorizo and then the shrimp. But everything was great! Their meat is cooked perfectly with delicious sauces to accompany them. The garlic butter sauce was heavenly. We were certainly satisfied with our experience and will be back again.

sR4s2gULH-_H4-IIYu4ixQ.text: Excellent quality meats and so many to choose from. The hype is real. I got the carne sandwich with filet mignon and the papas al horno on the side. Everything was so fresh and you could tell they use high quality ingredients. Steak was tender and cooked to perfection. The caramelized onions and roasted red peppers were the perfect accompaniments in the sandwich. A little heavy on the bread but you can order it breadless or open face. I just took off the top piece and ate it with a knife and fork. It was perfect. Papas were served with rosemary and roasted garlic cloves. What stands out are the 4 sauces that are self serve on the 2nd level - chimichurri, ajo (garlic), cebolla (caramelized onion), and pimenton (smoky red pepper). My favorites were the cebolla and pimenton. Put some on every bite to experience the different flavor combos.  Food came out promptly and service was friendly.  Will definitely stop by again to try more items the next time I'm in town!

3e_FnzdxCuxemwQg65QVhg.text: Gaucho is the quintessential Pittsburgh restaurant! They have a personable and excellent staff who are always friendly and welcoming. Their atmosphere is that of a rustic yet modern cabin, and their food is the zenith of the experience. The wood-fired meats and vegetables are the perfect texture, and the restaurant has four options for sauces to pour on top of them. The delicious sauces suffuse impeccably with the meats and the vegetables, creating a harmony of flavors.  The desserts are superb as well. Do I need to say anything about a mango coconut bread pudding to convince you?  The only issue with Gaucho is the line. They're so good that too many people go there! Get there early, so you don't get caught in the line!   They're an invaluable asset to Pittsburgh's food scene.

DrSuyfU-e3tPL8hhEPm7fw.text: There is a reason that there is always a line out the door for this place - it's just that good! Gaucho is one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh and one I always tell out-of-towners to try. I've never had anything I disliked. My husband and I usually want to try multiple dishes so we get some sandwiches, empanadas and all the sauces and split it. We always leave with some for lunch the next day too! Definitely a spot to try. You won't be disappointed!

kWNlBRzDq3PEB9Vy46GQPQ.text: I absolutely love this place. I came in for lunch and there was a wait but it was worth it. The menu consists of several different sandwiches, salads, small plates and entrees. I ordered a pork sandwich, the corn side and split a few empanadas. Everything was made fresh and they had several different delicious sauces to add to your food. The place had a great vibe. I can't wait to go back and try more.

h2SICbA8CTz0oi_XDDWnQw.text: Visiting Pittsburgh for a conference and dropped by here for lunch! It was my first time trying Argentinian cuisine and I really liked the food, place & the people! Will definitely recommend to others

Fkn1WamoqSi3nc5_gLRNqw.text: Food was good My only issue with the place is the wait. We waited 45 mins at 5pm To me it's just not worth it. Standing in the hot sun just waiting to get in, I thought would have produced mouth watering food. And by the time we got out the wait was 2 hours!

KD8CeBQK2Qiga9HfKDFg6Q.text: By far my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh! You can taste the flame in all of their meets and the sauces make the already good food exceptional. I recommend the qui qui chicken for anyone that has not eaten here before but I really haven't had anything that wasn't delicious

a0I7y4mpWq1yk2yei4edDA.text: For the last few years, this place has been ridiculously good receiving all kinds of attention in the news and on social media, but more recently, I think the food quality has slipped a notch or two specifically at their restaurant.  It seems like they have their best grill masters working their Asado wagon which frequents local microbreweries each week spring through fall.  I want to give Gaucho five stars on here, but they are not currently there.

jNoLIKTWIHXNWhWIlqjZLA.text: Food was amazing, great place within walking distance, definitely coming back. Also, Steve was a great guy, great energy and a positive attitude!

TpsvHKQ0SYvN0Mx0IHy1Zw.text: This place in one word: Damn!   I don't know how this food is so delicious. The spices, the cooking methods, the presentation, the atmosphere, the service. It's truly exceptional. We heard it was one of Pittsburgh's best restaurants, and I believe it. I enjoyed the casual atmosphere, but that the food tasted better than a "fancy" restaurant.   It's in the Strip District, so you can walk around and visit all the other shops, which makes for a great date.   I told my boyfriend that I was actually sad the meal was over (i.e. All the food was gone).  He got the huge steak plate with 5 different cuts of steak. The Ribeye was his favorite. I had the fish of the day on a deconstructed sandwich, which had the most amazing grilled onions and arugula with it.   A little expensive compared to some places you could visit, but we'll worth it for the quality and flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asada Platter. Garlic toast. Deconstructed fish of the day sandwich. Marinated eggplant. Perfection!

xmVJ5opFq3durzenfktoZQ.text: Ate here 2 days ago with 3 new friends, very busy , you have to order in the front desk and then wait to be seated, so there were a huge line waiting there, it took us about 30 mins to sit in front of table. Ordered Ribeye steak, Quiqui chicken, fried fish, seared shrimp, my ribeye steak was juicy and tasty, other dishes seems all fine too. Ps. The cookies at the front desk are quite nice

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bzLZXsrh-mI1S3zOzWbLrg.text: Was the 1hr wait in the cold and additional 1 hr kind wait to order worth it?   I don't know to be honest.   Maybe if you've never had an south american/Argentinian steak over a fire? I guess this place is a gem in terms of food diversity and culture in the area and is accessible by tourists on the strip as well. If I had my way, I'd honestly recommend going there on a less busy time for maybe lunch? We saw lines already starting at 5PM for dinner. Maybe a weekday instead of a weekend?  They make fresh chimichurri which was delicious. We got the NY strip steak large plate each which comes with a side salad and grilled bread which was delicious to dip in the array of sauces.   The steak was perfectly medium rare and they do cut your steak for you if you're not used to that.    We also got the roasted cauliflower as well. I think overall the food was fresh, perfectly grilled, and the ambiance reminds me of a family style modern farm house esq place with an almost cafeteria feel I also loved all the local art support. Be aware that it will be noisy so don't expect your intimidate atmosphere.  It is BYOB as well.   Overall not a bad experience but I honestly don't think it was worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. NY strip FYI extra bread is more money
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled cauliflower

Ot89Yd2jzUtVK5NBdHJPJA.text: Amazing food and very friendly employees and close to the strip district. I have been multiple times for lunch with coworkers and it is always amazing. I usually get the flank steak plate and the small 6oz is plenty large for lunch for me. I get the steak medium rear and it is some of the best steak I have had at restaurants. They also have 4 sauces that are really good and I usually use the roasted red pepper sauce on my steak and one of the green ones for the piece of bread they serve the steak plate with. I have also gotten the cheese/prosciutto plate and the meat plate (chicken, chorizo, etc) and they are both really good as well. I have never been disappointed by anything I have ordered at Gaucho and have never heard anyone say anything bad about it.

AbF0D9BjqOYXE-emJG0MAw.text: Great atmosphere and excellent food. We had the flank steak plate and we all devoured them. Thumbs up Gauchos.

UnLGVVp4jl2HqWfuJZd5Ug.text: All I can say is dayum! This place is awesome. Be sure to bring some patience, you will have to wait. Gaucho's is worth the wait. I was in Pitt for a conference and made a stop after locating the restaurant on yelp. As I stood in line I watched plate after plate pass by and everything looked good. I had the ribeye plate medium well, off the chain!!!!! I also had the grilled broccoli and the rusted roots potato's....a must. Sweet potatoes, carrots, onions,chopped celery, and I believe chopped red potatoes.  This is a must get as well. You have to get the cookies Coates with coconut, I grabbed two to go and a chicken sandwich to go. This place is off the chain!!! BTW great staff as well....OG is the manager and he will set you straight if you don't know what to order.  My co-worker had the sirloin and roasted potatoes with smoked garlic. And we both order empanadas to go as well. This place gets a yessss mister!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

imePLbeJ-kM0wUMKNdZGhw.text: I had an amazing time here with a college friend. The staff couldn't be more friendly. The bill wasn't too high. And the staff was wonderful. Jean our waiter had an excellent knowledge of the menu and gave us a lot of help sorting through the dishes. I settled on a fish dish and my friend had a steak dish. Both were fantastic. Definitely will be returning.

2q2Bhy5Ke9AIr2M9g2fEAw.text: I have a couple good things to say, a couple not so good things to say.  However- Everything aside our lasting impression was made the last few moments as we were about to leave the waitress approached our group spread out her $47 dollar tip and said "this is all you left , just wanted you to know. If that's okay with you then fine, I just did a lot."  I did not drink that evening, everyone else took advantage of the BYOB. Someone in my group handed her 60 more dollars. , before I could stop them.  The cash she claimed to "have left over" as her tip didn't match with The money she was given. Additionally, she did not include the $32 dollars in off those who paid with a credit card.  I won't be back, it was so uncomfortable. And I feel she was dishonest, whether by mistake in counting wrong or on purpose. In general not okay.   Update- this took place in the downstairs bodega. Never have been to the upper portion of the restaurant.

jczkp5qG69wOxAW7NSwCJg.text: I just found my new favorite steak place in Pittsburgh! Wood fired, smokey meat at an unreal price not to mention a great BYOB policy.  Needless to say it took a good 75 minutes to be seated on an early Saturday afternoon, but the wait is very much worth it!    I went here with my wife and friends from Buffalo.  The setup of ordering is different than most restaurants as we ordered before being seated.  I ended up getting the steak sandwich (Carne) which was your choice of meat served on a ciabatta bun with optional toppings.  The couple we went with split the steak platter which included a variety of meat to select for a total of 25 oz.  We brought a 12 pack to split between us over dinner so we drank that while waiting for our food.  When the food finally came, all of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals and were absolutely stuffed afterwards.  The meat had an amazing smokey flavor, and in addition to the meat there were 4 amazing sauces to pair with your food.  I would highly recommend trying all 4!    The steak here is extremely impressive! It's hard to beat the smokey flavor and the complimentary sauces.  BYOB is a nice option to have with your meal.  My only disappointment from the meal was not trying any sides or desserts! I even ordered a sandwich to go to eat later.  I will definitely be back here with friends to introduce them to such a great dining experience.

lVZCxMwrYzRd4ZZJbssAbA.text: I always got the sandwiches. I never knew what I was missing until I started ordering off of the entree menu. That's not to say that the sandwiches are lesser than, but the entrees are so fantastic it's really hard to pass them up. Yes the large size steak on trees and some of the bigger entrees are a little pricey, but the quality of food and preparation totally justifies the price. I'm not a huge meat eater, but this place offers incredible slices of red meat and the chicken is fantastic.  Totally worth the splurge. The flank steak is to die for, the chicken breast with the garlic sauce all over it is on real. The sides are good, the cauliflower and the broccolini are definitely the best, the potatoes are good but in contrast to the awesome flavors in the meats the potatoes seemed a little lackluster to me. They're supposed to be a sidenote the main show.    I've never ordered the paella, but I've seen it served and it is a ton of food-with lots of yummy things. There's really nothing better than a perfectly cooked cut of meat.  It's worth noting that even though this place definitely is carnivorous, their salads are some of the best in the city with or without meat-and all of their non-meat offerings are done right.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parrillida Mixta with no chorizo and flank steak instead!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The sauces!!!!!

DNeM8y-9nQRC93acyMfSBQ.text: Show up early, bring beer and be prepared to wait. Crazy packed on Saturdays but oh so worth it!

gDeRXRIu6hCqwg7TmwvQLw.text: Had to line up by the door to order first. Even though there's plenty of seats inside but you can sit until you ordered and paid. We had Pork(round shape) and Beef (dumpling shape) Empanadas (the beef one tasted better), medium cooked ribeye (tasted great but the meat did not seem very fresh), small Gaucho salad, and the featured pasta. Everything is amazing! The line went fast (15mins for us on Friday noon), so don't be afraid of waiting too long.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

f_JRhkJKDaIp2sRUOlwz8A.text: There's plenty of photos of the Paella.  The Paella served this past Saturday is much different from the photos here in on Yelp.  No longer has clams, mussels.  No longer has chorizo.  The Paella we were served has rice, mushroom, peas, onions, tomato, lemon, shrimp.  The Paella at Gaucho is a one and done for us.  3 stars for the Paella.  Bump up for the rest.

wTKfOguk5G1gg31uaWJ7gA.text: Heard about this place from other yelpers and a couple of colleagues. So, I finally decided to give it a try in the new year! We went on a weekday around 2 PM and were seated immediately. We had to place the order before we were seated. I think they expanded the place since it can definitely accommodate more than 8 people now. This is my first time trying Argentinian cuisine and I greatly appreciate the help their staff provided while we were ordering. They were patient and answered all my questions and infact made some good suggestions too.  So we ordered shrimp cooked on cast iron and vegetable empanadas. The shrimp is coated with lemon butter sauce and it is tasty as is and the taste enhanced further when we ate it with the garlic sauce. It is cooked and seasoned perfectly. I could not try their shrimp over rice since it is for a large group but I am glad they had this shrimp on their menu which is a decent replacement for shrimp over rice.  The vegetable empandas are herb flavored and have a unique taste. The filling was seasoned perfectly and the dough is cooked well. these tasted great with the roasted pepper sauce.  They also have pomegranate orange drink that goes well with the two items that we ordered.  Overall, it is a great place. Though it is expensive for the quantity, I will go back again for the flavors!

Cooked to order just the way you want it, great food even greater! Sauces!!! You will understand why you have to wait! Great service, great staff, just all around great place to dine.

4GdvvDAq2vc6AtnwG0dN_g.text: This is my first time experience here, I read so many good reviews so I just tried it today. We had chorizo (hot), empadanas (chicken and veggie), Cerdo, paletilla De cordero.  Among them, only chorizo and the empadanas with chicken filling were good. Cerdo was super salty, I couldn't finish it, the onions so greasy and almost burnt. The lamb shack (paletilla) was bad, like tasteless and not so well cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Paletilla de cordero (front), empanadas, chorizo, Cerdo (back left)

mSXZkiXL5TPdhhpgTIEtBQ.text: This is definitely one of the top restaurants in Pittsburgh.  Expect at least a 30-60 minute wait if you're going during prime hours.  I would recommend any of the sandwiches or the steak platters.  I got the paradilla mixta, which includes steak, chicken, and sausage.  I didn't really care for the chicken and sausage, the steak was the main piece.  If I had to order again, I'd definitely go for a steak platter.  I also got an empanada and it was really good.  They have 4 different sauces to try from and my group agreed that the red one was the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 4 sauces at gaucho.  Red one is best.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. NY Strip platter
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Paradilla Mixta and Empanada in the background.

qIHpHnl8kKr1K4fjXrYTQA.text: I spent a few days in Pittsburgh over the holidays and G.P.A. was on my must visit list! My husband and I went for an early lunch and only had to wait 10-15 minutes. The staff were very friendly. You order food and drinks (soft drinks only as it's a BYOB) at the counter where you pay and the staff seat you and bring your food out. Our food arrived swiftly once we were seated and I think part of the reason that you wait at the counter is so that the kitchen doesn't get swamped with orders. G.P.A. isn't fine dining - its a casual lunch/dinner option with a friendly, relaxed atmosphere. I was surprised to find that the tables were spacious and well spaced out and I appreciated that they didn't rush us or pressure us to leave even though they were busy. The food was very good, simply prepared and very flavorful. We shared a mixed grill of sausage, chicken and flank steak which came with some grilled country style bread,along with a house salad and two empanadas, this made for a hearty lunch that was satisfying and extremely reasonably priced.  The empanadas had soft tender pastry and tasty fillings, the meats were well cooked and juicy and the house salad made a nice fresh accompaniment (we had a small salad and it was plenty enough for two people). The meats came with chimmichurri and in addition there were large jars of it around the restaurant that you could help yourself to, we tried four different sorts and they were all amazing and complimented everything well.  We only had time for one visit, but I can't wait to visit again on my next Pittsburgh trip!

vU1o_l1Rb9olQcbwTg9OoA.text: I grew up in Argentina,  specifically in Patagonia. I've eaten in some of the better restaurant of Buenos Aires and this is a far cry from Argentine food. Very disappointed with the lack of authenticity in the chimichurri as well as the empanadas  I realize it's difficult to get Argentine beef but they don't even try. The worst thing is the style of restaurant, I guess they want you to feel like your being herded like cattle.

L1ke1egZkAyRMJBpG0vPVQ.text: Favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh! Very affordable, great meat, and it's byob! Would recommend anything on the menu and it's always cooked to perfection!

6SBX0i3qTitg8L8PAT9Ybw.text: Gaucho is as good as it gets. The only problem with Gaucho is that it's too popular, and the wait can be ridiculous. I recommend going on a weekday at odd times like 3pm if possible to avoid having to wait at all.   If it your first time at gaucho, I strongly recommend getting the Asado platter. The Asado platter contains 4 pieces each of 5 different types of steak. It's $50, but it has enough food to feed 2-3 people, so not too pricey when you split it. Get it medium rare. Trust me, the way they cook their steak, it's meant to be cooked medium rare. Try the steak by itself and then with their four dipping sauces just to get the whole experience.   Even though they're an Argentinian steak place, their vegetable dishes are amazing. I'm not much of a vegetable person, but every salad or vegetable dish I've gotten there blows me away. If you're with 2-3 friends, I recommend getting the Asado platter and a large salad and another vegetable dish. It comes out to around ~$20-25 per person.   There's no other place more worth it that Gaucho. Nothing in Pittsburgh compares. If you're trying to impress your friends who are visiting, this is the place to take them.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Asado Platter with the four dipping sauces

myky_9b60ouKnK-pcUNzvg.text: I cannot believe I had not updated my review. This is hands-down one of Pittsburgh's top three restaurants and they earned it. They started in a space the size of their current kitchen, and this was actually the building, and they have since blossomed into a consistent, creative, fun, high-end, but not stuffy headed steak house Argentinian style.   Everything from the salads with meat added option, which is an excellent value for prime cuts, the side dishes, empanadas, sandwiches, and steak plates are fun, rustic, a touch playful, always delicious, and, simply put, exciting and satisfying eats. I don't really need to break it down because you can find something for everyone here and it will be good. Don't discount how good they can do fish or chicken because they can do it very well.  For those that have not been, this is a counter service style restaurant so you cannot save tables or be seated until you have ordered. As part of the success, expect long lines during prime hours particularly power lunches and Friday / weekend dinner. Calling ahead is not always reliable to get your order in but is an option for pickups. The line for the counter can go up to an hour and a half long and on some nights the doors are closed almost two hours before closing time if they are at capacity with a very long line waiting. You will know because end of line will have a wood sign stating they are the last to be admitted.   Don't fret though, it is worth coming back another day because what you'll get is worth the wait and the price... and they are still very fair about all of their prices for what is superior quality and you would be charged almost double in a traditional steakhouse.

gCYuh7jjuuCVgjdow_9nmg.text: The place smells great but the prices are a bit steep and they arnt very helpful with the menu. All in all a pricey place woth good smells. I wouldnt recommend this establishment unless you already have an understanding of Argentinean cuisine.

BSxGcapSBzBulBYJuUo1fA.text: Go here! It's really a special place in the Strip district. My husband and I got here as they opened on a Saturday. It quickly became crowded (sometimes you'll see lines out the door) but make time for it. We ordered 2 different empanadas to try. They were good but not the highlight. I had the ribeye steak sandwich- so flavorful and tender meat. Husband had the rosemary pork sandwich which was even better- AMAZING! It's an order at the counter, find a seat and your food is delivered to table type of place. You must try the different sauces that they have at the service areas. The only reason this review is 4 instead of 5 stars is that my steak was cooked medium but I asked for medium rare- I really don't enjoy beef cooked above that (but the tenderness and flavor was still there) and the empanadas were just okay but they were enhanced by adding those amazing sauces though!

xZPG8cYLX4TD23fM6yQKIg.text: Good food! My hubby and I got ourselves some steak me flanks and him ribeye. The sauces were so good. We had to order extra toasts because we can stop dipping on them. Will def eat again!

_UIsHEUUNAdLJgWPTyTScw.text: We stopped by for lunch... wow.  Super tender beef with tons of fresh yummy sides.  The people there are very relaxed and there is a fun vibe.

3K0_GtokGzQ6tt5drh1GuA.text: Chicken was not cooked all the way, and the food was mediocre at best... would not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Really not impressed. Not sure what all the hype is about. Small portion sizes, chicken was not cooked all the way.

WnhW0jDZ3we9gFgE48uqTQ.text: Holy Mary mother of sweet baby Jesus.... Forgive me.  One of the best mouth orgasms I've ever had. If you love meat their steak sandwiches cannot. Be touched.   Perfect quality perfectly toasted bread delicious accent veggies.   I ordered a sandwich and the empanadas. I experienced food amnesia because the empanadas were so good I literally forgot I ate them both. In a matter of minutes.   Don't walk here run now.

FhQzYGYp4X4cuqeUis_ABA.text: The Rosemary Braised Beef is every bit as mythic and mighty and marvelous as its now incredible internet hype would have you believe. There's a baguette that holds a generous wad of paper-thin savory, fragrant beef sheets that are cooked slowly for an eternity. Caramelized onion and horseradish sauce are added for the sake of sweetness and punch. That's all there is. It is a Philly Cheesesteak gone rustic and cowboy, the campfire aromas of this small establishment beckoning people from late afternoon to early evening. So yes, GPA does a 4.0 job of making mundane meats taste extraordinary in a confined space and within a quick-serve framework.  I don't seem to be reading much about the desserts, though. I don't recall GPA selling them during my last visit. Regardless, my readers should give them your undivided attention.   The bill of fare lists 3 of which Kay and I tried 2. First at bat were the spectacularly scrumptious Panqueques. A crucifix of slightly scorched crepes, each rolled wafer resembled a tuile cookie in terms of flavor and chewy-brittle mouthfeel. Topping them was merely chocolate syrup, but filling them was a creamy, carnal, somewhat briny caramel that clung to the palate like a desperate lover.   The second sweet treat came in the form of Alfajores. Coming off as a cross between a macaroon and a Fig Newton, the trio of cookies come either with lemon or cinnamon flavors and also contain caramel (La Dorita Dulce de Leche). Soft, sticky, and full of sugary bravado, one could imagine having these with tea in more genteel surroundings instead of the gritty Strip District.   Apparently, Gaucho Parrilla Argentina fits the definition of a runaway sensation while still measuring up to the buzz it has unassumingly created. Who would have guessed they be the kings of Pittsburgh Yelp? 2 years ago on a February night, I was hoping they'd remain a secret gem.   P.S. Outdoor seating is available now. Indoor seating remains very limited. Prepare to opt for take-out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Panqueques
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Alfajores

eCfLDMH-celAN3Donak-Mg.text: Tonight was our second night visiting Gaucho. One word to best describe this place - FLAVOR!! The food is amazing! I think I could eat the pork tenderloin every day. All that being said dining at Gaucho is unique. Usually the wait is so long you are standing outside on average for 45 minutes and then an additional 15 minutes inside. The ambience in the front dining room is fine - there is a lot going on around you with the wait staff and the ordering desk right behind you. The back dining room leaves much to be desired (it really does resemble a fast food joint). Last night was our second time dining at Gaucho. The first time I was so blown away by the food I couldn't wait to go back. But after waiting again and lack of atmosphere we might take a break and go back in a year or so when we have friends in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wings!!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork tenderloin. The spicy mustard is absolutely amazing!!

QwezTEZm1OgatZnMu-d1UQ.text: Why aren't there more shops like this around?  On the West end of the Strip is this little Argentinian restaurant called Gaucho. It's easy to walk by without taking notice ... but the wood paneling and the amazing grill aromas will draw you in. They even have fresh rosemary growing in the store to use for their marinades and sauces. There is limited bar-style seating along the walls.  The staff is super friendly and inviting. The shop is about two months old, so they're still soliciting feedback on menu items and concepts from customers. I believe they are soon opening up their outdoor seating section as well.  The menu is actually quite big for such a small shop, with everything from sandwiches, to salads, to full entrees available. We decided to go for a Saturday lunch, and it wasn't too crowded inside at all. We asked one of the staff what the most popular items were, and he said the carne sandwiches were the hot item. I went with a ribeye carne sandwich (you can choose from different cuts of steak!), while the rest of the family tried the chorizo and pollo sandwiches.   The carne and chorizo sandwiches are loaded with roasted peppers and onions, while the chicken sandwich is loaded with portobello mushroom and onion. They all sit on ciabatta bread. The meats were all extremely flavorful and generously portioned. The ribeye had an amazing rosemary marinade on it that just elevated the taste experience to another level. While there are four different sauces you can experiment with in the center island (I highly recommend trying them all), the carne sandwich really didn't need any extra flavor at all. So good. The rest of the family thoroughly enjoyed their choices as well. I really wanted to try some of the grilled vegetable items (OK fine, I wanted to try everything on the menu), but I was full already.  This is such a great introduction of Argentinian grill food to the Pittsburgh area, and I can only see Gaucho gaining infamy as THE place for an incredibly authentic bite of Argentina.
