ON9ItJQdrFIZHYX96h79pQ.text: Nothing can go wrong with wood fired grilling!! Gaucho is the best (and the only one) place where you can try the perfect Argentine-style grills in Pittsburgh. They grills almost everything, red meat, chicken, shrimps, veggies. you can tell  how their magical ingredient, the wood smoke can make greater.  My favorites are wood smoked shrimps and veggie plate.  They also have nice paella (available in big portion only), sea food soup (recommend!), and pierogies.  The meat quality (cut, part of meat) varies a lot depend on the portion size and/or the day.

0RUuzvOKbaXBdWvxadAc3A.text: Really one of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh. Definitely a must try and go to place.  Can bet a bit pricey depending on what you order and seating is really difficult.   They need to find a better system on how they seat their customers.  The review is based purely on the food.... the service maybe a 2. The people that work there seemed stressed and unpatient.

t8oiN539pAqlQkHJ2Ck7XA.text: This restaurant is really hot right now! It is a different set up from the traditional restaurant where there is a dedicated waitress or waiter. You walk in and order from the front counter, leave your name and they bring your food to your table. It's byob and they don't charge a corking fee.  All food is ala carte and you can order any combination you want. Reasonably priced and good quality. I recommend trying different sauces and enjoying the flavours.

jvdn2qFPjMqpGdkSixMA9Q.text: So good! I have been trying to come here for ages, and I am so glad I finally made it. I had the vegetales con pan (a vegetable sandwich) and it was so good. I also had the grilled corn on the cob, which was also amazing.   The line was long, but it was worth it. The vibe of the restaurant is also very cool. The man who took our order was extremely friendly. Once you order your food, you take a seat anywhere and a waiter will walk around calling the name you gave for the order until they find you. It's a cool experience. There's definitely a long wait for the food, but it's totally worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

8UXe9llQeoFBWNj57p2xjQ.text: Amazing service. Amazing food. Portions could be slightly larger but I still think it's worth the price.

hg-RgiB7OiRinqTVA5FO_w.text: Delicious food but not worth the wait! If the line is out the door and wraps around to the side restaurant window, you're looking at about 1.5 hours...of standing in a line...to order your food at a counter...at a place that doesn't serve beer and wine. If I'm going out for a meal, I'd rather go to a place where I can sit or put my name in for a table and then come back.

xOlIYAjtXZoZt8_YCqnilg.text: So delicious! We got the Provoletta and the Rosemary Braised Beef = melts in your mouth good! Can't wait to go back!

glgPMeUrTXn8BuonMwcuFQ.text: Great restaurant! Bit more affordable than a full Argentinian restaurant. The lines for lunch can be very busy. I once waited for a full hour. I recommend going at nights and off-hours. The empanadas are crispy. I love their bife de gaucho.

ORL7Yof-Sm5nHKOIAMi-AQ.text: Gaucho has amazing food & a friendly staff. They don't take reservations so sometimes you have to wait in a long line outside of the building, but the food is worth it! Delicious food, plenty of options.. anyone could find something that they would enjoy!

JqTz4syR6_NbXBqw8AMo6g.text: I was in town for a Steelers game last weekend and we had decided to go here for dinner. Some of the best food I've had. I love that you can bring in your own wine and they will uncork it for you right in line while you wait to order

ahG0n96af0BZicECh2Vmmg.text: This is by far the best restaurant that I have been to in Pittsburgh.  The staff is very laid back and creates a straightforward but friendly atmosphere.  Any time I have guests in from out of town, I make it a point to take them to Gaucho.  My favorite menu item is the Carne sandwich.  You get to choose the cut of steak on your sandwich and there is no upcharge.  I usually end up with a Filet Mignon steak sandwich for $12.  The sides are easily shareable.  Our go-to is always the potatoes, some corn on the cob, and one of their rotating vegetables.  The desserts are also fantastic, although they do rotate.  I usually go with whatever seasonal bread pudding they offer.

N_nExUWTq9DWl-qZxRZSeg.text: Gaucho Parrilla has become one of my favorites in Pittsburgh. It's 7th in the nation on Yelp's list for best restaurants in the US and definitely deserves its place there.   I went with a friend and even though the bus dropped us across the bridge (the stop is right BEFORE the bridge, but he just kept going...) it was totally worth a freezing walk across an icy bridge to get to this place. The person who took our order was super knowledgable about the menu and I can tell they take a lot of care in preparing the food. He even offered to let us stand by the wood-burning stove since we were so cold from our walk over.   We got the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich and New York steak, as well as a side of potatoes. It was all delicious. I think the sauces they offer really make it awesome.   As many have said, the hours that they hold are a bit inconvenient. (Tues. to Sat. 11:00 AM  to  7:00 PM; Sunday Closed; Monday Closed) There have been many times I wanted to go, but it was already closed. Hopefully they will expand their hours after they renovate! At any rate, if you live in Pittsburgh (and eat meat), you should definitely check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak, sandwich, potatoes, and lots of sauces. So good...

inm1qKl-h2Iv8nTKEzHUVA.text: Everyone loves Gaucho Parrilla and for good reason. Their main thing is steak, but I don't eat steak so I always get a salad, which in many cases would be disappointing, but at Gaucho it's not. It's not disappointing at all. I get the El Gaucho salad, which has avocado and a bunch of grilled vegetables. Today I added grilled shrimp and it was worth the extra $5.   I've also had the vegetable empanadas, grilled corn, and potatoes. I recommend each and everything I've eaten there. And oh my god, all of the sauces. Delicious homemade sauces for you to drown your food in (or just for a little extra flavor. Whatever you want to do).  Each time I've gone to Gaucho new people have come with and no one is ever unhappy. One person I was with said it was "overly seasoned," but I don't like bland food so I am selectively disregarding his opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El Gaucho salad with shrimp. Also, vegetable empanada in the salad and side of potatoes. So freaking good.

VAxfIvzNc8QyABJ7u4-3dQ.text: I could eat at this place every day and bathe in the Chimichurri sauce. 'Nuff said.

OD38jo0Q4_xEm-NUS_zB7Q.text: Can't say enough about this place. It's great! Arrive early for lunch, it gets packed.

EpeNRiDKFXD58BKyAZrN5Q.text: You don't need to read any of these reviews.  This is the most popular spot in the city (and Yelp's #7 in the country!).  Just make sure you try the sauces.  The garlic (ajo?) one made my meal completely.  This place doesn't need me to tell you to go there, but if you need a review still, a messy one follows.  The +1 and I have tried to come here a couple times in the last year.  The first time, after work last winter, called the place, they said they were almost closing (~6:00) so don't bother. Fine.  Tried to go a few weeks ago while in the Strip on a Saturday. HA!  Unless you are patient and are extremely weather prepared, don't bother.  Lines out the door; we waited for about fifteen minutes and decided waiting in line outside in January is not for us.  But alas, I had a half day of work due to an appointment in Bloomfield.  It was 3 PM, snowing like crazy, maybe four degrees out, and you're damn right I got on that 86 bus and slid down to the Strip District.  The inside is tiiiiiny. Mostly kitchen, a middle table, six stools along the sides of the wall.  I was immediately greeted by Anthony, I think, who was so unbelievably awesome.  Another cook there, younger kid, was drinking all the wine in this BYOB establishment so I knew I liked this place already.  I wanted to take dinner home as the +1 was stuck in meetings all afternoon and couldn't join me, so I needed things that traveled well.  I knew I wanted chicken (pollo! .. which is "poh-jo"-ish, not "po-yo"; this ain't a Mexican joint!) and was directed to the sandwich which he suggested I get "deconstructed":  toast instead of bread, everything piled together, oh my sweet jeebus, you don't even know.  It had mushrooms on it which I do not do.. but I ate them. Me. Picky Queen of the East. I also got the potatoes (papas!) which were roasted to almost a blackened state in the best sense.  Don't forget the sauces for these.  I had a lot of help packing everything into my huge brown bag.  Everything separate and packaged so nicely. They are too sweet here; I can't stress that enough.  I asked for the most popular items for +1.  He received a rosemary beef sandwich and corn.  After he put that thing together and drenched it in the horseradish sauce, it was gone.  I have no idea what happened.  I thought he was going to drink the chimichurri. I'm not a beef eater, but it honestly smelled good enough to potentially turn me against my moral judgments.  The food is some of the best South American-y business I have ever had.  It might even be worth the line outside in January or, at the very least, another half day of work.

3cMnEbnl66ZxXS1U_gngbQ.text: Sometimes going to a multi-hundred five-star reviewed restaurant is taking a chance, because how could anything really live up to that sort of expectation?  Well, Gaucho does.  My first encounter with them was at a Yelp Elite event at which they were one of the caterers.  I was really taken with not only the absolute deliciousness of the food, but also the very down-to-earth attitude of its owner.  It took nearly four months since that first encounter  to finally drop in on their tiny (but soon to be expanded) space in the Strip, but it was abso-freaking-loutely worth the wait.  My. God.  I got a small plate of the flank steak, plus I split the cheese toast with my friend.  Another customer who was waiting for a takeout order also made sure I didn't forget to grab one of each kind of sauce, all of which seemed to be variations on chimichurri sauce.  I probably would have found my way to them regardless, but I was glad of the advice.  They made what was an incredible lunch even better.  I couldn't stop dipping both  my bread and meat into them.  I just...I can't even describe how delicious this food was.  The best part was that I still felt really good afterwards.  More than satiated, but not sluggish like one might be after dishes that rely on heavy fat, salt, and/or sugar to get the yum factor.  This was just expertly prepared meat, a delicious salad, and perfectly chewy grilled bread.  Next time (for there WILL be a next time), I'm getting at one of those sandwiches, though!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 6 oz. flank steak

AaaX9TSdlWNzsORBkH--NQ.text: I absolutely loved this place!  The food is absolutely divine and the addition of the chimmi-churri sauces made everything better. My friend and I both ordered the Parilloda Mixta which consists of the chicken, chorizo, and NY Strip. We also ordered a small plate of grilled shrimp, yellow rice and roasted potatoes. My steak was well done and the chicken with the green chimmi sauce made it more flavorful. The sausage was a little salty for me but the next day I finished the rest and weirdly it was perfect. I wish we would've remembered to bring a bottle of wine since its BYOB. There was not as much seating as I would have liked upstairs but we managed to snag a table as a couple got up to leave. The menu was a little confusing at first but I just hopped on yelp and the pictures on here helped us out tremendously. We were both extremely satisfied and we will definitely return. Our meals were worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The grilled shrimp was delicious. The sauces make everything twice as good!
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing!! I wasn&#39;t crazy about the sausage but everything else was yummy.

t4LE6mmOEFRm8VGKRielJA.text: Wonderful experience! Loved the atmosphere, the service, and of course, the food! We ordered one each of the chicken, beef, and veggie empanadas, a Pollo Sammie, a Bondila (sp?) Sammie, and a Rosemary Beef Sammie. We also tried the Provoletta small plate and sampled all four sauces. Everything was delicious! Like, really, really good! Suggestion...try to go between lunch and dinner to avoid the wait. We went at 3 and didn't have to wait at all. The only disappointing aspect of Gaucho Parilla is that there is not a location in my hometown of Charleston, SC!!!

uHazQpiejt_0hjRZFvyCQA.text: Are you like me that you want to save your last bite for your favorite food? That's impossible here. Everything is perfect. I was working on the roasted potatoes, ribeye, and sour dough bread at the end of my meal and it was impossible. Come eat here. You won't be disappointed.

Ku84H3pqK1kQHOIr4ujX3A.text: Food was exceptional. Super fresh. We loved the strip steak, braised beef sandwich, chirazzo sausage and brussel sprouts. We also had a combo dish that included chicken, which was totally delicious. Staff was super friendly. Atmosphere is great. Tip: Get there at 11am for an early lunch to beat the long lines that wrap around the building.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brussel sprouts

lYKAz1dsFJ96S5tVFsaY2Q.text: They're not exactly a well-oiled machine in getting food out, clearing tables, or seating people, and the one main seating room is just 4 flat walls that reverberate sound really loudly it's difficult to have a conversation. However, the food was great. The caramelized veggie plate, papas and the mixed meat plate all had really great flavors and portions were perfect for two very hungry out-of-towners. Would recommend if you have the time to wait

HFGxuMmJ1q5fq9roa5SQzQ.text: Maybe age is making me a bit slow with discovering good food places, I don't know how I only just recently found out about this AMAZING tiny restaurant. After eating there, I actually went on Food Network hoping to find a place to recommend this place to Guy's Diners, Drive-Ins, Dives!! Unfortunately, I didn't find it :( But this place is MOST DEFINITELY Food Network Feature Worthy!! Does that say how good this place is yet?   Writing this review makes me drool.... All of their sandwiches are amazing (if you are a steak lover, you can choose what kind of steak to use for your sandwiches)! The chicken and the veggies sandwiches are also really tasty! As a meat lover, I still find the veggie sandwich amazing! The salads they offer are equally as good. When I am in the mood to eat slightly healthy, I go for the salad. The sides are also fun/tasty! Just honestly, try all the food on their menu :)  They are currently under renovation. Can't wait for them to come back with their hopefully bigger space! The line is always out the door on weekends, it's definitely time to upgrade their space.

ab5MSfI-9OtstScmyXjxvw.text: Genuinely amazing food at a decent price. I had the steak sandwich, skirt steak, sweet potato & empanadas. The sandwich, steak & potato were absolutely to die for. I've been thinking about the food for days since leaving. Would skip the empanadas next time, not that they were bad but they were just good and I'd rather leave food for the excellent meat and sides. Great ambiance. Can't wait to go back soon.

VpJVHGZfVL4EIAOXUGKVFQ.text: It's legitimately one of the best places to grab food in Pittsburgh!  A destination for foodies as it is a serious introduction into the up and coming culinary movement going on in the steel city!

DUUVvrI8G338-wW8rtDIUw.text: This is not your typical sit down restaurant. When you get there you wait in line and then place your order. After your order is placed the staff then sit you at a table. We went on a Thursday night. The line was not that long, but we still waited about 30 minutes to place our order. The restaurant is BYOB so if you want something to drink make sure you bring a bottle of wine or beer. My husband and I ordered the  large flank steak, the small lamb chops and a side of mushrooms to share.  The flank steak was mediocre. I prefer my husbands over theirs. The flank steak could have been more flavorful.  The side salad and the mushrooms were good but there was nothing outstanding about the sides.  The side salad and mushrooms tasted like any other restaurant.  My husband liked the lamb chops. But said they were average tasting.  The portion size is small. My husband could have easily ate all of the food himself. I was hoping for a really different tasting, flavorful meal but everything we had was average tasting. With that said I would be willing to go back and maybe try one of the sandwiches on the menu.  I think we just maybe did not order the right thing. But the atmosphere is fun and hip and the BYOB would be a good addition if you had to wait in a really long line. #3stars

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pvBx34Y_s3zFfIbqDkah2Q.text: Food is amazing but since it's always crowded, they rush you out. They were so rude to my friends and I one day when we were catching up after dinner. They asked us to leave since there were people coming in. I understand you're busy but they were very rude about it.

sl80UPRLxKIgV5d9rAwu_Q.text: Fantastic!  My flank steak was so tender and tasty, and I loved tasting the various sauces with it. Mashed sweet potatoes complemented it well. Nice atmosphere; not stuffy with a casual yet trendy vibe. Can't wait to go back!

190y_HV_6xDTbuUY4w7xCA.text: Mara is incredible opening the wine! I cannot believe how much it cheers me up! Come for the food and hang with Mara.

QqM7CKgmfyCvm-Ai4ixUwQ.text: Argentina salad. You would think getting a salad at a steak based place would be a mistake. Key to a good salad is veggies and there was so much good stuff and even potatoes with rosemary.  Rosemary braised sandwich was delicious. Caramelized onions made it perfect. Bread was incredible. The sauces are plentiful and the best I've ever had. The vibe is awesome and clean. Super friendly people here. And the girl up front is hot. Dark hair with bangs I'm looking at you. ;)

MQ2IRDLa8DN7RJ_mXj716A.text: YES  It is worth standing outside in the line. This is the absolute best meal I have had in Pittsburgh.  Rosemary braised beef sandwich Empanadas  Sweet potatoes Papas  AMAZING.

h_rnPp34GUfn09TWTTR1Qg.text: This place was pretty good, and I totally understand why there are so many positive reviews of this restaurant. The potatoes were super amazing and the sauces added a lot of great flavor. The chicken empanada was awesome, but the beef was only so-so.  My sister and I were not huge fans of the sandwiches. They had a ton of meat, and we both took a lot of it off our sandwiches. I had the Bandiola (pork shoulder) and my sister had the Carne (steak) sandwich. I thought that the flavors of my sandwich were really interesting, but so intense I could only eat about 1/2 of the sandwich. Ditto for my sister.  We also got 1/2 dozen cookies they had in a display case for the road (5 hour trip). Those were AMAZING. So, so, good. I think those change day-to-day, but give their dessert a try!

vFbl-EX0JIob8GNx3BIryg.text: Went for a late lunch, so it wasn't too packed. You walk in and order at the counter, and the staff was incredibly helpful and patient. There are a variety of sauces you can get, which were all excellent, especially the chimichurri. We ordered a sandwich as well as an actual steak. Both were delicious (as we're the sides) and the sandwich came on bread that was toasted and perfect for absorbing all the juices. Definitely a must-go for anyone in Pittsburgh!

4OcjEfAetlxSYw5SqCP5dQ.text: We had the lamb chops, pulled pork and mushrooms. Everything came with salad and caramelized onions. The meats were so good in their own sauce, you don't need the additional sauces. I ate them all anyway.

D4aVrp2dm9crcWXDAbUzLw.text: Hands down the best restaurant in Pittsburgh! Everything is absolutely delicious. The combination of high quality ingredients and wood fire flavor makes every dish on the menu incredible.  If it's your first time at Gaucho, I would recommend trying the carne sandwich with filet (you can have any cut of steak on the sandwich for the same price). I find myself craving this every time I come. But don't be afraid to branch out and try the chicken, pork, fish, and sausage dishes. I have not had one bad dish in the many times I've visited. Even the simplest dishes, like the toast, taste so much better than anything I've had before. Gaucho makes seemingly simple dishes outstanding.  The atmosphere is casual and laid-back, and you will enjoy it much more if you have an easy going attitude. The lines can be long, and you may have to wait a bit for seating. But the staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. Take advantage of the BYOB policy and enjoy a drink while you wait in line! I promise it is worth it!

KHoigPaeji2Iv3-FnXrVjg.text: I'm going to save the details this place is downright amazing. Probably my favorite place. Such a great value. Must try!

Zh8LNt6kgxtLiLnAr60ZAQ.text: The smokiness of real wood they use for grilling gives the food an intense natural distinct flavor! These guys know their job! Ming Ming rocks!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pescado is a very flavorful fish sandwich.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne Sandwich is the most popular item on the menu

8fUxTfYL2nXvGqq5UZ5Tgg.text: This restaurant is such a great addition to the strip district. Their food is fresh and inexpensive. We enjoyed the grilled shrimp, salad, and filet. The BYOB is a plus and the atmosphere is fun. The staff was awesome and very helpful when figuring out what to order. Only down side was that the food wasn't hot.

7CL1lnf9reWe2EUk2XJSMA.text: I really don't understand why everyone is obsessed with this place. The food is good sure... but the line was an hour and a half when I went. Then you have to stand and wait for a table after you order. The chances are pretty good that you'll get your food before you get a table. People are just hovering over everyone to grab their tables when they look like they're ready to leave. The atmosphere is terrible - more like a Chipotle or Fazolis than a nice steak place. I give it 3 stars because the steak was tasty, but everything else was just average.

A4BaYt5ENLOO8eMkXaJ2XQ.text: What a wonderful find! This has fast become one of our favorite spots in the Strip! The food is amazing, especially the braised beef sandwich and grilled veggies! Long lines to get in but always worth it! So happy you guys expanded the space!

yUgyZSfKNdzXGPQ60vk3gQ.text: I don't know if I visited on an off day or what, but I was very much let down by the food here after reading all the fantastic reviews. The staff and overall experience were great, but the food just didn't cut it for me.  I visited with a group of four friends and I ordered the pollo sandwich and the vegetable and chicken empanadas. The sandwich was huge, but the flavors weren't very sophisticated and I didn't  really think they worked that great together. Plus the bread plus all the meat made for a pretty dry sandwich. The empanadas were similarly monotonous in flavor, regardless of filling, and the dough outside was oddly hard. My friends found their meals good but not fantastic.  Based on all the great reviews, I was so ready to fall in love with this place... maybe I will give it another chance sometime.

MQ8C3BiSo-Px6P65Kg3V7Q.text: Fantastic!!  The smells emanating from this beautiful eatery are tempting enough.  You step in and the decor is beautiful.  The staff was friendly and helpful, as this was our first visit (won't be our last!).  We had the steak (filet)  sandwiches, which were SO good.  We also shared the Provoletta appetizer which was fantastic.  The combination of provolone, toasted bread, arugula and Kalamata olives is just delicious.   Every aspect of our lunch was so good.  The ciabatta used for the sandwiches is perfect.  I can't wait to try everything on the menu.  Definitely an outstanding restaurant on the Strip!!

ApP9i0nLJ9WuXb3rnn4K_A.text: One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh, as their food is very flavorful.  In particular, I really like their ribeye steak sandwich as well as the potatoes (Gaucho papas).  I took a star out because they're somewhat victims of their own success... the restaurant is always crowded with a line out of the door and the seating is limited, even after expanding their space.

00eOi8Qi3sjZlWb023NYZA.text: There isn't much else to add that has not already been said...  BYOB, great food, and prices.  One of the ladies working here encouraged us to take home some extra sauce to accompany our breakfast, sammiches, etc. Excellent peeps here.  Warm and modern environment without being pretentious. Well done   Update: So far I've had three of Gaucho's sandwiches: the Bondiola (pork shoulder), carne (I had flank steak), and rosemary braised beef. The Bondiola is my favorite of the lot.  For around $13 for a delicious sammich and potatoes, I think you would be hard pressed to find a better deal in Pittsburgh for the skrilla.

-DoEQILJr2iq2O1mPsqChw.text: BYOB!  Take note...BYOB. I didn't and expected to buy a bottle of wine...but that in no way took away from the awesome food. From the second you enter the place you are greeted with a olfactory sensory overload of perfectly seasoned seared steak! The eclectic staff is happy to walk you through the menu and help you chose from many fantastically flavored selections from fish to steak, chorizo to empanadas, chicken to grilled veggies, sandwiches to salads...unless of course you already know what you want like we did. Have the Rack of Lamb and any Steak dish and you won't be sorry...and this isn't Aunt Pookies "lamby" Sunday Mutton, this is delicately french boned deliciousness cooked to perfection. I promise, you'll leave satisfied while planning your next visit and with whom you're going to introduce to the Argentinean food fantasy.

BAKWDceELDlOy6hGwdL0Hw.text: This store is completely evacuated. Don't know where it is moving into. Really miss the good food there.

AMHjSDBPP76XXbIlbYZ7KQ.text: This place was great! Great lunch, though it is a bit expensive. I had the chicken sandwich with separate side orders of empanadas and papas. All were delicious, but the sandwich was my favorite. I will definitely be back for more in the coming weeks. My coworkers loved their steak sandwiches.

KybWlDa-TKBXGSOTT3BQRg.text: I love smoked food! This place makes some great sandwiches! All of the meat is smoked fresh and the prices are great. The dinners are a bit more, I haven't had them yet. But I'm sure they're pretty awesome too.

MR2uLdU_iymCti5kfdUFhw.text: I've heard great things about Gaucho and finally got to try it a couple of weeks ago. I got lucky and there wasn't a line when I went, so I didn't have to deal with the wait a lot of people complain about. My friend and I each got a sandwich and split them, so I got to try the carne and the bondiola (pork shoulder). The bread the sandwiches come with is incredible. It's a little crunchy on the outside, so it doesn't get soggy from the delicious juices from the meat. Both meats were cooked perfectly, melt in your mouth. They also offer you free, additional sauces that you can serve yourself. I tried all four, my favorite was the chimmi. This place is worth any amount of wait!

qlr4t9Pzpad0A_l9nEfO3Q.text: Worth the wait in line!  Incredible meats and great/energized staff! Cannot wait until its warm to eat outside

zt4HP_pEBFHl1XFNbVvsiQ.text: Yelp! Rarely lets me down on a search for good eats in a new place and tonight I am so grateful to them.  This is some of the most amazing food I have ever eaten in my life.  The staff was friendly the food was 5 star dining in a casual fun atmosphere.  Don't let the fact that you order at the counter just means you have several people who check on you to make sure you are happy.  I do believe I have experienced the most delicious flank steak of my life.  And I think it's so cool that they have a BYOB policy no need to pay $12 for 6oz of wine!  This place is a total win if you don't come and eat here while your in Pittsburg well then your just plain stupid!

GT5p7w-74XfQ_-R3YB3cNw.text: Amazing! I could tell from the smoke billowing outside that this meal was going to be good, but it surpassed my expectations.  I had a steak sandwich, and it was fantastic. They have unique condiments in a table in the middle - I liked the chimichurri the most. But the meat was so good it didn't even need it!

bgareJpvFaRdAEmpLIQyaQ.text: This spot is all that & some. I wasn't too fond of my chicken empanada, but my sister said her veggie one was good. Their favors are so delicious!

i5OyNxzBvAQLkv2kMqP57w.text: I sort of liked this place. It's just awkward because there's not many places to sit and where they are located isn't an area where you can go outside and find a place to eat. I'm glad they are here- it's nice to have something different to try.

SVWfht4t7jk3uUXkCN8pmQ.text: First time to the area so I decided to check this place out. I ordered five things on the menu so I could try their top five dishes. I was not disappointed by any of them.   Highly recommended. One negative is the wait. Expect to be seated will take 30 to 60 minutes. Worth the wait.   Special note: they do take out. They typically cut off phone orders at 630.

uCeBaI2Gixn7m2MBRX51Fg.text: Yeah, I know what you're thinking! 3 stars for Gaucho Parrilla Argentina? You're CRAZY!!!  That actually may be a True statement about me, since my mother has never had me tested! But nevertheless, I did not enjoy the charred, ashy flavor of their meats (particularly the ribeye steak sandwich). I didn't add any additional toppings (which might have helped), but I wanted to taste the purity of the meat. Also, the ratio of meat to veggies was ridiculously lopsided with thick cut roasted veggies being probably 70% of the sandwich. Considering the cost of the sandwich, I would have expected more meat.  Although I liked the burger much more, I was not a fan of the hard breads they use to compliment their sandwiches. I also did not enjoy the strong flavor of the roasted potatoes and the beef empanadas were just okay.   My tweenage kids took a bite and refused to eat any more of their food. They have a serious dislike for anything that has a burnt flavor and I honestly couldn't argue with them. I love a decent char, but today it was like eating cigarette butts from an ashtray. I felt so bad because I really hyped this place up to them after reading reviews and getting recommendations prior to my visit. So I took them down the street for a bowl of pho to make amends. Another visit may yield a better result, but as a first-time experience goes, the food did not live up to the hype. The restaurant itself, the decor and the staff on the other had were awesome! What an eclectic collection of humans!   FINAL THOUGHTS  This place came highly recommended, which makes me dread writing this review. I definitely don't want this to be a slap in the face to all the awesome yelpers who suggested Gaucho as THEE place to visit for my one day trip to Pittsburgh, but I gotta be honest. Besides, there are so many positive reviews here that I doubt mine will even be noticed.   Ribeye steak sandwich (3.25 stars) Beef Empanada (3 stars) SteakBurger (3 stars) Roasted potatoes (1 star) Decor/staff (5 stars)  2016/82

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My son&#39;s steakburger was actually juicier than it appears. We just couldn&#39;t get past the burnt exterior flavor.
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside the empanadas
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empanada

ABdOXRnBOWbNn7kY_Tzr6w.text: Can't believe I waited four years to go to this place while my son was in college in Pittsburgh. Truly a local treasure!

7fC-brbOf7AD5QR_8GkK5Q.text: If you see a long line in the strip across the street from Altar Bar, it's not because some major new band is playing in town. No, Altar Bar is back to being a church and it's Gaucho's notoriously long line to try their authentic, wood-fired Argentinian grilled meats. Like Smallman Galley, they don't accept any reservations, but they have a much smaller staff/location, so the wait can be a bit daunting, especially if you're waiting in the mid-day sun during the lunchtime rush. I recommend going during the mid-afternoon lull on a weekday if you don't like waiting for potentially over an hour. Otherwise, be prepared to spend some time chatting with hungry strangers in the Strip. Once you finally get inside, make sure you try the their collection of self-serve sauces which include chimichurri, roasted tomato, roasted garlic, roasted onion, etc.

oF0Fu8DetkcXx6IJ2CmqjA.text: Delicious ribeye steak plate with salad, sweet onion, and chimichurri. I would love to come back and try the carne asada and other delicious meats.

nGeUIGTF4oqflP_oyZxrCg.text: Unreal. No other words besides unreal. Being from New York where great restaurants abundant and being spoiled with good food I was skeptical when I came to Pittsburg. In look for a restaurant with real, fresh food was the mission. Luckily I passed this restaurant driving and saw a line of people out the door with almost 30 people down the road. I made it a goal to try the hype the next day. Menu is very accommodating to any kind of meal you'd like. So I decided to order a little of it all.   The steak- medium rare rib-eye COOKED TO PERFECTION! And the flavors? Incredible  The el Gaucho salad- so fresh tossed with a balsamic vinegar   The chiqui chicken small plate- chicken cooked so tender  The spicy chorizo- if you enjoy heat, this is most definitely the dish for you   The layout is great, open kitchen, multiple sauce stations for my saucy people and best of all BYOB -- WITH NO CORKING FEE? Hello. This place is amazing.   Point blank.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BNJpkD9bqHvK2YvH-HO0jg.text: They do steak the best! Their plates and small plates are the best. Their sandwiches and other beef dishes are only okay. The sauces are excellent. Definitely do not skip their sauces.

GUQZPaR9RYIQrbL0bR7t_Q.text: Unbelievably good. We'll definitely be coming back.  Ordered the Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich as well as some Empanadas.

qgqiwsHWBsH6aofrr-DG7A.text: The food is delicious here. Super tender, moist meat with a slice of grilled bread? What could be better! Definitely get the Brussels sprouts. I don't know what they do to them, but they are soo good. The problem is the service. You wait outside in a long line only to be rushed as you eat. We even got asked by the server when we were going to leave because there were all lot of people waiting outside...but I was one of those people too. I wouldn't go back.

CnPywn5KMarblUoxaMCDeQ.text: Definitely one of the best steakhouse I ever ate (and I ate a lot). The skirt steak and the ribeye are my favorite! Really really recommend on this place. Why I gave only 4 stars instead of 5? It's because I don't like to wait outside and wait to be sitting. Especially when it's so cold outside (most of the time it's really cold in Pittsburgh). They have to do something about that.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

naleIkIJuV6Ees0g7oUSCw.text: Phenomenally delicious meat & BYOB. So, so, so good!  If you're looking for a burger - def get the steak burger. So good! Any meat of the grill will not disappoint. The seasoning are on point. This place gets crazy lines on the weekend, but you should be able to snatch a table on a weekday evening if you get lucky. The place is small but does open up around backs and has a hipster-ish ambiance.  You order at the counter and then take a seat (if available). Tons of great chimichurri sauces are available for dipping. I had the carrots with goat cheese for a side and they were surprisingly delicious and recommended to share.  If you're arriving, just be aware for the potential for long lines and no potentially no place to sit. The food though? Worth it!

lhzeZ3gvF1of7ELRgZVbXw.text: Had a great meal here.  Fantastic grilled beef, chicken and shrimp. The beef, especially, is so flavorful and has a unique texture to it.  It is really different from traditional American BBQ or Brazilian BBQ.  You have to try this place to experience it.  Yes, the line is long and they don't take reservation but it is well worth the wait.  Service was very friendly and efficient.

J3Mbb19FDE-1bG--kljRpw.text: I was visiting Pittsburg for work and stumbled on this place. The line was outside the door but only took 30 minute to get to our table. I ordered a steak medium rare and it taste very good and was cooked to perfection. The service was friendly and prompt. I was with 7 others who were from California too and we all enjoyed our dishes.  When in Pittsburg I will be visiting this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet cooked medium rare.

Ka6Ac4S1wDXypsOmjy6o3Q.text: By now it's just known that Gaucho is one of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh. I've never had a single menu item that wasn't absolutely perfect. I always look forward to the bread and sauces which are mouth watering. The line is usually out the door, but it's always, always worth the wait. The outdoor seating area is just as charming and warm as the indoor. I've enjoyed an array of the menu items, from the steak to salad to sandwiches. The time and skill put into cooking these amazing dishes is always apparent in the amazing flavor. If I won the lottery, I would probably eat here every day.

9wgRm7O3Ijj3EUSvR2VqPg.text: This is my first Argentina restaurant, and sure they didn't let me down. The receptionist are very nice. When I show him the picture that I want to eat (because I couldn't guessed what kinda meat would be like without a picture), even though the dish is not in their menu anymore he recommended me something very similar and even out some pickled onions to mimic the closest version. Incredible service! Will definitely go there again next time when I'm in Pittsburg. I ordered qiqi chicken this time and I'll lamb or steak next time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yXC80N38BawCfHvao7MKyw.text: In all the places I've been, all the time I've lived in Pittsburgh, and I only JUST made it to Gaucho last night for the first time.....but it was so worth the wait.  We decided to try to beat the crowd by being there around 6:45 on a Wednesday.  It was busy, but not line-wrapping-around-the-building busy.  There were about 7 parties in front of us and we stood for about 30 minutes.  When we finally got to the counter, they opened our wine and gave us wine glasses and water, then we placed our orders.  The menu is large and almost overwhelming because it all.sounds.soooo.good.  I ordered the deconstructed carne sandwich with flank steak. My date had the large Argentinean salad with flank steak.  We were seated and our food came out about 15 minutes later.   I got two of the sauces - one that pairs well with steak and the other that pairs well with vegetables.  Everyone is so insanely friendly and helpful at Gaucho - you can really tell they enjoy their jobs and take pride in the food they serve.  Everything was excellent.  The food, the wine, the service, the atmosphere.  I'd say my only complaint is that I think they do such a great business but they could really take it to the next level by making it a traditional sit-down, take your order and serve you type of place.  I would be more inclined to go back regularly if that was the setup, but I just am turned off by the line.  Definitely a place to try ASAP!!

bjnIc78TXaLZg5KQXoRCqg.text: Super!  All food is great. Little crazy with ordering first then they sit you, but great food and atmosphere.

VNbaWdd2LU-KL5qd4cwmEQ.text: Having heard such great things about Gaucho Parrilla I had high expectations for the meal. That being said, the food was just good and well deserving of at least a four star rating. The problem I had with the whole experience was the setup of the whole restaurant. Not only was ordering annoying and made me feel like I was at a high class fast food joint, but the menu was extremely wordy, confusing, and the only way to view it was on a huge blackboard up front. It is also worth mentioning that with this setup you'll be stuck up front holding others back while trying to figure out what to order. If it's busy you will probably feel pressured to make a quick decision from a lengthy menu.  Despite the annoyances up front I had no issues with service and the food was good enough to save Gaucho from a lacking experience. Besides burnt cut of toast, the steak, chicken, and chorizo that I ordered was done well and accompanied with some tasty sauces. I guess I can forgive Gaucho for it's annoying setup for a good meal:/

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kjfSICJqxL7l-wjPKvpqvw.text: Superb! Long lines at times though. Try going before or after the lunch rush during the weekdays. I talk about this place often. Do yourself a favor and go!

X9hK5yaiZDFe0bhE93QlLw.text: I'm so upset it took me this long to get here, but I was always nervous about the long line.  Luckily, when I went, there was no line at all.  There's nothing but good things to say about the food.  It's delicious and you get a lot of it.  I was nervous that I was only getting a sandwich, so I also ordered the mushroom side, but I didn't need it.  The sandwich would have been plenty.   I can't wait to come back again and again.

ZOfu8B336ej1xB-WNcMINA.text: Best foodie spot in Pittsburgh. Yes, the wait is long. Really long, so y'all can step out of line and go down the street to McDonald's.  I'll wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mUuyo5a0BEg5EkaMuXRnvQ.text: Amazing food! The sandwiches are the best deal as you get to pick your cut of meat for the same price. It's an order at the counter then sit kind of place. Make sure your whole party is there when you walk in. They won't seat you otherwise. You can also bring in your own bottles of wine. No corkage fees!

BtlV7JY_EdUZ9XkdRSpwHA.text: Delicious! One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh, hands down. Basically everything that you can order here is delicious, so just take your pick. Really nice staff too.

Ny1gnjUCAyGoXdZjsPQkXA.text: food comes in a big portion. Empanada was delicious. Pre-paid system. Servers are very friendly and they are fast with refilling water.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Counter
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ct6EcT6MmqvmzsXtddpmKA.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome. Everything here is done so well. I love the beef sandwiches. My wife talked me into getting a seafood stew and that was unreal. One of my favorite places on the strip for lunch or an early dinner.

yD9GvGtS73FD0oFRL5rGdg.text: My father is born and raised Argentinian and my family knows great food.  So when I came to visit my father in Pittsburgh we heard so much about this place and we made the trip down to the strip district.  This possibly might have been one of the better dinners I have ever had. Authentically cut beef. Empanadas were good  Veggies amazing  The roasted garlic dipping sauce  The braised beef sandwich absolutely to die for with the perfect bread to stay crispy and soak up juices.   Why yes that is 5 different cuts of beef. Yes that is beef empanadas- braised beef sandwich- flank steak- grilled veggies and salads. And yes it was magical. Probably one of the best places I have ever eaten at.  You have to get here early or you will get stuck in line outside the door. But if you get caught.... It's well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised beef sandwiches
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 5 different cuts of beef. Yes that is beef empanadas- braised beef sandwich- flank steak- grilled veggies.

2EU7IuK43hAB5g_ziMk2IQ.text: Mmmmm tasty!   I ordered the small flank which was accompanied by a rich salad of dark greens, radishes and carrots, and a large slice of toast. The steak was cooked to perfection. I did not participate in any of the sauces unfortunately. My fresh garlic allergy did not allow me. The only reason I knocked off a star was because I ordered my meal without garlic anywhere due the allergy and my steak came out with the chimi sauce on it, which does in fact contain fresh garlic. So, I had to send it back, which I really loathe doing. The staff was great about getting me a new steak quickly; however, the rest of my party had already consumed a good portion of their meal because we had to get back to the office.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The small flank which had the chimi sauce.

mwNadv5VE4xNxo7eYyB1LQ.text: Amazing place with really polite and cheerful staff.  Great vegetarian options. Vegetable sandwich and empanadas are highly recommended!  PS: though the line might be huge, its worth the wait. :)

PMumt9Cm7tbIvJ4sDHwJuA.text: I've only been once, but this is one of the best meals I've had. Luckily the long lines move quickly so don't be deterred. The staff manages to keep cool & friendly despite the ravenous customers. Everything I tried was spot on, seasoned well & cooked perfectly. I was surprised to find such an authentic meal in Pittsburgh. I actually considered a weekend getaway just to try again.

bT7d0k0cv3xNtOAyza8_tQ.text: Being new to Pittsburgh I have slowly been trying new places and was invited to enjoy Sat night dinner here. So to start off the place is busy on Sat night first come first serve no reservations expect a line but it's popular so it's expected.The are a lot of choices from steaks ,sandwiches, seafood paella, and appetizers. We got the paella with a side of beef empanadas and some ribs which were all good. The place is BYOB which is a plus. I will have to return again some time and try a steak to give it a full review but it was good. The place for the record is young and youthfull with music playing and isn't by far a quiet romantic place. It's all part of great food and great service.

zHSiDTu1biEMZDYnnNzTXw.text: The food is excellent, the owner is a bit strange. You have to pay for your food in advance so if you don't like it, they make you pay for a new dish. I'm not a huge fan of the trend and make sure you BYOB. They do not have any alcohol options

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7zd74ElX79RpK_Kbx0gOwQ.text: I'm a big fan of the pescado (that's fish) sandwich. Make sure to drench it liberally with whichever salsa you prefer from the salsa bar, and you won't be disappointed. Note that it can get pretty busy here around lunchtime (especially on nice summer days), so consider coming on the early side if you don't want to wait in line forever.  I only have one minor complaint with the establishment -- parts of the bread sometimes come out pretty burnt (and burnt food is a suspected carcinogen). But, you have to balance that with the deliciousness, so I figure it's worth it once in a while!

wVcojAmWHlfcFGvidu-Ryw.text: Food is 10+ stars, totally amazing.  The front desk, however, should not encourage patrons to sit on the patio. Flies, fleas, little black bugs all over the place, which completely downgraded the experience from a 10 to about a 2.  There is no reason they can't assess the bug situation on the patio and close it down when it's infested with flying bugs that are all over the food.  We ate and got out of there as quickly as possible. Sit inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Patio seating downgrades the experience. Sit inside.

Ofl1l-Fe3z9x1eoGfVVlyw.text: Interesting place serving great steaks. Argentinian style with multiple meet type such a sirloin, ribeye, flank steak, skirt, New York strip. You actually get in the line to order and then they bring the food to you. We got the combination platter of all the steaks which came with three pieces of yummy chargrilled chili bread. I wish this place had wine and beer instead of BYOB since we were out of town but we were lucky in that the patrons ahead of us were all too kind and gave us a half growler of beer. We also tried the passion cookie which was pretty good. Customer service was very good. Argentinian steak a little bit different in that they're thinner steaks fired on a chart grill and service sauces. I prefer reverse year and a big steak to get that perfect medium rare and enjoy it with just salt and pepper; however, the flavor of the sauces and seasonings were really yummy here and there are some days where I crave this type of steak.

0Job1VjIXs9Wm7I8L0Ji9A.text: This is the place to be if you were to ever visit Pittsburgh or a Pittsburgh native. This restaurant is worth the long line because the food is delicious and so worth it.  I highly recommend the rosemary beef sandwich. I also recommend trying the different types the sauces that is readily available on the stand

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

As2rJxpbwufFrI4e8PnVhA.text: Right on the strip, great for fueling up pre/post shopping. The menu can be a bit daunting on your first visit, but thank god there is always somebody in there to translate. The food and service quality has always been amazing and we have never been disappointed. You'll commonly see a line looping around the building, don't let that discourage a visit tho. The line diminishes quickly, so don't fret.

obXLD3H5OBzCKA5d0OyN8w.text: This place is always a solid good casual meal even for upscale foodies. Aid place to chill out and have tasty food. First time having their chicken and it was yum. Always a lot of people here so make sure you go in or order at most an hour before they close because they WILL cut you off. No soup for you! Their gaucho sandwich is off the wall but it's been a few years since I first tried it. Don't think anything has changed, just gotten better. So if you eat beef, WHADDAYA WAITIN FOR! The only thing that has changed is their expansion which means more people have gotten to appreciate this place as much as I did a few. Years ago :)

W6-Gfs-lVHu7sCBGiK1IIw.text: We wanted a "cheap" preview of this restaurant- so we chose the steak sandwiches- I had ribeye, hubby had flank. Word to the wise- get the deconstructed option right off the bat, else you will just do it yourself. We tore the delicious bread into hunks and paired it with the perfect bite of fire roasted peppers and caramelized onions and steak, trying each sauce. My hubby like the green best, but I couldn't get enough of the red. The dessert of the day was to die for. It was worth the wait in line. May I also add that the ability and encouragement to get your own water and sauces is perfect- I hate asking waiters for a ton of stuff. Great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

O1CEzr-UJedNvM2sSt0owQ.text: Still 5 stars. This is our favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh hands-down. I tried one of their salads with sirloin on it and it was the best salad I've ever had in my life. I was this.close. to licking the bowl clean. Can't wait to come back and try more of their food. AMAZE-BALLS

CYPN3MqfAzmV7PmciGEuZQ.text: The food is so good. Even the grilled bread is mouth watering. I love that it is byob. We stopped in for dinner one night. We were asked if we wanted to go downstairs for the chefs tasting. It was $50 per person and worth every penny. We got to try a little bit of everything on the menu.  I highly recommend!!

jfjVVu44_67ivkyWjnTXMw.text: I have wanted to try this place for a loooooong time. I work on the North Shore and every day going to and from work I smell the deliciousness of meat being smoked when I pass Gaucho going over the bridge in the Strip District. But finally the day has come!   My husband and I actually went here before a Yelp event (that Gaucho was actually providing small bites at...go figure). I got the rosemary braised beef and potato and bacon soup. The sandwich was so big, I  actually just ate the meat because I didn't want to fill up on bread. It was soooo good. I could probably eat a steady diet of just that morning noon and night for a full week. There was a horseradish sauce on it that really paired well with the rosemary flavor. The soup was also incredible and super flavorful. I probably could have done without it because the beef was so filling, but I'm glad I got it just to taste it! My husband had some sort of pork sandwich with pickled onions. He couldn't stop raving about it so it was also a win.  One thing I also want to comment on is how extremely friendly the staff is. You can tell how much they love their business and care about their customers. If you aren't sure about a menu item, be sure to ask for a full description. Someone will be happy to tell you about it no matter how busy they are!   The space is more of a food counter than a restaurant, so if it's busy you might want to consider getting your food to go, but I see they are looking to expand soon so that's very exciting!   I totally understand why this is yelp's numero uno in Pittsburgh! If you haven't gone here yet, you do not know what you're missing!

YrdX5s4QEcazALoTTxb0Jw.text: Excellent food and service. I got Pescado and it was great! We had to wait for 1 hour standing before we got seats!!

2e8cagjjrrxjEz_GfiPWQA.text: Outstanding food. If they would only move closer to Oakland :-). For carnivorous customers this is an outstanding choice. It would be help if they would take reservations but the food is so good ... Highly recommend.

aQJMHWg_hW8NQJhseEn-sw.text: Delicious! Totally loved the potatoes  we got there as soon as it opened so no wait. We got empanadas and they were super flavorful, especially with all of the great sauces they offer. We each got sandwiches (one carne filet medium rare and one braised beef) and they were both great. That bread is to die for.   Staff was incredibly nice and helpful. Overall wonderful lunch

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne sandwich, potatoes, empanadas

fEEcjE_APSP0m8PmKucGzw.text: I fell in love with this place!  Sarah was our server and she was fast and fantastic. She recommended a few items that we all ordered and shared.    The grilled shrimp - can't remember the name of it - was the best thing I've ever tasted.  I usually don't care too much about shrimp, but this we amazing.  When I go back I'll be ordering it.  We the group of us ordered about 10 things and shared.  All of us had different favorites.  Along with the shrimp, my favorites were the grilled vegetables and Papa's potatoes.  Others loved the potato salad, corn pudding.  A couple ordered sandwiches that they found to be their favorites.  I also had a small chopped salad that was perfectly dressed - it was lovely, but I loved the others more.  Try it.  I plan to bring my son there to try the shrimp.  Be prepared though, it's not a sit and order place.  When you walk in your arrived to a giant chalkboard of their menu.  You order at the counter and then sit down.  Tips are collected in a jar at the register and are shared throughout the staff.

zK2nSXP1QCkz5XEwnFxztA.text: I have updated this review to five stars, because I never followed up with a better review, but I have been back on several occasions and have had amazing food every time. Every. Single. Time. In fact, I recently tried their empanadas again, which I always counted as the weakest point in their game, and I was stunned by how much better they are than I recalled.  For the sake of history, my original review (where I assigned them two stars) follows:  I love Gaucho. It is my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh.  Unfortunately, today I had a terrible meal at Gaucho... far worse than any previous experience there. My coworker and I both had steak burgers for lunch, and we both thought that they were very salty and overcooked. We both ordered our burgers to be cooked to medium, and they came easily well done. Additionally, the bread they were served on was more burnt than toasted.  Gaucho is still a favorite, but I hope that food like I had today will not be recurring.  I fully expect to leave a far more favorable review on my next visit.

4rYsitq5ZA1rFCtrJkDMlQ.text: We went last night.  Tuesday at 5:30 we were told that the line is always long so expect to wait.  Much to our surprise when we walked in and there were only 4 people ahead.  For first timers the menu board is very confusing so if it is your first time look at the menu on line.  We had a very friendly couple ahead who helped us out.  The menu is broken into small and larger portion which helps.  Sandwiches, steaks, chicken, seafood, veggies, starch. I chose the steak sandwich.  You pick your choice of steak.  I had filet. Mine was perfect.  Another party member had the burger and he said that the burger was awesome  and another a steak and salad on plate (no bun) .  I would have given it a 5 but the steak had to go back because it was a medium and came back well.  Otherwise.   It was great.  It's BYOB.

IYbMmiLPf_jRe807-W2Vyw.text: The food is phenomenal here. Ate outside because we had an oddly warm February day this year. The line is a bit annoying, however the food is worth it. Every employee I encountered was wonderful and I look forward to going back sometime soon.   Suggestions: Write your order out in your notes before you get the register so you don't forget anything! Steak filet con pan was an awesome experience and the Brussels are next level. Don't forget the empanadas!

9Q-DpDJxJNer0JhDgKJhNw.text: It's all been said already but I'll say it again just to add to the 5 star reviews. Yummy!!   We had the Rosemary braised beef sandwich and the chorizo sandwich. Bread was so stellar and crispy and chorizo so nice and spicy. I added some red sauce to the braised beef sandwich and it took it up even another notch! The corn was good and juicy and the grilled vegetables with balsamic were flavor packed as well.   Next time I'm in town I will try the steak platters, they looked amazing!   Also the back patio had many seats even during a very busy time of day and the staff came out to check on how we were doing and asked how the food is. Nice people working there! This place is not to be missed!

z4kTUfbbHftFcLn-amXZHg.text: Amazing food! Awesome staff! I stumbled by this place looking for something quick, cheap and get a sense of local fare. I smelled the food from outside and decided to check them out. Walked in and couldn't figure out the menu so I asked the girl behind the counter about the menu. She came from around the counter and explained everything to me and my family, and shared what was popular there. I loved that she took time to do that. The food wasn't cheap but everything sounded so good that we tried a few things! Lol  The steak sandwich was an experience of awesomeness. The shrimp was great. I wish I tried the corn. Do yourself and palate a favor and check them out!

m0yItzfl2hOB1yW-iuGN7A.text: Read about this place on Yelp and since I was in town for a few days, I knew I had to try it. We ordered the shrimp, carne hanger steak sandwich, grilled veggies, potatoes, grilled corn, and 2 bottled waters. Our total was almost $50.  That's a little high for what I'm accustomed to paying for basically a carry out joint, but hey, you only live once.   While we waited, I stocked up on the sauces because I wanted to make sure I had the opportunity to sample each one. The chimi sauce is awesome, btw. We got our food and we were off to the hotel room to enjoy it. I started eating the potatoes in the car because 1. They smelled delightful. 2. I'm pregnant. And 3. "Who gon' check me, boo?"   You could tell the potatoes were batch cooked because some were piping hot, while others were just luke warm. It's a good thing my parents were in Michigan because the flavor of those hot potatoes would've made me slap my mama! Seriously though, the fresh potatoes were very, very good.   The corn was awesome! My hubby thoroughly enjoyed his shrimp and veggies. The flavor of my hanger steak sandwich was off the charts, but it not as tender as one would hope. The toughness of the steak caused me to deduct a star. Overall, this is a solid place with great food and awesome flavors. Definitely a must-try.

clqcwxzuobKrx4rwpCobkw.text: Gaucho's is bar far, in my opinion, the best food in Pittsburgh. I don't think you'll find a better steak sandwich on earth.

gZNZcHwv99gXdUmVQh2ykw.text: This is hands-down, the best restaurant in Pittsburgh. I think about going there whenever I am hungry. The meat is unparalleled, the brussels sprouts are a favorite, but seriously, there is nothing they do not do well, I believe. My mouth is watering even writing this. Excellent! Loooong lines, so have a small snack if you need to wait, but stick it out, because it is so worth it.

BHI-RvCSBrVFy9ci4vqnWg.text: Fantastic. The reviews are all correct. The food was amazing. The toast was a bit overdone but still tasted great. Too bad it's 4 hours away from home!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho Parrilla Argentina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;mixta&#34;

JuQ0k5IF7_lMmO25SgwT2g.text: I have various food allergies and experienced nothing but the best at Gaucho! I was informed that Gaucho uses 100% olive and corn oils (no blends) and no butter or milk (at least in what I ordered). I had the sweet potato mash, mushrooms, avo salad, and tried some of the steak burger. Very friendly service and cool atmosphere. Definitely recommend.

BYf9fFqCOXDwYufxMIf6sQ.text: Great experience. Hip place ! Crowd was mostly young adults , some looked like empty nesters. Had a San Francisco joint feel to it which I liked. Trendy but relaxed atmosphere.   Food was nice . Tried their grilled shrimps, chicken wings, and the beef burger. It had a fancy name that I don't remember. Be prepared to stand in line for a while on a busy night before you order. After you order and pay, you are seated and food brought to you relatively quickly. Kitchen is behind he counter so you can see the action while waiting in line. Prices are fair to a bit high. Don't go there if you are looking  for a quite place. Louder music and people talking in a not so big place. We were loud too so were fine. Saw a couple changing seats due to noise but I'm sure it didn't help.   If they could do something about the long lines which easily goes out the door around the block and noise levels, would give them 5 stars.

0AerWC7iWD_uZam6UIbifA.text: On a ling weekend from Chicago and found this place on yelp. The Carne sandwhich with ribeye cut (medium rare) was without question the best sandwhich I've ever gotten. Roasted potatoes and empenadas were really good too. All 4 sauces offered were amazing. Cant say enough about the whole experience. Will definitely visit before leaving town and every time I'm back. Definitely check it out.

iI7aPYCrftZ-ebEyGmLGXw.text: Delicious!! They give great suggestions if you're feeling overwhelmed by their menu.  The meat is perfectly cooked and all of the dips and sauces are delectable. Lunch for 2 costs around $25 and there unfortunately aren't many seats unless it's nice outside, then they have patio.  Highly recommended.\  Word on the street is that they're beginning work on the seating! That can't come soon enough!!

OIFSpnzjDPmtbvSDFq9T0w.text: After a 2 hour and 15 minute wait on a Saturday night, I was awarded with the finest Argentinian steak I have ever experienced in North America. If it's a perfectly cooked rare steak that you seek, I highly recommend this amazing steakhouse. WELL worth the wait!!!

KB9qVLc6bvSNe-0yTAg8cw.text: We went to Gaucho at around 6:00pm on a 70 degree Saturday and, you guessed it, the line was out the door. We waited an hour from the time we got in line to the time we placed our order and it was worth every minute. Our party of 4 shared the pescado, the grilled veggies, an empanada assortment, the smaller meat platter, rice, the short rib special, and the rosemary braised beef sandwich. It was ALL delicious and we ate every bit with the exception of about a half cup of rice. Fun, relaxed atmosphere and the food is served quickly! BYOB makes it even better - we brought a bottle of red to share and then capped the meal off with some cold Rumchata. One of the employees, Micah, was chatting with us, getting refills and brought us rocks glasses with ice for the Rumchata. He was extremely friendly and helpful. My only wish is that you could sit down and order like a "regular" restaurant. And that they held off a bit on the cowbell, it was extremely loud and happened too often for my parties' taste. It won't stop me from going to Gaucho again though. I look forward to the next rosemary braised beef bite!
